review_body: Pros The location is great, next to the beach, rooms are great sized, a little bit of noise, nice buffet breakfast, shops are nice and there are lot of stores.ConsAcross the street from the beach, the parking garage is small and it is 37 dollars and the swimming pool is okay.Overall I am definitely going to come back whenever I am in Hawaii or Waikiki.

This hotel has a great location and it is walkable just across the street to the beach. It is surrounded by many restaurants and they are also easy access. The hotel is beautiful inside and all of the staff were very kind and accommodating. We had a wonderful stay as we celebrated my husband's 60th birthday. So that'll give them the

Firstly, I strongly recommend everyone to book through Marian in Reservations. She was unbelievable in making sure our reservation was spot on (we had 3 rooms and wanted them together). Her responses to my emails etc was truly above and beyond. It is the BEST experience I have ever had when making a hotel reservation and she is a true ambassador on behalf of the hotel.Secondly, the rooms. We normally stay at the Moana Surfrider in one of their suites but no more. We stayed in the newly renovated suite with adjoining rooms on level 17 of the Kealohilani tower (closest to the beach). The room was huge with not 1 but 3 balconies. We had 2 x toilets, 2 x baths and a huge living area. The views over Waikiki beach especially at sunset were picture perfect. We got plenty of sun and the rooms were just fantastic. Again I would prefer these suites compared to the Moans Surfrider suites.The Moana Terrace is perhaps the best spot to watch the sunset over a drink. I am a very keen photographer and visited a number of other locations ie Tiki Bar, The Deck etc, but the Moana Terrace was the best. The food and drinks were reasonable. The Kealohilani pool deck area is being renovated and closed on the last day we were there. There is a second pool on the same level (level 3) located in the other tower. this had just been renovated and was great.D.K. Steakhouse in the hotel is the best steakhouse in Waikiki by far.If you are wondering why I have not given the hotel 5 x stars is because of the reception staff. Upon arrival, their internet was down so we could not check in and we had to wait. Also I had issues with the bill which took ages to remedy - hence the 4 star rating.I must also mention "buster" who helped with our bags. What a great ambassador of the hotel. Both my wife and I were left amazed by his zest for life, his passion for his job and love of the hotel. Both him and Marian are a credit to the Marriott name.I would highly recommend staying at the hotel (Kealohilani tower) for the following reasons:Huge roomsGreat viewsNewly renovatedGreat locationGreat restaurants in the hotelABC shop in the foyerGreat Pool Bar and Terrace andGreat sunset views

I stayed here for a week. Very good location, great staff and amazing views. A few of the restaurants we good+. My room with a view of the beach and the large gallery were a big plus. Views of the beach and Diamond Head made for amazing sun rises and sunsets.

This uniquely designed resort has everything you could possibly want. The people and staff were friendly and helpful. Even with the renovation, the minor noise didn’t detract from our wonderful time! It was also incredible to sit in the lobby of the hotel while sitting outside at the same time!

The Waikiki Beach Marriott had everything I needed. My check-in experience with Janeen was great and I loved that she was so patient with me when I forgot one of my documents. The hotel has 1300 rooms, but throughout the stay I didn't feel like I was staying in a busy/large hotel. The lobby is great for lounging. I also love that they provide reusable water bottles for the re-fill station in the lobby. Also thank you to Skai, who sent up some goodies for me and my boyfriend's birthdays.

I am extremely disappointed with this hotel. I made an error in booking and within 3 minutes tried to change it. The hotel never returned Expedia request to not charge me the one night fee but i noticed after two weeks of ignoring me, they put through a charge of nearly 400$. I will never recommend this and will try not to stay with this hotel chain again. I have never had this issue in any hotel around the world I gave stayed at and thought much higher of the Mariott chain until now. Must be hard up for customers so they need all the money they can get. Short sighted, considering I will repost this on so many sites .

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is a great hotel. We are Ambassador Elite Marriott members, so it takes a lot to impress us. But impress us the Marriott did! Fantastic room (we upgraded to an ocean front junior suite, and it was fabulous!), friendly and accommodating staff that were ready to answer even the simplest question, and a great selection of restaurants to choose from.

Great location with walk distance to the beach, restaurants and shopping malls.The rooms are quite old, which seriously needs renovation.The front desk staff are very technical and experienced when comes to upscale.
user_name:
K W
New York City, New York

review_body: I truly wanted to rave about this place. It was easy to get to, checkin was a breeze, nice rooms with tasteful decor, room service, very nice staff . But, from 10pm-until about 1am (which could have been longer but I passed out) the hotel is LOUD. People were still in the pool past 10pm. Kids screaming and running down the halls. No installation as I could clearly hear the family enter the room next door as the husand told the wife their kid pooped his pants and it leaked through the hallway. You can hear full conversations outside and as Ilooked out on the balcony kids still screaming and splashing in the pool. I am a hawaii resident I have stayed at most hotels in Waikiki and being that it is Waikiki you can expect some noise, especially from the outside but there is no sound proofing on the inside. I also can’t find anything anywhere about quiet times and being respectful after hours. Just a bummer as I love the Marriot but I also need sleep.

This hotel is centrally located near all the shops and restaurant, room with an amazing ocean view, the pool is a bit small but well equipped, we had a blast to walk everywhere we wanted because everything was near by, the staff at the reception is helpful. I like the fact that they give you a reusable water bottle so we minimize the use of plastic.

Fabulous room with Ocean view! This is the perfect location, the Marriott facility was amazing, the staff was friendly, Great spot to operate from while touring the entire island of Oahu. We highly recommend!

Location is directly across Waikiki beach. About 1/4 mile from the zoo and convenient to everything on Waikiki beach.  HOWEVER, this will not be a restful vacation. I always stay at a Marriott when traveling and noise wise this is the worse. Marriott completely went low budget when installing doors and windows. Beginning at 530am every morning starts off with ther sound of the delivery trucks backing beep signal in the area. Then you start to get the noise from a typical busy city such as traffic, horns blowing, people walking by talking loudly, etc. But then you also have the noise of the hotel itself. Noise from people opening and closing their room door (yes you can hear this loudly) , workers going by, guests going by, flushing toilet sounds the list keeps going and going. And this is all before 8am.

Had a wonderful stay for business and pleasure. Was upgraded to oceanfront room on keolohilani tower. Enjoyed sitting on the balcony looking at the view. Lisa k was so helpful in getting our rooms and treating us special. Had a great checkin experience and valets were always punctual with getting the car. The renovated rooms are wonderful with a nice decor. Hoping to be back soon to stay here again.

We booked this hotel “Premium, Balcony, Oceanview”. Needless to say our jaws dropped when we got to our room and opened the curtains to have an absolutely fantastic view of the hotel next door. We called the manager and asked why we didn’t receive an oceanview. Astonishingly, his response was “You have our Premium Oceanview”. What? He said “you have to go outside onto the balcony to the edge then crane your neck around the corner and if you strain real hard you can see the ocean. If you wanted an “Ocean Front” you should’ve booked that”. What crap. Recommendation; if you have to call resort to figure out their definitions of terms you should probably go somewhere else.

Beautiful hotel on Waikiki beach with great beach views. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful in arranging our transportation and suggesting restaurants in the area. Located right in the heart of the action.

This was our second trip to the Marriot Waikiki. We enjoyed it just as much this time as we did last. Nice location right across the street from the beach. A 2 minute walk from Kapiolani Park and the Honolulu Zoo. Great view of Diamond Head from our room. It is a very touristy area, however, it is set apart from the more hectic central Waikiki. Plenty of dining options nearby. Staff was very friendly. One of the pools is currently closed for remodeling, but the other was open. Sadly no hot tub was available during this time. With so many options for hotels in Honolulu, we find this one easily meets all our needs.

The layout of this hotel is absolutely beautiful. The hotel located right in Waikiki right on the beach. One of the few hotels that actually give you perks for your resort fee. You’ll get beach chairs, reusable water pouches, and beach towels. Customer service at the Marriott is exceptional. They’re so willing to go out of their way to help to make your vacation better. Our room was located in the remodeled tower with an ocean front view which priceless. Thank you Alyssa and Sharina for your hospitality! Sorry if I butchered your names! We will be back again!

The Waikiki Beach Marriott does not fail in any category. The hotel takes up virtually a city block facing the main drag and ocean. You will easily find your preferred spot to enjoy the beach and the hotel has an excellent pool area for lounging,food and cocktails.Food and shopping, both low end and high end are right outside the door with large numbers of people walking the strip. You will feel as though you came to the right place. I had a sinle room with king that was more than adequate with all the necessitys. Of course it was clean and the housekeeper approached me early in my stay to ask if I had any requests - perfect. Polite and communicative check in staff alerted me to what was happening during my stay, Chinese New Year, some construction and water shut offs, that assured no surprises on my part.Concierge was very open and helpful particularly with directing me to local transportation at the back of hotel. There were also several tours offered.

We were there in January. It is right across the street from the beach. We were upgraded to an oceanfront room with balcony overlooking the beach. It was convenient walking distance to beaches, snorkeling and restaurants.

This hotel felt so welcoming. The rooms we had overlooked Diamond Head. It was a delight to see it everyday. It was a very relaxing stay and top notch service!The hotel fronts Waikiki Beach. Lots of restaurants within the property. There is a Starbucks in the lobby.During our stay we were told that there will be water interruption, but it did not create any hassle to us as we were always out to enjoy Waikiki.

We absolutely loved our stay at the Marriott. The room was gorgeous and very clean! And for those of you who are like me and need to have conditioner for the shower they do supply conditioner! The bathtub was also very nice. We had an amazing view of the beach and two balconies. The service was amazing and gave us beach chairs and we could get fresh beach towels whenever we wanted. They gave us shell leis when we checked in. The bed was fabulous! Amazing pillows and sheets. Had the best nights sleep! The curtains were also very nice because you could close the heavier ones so that it was nice and dark when we slept. There was a pool and a gym, but since we were right across from the beach we didn’t really use it much. All in all, amazing stay. Highly recommend! I’ve stayed in Waikiki many times and this was my favorite stay.Don’t mind the bed, I couldn’t resist laying on it before we took pictures lol

I am a titanium member and seldom ever have check-in issue. I arrived in Honolulu at the Marriott and at the Bonvoy Elite check-in, they said they only had a double bed low floor room city view available when my reservation, made months in advance, was for a king, high floor ocean view. i was pretty perturbed after a 12 hour flight from Boston. Thankfully, the Front Desk Supervisor came along, Shermaine and within 10 minutes fixed everything and I was good to go and everything turned out great. Hotel is very nice. Stayed in the K Tower, 15th floor overlooking the pool and oceanview. This hotel has great access to the beach and the pool is great but only after about 1:00 pm when the sun comes over the hotel tower. Bell men are very helpful but do not love unloading taxi's or cars at the entrance (once you have lugged the bags to reception, they are all excited to help). Food choices in the hotel are OK. The adjacent Italian restaurant is expensive and food is expensive, small portions, but good. Sushi restaurant is fair both in food and price. Breakfast is very good; buffet with very friendly service. Compared to other Waikaki hotels, I think this has best options for beach, location, action, etc. Because of construction in pool area, there was occasional banging when at the pool but heard nothing in my room.

On a brief visit to Honolulu, I decided to use my Marriott points and for 60k+ points I was expecting more. The check-in process was chaotic with 3 separate lines for the front desk and somehow the Bonvoy rewards line I was in took longer than the others. I got a room with a nice balcony view of Diamond Head but was hoping for a water view. Also put in the tower near the beach. The hotel is so large that you don't get that personal touch from other Marriott properties. Surprisingly, I found the Hilton Hawaiian Village more accommodating when I checked out and moved to my new hotel. This property has so much potential but I found better options elsewhere.The pros: if you have free breakfast included, the Kuhio Grill was amazing. Get there early because it does fill up quickly. So many food options and very friendly staff. The rooms are comfortable and the heated toilet bidet seats was a nice touch. There's a Dominos across the street if you're trying to cut back on costs. I took the Roberts Hawaii shuttle from the airport and it was only $17 for one way (unlike $30+ for a taxi/uber). Very comfy ride and to my delight, my hotel was the only one for drop-off.The cons: Customer service needs improvement; wish Concierge was more easily available to assist with activities and information; Elevators can get really crowded so be patient; everything is expensive around the hotel, so ABC stores will be your best friend. I thought Kealohilani Tower would be better, but I got stuck in the Paoakalani Tower.
user_name:
Mike A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Perfect spot to base yourself for a Hawaii beach holiday, literally steps away from the iconic Waikiki beach with fantastic water views and updated fresh rooms. My room was clean and spacious, with very comfortable bedding and beach themed decor/colours. There are plenty of great dining options only a short walk from the hotel, as well as Starbucks and ABC stores within the hotel. Only disappointment was the size of the pool, its quite small and doesn’t have the same resort feel like other Waikiki beach properties do.

My husband has stayed here for work many times... again he was here for work as and active duty soldier...we were able to come to spend his down time together... at booking he requested the same room he had the previous visit..they confirmed.. upon checking in we did not have a room that was even comperable.. instead of a king bed we were placed with 2 double beds... they stated it was an upgrade...umm no it wasnt... 2.. they were doing renovations but informed NO ONE that their laundry facilities would not be available..no communications were sent out by the staff..so we packed thinking we could do laundry...nope and they wanted us to pay over 30.00 every time we needed clean clothes....and to top it all off the staff DOES NOT EMBRACE TGE ALOHA SPIRIT... never again will any of us stay at this hotel...definitely not up to the usual Marriott standards...

Very large hotel with more than 1,100 rooms. Just a few meters away from the Waikiki beach. Which caters more to the average tourists.Our second visit to the hotel. Took a room at the Kealohilani Tower. Supposed to be the better one. Had a room with premium ocean view. Could hardly use the balcony because the smell from the hotel restaurants i.e. steak house wafted from their kitchen. Burning cooking oil or something. Very disappointing. Their have to work on their air filter system.Room spacious enough, standard furniture. Fridge and room safe. Bathroom a bit small. Shower in the bath tub.Has only bathroom glass door. If a guest uses the bathroom in the night and turns on the light in the bath room the whole hotel room is brightly lit. Not well thought out.Has no executive lounge.Has a number of restaurants. Breakfast at the Kuhio grill, quite a distance away from your room at the other tower. Very busy restaurant, food on offer ok, but limited choice. Average breakfast plus omelettes and Miso soup.Pools small, no big deal. Fitness center ok but much too small for a hotel of that size.Lot of shops. Many Asian tourists. And folks with tattoos.Doesn’t have a real resort feeling. Is more like a very large city hotel.

Overall, I was very happy with our stay at the Marriott Waikiki Beach. Ocean Front guestroom was modern and spacious. Amazing view of the beach and water right from the balcony. Staff was super friendly and location was unparalleled. My only real issue was withe curtains which didn't actually block out any light. Things get lively at night and prevents you from sleeping too well with all the light coming through the window.

My boyfriend and I arrived at 10pm at the Waikiki Marriott. I had messaged earlier that our flight was only landing at 9pm and would only get there around 10. I got a confirmation that it was received. When we arrived, they did not have our room available and they had to put us in a 2 double bed room as they did not have any rooms available for a 1 bed room. They would need to check us into the room and check us out the next day. Since it was so late and not sure what other options we had around the resort, we had to take the room. So we called again in the morning to find a room, and they provided us with a room but we had to check out by 11am and only check back in 3pm the earliest. After spending the day around Waikiki, we finally got our room. However, the next day they shut off the water without warning us. This was an extreme inconvenience as my boyfriend was on the bathroom when we we found this out. I called to find out what happened and the front desk said it was a scheduled shut off until 4pm for our floor. All the guests on the floor were supposed to be notified by a notice under the door, however we never received a notice at all. We once again, had to move out of the room and into another room. After being moved twice in a span of 4 days, I was not satisfied by how the hotel handled this. I had to explain to both the front desk and management my disappointment with the hospitality of the hotel. You do not expect to move twice on a single visit within the same hotel and have water shut off in your room. After voicing my concern and my constant pressure, they offered me an extremely small compensation and told me to deal with it. Please be careful when you stay here. They hotel is under construction. This means lots of banging in the mornings and a chance your water may turn off. Hotel management does very little to hear your concerns and tell you to deal with it as they will not do much to help make your stay more bearable.

Great location across the street from Waikiki Beach. Very friendly, professional and attentive staff. Rooms are modern, bright and well appointed. Restaurants are very good and have many dining options.

This is at the end of the Waikiki beach area, walkable to most shopping facilities or activities. The hardware is relatively better than average.We paid extra for upgrading to premium ocean view room, but you have to step out to the balcony to get a partial view which doesn’t really qualify ocean view.

The Marriott Waikiki is a standard resort hotel very clean and impersonal, could be a hotel anywhere in the world. The check in staff were very helpful and courteous, our room was basic and simple. but had a balcony with a view of Diamond head other the top of other hotels, and if you looked around the corner you could see Prince Jonah Kuhio Kalanianaole beach and the sea.We checked the Grill restaurant out for their breakfast buffet, but nothing special enough to spend $35.00 on. (each) So settled for a couple of continental breakfasts with a view of the beach over the road. It is close to the beach so would be go for families with children to stay at.TIP: This area was once the Home of Prince Jonah Kuhio Kalanianaole, his statue is just across the road by the beach. This great man was the only elected member of a Royal family and British Officer to serve in the United States House of Representatives.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort delivered a top notch stay for our family's first visit. We just loved the location at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki - walkable to the heart of the action, though with somewhat lesser crowds at the beach. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a recently renovated Junior Suite that very comfortably slept our family of four. Though it is a big-city-busy hotel, we found their staff to be extremely responsive to every request we made from a birthday treat for my daughter to promptly delivering extra towels to fixing a bathroom door that came off the rails - on Christmas Day! We found the resort fee - which included the use of always-available beach chairs and towels - to be fair considering the location. We look forward to returning to this hotel some day!

My husband and one other couple stayed here last week. It was beyond amazing. This is our favorite place to stay. The rooms are open, spacious, clean and have remarkable views. The people here place hospitality beyond your wildest expectations. Everyone was so kind, sincere and truly made a difference in our experience. The remodeling did not get in our way. I did miss the other pool but due to the rainy week it wasn’t a big deal. I took several of the exercise classes even some I would never have tried and the instructors were amazing and everyone was welcome. They only negative is the parking ramp but I did not drive in it so it did not bother me. We brought another couple with us and they truly loved the experience. We ate at every restaurant in the hotel ad there was not one bad one and the employees again were remarkable. Love Eli especially. Thank you for the above and beyond experience.

We had reserved 2 rooms at this hotel for our xmas-new year holidays last month for 6 nights. I have been staying at Marriotts all over the world and I am a huge Marriott fan. However, I did not feel the rooms that were given to us at this hotel met our expectations. The experience was not the same! So I reached out to the Marriott management and they were able to work with me to resolve this issue. I am satisfied with their explanation that this hotel is going through a big renovation and within a year the experience will be very different i.e. like the great experience I have been having at other Marriotts. The current GM at this hotel, Thomas, is a really nice person - he is very customer service oriented. He listened to all my points and suggestions. People at this hotel, in all work areas, are really nice. I am satisfied and very happy. I will stay at this hotel again!

This resort was across the street from the beach. We payed for a ocean view and the view from my from was pretty good though far from the water. I didn’t mind though because I could still see the ocean and I could also see one of the pools, and therefore was able to tell when the pool was less crowded. The pool wasn’t to cold which is alway a plus. The room was your typical resort room (nothing fancy). We ate at two places in the resort. The ?Japanese sushi restaurant was amazing!! The buffet was horrible. I wouldn’t even call it a buffet the options were so limited. And the food there was subpar. My friends and I rented a car so we were able to explore a lot of the island. We also did a lot of walking from the resort and saw some great area ( walked about 1.5 hours from the hotel and the same back). It was a great experience (though I had been to this area on a prior vacation).

We love Hawaii and anytime we can spend there, we're obsessed. Thanks to that sentiment, we didn't dwell much on the hotel. We went with friends for a week over NYE - we were really there to enjoy the warm weather, the company, and some fun. All in all, the hotel allowed us to accomplish that.. we had a blast! We do like luxury travel and this was not at all that - so if you are looking for that, look elsewhere. If you want a nice room with a decent location to go and explore Oahu, this works!Pros: If you stay in the updated tower, the room is nice/modern/updated. We had a premium oceanview room, the view was nice of the water and the strip. Decent balcony off the room. Starbucks and many other conveniences in the hotel. Cons: Simply not a resort. Pool was crowded with kids and not very nice.Beach outside hotel not very nice.Check in was a disaster too.

Fantastic location walking distance to the beach, shopping and food.Us: family vacation Jan 2020. Bonvoy Elite Platinum membersnote: no lounge at this hotel for Platinum membersnote: was asked to PAY up to $125 for room upgrade despite being Platinum-EliteOur room was 29th floor I believe, nice view, comfortable sleep and clean room with a welcome greeting and a plate of strawberries for my wife's birthday celebration thanks.The room itself was a bit dated but like I said .. clean and good enough for a good rest.We don't eat meat/dairy and so we were a tad disappointed in the lack of hot vegan food options in the morning buffet and the food quality in general,. The potato 'stew' or whatever it was looked a bit weird and infused with cheese or something (and without proper labels). I suppose we could have mentioned upon check in about our Dietary preferences but not sure if that would have led to a better meal experience.Wifi worked good.Sleep quality good.Location excellent.Food: badResort fee: $33/night with dvd rentals and a cheap water jug is a disgusting mandatory fee.Would we stay here again or refer to others we know: No thanks

I am in Honolulu often for work and stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott where they never disappoint with great service. Valets are friendly and helpful with baggage and attentive to requests. I have stayed in multiple rooms and am always happy with housekeeping and the room decor, space and cleanliness. Easy walk to a number of places and accommodating with help and assistance.

Our family reserved 3 rooms (and prepaid) here for one night, as the beginning of our vacation. We arrived around 3:00 in the afternoon, unloaded all of luggage, and waited to check in. The man at the front desk was friendly and after taking our information asked us to wait for the manager. After a few minutes the manager came to inform us that we were being transferred to another hotel. I completely understand mistakes happen, but the situation was handled so poorly by the manager. He started off by telling us “because you are only staying for one night, we are transferring you to another hotel.” Again, I totally understand that issues come up, but blaming the customer for only staying one night doesn’t really make for good customer service. He informed us that we were being transferred to the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani. I was familiar with the hotel because I had looked into when booking weeks earlier because it was considerably cheaper (around $300 a night). When asking the manager if we would receive a refund for the price difference, he told us that he did not know what rates they were charging the public, he only knew what they were charging him, and to not worry we would not be charged more. We reserved two rooms for two people at $630 a night and one room for 4 people at $838 a night (taxes included). After loading all of our luggage back into a cab, and getting to the Sheraton we learned that the Marriott had reserved us 3 rooms, but failed to inform them that one room had 4 people in it, and had reserved us a room with a double bed for four people. The Sheraton then had to contact the Marriott back and forth to figure out the situation, taking much more time, with the Sheraton finally giving us an additional room. 1. After checking in at the Sheraton, I asked her what the room rates were for the night we were there (Keep in mind that this was if I were to book the same day that I was staying there, at the time of booking the Marriott the Sheraton was around $300) and it came out to right around $500 including taxes and the resort fee. It was extremely frustrating to be paying the much higher rate at the Marriott when I could have just booked a room at the Sheraton and saved money and all of the hassle. We never received the difference in the room rates. 2. Paying MUCH more was extremely frustrating, but what was almost worse was the whole afternoon that was lost. After getting to the Marriot and unloading all of our luggage waiting to check in, loading all back up, waiting to check in at the Sheraton, waiting while they went back and forth with the Marriott because they had reserved the wrong type of rooms the entire afternoon was gone. Having only a short stay in Honolulu before continuing the rest of our trip, I surely did not want to spend it doing what I did. I feel like the least they could have done was informed us ahead of time (even an hour would have been great) so we could have gone directly to the Sheraton. Even though the Sheraton had nothing to do with the incident they were actually much more apologetic about the entire situation. The manager also informed us that when booking (and paying full in advanced) with this hotel that their contract states “that we will provide you a place to stay but we don’t have to provide you a place to stay at our hotel.” Keep this in mind when booking here, you might actually end up at a completely different hotel than you booked and will not be refunded the rate difference.

Our family stayed a week at this hotel during our recent trip. A few things led me to choose this hotel among many other hotels at Waikiki: 1) It's close to the beach (just across the street though we didn't spend anytime there); 2) Reasonable price; 3) I am a Marriott member. It turned out to be a good choice. Had our first pleasant surprise when we were upgraded to an ocean view room at checkin. The hotel is pretty quiet so that you can rest and unwind after a day's busy activities. We all slept well. Yet it's within walking distance to the hustle and bustle where all the shops and restaurants are. Staff and service are very good. There is a Starbucks and ABC convenience store right in the lobby which we visit almost every day. We also liked the open and spacious lobby. Overall, it's a very nice hotel I would recommend to anyone who are to stay at Waikiki.

The Marriott Beach Resort was the perfect place to spend our Christmas vacation with family. Upon checking in they gave us water bottles and each person a package of cookies. The elevators were quick and our room was the perfect size for 4 people. It has 2 Starbucks inside the hotel that open at 4:30 am, which is great when you are suffering from Jetlag. The lobby played Christmas movies every afternoon on a large screen TV. We would spend afternoons by the pool having a few cocktails while the kids play in the pool. It is located on the third floor so you get a view of the ocean and the bar has happy hour every night from 3-6. It seemed like this hotel had thought of everything. Each detail had been thought out and well executed. Can’t wait to return.

The hotel is located in a great walkable area for Waikiki Beach. Rooms are nice and the one we stayed in had double balconies. Only one pool is open and that was cold. Not swim-able. The other was under construction. But if you are a true beach going lover... the beach out front is protected from the waves and was warm. Perfect for little kids. Yoga in the a.m. hosted by Lululemon... a real treat.

Whats Good - Great location opposite beach and the sea swimming pools .Not much outside noise or noise inside from other rooms , our room just refurbished and really nice .. Good views from some rooms Not so good - tiny pool area and the pool itself was a real let down . Pool bar slow service for food , almost walked out - ok when food came .

This was an amazing getaway. The hotel staff were very attentive and address all concerns that I had. My room was comfortable and clean. Request a higher floor to have the best view. Must meet with concierge to arrange great activities. I was not impressed with the beaches in this area but the hotel is centered in an area for great shopping.

The location is excellent. The beach is right across the street. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Each room seems to have a small balcony for guests to sit outside and see the street and the water (or part of the water if not from an oceanfront room). Our two rooms are spacious. That said, I did not find their hotel environment attractive. Have been in many Marriotts with nicer settings. Parking is expensive ($45/day), and there is an additional charge of $35/day/room. Some minor points: they don't provide hotel slippers and there is no water in the room (have to go downstairs to get it from the water supply station). There is a small pot to make coffee or tea available, but one cup only. Must wait for the device to cool down to make a second cup.

We liked our room and the view. We were in room 2204 and the rooms are basic, but spacious. Parking is expensive at $50 a day. You can walk to anything in the beach area and there are lots of restaurants in the area. My only complain is the resort fee includes basically nothing at all and there is only one pool open and you can’t even find a chair or enjoy it at all. They disclose this, but it’s bad and that fee should be discounted if the resort isn’t 100% in my opinion.

Very nice hotel, conveniently located. Stayed there during the busy New Years time. Rooms are excellent- fully renovated.Got the ocean view room and amazing view of Diamond Head from belcony. Friendly staff helped provide lot of tips for visits.

We booked about 4 months in advance for 5 nights and requested for 2 double beds. In short- you pay same amount and request months in advance for decency bed for your child instead you are given whatever they feel like, possibly profiled you and if you’re deemed suitable and posh enough for the new tower with rooms that you see on their website, google, Expedia but don’t be fooled you’d mostly end up in the old tower with leaks, construction noise, no water on certain days!!! Our ordeal- When we arrived we were given a tiny room with Queen size bed, impossible for the 3 of us to sleep on. We were told a room with 2 double beds would be available the next day. Our room for the first night was so tiny the there was no space to put roll away bed until we put a chair and a table in the balcony, even after that there was no space to stand!Next day arrives and we ask to look at the rooms with the double beds, only to find out because we had other family in our trip that the tower was extremely noisy with construction work going on through the night, no water for an hour one day (with no note saying that there will be no water ) ceiling dripping in the hall. The room we were shown was old and shoddy with a roof of parking lot blocking any view from the balcony. Couldn’t believe this was a room they’d offer for people who’ve paid the same price in the new tower! All of this took about an hour or more standing at the front desk, not knowing what the hell they were staring at the computer or going to a back room for. We were then told that a room in the new tower with 2 double beds would be available for us next day and to bring our bags down so we can shift in it. We had planned to go to pearl harbour memorial first thing in the morning so we packed our bags and went to speak to front desk to ensure that we could move into our new room when we got back from the memorial. Well we were wrong there we were standing at front desk yet again for more than an hour, to be told they can’t see the note the same guy at front desk had made yesterday for the new room, then they told us they tried to call us in the room and our cell phone to tell us there was no room for us the next day, which was a complete lie we had no calls on our cell phone, and why would we be in our room to answer phones from front desk all day? There was no letter/ note either to say there was no room with 2 double beds! Absolute lies straight to our face after waiting and watching incompetent staff faff around! For a whole 10 mins they saw 2 rooms available and then suddenly after some time in the back room with the manager they had disappeared and the hotel was fully booked!! Another big fat lie!We ended up not getting the Arizona memorial tickets because of the time we wasted with the front desk! Marriott Waikiki need to get their act together!

We are here for 5 days and just arrived yesterday. If I wasn’t staying here through points and need to stay the 5 days, I would have checked out. There is construction going on during the day from 9-5. And when I say construction, it sounds like someone is in our room drilling. Like in our room. We came back to the room for a quick nap, and it is an unbearable sound. The pool stinks. It looks like it is from a motel 8. I am so annoyed that we are staying here. The rooms are in major need of renovation. This is my second Marriott stay this vacation in Hawaii and it is by far the worst one. The room seems like it is from 15-20 years ago. We actually have paint chipped off the side of the wall next to the bathroom. Find out if your stay is during the construction, and if so, find a different hotel. I cannot recommend this place less.

This is our 4th day at the hotel, and I usually don't write a review until I have had the same experience at least a couple of days. So here are the facts:Pros:1. Location is great if you want to be at Waikiki beach or want a city experience. Its just across the street from the beach and close to the downtown, malls, restaurants etc.2. Housekeeping staff is very friendly3. Rooms are clean - pretty basic amenities4. Starbucks is inside the hotel5. Rooms have private balconies6. Every tourist activity will most likely have a pick up point at this hotel, because of central location.Cons:1. We are a Marriott Bonvoy member and as we arrived, we were told that we are being upgraded to a better room on higher floor. We got to the room and there were 2 double beds (when we had booked one king). If there were 2 queens, we wouldn't mind because the room had a better view. So we went back to our original booked room.2. Parking here is $45 a day (for self park and $50 for valet), if you rented a car. So we paid $20 per day for rental and $45 for parking. 3. Since the hotel is right on the main street of Waikiki, the road noise is so loud, that you feel like you are sitting on the street. The glass doors and windows are not able to block any noise at all. 4. As if the road noise was not enough, there is so much construction happening at and around the hotel right now that you can hear it from all sides. Again, doors and windows do not block any noise. So if you are trying to take a nap during the day in your room or at the pool, good luck!5. Pool is equally noisy, even late at night, with construction happening. Jacuzzi / hot tub is not functional at this time due to "rennovation" 6. Each drink at the pool is at least $13 and I am pretty sure there is negligible alcohol and a lot more cream in pina colada than what $13 is worth. Every food dish at their restaurants is small portions and big price, but oh well, it is a 5 star hotel. 7. We had trouble sleeping because of all the noise around during night time. I recorded an audio to give everyone an idea of what the noise level is like, but doesn't look like the file type is supported in trip advisor.

We decided to book here when we were unable to book all the nights we wanted at another hotel in Waikiki. We are Bonvoy/Marriott rewards members and wanted to give this one a try. We will definitely stay at the other hotel if we ever come back. Pros:-Clean room-Friendly front desk lady-Friendly valet-Close to lots of dining and shoppingCons:-Double beds, not queen beds-not a relaxing environment-The first room we were given was not ready and we had to change rooms-One bed is very close to the Lanai and our room is pool side w/ocean view and it seems the pool area is loud all hours of the night. It's 12:30 am right now as I write this review and I am awake (again) due to noise. It was obnoxiously loud earlier in the evening.-Expensive resort fee, expensive parking

I stayed there for 2 nights during a business trip. The room is OK although nothing exceptional. The hotel is HUGE and feels a little bit like a mall when you walk around...It's walking distance from the beach but Waikiki is a tiny strip of sand with 1000s of people piled up ...Not a place i would go to spend family/vacation time except if you're a fan of massive resorts

Enjoyed a wonderful time at this resort across a beautiful stretch of beach on the diamond and the room for a nicely appointed and a lot of great shopping and Dining available around. the terrific stay it was grossly interrupted after we check out. departing the valet area have all the cash I had in the American dollars I have left and gave to the valet Eddie [-] he literally took each one dollar bill in each hand, looked at the money then looked at me with gross face as of insulted. I can not believe it

Came in late after 20 hour day. Gave me grief at the front desk, had to call manager to straighten out. Room was a place to sleep having to get up at 7 am for another 5 hour flight. Clean, used heavily, lots of people and tours. Recommend if you can get a good rate.
user_name:
Explorer663662
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I hesitated to book this hotel because there are SO many options in the Waikiki area, and this one is a bit further south. However, I had 0 regrets. In fact, I am more pleased with this hotel than any other in that location. It's conveniently located to many of the restaurants we had looked up, it's right by the beach and the zoo. The rooms were clean, spacious, and our view was spectacular. We sat on our balcony every night soaking up the sunset. The service was excellent, and everyone made us feel welcomed. It's a very busy hotel, but they make you feel like you're the only one. I would 10/10 return.

I've stayed at this hotel many times over the years and my experience has always been excellent. This stay was no different. In many ways, this was actually the best stay I've had. The pre-check in e-mail that seems to have been sent to all elite members was such a nice new touch. With such a large hotel, it's often difficult to feel a personalized level of service, but this set the tone for a great stay. I cannot say enough positive things about Sharilyn, the guest services coordinator who helped to coordinate my pre-stay requests. Sharilyn is one of the friendliest and best brand representatives for Marriott that I have come across (and I think that is saying a lot with almost 600 lifetime nights). Not only did she correspond warmly before my stay, I had the opportunity to meet her while at the hotel and she was just as great an ambassador in person. The opportunity to upgrade to an Ocean Front room was much appreciated. The renovations in the Kealohilani tower were so well done. It looks like every aspect of the room was redone. The touches are wonderful and great both for a business or pleasure trip. It is great to see that the owners are putting money back into the property as I cannot wait to see the redone pool area next year. Beyond that, I feel like family whenever I have breakfast at the Kuhio Grill. The staff seem to recognize me from year to year as I am always greeted so warmly. I love that much of that staff has been at Kuhio Grill since I began coming to the property (back in 2006). All I can say is keep up the great work!

Only had a few days here on our way back to AU from a mainland US trip. Hotel is quite nice and facilities are good including pool area and restaurants. WiFi is absolutely shocking though. For this day and age you’d expect far better. We were on 31st floor so not sure if that was a factor but it was really bad. Made it difficult when trying to keep up with work emails etc

Waikiki Marriott is a beautiful property. Well maintained and great ocean views from just about every room. The food choices are excellent and the service is outstanding. This is not right on the beach, but it is just a short walk across the street to the beach. And, walking distance to all of Waikiki. I highly recommend this property.

Arrived and welcomed with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room ..as guest services texted me before arrival to welcome us. I told them we were eloping and they delivered these goodies. Beach is small and overcrowded with homeless. Easy run to Diamondhead Crater trail. Excellent food!!

I used my suite night rewards to upgrade to a suite for part of my reservation. I fully expected to have to switch rooms to accommodate my entire stay, but the front desk was able to rearrange so that wouldn't be necessary. While that was definitely appreciated, I'm still skeptical that the room was actually a suite and not just a regular room with 2 queen beds. No sofa or sitting area, no additional amenities than any other Marriott room I'd stayed in (standard mini fridge, coffee, safe). It was on the corner of the hotel so while it did have a lovely ocean view to enjoy for maybe a few minutes in the morning before I would head to the office, that benefit was overshadowed by the nightly music from the neighboring hotel that lasted until 11pm or later. Unfortunately, I heard more of that music while trying to fall asleep before another work day than I saw of the ocean during my entire trip. I know the hotel cannot control entertainment from another hotel, but surely there could have been some forewarning upon check-in. Had I known, I honestly would have passed on the suite and just opted for peace and quiet in the evenings all together. From a confusing arrival with no signage directing us to the hotel entrance from the main street, to late nights of ambient music that didn't help with jet lag or lend itself to a refreshing next day, I found the overall experience to fall short in comparison to my prior Marriott stays. Just disappointing to have traveled so far only to wish I was somewhere else each (noisy) night.
user_name:
Sarah S
Wake Forest, North Carolina

review_body: No fans of a bustling and crowded Waikiki Beach, we got lucky to have found Marriott for our stay.In the midst of chaos that is Waikiki Beach, we got the perfect if not the best view of Beach .We arrived late at night, the check in was fast. We got a room by the hook. When we open the balcony we were just happy to see Waikiki Beach for the first time at night. But next to us is the ice machine, the light was constantly on and the sound when people on the floor get ice off of the machine was just loud.The next day we went by reception and ask the staff for another room. They have availability of one room further from the ice machine. That's totally not worth the swap. Then we told her that we don't mind waiting another day of that will be better, so they can take their time to accommodate us to a better room.It was well worth the wait, Kalae (apologies if the name is incorrect), the same reception staff from the day before, had us check in our bags, and gave us our new rooms at 1500 the next day. We got in the room, opened the balcony and just sigh. Beautiful. Not only we were further away from the ice machine, we were further up. Fantastic views. I could swear the room seems bigger, but maybe because it's beautiful it just seems better. We met her again close to the end of our visit. We stopped by reception just to thank her, she was just wonderful. We were truly grateful, she made all the difference to our stay.We spent a good few times at the pool at days when we were too tired to go to the beach. So convenient because we can just drag ourselves easily back to the room. Ilikea was there attending to us. She was the most friendly, lively, charming and pleasant staff by far. We saw how she treated other guests too. Very very kind.The last highlight was on the last day after a full day at the pool we were ready to take showers and get ready in the hospitality lounge as our flight was close to midnight. Buster helped us get our small bags to get ready and then later our suitcases when we were ready to leave the hotel. He was very helpful and kind, genuinely kind. The wonderful feeling from this interaction stays with us for a good couple of days. Until today when we would talk about him and it would automatically bring a smile to our faces.

Big size hotel is located right in front of Waikiki beach where you can have short walk to the shops and restaurant around the area. Also if you would like to go Ala Moana shopping center, there is shuttle and tram services all day long within 10-15 mins from the hotel. Room is just okay, old style but they are renovating so pls expect some noises. I would recommend to get room with ocean view balcony. It’s a big different! I woke up seeing beach and clear sky in morning even sit outside looking in the dark was helping me have fully vocation vibes.1 pool closed for renovation so 1000 rooms sharing a tiny pool on 2nd floor.

One of the busiest main beaches in Honolulu, something for everyone.Has definitely changed over the last 30 years the 1st time I came here, much more touristy but still a nice beach to walk around and take in the sites, can rent surfboards and anything you choose.

I am a loyal Marriott elite member and this is the worst Marriott property I have ever stayed at. I understand construction needs to happen but when they are beating on your ceiling so hard that pieces are falling on your bed then that is an issue. When I talked to the manager about it he said that there is nothing they can do about it because they have to fill the rooms and can only hope that the guest are out for the entire day. Needless to say I checked out 3 days early. There are so many nice hotels on Oahu so stay somewhere else. Even without the noise this hotel is sub par for a Marriott. Very few amenities and the grounds are unimpressive (there are none other than a few patches of fake grass).

We loved our experience at this Marriott. I did not particularly care for Waikiki (too crowded and commercial) but this hotel was excellent. Beautiful facility and rooms, great service. Room was spacious and clean, bed extremely comfortable. We were upgraded to a high floor with an amazing view of Diamond Head, which is one of the advantages of staying so far southeast on Waikiki (few other tall towers to obstruct the view).The restaurants were ok not great, but there are a thousand other restaurants in Waikiki and beyond in Honolulu. I would definitely stay here again, but I doubt we would return to Waikiki. So convenient to be able to pick up our rental car here!

During our recent visit to Marriott Resort Waikiki,October 26th to 1st November 2019, my wife and I experienced a hotel where service was non existent and we found the staff quite rude and non helpful.Though the room was sold to us as a luxury room we found it very basic.Being told that gratuaties had to be paid we ask the question WHY this is mandatory when service levels are so poor. Things such as room cleaning was extremely poor and simple things like soap, clean towels, and waste bins were constantly missed. This is one experience we will certainly not be repeating or recommending to others.

With a wonderful ocean and pool view, from freshly updated room, this hotel provided an excellent overall experience for us.Best deals are the fish tacos and chicken quesadillas at the pool level moana terrace restaurant at happy hour.Friendly staff, very clean rooms, enjoyable views from our balconyWe would definitely stay here again.

My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa for our 5 year anniversary. We were in contact with Sharilyn in guest experience who went above and beyond in making our anniversary very memorable. She was very engaging and personal as she got to know our itinerary and reason for our stay. It is always nice when someone asks, “Are you celebrating anything special while you are here?” Rather than having to surface this ourselves. She sent up a nice amenity on the night of our anniversary (pictured)! Sharilyn was very attentive and hospitable. It shows that she genuinely cares about her guests. Thank you Sharilyn for a wonderful stay!

By choosing a beach front room, we had a gorgeous view of all of Waikiki beach & ocean. It has just been refurbished and each of the ocean front rooms had a balcony with 2 chairs & a lounge chair for our enjoyment. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The hotel is at the end of the beach near the zoo so you have the entire beach to look at. We couldn't have picked a better place to stay.

I’ve stayed at this hotel four times now in the past few months and really love it. The renovated rooms are beautiful and some of the nicest I’ve seen at any Marriott, at least in my opinion. I also like that the hotel has water filling stations, coin laundry, food stores, and some to-go restaurants right next to it. I also always find the front desk staff to be very kind and welcoming. I often check in very late in the middle of the night because of flight schedules and they are still energetic and welcoming. I look forward to my next stay, and to seeing the remodeled pool deck. Thank you Marriott!

Upon arrival we were greeted and felt extremely special to be there! We were checked in by Front desk Manager Wendy who was amazing! We had mentioned that our anniversary was earlier that week and we were sort of on Oahu celebrating that. She had given us ocean view and also when leaving the desk stopped us to give us a treat! Cup Cakes which is actually our favorite. Location of the hotel is perfect, last hotel on the Waikiki strip. Pool service was good as well and even though the other hotel pool was under renovation the pool that was open wasn't too crowded. Really a perfect few nights in Waikiki.

Long flight from LHR to LAX. Have a day rest then another six hours flight to Honolulu. Very nice and friendly place good to hire a car to get around every where as there are a lot of buses called trolleys but very expensive up to $25 each person each trip.A trip to Diamond Head is a must. As the view from the top are unbelieveable. It takes around 45 minutes to climb make sure it's done first thing in the morning as the weather gets very humid and a bottle of water is a must.Plenty of shopping places with all designer names.Best of all is Waikiki beach and the sunset is amazing

First visit and not a fan. Right from arrival, parking is a pain and watch the overhead mirrors so you don't tag another car coming around the corner. Check in was smooth but watch your reservation. Mine was for a king or 2 doubles, got the 2 doubles even though my reservation was a month in advance. Was eligible for an upgrade, asked for it and told my 2 doubles were an upgrade, right.Reservation says ocean view, but should say ocean viewable, see pictures. First is the view when looking out the balcony, you have to look right and down the street to "see" the ocean. Bed is comfortable but I'm by myself on this trip, had I brought my wife I'd leave. Carpet is buckled and stained. Oh yeah, you want ice, it's only available on odd floors and of course I'm on an even floor. Went up a floor to get ice and guess what, out of order, then down 2 floors and back up 1 just to get ice. $180 a night AND a resort fee, wow.

My husband and I were celebrating a special anniversary and our children gave us a trip to Hawaii. The hotel was very nice and newly renovated. Our room had an ocean view as well as a view of Diamond Head. The staff had forgotten to send up chocolate covered strawberries, but it was sent up after a phone call. The hotel was very convenient to dining, shopping and the beach. The hotel provides towels and beach chairs at no charge. I would definitely stay here again. The on-site laundromat came in handy as I had a mishap with ketchup on the plane.

Significantly improved from even a few years ago. We got a room upgrade too. WHAT A VIEW - both Waikiki Beach AND Diamond Head. Easy walking to LOTS of restaurants and shopping, not to mention literally across the street from the BEACH. Relatively reasonable prices (except for parking). Nice shops within the hotel complex, including a very nice ABC Store.

This was actually our second stay at this hotel. We are Marriott Platinum, and enjoy the predictability of the Marriott product. In this case we upgraded to an ocean view room and were glad we did. This is a very large hotel, but seems well maintained and managed. The front desk was helpful, but I was disappointed they didn't have our room ready when we requested an early check-in. Looks like they do well to keep their rooms fully booked.Fortunately, the breakfast came with our room and we enjoyed both the food and the service. They have a very large breakfast offering including great omelets cooked to order. We were especially impressed with the friendliness and efficiency of the waitresses. Very attentive and recognized us after the first day. Their brightness was a great way to begin each day.Our room was clean and well-appointed. The Wi-Fi worked well and the shower was good. The real star of this hotel is the location. Close to the beach and easy access to restaurants and transportation. We'll be back.

The hotel is under renovation! My complaints go far beyond the room that we were given. When we arrived at the hotel it was under construction. If we would’ve known the hotel was under construction we would’ve not stayed there. There was no indication on Marriott‘s website nor was there any indication or information provided to the travel agent that made our arrangements. On the day we were leaving hotel was when the travel agency notified us of the construction.Our room was directly above the construction site. On the day we checked-in the guest relations agent had to stop the check-in process because the jackhammer noise was so loud she could not communicate to us. Every morning of our stay, the jackhammers begin around 8 AM and went on for hours. On one day our water was shut off due to construction.One of the managers from the Marriott property contacted me on Friday (Oct 18th) morning. He called around 9:00am MST and I made a comment to him that it was 5:00 am in Hawaii. He stated that he was the late night manager and following up on my comments. He said that there was a manager on duty 24 hours a day at the resort.I told him that on the day we checked in that the clerk had to stop the check in process because the jackhammers were so loud you couldn’t hear her. I also told him that the jackhammers were going off every morning and there were front end loader’s hauling off concrete outside our window. I also told him about the water being shut off on the one afternoon. I also explained to him that we had stayed at the Marriott resort hotels and this was not consistent with our resort experiences with Marroitt. The manager stated that the hotel was under reconstruction and the area that we were staying was part of the tower that were being renovated. The manager said that we “should have expected some issues or inconveniences as a result of the renovation”. REALLY!!!The manager offered to give us future free nights at the resort or add Marriott points to my account. I told him that I would like to talk to my wife about his offer and ask if he could call me back Saturday morning at around the same time. He said he would call me back Saturday and we have not heard from them.I am very disappointed with Marriott headquarters as well as this hotel as no one could ever call our experience as a resort destination. The beds were soft and folded up at the edges, the towels were thin and tattered, and far from any resort experience we have ever had with a Marriott property. The hotel should be ashamed of themselves for charging people a resort fee.On the day we checked out we were notified the the hotel was under renovation.

Stayed here for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is one if it’s many outstanding features. On the other side of the road from the famous Waikiki beach this hotel is truly in the centre of the action. 90 seconds walk into the sand. Doesn’t get much better than that. I was fortunate enough to end up with a balcony and I had a beautiful view of the ocean. The room was very spacious and inviting. The bathroom was very nice and more than large enough. Bed was super comfortable.The lobby area is really quite stunning. Big open space with a star bucks and a full convenience store. Staff are AMAZING. super friendly and helpful. We came as a decent sized group and not all rooms were ready but they made sure to keep us informed and well looked after. Included breakfast was top notch. Standard ‘American’ breakfast with a full Asian breakfast section as well. Including a variety of breads and cheeses and charcuterie. The whole 9 yards.Car rental from large company in the hotel was really handy. Means you don’t have to pay to park over night. Pool area was huge and didn’t feel crowded. You won’t be disappointed if you stay here. Everything you need. Right where you need it.

The non-renovated rooms should not be allowed to rent out. So so so gross. The carpet is filthy, the decor is from the 80’s at best, the views were of a construction site/parking lot. I had to walk for 10 minutes to get to the only open pool or restaurant. The front desk staff was super short and unfriendly to us. I have a feeling being a “friend & family” of Marriott is a bad thing in this hotels mind. They seemed to treat us the poorest and give us the worst because of our earned discount and that’s super sad. Marriott preaches to treat their employees like their guests and this one absolutely needs to take a lesson on that.

Ocean view was amazing, and we can still see the Diamond head view as well. The staff were really friendly. Room was very neat and clean. I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott. The staff new it was our honeymoon so there was always a surprise in our room every time we came back to change clothes. Bottle of Champagne, cake, flowers, etc..

October 2019:I’ve stayed here a few times this year and haven’t been disappointed at all. I was originally in a smaller room with two double beds which I found to be ok, but a bit too small for me. I had a leaking toilet so after the first night the manager offered to put me in another room, so I took the offer. The second room was much bigger with bigger beds but was lacking any kind of view. Regardless I was still happy and am thankful for the bigger bed. BE AWARE that there is a lot of construction/renovations going on for the next few months at this property so if you are a late sleeper or want to have access to a big swimming pool this might not be the place for you. This is from my April 2019 stay:The rooms are nice and the staff is friendly and helpful. My only negative is that the bed was too hard for my liking. Other than that in enjoyed staying here very much. It’s close to everything in Waikiki and if you don’t like to walk, grab an Uber or Lyft. We had a great view of the beach and Diamond Head and even had a 1 legged pigeon who came and visited us at sunset every night.

we had an east facing room with fab views to Diamond Head Crater. We had booked bed and Breakfast and the breakfasts were good. The bed was comfortable which was the main consideration. The bathroom door didn't shut properly so there was a big gap when closed. not sure if that was intentional.We did have some very noisy neighbours for a couple of nights which spoilt the experience a bit but thats not the hotels fault. We never found the bar so not sure if there was one.|We used the Concierge for some tourist advice which was good. we stored the luggage on the final morning so we could do some more sightseeing. Very helpful.Overall a good stay and a nice hotel

Stayed in room 2414 right at the top of the hotel Great room with fantastic ocean and Diamond-head views. There are 6 lifts which are fast and frequent. The hotel organised our helicopter trip round the island, car hire, sunset cruise and Pearl Harbour trip - all great trips organised really effortlessly. The pool area was great despite the refurbishment noise taking place when we were there. The lobby shops are all fantastic (barter on the prices on offer - I did) and they have the inevitable 2 "ABC" shops on site (which were really useful). The staff were really helpful and the three restaurants on site are all good too. We treated ourselves to a spa massage too - the ladies were friendly and made us feel special. I really cannot fault the hotel in the two weeks we were there.

I loved everything about this hotel. There are two towers, i stayed in the tower closer to the beach. It was amazing. Great renovated room with real AC and a nice balcony. The bathrooms are great, double sinks with nice separate tub and shower. Beds were comfortable. Food was ok, the breakfast buffet was great. Staff wonderful. I love that they give you refillable water bottles! The hotel is undergoing a renovation but i never found it obtrusive or loud, they have two pools so if one is under reno the other one is open. Another great thing is the pool is open past six pm. Sometimes you just want to go swimming at night, and you can here! I will definitely recommend this to everyone- great property.

We stayed here for 3 days. It is undergoing renovations so during the day in our tower it was noisy, we were further away from the beach front but still had an ocean view and a great view of Diamond Head. The room was spacious and clean but ready for a refresh. The bar overlooking the beach was great for afternoon drinks. Being right on the main drag meant that there was a lot of choice of restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. There is no airport shuttle but it is a major pick up location for many tour operators. Taxi from the airport is about $40.

Just spent a week in room 3163 and it was great. Beautiful hotel, modern and clean and could not fault a thing. We had three rooms for our family and everyone was happy with the wonderful staff and location of the hotel. Breakfast buffet was great and catered to all our tastes. Even received two delicious red velvet cupcakes from Allyson at reception for my birthday this month.Highly recommend this fabulous hotel.

the room was really comfortable, the location was outstanding, loved the curved balcony and the views. the price was high but we were not looking to penny pinchand were treating ourselves to that once in a lifetime experience.

Since last visiting many years ago, the rooms have been updated and the beach area has much improved. We had an ocean view room and it was perfect. We enjoyed our breakfast on the balcony watching the surfers come to start their early morning swim. The room has been updated and was comfortable and clean. Cleaning staff is excellent. We were greeted by great desk staff. Beach is across the street, one wish is that Marriott provide for umbrellas and chairs. To rent from private company is $50 a day or $30 for 2 hours, a bit steep. The area is busy, plenty of great restaurants to pick. Some nice shops on first floor. Nice steakhouse, Sushi and Italian attached, but not part of the hotel. Pool area is nice, cabanas are $75 a day for 2 lounge chairs and 2 waters- so skip and use lounge chairs and umbrellas on deck. Service at pool is a bit slow. The pool bar is better. Great onion rings, nachos not so much. Drinks are good and average about $13 each. Resort type pricing. Over all a,very good stay.

A lovely position and close to many major attractions. The beach across the road and walking distance to zoo, aquarium and shops. We were in the Bonvoy tower on 21st floor with superb views from the balcony. Pool only small and the noise of construction being carried out a little annoying. Rooms are spacious but we found it amazing that they only supplied paper cups for tea and coffee and that was limited. No wine glasses in room either. Staff very friendly and helpful.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. Right in the middle of waikiki beach. Beautiful ocean views. You can walk everywhere from this hotel or get on the bus right outside the hotel. A half block from a huge outdoor shopping mall. They closed off the street on the weekend and had entertainment and vendors right outside the hotel. The only downside is that you have to get up early to get a chair by the pool, and you have to pay for an umbrella on the beach, and they go fast too. Book an umbrella the day before. The food wasn't great at the pool bar restaurant or the concierge club, but there are lots of places to eat in walking distance from this hotel! The room was fine, bed was great.

This Marriott property is in an excellent location, all the hop on hop off bus lines stop next to the property. It is only two blocks from Kapiolani Park Zoo, five blocks to the International Market place, across the street from the beach, etc. The parking is expensive, so we cabbed from the airport to the hotel then used public transportation or walked to most of the locations we wanted to visit. There are good restaurants on site with countless other eateries within easy walking distance. We will definitely stay at the Marriott Resort and Spa the next time we visit the islands.

We stayed here in a king premium ocean view room September 10-16th. The room was quite large, and had a nice ocean/Diamond Head view. The room was very clean, and the bed was comfortable. The were several restaurants on property, but we only ate at the pool bar once. The food there was just ok, but the views of Waikiki were amazing. The pool was small, but clean, and there was plenty of seating and umbrellas. It was a great location. The valets worked quickly and were always ready to help. Everyone in our party of 4 agreed that we could not have chosen a better place to stay.

We recently stayed for 8 nights on holidays. Whilst the staff told us that they were renovating when we checked in, I was surprised at the drilling and hammering from 9am in the morning. We also did not have water for 6 hours on one day due to renovations. Whilst the hotel staff were friendly, if you are on a relaxing holiday you may wish to reconsider during the renovation period. If I had known in advance, I definitely would have booked another hotel.

If you have to stay in Waikiki, and we do to conduct local business and visit family, this hotel has an excellent location. Only two blocks from Kapiolani Park, it’s at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki so leaving the hotel is fast and easy, and returning you can come in from the Kapahulu Avenue side and avoid all the craziness trying to drive down Kushiro or Kalakaua. Their parking is expensive, but so is most of Waikiki. Good restaurants on site, International Marketplace eateries are a few blocks away, and the beach is across the street. They were remodeling one of the two pools this visit, so a little crowded at the one remaining. The room we had was nice, comfortable, clean, but the layout was strange. TV was on the wall to the right of the beds, no door for the toilet area of the bathroom...etc. this was a recently remodeled room, so kind of weird. We’ve stayed here 4-5 times, never disappointed.

My wife and I visited this hotel for three nights at the end of September. This was our first time in Hawaii, and as we wanted to visit pearl harbour museum, we stayed at this hotel in Waikiki. Waikiki was not what we expected, very busy, very noisy and reminiscent of a low budget Spanish resort. We were also disappointed with the Marriott hotel, rooms and facilities were ok, however we found the staff generally unfriendly. Won’t be back. Sorry, just our view of the resort/ hotel.

Fabulous hotel. Rooms were spacious and an excellent sized balcony. Views from the room over Waikiki beach are beautiful. Free WiFi and every guest is given a water bottle that they can fill from numerous points in the hotel. Courtesy room to use after check out if you have late flights

Let me say at the outset that I had no problem with the Marriott Waikiki. There was a sign in the lobby about rooms being refreshed and I found that our room was very nice. My main complaint, though, was a characteristic of this hotel that is typical of hotels in this area. Most of the public areas are not air conditioned. They are, rather, open air. This can be a real problem in Hawaii where it can be quite hot and humid (mostly the latter) much of the year.

Stayed at the newly renovated wing of the Marriott Waikiki Resort and Spa. Big property. Nice and spacious lobby with a Starbucks. The rooms are nice but have a couple of flaws. Every time the shower is turned on, you need to move the hand held second shower and aim it to the shower wall otherwise, the water will end up on the floor. Secondly, the walls are very thin.You can hear conversations next door and every time someone uses the toilet. The hotel is located across from the beach and lots of restaurants nearby.

We stayed at this location and found it quite nice. Our room on the 24 floor had a breathtaking taking view of Diamond Head. As far as the inside of hotel the have an open air lobby which is nice, rooms have refrigerator, great air conditioners, wonderful water pressure, coffee and tea in the rooms, cleaning service every day, easy access to Waikiki Beach and tons of restaurants and shops to enjoy. They have two towers so you could have a grand view of the beach as well. Staff is so awesome!! We want to send a shoot out to Buster the bellmen as he was incredible!! He was so helpful our entire stay and so positive!! His energy just filled us with joy!! He loves his job!!! Hotel is easy walking distance to bus stops, beach, zoo and shopping. Hotel is also a major pick up location for chief’s luau and duck boat tours!! I would recommend this location for any traveler.

Stay at Waikiki Beach Marriott, the Resort was Fabulous, however Some , I say some of the staff could’ve been a little more friendly. Front desk clerk was great, however the Concierge Desk clerk seemed a little lazy, when asked a question the guy was very vague a gave the impression he had better things to do. Parking garage was tight. Entrance and exit was the same direction, which was kinda dangerous due to the “curve around”barely had enough room for two cars side by side .We had a partial ocean view which was great !! No complaints there . Not a lot of activities to have to pay a $37 daily resort fee. I’d recommend this hotel because of short distance to the beach and cleanliness .

the check in process was great, the room was super clean and honestly the walk to the beach was actually really short ( less then five mins ) they had a starbucks yay haha and the boardwalk was actually really close by. I would honestly come back here. The room was clean and big too.

There was some building work in progress while we were there, so one of the pools was out of action, and there was a bit of noise during the day. The rooms were fabulous, and the views of Diamond Head were memorable. The hotel was very expensive by the time I converted our Aussie dollars, and I’m not convinced that it was worth it. We arrived very early after an overnight flight, and checkin wasn’t until 3 pm. We spent the day napping near the pool, but I felt that the hotel didn’t do enough to try to get at least one of our two rooms ready. We were offered the “hospitality room”, but it was really only a place to change clothes, and not very comfortable. There are cabanas by the pool which all remained empty all day while we waited, and I couldn’t help but feel that it would have been nice if we’d been offered use of one while we waited - would have saved me from continually nodding off in the shade and waking in full sun! Having said all that though - I understand that checkin time was always advertised, and our luggage was securely stored, so perhaps I’m being a little unfair! The hotel is conveniently situated across the road from the beach, and handy to shops and restaurants, and we did enjoy our stay.

Have stayed here for the last couple of years visiting friends. The Waikiki Marriott is a big hotel (over 1,000 rooms in to towers), two small pools and a number of restaurants but then you are right on Waikiki Beach! Rooms have obviously bee upgraded in the last couple of years, have had good service and good meals when eating on site, however so many great choices along Waikiki. Our breakfast was included and the morning buffet in Kuhio Grill was great and all the staff were very friendly and helpful.

I came for Labor Day weekend a short trip. First time in Hawaii. The hotel was beautiful the exterior was very nice and the room pretty nice with a wonderful view. But I have to give a poor review on the customer service. I hate do it but, I am paying for service and when that service is not meant then I have to express it. When first arrived the front desk person was very dry and cold not very hospitable. I try make a racist issue it 2019 and we International people that travel but with said it still have old mind set. I am sorry people still care that attitude today. It not first going front desk asking for some information or clear fiction on something. Same thing dry cold not warm, disconnected very short not smiling. Didn’t want even give service. What bugs me the most I am a long time member. With platinum, I ask the staff at front desk will be getting my point for my stay and he said yes.
