Why when looked on my account after my trip I didn’t see that I even stay at this hotel or got my points. When called back the same issue very dry cold and disconnected. And she toll me because I booked with a third party I don’t get points, why would one of your trained staff say something that not true if they are looking at my reservation. When call just now hearing of this. I like be respect either there for business or vacation if was business I would taken issue to head the hotel and bypass all of this rude behavior.

just few steps to the beach. very clean, have bar and live music daily by the pool. convenient starbuck coffee downstairs, restaurants and shopping around. Valet or self parking. Nice and roomy lobby area

This hotel was great! It is walking distance to all the shops and across the street from the beach. The rooms were great (my only complaint is we heard a LOT of noise, all hours of the night). The staff was great. Breakfast buffet was really good too. Parking is expensive but I'm pretty sure it is anywhere in the hotels. Great ocean view.

Average hotel in my opinion with expensive add-on fees. The "resort fee" is listed at $37 per day but in reality is $43 per day when you factor in the taxes. I asked the check-in agent what we get for the fees and he basically could not answer the question. There are reviews on here about great staff, however they must have been on holiday the week I was there, with the exception of the staff in the restaurant at breakfast whom was very friendly and efficient. We were not given a room upgrade although I have elite status with Marriott, the check-in agent seemed very disinterested. He did offer us complimentary breakfast because there is no Concierge lounge at the hotel. Breakfast buffet was adequate however it was basically the same thing every day. Some variety would have been nice. As noted on here the parking is very expensive - $50/day for valet plus tax. I'm told it is some of the most expensive in Waikiki. More disappointing was that I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival to ask if they could do something for us the day we were getting married. Supposedly they took note of this, however they did nothing, epic fail on the part of the hotel. Too bad, because these are the small things that make a "great stay" an "outstanding stay." Room was adequate, it had been renovated which was nice but nothing special. As noted in other reviews on this site, the pool area is very crowded and chairs can be hard to come by. Hotel did not want to honor late check out that I get as an Elite member saying that it does not apply at resorts, however in the end they did allow the late check out.To me there was nothing remarkable about the hotel and I would not stay here again. Much better (and less expensive in many cases) options in the area.

The hotel has a large lobby and a heated pool on floor 3. I had a room with 2 queen beds and a balcony, and the room was perfect for 4 people! You just need to cross the street to get to the beach. The hotel has 2 ABC stores in it and even a Honolulu cookie company in it! There is No parking in the hotel, you can use the Valet or park at the parking meters, which shut off at 6pm, then its free. The Honolulu zoo is only a few blocks away, and the west side of the hotel has great views of Diamond Head and the beach by it.

This my good to hotel in Hawaii!!! An added bonus is that they have free Hawaii themed resort activities daily. The pool over looks the Duke's status. The rooms are very well equipped and spacious. Parking is $45-50.

We clearly didn’t do enough research because (based on the name) we thought we would be at a “beach” hotel. In reality, you go to the sidewalk. Go to the crosswalk, hit the button, and hunt for a spot on the public beach. Cost: Counting the $37 dollar resort fee and the ocean room view upgrade it ended up being $390 a night. For a place that was neither a beach hotel or resort. In reality, within two blocks of the place there are less expensive places to stay, because all of you end up using a crosswalk to hunt for a spot on public beach. The a Marriott justifies that $37 “resort” fee by offering things like ukulele lessons, but it’s a hotel (not a resort).Room: Just fine, remodeled, clean carpet, decent furniture, decent bathroom fixtures, good working Air Conditioner, clean smelling room, great maid service!Staff: Didn’t need them much but everyone, and I mean everyone was fantastic and hospitable!Pool: For a two tower hotel WAY TOO SMALL, and too few beach chairs. You would have to get there earlier to reserve a spot and who wants to do that on vacation. Sure, just cross the street and hunt for a spot on the public beach, but if you want to spend any time there you might want to stop by a store a buy a beach umbrella.Food: We passed on the $45 dollar breakfast buffet and the $20 Hamburgers at the pool bar. There are a ton of nice restaurants in walking distance.Parking: $45 a day self park or $50 valet. Didn’t want to drive in Honolulu so we did Lyft, Taxis & Tours.The Hotel is $15 Taxi ride to Diamond Head, make sure to do that for a great hike!

We booked this hotel via Orbitz and were excited for a hotel located on Waikiki Beach with ocean views. Upon checking into our room, we were HIGHLY disappointed when we opened our door and found a very dated room that did not match the photos online, at all. When we asked the hotel, we were informed that half of the hotel is renovated and half is not. We were in the un-renovated tower and it was an additional $175/night to get the room we thought we had booked in the beginning. We honestly debated cancelling our reservation and finding a new hotel, but we were there during a peak time, and there was nothing else available. We paid for the upgrade, because we refused to stay in the old room. Due to the renovations there is also a lot of construction noise during the day.There was only one pool open, and it was quite small. While you can see Waikiki Beach from the hotel, it is across the street and public access. I did not feel comfortable leaving my belongings on the beach while getting into the ocean.

This property is large, with 2 towers. Was fortunate to have gotten a newly remodeled room which was very comfortable. The ability to go out onto the patio was invaluable for getting over the time change and adjusting. The meeting facilities were good.

Hotel is in a great location, however could be better by being on the water like the Sheraton down the road. Hotel is very old, but they are remodeling. Wanted to give the building itself a 3, but the staff greatly compensated for it. So way to go staff! Also, the pools are bad, but again they are remodeling those.

The property is beautiful and very close to alot of food places and trolley. The only problem was the room cleanliness we had two rooms and both of them were dirty. The tv and internet didnt work in the room. The staff and manager apologized they are going thru reconstruction. I would still stay there again. Housekeeping does need retraining on vaccuum and wippeing all counters. Old coffee stains and other crust substances on counters. Dirty qtips on floor on our other family members room. One day water was shut off didn't know until night prior. May should have stated on website ahead of time or at check in. Jordan at front desk was really helpful and the BEST OUR entire stay and the manager. Jordan went up and beyond and when other staff didn't want to be bothered he was always approachable with a smile to help. He needs to be a front desk manager. Or train others on how to be a people person l. I cant wait to visit back with the finished remodel. The staff is amazing and the food at the breakfast Buffett and seafood buffet night well worth it. ABC store in lobby which helped woth grabbing late night snacks. Has a DVD rental box free for guest ro get movies came in handy with DVD and fridge in the room. Microwave $10 a day. Make sure if needing a car rental from downstairs book a day ahead gets full quickly.

Love the location. Close to everything you might want in Honolulu. Yes, it is a big hotel and it is a very crowded area. But isn't that what you want? Staff was helpful, rooms were nice. Pool is always not crowded as most people go to the beach right there. But the pool is a nice change.

This place needs a severe modernisation. It’s rather old school, has no concierge lounge and the food at the bar near the pool is average. Location pretty decent right near the beach front. Staff is friendly and service oriented. Facility requires a severe Restauration though. Think there are better places around at a similar price range.

My wife and I stayed here for a week in July. It is a big hotel with a good location close to the beach (but not ON the beach like Moana Surfrider or Royal Hawaiian). We had one of the newly refurbished rooms in the tower closest to the ocean. The room was not large but was nicely done, and the bed was outstanding! (I stay 75-100 nights a year in Marriotts and this was one of the best I have experienced)There are two fairly run-of-the-mill hotel pools here, and one ~8 person hot tub. You get some poolside service at one pool. and basically none at the other. Really nothing exciting and one of the reasons I find the "resort" label a little misleading. There is a pretty good breakfast buffet here with a big selection (although it doesn't change much day to day). It is complimentary for Titanium members as your welcome gift (for two people in a room I believe). Servers were all very friendly.Parking is SUPER expensive here...do your research online and you will find a MUCH cheaper alternative just across the street.

We spent four nights here as we visited family. Overall, the experience was terrific. They are under construction, but we did not hear any of the construction noise as it is happening mostly on the lower floors of the hotel. Note that the entrance to this Marriott is on ‘Ohua Ave. and not Paoakalani Ave. as Google map states.Typical of parking anywhere in Waikiki, it is expensive: $50 for valet and $45 for garage. The porters are friendly and work well together. The parking garage entrance is half-way down the block from the valet entrance. It is a tight garage and some people drive very aggressively so watch yourself before getting to each corner. The main hotel entrance is on the first floor but access to one of the towers/shops from the second and third levels. They also have a dedicated tour group part of the hotel where tour buses can pick you up away from the main entrance of the resort.Check-in is nice and simple with a wonderful staff behind the desk. They genuinely seem happy to see the guest and treat them with respect.Our room was nice and updated; a cozy place and well thought out. There is a small closet with a safe, ironing board, iron. A single cup coffee maker with some coffee and a mini-fridge. I have begun to understand and appreciate the sliding door to the bathroom so the door is not in the way when open, same for the shower. The rooms are not so isolated though as there was a larger than average (to me) gap at the bottom of our front door, roughly an eighth of an inch, 4 mm. It was convenient for the staff to slide papers under the door, but I thought it would be easy enough for insects to enter as well. Noise in the hallway can easily be heard in the room. The lanai had two chairs and a cot.The staff was excellent and polite. Our room keeper did not seem to take our “tip” we left, so we left a larger one upon our departure.This resort is on the east end of Waikiki but an easy walk to anywhere on the main street. Across the street, the beach has a rock wall so it is suitable for children to get into the ocean water although it can get a bit dirty.There are plenty of shops and restaurants on-site and more just block away. They have a saline swimming pool on the third floor. Grab some towels by the pool to lay out to get some sun or if you want to go out and explore other beaches. Good place to stay if you want a slightly (and honestly I mean “slightly”) calmer Waikiki experience but can get into the experience very easily by walking a few blocks to the west.Overall, a wonderful stay with pleasant and helpful staff and will definitely consider staying again the next time we visit in Waikiki.

Great place to see Waikiki just steps from the beach. Great service and very upscale place. I would recommend the beach view. Lots of food and shopping just steps away. I will return. Very polite staff and very professional. I would also recommend the valet parking. Just pull up and they take care of the rest.

My first time to Hawaii and we booked this hotel for our (early) anniversary. Wendy at the front desk was very cordial and a great help in checking us in. When we got to our higher level modern room, the view was just breathtaking! This hotel is at a very central location, just across the beach, and has shops on the lower levels. We liked it so much that we want to bring our entire family here next time.

I just wanted to let you know about the amazing time, my family and I had during our short stay here. We were in Maui for about a week and decided to hop over to Oahu to see some family and friends. In Maui, we decided to stay in a Time Share from a rental company and our services there were subpar, so it was so nice to come to this resort and find the opposite.The main reason for my review is to tell you about how much we enjoyed, Buster. He took our bags to our room and told us about all the great things your resort had to offer, including the fact that we could see an amazing sunset and the Friday night fireworks from our room. We were just about to head to that area, so he saved us a trip. We would of missed out on a spectualar view had he not mentioned it. (Note: my understainding is this is only the rooms facing west in the K Tower).In addition, I found myself a bit lost at one point trying to find the pool towels later in the evening. I ended up in the Lobby and Buster asked me, if I needed some help. I was a bit embarrassed since he just told us earlier that day, but he took the time escort me, so I wouldn't be confused from his directions, again.All in all, we had a spectacular time. The entire staff was amazing, especially everyone at Valet, the Bell Man, and Buster. We think we left a couple of ours son's toys and books in the room - we think he threw it behind the couch or bed. I called and everyone there was very helpful and they said it may take a couple of days for someone to call me back, since the room is occupied. I have little hope that they would find it, but appreciated them taking the time to talk to me and I hope to hear from someone soon.I will definately be recommending this place to all of my friends and family and plan on staying there again, next time we are in Oahu.I forgot to mention that this place has DC Steakhouse and Sensai Sushi. Both are the same owner and share the bar. They have Happy Hour including a late night Happy Hour with Karaoke. Note: Their maybe a wait, so get there early. Also, if you don't want to wait. Sit at the bar and you can order from both menu's. The food and the service is fantastic!!!Mahalo!

Very night the bed was very cozy although there were rattling pipes between the walls witch made it a tiny bit hard to sleep. It seems like this hotel would deserve 5 stars! But there was another problem... my family had to wait 2 or 3 hours until our room was ready for our first night! But I felt IT WAS WORTH IT!

We spent 7 days here in July 2019. I chose this hotel because I had stayed here back in 2005 or 2006 and really enjoyed it. Still a nice place. Great location. Spacious room with oceanfront balcony--but at $500 per night, a bit steep in price. Still, worth it, in my opinion. Saltwater pool area is AWESOME, especially since poolside food/bar service is available and there is live music. My only complaint is that the front desk staff that we encountered had no clue what they were doing. Slow, confused, and no customer service skills whatsoever. I had requested early check-in, but room was not available. It took 30-45 minutes for them to figure this out. We were told to come back in a couple of hours. When we returned, it took LITERALLY more than an HOUR to get checked in. Completely ridiculous. This crappy start to our stay nearly caused us to seek a different hotel. But other than that, everything was great.

Stayed here when my son was relenting in the Army. Not sure you can get a hotel that is any closer to Waikiki Beach. The staff are wonderful. The lobby is spacious and welcoming. They have a Starbucks in the lobby so a big plus there.My room was huge. Rooms 1903. Large living room with a dining room table for 4, large television and balcony looking out at Waikiki Beach. Beautiful at night and early morning. I had a direct view of Duke Kahanamoku statue on the beach. Awesome!The living room can be a lockout as the room has two outside doors so one for the master bedroom and one for the front room.There are plenty of places to shop nearby as well as lots of restaurants if you choose not to eat at the hotel. The restaurant where you get breakfast is awesome. the staff super friendly and helpful I had lots of questions about local restaurants, not the tourist ones but the ones locals would eat at and had plenty to choose from that a couple waitstaff provided.The zoo is just down the street as is the aquarium. The beach is right there so lots of fun learning how to surf right across the street. Thoroughly impressed with this property and will return again next year.Be on the lookout for Ha'aheo Zablan, operations Manager. Say hi to him.Awesome gentleman and super helpful! Thank you sir for your help!

Stayed here for our family vacation with our 4 year old and it was great. The staff was friendly, the room was comfortable and very clean with a great view. We also really like the location since it was across from the beach and within walking distance from the zoo and aquarium. Not to mention there was a lot of restaurants and shopping there as well. They also had a good pool area which we enjoyed. We will definitely return.

We had such a great time! Beautiful, clean room with amazing views...the food and drinks were also great. Loved the breakfast Buffett - everything was fresh!!! The hotel staff was amazing in every way. Highly recommend this hotel. I could go on and on...

Beautiful hotel with great views of the water on the ocean side. They were able to help us book a couple of excursions and were very helpful with that. I had a remodeled room, and it was very nice.A few gripes:1. Instead of water bottles, they provide reusable plastic water bags you can fill up. But the only place to fill them is on the ground floor. Kind of annoying you have to go all the way down to the lobby to get drinkable water.2. The business center charges a fee for using the internet and even more for printing something. I wanted to print one sheet of paper but it would have been a fee. And I have status there but no discount for loyalty. Ridiculous. 3. Service pool side was pretty slow. Couldn't track the guy down.4. Air conditioner doesn't vent into the bathroom so it can get pretty hot in there.

Lovely hotel, nice pools (pool could be bigger , if hotel is busy the pool is manic and quite small) but still a lovely out door area with the pool! Brilliant happy hour , half price cocktails and appetisers.. food and drinks were great, no complaints here. Room was nice and spacious. Huge comfy bed . Lovely views from our balcony. Was quiet once the doors were closed, so had a nice relaxing sleep. Starbucks down stairs in the hotel lobby which is always a plus, all in all a great night stay . Wish we could of stayed longer. The only down fall is the price of the parking , 30 bucks a night .. a lot more expensive than other places but still a great place to stay if you don’t need to park a car.

We visited here for our honeymoon in July ‘19. We had a great 5-day stay in Oahu and overall enjoyed the visit.We have to start by questioning the resort fees...Is it really a resort? It has a few shops on the ground floor and some restaurants over 2 floors that the rest of the general public can access. Are resort fees a strange American custom - never heard of these before this trip. We really begrudge paying an extra $200 dollars when we paid silly money to come To Hawai’i from Scotland to begin with. What did my fees pay for? WiFi (free to access. Some discounts? (didn’t use them). Parking (nope, had to pay for that too). The Pool? ( you can wander in off the street and use it). The resort fees should really be rolled up in the price. They offer nothing extra and really tarnish what would have otherwise been an excellent stay. Absolute scam by hotels in the USA and something to question with your holiday booker/travel company. Location is however, excellent. 2- minute walk across the Main Street from the hotel to Waikiki beach. 32nd floor view from the rear tower was awesome from our balcony. Sansei restaurant was a great tip and though maybe a little pricey, a great honeymoon meal. You are paying for a top location but could probably find something similar with lower fees nearby if you shop around. We did really enjoy the service, hotel and stay other than the fees.

Traveled for business, used my suite night credits to upgrade. Upon arrival was told i was being upgraded from a city view to an ocean view suite. Suite???? It was a room with 2 beds and a chair. The terrace faced another hotel and the ocean was to the right. Window to the ocean had ripped film all over it. This room was FAR from a suite. It was a regular room. The TV was mounted on the side of the room, not too comfy to watch tv when in bed. The housekeeping was hit or miss, we didnt even have extra toilet paper in our room. Complained and got my suite credits back, felt like they tried to get over on me. Construction by the pool, not one quiet minute while i was out there. They should remove the extra $37 fee while the construction is going on, its terrible.I am a titanium member, was not impressed w this facility at all. The valet was very nice but that's really the only positive thing i can say about this resort.The beach across the street is gross. Not the hotel's fault or issue but the smell of urine is insane and I almost stepped on a mouse one day on the beach. Im sure Hawaii has other beautiful places, Waikiki isnt one of them.
user_name:
chrnnurse
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and my family booked an 80 min stress fix massage on my birthday (July 8). The therapist was nice and friendly. She said since it’s my birthday she would give me complimentary back scrub which is normally 15$ extra. I told her no but she insisted to take it since she’s giving it for free. Make a long story short I ended giving in. At the end of the session I gave her 20$ tip and she thanked me and left. As I was walking out of the spa the cashier said I need to pay 15$ for the upgrade. I was so shocked and disgusted with the therapist that she probably wasn’t happy with the tip and just decided to charge me. I’m not coming back here again due to unprofessional therapists.

This property does not live up to the Marriott name, let alone resort and spa. My daughter compared it to a budget holiday inn, and that would be about right. Disney value resorts have more amenities. Pretend the pool isn’t there since it’s so small there’s no point. Restaurants aren’t good, everything is overpriced. There’s a 35 dollar per night resort fee, I questioned what it provided and was handed 4 water bladders that you fill at hydration stations. Wow that’s some high priced water!The rooms are small, double beds which are small, rugs stained, old curtains, dirty balcony with pigeons waiting to eat your breakfast, small bathroom with door that gets stuck, no water pressure. No shower cap or magnifying mirror. Like I said very basic budget hotel.Parking is 45/night but we found a friendly attendant across the street in another hotel for 80/week.If you’re looking to book and have no intention on staying inside the resort I guess it’s ok, otherwise go to Moana surfrider which is a Westin (wish I realized this) or the Sheraton. Better yet, get as far away from Waikiki as you can and stay in another part of the island.
user_name:
ArtMom13
New York City, New York

review_body: My room in the new tower was HUGE with a balcony to match. The room was updated with a comfortable bed. The hotel has no private beach access. The beach is just across the street and easy to access the beach and other Waikiki area activities. My biggest complaint is that they charge a resort fee and this is not a resort. It is a hotel with a pool. If you want a resort, try the Royal Hawaiian or the Sheraton Waikiki.
user_name:
David H
New York City, New York

review_body: When renting beach umbrella and chairs they say first come first serve but not true. They told us at 9:30 the first two rows had already been taken and checked in but not true, i observed three sets of chairs in the second row where people did not check in until after 10. So what’s with that?

The hotel is located in a busy area along Waikiki Beach, and near an outstanding shopping and dining area. It was nice to walk to dinner along the beach each evening, people watch, and do a little shopping. But it is crowded.The hotel is fine, with a friendly staff, good views, and spacious rooms. There is on-premise shopping, car rental, and good restaurant options. The spa staff is friendly and competent.Ultimately, it’s the little things that hold it back. We had a pretty renovated room, but the beds are small (double? Barely larger than a twin, really) and uncomfortable for two people. The drain in the tub wouldn’t seal so taking a hot bath after a difficult hike was tough. There was a nice breakfast buffet, but it is expensive. And the parking garage is tight and often full.Overall a good choice, depending on what’s important to a guest.

I saw Marriott and it is a beautiful hotel with an excellent location, but shoppers beware. Iwanted to warn anyone staying near the hotel NOT to buy anything from Fortoire who sells skincare/Jupiter red light therapy. It is a shop with same address as Marriott but a storefront, perhaps leased from the Marriott. The Jupiter does not work and they tell you all sales are final after signing card, it's printed on bottom of receipt. This is not legal without conspicuous signage saying, All sales are final." Or similar, which there wasn't, but even if there was, when a product doesn't work as explained or described, they must take it back if you paid with credit card. Don't get scammed with these people, make sure Visa backs you up. This verbage is in Visa's policy. If you've been duped, contact Chamber of Commerce. Or contact me on Facebook. Tara Mayole, Phoenix

My husband booked our room thru his app since he is a platinum elite or whatever member. When we went to check in they were gonna put us in a regular room when he clearly had booked an ocean view. The gentleman at front desert was awesome at making calls and clicking clacking on his computer to make sure we got what we' booked. ( wish i could remember his name. But he was shop steward) It took us awhile to get checked in, but our room was great. Premium ocean view. Very convenient to elevator. However, upon check out we were shocked to find that hotel guests are charged $50 for using valet parking. Guess we' should've checked first. Also they charge ge tax on a resort fee tax!!So just be aware that the price of your room will be charged about half more in fees and taxes!Go to a hotel that offer discount or free parking for hotel guests. Doesn't matter if your "premium elite" member you get nothing for it at this Marriott.

This hotel is a total disappointment. The room was not one of the renovated rooms and was rundown (Room1059) and by an elevator. There is not adequate enough seating nor umbrellas by the pool and they allow locals to come in and use the facilities and needless to say they are far from upper class. It’s definitely time to choose an alternative hotel chain. Good location but outside of that this place is far from a resort!!!

Loved this hotel. Had balcony facing pool and ocean. Loved listening to the nightly entertainment while sitting on my balcony drinking wine. Hotel is very nice and in great location in Waikiki. Can’t wait to go back.

Hawaii is Hawaii, but it’s much better with an ocean view and a great room. We booked an ocean view and a double or king bed( preferred but not guaranteed). Well, in order to get a newly renovated room with an ocean view and king size bed we were upgraded and we ended up with a partial ocean view and a view of the Ashton next door. The room upgrade isn’t really worth it. There are a few things they need to work out in their renovations. The bathroom faucet is too far from the edge of the sink so it sprays all over the edge of the counter. The bathroom shower didn’t seal well so there is always water leaked onto the floor. There is no night light in the bathroom and the door and a side wall are opaque glass, so if you get up in the night, you’ll most likely wake your partner. I did visit the spa which I have to say was very professional and amazing. They use Aveda products. They also help with wedding planning for a beach wedding.

We had an awful experience at this hotel. We have been loyal Marriott customers for thirty years. Due to this, and our 'status' we were given 'free' breakfast vouchers for three people (my husband, myself and our five-year old). We had enough for our fifteen day stay. My husband was serving his annual duty on Pearl Harbor. Due to his officer schedule, he had to be at the base at 6:00 am. That meant he needed his car from valet at 5:00 am. They never got it to him in time during the entire stay. It also meant he didn't get the free breakfast buffet, because they don't open until 6. So I used vouchers and took him fruit for when he returned home. On the second day I tipped our server $15 for nothing (as it was buffet and we didn't order coffee or tea) but she was kind and we tipped her and left. As we left the restaurant, two men approached me and stood on each side of me. My daughter was behind me. Neither men introduced themselves or acknowledged who they were. I said this better not be about the fruit because I just gave the server $15 and two breakfast vouchers, my five year-old didn't need one. They asked me to go into an office with them. I asked them to identify themselves and what this was about. They told me I was seen stealing silverware from the restaurant..... I was blown away. I couldn't believe what I was hearing. First of all, my silverware is the Arctic pattern from Pottery Barn, not their cheap silverware, and we had yet to even leave the complex, making it a legal impossibility. Theft is taking something and converting it to your sole use. We had not even left the hotel, dealing with jet lag from the day before. I was outraged. My daughter was confused and crying. I told them I would not go into any office, if they were going to accuse me of something if public I would be vindicated in public. I gave them my name and told them I was through and to leave me alone.I took my daughter and tried to comfort her, but she went into hysterics saying they were going to arrest us. I said no, they were leaving us alone. I was wrong. I turned around, and sure enough, they were following us. I went to the front desk extremely upset and dealt with the front desk manager. There were several women standing there and they asked why the men kept coming over to me when I had made it clear to leave me alone. After thirty years, this is how we were treated. When I did Pro Bowl events, they treated me like I was special, but when travelling for military duty for our country we were treated like scum. The general manager knew of this situation and did NOTHING to make it right. He did not even reach out to me. We still had 12 days to deal with that place, and unfortuneately couldn't make a different reservation elsewhere. Not only did they assault my daughter and I, they thought that moving us into a king suite from a queen would somehow make things better -- with two days remaining. The general manager was condescending and arrogant, and has zero respect for women. I will never, ever stay at another Marriott again, and am disgusted that they think that less than a year later I would be interested in their repeated attempts to get me to join their new bon voyage or something program that I now receive endless emails about. Now what to do with all these books of mormon. Shame on you Marriott for believing traumatising your guests isn't 'damage'.

I’ve been to Hawaii four times and I’ve stayed here each time. There are two hotel towers and the rooms offer views of the city, ocean, and Diamond Head. The breakfast buffet has a lot of choices and POG juice! There are two pools, gym, restaurants shopping, and two ABC stores! The one stop shopping for everything you need! The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. It’s just across the street from the beach too. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

This hotel was wonderful!! Great location and our room had views of both the beach and mountains! Close to everything! Great, super friendly service!! Couldn't ask for better! Super comfy beds!! Delicious breakfast!

Stayed here for 8 nights in a newly renovated room, they've done an awesome job! We had a balcony with a side ocean view. The room is large with separate couch/seating area. Bathroom had a walk-in shower but no tub. Coffee pods replaced daily when used! Room also had a small refrigerator which came in handy. As a platinum rewards member I benefited from free breakfast at the property, the buffet is a great way to start the day! Hot & cold options with an omelette bar. The lobby area is semi open and a really nice area to relax in with a coffee or cold drink! Location is good, right across the street from the beach and a short walk to dining and shopping. We did hear some hammering and drilling during the day which was a bit annoying especially when trying to relax at the pool but it did not spoil our stay.

We had a great time at the Marriott Hotel at Waikiki. The location was very convenient just a few steps from a very scenic beach area and the zoo. Our room was up high and had terrific views of the beach and Diamond Head. Definitely splurge for the views! The two pools were small but frankly being so close to the beach was where you want to be anyways! Service was excellent!

A great place to stay. Excellent service overall. Buffet brekky was good and location is very close to Waikiki beach and shopping. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay at Waikiki Hawaii.

The hotel itself is nice and the beds were really comfortable. However, the street noise was AWFUL and lasted all night. Then the maids were as loud as possible, too. We even had our “Do Not Disturb” sign out which they completely ignored and opened the door anyway. On top of all that they are remodeling hotel rooms and we just happened to be the lucky ones who got the room right next door. So we got to hear drills and hammering all morning long. This was an awful experience.

What a great location! Directly across the street from Waikiki Beach, walking distance to park, zoo, restaurants and shopping. Convenient restaurants and shops in hotel. Loved our room and the view. Very comfortable beds and pillows. The bathroom was tight as the toilet was directly in front if the door so it was awkward. But everything else room wise was perfect! Loved the aroma if the shower supplies! Enjoyed making a lai and hearing Hawaiian cultural stories from the instructor.

This hotel is in the perfect location (Waikiki Beach). Very convenient to shops, restaurant, and the beach! The room we had was very small, but nice. Several different hotel restaurants to choose from as well.

Stayed at the Marriott, with the beach across the road, and a part of Waikiki Beach where a stone wall has been built some yards out to provide a really safe 'pool', great for kids and safe for anyone swimming. Beach is not fine sand, it's almost like finely ground ;umice, and they even import beach for Waikiki from Newcastle, Australia!! The Marriott is undergoing a renovation in the first block and you are warned that the builders work from 9-5. It's noisy if you're remaining in your room, but there are worst things in life. It's not a problem as generally you're away for the whole day doing touristy things. We had an ocean view room - absolutely huge which is a nice bonus these days. The bathroom was quite small in comparison but that's a first world problem. Towels are really thick, good quality - always a sign that your hotel takes itself seriously. Housekeeping was great, all staff friendly and polite. Everywhere is clean, dusted. Lots of amenities at the hotel to cover all ages and groups. One of the bonuses of the hotel was its proximity to the beach, and that the trolley bus (Hawaiian institution) stop was at the back of the hotel. One thing, if you are being picked up for any activities from the Waikiki Beach Marriott, ensure you ask EXACTLY which lobby you will be collected from - there are 3 entrances. There's the front, main lobby; there's a Tour Lobby (used a lot) and a smaller half hidden 'lobby' on the south, beach side. I couldn't fault the standard of service from hotel staff or staff in shops within the hotel. Make use of the friendly and efficient concierges who will arrange or advise on anything you'd like to do. None of the restaurants do breakfast, but there are lots and lots of places to eat in surrounding streets. There are two restaurants which do happy hours with food and drinks; food from the Japanese restaurant was absolutely delicious and fresh.

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as the first stop on a Hawaiian anniversary trip. Like the majority of other hotels in Honolulu, the Marriott is a high rise and has more of a city feel than a beach resort property found elsewhere in Hawaii. We actually loved it. We were in a newly remodeled room, which we found to be very nice. We were up on the 20th floor, with a side view facing Diamond Head. The staff was all very helpful and friendly, and the room was modern and clean. The location is on the south side of the hotel and shopping strip, and across the street from a public park. It is a very nice and easy walk heading north to see all of the other hotels, restaurants, and stores. My husband is an Elite Marriott member, so the breakfast buffet was included in our rate. We really enjoyed the buffet and were happy that the staff offered to go cups and plates for us to take more with us. They could not have been any more friendly than they were. The fresh juice was quite a money saver, as we took a couple of cups with us and mixed it with our own vodka for drinks later! It was delicious too. I've also never had sticky buns with macadamia nuts before - YUM!!! Use the ABC Store in the lobby to help save some money on snacks and drinks. I would definitely recommend the Marriott, and would stay again.

This is not what one expects when thinking of a Hawaii hotel...or at least not what I expect having stayed in many hotels on all 4 major islands. It was more like a 'city' hotel you can find anyplace in the US rather than a beach resort in paradise. After checking into our 1st room in the 'non renovated' side of the hotel, it was so small and bland so they switched us to a jr. suite on the renovated side of the hotel. That room was huge but oddly designed and a bit sterile. We had a 2 kids with us and were assured this room had a pull out queen bed...it did not. They brought in a couple rollaways that were very uncomfortable. The beach area outside the hotel was very crowded with tourists, locals and a large homeless population. It didn't feel all that safe for a family. The restaurants face the street and not the beach which was disappointing as well. Needless to say, we checked out after the 1st night and moved to The Moana. If you're on a budget or using Bonvoy points and only using the room to sleep & shower, it's fine. If you are looking for Hawaiian charm & beauty, look elsewhere.

Stayed two nights. Across the street from Waikiki Beach. Conceirge was very helpful in suggesting things to do and booking a Luau for us. Restaurants and shopping on site although some are a bit pricey. Pool looks nice but we only swam at the beach across the street. Beds were comfortable. Neighbors were quiet or we didn't hear them. Our room didn't have much of a view but we weren't in it much but to sleep. Check in was quick and easy. Check out is 11 am our flight wasn't until 10 pm, we were allowed to check our luggage in to storage for the day after we checked out. We went and enjoyed the day and returned for our luggage later. I don't think resort fees are necessary on top of room rates but it seems to be a norm in Waikiki.

I stayed Marriott Waikiki for 4 nights.It is at the end of the waikiki beach. Far away from the main street but it would be quiet. It is not on the beach at all and you need to cross the road.Staff is nice during check in and told us every information we needed, especially the activity schedule.Room is standard as usual. But the view is good and i love the balcony. But so sad that it is noisy to stay next to the elevator.***There is an Ukulele shop inside the hotel and free lesson at 1pm. Although i didn't join, it seems fun我在威基基萬豪酒店住了4晚。它位於威基基海灘的盡頭。 遠離主要街道，但它會很安靜。 它根本不在海灘上，你需要過馬路。辦理入住手續時工作人員很友好，並告訴我們所需的每一條信息，尤其是活動時間表。房間照常標準。 但觀點很好，我喜歡陽台。 但是很傷心，住在電梯旁邊很吵。****係酒店入面有間香港人開既Ukulele店,1pm有免費課程,大家去參加同支持下

We stayed at the Marriott Waikiki Beach in May of 2019 for our honeymoon and the room was amazing! Everything was recently remodeled so our room looked brand new. The bathroom had 2 showers, the bed was extremely comfortable, and our view of Waikiki beach was amazing. The hotel is right across the street from the beach and is also very close to all of the shopping locations, the zoo, diamond head, etc. We ate at the restaurant by the pool one day for lunch and our food was delicious. If we ever come back to Honolulu we will definitely stay at the Marriott Waikiki Beach.

We decided to stay over for an extra day after an island cruise. Love the room, large enough for a coach between the king size bed and the tv. Nice view of the courtyard, if you want to see the beach, get a room on the 5th floor or higher. There are two sides, one beach and one not. Loved the room, loved the open air first floor. Hotel is just across the street from the beach, one of the best ever. Next trip to Hawaii, we will stay here instead of one of the beach resorts. Just a nice location, close to the beach and walking distance to several good restaurants. Take a walk down to Dukes, worth it.Really looking forward to my next trip to Hawaii during whale season.

We stayed two nights prior to a cruise.Location is great, just across the road from the beach.Huge common areas means there is a bit of walking within the hotel.Two pools one which has bar/food service poolside.Rooms are standard type in Honolulu with everything required but nothing special.

Newly renovated rooms, friendly staff, view that is spectacular! I would highly recommend! The location is the heart of Waikiki. Even the sofa bed in our room for kiddos was not uncomfortable. We stayed in P tower and everything was brand new.

I stayed for 2 nights. The service was good, the room was fine, and it had one of the best hotel gyms I've ever seen. It's very close to the beach, but the rooms are smaller than other hotels in the area. The resort fee seems arbitrary and unnecessary.
user_name:
MEL17DC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great location. Good sized comfortable rooms. Pay extra for ocean views. Pool & bar on level 3 where you can enjoy drinks & have a great view of the sunset. Plenty of facilities & shops nearby. Walk across the road to a sheltered swimming area for adults & children.

We stayed here 4 nights, walking distance to shopping, great restaurants within the hotel. Staff very nice. We had an awesome view from our room , very comfortable. It wasn't one of the newly renovated rooms , a little outdated but very clean.

We come to Hawaii every few years and stay in a different place every time. However, this is definitely a hotel we’d come to again! Nice rooms, beautiful grounds, large pool areas, lots of places to sit, directly across the street from the Kapiolani Park Beach...excellent all around. Looking at the map prior to booking, we thought that since it was close to the zoo it would be far from the main Waikiki area, but it’s all very close & a lovely walk!Photos show our balcony room overlooking the beach and pool areas...we didn’t want to leave & even opted for a picnic lunch and drinks on our balcony.June 2019 - the hotel is currently under construction so you will obviously hear the noise. However, construction hours are outside sleeping hours so you are able to get a good night’s rest without worrying about excessive noise.

I hesitated finding another hotel due to construction and so glad I stuck w the Marriott. We stayed 10 nights w kids ages 5 and 13.Location was great. We were in K tower closest to beach. Pools were great. Pool bar/food great. Loved fish tacos, salads, burgers, and smoothies. 25% discount for elite members. Mostly ate there for lunch and cheeseburger in paradise restaurant 1-2 min walk from hotel for breakfast. ABC stores are in hotel as well as cute shops, ukulele store, Starbucks and more. Enterprise was right in hotel and we reserved cars 3 separate days. Convenient for sure. Water stations to refill bottles were great. I took advantage of two complementary yoga classes in the hotel which were amazing and my husband enjoyed the fitness center. Also did free lei making classes with kids and ukulele lesson. Concierges were very helpful. We did chiefs luau and entire family enjoyed that. Housekeeping was great. TVs had Netflix etc. rooms were clean. Balconies were lovely. We had ocean front which we enjoyed. PF Chang’s and Cheesecake Factory 15 min walk approximately. Tons of shopping and malls nearby. Beach in front of hotel had wall to protect from crashing waves. Great for younger children. Very near that were beaches w larger waves. It seemed that beaches near Marriott were far less crowded than ones up towards Westin and the more central part. People were really crammed together there.The only inconvenience we had with the construction was the first full day we were there we did not have water in our room from 10 to 3 but other rooms were available for this. They gave us notice for this and even upon check in asked if we wanted to switch rooms. We just headed to beach and pool that day and it was not an issue. Other than that you heard an occasional drill or noise but frankly the sound of police cars and ambulances going by was way more loud than this! I would not hesitate staying in this hotel again. Again location, location, location and just the convenience of so many other things.

I just spent one day on this resort and absolutely everything about it was amazing! The resort is right in front of the ocean with plenty of bars and restaurants inside. There was this one particular bar inside the resort that looked like an underwater cave. To get to it you had to go down wooden stairs and the walls where waterfalls and decorated with growing plants and bushes and trees. If I ever go back to Hawaii, this is one resort i have on my bucket list, I would love to stay there for an entire week!

This was a surprise trip from my husband to celebrate our eighth anniversary (we never took a honeymoon) and we were truly excited. When we arrived, they explained that they upgraded our room to two queen beds. My husband explained that he booked a King bed etc. They explained they were under construction and that we could have an older room or a room by the elevator. We chose the elevator and we could hear it going up and down the entire night. Our first night was hard. The hotel gifted us breakfast tickets etc. and tried to find us a better room. We were so mad that we checked out. They finally called us and said they found another room (honeymoon suite) and we said, "fine". When we got back (10 minutes of saying...fine), they gave away our room and we were stuck with another crappy room. They did give us money off and gave his champion and chocolate covered strawberries to make up for it. However, the trip was disappointing since he did first class with everything he planned and then it was screwed up with the hotel. The hotel itself (common areas) was beautiful and the location was great. The concierge services helped us booked such great excursions. I just wish the hotel room had worked out. Customer service with the staff was very professional.

Quality of rooms 5 out of 5Quality of bathrooms 5 out of 5Cleanliness 5 out of 5Service 5 out of 5Value 5 out of 5Style modernConnectivity Free WifiRm Entertainment/TV/Cable 5 out of 5Strategically located in Honolulu for activities and dining experiences.

I spent 7 nights at the Waikiki Beach Marriott this May. The hotel is large, but not enormous, and rooms have excellent views of Waikiki. Check-in was smooth, valet parking ($5 more per night than self park) was excellent, and property has two ABC stores on-site. There is also a starbucks in the lobby and another across the street from the hotel. Elevators were fairly prompt.My favorite part about this hotel was the location...very close to Diamond Head and great swimming, but not too far from the busier part of Waikiki. Quiet, but close to everything. Tons of a great restaurants in close proximity. The pools are small, but the fitness facility was pretty impressive.The only issue here is the current renovation on-going in the tower closest to the water. I opted for a high room in the rear tower, and I recommend those rooms until the construction is done. If you are going to spend a lot of time in the hotel, make sure you have a room in the tower farther back.

Location is wonderful – literally across from the beach. Pool area is very nice, overlooking the beach. Beside the pool and also overlooking the beach is the Moana Terrace – excellent food and service. We had burgers, club sandwiches, and fish and chips – all great. Moana Terrace also has very good live music in the evenings. Stayed in room 2116 in the Kealohilani tower. It’s an newly renovated room. Exceptional décor – bright and airy, fabulous linens and bed. Another big plus – we had a million dollar view of the beach, as well as a very good chunk of Diamond Head. Enormous TV. Very friendly, welcoming and professional staff throughout the hotel. However, 2 concerns – 1) could not view this fabulous enormous TV from the couch, and 2) there were 2 double beds even though the room was easily big enough for 2 queen beds. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel, requesting a king room, and ended up with 2 doubles. I was especially surprised that this happened in the newly renovated part of the hotel. Also there was no desk in the room.

Immediately upon check in, we were treated poorly by a front desk person. Thankfully another stepped in and it went better from someone with more aloha. The property charges a resort fee and for that you are supposed to get refillable water bottles. We stopped down to ask for them and again were treated rudely but a different person at the desk who didn't believe we weren't given them at check in. Really? Fortunately our room was comfortable and had a nice view of the ocean from the balcony. Due to the bad service, we will probably look elsewhere next trip to Oahu.

Four days and nights with no complaints. Spacious rooms with fine views and comfortable if not luxurious furnishings. I liked leaving the sliding door ajar and seeing what avian life came to call. Close to the zoo and aquarium well as other amenities. On site services are beyond reproach though paying a daily resort fee always bothers me if I am not using it. The gym and pools were fine. Be sure to walk over and enjoy the Hula show on Tuesday , Thursday and Saturday.

This is a very nice hotel with a couple of small/medium sized pools and close to the beach. It is within 10 minutes walking distance of a very good shopping centre with many designer stores. There are also restaurants and cafes within this area all within easy walking distance.

Please avoid this Marriott on Waikiki beach at all cost at the moment. Its under renovation and they really dont tell you how bad it is. Its really worrn out hotel. Air hammers none stop above you starting at 9am. Furthermore I would be careful with choosing beach front room, as they have single pane windows you hear loud music and street traffic non stop until the wee hours. Not a pleasant stay at all.

My wife and I stayed at this property for 10 days in May. I am Titanium Elite and was hoping for all the normal amenities. Not so. We did get free breakfast, but there is no lounge access where in the evening you get some free food and free drinks. The breakfast is not bad, but a far cry from the quality I am used to in the European Marriotts. For the 10 days it costs me 490,000 points for an ocean view room! In addition they charge you $35 per day as a "resort fee." Just another way to get more money out of you. I did have suite night upgrades for the 10 days: however, the suite they offered us was not much more than a big normal room with a two sink bathroom. Also, you could not see the ocean from the suite (city view). The other thing, which eventually made me refuse the suite is the noise that came from the outside. Directly underneath there were these large AC heat exchangers that rattled quite loud. Then they found us a room on the 32nd floor in the Paoakalani Tower. However, that room was close to the 5 elevator shafts. These elevators are very loud and they sound like a wooden roller-coaster when they rush up. Also, if you wanted to get a glimpse of the ocean, you had to look sideways from the balcony. The next day we changed rooms again. We got a room furthest away from the elevators. There we could not hear the elevators but now we could hear every bus that passed by the hotel, even though we were on the 29st floor. Just be aware, if you book this hotel, the windows are not soundproof at all. They not even dual pane windows.The decor in the rooms is dated and quite rough in some spots.To make a long story short, I do not feel this hotel is worth the almost a half million points it costs me to stay there. The hotel is conveniently located close to the beach, with is a positive.And finally, do not book tours with the Expedia people on-site there! You pay a lot more there than at other places.

I had a few issues with the hotel. One was my attention to detail about rates and DoD Contractors getting the government rates. Even though I am here for the government, I was not afforded the opportunity for the government rate. This is a bigger issue than the hotels. There should be a way for contractors to get the rate since that is only what we can be reimbursed for. Perhaps a letter. My other issue is that the noise from the construction was so loud. I came back from work at 3 pm and wanted to rest since I am coming from DC. Well that was impossible since the construction, that is not on any of their websites, was so loud. It sounded like they were right above me. I understand I am in paradise, but jet lag people need afternoon naps and that is not going to happen in this place until the construction is done.
user_name:
Ken G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: After my cruise i stayed 3 days in Wikiki. The Marriott was fantastic, beautiful facilities and in perfect location.Staff were fantastic and i felt very special. The pool facilities are great, plenty of beds and great food and cocktails and the Moano Terrace. See you in October 2020

This hotel is undergoing a substantial room renovation until September, or so we were told. We were there two days and it sounded like a jackhammer was running from 9-5pm a few floors above. There is no mention on the hotel website. All the staff did was shrug and apologize. Call ahead to make sure you are not in the section of the hotel where they are doing the work. Other than that, the room are small and a bit dated but otherwise in good condition and very clean. The staff was otherwise friendly and helpful. The location is absolutely fantastic. Perfect for beach walks, beach time, restaurants and other attractions. Just do yourself a favor and make sure you don’t need to deal with the work.

First, we came from the Marriott on Kauai and had an amazing stay. This place, should be avoided at all costs. There is renovation going on and it has made this place a nightmare for guests. The complaints range from getting the wrong room, being reassigned a room to getting yet another wrong beds again to floors having no water for a day. The front desk staff is overloaded with complaints and it shows.

Great location across street from beach.Public areas nicely decorated and very clean. Appears rooms have been updated and are nice. Pool area is large. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and always asked if we needed any assistance. Breakfast area was large with a large selection of items. Chuck, who made the omelets, made perfect omelet for my wife all three days. Many of the tours pick up at this hotel.

We stayed here for two nights after flying in from Charlotte, NC. Food was great, rooms were clean, the view was great, and everyone was friendly. This hotel is in the perfect area if you want to check out the beach, do some shopping, or find some great places to eat!

The best thing about this hotel is the service. The tour guides are great , there’s a Starbucks in the hotel,the bar and pool area overlooks Waikiki Beach. Little costly for drinks when not happy hour. The rooms are clean and our corner room is large with a limited view of the beach. Room has all the requirements just needs a little updating. Beds very comfortable.

The Marriott is perfectly situated just across the street from Waikiki Beach. The hotel's facilities are great, it's restaurants excellent.Staff is super friendly. Special thanks to bellman, Buster, who acted like we were honored guests visiting his home and waitress, Alexis, who gave us great service and was a wealth of local knowledge.Rooms are large and really great. Beds, very comfortable.Their gym is quite good, especially for a hotel. We didn't use the pools but they are very good.Money saving tips: If you're a Marriott Elite member you get 25% off in the hotel's restaurants. But, you have to ask for the discount or you won't get it.Should you rent a car and need to leave it for up to 4 hours in the garage, just buy a drink at a bar. You'll save the $15 valet charge.Bottom line: This hotel isn't cheap. But you really do get what you pay for.

This Marriott property is within easy walking distance of most everything in Waikiki and a convenient jumping off point for activities around the island... and please, if visiting Oahu, get to other spots on the island!
user_name:
Boise_Jax
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice-ish rooms and great location. However pretty disappointed. First off, reception had a massive line up for guests trying to check in, it's not middle of the night, it's 3pm. And for the longest time only had one person manning the desk. Put more people on? Now we paid for an ocean view room and requested a king, what we got now is a room where if you stand on the balcony, you can see the ocean and two double bedroom. I get that sometimes those kinds of requests cannot be met, but he started the check in with " I know you booked an ocean view room, let's see if that's available." Um, what? I would hardly call this an ocean view room. We asked if there's room to upgrade we'll pay the difference but none available it seems, except on booking online I can see rooms available. Nonetheless, we're here for 4 more nights, if we didn't prepay the trip we probably would have left.

First time in Ohau and first time at the hotel. Stayed 6 nights. Concierge was in contact prior to the arrival with helpful info about the hotel and location. Hotel staff was amazing helpful, from the front desk and to the cleaning staff. Room was upgraded from garden/city view to ocean view. Room was one of the older kind but no complaints. Room are being upgraded but never had an issue with noise or construction. We took the free breakfast instead of the points and it was well worth it. Great buffet with cook making fresh omelets and everything else you would need and ask for. Took up the surfing lessons out of the hotel which was awesome as well. Didnt worry about parking since we did not rent a car. Uber and Lyft are all over the city and cheaper then the cabs. Located at the southern end of the strip, lots of shops, restaurants but not as crowded as the other parts of the strips. Right next door to the zoo and aquarium, it's definitely stay again if we ever get back to Oahu. Thanks Marriott.

The rooms are nice and the staff is friendly and helpful. My only negative is that the bed was too hard for my liking. Other than that in enjoyed staying here very much. It’s close to everything in Waikiki and if you don’t like to walk, grab an Uber or Lyft. We had a great view of the beach and Diamond Head and even had a 1 legged pigeon who came and visited us at sunset every night.

This hotel was great, as is usual with most Marriotts. Location was excellent for access to beach and restaurants. Parking at the hotel is fairly ridiculous ($28/day), but probably typical for that downtown area. No complaints. Would stay there again.

Resort was comfortable and in a great location. Restaurants on-site were very good for breakfast and dinner. The open lobby area was so nice. The beach was across the street and shops were all along the Main Street. Definitely recommend!

We came her to celebrate my 50th birthday. I reserved an ocean front room in the front tower and received an email from the front desk a few days before arrival warning about cunstruction in that tower. They gave me several options, but I wound up staying where we were, and they waived the resort fee for the inconvenience. We are here now. We have not heard a single construction sound nor been inconvenienced in any way. Every staff person we have encountered everywhere throughout the hotel has been exemplary and totally up to Marriott standard. Ocean front is worth every penny. We are here for 4 more days, but so far everything has been absolutely perfect.

More like a business hotel. Clean, comfortable, good attentive staff, fast elevators. One of their restaurants serves buffet style breakfast at a very reasonable price.Great location right across the Waikiki Beach. Big ABC store on site and of course... a Starbucks coffee shop.Great location right across the Waikiki Beach. Big ABC store on site and of course... a Starbucks coffee shop.

I've stayed here twice, including just a few nights ago. Both times I was taken in by seriously misleading room descriptions. This hotel calls a room "ocean view" if you can any sliver of blue from the balcony, even if it is blocked by buildings and not visible from inside the room itself. It will call a room "ocean front" even when it actually fronts on a side street (Ohua Ave) and has no "ocean" frontage at all. So whatever you do, DO NOT pay extra for an "ocean view" or "ocean front" room. It is a total waste of money.Beyond the views issue, the carpets and furnishings in the rooms are extremely tired. Towels are rough and ragged. Felt like I was in a Motel 6.My advice is stay somewhere else.

By June 2019 the front tower overlooking Waikiki should be completely renovated.It needs it as the renovation is past due.However, that being said, we enjoyed our stay.The room was perfectly clean.The bed was super comfortable.Our view of the pool and Waikiki was very enjoyable.The outside deck was a joy except for the traffic noise one must expect in a major city.Restaurant food was good and the service excellent.While the hotel was busy, it was not the giant crowds we saw at Hilton Hawaiian Village where we toured the property.It made us happy we chose Marriott.

We stayed three nights with our vacation travel group. This hotel has a couple towers. Our clean king bed room was on the 25th floor. This was the highest room I have ever stayed in. So for me stepping out on the balcony made me feel a little uneasy. The main buffet dining room was in the other tower so we had to walk a little to get over to it. They have a great selection of food for breakfast and dinner. All the food was very good. They also have a full service bar. There are shopping stores on site. This hotel is right across the street from Waikiki Beach. A great location. Great stay.

Usually stay at the Westin. I saw the Trump Hotel and the Royal Hawaiian and should have booked either one. Signed onto the Marriott. Have to say it was very nice. Great valet service. Close to shopping... only 1 block. Close to everything else... highways H1 East and H1West, the zoo, the aquarium, restaurants. Beautiful church across the street: St. Augustine by the Sea. Fab restaurant inside the Marriott: Sensei. Shopping inside the resort. 2 pools, big workout gym, spa and more. Definitely enjoyed my stay. People on the island of Oahu and the excellent staff made my stay very wonderful.... not to mention the big breakfast included in my booking. It’s not my Maui but Oahu and Marriott, you have great taste. Thanks for the spirit of Aloha!

We checked in today 3/31. We were upgraded to a Diamond Head/beach rooms because my wife is a gold member. We also own a Marriott Time share so we’re Marriott people and I’m not inclined to write them a bad review. We did online check in but it still took 10+ minutes at the front desk. The room is dated and smelled funny but the view is great. Did not appreciate the $38 resort fee when we will be here less than 18 hrs. It gets you collapsible water bottles that you can use at “hydration stations.” Too bad they don’t bother to refrigerate the water. I can also get a free surfing lesson but that’s not going to happen because we’re leaving at 9 AM. The room only had three bath towels. We spent the day traveling so showered before dinner. We’re leaving first thing in the morning so one of us is going to hope they dry in time. I know I can request more but I shouldn’t have to. Then I jumped in the shower and looked for the soap- none. Called to my wife to hand me the shower soap - none. So now I have to move the soap back and forth between the shower and the sink. Compare this to the Westin Maui where when we checked out today there were 10 bars of unwrapped soap because they gave us more each day. Bad job all around.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott categorically well exceeded my expectations in five hotel vacationer functions: 1) customer-centric staff, 2) food management, 3) accommodations, 4) hotel technology, and 5) location.First, the desk staff—Luisa and Kenneth—demonstrated superb customer interactions and professionalism. They were both very engaging, pleasant, and accommodating. This team did a superb job ensuring this traveler was taken care of. Thank you. You both should receive awards for your work.Second, the Kealohilani Tower restaurants were awesome. The Kuhio Beach Grill hosted a superb dinner and morning breakfast area. The prepared food was fresh with pleasant distinct flavors and well presented. Nicely done. Note: for this hotel the breakfast area open at 5:00 a.m.; which made it more convenient to start the exploration day. Also, the Starbucks opened at 4:30 a.m. to help raise the eyelids. Wonderful, wonderful!Third, the room accommodations were very comfortable. The complimentary toiletries were high-end brands. My room was in the Paoakalani Tower which provide a nice view of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. Room 3068.The walkout balcony provided to chairs and table to relax and enjoy the view. I could see the surfers catching rides. The room had a mini-fridge but no microwave.Fourth, this hotel provided hydration stations located throughout the hotel. The system was easy to use for refilling water bottles with filter water. Good way to cut down on water purchases. The elevators provided a secure access system. Room key needed to scan and get to your own room. :)Fifth, the hotels location is perfect. Fifteen minutes from the main airport. Easy 28$-40$ Uber ride. The hotel is surrounded by several quaint shopping areas and parks. The hotel is within walking distance of grocery stores; if you are on a budget.In sum, this Marriott property earned a 5-star rating from this traveler. In fact, I put this hotel on top of the list. I will definitely... stay here again.

The Marriott Beach Resort and Spa is not a resort: it is a two-tower, 1,400 room hotel that is a decade past its prime from a design perspective, but maintains a clean, dignified demeanor. Convenience is its selling feature: adjacent to Waikiki Beach, it is very convenient to the ocean, and there are several convenience chains and multiple Starbucks on its ground floors. The two pools are nice (if small).: my kids didn't mind the size, and like their 6 and 8 foot depths. If you're looking to just sleep in the rooms, this hotel is a good option: clean in the rooms and common areas and courteous staff.A COUPLE OF WATCH-OUTS:Hold on to your wallet, as this property charges a lot of extras. Parking is $50/day valet, there is a $40ish "resort fee" every day in addition to your room that gives you access to, essentially, a Redbox of quasi-current DVDs and a couple of arts and crafts offerings. It would be way less infuriating if they just raised the room rates, as there is nothing resortish about this property.As of April 2019, the hotel is undergoing significant (and badly needed) renovation of the guest rooms, so brace for noise and inconvenience. Finally-- this is a tired property. The rooms are badly dated; the bathrooms especially are not up to modern hotel standards (iron tub/shower combo with grip tape at the bottom, single vanity counters, no locking doors on the bathroom. The beds are tired and not comparable with more modern Marriotts, and the furniture bares at least a decade's worth of wear and tear. BOTTOM LINE: If you're looking for a basecamp to explore Oahu, this hotel is a serviceable option. If you're a Marriott loyalist (like I am), you WILL be disappointed in the comfort and design of the rooms. And if you're not up for walking to get to the action of the main shopping district or more open sections of beach, you best look elsewhere.

The pleasantly decorated rooms and ocean view were exceptional. On the ground level were shops, restaurants, beautiful and unusually decorated gathering areas and a lovely pool area with views of the beach. The staff was friendly and very obliging.

You would never rate this hotel 5 stars. Less than poor room conditions and multiple encounters with poor service. To be fair there are always pros and cons, but in summary look elsewhere for better hotel options. Even if this shows up with the lowest rate. The pros: on the beach and extremely walkable. The cons: the rooms are plain terrible with carpets bubbling up due to age (picture is of “good room”). And if you have allergies like me, be prepared to have a miserable time. My daughter developed a rash that I attribute to room’s level of cleanliness. The word the staff kept using was “dated”, but you won’t find that anywhere on the room descriptions before booking. At $209(plus resort fee), I should have known better. The service at the front desk was average and they did accommodate a room change which took two attempts. Other hotels have done more with less harm. Housekeeping failed to deliver requested items and took 3 calls to complete. Also, the bell hop would not wait to assist with room change. Trust this review, stay away.

Great location, really nice lobby. Rooms were mediocre: ours had several cigarette burns in the carpet. No Concierge Lounge. For $400/night, how about a lounge? All room had a $37/day resort fee to cover things like morning yoga, DVD rentals, 1 hour SCUBA class. Lots of stuff we didn't need, want or do. Still had to pay. The breakfast buffet was laid out to be a big affair. Great service, but the food was a major disappointment for $36: nothing special in the lineup you couldn't find at a mainland Marriott for $18.Four days later I was eating breakfast at the Houston Marriott Marquis Concierge Lounge and I was so surprised: it was complimentary and at least twice as good as the $36 in Waikiki. Maybe the folks in Waikiki should take a trip to the mainland to learn how to be distinctive when offering expensive rooms.I recommend trying someplace else on the Beach. It can't be any more disappointing for the price, and might be better.

We stayed at this property in March 2019. The hotel is clean, close to restaurants and shopping, and Waikiki beach is right across the street. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious. The staff we came across were all very friendly and helpful. Things to note are that Waikiki is a very busy spot. If you are bothered by noise, either bring a white noise machine or stay elsewhere. We booked the premium ocean view room and although we could see the ocean, our view was more of the hotel next door and the street. Also, the hotel should really nix the “resort” fee as we felt it didn’t really feel like one. On our last day we had no hot water, but upon check out we were discounted the resort fee for that day. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but found it to be a bit pricey for what we got. Best feature was location as it was so close to everything.

As we have had many good experiences with Marriot hotels around the US and Cancun, we didn’t think twice while choosing Marriott waikiki for 4 nights during our honeymoon in Hawaii. Turns out this does not look like a 4 star hotel. The room is old, noisy and the shower is not good. Regret not have chosen the other many many options in Waikiki

At his time of visit they Reno work was in the tower closest to the beach. Did not affect our stay.The location of this hotel is very good. There are two towers the furthest away from the beach is 1 block. There are 2 pools and 1 hot tub.(All good) Pool towels are supplied and can be taken to the beach. The exercise room is very good with free weights and numerous fitness machines. There are 3 different water filling stations for your containers. The 1 negative point is the resort fee is $37/night. Easy walking distance to many restaurants and the International market place.

Close proximity to the beach, just couple minutes to cross the road. The rooms are nice, relax, island vibe decors. Great Staff. Marriott Waikiki Beach has everything you need either for business of for pleasure.

We selected this hotel because of the proximity to Waikiki beach and it was perfect! Everything was fantastic! Their staff, amenities, dining options and overall convenience to shops/restaurants . We highly recommend this property if you’re looking for a great place to stay near Waikiki beach. A special mahalo to the front desk staff. They were beyond amazing.Vicki

Took the kids there for a weekend for a little staycation. The kids had a blast, and David at the Front Desk was very welcoming and helped return a lost item. Thanks guys, will definitely stay there again!

Rooms were good, but I hear some are brand new. The hotel has every amenity you could ever need and is within walking distance of everything in Waikiki. Beware!!! They don't make it very clear that you have to pay a mandatory resort fee of $37 per room and night. The parking is also $ 45/night.

The hotel front desk staff were very nice but don’t expect much more than a great view. The pool area was super windy and not relaxing. The gym was nice. We upgraded our room but our room (and all rooms) was in desperate need of remodeling. With the exception of the view, the value was not in line with the price.

We mistakenly booked the Courtyard Marriott, so went to this one and asked for a room. Lindsie held a room at a great (member)rate while we checked out of the other one. When we returned the next day, Wendy upgraded us to a king with a balcony looking at the beach for the same rate! Beautiful, clean, spacious room, great pool bar, fantastic staff, close to swimming beach, excellent buffet deal in one of the restaurants. They made our holiday! Perfect.

This is a decent hotel but do be aware that it is at the very far end of Waikiki, away from most of the restaurants and shops. Ocean view rooms are nice. The sushi restaurant here was decent. Breakfast buffet was just ok (omelet station was nice), and price of room included only one breakfast voucher. Beach here is nice but behind breakwater, would be good for kids to swim.

What a way to start our honeymoon. The Waikiki Marriott upgraded us to one of the largest suites on property (after we booked into a regular room) and it was almost too much. Full disclosure, we are platinum with Marriott, but were not expecting a suite of this size. The room was magnificent - top floor with 3 balconies and great views of Waikiki Beach. We were fortunate enough to be in the tower that was not under construction. It made for a little longer walk to the restaurants and beach, but worth it to avoid the noise that many have written about. The pool was great and the breakfast each morning was an excellent perk to start the day. People come to this hotel repeatedly and I can see why - the staff care and want to make sure you have everything you need. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Waikiki! Mahalo nui loa!

It's a Marriott right on Waikiki beach, what more could you want. Clean rooms, good restaurants, etc. I travel here often for work and enjoy my stays. Only tip I would have is that it can sometimes be difficult to get your car back from the valet in the morning. Make sure you call down 10-20 minutes before you actually need your vehicle.

My first experience in waikiki after horror flight was a fantastic massage...but ended up converting to $320 AUD for 80mins. Then the Madame at front desk was very rude insisting I tip 17.5%. I gave her all i had at hand which was $20 USD, but made me feel terrible and ruined what should have been a relaxing experience. Disappointed. I do not recommend unless you are included in a bridal party and a millionaire is covering your bill. Like Asia pushy culture...but 30x more damaging to your wallet. Nice view, but felt ripped off as I fell asleep and don't even remember massage. The girl that did the massage was great. Just exiting reception was issue.

This was my first experience at a Marriott and, will absolutely be my last. Perhaps what is most disappointing is that this discovery occurred on our honeymoon. We had never visited Waikiki before and we’re relying heavily on reviews. We picked this hotel because of location and based on other feedback online.
