When we arrived we were informed that, although we’d requested a king bed, there were none available, so instead were we okay with two doubles. We said we were celebrating and would prefer a king, and they were able to compromise and find is a room with a queen bed. They then explained that there was construction happening in our tower and we should expect noise from 9-5 on the days that we would stay, until this point there had been no communication about construction and the rates had not been reduced. Again we were disappointed, but we wanted to stay positive, I explained that it was our honeymoon and asked whether there was any chance that they could find us another room, they said they were fully booked. They then explained the $35 per person mandatory ‘resort fee’ we needed to pay in addition to what was already paid for. When we asked what this was for they explained the wide range of exercise classes available (including yoga with lululemon, which is complementary wherever you are in the world...) and a few other scheduled events hosted at the hotel we were not interested in attending. We arrived at our “city view room” and were not so pleasantly surprised when we opened the curtains that overlooked a massive concrete parking lot with a offensive 7 metre concrete cylindrical vent/structure outside our window as our ‘view’. The room was tiny and extremely outdated. I called the front desk to see whether there was indeed another room we could move to and they said that we could consider an ocean view room but this would be an additional $45 a night and was potentially in the other tower. By this stage I was extremely frustrated and not interested in spending more time or money so we agreed to stick it out where we were rather than drag the escapade out longer! When we booked at the Marriott we had expected a certain level of professionalism, customer service and room standard-none of which were met. Having now explored Waikiki and having strolled through other hotels on the strip that are priced comparably and FAR more luxurious I wish I had this information beforehand! Of course we still had a great time enjoying one another’s company and exploring the beautiful beaches, but will not be returning to this hotel, or the Marriott more broadly, after this experience.

After flying all day from Philadelphia to Phoenix to Honolulu, it was a pleasure to arrive and have a place to adjust to the time change and culture/temperature shock (I say that in a good way). Clean and comfortable rooms. Hotel activities included traditional flower lei making one day, and ribbon lei making the next. Our room had a beach view, and our sister's room had a great view of Diamond Head.

We stayed here in 2017 it was very nice and clean , they came every day to clean very hospitable . the only thing i can actually say is that there food cost way more than other hotels so if yo do plan to eat here I suggest take enough money, We know Hawaii is expensive already it just seemed higher than other places we been too. Other than that the employees and front desk are very helpful .

Cam is the best!! 5 Star+ service helping me arrange a gift for a hotel guest. I called Cam with an idea, he provided options and within a short period of time he delivered above and beyond the call of duty. Courteous, helpful and delivers.....great combination.Thanks Cam!!

5 trip advisor bubbles for Waikiki Beach Marriott on this stay. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. Great location, easy to get to the beaches and shops. Marriott always puts together a great experience and this was no exception.

We were only in Waikiki for 2 nights and chose to stay here due to its proximity to the beach. Overall the hotel was perfect for what we needed. It is across the street from the beach, which was great, it has a ton of shopping and restaurants within walking distance, and everyone at the hotel was BEYOND kind and accommodating. We were in an older room - I know they are remodeling them now - but the room was fine, no complaints at all. We didn't use much of the amenities on property but the pool looked nice and there are several shops and stuff downstairs. The only reason this is a 4 star review instead of 5 star is that you are automatically charged for parking ($50 a day) and there is a resort fee which was in the $30 per day range. I booked this through Marriott and was not told about these fees upfront. Other than that we did have a great stay and I can't stress enough how genuine and kind every single person who works here was.

was a last minute change to stay at this property and it didnt disappoint. the pool/bar area was lovely (note that sun doesnt get on the main pool till about lunchtime) and the wait service around the pool was great. our room had fantastic views and a lovely big balcony. a big thanks to kenneth and scott for the great service

Great staff, power went out so they were very accommodating. Hotel is currently as of February 12,2019 undergoing renovations.Great location. Use Uber!!! Lots of shops within walking distance. Everything is expensive $6.00 for a loaf of bread...$15 for 3pancakes at ihop. Lots of people on the street in front of shops trying to get you to come in to buy stuff. High pressure sales people out there. Use Marriotts consigere service to plan excursions
user_name:
MIKE H
Mount Holly, New Jersey

review_body: We are Marriott rewards members, our first choice was an ocean view. Of course, we were not disappointed. NOTE! the hotel is in the process of remodeling the rooms. The older rooms are dated but that will change soon. When you make your reservation request a newly remodeled room for sure and an ocean view. One negative that is glaring and surprising, the toilet paper is terrible, the purchasing agent must have gotten a kick back! This is most definitely not up to Marriott standards, especially at $300 plus per nite.

‪As we depart back for the mainland today; I can honestly look back and say how outstanding @MarriottBonvoy Resort & Spa treated us. No matter your member status, every guest was welcomed like honored friends and family. ‬ With every staff and team going the extra mile to make this first timer to Hawaii feel welcome. The on-site restaurants were great and having two starbucks rocked. While it may not be the newest property on the block, it none the less, held it’s own in cleanliness, quality and hospitality. A perfect location to navigate from, with two pools, hottub, work out space, cabanas, on-site cultural activities and both adult and kid friendly beaches.

Stayed here 2 nights for a business trip with hopes to also squeeze in some relaxation time. I’m a devout SPG/Marriott platinum member and try to not go off brand. Typically you know what you’re getting and the hotels have consistency that’s dependable. I feel this property misses the mark with the Marriott brand. There are multiple towers so potentially I was placed in one that is being updated soon. My room was very dated, very tired, musty smell, old dingy carpets. On the plus side, the view is fantastic out to Diamondhead. And the locations is stellar as well. Confusing to me is the $37 daily resort fee. This nets you two disposable water containers, access to the practically non functional WiFi, some fitness classes I won’t be taking, DVD rental (why on earth would I rent a DVD here), and a few other items that will not be used. This is a hotel not a resort. If Marriott needs to increase rates to stay profitable for this property, just add $37 to the already overpriced room rate. I’d feel less ripped off, just call it what it is. So my point here being, the value for the price is way below my expectations as a platinum Bonvoy member due to the quality of the accommodation (dated room, musty smell, old feel). There are other properties in Waikiki in this same price range that would delivery on those features.

Good hotel, but not overly fabulous. We were upgraded upon check in to 19th floor full ocean view which was spectacular. Found out the reason was due to construction on that part of the building and our water would be shut off much of the day and we were warned about noise. It was fine with us bc we were leaving the next morning anyway. When we came back for another night the end of the week we requested a quiet room and late checkout and both were accommodated readily. The valet staff and bell check staff are super nice. However, overall it’s very large and it’s confusing whether you’re in a hotel lobby or a shopping mall. There are two or three towers with different elevators banks. The location is nice, right across from Waikiki beach, but beware of the homeless people. There are many all around. I booked directly through Marriott several weeks ago, but discovered Expedia had a lower rate (by about $40). The hotel would not honor that price. Bummer for us.

This hotel is location right across from Waikiki beach. The location is SUPER. There's shops and restaurants all within walking distance. Aside from location, this hotel is SUPER DATED! We stayed in a suite on the highest floor, next to the presidential suite. But still...the room were super dated. We just went during a wrong time because they placed notices everywhere stating they'll under renovation March 2019. We stayed here beginning January 2019.The pools are small and crowed. Only one hot tub and it's also small and crowded. They charged us $10/day to add a microwave in our room.We'll try this hotel again after renovation.

This hotel has a great location! It's on the main street in Waikiki, and is just across the street from the beach. For us, this was perfect! The hotel is large and rooms are clean and comfy. The breakfast buffet is pretty good too.All staff that we encountered were incredibly pleasant and helpful. Would definitely come back! Parking tip: the Waikiki banyan across the street has parking for $18/day or $110/week, cash only. Great lot with lots of spots.

Room on the 33rd floor had amazing views and will appointedStaff were great throughout the hotel and the location, well it is just the best and walking distance to everywhere you ever want to go whether bars, restaurants or the beach

I expected more from a reputable hotel chain such as the Marriott, but upon arrival, it just felt.. meh. It has the bones to be a spectacular hotel but unfortunately it’s just really dated. The lobby area is nice & the staff are friendly enough, but the rooms are VERY average! Lime green decor - gross.. & our bedding sheets had a big yellow urine stain on them... fortunately they were quick to change them & they actually offer to clean ur room every day if necessary. I was a bit disappointed in our “ocean view room”... it felt more like “ocean glimpses” rather than “views”, the room itself was tiny & I swear the walls are made of paper mache as we could hear people talking in the rooms next door. I do hear the place is getting renovated in the coming months so I personally would hold off on staying here until the joint is fully reno’d.

I came to Hawaii primarily for work, though I slipped in a couple of vacation days. I'm Platinum Elite with Marriott so I tend to stick with Marriott properties whenever possible. I looked at several options in the Waikiki area -- mostly due to proximity to the U Hawaii Manoa campus - where my meetings would be. I looked at all of the Marriott/SPG properties in the area and almost selected the Laylow or Sheraton, but the Sheraton reviews here made me change my mind. I opted for the Marriott for the ocean views, ultimately, I suppose. In retrospect, I wish I'd chosen the Laylow. So, the good -- the view is decent, though for a premium room I would have expected a little better. The staff at the hotel was great. That's actually one of the biggest pluses I found to this location. They were all very friendly and helpful and welcoming. The on-property restaurants were top notch. In fact, I very much enjoyed the steakhouse and sushi restaurant. The Italian restaurant on property was primarily outside seating and it would have been better if the evening hadn't been a little chilly -- not their fault -- I wasn't expecting to sit outside.The not-so-good -- they were actively doing room renovations in the hotel. They had limited hours to 10am to 4pm for the work, though on at least three of the days, I heard them start between 8:30 and 9am. If I hadn't already been awake, I probably would have been more than a little irritated. The rooms are definitely in need of updating, though. Mine was not in great repair and it wasn't terribly clean, especially the bathroom. The walls and door were incredibly thin. I could hear neighbors on both sides having conversations (and not really loud ones) and when people were talking in the hall, they may as well have been standing in the entryway of the room. The ugly - the resort fee. I'm not sure I noticed that on the Marriott site when I was booking, but it's pretty much gouging. There's really no service that was provided worth the fee. I think this is the first Marriott I've ever stayed in that had a resort fee. I'll pay more attention next time...but Marriott might consider revising the services one would get for that fee if they're going to have it. All in all, it wasn't a bad property or a terrible experience and I don't want to paint it as such. I just feel it's a bit overpriced for what you get...and I'm not one to skimp on price to get what I want. I will seek other options on my next trip to the Waikiki area, though.

Folks:I love this place! The location in Waikiki is awesome just steps from the beach in heart of everything and wonderful place to stay. I’ve been coming here for years and while you may have more luxurious places to stay in Waikiki the service and friendliness you can’t beat. The new facilities and room upgrades will be well with a look. I can’t rave enough about the location and service. Large workout facilities, yoga classes and two pools on property including a Starbucks and two ABC stores for your late night munchies or whatever. Platinum membership rates hear and the take care of you road warriors! Enjoy your stay...Mahalo

So I was on the 10th floor and while you can tell the hotel has some age to it, I had no problems with my room or stay.The staff is very friendly and there is plenty of shopping and food within walking distance. The breakfast buffet is pretty good but also priced pretty steep. If you have it included in your room price or have a discount then its a great option to start the day but there is no shortage of dining options in the area.Used valet parking the entire stay and had little to no delays in getting my vehicle.Overall a terrific stay.

The massage I had at the spa was one of the best if not thee best I’ve ever had. Hotel was clean and didn’t have any issues. We had view of diamond head which was beautiful. The beach is just across the street. Food was delicious!

This isn’t a resort. It’s a tourist trap hotel / oversized motel. The staff is miserable and and the rooms are an aged pea green/ yellow. The valet guys are rude and parking is overpriced. It is not on the beach and it is not a resort. They do charge a huge resort fee for which you get 10% off their overpriced restaurant and free WiFi that you don’t need. Oh and dvd rental, because who doesn’t want to watch dvds while in Hawaii. The staff is the worst. Better options in Hawaii.

We stayed 4 nights here and enjoyed our stay. The rooms are large and will be getting renovated next month, we had a lovely view of the beach and Diamond Head and our balcony was a great size with a sun lounge to catch the sun. Easy access to the beach, shops and restaurants. Pool areas had lots of sun lounges and got a lot of sun which is a bonus. Would happily stay here again. Staff were friendly and check in a breeze.

The location is great. It is located near the zoo side and right across the street from the beach. Its amenities include several restaurants, shops, 2 Starbucks, etc. The downside is that, currently , the hotel rooms are a bit "tired"looking. The lobby isn't impressive. However, there will be renovations, according to all the ads, effective March, 2019. The Spa is very nice and caters to wedding parties, as qell.

Chose this resort for our first trip to hawaii. The room was bright and cheery. The people couldn't have been friendlier-from the bellman that helped us with our luggage, to the people checking us in and out at the front desk. We ate at the buffet for breakfast, which I thought was a little pricey, but the food was prepared well and delicious.We had a great view from our balcony of Diamond Head and the Ocean. Highly recommended.

The hotel is not on the water and the location is towards one end of Waikiki. I would prefer to have the hotel closer to the center of Waikiki. I love Marriott and wish that they would have more choices in Waikiki.

This is a terrific place to stay I will tell you it is worth being a Marriott rewards member I reserve a room here for our last 4 days in Hawaii. When we checked in I asked if we could upgrade to a different room after a few minutes of talking the desk guy handed us our key cards said we were on the 23rd floor with ocean front view. And because we are Platinum members we got the breakfast daily if we had to pay for it it would have been $70 for two of us that’s a nice savings for three days. It pays to stay at one brand if your looking for perks in return for you loyalty. Anything you need just ask the maid service was excellent the lady would ask us each day if we needed anything and if we wanted our sheets and towels changed. We never changed them we don’t change them everyday at home.

Located at the south end of the main drag and opposite Kuhio Beach, which is quieter and better, with break waters providing crystal clear, kid friendly lagoons for swimming, this hotel is just a few minutes walk from all that Waikiki has to offer. It is no worse, and a lot better than many of its competitors, and we should know, we have stayed in many. Prepare to be upsold on check-in. We are staying in a junior suite with ocean front, side views and a great balcony. We have two queen beds and the bathroom has twin sinks and separate bath and shower. Slightly concerned about the oceanfront windows, which have large cracks in them, that appear to have been superglued. I pressed on them gently and they moved. They would not withstand high winds, or anyone pressing hard on them. We are on 15th floor and there is a lot of noise from pool bar music and the street. If the mentally-deranged homeless on the beach are awake early, so are you. Then there's the guy in the next room on his 5 am call to his cohorts on the U.S. east coast. We heard more expletives than at a gangsta rap convention. There does not appear to be a lounge bar, so we decamp next door to the Alohilani - generally quiet bar, great cocktails, huge two-storey aquarium, pleasant live music, typically Waikiki high-priced place.

This vacation sharing property that is also rented as a hotel is located at a very good location, steps from Waikiki beach. However it also is almost the end of the main drag. Almost everything is North of it. rooms are run down and beds pretty bad, nothing that you will expect at a almost $300 a day hotel. WE have no idea what service is like other than checkin, no experience. Breakfast was at the Starbucks in the lobby and thats pretty ,much was the experience at this hotel during the three nights stay.

Nothing fancy--this was a decent property, but pales in comparison to others in the area at equivalent rates. The rooms themselves are a nice size, and the beds were comfortable, but the resort amenities and overall vibe of the place leave something to be desired.

If you want a relaxing night sleep, expect to be woken up by the room next to you. I’m on a business trip so sleep is important to me. I was woken up at 5am to the room next to me talking on their cell phone. You should NOT be able to hear people through the walls this bad! Then, I had to unplug my room fridge because of the noise it was making all night. I called the front desk and asked for ear plugs, and she just laughed at me and said no. They also give you no water in the room. I am a Marriott rewards member so it’s a complete shame. All I can say is it is way too loud and they have nothing to help!

I am about to embark on my 32 visit in 8 years to the island of Oahu and 31 times I have stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott (I stayed 1 time at the Waikiki Courtyard but never again). The entire staff at the hotel is exceptional at customer service. Every time I go there everyone has a smile and a Mahalo! Everyone from the sales representative Marian Ida, to Chuck at the omelet station and the hostess at the morning breakfast buffet. Yes people even recognize me based on all the times I have stayed there. The hotel is in beautiful shape yet the hotel rooms are becoming weathered. I understand that in 2019 ALL the rooms will be refurbished which will be welcomed by all. Yet no matter what if you get an Oceanview front Tower room (preferably a room ending in XX33 corner) the views are spectacular! Certainly a wonderful location directly across from the famed Waikiki Beach!

I am highly disappointed in such a reputable brand like Marriott. I had 3 rooms books at this hotel and unfortunately they were booked by someone else on behalf of my account few months ago. I was not aware of this booking until I got a folio from marriott saying I was being charge $250 per room for 1 night which totaled to $750 for no show. I realize hotels have a policy in place but charging someone $750 for no even staying there seems outrageous. Furthermore, the property said they had to get any changes approved by their finance executives and when I asked to speak to them directly, they have not yet contacted me. I have been a long time Marriott rewards member. While I am currently not a very status on their program , I expected better treatment and better goodwill for the sake of customer service. I contacted Marriott's customer service directly as well and after being on hold for 20 mins each time, they told me they can't do anything and simply gave me a number to their "office of consumer affairs" I understanding places like this go full occupancy and hence hotels need to charge guests for no show, but they could be descent enough to just charge me for 1 room on the reservation vs charging me for all 3 rooms.Due to work, I have been staying in hiltons for last couple years and will continue to provide my business to them happily for being robbed of $750 by this property.Be aware ~

I really enjoyed my stay at this property. My status with Marriot allowed me to book two nights for free and I got an upgrade to a partial ocean view. The balcony was a wonderful place to sit and drink a cup of coffee. My room was clean and comfortable and it was cleaned promptly each day.The beach off of this resort is very popular. The water is clear with a lot of coral. It’s a little dicey for water sports, as where it’s shallow, you risk hitting coral. I recommend bringing water shoes and reef guard clothing if you plan to spend much time in the water.The location is convenient. It’s a short drive to downtown. I had no trouble getting an Uber from the property. You can also walk across the street to the beach (it’s essentially beach front) and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.Parking was a little tight. It filled up a couple of times, but if that happened, the valet guys would park it for you for the same price as self-park.Overall this is a solid bet in downtown Honolulu. Even better if you have status with Marriot.

I spend 5 nights in an Ocean Front room this past December for a business trip I extended for vacation. The room was huge and had a great view of Waikiki Beach. I loved the balcony and spent time out there every morning and evening enjoying the waves, watching surfers and the beautiful sunrises/sunsets. The chaise lounge chair was my favorite spot. This part of Waikiki is a little quieter, but it's still a busy area. Wonderful for walking and exploring, though.The room itself was quite comfortable, I had a king bed and plenty of room in the room itself. The bathroom as others have noted is small, but they are planning a renovation soon I believe. It wasn't so small that I would avoid staying there again, but I was traveling alone. It could be an issue for couples or families to share that space.Service was terrific! When I arrived around 6pm on a Saturday, exhausted from 12+ hours of travel and a long drive from the airport (Waikiki Santa Festival closed roads combined with getting lost :)), I was fried. Everyone I encountered upon checkin was so kind and thoughtful from the valet who took my car and unloaded my bags to the young man who checked me in at the front desk who saw how exhausted I was and said 'I'm going to get you to your room quickly, so just call down tomorrow if you have any questions'. Appreciated him skipping the overview :) I ordered room service a few times and ate at the poolside restaurant. Great food, great service and a lovely view of the ocean.The facilities here are well maintained and very convenient. I enjoyed having the ABC Store and Starbucks downstairs. I picked up breakfast there most mornings and went for a walk on the beach to enjoy the sunrise. Once the work part of my trip was over, I spend a lovely afternoon by their pool.At the end of my trip, I changed hotels to the Kahala Resort (which was great) for my last 2 nights in Hawaii. I thought I'd treat myself to a more resort style experience. In hindsight, although the Kahala was lovely I'm not sure I'd have changed hotels. Something about the Waikiki Marriott was just so comfortable.

For the most part we very much enjoyed our stay at the Waikiki Marriott. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and is probably the strongest point to the hotel. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We were in the non-renovated tower, but quite frankly we did not feel the difference. There are two issues that prevent us from giving this a five star review. Firstly the parking lot is an absolute nightmare. The spaces are small, and it is very difficult to negotiate the corners if someone else is coming in the other direction. Secondly, and perhaps even more annoying, is the fact that two weeks before our reservation we received an email from Marriott telling us there would be a $37 resort charge per day per room. Essentially this is a bait and switch regarding pricing as we had no opportunity to decline the resort charge without canceling the reservation, and we did not use the pool or the gym. Marriott - I would have thought better of you.

We stayed here with our family of 4 for 6 days over Christmas. We enjoyed our stay, but we were there mainly to see family so we didn't spend a ton of time at the hotel. The location is nice as it is on the edge of Waikiki so the congestion is not quite as bad as being in the heart of Waikiki. The Pros: -Our room faced Diamond Head and it was lovely to see it and the ocean from our balcony.-The gym was spacious, nice new equipment, and the morning Yoga classes were great. -Pool wasn't very crowded (but we weren't really in there during peak times)-Pool bar has a nice view of the Waikiki SunsetThe Cons: -hotel lobby and surrounding areas have a big of a shopping center feel. There is no place to just chill out on a hammock or similar. -Swimming pools are pretty standard rectangular pools (probably built many years ago). There are 2 pools, with a strange vast concrete area between them. -The buffet restaurant was terrible. A meager offering of choices and a very sterile cafeteria feel. Overall, the stay was satisfactory and our room itself was nice, but the lobby area and overall hotel lacked a relaxing island vibe.
user_name:
Kangamom
New York City, New York

review_body: was very disappointed. it was very out dated. bathrooms were very small, toilets right next to the tub. had to close the toilet sits down. or else things fall in. asked for ocean front. but didn't know the hotel is facing sideways.

Renovated, but it falls short: weak surface materials in public areas, did not do anything to the 1960 bathtub and vinyl curtain in the bedroom. Room key on the phone/apple watch is a great idea, but what would it worth if not working in the elevator and need to carry the key anyway?

Of the many trips to Hawaii, I have never stayed at the Marriott Resort and Spa. Rooms are very large, great television with internet options. The staff ar the property is first rate. If you are an Elite Marriot member there are some great upgrades. I understand that the property is renovating rooms and deck pool and should be accomplished by December, 2019. Great Resort.

Amazing room with a great ocean view. Thanks to Ronnie at the front desk at check in for the upgrade and welcome service. Housekeeping amazing Natindad room attendant on the 16th floor made sure we had ample amount of amenities. Kuhio Grill service great by Lehmann; made sure our drinks were topped up and great conversation. Prime Rib Buffett food selection could have been a bit more plentiful however was tasty.Great location right on the beach! Would definitely book again

We enjoyed our stay at the Marriott very much. It is a top-notch hotel with a variety of amenities for everyone to enjoy. We had an Ocean Front room and the view from the balcony was spectacular. The hotel has several restaurants but we kept going back to the Moana Terrace Bar & Grill. The food, service and the relaxing ambience it provides were just outstanding.

I loved the location of the hotel. Most of the time we were out and about running from one place to another and this hotel was easy to get in and out of. Also, do the Valet parking if you have a car, the cost is a few bucks more, but totally worth it. The rooms were fine, nothing special and the hotel amenities were fine.

The hotel is good, but short of great. Well located in Waikiki the hotel has some rooms with excellent views. My impression is there are two types of employees here and many have worked here a very long time. Some are great like returning to your favorite aunt or uncle and love to chat then some appear jaded and bitter toward the customer (or maybe their job). Some wore large union pins saying “workers should only need one job.” Everyone dislikes the resort fees but the resort fees here for $37 per day are truly worthless. Marriott should be honest and transparent and include the cost in the base rate rather than generating unnecessary ill will. The rooms are very clean and they do a good job maintaining the property. There are two pools and a nice pool deck bar. I found staff  were also accommodating to requests. The staff that work in the breakfast grill are almost universally awesome and the food offering is impressive.
user_name:
PerksAdvisor_NYC
New York City, New York

review_body: Check InOpen Air Lobby - quick and efficient - greeted with a smile - The lobby has many very nice areas to sit, relax and collaborate. There are shops and a starbucks in the lobby area. The "Hydration Station" in the lobby is very awkward to use because of the height and a wide counter in front of it - I would say Not ADA Compliant - they should address this issue - the counter in front could be made narrower - it is about 30" deep and only needs to be about 12" deep. The RoomNothing spectacular - standard Marriott room - consistent The BreakfastIncluded as a platinum member - very nice breakfast buffet - Shout Out to Chuck Schumacher, he makes a great omelette and is entertaining, Pro Tip: ask for a cracked egg omelette - the pineapple and papaya are wonderful - the sticky buns are very good - recommend the bread pudding with vanilla sauce, add a sprinkle of cinnamon from the oatmeal stationThe Prime Rib BuffetThe Prime Rib was excellent - delicious, tender, and juicy. The rest of the buffet wasn't very good. We went on Thursday which is Asian fare. We took advantage of the 50% off deal available Monday through Thursday during limited hours (I think it was 4-6 PM and 8-10 PM). Considering the cost of everything in HI being pricy the buffet was a very good option all things considered.ParkingThe parking garage is very tight. we didn't experience any issues with our vehicle. I did hear on pickup truck crunch on one of the columns as the driver cut a corner too tight. I saw another vehicle during my stay that appeared to have scrape on the passenger side consistent with an encounter with a concrete column. Resort FeeThis property charges a $37 per day resort amenity fee. There is a daily activity in the lobby which my wife participated in several times. She made some beautiful Leis out of Orchids on two days and Ribbon on another day. Other activities include Yoga classes and scuba diving training.LocationThis property is nicely located just across the street from a very nice beach with barriers that make for minimal wave action. Many people go beyond the barriers for surfing. The beach is beautiful with numerous palm trees. There are areas where you can sit in the shade and outdoor open air showers to rinse off before/after going into the ocean. There is a plethora of dining and shopping within a 5 to 10 minute walk. The property is large with two towers with hotel rooms and many shopping outlets and rental car desks included. There is an open air area with shops and seats closer to the beach too. There are two pools and a hot tub and plenty of areas to sit in the sun or shade if you prefer. It takes about 5 minutes to drive to the H1 - you can pretty much be anywhere on the island in less than an hour. There were a number of homeless people in the area along the beach witnessed during our stay. Sad to see but we didn't experience any issues with them. There was periodic Police presence - we saw one person get jacked up for jaywalking so watch those traffic signals.Fitness CenterExtensive fitness center with plenty of high end cardio equipment and machines.Hydration StationsThe hotel has several areas to refill water bottles. I made use of these throughout our stay.

Perfect place to stay for New Year’s Eve! Across the road from the fire works and you can count down the new year from all around the world! Great hotel! Staff very friendly and helpful! Perfect location for families

This was the 2nd hotel I stayed at after my cruise, prior to my flight back to the states. It was great to unwind and reflect on an already great vacation and take in some of the sights and sounds on Waikiki beach. the hotel was walking distance to the beach and the downtown shopping area. Plenty of gift shops and restaurants on the strip. The hotel was great for relaxation with multiple concourse levels, pools and restaurants poolside. Not crowded either. You could easily spend your time in the hotel. We had a great suite on the upper floors with a balcony and view of diamond-head.The movie rental service and popcorn was cute. All around a great value which I would highly recommend.
user_name:
ritexcorp
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed on Waikiki Beach many times and love it for the great beach, shopping and restaurants. This hotel is very misleading. We paid for a ocean view, beach front hotel but the hotel is across the road from the public beach and the room barely had a view of the ocean. I was let down also because the pool is just a basic pool on the third floor, no pretty landscaping, resort feel. I wouldn't stay here again. I would choose another hotel with pools and landscaping out by the beach or just save money and choose an off the beach hotel.

Our party of four stayed here for 5 nights on our first visit to Honolulu. We generally stay in rental homes as we prefer larger and more private accommodation to hotel rooms. That said, we had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The location is excellent for the beach, Diamond head, shopping and restaurants. We got a much better room than we expected with views of the ocean, a mountain and the city. The pool areas were lovely and relaxing. Most of all, the staff are friendly, helpful and cheerful. Everyone from housekeeping, the front desk staff, valet and concierge were welcoming and kind. Front desk staff let us check into our room 3 hours early as our flight arrived well before the check-in time. The only negatives were the beds and the internet. The beds were not good for people with back problems and a Rollaway bed, for which we paid extra, was lumpy and uncomfortable. The internet speed was way too slow forcing me to use my limited data plan for work purposes or to book tours etc. Overall our experience was good and we would recommend this hotel!

Booked via Costco travel. Paid $$$ for 5 nights. Location seem perfect if you want to hang around Waikiki area. Lots of restaurants, shopping options and beach is just across street. Yes, hotel is not right on beach , need to cross a street to access beach. Our room seemed just ok , bathroom was small and dated! Seemed more like a best western types! They have two pools on property, small , crowded and nothing amazing for the price and resort fees!There is extra $40 parking charge per night . Paid extra for ocean view and we were placed in the back building with far view of ocean from an angle in the balcony. Might as well do without it and save some $$.There are lots of hotels on that street and around thAt area. Next time I would save $ and book some other place. Good thing : good location for those looking to hang out around just Waikiki area. Starbucks on property.Lots of food options and shopping , Waikiki beach . All walking distance.For those looking to explore Island, you will need a car and parking fee sucks , +$$ resort fees. Do the math!

This hotel sits in a good location, close to shopping and main street. It is conveniently located but some renovations are required (fresh coat of paint and carpet replaced). Service is good and water fountain is a bonus.

Marriott Resort and Spa is an excellent hotel and resort in typical Marriott fashion. Excellent location in Waikiki, just across the street from the beach. You can walk to just about any attraction in Waikiki. 5 Stars as expected from Marriott, along with 5-star prices as well.

The hotel is old and dated and the room interiors are far below average, at best a 2 star hotel. Our room had a really bad odour and the so called ocean view room is a joke as it’s definitely not ocean facing. The service is awful and we were informed any room service will take minimum 90 minutes and there is nothing they can do about it as they only have 2 servers attending room service. There is no GM of the hotel as the existing GM quit 2 weeks ago and there is no one to address any issues or concerns. The hotel is fully booked due to the Christmas and NYE busy season and everyone is now at the mercy of the hotel. It’s absolutely ridiculous to take the guests for a ride, specially when you are paying top rack rates. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone and it’s a joke to be called a Marriott property. At best a 2 star hotel charging 5 star rates.

Family stay after Xmas through New Years, this hotel is very dated in its decor but you can see my pic below that there is a renovation planned for March 2019 which will yep bump up the reviews.The pools are small and lack any real interest, no kid friendly activities at the pool which we would have expected for a hotel here given its size. The upside of course is that you’re only a block to the beach but sometimes a pool break is good.The lobby is updated but is a bit confusing in its layout and there is only one other grassy area with only a few chairs for lounging about without leaving the hotel.Platinum perks we received:Water bottlesTwo free breakfast buffetDVD rental cardDiscounts at on site stores and spaNot sure if our room was upgraded but we have two doubles and one king and it’s not a suite and not ocean view but large enough with two balconies for our four person familyProsCultural activities each morningRental car available on siteLaundry available for a charge and can use credit card

I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member with Ambassador service. The majority of the time, all that means is free breakfast, with no other special treatment to write home about. My experience at this hotel, however, has been fantastic and my expectations far exceeded.I booked a 7-night stay with points. I did not expect an upgrade, since I was coming during a very busy time (week after Christmas) and the hotel appeared to be nearly sold out. Much to our delightful surprise, we were upgraded to a Deluxe ocean view suite with a separate living area from the bedroom and two lanais with full view of the ocean. It is fantastic.Secondly, on our first night, upon returning to our room, there was a beautiful fruit basket waiting for us with a note congratulating us on our upcoming bundle of joy (my wife is six months pregnant). It was such a delightful and much appreciated surprise.The free breakfast is also excellent. The staff are very attentive and efficient. The selection and omelette bar were also very good.The hydration stations throughout the hotel were a very nice touch, as were the refillable water bags provided to us upon checkin. The morning Pilates and Yoga classes are a great way to start the day.We are only in our second day into our vacation and have been thoroughly impressed thus far. I highly recommend this hotel for your visit to Waikiki.

Our family, (2 teenagers included), chose this hotel for its location on the strip. I can go into a long review but in total this is a great hotel and perfectly located on the quiet end of Waikiki. See hints below;Quick Notes:1. Very Safe - Room keys needed for access all over the resort, (gym, bathrooms, laundry room onsite)2. Very Clean - I never saw anything that raised alarm3. Very hospitable - I am platinum with Marriott but everyone was genuineHINTS:1. Do not buy the breakfast ... it is a Buffett and not high quality just a lot. - Instead there is a dinner to the left called Eggs and Things as well as a Burger King for a quick cheap biscuit to go2. Try to get to the 20th floor or above on the east side for a good view of the ocean and Diamond Head3. There is a Starbucks in the hotel ... great service4. There is a refrigerator in your room so go to the ABC Store located in the resort and stock up on water, beer, liquor, etc... and save a buck!5. Down the block is an amazing resturaunt called Morimoto Asia ... get a reservation 2 days in advance and try the braised ribs.6. Laundry machines on site so don’t overpack!!!!!7. The Waikiki Aquarium (2nd oldest in the USA), is a short 10 minute walk from the resort. They have an amazing Luau to enjoy! ($159/adult Diamond Head Luau is the name online)Enjoy your stay ... if I ever come back to Oahu I will absolute stay here again!

<Japanese follows English>I went to Waikiki at Dec 2018 with my wife. However, I felt not good by below point. I think I never use "Waikiki beach Marriott" again.・I could not receive the upgrade service in spite of Marriott Gold Elite Member.Although I have stayed several times in hotels of Marriott or SPG so far, basically any hotel upgrades several stages or even if they cannot upgrade by any chance, they told me "The room is full I was not able to upgrade so I cannot upgrade" . However, this time I was told not only that they could not upgrade with unfriendly tone but also that they would upgrade if I paid some more. Even though the room was vacant, I could not receive the upgrade service. I felt very uncomfortable.・The service of Japanese service desk is terrible. I used it several times, but it was a terrible response at all. When I wanna book a restaurant, they just show me the screen of OpenTable and When I wanna book a taxi to the airport, they told me that you can book on the Internet. Their answer is not different when asking Japanese travelers on the road side. It's not service just standing. At least in Maui, they called a restaurant and made our reservation. ・The service about unexpected incident is not good.I called the front desk when our room's toilet didn't flash. However, nobody came our room in a hour.2018年12月に妻と2人でワイキキビーチマリオットを利用しましたが、以下の点であまり良いサービスは受けられませんでした。今後、ワイキキビーチマリオットを利用することは二度とないと思います。・マリオットのゴールドエリートメンバーでしたが客室のアップグレードが受けられなかったマリオットやSPG系のホテルにはこれまでも何回か宿泊していますが、基本的にはどのホテルでもアップグレードしてもらえており、仮に満室でアップグレードしてもらえなかった場合には、チェックイン時に「今回は満室なのでアップグレードできません」と言ってくれたりしていましたが、今回は、不愛想な感じで「アップグレードはできない」と言われた上に、普通のお客と同様にいくらか払えばアップグレードするともいわれ、部屋は空いているにも関わらず、結局アップグレードはしてもらえませんでした。正直、かなり不愉快な気分になりました。・日本語サービスデスクの対応がひどかった何回か日本語サービスデスクを利用しましたがすべての対応が愛想もなくひどかったです。レストランを予約を相談した時も単純にオープンテーブルの画面を見せられただけだし、タクシーの予約をお願いした時も、ネットでできますよとそっけなく返されたりといった対応で、サービスというよりは単純に日本語のできる人が立っているだけといった感じでした。少なくともマウイに泊まった時は、レストランに電話をして予約を取ってくれたりしてもらいましたが、今回はそのような気の利いたことは一切してもらえませんでした。・不測の事態に対する対応がいまいちトイレが流れなくなり、フロントに電話をしましたが、1時間たっても誰も来てもらえませんでした。

This hotel was massive! Parking garage convenient and affordable but tricky with hotel sides/elevator access. The hotel is dated but very well kept. Nice clean rooms. Amazing location! Fireworks, action, nice part of Waikiki Beach for families and close to quiet beach end. While I liked the hotel it was just too big for my taste! It was like staying in a mall. If you like to spend money, shop til you drop, enjoy nightlife and be around lots of people - THIS IS IT! Otherwise, nice walk to beautiful beach.

I only gave 4/5 stars as although the location & facilities were great it was on the pricy side compared to similar resorts on Waikiki Beach. Make sure to bring your own water bottles to refill as there are free water stations located throughout the hotel. They do give u a small water refillable pouch but we drink a lot of water so it was handy we brought our own refillable bottles. Big enough to put ice on ready for hikes and walks etc. The ice machine on our floor we used quite a bit. The ocean facing room itself we had was amazing very roomy, Great view for sunset pictures and watching the waves. The pool was small yet sufficient and you were able to bring their beach towels to the beach and return for fresh towels daily. Our room attendants were amazing our room was cleaned impeccably each day. It was so handy facing Starbucks downstairs for my daily coffee fix. Cold foam brew & cacao protein shake were the best. The hotel was close to other hotels that had great restaurants within walking distance for snacks and açai bowls. Very safe, secure hotel in the quieter end of Waikiki and a great walk to/from diamond head hike and easy to bike ride around. When staying here you get a Marriott card that entitles you to free Honolulu cookies daily 1 per person. That was a great perk. The room also had the biggest safe I have ever seen fitted laptop, camera gear and a backpack which came in handy.

Stayed the week before Christmas 2018. Everyone was super nice but the rooms were a bit dated. They did say they planned on renovating the hotel in March 2019, and it surely needs it. They have to pools, one closer to the beach which has a deep bottom and another pool and hot tub by the workout facility. The workout facility has all the equipment needed for a full workout.

The hotels location is Great near the zoo and at the quiet end of the beach and that’s great if you have little ones as there is a great swimming spot right a crossed the street for families as well some unreal sunsets if you get an ocean view room. The pools are just ok there isn’t one that is great for kids that you would expect at a resort. The rooms as small but that’s ok as you shouldn’t spend much time in them with so much great things to do close by. The gym is outstanding lots of space and equipment. Now the really disappointingly part, the staff are just not up to the standards of what I have come to expect from SPG/Marriott hotels. As a Platinum Elite with Ambassador member I spend both a lot of time and money at hotels each year and my check in experience was the worst ever at a SPG/Marriott hotel. I was told we would have our room in 60 minutes so we went for lunch when we came back to see if the room was ready 90 minutes later it was not. I didn’t know it at the time but the person that was at the desk was the manager Carina. She is the WORST person I have ever spoke with at a hotel ever. Based on her I would not stay here again choosing the Westin down the street instead if you are looking for a hotel in the SPG world. If the price is right you could do worse as the sunsets are fantastic but do not expect good service.

We stayed here 9 years ago and had a great experience. Even though didn't have the CEO of Marriott bump us to penthouse this trip still an awesome stay! My husband generally doesn't like to stay in same place twice and I research things to the extreme. Our plans changed and we decided to do the NCL cruise again after Pearl Harbor ceremony on the 7th. Originally booked it through NCL until they wouldn't add the extra days. So just did it on our own. I research other places for about 2 years truly glad we went with the tried and true. Our room had fabulous views and was quite roomy. Beach access was Awesome right across the street, not to crowded and there was a wall to keep the water calm. The cafe by the pool was really great as was our server Cheryl she was Top Shelf. It's kind of cool I used to think of Marriott as out of our league cost wise, but have stayed at a Marriott 3-4 in the last 9 years and has been affordable. Only complaint I'm a non-violent tree hugger and don't like maid service every day even telling the ladies so. Don't know if it was the language barrier or they just do their thing. Women said in broken english they were going to come in everyday regardless, because it's their job. Just trying to save the planet for next generation ladies.

Solid hotel for a vacation stay. In the heart of the action, a short walk from shopping and restaurants. Directly across the street from Waikiki beach. Decent pool, room was fine. Was upgraded to a beach view as a Platinum member. The breakfast buffet was good. Would recommend this as a good home base for a Waikiki visit.

We've stayed at this location at least 10 times. Mostly because of the good service, reasonable rates (outside of Xmas of course) and great location. The main beach at Waikiki is a 5-minute walk, so you don't have to be stuck in the congestion that crushes you in the central and north ends of the beach. There are two Starbucks in the building, their house restaurant (Kuhio Beach) a decent steak place (d.k), a good sushi place (Sansei), and a crowded Italian place (Arancino). While there is some fast food nearby, you also have the new opened Morimoto Asia and its more casual sister, Momosan nearby (both highly recommended!). There are a few downsides, but they're not dealbreakers: They redesigned the lobby a few years ago, so while more contemporary, it was done on the cheap. Feels more like an ugly furniture showroom than a grand lobby (granted, it is open air). While the views can be wonderful, the rooms often feel dated, and we've noticed worn furniture and carpet here and there. The pool feels small and uninviting, but the gym on the same level is pretty good. Still, the location means we can walk to central Waikiki in a few minutes, or quickly escape for a hike at Diamondhead and the east side of the island. Overall, the place could be better, but we still like the staff and its conveniences.

This was an adequate hotel for business travel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet and menu was good, but the buffet felt overpriced at $30 for breakfast for one person. After the first day, I bought yogurts and bananas for my room and never returned to the dining room. I was too busy working to check out any of the amenities. This hotel is just across the street from the beach, and a very short walk from a ton of restaurants and shopping.

Had a great stay, with good amenities - we even got water bottle pouches to use! Very convenient and they also had water filling station to refill them at. Just steps from the beach - easy to get to the water for a bit and then get back to your room to wash up and head out! We needed to print something, and there's even computers and printers to use while you stay at the hotel. Only valet parking which isn't cheap, but neither is any of the other parking around here. Guess you do pay the convenience.We had an outside room so could hear the traffic in the mornings - but we are heavy sleepers so not a problem. If you are a light sleeper, consider requesting a room that oversees the courtyard. Only complaint is that we booked an "ocean view room" however it was more of a view of the next hotel! Just a sliver of a view of the beach.

Great location, terrific restaurant selection, amazing lobby, but hotel room slightly outdated. The room configuration is from the 70s where the bathroom vanity is separate from the toilet and shower room. There is no door to separate the vanity from the room. I really wish the hotel had modernized rooms.

The resort itself was amazing between yoga at lululemon, surf lessons, various restaurants/bars, and two Starbucks to choose from, you have everything you need! I was actually there for work, but my friend came along to bum off my hotel. We had a beautiful view of the beach from our patio, and she took surf lessons one morning through a vendor in the hotel. Because she took lessons there, the equipment was free for her to borrow the rest of the week! The hotel room itself was very spacious. It could use a little renovation due to use, but I’m sure their volume of visitors is insane. Even if you have status here, you won’t be able to use your late check out without paying a few due to all the guest check-ins. Our hotel was just across the street from the beach, and we were close to a lot of shops, live performances on the beach, and many other amenities. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Just returned, 8 night business and pleasure trip. Repeat guest. FINALLY this resort is following the established published rules for Platinum Elites breakfast benefit. No more coupons. Should you decide to have breakfast as your amenity for you and guest each day of stay, all that is required is to show your black room key and provide your room number. No charges to dispute on check out. I will continue to complain about resort fees and paying for something I already get. Service in the restaurant is not up to usual standards. There are fewer guests eating breakfast in my observations due to the coupons being discontinued. One must now pay $30 plus dollars. Not something a family of 2 plus will do everyday. Servers look bored and put out to bring water.Rooms are the same tired, dated, worn and torn rooms as on previous stays. The good news, remodel starts in January. Much needed and appreciated. Parking TIP- Park across the street at the Banyan - $110 for one week or $30 per day. It is $40 to self park at the hotel.As I'm not able to rate .5 stars, my rating continues to be 3.5 for this property.Looking forward to the remodel.

We recently stayed 5 nights at this beachfront property. The first room we got was seriously in need of renovation. We worked with Allyson Yoshimura at the front desk and she was able to get us a nice view room (Diamond Head/Ocean View) in good condition..... very good customer service. This is an older property and we were told they plan to renovate/upgrade the rooms starting in Jan 2019. You cannot beat the location: across from Waikiki beach, next to zoo and shopping. Plenty of restaurants in the hotel, pool/pool bar and a nice Starbucks in the lobby and ABC (convenience stores) on site.

Large, pleasant and clean rooms. Good location in Waikiki. Our room had an excellent view of both the ocean and Diamond Head. Concierges just didn’t listen and tried to sell us something we didn’t want every time we had questions - e.g. when I asked a question about time to get to Pearl Harbor by Lyft for a tour I had previously reserved, they tried to upsell me on a “complete” tour including travel to/from, which was more expensive and not what I was interested in and then tried to convince me it would be v difficult to get a ride back from Pearl when I declined their offer...yuck. It was clear they were working on commission. First time I’ve experienced this type of service at a Marriott property. All others at this property treated us very well. I’d stay at this hotel again.

As an elite Marriott member who is staying at an elite Marriott property, the service should also be elite. While the service was good and in some cases great, the devil is in the details. Providing elite service means ensuring that every customer has a positive experience with service. After checking in, I had to wait 2 hours. I was told I would be contacted when the room is ready. I was not contacted, but after 2 hours I asked for a manager who then told me the room has been ready. During one of the days, breakfast service was slow although servers are walking around in circles. And, on my last day, I requested late check-out. After being told I was good until 4pm, I attempted to enter the room around 2pm only to find my room key was not working. I had to walk down to the front desk which is a long walk.Elite members staying at an elite property should receive elite service!

Very nice hotel, but room was just average. It's in the middle of everything though, the location is awesome, the staff are very helpful. There are 2 towers, I felt as though I had an old tower. I upgraded to an ocean view room, but really got a room facing other buildings with the ocean on the side. The hotel is right across the street from the beach and lots of shops and restaurants to keep you entertained. I will definitely be back here!

Stayed at many Hotels before on Waikiki and we wanted to try Marriott this time. Hotel is very clean guest rooms and friendly staff. Everything worked fine but is dated. Upgrades are needed. Pool area is nice with sun afternoon till sun set. Food at hotel is average nothing great and seems overpriced for average food. Noise all times of the day from vehicles, construction, and helicopters, flying over the Beach. Beach is right outside the Hotel which was nice. Be careful if booking rental car through hotel as in my case there was no benefit at all doing so. You can do better on your own.

We enjoyed our stay here as we were walking distance from most anything we wanted to do. We were close to food, beaches, shopping and the Zoo. This is an older property and it reflects it with dated rooms, however they were clean and the maids were very efficient. It was disappointing they didn't have airport pickup and a cab cost us $55 with tip, I found out later you can Uber for about $25-30. We had a good view of the Pacific from our balcony and enjoyed sunsets, parades and fireworks. The bar was good for sunsets too, but nothing fancy here as most everything comes in a plastic cup, but the bartenders were friendly and generous. It was a surprise that we had to cross the busy street to get to the beach, but didn't pose to much inconvenience. There were bikes to rent at various places near by. The Zoo was just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There were shops on the property, but look around as there are better deals elsewhere. Check in and out was easy and the desk personnel was friendly and helpful. If you are renting a car, be prepared to pay for parking everywhere, just a heads up!

Booked this hotel 2 times. We forgot to cancel one of our bookings...while I understand this was my error, I had hoped Marriott would be at least a little helpful. We were charged the full nights stay. The customer service was terrible. Not what I expect from Marriott...they have gone downhill. I will No longer stay at Marriott.

First time to Waikiki and Marriott system had me booked for two rooms. Only booked one room on the their website and only confirmed for one room. The second room seemed to be an anomaly since I didn't have the cancellation number for said reservation. Either way, Kenneth, Rinston and Yuko were able to update me regarding cancelling the room for no penalty/charge and were empathetic to my needs. I've been an Elite member with Marriott for a year now and I am happy to be a loyal rewards member, Marriott treated me right and made our stay wonderful.The property itself is huge with plenty of stores that sell authentic Hawaiian products and a couple nice restaurants to eat at. We had the breakfast buffet at the Kuhio Beach Grill which was good for what they offered and had drinks at the Moana Terrace Bar & Grill, this place had live music all throughout the day and the bar had great ambiance.The rooms are average but it will fit your needs, the balcony views are nice. This property is located on the quiet end of Waikiki but is a short walk from the beach, other major properties and shopping centers. Would definitely stay here again!

Despite the SPG points merger disaster, still fans of Marriott. Front desk service is solid. Rooms are a bit dated but OK. F&B service is a disaster! Lots of attitude. Lots of “no’s” to very simple requests. Not up to Marriott standards. We are not high maintenence guests. Heard other guests make similar comments. Marriott leadership team needs to pay a visit and make changes.

My second stay here while in Waikiki on business. The hotel is enormous. The rooms are nice and the balconies are spacious. The service at the hotel is generally very good, rooms are clean and staff is friendly. The restaurants are a bit shaky though and pricey, but then again, this is Waikiki Beach, so I would expect no less. The hotel is very full with a lot of large groups so you will not have the pace to yourself, and it can be difficult to get a seat at Moana's Terrace at Happy Hour even in the middle of the week. Two nice pools and just across from the main swimming area at the beach, so location is fairly convenient. Hotel is at the opposite end of the main drag for most of the other hotels and restaurants (closer toward Diamond Head and the zoo), so less convenient than some of thee other large resort hotels, but also seems to have more updated facilities in some respects.

The hotel is nice. It's quite large which means you may have a lot of walking to do to make you're way around the hotel. Beautiful lanai and lobby. Nice restaurant/bar on-site. Close to the beach and shops/restaurants. We would stay here again, but if we traveled with another couple (which we did) we'd book our rooms together to ensure we were closer.

Hotel is across the street from the beach. Many good shops on the first floor. Good beach views from a number of the rooms. Hotel rooms in strong need of updating, painting, overall aesthetic maintenance.

It did not seem like the staff was happy. Our check-in was a long tedious process- after flying all day- you just want to get to your room! She was pleasant but a little grumpy and we felt like an imposition. The room was nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. The hotel was located in a good spot. Being in Customer Service I’d say- figure out why people are not happy?

Leisure get away spot for a few daysProsClean roomsBalcony Close to beachConsTook until late afternoon to clean roomParking $50 per nightNo microwave in room or available$37 resort charge but no resort Breakfast not included

Excellent location, clean, friendly and up to date facilities. The room are excellent and the views spectacular. You CAN NOT go wrong staying here.. will definitely be back.. :) Woo Hoo.!.!.!.! If you like the beach you'll be 200 ft away from spectacular waters and shopping areas. Rent a car from the hotel and take a drive... you will not regret it. We rented a Jeep and headed toward the north shores.. Almost forgot... the Italian restaurant within the hotel area is fantastic.. lots of things to do... I can go on and on..

We have stayed at a wide range of hotels in our many travels from St. Regis to Motel Six. The Marriott on Waikiki Beach is what I would call a great value with a super location, classy service in a casual, friendly, yet professional manner from the front desk all the way to the busboy and concierge. Our checkin was a bit complicated because my son-in-law treated us to two nights with his elite status points and our additional stay was on us. Jordan at check in (who remembered exactly who we were three days later) handled our situation with aplomb, making sure we received Elite status all the way through to our departure, with an upper floor room near elevators as requested. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with great service by Laini, a real pro of a waitress. The nightly entertainment at the Moana Terrace was great with the guys encouraging requests and dancing which we did with a great connection to the fun crowd there with us. The only downside was the very expensive and average dinner we had on the Terrace. (An average salad with a small piece of fish on it for 25 bucks). The tour lobby is very helpful and convenient for all pickups and dropoffs. Definitely liked that. Right across from the beach. Loved the open air areas all around. Only a block from the zoo and aquarium which was nothing super special but nice to support their education and ecological programs. All in all, wouldn't hesitate recommending as long as you don't expect a luxurious suite with a bunch of amenities. Just a good, clean room with a great bed and nice views.

For me and my husband’s first visit to Oahu and our 20th anniversary, we selected Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa due to its location. It’s right across from the beach with views of Diamond Head and walking distance to a lot of restaurants, shops, and attractions. We cannot say enough about the hotel staff – they were top notch and only added to our experience! Everyone we encountered was warm, welcoming and eager to ensure we had a pleasurable stay. We stayed in the Keohilani tower and our room had beautiful views of the beach with its many surfers, boats, and sunsets. Our room was very clean and comfortable and more than met all our needs. The breakfast buffet at Kuhio Beach Grill was very good, fresh omelets, fruit, pastries, BACON, and much much more. The wait staff hustle and even offer “to-go” cups for coffee and waters. However, dinner there is more cafeteria style with bright lighting and no atmosphere. Moana Terrace, the pool bar, is fun with happy hour specials and live entertainment every night. During our stay there was plenty space at the pool, so no need to get up at the crack of dawn to grab a chair. The beach is across the street, so there are no chairs or service on the beach. However, there are plenty of places in or near the hotel to rent chairs and umbrellas.I like that we received refillable water bottles when we arrived and there are several filling stations located throughout the property that came in very handy and is very green! It was also convenient that they had an ABC store on the main level, where you can get just about anything you need from liquor/snacks to souvenirs for reasonable prices.We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for 8 nights during our holiday from work. First off, we are both Marriott loyalists - and will be in the future. We used points for the stay and were even 'upgraded' to a larger room on the corner right next to the ocean with a great view of the sunset at night. A couple of key things stick out about this Marriott - First, there is no lounge for Marriott Rewards members. Platinum and Platinum Elite members have the option to choose points or breakfast for 2 each day/night of the stay. The breakfast is amazing and has a wide variety of options to fit the appetite of anyone from various cultures who stay at the resort. Second, the service you receive from the team at the hotel is second to none. Every one you pass says hello and tries to help (if needed). Finally, as nice as everything is the building and facilities are in desperate need of upgrades. It was infuriating during our stay to have constant issues with our shower - it would not drain and made the 'upgraded' room a laugh every time we walked in. Taking into consideration there were protests by the housekeeping staff at multiple hotels near the Marriott we won't complain but can't say we'd rush back here. This is a good property but for the steep price tag (or points per night) I have to believe there is a better option nearby.

I was here four years ago and loved it, in fact every time I come to Hawaii i try to stay here unless it's totally booked out. Greeted with a smile, explained everything. Happy days - emailed in-advance as I was coming from Australia and requested an early check in...no worries got to my room and slept off the jet lagThis time, I got here and was told I had to wait until 3pm even though I requested and paid for an early check in...thanks for taking my money there.I emailed back and forth with the Marriott for weeks trying to get as assistants to help do a surprise proposal to my partner, the wanted nothing to do with me to help. On arrival I went to the desk and said "Hey I've been emailing back and forth..." front desk weren't interested in what I was trying to achieve and basically left me high and dry trying to improvise a proposal which I manage to pull a rabbit out a hat on the beach with a basic picnic no thanks to the Marriott staff...Previously when I stayed here guest where given to free cocktails during happy hour via little coupons... that never happened and the bar is grossly over priced compared to the last time I was here. I found blood stains in the bed sheets and requested someone come change the sheets...that never happened...I tried to organise a pearl harbour tour the concierge, and when I decided not to do the tour due to the price, every time I walked past I would get a dagger stare from the staff...Oh and there is some ridiculous resort fee which I have no idea why I paid this every day or what exactly it entitles me too...Absolutely terrible service from the staff and I will NEVER! stay here again... and to add insult to every terrible review you get some canned response from management saying "they will look into the issues" Yeah that is total BS...For what you pay, this hotel has become grossly overrated, I have no interest in ever coming back here again and will make it my goal to ensure I let everyone who comes to Waikiki where not to stay.

Nice and close to everything! Beach right across the street! Most friendly staff and very helpful. Restaurants close by and zoo is one block away. Went to Dukes for dinner, very short walk. Used Lyft for everything. Didn’t need a rental car. Excellent service!

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa, is centrally located with vast ocean views. The staff are very professional and informative.Restaurants, bars and shops are at your door steps. The resort offers many deals with restaurants, messages etc and free videos.

Stayed here for 4 days as part of total 8 night vacation. First impressions good - upgraded at reception to include complimentary breakfast for 2 guests ($70 per day value) and got room on 22 floor. We paid extra for ocean view at time of booking, I would recommend this. Even though we were on 22nd floor you could hear the waves crash in the morning and it was great to watch the early morning surfers ride a wave. Room was large but bathroom pretty small and needing modernised in my view. This is big hotel split over 2 towers but you can easily get to both. Did not eat at ant of the onsite restaurants as there is so much choice walking distance down the street. Also has ABC store which has pretty much everything you would need to buy on holiday and Starbucks for your take-out coffee etc. One final point - we ventured back into hotel last evening of our vacation and they had live entertainment on which was best we seen whole time we stayed in Hawaii. Not sure of their names, they had flown in especially.

My wife and I stayed recently for 5 nights. The staff was very good at check in and the room was spotless. Had a suite on the 10th floor. Could see the beach between the buildings. The staff sent us a fruit basket for our anniversary and I thought that was a nice touch. Parking can get kind of tight as it was full almost every night with self park. Breakfast buffet was very good. The omelet station guys were lightning fast everyday. Gets crowded but moves fast. Definitely will go back again one day, great Marriott property. Not a fan of the resort fee, not sure it is of any value except the hotel.

The hotel has a great location. It is walking distance from the beach and the stores of Waikiki Beach. I thought the service at the hotel was great valet to the check-in staff. The breakfast buffet was enjoyable experience and I recommend a meal if you stay at the hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable place to relax on a vacation.

The location is really great for the beach, transport, zoo and restaurants. Walking distance for all. The rooms are very clean, quite spacious. Staff were exceptional with all the dealings we had with them, and were very knowledgeable about any tours or places of interest. It was also nice to have a few restaurants on site, when you had had a busy day and just wanted to relax

We just come back for an amazing trip to Hawaii and Marriot did not disappointed us! First of all, the location is superb! Beach front and right on the middle of everything. From check in to check out everything was very pleasant and we didn’t have any issues. Got a great big room with a very comfy king bed! Bathroom (shower/tub) is on a small size but the sink is outside, which is a great feature. Air conditioner worked great! No issues with the TV, refrigerator or anything else. The view was PRICELESS! We stayed in the 31st floor with a full view of the ocean and Diamond Head. So basically when we were in the room, we were in the balcony just enjoying the gorgeous Waikiki scenario. 2 great pools in the property. Wish they had a bigger jacuzzi or more than one. We did tried to use for 3 days in a row and it was very crowded. Nice gym! Small garage.The pool bar, OMG! We had lunch (with a incredible view) twice there. The food is amazing (10 stars to the pork sandwich and Hawaiian pizza) and my boyfriend said the drinks were also. On our check out day, since we have the room back at 11am but only needed to be at the airport at 8:30pm, we were able to use the hotel and they also provided us with a complimentary room for shower. It was great. Thanks!I only wish Marriott would provide beach chair and umbrella for free, like other hotels do.

Me and my partner visited early November 2018 for a 7 night stay. The trip was to celebrate my 40th birthday and recreate our first ever trip taken together 18 years ago. I booked a package vacation through priceline and got what I considered a very fair price. Our flight from Sacramento arrived early and by the time we got to the hotel it was around 11.30am. We figured we were too early to checkin but gave it a shot knowing that we'd probably have to come back later.We were helped by the most wonderful lady named Anna. She was very polite and asked what brought us to Hawaii to switch I stated we are celebrating my 40th. She politely asked how many beds.... as a LGBT traveler this can sometimes be awkward however Anna was wonderful and made us feel super relaxed and welcomed. Anna informed us that she was upgrading our room to an ocean view and that it was ready right away. I was so thrilled and extremely thankful!!!!The next day we had been out exploring and came back to the room to find a bottle of wine, cheese, chocolate strawberries, a fruit platter and a hand written card! See pics. Omg I was just speechless!!!! This is truly the nicest thing any hotel has ever done for us! We have traveled all over the world and this is the one stay that I will never forget. I rushed down to the front desk to give Anna my thanks!I want to give my sincere thanks to Anna and all the staff at the Mariott Waikiki beach hotel and spa. Everyone we encountered was extremely polite and friendly. The housekeeping staff were amazing. Once they realized I was a coffee drinker they stocked up my room with extra creamers! It is the small details like this that are the difference between a good hotel and an amazing hotel! Thank you so much for making our trip amazing :-)

We stayed here for nine nights Oct 9-18. View was terrific. Concierge was very good. Location good, close was to everything. Room was fine, but bathroom was small and outdated. Tub enamel was peeling off; bathroom had no fan.

The view from our beachfront room was amazing and an easy walk across the street to the most beautiful beach. Lots of dining options within walking distance that even satisfied our picky eaters. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Loved the music around the pool. Our room was clean and nice. We had a great time and would recommend this resort.

Five nights at the Marriott Waikiki in October 2018. Front desk staff was great - accommodating and very helpful. Room was upgraded to a junior suite with ocean view. Unfortunately, no time to enjoy pool or beach. And due to press of business - I had no time to fully explore hotel or Waikiki.Since this is resort hotel - room was not really set up to use desk extensively. It could have used a more accessible power strip. Nightstand had ample ports which were helpful.Room could use some modernizing - particularly the bathroom. The buffet restaurant - where I had breakfast one day - was utilitarian and looked more like a banquet room. Overall, the hotel was fine for my needs and it's employees were all attentive and pleasant.

The management at this hotel lie to you, just to get your business. I was told by the front desk that I would get loyalty points for my stay because I told them I would cancel my room and rebook elsewhere. When I checked my points at a later date, they were not there and now they will not honor what was discussed at checkin. I will never stay at this hotel again!

What a great Hotel. Excellent staff, room with ocean views, fantastic facilities, eg: bar by the pool, choice of restaurants, ABC store, Starbucks, two pools, the list goes on and on.Location is perfect, short walk to Waikiki beach, Zoo, Bars, Restaurants and shopping.The Concierge, Ron was fantastic, friendly, professional, attentive and a great Ambassador for the Hotel. He had a great range of suggestion of things to do and places to go.We booked The Chiefs Luau, which was a great night, A Pearl Harbour tour and a Tour around the Island which were also greatWould we stay here again, definitely yes!.

Very large hotel with more than 1,100 rooms. Just a few meters away from the Waikiki beach. Which caters more to the average tourists.Has two towers. The Kealohilani Twr. is closer to the beach and has the better views.Room spacious enough, standard furniture. Fridge and room safe. Bathroom a bit small. Shower in the bath tub.Has no executive lounge.Has a number of restaurants. Breakfast at the Kuhio grill, quite a distance away from your room at the other tower. Very busy restaurant, food on offer ok, but limited choice. More like the famous “Free hot breakfast” style plus omelettes and Miso soup.Pools no big deal.
