Fitness center ok but much too small for a hotel of that size.Lot of shops. Many Asian tourists. And folks with tattoos.Doesn’t have a real resort feeling. Is more like a very large city hotel.

They're really pushing it to call it a resort. It's beautiful when you walk in and a lot of shops connected to the hotel. It's cool that they give you these water bladders and have hydration stations to refill your water bottles. But that's the only thing amenity-wise that makes it more special. There are a lot of flight crews that stay at this hotel, so asking for a preferred room could be difficult. The hotel is quite large with two towers, but somehow they couldn't find us a king bedroom for our honeymoon. Regardless, the rooms were quite standard. The bathrooms were smaller that I expected, especially for what should be a higher brand hotel. At the end of the day, we don't really go to Hawaii to stay in the room. The location was convenient to the zoo, park, aquarium and closest to Diamond Head out of all the resorts. It's right across the street from the beach as well. When we come back to Honolulu, we will probably opt for a different resort.
user_name:
jlewsam
New York City, New York

review_body: The waikiki marriott resort exceeded expectations! Situated right in the center of Waikiki, this beautiful property features several restaurants, two pools and easy beach access. Our room was spacious, updated, quiet and comfortable. We had a patio outside that had views of diamond head and the beach! If you are looking for serenity, this is not the place for you and I would recc. Maui or another city.
user_name:
Charlotte B
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Waikiki for 5 nights to celebrate his retirement and for our first trip to Hawaii. The manager graciously upgraded us to a junior suite overlooking the ocean to help us celebrate. Spacious room and bathroom and beautiful views! Loved the balcony. The cleaning staff and front desk staff were excellent and friendly. We enjoyed drinks by the pool and during sunsets, you can’t beat the view from the Moana Terrace! Very close to Waikiki Beach and shopping, restaurants. It’s a busy, noisy area of the city, and the rooftop bar at the hotel across the street has loud music at night, but we were prepared with a white noise machine. The beds were extremely comfortable and we had no troubles sleeping after exploring the island each day. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel if staying near Waikiki. Our trip to Hawaii was absolute perfection!

Situated down one end of waikiki one block from the zoo this is a large and comfortable hotel. It comprises two 30plus floor towers, the bedrooms are very clean and of a reasonable size with small balconies. There are 2 small swimming pools at the bottom of each tower with plenty of sunbeds. There are a number of restaurants but we only ate at the bar which has a good selection of food and drink with some tables overlooking the beach. Staff are friendly and helpful. Each tower has a Starbucks and an ABC (convenience) store and there are clothes shops in the hotel mall. The trolley stops outside the side door of the hotel and at 2$ a journey is a good way to get round Waikiki

I really wanted to like this hotel. We stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary which I mentioned upon booking. We paid for an oceanfront room, but, as Platinum Members and the occasion for which we were staying, I was expecting to be placed on a higher floor. A few minutes after we checked in, a gentleman came to our door with chocolate covered strawberries and told us it was part of "our package." I laughed. We had no package; it was obviously a thoughtful gift for our anniversary. The rooms are quite spacious and have 50"(?) tvs. There is a small refrigerator and charging stations built into the bedside clocks. Also, there are reading lights attached to the headboards. The bathrooms are quite small and I banged into the toilet and tub on numerous occasions. There is only one concierge that I would recommend: Amanda. She is the only one who could answer every one of our questions and offer other suggestions to add to our itineray. I think I spoke with 5 or 6 other concierges during our stay. I had asked one of the young male concierges if we could get directions to somewhere in town. His answer was, "don't you have a smart phone?" Not the kind of response I would expect from a Marriott employee, especially one who works at an expensive hotel. As another reviewer said, the $37+/day resort fee is really steep. If you are going to charge this, then start by making sure your fitness center is clean (it was not) and there are services poolside (there was not). The breakfast buffet was excellent, but at $34.95/person it's expensive. We would not have eaten breakfast there had it not been included as part of our Platinum status.

So close to the beach. 24 hours mini shop. A walk away from all the happenings in Waikiki... what else do you need? None. Marriot has it all. The resort staff were there all the time for you. Dedicated to ensure your stay is absolutely amazing. The cleaning crew made my room spotless every single day. Fresh everything. The rooftop bar was amazing to say the least. The bartender can whip out a wonderful Mai Tai. The lobby crew was so helpful that they know of the back what I needed to ensure my stay was fabulous. Look at my full review at my Instagram account @ titansvn_☺️

Fine rooms, a little bit outdated bathrooms. Facilities are fine however very impersonal . The swimming pools are far from each other, no service at the pool. Not for a fun day at the pool. I would rather stay at a smaller set up hotel.

If given the option, I would rate the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa 3.5 out of 5 stars. Overall, my stay was good:The location of the hotel was perfect - at the end of the main strip of the Waikiki beach area directly across the street from Kuhio Beach, easily accessible with everything you could want within a one block walk without the hassle of being in the middle of busy one-way Waikiki streets, with gorgeous views overlooking the beach and looking towards Diamond Head.The hotel staff was pleasant and accommodating - any request I made of the front desk was honored, the bell staff and valet parking were pleasant and responsive, the gentleman who taught the lei making class was very nice with interesting stories about Hawaii and its culture, the bartenders at Moana Terrace, Sansei and the servers at Arancino di Mare were great, and the servers at Kuhio Beach Grill for the breakfast buffet were very nice but provided limited services (as expected at a buffet).The pool areas were nice and clean with plenty of lounge chairs and cabanas.Upon check-in, as a Marriott Rewards platinum member, I was upgraded from a City View room to an Ocean Front room on the 18th floor of the Kealohilani Tower. I was very happy with the upgrade, the view from my room was spectacular! I was also given a reusable water bag that could be filled at filling stations located throughout the ground floor of the hotel. I was given the option of 1,000 rewards points or the breakfast buffet for 2 for the duration of my stay as a welcome gift - I selected the breakfast.I dined at Arancino di Mara and Sansei Sushi Bar (I sat bartop) for dinner. Both restaurants were very good with great service.I had the breakfast buffet at the Kuhio Beach Grill most mornings. The buffet was decent with plenty of hot options, omelets made to order, fresh fruits & juices, and several bread offerings as well as miso soup and rice with toppings. The price was steep at $35 per person and, if it wasn't included I would have probably eaten elsewhere for breakfast.Why only 3.5 stars? The room, while clean with a comfortable bed, was seriously outdated. Just replacing the carpet would make a big difference. Also the bathroom area, with a walk-through vanity sink area to the toilet and shower, was very small - not what I would expect of a resort hotel. The room was not very soundproof. I could hear the person in the room next door snoring, and a toilet flushing from a nearby room. Loud sounds from the street were audible in the room as well.The $37 + tax per day resort fee was outrageous. The resort fee included: fitness and cultural classes daily, unlimited dvd rental, discounts at shops located at the hotel and one introductory scuba diving or snorkeling lesson - that's one per stay per room, not per day or per person staying in the room.The food at the Moana Terrace was expensive and uninspired. Marriott should be embarrassed for allowing such terrible food on its premises. As an example, the nachos were served with a bad cheese sauce and the sweet potato fries were stale or undercooked.I would stay at this location again, particularly if I was in town for business, but would readily consider other nearby options as well.

I was advised to join the Marriott reward program so I would get preferential treatment at this Marriott.Well from the moment we checked in the hotel was a disappointment. We didn’t get the room we booked . They wanted to charge us more than what was quoted and the room we eventually got was a disaster.Bathroom falling apart , no facilities and no service .We were promised a manager would contact us to sort out our booking . No contact was made the whole time we were there The pool area was basic and the pool was like a plunge pool . Nothing like it was described to me . Location was ok except for the fact you have to dodge all the homeless men during the day and night Not a great experience and never again .We have stayed at the Trump and the Halekulani in the past and would recommend these hotels over the Marriott every time .Thanks for nothing Marriott Rewards

Large king room, clean well furnished. A small balcony for relaxing. Across the street from Waikiki Beach not far from Diamond Head. Walkable to downtown shopping . Restaurants in the hotel with many nearby. Easy check in and out.

Husband and I stayed here for 9 night vacation. Ultimately there was nothing wrong with the hotel but nothing particularly outstanding. Loved the location; great being at the end of the busy Waikiki beach. The open reception area is impressive with staff friendly and helpful. Other than that no real complaints. The room was basic but overall was clean which is the main thing. It was pricey but then I found that to be case for beach side, ocean view hotels which is what I was wanted.

The room was clean, our ocean view was excellent, the bed was comfortable, we're very pleased with the service. The lobby and the courtyard sitting area was awesome, doorman and valets were ok. Upon our checkout, the memeber reward services deck was very helpful and professional.

I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott resort during a business trip back in May. I loved the location: just one block from the beach, and there was tons of shops and restaurants along the strip. However be warned that on the Waikiki strip there are a LOT of homeless. They never exuded an air of danger, but it does make you feel a bit uncomfortable especially when they’re essentially lined up one after the other. The room was a little dated and darker than pictured in on the Marriott site, however even from the secondary tower you have a nice ocean view (there was even fireworks Wednesday night!). The WiFi worked great inside the room, but in the hallway it was nonexistent for some reason. It was fine in the main areas of the resort as well. There’s also a water refill station in the lobby, took me until day 4 or so to realize. Breakfast buffet was very good, loved that it started at 5AM since East Coast time had me waking up at 4:30. Great omelette station (though be warned the line can get LONG especially later in the morning), loved the fresh pineapple and pineapple juice, the cinnamon rolls are deceptively delicious. Though if you aren’t an elite member and get the free breakfast, $30 is too much in my opinion. There’s a Starbucks in the second tower if you aren’t into the pricey buffet, and a fast food joint on the corner. All in all, I’d stay here again, however if I were here on personal travel I feel the price is a bit much for rooms that are in need of a little polish and updating.

As a Marriott Platinum this was my first day at this property. I was told I was upgraded to a junior suite however when I arrive in into my room it was a room with 3 beds for one person. My room had an odor of dirty diaper I also noticed brown stains on the carpet. I packed my bag back up and return to the front desk it took them eight minutes to find me a new room which was a downgrade for my inconvenience the same ridiculous room setup with three beds but this time with a view of a parking lot and air conditioner unit. The second room didn't smell bad but also lacked preventive maintenance. Three beds and one chair and the chair was extremely worn down there was hair and stains on the top sheet trash underneath the table dirt dust and hair stuck to the fire alarms bathroom floors that were dirty drains that were nasty. But this room didn't smell like poop. Shockingly bad if this was a roadside Inn but this is a resort in a city with the most ridiculous Hotel nightly rates they charge of ridiculous Resort fee. With all the options in this city this hotel shouldn't be considered. Things happen rooms can be dirty or have an odor... But when I guess brings it to your attention and is inconvenience by it you should be a little more apologetic and not downgrade them.

Not what i expected for a five star hotel. No mini bar, no free water in the rooms. I found honolulu quite expensive for many things. And cheap for some. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Beds comfortable and rooms qite spacious.

We ended up with an amazing view of the ocean on the 19th floor. We got to listen to the waves in the morning when we woke up and at night we went to bed. The hotel is clean, bright, friendly and perfect. The beach in front of the hotel is nice because there’s a wave break and you can easily go out and enjoy the water. Very close to several nice restaurants and places to walk along the beach.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is a beautiful hotel located just across the famous beach with its same name. It also right down the road from Diamond Head Crater and world class shopping. With its renovation a few years ago, the look of the resort has changed to one that is quite modern while still taking in the Aloha feel with beautiful local foliage. Being steps from the water only makes this the perfect choice when looking for accommodations in the Waikiki area. On property, you have Enterprise Rental for your car rental needs, which makes it very convenient. Taking a drive around the island is thus very easy. Also, there are several restaurants on property, but one of the favorites is the Moana Terrace. Here you can get lunch by the pool in a relaxed atmosphere. Having comfortable and beautiful rooms is very important, but due to the greatmanagement team of people like Chris Tatum (general manager) and Charlene Kamada (assistant), coming back year after year is a clear choice. This has been the location to celebrate special events in our family, and they have gone above and beyond. This is something that comes from the heart and that is why the property is so successful. Keeping loyal customers who will return over and over again is the most important factor.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott was a nice hotel. We stayed for 2 nights and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite. The view, especially for a sunrise, was great! However, I wouldn't expect any unobstructed views and the hotel is in the middle of a city. Right across the street from the beach, but the pools leave something to be desired. Nice room, very large hotel (2 separate towers).

We stayed here for a few nights. At the beginning of the trip we informed them we may have to leave early due to a family illness and they said this was fine. When we actually did have to checkout early (we gave them notice) they were very rude.The rooms are very dated. Almost motel style. We paid extra for an ocean view and got ocean glimpses between buildings.We had massive issues in our room including bathroom light not turning off and bath tub plug stuck in. We notified this on arrival before unpacking and instead of moving us they sent workmen in while we were there to drill away loudly. Then they left a mess in the bathroom.Every day we had to call up and asked for teabags as they only managed to supply one a day for a room for two people paying a resort fee I found it unreasonable.The pool area has been badly designed. More seats than space in the pool. Half of the pool (already tiny) is used by a diving company so you are trying to relax and have a diving class going on. It is not paradise as it looks in the photos so we spent our time at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon instead.The italian restaurant downstairs was good. I wouldn't stay again. So many better options in Waikiki for the room rate. We were really disappointed by our stay having had good experiences at other Marriotts globally.

We stayed at this Resort for three nights prior to a cruise. From check in to check out, all the employees were so friendly and helpful. The lobby, pool area, and the shops were very nice. The rooms are a bit dated but clean. I was just a little disappointed with the "Ocean View", we did see a tiny view of the Ocean from our balcony but our Main view was the hotel next door and Diamond Head. The location of the resort was perfect; having the beautiful beach across the street, shops and restaurants within walking distance. We were sorry we were not staying longer than three nights.

Great location right on Waikiki beach. Awesome pool area and hot tub. If the room was a little larger we would have enjoyed it a bit more. overall great resort though. Good times and good vibes. I will stay here again.

Spent 8 nights in an ocean view room. Great sunset view. Since I'm Marriott Platinum was able to get the breakfast buffet for free (reject the platinum 1000 point gift to get this..well worth it). Many amenities at hotel with fee. If you need a rent car, they are available there...although we used Uber extensively with great results.Several restaurants in the hotel as well as pool bar. Really good sushi in the seafood/sushi restaurant. And it is so easy to walk the the beach as well as shops and restaurants on Waikiki.Good area to jog with a large park, quieter beach front, and Waikiki drive just off to the east.

The General Manager Chris Tatum operates this property with all of the standards you would expect from a fine Marriott Resort Property! The entire staff is kind, considerate and knowledgeable in their area of expertise. Janice and Madonna each morning for breakfast start our day off with smiles and greetings to enjoy the day, the breakfast is also delicious! Housekeeping takes care to make sure the room is always perfect, offering a turn down service when requested. We have special circumstances, traveling with a 99 year old WWII Veteran and the entire Marriott Staff at this property have welcomed him with open arms, gratitude and honor. We cant thank everyone enough for making our stay perfect! Wonderful amenities, the pool and cabanas are lovely overlooking the sand and the surf! 100% Recommended!!

Look, you're not staying at the Ritz-Carlton but you will be quite comfortable here. Check-in was easy and pleasant. The hotel was bright and clean. I was upgraded to the K-Tower in a premiere room (or whatever they called it) and there were plentiful elevators. It was not too crowded. I had an ocean view room on the 13th floor. Frankly, the view was not so great, and was 80% adjacent hotel with 20% ocean. The room itself was spacious and could fit an extra bed easily if you needed it. It was sparsely furnished, however - there was not an ottoman for the lounge chair, which would have been the right thing to include. The bathroom was OLD and tired. It looked straight out of the 1980's. That needs to be updated. TV in the room was new however, and was a smart-tv with Netflix, etc. The location is central Waikiki, so if that's what you're looking for it doesn't get better. They seemed to have many associates available to book excursions for you, but I did not use them. Good option if you want to be in Waikiki at this price point.

Stayed here to attend a company conference. It is not the sort of hotel I would normally stay at. For a conference it was good. Meals and service were good and the staff friendly. However I was always amazed at how quickly they tried to work us through meals. It was speed eating and on to the next course as if to get us out as quickly as possible. Slow down.

Dates of Stay: Sunday, 9/9/18 - Tuesday, 9/11/18Total Nights: 2In a nutshell, the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort is true oasis on Waikiki Beach; it is in a great location, has friendly & attentive staff, and offers spectacular views from modern and well appointed rooms! The next time your travels bring you to Waikiki, I definitely would suggest a stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort!!Now, for my detailed review:Having stayed at numerous properties in Waikiki over the years, I have seen it all; old, tiny and overpriced rooms at overcrowded properties offering lack-luster service. However, a recent stay required two nights in Waikiki at the tail-end of a vacation and I must say, the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort is a true exception to the usual chaos of Waikiki Resorts. This was a very brief stay, but in the two nights I had at this great property, I was truly impressed and although I am not a fan of Waikiki, I most certainly could see myself coming back to the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort!!The location of this property cannot be beat; it is at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, allowing for easy access to Diamond Head, and it is within walking distance of the beautiful Honolulu Zoo! Just a few blocks down the street, you will find amazing shopping and dining at the International Marketplace. And, by far the best part of this property is its direct beach access; it is directly across the street from Waikiki Beach, allowing for a great beach day! Also, as some reviews have mentioned, being at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki means this property is away from a lot of the loud hustle-and-bustle of some of the other properties and makes for a very quiet and relaxing stay. All-in-all, this property has a GREAT location making it perfect for your next stay in Waikiki!As you enter the property, you will find yourself in a beautiful open-air lobby -- the Nanea Lobby -- which has been recently renovated and looks quite modern. You will find large and well-staffed check-in counters as well as a separate check-in area for Elite Tier members of the Marriott Rewards Program. And, although it was well-staffed and we did not have much of a wait, the staff was amazing and pro-active and would constantly walk through the check-in area passing out bottles of cold water as you wait. AMAZING service!Within a matter of moments after arrival, we were at the Front Desk and a very friendly agent explained the property to us and told us that our junior suite had one of the best possible views. He also explained the Resort Fee and its inclusions.Yes, this is a Resort Property in Hawaii, so you will have a Resort Fee -- like essentially every decent property in the area. The Resort Fee at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort is currently $37/day and includes:-Macadamia Nut Chocolate Amenity on Arrival (VERY tasty!!!)-Enhanced High-Speed WiFi-1 Introductory Snorkel or Scuba Lesson-Daily Fitness Classes-Daily Cultural Classes-60-minutes of long distance or international calls per day-Unlimited Blu-Ray/DVD RentalsAll-in-all, a decent list of inclusions. The Blu-Ray/DVD Rental is a VERY nice touch! All rooms at this property are equipped with Blu-Ray/DVD Players, and off of the lobby there is a Redbox-like machine which you are given access to via a card at check-in. Not bad to have such an option included with your Resort Fee!Also, as for the "Enhanced High Speed WiFi" -- unlike many properties that claim to offer such a feature, the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort truly does. You will find the property to have EXCELLENT WiFi speeds; we did not have any issues with connectivity or streaming throughout our stay!As for rooms on property, they are typical rooms of most Marriott properties; decent size (most are around approximately 350-square feet) and well-appointed. Each room features the typical plush Marriott bed and linens, as well as Marriott's new high-end internet televisions which offer a quality on-screen guide and the ability to access all types of streaming services. The bathrooms feature the Marriott Thann Bath Products, and each room also features a small mini-fridge. Finally, all rooms feature large curved balconies that offer great views of either the city or the ocean. All-in-all, quite nice rooms for the Waikiki Beach area!As for room view, this property has several varying views from two high-rise towers. Views range from City View to Ocean View to Diamond Head. All such views are amazing, but I would highly recommend splurging a bit for the Ocean View rooms as the height of these towers provides for truly spectacular views! Should you be here on a Friday, you would have amazing views of the Hilton Hawaiian's fireworks display!As for our room, we booked an Ocean Front Junior Suite, and we could not have been happier; it was an AMAZING room located high up in the Kealohilani Tower -- the tower closest to the ocean and beach. As you walk in, you enter into a sitting area with a bathroom off to the left. The bathroom had an over-sized double vanity, a shower, toilet and a deep soaking tub along with the mini-fridge. The sitting area offered a comfortable sofa-sleeper and a large curved balcony which offers spectacular views of the ocean, Waikiki Beach and also the city. As you progress further into the room, you find the ultra-plush and comfortable Marriott pillow-top King-bed along with a large work/computer desk, dresser and high-definition television. The room was equipped with ample lighting and electrical outlets -- unlike many local properties. Finally, one of the best features of this Ocean Front Junior Suite is the wall of windows facing out toward the ocean -- truly amazing views from bed! All-in-all, a truly wonderful room for the cost!As for dining during your stay -- in addition to all of the amazing local venues within walking distance -- the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort offers numerous excellent places to dine! First, do not miss the Kuhio Beach Grill, located on the second floor of the Kealohilani Tower; it offers an amazing breakfast buffet as well as a wonderful dinner buffet with varying themes each night. It is know for its Prime Rib Dinner, offered Monday-Thursdays at a great rate; as we were there during this period, we tried it and it was AMAZING! Additionally, the Moana Terrace Poolside Bar & Grill offers excellent drinks and dining with beautiful ocean views. For excellent sushi and seafood, don't miss Sansei Seafood Restaurant & Sushi Bar. Or, if Italian is your preference, the property also has Arancino di Mare. Finally, for coffee lovers, the property offers an on-site Starbucks.So, you most certainly will never go hungry during a stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort!Finally, the property offers a great deal of local shopping, such as one of Waikiki's many ABC Stores and a Honolulu Cookie Company. So, you are able to easily get a fair amount of shopping done during your stay!Oh, and a quick note on safety and service during Hurricane Issues. Our stay ended just prior to a Tropical Storm hitting the Islands. Throughout our stay, as the news hyped the potential effects of the storm, the property promptly and consistently updated its guests with daily information on the pending storm. I have stayed at numerous properties during hurricane season, and this property offered some of the most efficient and effective communication to its guests that I have ever seen! And, to make you understand how safe this property might be, we saw numerous FEMA Staff checking in during this period; so, if FEMA sends its people here, it must be one of the safer properties! That definitely put us at ease!!All-in-all, the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort is a truly great property, offering spectacular views from well-appointed rooms. It has great dining and stellar service and staff, and it truly should be the property of choice for your next stay in Waikiki!

we were upgraded to K building with partial ocean view - thanksHowever from our experience this is nowhere near a category 6more like 3-4 stains on carpet carpet seam separation bathroom wallpaper starting to peel old style small bathroomlocation a plus

Just returned from an 8-day stay in an oceanfront room at Waikiki Beach Marriott. Many of the reviews I read prior to booking were on point. After much research, we decided on this location rather than the outrigger due to price. I paid a AAA rate that was pretty much half of many other major Waikiki hotels. The location was great, just a couple of blocks north of the heavier traffic. Views were just as expected and the staff was friendly and helpful. When we return to Oahu, we will stay again.

Pros: Excellent location for street festival and floral parade. Clean room. Great View of the beach and Friday night Fireworks.Cons: The daytime bartender in the Moana Terrace Bar is a butthead. He will not allow you to leave your bar tab open unless you actually sit at the bar. We were in one of the cabanas and he would not allow us to leave our bar tab open. The evening bar tender allowed us to leave our tab open when we were in the smoking area. The smoking area is awful. There are only three wooden seats and they are so uncomfortable. Also, we were smoking cigars and there are no ashtrays for cigar butts so you have to cram them into these small slits made for cigarettes. If the sun is out and you want to smoke you have to do it with the sun beating down on you because there is no cover for the smoking area. One night we were out smoking cigars and it started to rain. All we could do is move to a place under cover. One of the workers walked by and made a comment about us being there, but what else are we supposed to do. When you smoke a cigar, it's not a 2 second smoke like cigarettes. I think the hotel could at least make the smoking area more comfortable and put up some type of shade and rain protection for smokers. And get some ashtrays for cigar smokers.All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel and our stay there. The food in all the restaurants in the hotel was very good. The cleaning staff always had our room spotless. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits Hawaii.

Hotel is decent. Customer service was good and hotel is situated in a good spot—lots of restaurants and easy to get to the beach. My only real complaint was that the room and bathroom was tiny. But it was Waikiki...so cant expect too much space.

Very large room! Beautiful view from the 14th floor. Room had an off-putting odor upon our arrival, but either it dissipated or I got used to it. Also, while I did end up sleeping well, the bed seemed to be nearing the end of its life, just a bit soggy, for lack of a better word. Location is on the beach, just cross the street and right in the middle of all the action, so of you are looking for a quiet, out of the way place, this is not it. Overall, though, I would go back.

Our flight home from Honolulu was recently delayed by a day and the airline put us up at the Marriott.First impressions were great. A nice welcoming smile as we stepped out of the taxi, huge open lobby and quick check in and getting access to our room, even though it was only midday.The room was huge! We had a family room which had 4 beds in it and a balcony which looked straight onto the ocean from one angle and to Diamond Head the other way. Room was clean, comfortable and we had plenty of space.All the staff we encountered were incredibly welcoming and friendly.My only issue is the hotels location. Whilst it is directly across the road from a beautiful part of Waikiki Beach, it is a fair way from the Beachwalk. Having said that, I definitely would consider staying here if I only have a couple of nights in Waikiki.

This hotel is right across the street from the Ocean. We had a great ocean front room and view from our balcony. We stayed during Hurricane Lane so they beach and shoppes in the area were limited. The staff did a great job providing information and the restaurant has a good breakfast. The movie rental card came in handy with more time than usual in the room

It is with great pleasure that I write this review. We have just returned from our wedding anniversary vacation in Honolulu. It was just fantastic. This hotel was just great. We had a fantastic sea view and a very nice room. The facility was just beautiful, just across the street to the fantastic Waikiki beach. Next to all surfers and very pleasant area with all the nice boutiques for superb shopping. Just next to all restaurants and activities.The only bad point, is that the price of the hotel is high and we found that at that price per night, breakfast should be included.

Arrived at 6am from Australia. I was told we would have breakfast included in our package however, they have us it's not included on our arrival. Very disappointed that we were told we would be able to check in early because we were arriving so early & when we got to the hotel they told us we would have to wait until 3pm, WHAT A JOKE !!!!!!!!!

Very nice hotel. I love it. Right on the beach. Staff are all nice and courteous. The info desk was particularly helpful, giving me ideas where to go sightseeing and where to dine.Lobby has a touch screen info TV where you can get info where to dine. The info needs to be updated as some of the restaurants recommended inside are no longer there, quite a few were closed but still appear on the recommended list.

I travel for a living and i recently stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa from mid July through the end of September. The hotel is not designed for long term stays althiugh it does offer on sight laundromat, free buffet breakfast and the half price prime rib buffet (if you get in between 5-6 M-Th) cant be beat.Hotel is clean and staff are friendly. Location is on the southern side of Waikiki Beach. Not far at all from the beach action.

Had a great time here. Stayed for 14 days and loved every minute of it. Thank you for making the family and I always feel welcome. Overall the room was adequate and the pool was fantastic! The customer service was fantastic and helped us elevate our vacation to the max.

Great place to stay for a relaxing time in Honolulu.Hotel is a little older and needs to invest in up keep but over all it is a great place to stay.Good views from the room and spacious rooms.A quality stay for a reasonable cost.

I am writing this from the Marriott Waikiki. We have been coming here for years. Best location in Honolulu, but it is in need of a refresh again. Furniture in room worn, nicks and scratches on walls. Few details that haven’t changed since our last visit.1. There are still signs up directing guests to the old location for the Kuhio Grill. Grill moved two years ago. 2. Activity Guide lists incorrect prices for Moana Terrace bar Happy Hour. Prices were raised last year. 3 Toilet paper is roughest I have ever encountered at a Marriott property, and I have been an Elite Rewards member for 25 years.4 Can only position shower head for very tall or very short person.

As Elite members we are usually welcomed at Marriott’s, but here there was no difference to anyone else. No door card saying Elite. No recognition at checkin. And the room is just a room - clean but dated. Smallest bathroom ever. Great pool area though.

This was an unplanned stay due to a cancelled flight but the best hotel I stayed at in Waikiki. The staff was ready to accept an influx of passengers from my flight at 1:30 am. We were greeted with water and the check in process was smooth and quick. I'd definitely consider staying at this hotel the next time I'm in Waikiki. They even have a nice area you can wait in if you fly out late in the day or fly in before your room is ready. You can also use all the amenities. The staff are all super nice and friendly.

As an elite member of Marriott they treated us pretty well. They offered us 1000 points or free breakfast. Um free breakfast please! And it was worth it! I would have actually paid for this breakfast spread. Homemade waffles, omelets, fresh fruit, pastries, oatmeal, meats, Asian noodles and ramen type food. Good coffee - they give you TO-GO cups too!!!! Very good service. Pool drinks: could have been better. Pool area: clean, nice, comfy chairs, waiters. Cabana’s available. Laundry: we used it. Was 100 feet from the pool on the same deck. Safe to leave clothes. Only $4 a load. Not too bad. They also have dry cleaning but like everywhere it was $$$. Food: we only ate at the pool deck. The nachos were good. But the service and location and view was the point. Lobby: beautiful, roomy, very Hawaii. They had activities on a weekly calendar, yoga, even rental cars available in the hotel. Tour concierges, 2 Starbucks, 2 ABC Stores, souvenir and jewelry stores. The ABC store was nice to buy towels, medical stuff, WATER and sunscreen. Room: we had an ocean view down Waikiki towards the Royal Hawaii. Very nice view. Watched the sunset a few times from our balcony. The room needs updating though. Especially the bathroom. *But guess what- you are in Waikiki on Oahu with too much to see and do. So we weren’t there much at all. As far as the location and the amenities you can’t beat it! It was a big hotel. Not a resort. It was there to serve our purpose: breakfast, shower, sleep (beds comfortable by the way) and park our rental car. I would do this again if we come back.

Close to beach, sights, restaurants and shops. This hotel is clean, comfortable and staff are 1st class.We were lucky to have a room on the 21st floor overlooking Waikiki Beach. I cannot speak highly of this place. I highly recommend it.
user_name:
Debra N
Albion Park Rail, Australia

review_body: The Marriott is across the street from Waikiki Beach, which is advantageous. Close enough to walk too, far enough not to have tourist traffic in the hotel. The sheltered beach is calm in the surf and makes a nice place to s wet I'm. The rooms are large, and ours has a small refrigerator. Nice sized full bathroom. Very clean. Robes and slippers provided. Balcony was large enough for two chairs and lounge chair with a great ocean view. I recommended.

We had a fabulous time. The staff was welcoming and helpful. The room was beautiful, with an incredible view of the mountains and Waikiki Beach. Although a little pricey, it's well worth every penny. The pools were clean and well tended. The other public areas were also well kept.
user_name:
Susan L
Santa Fe, United States

review_body: Stayed here in August 2018, the hotel is pretty big and we were on one of the top floors. Before booking I read quite a few reviews which worried me a little but i still booked and was glad. I didn't have any issues, apart from the resort fees but you'll probably already be aware of that.Coffee machine worked ok in the roomRoom safe was working ok.Fridge in the room was goodBed was comfyNice big TVPolite staffThe lady who we booked an Island tour with was quite rude though but hey ho, some people are just miserable :)) - Think she was far east asian. << The only reason i'm not giving this hotel 5* for service. The distance to the beach is great. Burger king around the corner too and loads of other places to eat at. We didn't even think about eating in the hotel as it's always a silly price. The Egg's breakfast place always had a silly queue so we never went in. Instead we ate breakfast at another place called Cheese Burger in Paradise, lovely food really friendly staff and prices were good too. There is also a place where you can fill your water bottles up too downstairs in the main lobby. Check in was easily done within 10 minutes. The 2 pics show the view from the room, Ocean view, although you need to turn your head to the left a little (not a big deal) because it takes only 10 minutes to walk to the beach!Don't let the reviews scare you, just remember that you won't be raising a family in the room, it's just a place to sleep. I'm a picky person, I dont have any complaints about this place. I would return...

Our stay here was good but there were a few things I was not crazy about. We were upgraded to a DiamondHead view room which was wonderful. The view was spectacular. Hotel sits across the street from the beach. Hotel is very large. Two towers with different elevators. We were in the tower that was furthest from the beach which was fine but the main pool and pool bar is on the 3rd floor of the other tower. That was my main issue - not a big one but we were constantly walking from one tower to the other. Wish there had been a small bar near the other pool. The pool bar was good with happy hour from 3-6 which is a good deal and nice menu for pool bar. Good view of the water for sunset from pool bar. Room was spacious and clean - no complaints. Bathroom was large and roomy. There is a nice , bright lobby and as you walk to the beach you can walk under other tower with shops. Overall, we had a nice stay and would choose this hotel again.

We haven’t stayed at this Marriott in a while and love the newly remodeled lobby and common areas. Rooms are only partially updated and ocean view wing rooms are due for full update in October. Can’t wait to see it then. Took 1 star off for the location. Location: while address is on Kalakaua Ave (oceanfront), main entrance is off a side street. The hotel is located pretty far down the east end of Waikiki. It’s a longer walk than I expect to main part of Waikiki for food and shopping (especially in the heat or rain). It initially didn’t seem that far, but it is if you walk it multiple times. A lot of the shops on the east end are very touristy and not updated, so you really would want to shop in the more central part of Waikiki for best selections.I usually stay at the Westin Moana Surfrider or the Hyatt Resort, which is so near Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and International Marketplace, just a little more convenient for food and shopping. But I was able to get the Marriott for a much better rate than the other two. Unlike the Westin which is truly beachfront, both this Marriott and Hyatt resorts are across the street from the beach. But it’s a very short walk. Other than location, love everything else here.Parking: Like all of Waikiki resorts, parking is highway robbery, but no choice. Self park is $40 daily and valet is $45. The parking area has a long semi-circular driveway, so plenty of room for cars, never feel jammed (unlike Westin and Hyatt). The valet staff is also very quick in getting us our car every day (it takes 15-20 mins at the other two). Resort fee: many Waikiki hotels’ resort fee of $35-37 daily is separate from parking. So remember to include this in your pricing decisions. Resort fee covers local calls (only useful for international travelers), free activities classes, spa discount, free newspapers and DVD rentals and shopping discounts. We didn’t use any of them.Check-in: There’s a separate platinum desk and a Japanese speaking desk. A day prior to arrival, I texted the Marriott staff to make request for early check in and King bed room. The chat team was quick to respond and room was ready and as request upon arrival. Totally awesome. Common Area: spacious seating and tables in the open air main lobby. Starbucks on site. Very clean and surprisingly quiet. A few touristy shops on site. Platinum Elite Upgrade: so with the new Marriott SPG merger, premier upgrades will be interesting to see. We were offered an ocean front king room, no suite. When we stayed at the Hyatt before, as a top tier elite member, we’ve almost always gotten a suite upgrade. So FYI.There’s also no elite lounge (both Westin and Hyatt do), but elite member can choose points or free breakfast. We got the food and it covers breakfast buffet for 2, all you can eat.Bell staff: very quick and efficient at both check in and check out.Room: We’re in the ocean front tower, which is furthest from the main lobby. Room was good size and has a spacious balcony that overlooks Waikiki beach. Due to the location of the tower, you get an Ewa view (no Diamond Head view). The room has a comfy king size bed, huge LCD TV, long desk and drawers, mini-fridge for your use, club chair, balcony furniture, closet with robes and slippers, safe. Carpet looks pretty new and linens were soft.Bathroom: typical Marriott layout, with single sink right outside separate room for toilet and tub with shower. It’s average size, feel tight with 2 people in it. Food: we only had breakfast here and the buffet had a good selection of American and Asian food options. There’s also an omelette station. Service was quick and food was tasty. There’s also a bar there, so you can get a cocktail or beer.Overall, we had a very good stay. Solid value and we would stay here again. But if the price was the same, I might choose the Westin or Hyatt instead due to the location and elite amenities.Picture us view from our room balcony during Hurricane Olivia.

My wife and I only spent one night in the hotel but we did a little walk around it and it was very nice and with some very interesting up scale decor in the lobby area. Our room was on the 25th floor and the elevator is pretty fast. The room faced East towards the mountains and views of other hotels and the streets below. The room had a queen bed and was very clean as the bathroom. The room was spacious with a couch to watch TV (never turned it on) and coffee maker with coffee, there is a safe in the room for valuables if needed. After shooting some photos of the room and looking out on the balcony we decided to go to the beach. The beach is right across the street from the hotel and the streets were busy with tourists. I found it kinda on the crowded side and we had to find a spot to put our stuff down on the beach. We still had plans on getting in the water that way... "Yes I have gone swimming at Waikiki Beach". I was in only maybe 5-10 minutes and called it quits and my wife only got her feet wet. That area is good for kids and certain people who don't like waves, kinda like a big bathtub. I could not go to the other side of the Waikiki Wall and Queen's Beach and play in the waves since I was nursing a broken rib from a few days ago..bummer!! Back at the hotel we decided to go and get something to eat, there is a big digital map / locator hanging on the wall and you click on it for what you want to do.. go eat! A lists comes up and it shows you how to get there... cool! We came back down and went out on the beach to catch the sunset but I only brought my smart phone out to the beach... still a Nice sunset!In the room the Air-conditioning is pointed at the bed, I think there needs to be a way to point it away or up. We had to get up early and be on our way by 05:30 and of course it was pouring rain outside. I called down and by the time we got there our rental car was waiting. All the hotel staff that we interacted with was very courteous and helpful. Thanks to the staff.

Checked in for two nights. I am an elite platinum member. So have long history with various properties and brands. Hotel is not an easy property for wheel chair guests. Avoid any room with “10” or near stack unless you want the hummm of the AC. Grill staff was very good. As were valet staff. Not one of our better stays at a Marriott property. Decor and public areas seem dated. Ever been to a resort hotel where plants are just paled around in plastic pots? Be careful and know valet and resort fees. These add up quickly to your daily room charge.

I’m a Marriott fan and this one lived up to the name. Wonderful large rooms with super comfy beds. The main pool was nice and heated with lots of lounges. They had live music on the weekends which was awesome . Every staff member we encountered was polite and asked if everything was perfect for us. The best part is that it’s on the east end of the strip, so it’s quieter, less busy on the beaches and only 1 mile walking to Diamond Head. We loved walking on the beach strip nightly. Some cute stores inside the resort also.

This hotel was "ok" but not much more. The room was large but the bathroom was really, really circa 1970. There was an ocean view as advertised but the view was at an angle. If you looked straight out the window you saw an office tower and we were on an upper floor. The resort was very large so getting the attention of the concierge was impossible. The beach was just across the highway, though, and many of the tourist spots were close. There are certainly more attractive properties around at around the same price but the hotel was clean and well-serviced most of the time. The resort fee was something of a rip-off and should just be included in the base cost of the room as it is mandatory and nothing extra is provided.

We loved the location of the resort - super convenient to get to everything in Waikiki. We walked to the beach and a lot of shopping / restaurants. Negatives about the hotel was the pool area - the pools are tiny and there isn't much of an option for an umbrella unless you get to the pool at 8AM to claim one. The beds / pillows weren't the best but doable for our short stay. Our view of Diamond Head was INCREDIBLE. Loved watching the sun rise. Also, I appreciated the Marriott Platinum Elite perk of 25% off dining in the resort.

The Marriott is clearly a dated property however it was still a clean and comfortable stay. Great location and nice staff. The hotel was very accommodating to my minor needs. There was a horrible stench in the hall on our floor at check in-they had air blowers to dry whatever was wet. I made them aware of the stench and it was gone the next day. I hear that they are beginning a renovation soon. The hotel is directly across the street from Waikiki Beach, walking distance to the Aquarium and the Zoo. Great location for everything really (shopping, dining) We rented a jeep for a few days and parked at a nearby parking garage ($30 a night vs paying $45 to valet with the hotel). There is a Starbucks and ABC Store onsite. They provide late checkout and also have a Hospitality room for guest to shower and chill until your ride arrives. Very pleased and would stay again. K-Tower is the tower closest to the ocean with the best ocean views!

Stayed here for a girls shopping holiday - great hotel and service and location very good - just a walk over the road for a swim in the see. Handy to central Waikiki and all it offers - dk restaurant in the hotel a great meal as well/. Only thing I would like to see changed is a decent coffee maker. in the room but I would definitely stay here again

We rented a car drove to this hotel from the airport, which took about 25 minutes. There is ample on site parking, but will cost about $25 daily. Check in was fast and we had a room with a balcony and view, not sure if there are city view rooms as it appears most face the ocean. The hotel rooms are a little dated, but the rooms are clean and all of the shared spaces and amenities are also clean. We purchased a tube for $10 from the onsite ABC store and went across the street to the beach. We took limited items as we did not know what to expect, but overall the area did seem safe full of tourists. There are some homeless people around, but they do not seem to bother people. We were able to walk to various stores and restaurants within 10 minutes and there is plenty to pick from. We had the continental breakfast that does have about a 15 minute wait, it is pretty standard breakfast nothing special. We were able to store our luggage after check in, we lounged by the beach and pool and enjoyed the views, then used an on site shower, before driving back to the airport.

From check in to check out, everything was perfect! $40 a day to park is a little hard to swallow. On top of the resort fee too. Especially since one day there was no parking available, we had to drive up and down the garage til we could follow someone to their car. Property is beautiful and in the center of everywhere where you would want to go. Great stay, we will be back!

My daughter & I stayed for a week at the Marriott and thought it was very good. The location while not n the middle of the busy main strip was fine for us and I believe quieter staying at this end. There were lots of restaurants around and the public transport was very accessible from here. ONce you leave the hotel turn left and you will find Wolfgang Pucks Express and Jamba Juice, great for taking to the beach.We however did only eat at the hotel once and that was for breakfast as we had no choice due to everything being closed due to hurricane lane. It was expensive for what it was and not a lot of egg options ie: poached eggs and if there was that option it was not advertised.The hotel facilities were good with a lovely hot spa and starbucks and ABC shops on site.The room was very clean and roomy and I have to say very comfortable beds, room service was great and I would stay here again even with the daily resort fee which again is quite high but I believe normal for Hawaii.

We had an excellent stay here this week. Jatin and Carina at the front desk provided exceptional service. The resort is in an excellent, less congested location with lots of amenities, good food and a beautiful pool bar overlooking the ocean. Would stay here again.

My third time at the Waikiki Marriot and it is a solid choice in Waikiki. To be fair, it’s best to compare to other hotels in the same price range. The normal rate range in 2018 is $200 to $300/ night. For this price you get a great location across the street from the beach, a big pool, big rooms (albeit old), an outdoor lounge with live music. Another comparable hotel in this category is the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani (see my reviews). As a Platinum Marriot/ Starwood member, they still give the breakfast/ dinner coupons. The buffets are decent (think Las Vegas buffet) and who can complain when it’s free ? If you want a Five Star hotel then you need to go elsewhere and pay at least double the price. I would stay at the Marriot Waikiki again.

We stayed in this hotel in August 2018, just before and through the alert for Hurricane Lane. Hurricane Lane never really arrived, but most stores and restaurants closed anyway. Marriott kept a couple of restaurants open throughout so there were options for eating, though they were expensive and didn't have much in the way of vegan options. Our best meal was at Sansei, the sushi place. The room was nice, with a good bed, reasonable bathroom amenities, and a balcony just big enough to have breakfast on (for two), with a great view of the ocean. I fed some pigeons on the balcony the first day and the clever little buggers were waiting for me, looking through the glass door, every morning thereafter. There was coffee service in the room which I appreciated, and I bought soymilk at the Starbucks (in the lobby) to put in my coffee. The hotel is close to the beach, shops, restaurants, and more. A friend of mine has a house on Diamondhead and we chose to stay at the Marriott instead because of its proximity to the Waikiki beaches with their surf lessons, board rentals, and general bustle of happy activity. The beaches here are sooooo good for kids. Plenty of white sand, lifeguards, activities, and just enough surf to bounce around in on a tube, or if you want to paddle out (and have some surfing skills), you could catch some epic waves. Pro tip: The ABC stores that are on every block (there are TWO in this hotel complex!!) have nice inflatable tubes for $3.99 (we bought several), snorkel and mask sets for $19.99, and you can find boogie boards in the area starting at $19.99 so you don't need to travel with any of that. There is also a Mexican Grill a block away that is a LOT like Chipotle, which is a nice option for kids. The parking, however, is going to cost you -- $40 for self park, $45 for valet. Ouch. Suggestion for the management: More vegan options on the menus would be appreciated. And yeah, I know that I can ask the waiter or chef to accomodate us, but why not just put something right there, on the menu? It's better that way. :)

First of all, this property is across the street from the sand. Not on the beach, but if you can handle crossing the street first, you’ll be fine. Beach has a nice man that will set up chairs and umbrella for a few bucks. Our room was nice and clean, bed comfortable. Hotel is noisy, you hear the people above and next to your room. We did have a balcony which had two chairs you can sit on. A few issues that could be a concern: Elevators, not enough of them, there will be a wait and it will be crowded.Marriot rewards, don’t expect anything. They charge a resort fee, 37 dollars a day.Perks of free internet are included in that. Further, they have tried to explain the breakfast situation, bottom line, you will get some coupons for breakfast to offset the resort fee, but you should get that anyways (platinum) so it’s just a 37 dollar fee to them. I don’t know what the other Waikiki marriot’s do, so only speaking about this hotel.Previous trips I have stayed at the Royal Hawaiian and the Sheraton next door to it, but for the difference in price, the marriot is a good alternative. Just don’t expect to be “wowed”

For years Marriotts around the world have been delivering good service and quality facilities but like a number of other top accomodation spots on Waikiki, this resort hotel in Waikiki has lost its shine. Despite pre paying the accomodation for the night before we arrived and telling them we would not be in until 7am the next morning, on arrival there was no room for us as they were fully booked the night before! They finally got a room ready two hours later but we had to move later in the day. We were provided with coupons for free breakfast only to be told when we went to use them that they were invalid. Some staff were helpful and attentive but others, particularly young ones on the front desk and serving poolside were bordering on rude and certainly made you feel like an inconvenience. Having sat poolside over a period of days and making the trip to the bar to get food and drinks, it was a delight the final day to have a hospitality staff member appear and take a drink order. This delight was shattered when she returned later and asked if we would be wanting any other drinks as it was a "really long walk" for her. We decided to go out for lunch instead of staying at the hotel where we were such an inconvenience. Having been many times to this hotel, we won't be back.

My family and I were displaced for one night because of Hurricane Lane (was supposed to drive up to a house rental on the North Shore but decided to stay in Waikiki in case driving got bad) and were able to get rooms at the last minute at this hotel. We didn't have high expectations to be honest and thought that it would be fine for just one night. I have to say they exceeded our expectation in every way. 1) check-in: smooth, friendly and efficient - Kenneth at the front desk was amazing. He took the time to check us into our two rooms, accommodated our request of connecting rooms, explained Elite benefits (which I didn't know I was a part of), and told us that the hotel will be going through renovations and that we should come back when it's complete (we sure will!) He was just super friendly and kind. He really set the tone for the rest of our experience at the hotel.2) luggage and parking: again, employees were just above and beyond friendly, always ready to help and our luggage person came up to our room with bottles of cold water and explained the activities in the area. Really helpful and friendly.3) location of the hotel - smack in the middle of everything. We were at the Modern the night before and really the locations of the two hotels don't compare in terms of convenience. This hotel is truly in the middle of everything you want to be close to.4) rooms - I've read everywhere that the rooms were tired and outdated so I didn't expect much, but the rooms were actually quiet good - spacious, clean, huge TVs. I can't wait to come back after the renovations but the rooms were really fine the way they were. Our rooms faced the ocean and the diamond head and it was great.5) the lobby - huge, beautiful, calm and great for people watching. Overall the hotel was great beyond my expectations and we would be sure to return. One more thing - this is not a big deal but the hotel waived their resort fees for the hurricane, which I thought was a very classy gesture. I only wish we could have stayed longer and tried their restaurants. Thank you everyone at Marriott!
user_name:
Kathryn C
Forest Hills, United States

review_body: The accommodation met all my needs. Great housekeeping, beautiful landscape, unbelievable location. Many stores and places to eat. Location was a key reason why we decided to book this resort, right across the street from the beach. This was however very expensive, but it was worth it. We walked to many stores and restaurants and we didn’t need to rent a car, everything was in walking distance.

We arrived here on Friday, August 17, 2018 after traveling for 15 hours and our room was amazing to say the least. The hotel was spotless, very well kept and the location is prime for shopping, site seeing and so much more. The only complaint I have is that we needed a roll away bed, which was requested when the hotel was booked and again when we arrived. It was not in our room, we ended up calling 3X to get the bed and it never showed up, finally we just went downstairs and pretty much let the frustration show that the bed had not arrived after requesting it for the last 3 hours. The bed finally arrived...this is the reason the hotel did not get a 5 star rating from me.

If you know what you're getting the Waikiki Beach Marriott is fine, but the management makes no effort to improve the services despite several previous identified issues:1) No turndown service, even in suites2) Resort fee charges for amenities that Marriott requires to be complimentary for elite status guests (telephone calls, internet access, breakfast -- even at resorts in the new post-August 18 program)3) Hotel DOES NOT tell elite status guests they get a discount on food and beverage at the pool bar by showing their "elite" guests. To offer this discount but not tell guests nor print it on the welcome letter or resort fee card is dishonest. When I complained the manager on duty apologized but didn't adjust my bill. He did send a "complimentary" bottle of wine to my room, which was a nice gesture until I looked the brand up and found out it was a $6-9 bottle of sparking wine. Really? That's an insult.4) The breakfast buffet is better at Denny's. The buffet in the hotel's breakfast restaurant is vastly inferior to other hotels and restaurants in Waikiki. No fresh berries. The yogurt is cheap. The juice isn't even fresh squeezed. I fully understand that this is a busy property with lots of elite status guests every night. I also understand that many of Hawaii's hotels are older. But there's no excuse for gaming the system to avoid giving the elite status benefits eligible guests are entitled to receive. There's also no excuse to being dishonest about the discount on food-and-beverage guests are supposed to receive. Come on, Marriott Waikiki Beach, you can do better.

Great location on Waikiki beach. Large very nice facility. Fine friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast buffet.Very convenient to shopping. Clean comfortable large rooms. stay on upper floor for great views. I was on 29th floor)Food and drinks at pool side bar great. Nice entertainment in evenings. Will Return.

We are Platinum Lifetime Elite so always choose Marriott. We enjoy the superb Marriott staff and almost always wonderful properties. This hotel is rather tired and needs a renovation. The lobby area was up to date, and the public areas (pools, restaurants, fitness room and spa) all seemed to be, as well. A courtyard area in the front tower was underwhelming...could be improved with some tropical plantings and remove the cosmetic shop whose sales people constantly harass everyone who walks by to try their products. Most annoying!Our room was spacious, but the furniture was dated and not very attractively arranged. The bed was Marriott comfortable so as good as we expected. The bathroom was extremely small, but clean and well maintained. The hotel’s general appearance on the floors, however, was worn and old. We heard from the housekeeping staff (our room attendant was outstanding) that the hotel is scheduled for a badly needed makeover this Fall. We did love the location which we think has the best view of Waikiki beach. We were upgraded to the front tower in a high floor looking straight up the beach. It could not have been better with rainbows in the morning sunrise to breathtaking sunsets. We would choose this hotel again for the location and the usual great Marriott service.

I stayed here with my girlfriend for four nights and we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is just a short walk to the beach and about a 10 minute walk to all the action on Waikiki. This was actually quite pleasant for us as it gave us some extra walking all day and we avoided feeling like we were staying in too crowded an area. As far as amenities and facilities the hotel is fine but nothing too special. Showers and bathrooms are of an older style. I feel the price value is lacking but it is probably just a hawaii thing. I live in Asia where 200 a night will get you a very nice five star hotel so it’s a bit of a shocker to spend 300 a night for a four / three star hotel experience. But based on my research this seems to be going rate. Daily parking is expensive at 40 dollars a day. Literally right across the street is the banyan Waikiki garage where you can pay 30 dollars a day or 110 for a weekly pass, a much better option and the one we took. Entrance on kuhio road, must pay in cash. Or if you are really looking to reduce parking expenses you can park at Honolulu zoo which is a 5 to 10 minute walk away and 1 dollar an hour...but I am unsure if you can park there at night.

Located on central Wakiki beach, the hotel gives you direct access to the Pacific Ocean. Rooms are spacious, as I got two rooms for my family and plenty space for little ones to run around. Get the ocean view room with a balcony, it's worth it. The overall hotel can use a bit more renovation, but overall is comfortable, clean, and supported by the world class Marriott staff. Recommended!

Beautiful views from our hotel room. Now we did have to upgrade for this view, but well worth it since we're here during the incoming hurricane. Waves are incredible and lots of surfers you can watch. Bring your binoculars.Waikiki beach has pretty much everything a normal beach town does, except it's very metropolitan, city like, very busy. The hotel is an older place, but kept up pretty well. Two separate pools, although small. A large lounge area with many chairs available. Rooms are large, we have a king bed with plenty of move around space. Typical bathroom with one sink and shower, closet, safe, small fridge and a single serve coffee pot. Diamond Head is literally a 5 min drive or 15 min walk away. Resort fees are at all hotels it seems and a $40 fee to park your car daily. We rent a car as needed or call a Lyft driver.

We spent a wonderful couple of nights at this hotel, but I was fairly unhappy that as a Gold Elite member the resort fee no longer includes breakfast, even though I was told and made my decision to stay at this property based on this being inclusive when I booked my stay. The front office staff was fairly unimpressed with my being a Gold Elite member, and not very sympathetic to the fact that I was told this prior to my stay. Or that this policy had just been implemented that week.What would have been more fair in implementing this policy was to stagger implementing it based on when the reservation was made, so that those given this information when they booked were not slighted/cheated when they then booked into their vacation destination.For the money, I would in future prefer to stay at the Courtyard Marriott just up the street. More intimate property, almost as convenient to the beach, and you don't have that nonsense resort fee if you don't intend to use any of the resorts amenities.

Beautiful hotel with spacious rooms and very good facilities, including two outdoor pools and a gym. Located just across the road from Waikiki Beach, yet allowing the comfort of having a dip and then relaxing under umbrellas, with plenty of beach chairs next to the pools. Walking distance from major shopping centres. My only (rather minor) negative comment will be about quality of buffet breakfast: no fresh vegetables, literally zero, or any other, healthier, options in the middle of summer. Lots of breads and pastries though. After our first breakfast we opted for having our breakfasts elsewhere.

Customer service and the friendliness of the staff were both 2 thumbs up. Rooms were comfortable and clean, nothing fancy. Resort fee is ridiculous. $35 for towels? Pool is small and Hawaii hotels do not have the resort grounds like the Caribbean. Really nice that they provide hospitality bathrooms to allow you to shower if you have a later flight. Starbucks, ABC liquor store and Enterprise Rental Car on property. Concierge was very patient and set up some great activities for us. Lobby area is open air and really gets you in the Hawaii mood.

Stayed here for an end of summer bash and also celebrate my mother in laws birthday. I had stayed in the HHV for years to take advantage of my Hilton gold status for room upgrades. Now that I’m Marriott gold, thought I’d try this resort out. Great location. They offered me a oceanfront room on the side opposite diamondhead, and I paid up to upgrade to a junior suite, which is not a suite, but a corner room with a sofa (not a pullout but big enough for a child to sleep in). A bit pricey, but the views were amazing and the lanai spacious enough for us to eat on it.There are two pools but one is a bit small for my liking. Parking garage is very convenient to access and the laundry is on the way to the garage. The property layout is very convenient, as opposed to the HHV, which is huge and sprawled out, which is good and bad.Overall the Marriott gets a big thumbs up.

We came to hotel earlier and our check in progress was quick and great experience. Unfortunately, I didn´t memorized the name of kind and friendly lady at the front desk since I wanted to personally thank her for feeling very special and welcome. She offered us an upgrade to Kealohilani Tower for very reasonable price. Of course, we took it and we had a fantastic sea view and unforgettable sunsets from 23rd floor. Our room was great, spacious and clean and well airconditioned. We were happy with traditionally comfortable Marriott’s beds for a great sleep and a big tv screen where we enjoyed watching free rented movies. Breakfasts were ok and staff in restaurant was efficient and friendly. Hotel has a great pool. It is not very big for such a huge hotel but it was nice. It was just from time to time overcrowded by smaller children and at that times it would be better to have separate pool for adults. Nevertheless, we enjoyed late afternoons after long hot days in the pool. We also arranged a trip to Pearl Harbor with hotel´s concierge. Lady was very kind and professional and we quickly arranged everything. This was the best trip and great experience on Oahu, although the walk along Waikiki beach was great as well. I hope someday we will return to this beautiful island and this hotel even it is on the other side of the world from our country:) 

Landed in Honolulu airport. Smooth travel experience although baggage claim was crowded—too many flights on a single belt. Had a great Uber driver, Vincent, who has lived on Oahu since 1976 and provided good tips on island attractions and making the most of our stay. Very entertaining and helpful. Open lobby is beautiful with plenty of comfortable areas. Check in went smoothly—we requested two rooms close to one another and we were upgraded to oceanfront from Premium Ocean View in the Kealohilani Tower. To keep the rooms together, we went with two double beds for our room. To get a king with the upgrade would have out us on another floor. The view from floor 18 of Waikiki Beach was amazing looking south towards sunset each evening. The rooms were spacious with a good size balcony with curved railing, including a table, two chairs and a chaise lounge. Despite facing the beach and Kalakaua Ave, the room was surprisingly quiet at night. Rooms were well kept with a 40+ flat screen, old style mini fridge and a good amount of room. Bathroom was an older style with a separate sink are, then a door to the toilet and a combined shower tub. This would have benefitted from a fan and separate light switches, as one switch controlled both bathroom area lights, which spilled a lot of light into the darkened room for an early riser like me. Bed and pillows were good. Outside of the room, elevators were fast with little waiting. Convenient number of shops downstairs and two Starbucks, both of which opened at 4:30am. Ate lunch on at Moana Terrace on pool deck—good service and the food and drinks were good but not great. Waitress reminded me of 25% discount as a Platinum member, which doesn’t always happen. Great view of Kuhio Beach as we ate. Pool was nice and well kept. Didn’t have any problem finding available lounge chairs. Fitness center also is great—open 24 hours with plenty of options and space.Visited Pearl Harbor through a tour agency which also included an hour tour of Honolulu. I booked it primarily for conveneience but was glad we had the tour of the city. Plenty of interesting history and a much larger place than I realized when booking. Speaking of which, the hotel location is great for walking to restaurants and shopping within 5-10 minutes…almost unlimited options for both.. One note—we didn’t realize how busy Honolulu is.. As my son said, this is like South Beach. Not a criticism but it’s not the sedate ‘chill’ of Maui…different experience and we’re happy we visited.. No shortage of options, both upscale and reasonable.Also hiked Diamond Head although it’s really a walk with a few steep steps and narrow passages.. Used Uber both ways…very convenient.Overall, the hotel has a beautiful lobby, great fitness center, and a very convenient location. The rooms were well kept but still look somewhat dated, especially the bathrooms. We enjoyed our stay!

Found the hotel to be in a good location and lovely views. In our opinion it is starting to look a little tired, especially for 4.5 star rating. We stayed here before and after our cruise. There was a hiccup with our accommodation they had us booked for 8 days and we said no, 2 days before our cruise and 1 after the cruise. All our paper work said that. They did not seem willing to assist us and told us we had to rectify as there was a third party involved. We went down to reception the next day and there was a lovely women who fixed everything up in 15 minutes, said it was the cruise line had made the mistake. So don't know why it couldn't of happened the day before which caused us a little bit of stress, having to ring Australia and try and work it out. Reminder to people that there is a resort tax on top of our normal rate. Apparently this is a norm.

This property is located right across the street from the infamous Waikiki. Although could use a little refreshing overall clean. The resort fee is a little much and pool drink service was a little lacking. This would be a perfect place to stay if it was closer to the main part of Waikiki shopping and restaurants. If you like it a little quieter you’ll be ok if you like to be closer to shopping etc.... this isn’t the place for you. There is an ABC Store and Starbucks on the premises. The buffet was great and the staff was very pleasant.

We were keen to find Accommodation that was right on the beach and the Marriott was a great fit. Just across the road from the beach, and close to lots of Restaurants, we weren't disappointed with the location. Unfortunately, the room was a little disappointing as we had no hot water for the last 3 days and a lack of exhaust fan in the bathroom, was at times, if you get my drift, quite unnerving ! The staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly at the Poolside Bar.

I've just returned from a 7 night/8 day (Aug. 1-8) stay at this resort. The resort was really nice, but my reason for giving it 4 stars is that although the room was clean, it along with the bathrooms needs to be renovated. The bathrooms are very small and you don't have much privacy because the sink is separate from the bathroom. Also when I booked my room, I specifically asked for 2 queen beds with an ocean view. When we checked in, my friend and I were given a room with a king bed. That issue was resolved with double queen beds with a view of Diamond Head and the ocean. My other issue was the $353 incidental charge that had to be paid upfront. I was aware of the $37 daily resort fee, but not the incidental charge. Thankfully I will get that back within 10 business days. Overall, I had a wonderful stay and everyone from housekeeping to the concierge staff were very friendly and helpful with whatever issues/questions we had. The hotel is in a good location, although it was further from what I consider the main part of Waikiki (international market, Ala Moana mall and surrounding areas). I wouldn't mind staying here again, but I hope that the rooms and bathrooms will be renovated soon.

Wow!!! This place is great!! Staff is so friendly, clean rooms, Starbucks, gift shops in same building!! Two pools, Beach close to hotel!! Coming back next year!!! The only thing that bummed me out was I stayed to watch my grandsons by the pool while my daughter went to the bar to buy us a Pina Colada. :( She was told she can only purchase one alcoholic drink at a time :/

We stayed for 8 nights. The locations was great for us. When making the reservation, I was a little concerned that the hotel is across the street from the beach instead of on the beach, but this was no problem when we were there. The hotel was actually closer to the beach than my room in another Waikiki hotel where the property was on the beach.The room in the hotel was a little bigger than average, but the bathroom was small. Concierge (Amanda) was very helpful. Staff was friendly. Convenient shops on the ground floor of the hotel. The shops included 2 ABC Stores, Aquatic activity stores, Starbucks, Italian restaurant, gift shop, cosmetics, clothing, etc.The location is toward the east end of Waikiki.
