This was good for us because it helped us avoid a lot of the Waikiki traffic that you would have to deal with if you were in the middle of it.

I recently stayed here for about a week, we paid a little extra hoping we would get the best room possible . I was surprised that they don't even offer a water bottle in a room or any fruit. For the price that we paid I would think a bottle of water would not be a big deal. I had to keep going down to the ABC store to get water. I noticed that they had hydration stations but they were too small to fit my water tumbler. In addition, they charge an extra fee daily. I think next time I will check out the Westin , I went there for a spa day and was beyond impressed.

It is an urban location but right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Two pools and hot tubs plus bar area at the third floor level are awesome. Walking the adjacent streets offers a wide variety of restaurants and shopping galore. It is a beautiful hotel facility with great friendly staff and a terrific location.

We are Platinum Elite Members, and we stayed here for a few days in July 2018. It is clean, staff is friendly, and hotel is very cute! Good restaurants (Kuhio Beach Grill's breakfast buffet was the best), and very close to Waikiki Beach. The hotel itself has restaurants and shops if you wanted to buy souvenirs and such. We were also on the "Strip" so we walked to the restaurants and shops. We had a Junior Suite, which was ocean view, and it was lovely. I will definitely be staying here again in the future!

We landed in Honolulu 6am. Fair enough we cannot get into our rooms until 3pm. That's ok. I thought I could hang out all day but it got to 1:30pm and jet lag was well truly setting in. I was a walking zombie. So I thought I would if see if the room was ready. I was dog tired, eyes hanging out of my head. Room not ready. I could wait no longer. Did I tell you I had become one of the walking dead? Anyway, I asked to be put in another room,so I was relegated to a floor below. Ok, I relented. Then drama struck! I didn't have the bag ticket! The bag area would not give me the bags. I said that's ok. Just send up to my room. No. She said. We don't do that. Too many people. Guests take their own bags. Oh no. I lost it. Yes sorry. I did. My bad. I went back to reservation desk. Girl who helped me change the room was gone. Saw me coming? Maybe? The poor replacement copped it instead. I said just put me back to the original room and I will sleep here in the lobby instead, I said. Quite loudly. She asked if I had ID. I did luckily. My passport was in a friends room. Luckily I had my aussie drivers licence. She's gestured to another. 'Get this lady some water!!' I just have looked like I was about to have a heart attack. She organized my bags. I went to my room. Bags appeared 45 mins later. I passed out. So the lesson is. Either organise a room to be ready when you arrive, prior to departure or be prepared to suffer. Also, don't lose the bags ticket. They do not take the bags to your room. That was my initial introduction to this hotel. Sadly it was not good

This Marriott did not disappoint. The stay started out with an incredible view of Diamond Head and the beach. The open and airy design is clean and relaxing. The excellent available food options mean you don’t have to wander far, if you don’t want to. The breakfast buffet is varied and, the Prime Rib dinner buffet was wonderful. We went to the on-premise steakhouse and had a great meal as well. The service was good at all locations with the Moana Terrace bar the lone exception. There are two pools, one a long way from the bar. No service is provided there, so I attempted a walk up. No less than three bar tenders asked “where are you sitting?” rather tersely. We struggled to get them to hear my order and they failed on half. Drinks are not cheap and rude, poor service is unacceptable. Definitely skip that bar unless you score one of the few seats in the service area!

Our biggest concern was the size of the pool and pool area, so we were pleasantly surprised to find two separate pools and a huge deck of chairs. Over our two weeks we never failed to find 4 deck chairs together and we often got up late.Location is excellent, right by the beach and never more than a 15 minute walk from anything food, shopping or drink wise. We would stay again for sure.Hotel Management - How about making one of the pools an adults only area? Like by the bar!

This was a special Grandparent trip for us. Planned a year ahead. Grandparents and 3 grandsons. Location was perfect for our activities. We were usually down to the Kuhio Beach Grill for breakfast by 5:30 because we would be picked up by 6;30 for snorkeling, biking, hiking tours. The boys took advantage of the great breakfast. We also enjoyed the Moana Terrace at pool area for food and the view. Our room was good in the front tower. It was so convenient to walk out to the pier and beach. Lovely walk to all activity on beach. Duke's. Surfing lessons. Outrigger Canoe ride. I would stay at this Marriott again, Thank you from a long time Marriott Rewards member.

Our last visit here was in 2001 and this place is still a perfect place to stay. My husband and I plus 3 kids enjoyed our stay here. The view was beautiful. Staff was friendly and quick to help in any way they could. Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I love how Waikiki Beach is only steps away. The water refill station proved to be very useful. Their open entry sitting area near the checkin area is a great place to eat food purchased from anywhere. We definitely would stay here again.

We had a wonderful visit to Waikiki. The pool was a bit of a disappointment. Very small and crowded but it seemed like most hotels around us were similar. Amanda in concierge was AWESOME. She even helped with our next trip to Maui! She was just beyond helpful. The brunch was wonderful. Would definitely stay again.

I am a platinum member with Marriott and I’m a little bit frustrated that none of the Marriotts in Hawaii actually have a club or lounge area for elite members. I’ve been to this hotel before and the service was much better than last time for instance I asked for them ExpressCheck out with the bill under my door and emailed to me as well so I wouldn’t have to check out in the morning. Woke up in the morning no bill so I had to go down and take the time to check out after requesting an express checkout. The room was OK I had a nice view breakfast was mediocre nice place if you plan on staying for for five days and take your time and relax and walk around great location highly recommend the location.

Expensive but a very good location, close to the beach (across the street) and many restaurants. You can even walk to the zoo. The room had a good sized balcony with a water/island view. There was a busy Starbucks in the lobby and an ABC convenience store. We appreciated the self-serve water-bottle refill station in the lobby.

I took my 2 kids (11, 8) solo, on a quick 4-day, a weekend getaway in late January to get some rest & relaxation before I started a new job. We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott because of the convenient location on the Waikiki strip (where it's at the end of the strip/near the zoo area, so it's a little less hectic) and it's also right across the street from the beach. The woman at the front desk was friendly and upgraded us to a partial-view room w/a small balcony, which the kids & I appreciated. The kids really enjoyed the free NetFlix access too.

Stayed here for two nites following our cruise. Pricey, but everything is on Waikiki beach. Staff was friendly and helpful. REstaurants on site were all very good. The breakfast buffet and the prime rib buffet at night were excellent. Convenient to the beach and also the harsh reality that shows up at every nook and cranny with the homeless that hang out down there. Makes you feel kind of guilty to be staying at such a nice place when people are living on the street corner across the way from you. Room was spacious and had great views of the beach. Nice place to stay for a couple of days to experience Waikiki
user_name:
Jeff R
Noblesville, Indiana, United States

review_body: We recently stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for 10 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel is fantastic with everything you need for a very comfortable stay. Restaurants, bars, pools, very comfortable rooms with great views and very friendly and helpful staff. We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel and definitely planning on coming back.

My family and I stayed here one night since we headed on a cruise the next day. When we arrived the desk informed us that our room had already been booked so they went ahead and put us into an ocean view room (we were not complaining). The view was nice especially in the morning sipping our coffee. All personnel were cordial and helpful. I will say that our shower floor did look a little dingy, not sure what that was, if either mold or just darkening to tile grout. By all appearances the hotel is well placed with plenty to do and a beautiful beach area.

Awesome location near the end of the Waikiki strip. Walking distance from everything, or a short Uber if you want to go down the strip further. Service was great. Across the street from the beach. Rooms were specious and clean. Had a balcony and loved it. Lobby is very open and modern, lots of seating. Was told they are about to do a huge upgrade to the sleeping rooms. Nice to hear they like to keep it fresh. We had a nice experience. I would recommend.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for a week as part of our honeymoon (week two was at the Waikoloa Beach Marriott). Overall, our stay/experience was very good. We were on the 23rd floor in the K tower and had a great view of the ocean. Plenty of food and shopping options and having the ABC Stores on sight was awesome. However, after staying at the Waikoloa Marriott, the following differences were noticed by us...---Not being recognized as an elite member at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. My wife uses the Marriott Visa card religiously. Although we were not looking for recognition, the Waikoloa Marriott treated us with a higher status as a result of having the card and staying with them. If anything, having a voucher for the breakfast buffet per day would have been nice considering the high cost of it.---Being recognized as a honeymooner. Waikoloa Marriott went out of their way to help us celebrate our honeymoon (i.e., Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries; complimentary drink at their restaurant). Nothing in Waikiki. I know the Waikiki Beach Marriott is much bigger, but the service from the front desk is very impersonal to say the least.We would most like return for a future stay; however, being treated as a person in Waikoloa compared to just being another number/guest Waikiki was a glaring difference that struck us

The views from Ocean Front rooms/suites have great views of the ocean. The hotel is located immediately across the beach thus making for a great location. However, the interior of the suite I was in was pretty dated and worn, but the view made it ok.

The Marriott Resort and Spa is located across the street from Waikiki beach. You can be on the beach in a matter of minutes. We stayed in two rooms, Ask for an ocean side room. We had an excellent view of Diamondhead and the beach. The pools are a little small, but they work for a kid that wants to splash around. Night music happens almost every night and the bar prices are steep, but that is average for the area. There are two abc stores in the building and 1 starbucks. I would recommend this hotel based upon the great location, great views and convenient amenities. One negative is that, breakfast is not included, you get some tickets, but not enough for your entire stay. If you go to the buffett for breakfast it is $35 bucks and it's standard fare comparable to what you could find at a residence inn.

My fiance and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott in October 2017. The hotel is beautiful and staff are very helpful and courteous. It is a large property, so we requested to be in the front building closest to the beach. We arrived early to check-in, and were informed the room we were scheduled to be in was not ready, but a different room was. We were upgraded free of charge to the second room which ended up having a view of both Diamond Head and the beach. I will say this hotel is on the very end of Waikiki Beach, so if you want something a little closer to all of the nice shops to stay somewhere else, but the hotel was much more quiet since it is on the end. Everything was still in walking distance. We would stay at this hotel again.

Overall we liked the hotel. The location was perfect within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Our hotel had 2 abc shops and a Starbucks within the hotel which made it very convenient. Rooms nice and food was good in restaurants. The major disappointment was the pool. Very small and overcrowded. Their was a second pool with no view that also got crowded. They also had chairs that were covered but those were reserved for rental. (Did not see them used all week) Ridiculous to try to charge for seats when you are over crowded as it is. There were lots of additional seats way far from the pool so you couldn’t even watch your children if you used them.

If you're looking for a hotel in the heart of Waikiki, this is it. From a convenience standpoint, it's perfect. You can walk to the beach, lots of great restaurants and shopping. It was also nice because a lot of tour companies provide pickup at Waikiki hotels and that was a huge plus for us. We only rented a car for 2 days while there. No issues with getting an Uber or Lyft! The hotel itself is nice. The lobby is lovely and you'll find Starbucks as well as ABC and gift shops. The pool area is great, restaurants are decent (although a bit on the pricey side...but welcome to Hawaii!) and the staff was very pleasant to work with. The rooms themselves are a bit dated and I guess I expected more for a premium room...but they were clean and served their purpose well. The patio overlooking Diamond Head and the beach was relaxing and spacious. The bathroom area is small, but we managed! Overall, a great location for our family and we enjoyed our time there!

Having traveled to several resorts around the country and world, the Marriott Resort in Waikiki is not even in my top 10.Customer service at the on-site restaurants and front desk were non-existent! As a Platinum Elite member I expected at least some form of quality customer service. Besides the lack of quality customer my room seemed to be outdated compared to what I’m normally accustomed to, even compared to non-resort style hotels. During my stay I paid the military rate, unfortunately as a loyal Marriott Rewards member I felt that may have been too much...

Nice hotel with great facilities. The gym was one of the best we have seen in a hotel. The pool area was very nice and the service was good too. I would agree with other guests comments about the $37 per room, per night charge as being excessive. I’m still peeved that neither our travel agent nor the hotel highlighted this charge or the services that were included in the fee. The charges to use a lounge at the pool were also excessive. Buffet was average and we only went once.

We had a good time. The hustle and bustle of Waikiki is real. Not leisurely beach life. One thing that was very special about our trip was Kylie Sueoka, the Concierge who helped us at the Marriott. She was kind helpful and very knowledgeable. I love it when I come across special people!

We used points for 7 nights at this hotel. We are a family of 5 and were given a large room with 2 beds and partial ocean view. The room was clean and comfortable and the balcony was large enough for a lounger and 2 chairs. The rollaways were about $40 per night so we just made a bed out of pillows for the kids to sleep on. Trang at the front desk was awesome and gave us 7 extra breakfast buffet coupons (we originally received 7- 1 per night), so in total we had 14, so we would use 3 at a time and then pay $15 for 2 kids buffet. The breakfast buffet is great with lots of the typical breakfast choices plus the omelet bar. They will also give you a to go cup for your coffee. The pools are nice as is the hot tub. It was easy to get towels to use for day trips or the beach. The location is great too as it’s close to lots of sights and restaurants. We ate at the pool restaurant one night and the food was great and they had live entertainment which is always nice. The parking is $40 per day which is steep, but not many alternatives. There are lots of shops within the Marriott for souvenirs and the ABC store for convenience items and wine/beer/liquor :) I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a hotel on Waikiki beach!

Located across the street from Kuhio Beach, this huge hotel was wonderful. I must admit, I was put off by the size of the place. Once I got used to the size, I got down the business of getting to know where everything was. Although the hotel is huge, it was really easy to get around. Knowing where we were at all times actually shrank the hotel's size down to manageable. A few things to remember: ABC store is street level facing Waikiki beach. The pools are on the 3rd floor (I think). We mainly swam in the pool next to the "cafe." It was great. We swam at night as were entertained by live music. The gym is nicely appointed. It's got lots of machines, treadmills, and the such. Free weights were a bit lacking, but the other machines more than made up for it. It's located next to the other pool (tower 2). We stayed in an ocean view room and weren't disappointed. The room itself was pretty good size. The bathroom was a little small, but I liked the fact that the toilet/shower was separated from the bathroom sink.

We have been visiting Waikiki every year for the past 15 years. We stay each year at this wonderful hotel right across from the famed Waikiki Beach!! We have never been disappointed in the service or location. Wonderful staff at the front desk (Special kudos to Jatin), amazing bell staff (special mention of Russell!!), and the LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION cannot beat it. Kuhio Beach grill has fantastic breakfast (kudos to Chuck who makes super wonderful omelettes). Music by the pool is wonderful too. LOVE this place,

To be fair, the primary function of a beach resort hotel is it beach - this, the Waikiki Beach Marriott has. With that said, rooms have a nice view but are otherwise ordinary; mine (1728) appeared in need of a little maintenance love and was on the noisy side of loud from neighboring properties. Albeit the hotel's breakfast buffet was excellent, the $37.00 per day activity fee is excessive, especially for elite members of Marriott Rewards and those traveling for business not pleasure.

Room was great. Balcony with great view, ,A/C, comfy bed, clean, service great, pools awesome. Beach there was not as crowed as further down which was great The food at the restaurants were really good. Concierges were very helpful as it was my first time there.

Waikiki beach Marriott Resort and spa is a perfect hotel away from the downtown craziness. Cross the street to a nice walled off lagoon, fun ocean waves right next to it. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, overall very clean and tidy. Pool tips: it can get hot - cabana rentals are very affordable and a nice to have to get some shade. Lower pool can get busy with little ones, upper pool is more mellow. ABC market located onsite, along with other shopping. Rental cars onsite also (Enterprise) - Tip: rent from the concierge / hotel staff and not direct through Enterprise. Will save you a lot of $$$ and you get the same service. Overall great place to stay

We stayed at the Marriott Waikiki Beach resort and spa from June 22 to July 2 and this is by far the best resort in Waikiki. This Resort has great service and an all you can eat breakfast buffet that is truly wonderful. One of their chef's Chucky makes the best omelets I have ever eaten. Their employees are so kind and always their to help you for plan your itineraries. Great Customer Service. Located on Kalakaua Avenue and walking distance to shopping and dining out. I highly recommend Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa.

There is really nothing outstanding about the Waikiki Beach Marriott other than its location right on Waikiki Beach. At check in, there was a snafu with our tour agency reserved rooms. The room reservations were in the system, but there was a question about for how many nights. The front dest lady waiting on us was plain rude. Although we had two rooms reserved as a party (same reservation number), she demanded that one us get out of line and "wait our turn" it seems she couldn't possibly check in both parties at the same time. I went next to another desk person who looked at the reservation and after a few minutes of searching, decided I needed to go back to the other lady since the reservation number was the same as my other family member. Mercifully, the original grouchy lady decided she could arrange for both our check ins.The rooms were clean enough but obviously in need of refurbishing. The carpeting and furniture upholstery were somewhat worn. The bathroom is from an earlier era where it seemed acceptable for the commode to block use of half of the double sink (not to mention not having the commode in it's own private cubicle separate from the sink and shower like we'd just had at our Maui Resort). There were several restaurant and shopping options on the property, which was convenient. The pool area offered good seating with a wonderful ocean view. In summary, this is not a bad, yet not a particularly great property. It's main claim in drawing tourists and justifying its price is totally in its location, not, in my opinion in its service or rooms.

We stayed here only one night the night before our cruise left. Check in was quick. The room we had was a partial ocean view. It had a great balcony which we could look left and see mountains (hills) and right to Waikiki beach. The street traffic was loud while on balcony, but we had a quiet room. The room and bathroom seem old and need updating although everything was clean. The bell staff was great. Held our luggage for us the next morning while we did some sightseeing and gave us free waters.

Looking forward to staying my night at the Marriott. Great brand and hotel chain. After staying at a different hotel in my first leg of the trip and how great there customer service was, I was truly looking forward to to my stay here. It all started when I arrived at the hotel for check in. I was rudely greeted by the front desk. I told her it was my first time here but she didn’t seem to care. I was handed my room key, a pack of papers and that was it. I asked where the elevators were and was told over there! Note: there are at least two towers and they don’t connect so later in the night I was lost trying to get back to my room.When I got my room I reviewed my papers. First thing I looked at was a list of the resort activities included. The first thing on the list was supposed to be a chocolate at check in. Wasn’t given this when I checked in and not surprised by the way I was treated. It is ridiculous that YOU pay a resort fee and the hotel doesn’t honor it. No one would know what the resort fee includes prior to checking in to the hotel. You get a DVD card to rent DVDs but wasn’t told about that feature or even where to go to use it. The room had an odd odor in it. Not sure if it was a floral perfume or mold or a combination of both. The bath room is very dated. Also if you are tall you can’t see your head in the mirror. Th bed sheet had a stain on the right side of the bed. DO NoT stay here as there are other hotels out there that are cleaner and the staff is much more friendlier. Also, you will see the Marriott manger of this hotel respond with a canned verbiage response saying they will look into these areas or that they are redoing the rooms in October 2018 just like the other people who give poor reviews.

This hotel was absolutely brilliant right from the start. We landed from Melbourne @6am and got to the hotel around 7.30am although too early to check in the hotel were so helpful at looking after our luggage and allowing us access to a bathroom to shower and change as well as full access to all hotel facilities . They sped up our room and upgraded us so we were in our room before midday. Rooms were very clean and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. We loved the pools and gym and of course the location just made it so easy to get to all the shops. A pink trolley stop is right behind the hotel so again making it easy to jump and off to go to Ala Moana. The stop for the Roberts bus tours is right outside also which we used for Waikele outlets. An ABC and Starbucks are in the reception area. Our only complaint would possibly be the pool side service which although very friendly was very very slow.Overall we loved this hotel and will definately be booking again on our next trip.

Here's a list of things I enjoyed about this hotel: polite and fast valet, quick room cleaning, friendly staff, great in-hotel restaurants, multiple Starbucks and ABC stores on the first level, 5 minute walk from downtown Waikiki Beach shopping, quiet evenings, Netflix available on TV, and amazing view of the ocean.

This hotel is showing its age, but most of Waikiki is and I was pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and tidiness of the room. Probably the best feature is the balconies which are great to sit on, and that the rooms are relatively spacious.We reserved the highest room category, ocean front in the front tower. When we arrived I was somewhat disappointed as although it was technically an oceanfront room in the sense that it looked out to the ocean without obstruction, there were literally 50-100 rooms that were closer to the ocean and had a better view of Waikiki. I somewhat doubt that these rooms were all occupied by people who had shelled out for the top room category. In advance of staying at the hotel, I contacted them on three separate occasions for as high a floor as possible but will still only allocated level 13 out of 25 floors. Admittedly I am only a silver member but still I had somewhat higher hopes..I’m not sure what you have to do to get the higher floors.I did receive one breakfast voucher daily as an elite member, which went beyond the strict entitlement I had not being gold or above and so I was grateful for that. The hotel was at 97% capacity which meant that one day we had to wait approximately 20 minutes for a table.Probably the biggest issue we had was noise. We could easily hear conversations coming from the next room, through the interconnecting door, and the noise from their TV when it was turned on. There was also a lot of noise coming up from the pool, which does not close until 11pm. Finally, the water pipes are very loud whenever the rooms above or next door use water. Interestingly, the kids staying in the interconnecting room to outs had their family staying in another room down the hall without an interconnecting door.. with a bit of planning the hotel could have given us a quieter room that didn’t interconnect and the family could have been together. I really like Marriott and this hotel is an OK option for expensive Waikiki, particularly in terms of its location and the surrounding amenities. But definitely moderate your expectations, and don’t expect luxury or a peaceful stay.

A great holiday for our family of 8. Suburb location across the road from the beach, towels provided by the Resort was a bonus. We discovered the pool bar was the best place to eat in Waikiki, the staff friendly and helpful and spotlessly clean, spacious rooms with lovely toiletries. Our request for our rooms to be close to each other was organised and ready on arrival and it was a nice surprise to have been given a connecting room as part of that request. We had a problem with our toilet which was fixed immediately. Only issue was giving the Resort our credit card details to hold for any expenses to our room and after staff advising there would be no charge made to our card, discovering that a large amount had in fact been charged. We had a package that didn’t include the Resort fee so if we were able to get the same package again would definitely make a special trip to stay at this resort. Overall had such a great time we would return!

Just had 8 glorious days at this resort Cannot give enough praise to ALL the staff who were so happy and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Resort was clean and the room 1722 was spacious and view Spectacular WILL BE BACK

I was here for several months on business which was perfectly adequate for my stay. The staff was helpful (if understaffed) - the location was convenient (on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki, so easy to access the rest of Waikiki without feeling trapped in it) and overall it was a very pleasant business trip. It was however, not without frustrations. I would caveat this by saying that were I to stay for vacation in Oahu, Waikiki would be my LAST choice. Waikiki is dense, touristy, and crowded and many of my frustrations were the result of those disadvantages.--Firstly, the elevators. There's not enough elevators for the number of floors the hotel has, and if one or more is out of order, you can easily finding yourself waiting 10-15 minutes to catch a lift to or from your room. This is by no means a deal-breaker for me, I'm not averse to walking upwards of 15 flights of stairs, however every time my patience ran out with the elevators and I tried to take the stairs, I found them both hard to find and harder to navigate. Several times I would find myself in the employees only areas of the hotel, wandering into housekeeping or human resources just trying to find my way out to a level that takes me to the ground floor. Not all stairs connect to a guest exit - and none of the stairwells are well posted with signs. The stairs are also terribly dirty - on one occasion I could have sworn there was human feces in them by the odor. PRO TIP: If the elevators are being terribly slow, take the lobby stairs up to the third floor - they show up much faster to the third floor than they do to the lobby.--Secondly, the concierge. The concierges were all extremely helpful, HOWEVER, they're terribly understaffed for such a high volume hotel. They have a couple desks (not always staffed), but almost all the time they're occupied, and usually with a line. It can be really time-consuming to be able to speak with someone about booking excursions or getting general help. More concierge staff would go a LONG way.--The pool. There are two pools, both are rather small and both can get very crowded (especially the one hot tub at night). Most of the pool space consists of row after row of pool chairs stacked together like sardines, without any shade. There are cabanas, which are usually empty, but you have to pay for these. The pool area is definitely underwhelming.--Parking. Self parking sucks. It takes a while to drive up the cramped, tight parking lot and often you get to the top to discover it's full (there's a sign out front that says when it's full, but isn't always reliable) Valet if you can. The valets are great and it's super convenient.Overall, if you HAVE to stay in Waikiki you can do worse. I would stay there again for business, though if I was on vacation, I'd opt for something a bit nicer outside of Waikiki.

We stayed at the Marriott for two nights after a 10 hour flight from the east coast. It’s a nice place to decompress after travel and become acclimated to the time change. Very typical luxury Marriott with an extremely attentive staff. The pool restaurant is reasonably priced. There is a Starbucks on the property that opens at 4:30 AM, which is convenient if you’re from the east coast and waking up early due to the six hour time change. The hotel pool is very small, but the deck is nice. Get an oceanfront room if you can. We were able to rent a car on the property for our trip to the North Shore. The hotel breakfast is very expensive and not worth the price. Lovely staff though. Avoid room service. A turkey club sandwich and can of Pepsi in desperation after our long travel day sat us back $40+. Stay here only if you must stay in Waikiki. There are nicer beaches on the North Shore.

We really enjoyed our stay here. The lady that helped us book tours was extremely helpful. The beach access is great.....just a walk across the street. There is a protected area behind a wall for those who do not want the big waves. The restaurant by the pool was excellent. The pool is a little lame for such a big hotel, but everything else was great

This is a very nice resort across from the beach, minutes away from everything there is to do in Waikiki. As a local we know all of the hotels and what provides the best value and perks. Beautiful ocean view from our room was the first thing that struck us. Great pool bar/snack shop with great food and drinks overlooking the beach. Everything is well maintained and staff is terrific.This is an older hotel so rooms are not as spacious as newer hotels but still nice size. Pool likewise does not have all the bells and whistles but you are coming for the ocean. I highly recommend this hotel for locals and tourists.Breakfast buffet is awesome

Stayed 6 nights for business trip. Very comfortable stay at great location. Upgraded room with ocean view because of Platinum Premier Elite membership. I will definitely come back to this hotel for vacation with family next time.

We had a lovely time at this hotel. Our view and balcony looked over the zoo and beach, it was a short walk to shops and restaurants and had all the usual ammenities. The staff were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. We wished we had stayed longer here.

The first day that my family and I stayed here, we experienced AC problems and the second we complained to the front desk, they sent someone to repair it. Dave, the repairman, was very nice and fixed the unit within the hour. Now we're getting cool AC to compliment the ocean view.

To you it may seem nothing special. No, it was near sunset, but I don't remember anything about that, only the dining room's superb service, and the excellence of the food and beverages.Well worth a second visit now that we are kamaaina here in Oahu (uncertain of the spelling of that word, though I am a teacher of English!)

We really enjoyed our 5 nights here recently. No doubt the showing it’s age but most of the ones on the main beach are in the same boat. Loved the hotels shared lobby spaces which have been done recently. We had an Ocean View on the 17th floor which was incredible in regards to views. A little bit of noise being up so high because there is live music in the pool area below at nights. All the staff we encountered were friendly, the pool bar side staff could be more attentive, numerous upselling opportunities for drinks here if they were more onto it. The only negative was that there was a shop on the ground floor called Truffoire who try to lure you in for a facial and when declined are very rude, we ended up having to avoid them for the next few days which wasn’t ideal.

We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott as part our our cruise stay. We arrived very very early in the morning and had to wait to check in to our room. The wait was well worth it! We were upgraded to a very large room which consisted of a king and two queen beds, two bathrooms and two balconies. It was fantastic to have so much space for our family of four (with two adult children). The pools looked very inviting but we didn't have enough time for a swim as the shops and sights were calling us!It is in a great location, close to the International Market Place and many restaurants. It also has a Starbucks on site and two ABC stores. Overall it was a great stay and we would recommend the Waikiki Beach Marriott.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott is a very nice resort. It has some unreal views from it. The room was nice and the ocean view was fantastic! The pool bar is great and the sunsets from there are amazing! A must try is the surf board pizza, goes great with a Blue Ocean cocktail! The location is great, beach is across the street and there are many things to do very close to the resort.

We loved our room in the tower with a beach view. Balcony was nice to have. The room was spacious. The staff were so attentive--it was nice to have the rollaway already set up upon arrival. It was nice to have plenty of towels and toiletries already in the room upon arrival. The water and macadamia nuts on arrival were a nice touch (for Elite members)Alexis was our waitress at breakfast and she was so kind and helpful!The location near Diamond Head and the zoo was really convenient.

We were upgraded on our 3 night stay to a Junior Suite which was huge! The view was of the mountains & had 2 balconies. Overall the hotel was comfortable but showing it's age. I understand a remodel/refurbish is coming next year. Breakfast buffet excellent & efficient as was the Friday Seafood buffet. Location very central to Waikiki.

Our room had balcony view of ocean...which also picked up a lot of sounds from outside, as the bands playing. Rooms were great. Food very expensive. Breakfast bar $35. It was good but not that good. Daily resort fee is $37....too much if you dont use any of it.

This is a conflicting hotel. First, usually for elite members, the Marriott brand of hotels gives two free breakfasts per day (complimentary). Just because they add the word “resort” to it, that’s the excuse to renegotiate and only give one free breakfast per day. This definitely puts a bad taste in my mouth as a loyal Marriott elite member. They also charge for kids under 12 for breakfast. The Sheridan hotels don’t.Second, they charge you $40/night for self parking, or $45/night for valet (really $50/night with expected tips). This is robbery. They also charge a $37/day resort fee which is just an excuse to charge you more for services you would get for free at any other Marriott. Third, hotel is not on the beach. You have to cross the street to get to the beach.Fourth, customer service is good. Phoebe at the elite desk did her utmost and got us a corner room with a view of the city, ocean and two queen beds. She rocks.Fifth, rooms are a bit run down. Bathroom shower is a disgusting mold fest. Hard to open sliding door patio. Nobody mans the swimming pool for handing out towels. The toilet is exceptionally loud when flushed. The air conditioning doesn’t do a great job at keeping room cool. Also people smoke in these rooms (even though they are considered non smoking rooms). So if you have a connecting door, the other rooms smoke will seep in your room.Overall - I’m considering moving my loyalty from Marriott to Hilton because of this experience.

We arrived after a stay in Vegas. When we arrived we were greeted with welcoming arms a bottle of champagne. They new it was a special trip for us so they upgraded us from a city view to a beach view. The next day we received another bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The staff were friendly, helpful and the location we couldn’t complain. See the magic show for a bit of fun. Shop at the outlets for specials relax and enjoy. We did the aloha circle tour full day north shore. The highlight was the swimming with turtles but that’s about it all day stopping at little places for things was boring and I would have rathered spent more time with them swimming. It was ok next time I would try to avoid doing that. I couldn’t find a decent coffee in Hawaii yes even Star bucks is not the best. I don’t drink percolated coffee unfortunately that’s all there really is and espresso is not really espresso. All in all we had an amazing time at the Marriott would definitely come back!

We ended our honeymoon with several days at this beautiful hotel. We arrived very early and were not able to check in, so they let us store our bags and gave us a hospitality card so we could change our clothes in the locker room and enjoy the pool while we waited. Once we got to the room, we found a spotless place with a killer view! We loved the pool, met some lovely new friends and had a wonderful time. We had one service related issue, reported it to management and Amber bent over backwards to make sure she made it right! And she did! Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

I had the pleasure of staying at this property last month, 4 days prior to cruise/tour where I was booked with cruise line for 3 nights. Upon check in we were given the upgraded room for the whole time. They could have had us move after the first 4 nights. Much appreciated!!!!!

We stayed at the Marriott for one night prior to our cruise. Check in was a breeze, the room was very clean, the view wonderful and the shopping area in the lobby was a great place for my husband to buy a few more Hawaiian themed shirts at a really nice price. The ABC stores in Honolulu are great. One poor point was the elevators, very slow. The pool area was fabulous, comfy chairs and a bar nearby for a yummy Hawaiian beer. I would stay here again.

Stayed here on our first trip to Hawaii - we saved for this for months and pre paid everything in advance - only to be told upon checking in that we had to pay $37 activity fee each per day - for Zumba lessons etc - which we didnt want nor participate in!This is a money making fee taking advantage of people that basically have to pay this or they will not be put in their room.We got a very grumpy Chinese lady in her 50s or 60s and has no customer service whatsoever.We arrived early as got off our flight and said we could wait in the grounds of the hotel until check in at 3.0 pm our bags were put in storage.I went to sleep in the sun outside on one of the couches only to be woken up by one of the staff walking around and was told I COULD NOT SLEEP there......Their rules are ridiculous - we had just spent $100 on a lunch in their outside cafe and was waiting to check in after lunch.Apart from this shocking check in and extra cost - the room was lovely and the view of the beach also very lovely.The room was quiet.

We stayed a weekend after our cruise to spend more time in Oahu. The staff is super helpful. The beach is across the street. We had an ocean view room and enjoyed sitting in the balcony in the evening to relax and enjoy the view. The breakfast buffet (Kuhio Grill) had a great selection and opens early for those who want to eat and go on early tours/activities.
user_name:
RJSLee
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently spent 7 nights at the Marriott Resort and Spa with my family. We had joining rooms with an ocean view. I picked the hotel based on my research for hotels in the Waikiki Beach area and it presented the best value for the accomodations we needed. The rooms were adequate in size and contained plenty of space to place clothes and a large safe to store valuables. The rooms have two double beds and not queens if that is an issue.If all you need the hotel for is sleeping and location then you shouldn't be disappointed. However, if you need to park a car and want to eat breakfast there then you will pay higher fees. Valet parking was $45/day and the breakfast was about $35. There are places to stay nearby that offer lower prices per night but are a little further out from the beach. Since we were traveling with young children we wanted something closer to the beach.I recommend it as a good place to stay while in Honolulu.

Previously reviewed this hotel, solely based on the customer service I received by Lynn prior to our visit. The service provided by Lynn made us look forward to our trip and we hoped the hotel would match her service. It did. We had booked an ocean view room and were lucky to receive an upgrade based on my husband's Marriott Reward membership and, I think, the goodwill of Lynn:-) Great view! Yes, I agree with some of the other posts - the hotel is very 80'ish, but clean. And yes, there is a bit of noise from the road but also from the ocean, so focus on the noise from the waves:-) We would definitely book a room here again, but would make sure to get a high floor ocean front. And glad we booked in this end of Waikiki Beach, since much less busy than the other end.

We recently stayed here for 5 nights and had a great time. We were upgraded from our city view to an ocean view upon our arrival. The staff at the front desk were friendly and eager to be helpful. The hotel is a bit older but the room was comfortable and our view was amazing. It is located in the heart of Waikiki, and also a shrt walk from the Zoo and Aquarium. My only complaint was that there are so many empty store fronts in the lobby 2nd floor. It would have been nice to have some casual dinning options in the main lobby or even a bar.

The room was spacious with small lanai (balcony) on the 32nd floor with a small ocean view and a lot of south side view. The facilities were excellent, there are 2 restaurants in the hotel area - one Thai that we tried and was very good, although it was no cheap, and one is Steakhouse that we did not check. Nice pools and Jacuzzi, there is also baby pool. The location is splendid - 1 minute from Waikiki beachfront and 1 minute away from many other good restaurants and shopping centers. The staff was lovely and very helpful and greeted us with a big smile.

This is a very nice hotel. I wouldn't give it 5 stars but might give it 4.5. It's in a great location on Kalakaua Ave. across the street from beaches, a block from the zoo, within a 10 minute walk to the aquarium, and away from but a 5 minute walk to the main shopping areas.The pools are small (!!!) but it is across the street from wonderful beaches and not in the (most) crowded areas of Waikiki.

More of a hotel than a resort feel, but great access to the beach, restaurants, parks, and shoreline views of Diamondhead. I didn't use the pool or other facilities, and this was a business trip, but enjoyed being across from the beach for morning runs up Diamondhead road and west along the beach. Parking valet was prompt with the car waiting in the morning, and two Starbucks made for a convenient breakfast options. Bar/lounge offered nice evening views of Waikiki beach.
user_name:
Jon A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: booked a week at the hotel for $326.00 a night, pretty pricy but had to book last minute. I arrive to check in and am told I have to pay a mandatory $37.00 activity fee and $40.00 for parking, much more than I expected to pay, but I was there, not much else to do. Went to the room thinking it was gonna be a big vast suite... Nope, small one bedroom with spring mattresses, low water pressure, internet was spotty at best, and a tv remote that didn't work... What was the money paying for? I called another hotel closer to base that had a cancellation and military rate, free WiFi, and they waived my parking fee. When I went to the desk to check out of my overpriced room, I told them I was unsatisfied and they charged me another $75.00 for early checkout. No such thing as, "if your not satisfied, get your money back" at marriotts I guess. Very dissatisfied, and will think twice about staying at another marriott.
user_name:
Bryan S
Bangor, Washington, United States

review_body: Stayed here for five nights in a patrial ocean view room. Overall, the hotel was nice, but really didn't have the feel of a resort. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful. We were notified by the Mariott app that our room was readyat 1pm, the early check in was much appreciated. Our room had a beautiful view and the room had all of the basics that you would expect. What I was most disappointed with was the pools areas. Both of the pools were small and mostly family oriented with lots of children. I didn't find it a very relaxing atmosphere. Additionally, the hotel doesn't have chairs on the beach as other hotels I Waiki. The ABC Store was very convenient and a big plus. Also,the both the Italian and Japanese restraunts were wonderful.

Stayed here 2 weeks on a work trip. This hotel is nicely located right on Kalakaua Ave (that is the beach front street in Waikiki). So it's convenient to go to the beach. Kalakaua also has many shops, so it's bustling at night with tourists walking around.Room is pretty good. Nice, clean, and sufficiently modern, though not the most luxurious Marriott I've been in. My platinum status was acknowledged and I was upgraded to a suite. My last time staying there, the hotel charged $25/day resort fee, though that included a Mai Tai a day (which I think was not very good), and a buffet breakfast for 2.There's no concierge lounge, so it's a bummer for elite members. There are plenty of dining options right below and around the hotel though.There's also a $35/day fee for parking in the garage, but I think all hotels on the strip charge for parking anyway.Overall, it meets the usual Marriott's standards, so recommended.

Stayed one night before our cruise. Check in was easy. Room key didn't work but security came and remedied that. The room was large with a balcony over looking the beach. Room was very clean and bed and pillows where very comfy. The concierge was the best. We had an itinerary change for our cruise due to the volcano activity on the Big Island. They helped us cancel reservations in Maui for our Luau and found us another one to go to. They also helped us book a Pearl Harbor tour even though it was late afternoon. I recommend this place highly.

I'll begin by saying that the "hotel" aspects of this property were of the normal standards of the Marriott brand: Prompt, respectful, courteous service with a clean an well cared for comfortable room.Where the property dropped the ball was in three areas, one of which she can't do too much about and the other two she could if she wanted to. First off, the beach across the street is awful. It has a seawall that traps water allowing marginal exchange with the ocean. You can almost smell the urine. For people who like to swim in the ocean, a hotel further west on the strip would be better.The next is in the area of the parking rate and the involuntary extortion--oops, I meant the hotel resort fee. Come on, Marriott, just add it to the room price and don't make your loyal customers feel like victims. Likewise the parking: give us Silver and Gold members some kind of a break!I could live with the above problems and, in fact, we have; this was our third stay at this property in the last 10 years. But it pains me to say this. On our next visit we will stay at either the Hilton or Trump hotels for one reason only: that is because of the harassment my wife (especially) and I got every single time we walked across the first floor to the elevators from the girls selling some sort of beauty products at a shop called Truffior. Even if we walked as far as possible across the floor they would literally holler at us trying to hawk their wares. One evening, after stopping at the ABC store, two of these land sharks tag-teamed my wife, in spite of her asking them to leave her alone, and bringing her almost to tears! I would expect this sort of thing to be tolerated at a third world carpet bizarre, not on the main floor of a Marriott Hotel.

As a Marriott Gold Member for the last 11 years I know when I am being lied too by the hotel staff. In this case I had checked in the day before using the Marriott mobile app. I requested an early check-in but we called ahead and talk to the front desk anyways to make sure that our room would be available. The lady on the phone said that our room would be available at 12 p.m. just check in at the mobile check-in Elite line at the resort.We are local in Hawaii and we're aware of some of the problems with parking in Waikiki. When we checked in at the mobile check-in line hour customer service agent Phoebe looks surprised that we were there. Normally your keys are already available when you check in through the mobile app she looked around and could not find them and then told us that our room was not ready. The lady on the phone told us that there were plenty of rooms available in the hotel because they were not full and that an upgrade would also be available to our room of which we were available. Phoebe said that there would not be an upgrade possible because the hotel was 97% full. You told that we would be alerted on our mobile app when our room became available. Because we were local we did not bring luggage so leaving our luggage with the concierge. We did however have some tote bags that would not have been secure. We proceeded to the pool where we were going to wait after changing and they're restrooms. After about two and a half hours we once again called the front desk on the phone. The lady on the phone this time said that our rooms had always been available since 12 and that the reason they did not give us a room was because they were really busy? We asked Phoebe why we were not alerted on the mobile app. regarding our room being ready and she said" oh I forgot".I have stayed at Marriott properties all over the globe but this is the first time I have felt like the property was not being truthful about my reservation.That being said we had no issues with our room or the property. Rooms had mini-fridge, smart TV'S and I think the waters/ice stations at the pool areas were a nice touch. As others have mentioned be mindful of the additional resort fees and parking which can add up fast but pretty much standard now for resorts and city centers.For the management of the Waikiki Resort please, the standed answer about doing better is not necessary. You should have done better the first time.

Staff were amazing and hotel really nice. If you expect new and polished then you don't know hawaii. Furniture in room is a little dated but this is normal for hawaii. Pool was great. View was great. Highly recommended for families and younger travellers.

Nice hotel close to the beach.Friendly staff. Upgraded when we arrived.For $99 you can stay in room on last day until you go to airport.Food good but expensive.Two pools and gym.Overall I would recommend.

Decent hotel, good location, poor customer service, terrible parking arrangements and overall overpriced. That pretty much somes it up. If you're in the mood to splurge I suggest looking somewhere else.

Waiting in hotel now just been advised it’s going to cost us another $38 American a day for wifi and Zumba which I don’t even want - waiting to check in after a long early flight from nz fell asleep in their couch and got told I can’t sleep on couch omg I can see now why their poor rating in paradise

We traveled here in early May 2018 for our honeymoon and stayed here before we moved over to Maui for the second week. In retrospect, this may not be the best hotel for honeymooners as it's not a "luxury" resort, but it fit our needs just fine. It's well situated on Waikiki Beach that you can walk to most everything you need. It's on the east side of the beach so you're not directly in the center of the action, but that helps with noise as night. Room service was wonderful and the view of Diamond Head was awesome! Definitely get a DH facing room--pretty special to wake up to everyday. We are Marriott Elite members and therefore took advantage of free breakfast every morning. Thank you to Marian (I think I spelled that right!) who was the friendliest and most attentive table attendant (it's a buffet). Her smile lights up a room and I hope she knows how nice it is to start off a morning with such a sweet person! Overall, wonderful hotel and has everything you can need. Valet was SUPER quick and helped with directions as well!

We stayed for a full week for our honeymoon. The moment we checked in, the employee immediately upgraded us to a room with a full ocean view facing the west, for perfect sunset views. It was absolutely beautiful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but of course we didn't spend much time there. The lobby was beautiful and open and airy, and there was perfect access to great restaurants and shopping, and of course, the beautiful beach. I would love to go back!

We stayed here this past weekend and had a great time. Our room was upgraded and we had an amazing view. The staff was super friendly from the moment we checked in until we checked out. The rooms and facilities were clean and welcoming. The pool is small but there are two different pools to choose from. There are restrooms located all around the property. There are great options for dining around the hotel. We got all our kids mcd's which was a couple blocks away. We also got take out from sansei and sat poolside and ate our food. We listened to live music and had a couple cocktails at the pool bar. The sunset view is amazing too. For the size of the hotel nothing was too crowded and the elevators were fast. I think the only downside to the hotel is that the beds were not very comfortable but we didn't go on a staycay to sleep our time away. We lounged on the balcony and soaked up the sun, walked around waikiki and swam. The location of the property is great. In my opinion it has the best access to waikiki without being in the center of the chaos. It is walking distance to stores, shopping and restaurants but also has 2 of our favorite restaurants on property, d.K. Steakhouse and Sansei.

We stayed here for 4 nights, at the end of our vacation. The hotel is on the main drag in Waikiki so it’s very convenient to restaurants, the beach, the zoo, and plenty of shopping.We were actually able to check in early, which was a plus. They also let us check out late on our final day. They have parking, but if you valet park it’s $45 a day, $43 if you use their parking. It’s worth using valet as they can pull your car up as many times as you need. The valet staff was very professional.Since we are Marriott Rewards Members we could use the special checkin line, which saved time. The have a concierge in both of the lobbies, to help with booking tours. They were very helpful. In fact the lady we used was the best of our whole trip! Very helpful in making our choices.The rooms are OK. Older Marriott furniture, small bathroom, bathtub had scars/scratches on the tub. Not enough room on vanity for toiletries. They have a small fridge, and a huge HD TV. If you need bigger beds ask for queens, we had smaller than queen and it was a little tight. You can get king beds too.Most rooms have balcony’s, with great views of the ocean if you request it; but it’s not free, they charge you $45 a night for ocean view. A bit steep.You can print airline boarding passes, Swim in one of their two pools, go to Starbucks, right in the hotel. The breakfast buffet is really overpriced. We got two days free due to Marriott points, but I would not spend $28 a piece for this buffet. Not when there are so many close options (McDonalds, Starbucks).Location is key and this place has it! I’d probably stay here again, but see if I could get a room without having to pay the up charge for ocean view. I don’t think any of the rooms have been remodeled in a while, based on the couple of rooms we saw.If you have young kids don’t let them on the balcony by themselves. The railing is lower and kind of flimsy. Newer hotels have to raise the railing, and make it more secure.

Do we really need a review of a Marriott property? Always exceeds expectations, always great service. It’s my husbands hotel of choice, his go to whenever traveling for work or leisure. This property is directly across from the beach and has my favorite- an ABC store (2 actually) - with inside the property access. You can’t go wrong here... ever!

We arrived early and Reception was very helpful. Of our two rooms, fortunately one was ready and we also requested an upgrade for the second room which came at a reasonable uplift - however we were very happy. We were travelling with our teenage daughters. Both rooms were in the front Tower, the girls looking south and ours north. I highly recommend north views, our views up Waikiki beach were a daily delight. The rooms are very spacious; cleaned immaculately with the usual creature comforts and typically smaller bathrooms as you would expect with the age of the property. We stayed for 4 nights and would have stayed longer. The pool is functional and all you need when you have the beach on your doorstep. We loved being across the road from the 'protected' pool. Restaurant food and service was very good for both of the Restaurants we tried. Having additional amenities on the ground floor was also very advantageous.The balcony is awesome...but does struggle with wi-fi access from the room.

Stopped in here while in Waikiki to check it out since I’m a Marriott Rewards member. It’s a BEAUTIFUL hotel. Based on my experience with valet, I’ll pass. They were rude, nasty, and unhelpful. Just very off-putting as a first impression. Decision made.

Extremely rude service after they made a mistake over our booking. Had to wait in the lobby for an hour and the rooms weren’t what we booked and paid for. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Waikiki. Hope the review saves others from what we went through.

Great spacious, clean rooms with good ocean view. Delicious buffet breakfast served in the Kuhio Grill restaurant (2nd fl). But the dinners are not so good, check it out carefully - the BBQ night was stale. Good access to beach, and shops, restaurants. One drawback is that the car valet area can be quite congested, Only 2 lanes, and sometimes cars are parked and locked and blocks access. This area as well as the front desk could use more staffing, to keep loading and unloading moving, and speed up checkin process, waited over 20 minutes just to check in. Otherwise, a nice resort with good spa, fitness center, pool.

Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa Review. May 7-11, 2018. Room 2118 Kealohilani Premium Ocean ViewBathroom: Average, definitely signs of wear, could use some maintenance.Bed: All white linens, very comfortable. The room had a king bed, beautifully made up and A+.Room: Large, plenty of space and clean. Room key system has been updated and is better than the old system. The TV was very large and nice to watch. Very old carpeting which used to have giant ripples that were a tripping hazard. The carpet in my room had been restretched and had ripped and separated leaving a large hole in it next to the bed. Lanai: The best feature of the room. Large and has a chaise lounge which many hotels don’t have. Great place to eat and relax.Service: The maids were friendly and pleasant. Location: Good location in that it is close to the beach and less crowded than other places but a major problem with homeless people who are more than just homeless, they have mental health issues.Recommendations: Having a giant TV monitor (no remote) in the lobby area that plays FOX TV non stop is awful. To be honest they also have another monitor playing CNN. It might be a good idea to abandon political TV and go with HGTV and ESPN. You will offend fewer people. Do a better job with enforcing non-smoking policy and explain to people that it includes the lanais. I have run into smoke coming in my room on this visit and a previous one.

I had heard it was in the city and would be very noisy. I actually loved the area. Easy to walk to restaurants, shopping and the beach is right across the street. As a Marriott member I was able to get a lovely corner room which was lovely.
user_name:
maureen1927
New York City, New York

review_body: We got too Hawaii and the first day started out great till we got to the hotel(AKA a drug/hooker)resort.the room door was made steel and watch your fingers there.the room was very old and dirty we stay the night and got new hotel the next day. I was able too get a room in the Waikiki Marriott beach resort for rest of our stay.

It was a beautiful hotel with a nice staff (Tina was amazing). Some signs of wear and tear, and our Gold benefits were modified (only 1 breakfast, but still got a good floor upgrade), but the breakfast buffett was SO good. Would highly recommend!

Thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the end of April this year. We enjoyed exceptional service everywhere, and its proximity to the beach is great. Several ABC stores on and near the property mean you can buy beer and wine and whatever else at store prices, which were comparable to mainland prices, without being forced to buy at resort prices. Walking down the strip to fine restaurants, beach bars, and shopping is easy, not far at all. We decided to upgrade to beach view and were glad we did. Patios on these rooms have beautiful views. Poke and fish tacos, yum. Breakfast buffet was amazing. Housekeeping thorough and so courteous.It was fun surfing, my wife's first time, I am fairly experienced. You can rent a board everywhere. As the beginners surfing capital of the world, be careful. Hundreds of surfers, not kidding. We saw an outrigger canoe with ten or so aboard riding a wave go right over a poor surfer who didn't realize he needed to get out of the way. His head went right between the hull and the outrigger and his board bounced of the bow. Man, he could have been killed. The canoe riders couldn't have cared less, they have the right of way, and blew a conch before riding the wave. Surfer's fault. Be careful.I must acknowledge the service from Jeane and Lea at check in, Russell the bellman, Chloe the server at the hotel bar and restaurant that overlooks the beach, and Sarah at the ATC(?) store inside the hotel (Kamsahamnida!) who was great with helping pick out a flowery dress and shoes, and Ricky at Sansei. All exemplary of the level of hospitality you would expect. Mahalo!

We were very pleased with our recent stay here. The rooms were clean and the hotel was in a great location. Lani at check-in was incredibly patient and helpful as we sorted out our reservation. I also wanted to compliment house keeping who not only was very friendly and hard working, but also collected clothes I left in our room after check out and held on to them for me until I was able to pick them up.Our only negative experience was with the concierge which I DO NOT recommend going through. We tried to ask about the best way to see Pearl Harbor and inquired about the walk-in tickets. She insisted the walk-in tickets were misleading and they hardly had them and we should go through a tour which would cost us $60 a person. After swiping our credit card the total was $72 plus tax person... and of course no refunds. And when we arrived at Pearl Harbor the day of, there were still plenty of walk-in tickets available. Not only did we get swindled into doing the tour (I guess our fault), but we were lied to about the cost. Great hotel, but book activities elsewhere.

This was our first time in Hawaii and this resort was beautiful! We had a beautiful view of the ocean and were right across from the beach. Very lively area for our first stay. Right near the zoo and many other shopping malls and scenic tours.

We were on the 27th floor . Got a free upgrade from a city view to an ocean view room ! Bed was very comfortable , pillows just right for us. Not too soft . Plenty of hot water for our showers ! Room had a small frig , and coffee pot . Plenty of shops and restaurants on the first and 3rd floor. We used the washer and dryers once . 3.50 per load for wash and dry . Food is pricy . But your in Hawaii, it’s expected . Overall great stay for us!!!

I really wanted to like the hotel as I find Marriott's to be pretty consistent, but they failed to deliver for me. Location is great, right across from the beach with tons of amenities nearby. Service was friendly at check-in and the restaurant.Other than that I don't have much else positive to say. Check-in was okay, I was told I was upgraded to an oceanview room as a Platinum Member, oceanview if you stood at the edge of the balcony and peered all the way over the edge... In addition once we got to our room I found a dirty q-tip and kleenex on the floor under the sink - gross! and housekeeping didn't come until nearly 4PM.I think what's really disappointing is the high resort fee for really nothing $37/night and you don't even get bottled water or a newspaper, not did we ever receive our welcome chocolates.

I've been to Waikiki before so I knew this hotel wasn't directly on the beach. For me that wasn't an issue.However, I can understand why some might be disappointed by the location, especially when the hotel doesn't provide tote bags and towels for the beach. In reality, the Waikiki Beach Marriott is not a beach resort. It's just a big downtown hotel that happens to be across the street from the famed beach.My experienced was a big bag.Positives:1. Upgraded to a junior suite, thanks to my Marriott elite status. While the suites are advertised as oceanfront, the balconies are on the side of the building. 2. Immaculately clean. 3. New 55 inch TVs.4. Friendly and courteous staff.5. Great location for exploring the Waikiki area.Negatives:1. The hotel advertises that windows in the rooms open. None of the windows open, unless you count the sliding glass door to the balcony.2. The resort fee is expensive and includes virtually nothing that guests don't already receive for free if they have Marriott elite status. 3. There is no enhanced internet option. The internet is slow.4. No newspapers. With a daily resort fee, they could easily have a stack of newspapers on every floor or deliver one upon request.5. No evening turndown service. 6. No complimentary bottle of water in the room.7. The welcome amenity was never delivered.8. The breakfast buffet is OK, but hardly gourmet. There are no lattes or cappuccinos, no mimosas, and no smoothies. The buffet didn't have any fresh berries or even granola. You can get a better and less expensive breakfast elsewhere. All things considered, it is a reasonably priced and perfectly fine hotel if your expectations are appropriate. Don't expect a beach resort.

Our entire family rates this our favorite hotel! We have traveled quite a bit but the Marriott Waikiki always feels like home. There may be fancier resorts but this one is still our favorite and we’ve made so many great memories staying here over the years. We checked in last night for a one night stay to celebrate our daughter’s 9th birthday. The front desk staff gave her chocolates, upgraded our room to a family suite (4 beds and a huge bathroom) and had chocolate covered strawberries sent to the room later in the afternoon. Our room was made available to us immediately even though we arrived at 11am. I was so surprised and impressed! We love the pools and the dining options by the pool. The fish tacos, nachos and Coconut Crushers are our favorites there. The breakfast buffet is not to be missed! Some things I want to note: Luisa at checkin was amazing. She was so sweet and welcoming and made our little girl feel special. On a separate note, the beds in this hotel are my absolute favorite. I love the mattresses and the bedding is so comfy. Add the great location and you can’t go wrong at the Waikiki Marriott!

The Waikiki Beach Marriott offers a great location across the street from Waikiki beach. You are in the center of everything and there is a mall on the ground floor with many places to eat and stores to shop. The Marriott is a very well kept hotel with friendly staff and very nice rooms. We recommend this hotel and will stay at the Marriott again when visiting Honolulu.

We stayed here as part of land/ cruise vacation planned with Norwegian Cruise Lines of the Hawaiian Islands. Nice location across from Waikiki Beach. Nice room with view of beach. Dinner at the DK Steakhouse was excellent and located on property.

We stayed at this resort for 6 nights in early December 2017 and we liked this true Marriott style full scale hotel. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. They offered complimentary breakfast coupons for two guests, probably because I am platinum or may be they charged resort fee, They also offered me a free upgrade to ocean front view room which has amazing views of the ocean and our family enjoyed the views a lot. We enjoyed the food in the pool restaurants and the service was great. We liked the location as well however some many not like the bustling and vibrant atmosphere. Overall we liked this hotel , staff and the service. The bathrooms are little outdated but the amazing ocean views compensated it. The only issue I had was not so good experience in the concierge lounge with a particular chef at omelette station, having some attitude issues and he should be coached/counseled on how to treat customers. Unfortunately I can not put more details here in public, Had I not this issue, this hotel deserves 5 star. Overall great experience.

I am a gold member who has stayed at Marriott properties all over the world. This property is one of worst that I have stayed in. The staff are quite welcoming and while the hotel is well situated it is very dated with few amenities. I was lucky to be upgraded to a family room, but I’m surprised to learn that there is really nothing provided for the nightly $37 resort fee...other than internet which gold and plats already get without charge. I just learned that to use the computer in the business center there is a charge. I have never seen this before and feel somewhat robbed. The pool area is very dated and completely unimpressive. My room looks out onto a parking lot! There is no resort feel here at all. I just came from The Marriott Maui Ocean Resort. It is unbelievably amazing there and is definitely a resort....but no resort fee. All in all this is a decent place to stay but well below my expectations for a city hotel.

On the Diamond Head (east) end of Waikiki, a couple blocks from the heart of Waikiki, directly across the street from the beach and near the zoo and Kapiolani Park, this huge resort is comprised of 1000+ rooms in two towers. Modern lobby and typical 4 star hotel rooms. Front desk staff was cheerful and helpful. Most rooms (80% or so) offer some sort ocean view, with the tower closer to the ocean offer a wider viewing angle (room classified as ocean view, or the few room directly facing the ocean classified as premium ocean), while the mountain side tower offers a sliver of an ocean view (rooms classified as city view) and slightly smaller rooms.F&B: Kuhio Beach Grill serves buffet breakfast and dinner on level 2. Hotel breakfast vouchers are for this location. Made to order omelets by an entertaining and efficient chef. Not a huge selection, but a good mix of the standard hot foods, fruits, and pastries. At $35, would be tough to justify with the many nearby breakfast options. Despite it being a cattle call from 8AM-9AM (go early or late), staff managed the crowd with a smile. Shout out to Regina, full of aloha. Buffet dinner at $50 is a better deal, with prime rib and snow crab legs or other rotating specialty, but again, there are plenty of nearby options.On premise, but managed separately, are Sansei (Japanese fusion), DK Steakhouse, and Arancino di Mare, all high quality options where locals would go out of their way to eat at. You may even be able to room charge. Very special early bird, but requires a local ID. Late night happy hour for all.Amenities: Two quaint sized pools and a jacuzzi. Respectable gym. All on level 3.Gold: No executive lounge, gold members provide one complementary voucher per day to the Kuhio Beach Grill breakfast buffet. Upgraded room is subject to availability. My prior stay was in the mountain side tower with a limited view, but this current stay offered the ocean side tower on a high floor with a respectable ocean view.Parking: $40 self park, $45 valet. 2 block walk to the zoo parking lot @ $1/hour, overnight ok, can renew via mobile phone, or $20 for 24 hours or $10 for 4 hours at nearby Waikiki Banyan (no in-out privileges).

We had 2 rooms with nice Ocean views. The rooms were large by Honolulu standards and rather well appointed. The staff was great. But what they say about resorts is correct, you don't need them. We had a great time, but not planning a return anytime soon.

We stayed 4 nights at the Waikiki Marriott. Our room 2221 faced Waikiki beach in the Kealohilani Tower, which is definitely the better tower for views. The balcony was nice but not very private because the tower is an L shape so you see many other balconies. The room was clean but the carpet definitely needed to be replaced and it’s definately time for a decor update. But the bed was really comfortable. The bathroom vanity was small. The staff was friendly and we got 4 free buffet breakfasts. The food was great, especially the made to order omelettes and the fresh juice. Would stay here again if we return to Honolulu

I am very loyal to the Marriott brand. I came to the Marriott on business. The hotel is in a nice location , and on the beach. The people are extremely nice. The upside, good food, beautiful views, nice gym. The lobby is open air and pretty. The hotel rooms are a bit out dated and not the nicest (even though I was in a Jr. Suite - two beds and a couch?) but the bathrooms are newer. The 2 pools are very small, It's very pricey but that is just Waikiki. I'm not a huge fan of Waikiki because it's over built and tourist overload but I had a very nice experience at the hotel and the people are just so wonderful. If you are going to Waikiki, definitely a property to consider.
user_name:
edf662018
New York City, New York

review_body: Close to beach. Room very clean view from our room awesome desk staff very helpful. Nice to have laundry facilities as we were going on cruise ship. Starbucks and ABC store in lobby. We felt we were well taken care of in this hotel. Great start of our vacation to Hawaii.

Excellent location but this hotel, just like all of Waikiki, and pretty much all of Honolulu, is stuck in the 1970's. Terrible architecture. Old buildings. No color. So much refurbishment necessary I don't know where to begin.

The hotel is across the street from the beach! Our room had a great view of the beach and it was great to be able to cross the street to get to the beach. The only downsided I would say is the walls are a bit thin and you will hear your neighbors, but we where out most of the time so this was no big deal. I would stay here again!

When we checked in we was asked if we wanted to upgrade to an ocean view (for a charge of coarse). We wound up on the 23rd floor. We could see both Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. The wife really enjoyed it. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was surprised to find that there was a Japanese Desk.

We just returned from a great stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. This was not our first visit and it will not be our last. The property is lovely (pleasant open-air spaces and lovely pools) and sits in a great location to access all of the fun of Waikiki. We stayed for 11 nights in Room #1512 (we checked out on Friday, 4/20). I wasn't given a comment card or sent an e-mail for feedback so I thought that I would use TripAdvisor to share my praise.
