The woman who checked us in upon arrival (I am sorry that I cannot remember her name) could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. It was the perfect way to start our holiday. I also want to mention our lovely housekeeper, Silvia. Each time I encountered her, she was smiling and genuinely friendly. She was very accommodating of our timing and did a fantastic job keeping our room clean and tidy. I hope that you share our appreciation with her. We will absolutely be looking forward to our next visit!

Hotel is situated in a great location overlooking the ocean at Waikiki beach and along the main strip of the downtown core. Great view from our balcony overlooking the pool, Duke's restaurant patio and the ocean.

Hotel located on the Main Street in Waikiki so lots of restaurants and shops all within walking distance. Of course there’s an ABC store or two and a Starbucks or two in the hotel along with various other shops. Although it’s not directly on the beach it’s right across the street so wasn’t a long walk at all. Hotel lobby is large and well decorated and staff was very friendly from the valet, check in, restaurant staff to housekeeping. I had two rooms in the Kealohilani Tower and with my status we received upgrades on both rooms to ocean view and an ocean view suite. The regular ocean view room was very roomy, bed comfortable, but my only complaint was it a bit dated and needed an upgrade. Tub and fixtures were old and worn. Nonetheless the view from our room was perfect. One of the nights there was even a fireworks show on the beach right across the street and the view from our balcony was just perfect. The hotel pool was kinda small but there were a good amount of lounge chairs and bungalows to rent. Drink service at the pool was sparse but once you were able to flag down a waiter or waitress the drinks kept coming and the pool food was surprisingly good although service stopped too early. There was a bar close by but it’s always nicer to have someone bring you the drinks. Breakfast is not included with the resort fee although I did receive vouchers as a platinum member. Attentive service at the restaurant and all around at the hotel.

Our stay here was not what I totally expected when I booked us here last week. I bad gone back and forth between booking the Moana Surfrider and ultimately my husband's Marriott elite status won. We booked a 'ocean view room'. We checked in online via the app and got to the resort about 1pm and were told the computers were down and they did not know if any upgrades were available or if the room we actually had was available due to this computer outage. Knowing that an early check in is not always a guarantee anyway and more of an elite perk, we went down the way for lunch. It was nice to be able to leave our bags and change in the Hospitality Lounge which has showers; dressing room and even an iron. After lunch it was now after 3pm and we wanted our room. Well, the system was still down. Our room was not even close to an ocean view; it was partial, at best. Not what we booked and facing another building. The bathroom was tiny., separate is the sink area for makeup and what not and it's small too. The coffee maker had to be plugged in over here, as no plug exists under the place they have it stored. The room itself was basic. The two beds were not even queens they were doubles. I knew it was not an upgraded room , BUT, we were in Hawaii... and their system was down. Do we want to spend our time complaining? No. When my husband called to ask about the room the response was that we could move to a panoramic view tomorrow but we would have to come downstairs with all of our bags and check back into the new room. Not doing that., as it takes away from island time. Our first night was incredibly loud as the building across is a bar with live music. It goes until past 0100am. Due to my husband's status with Marriott, We were given one breakfast coupon pp p day. Usually due to my husband's status when no Club is on property the option of drink coupons; points; or breakfast is given and it's usually for two. Mind you the breakfast buffet was $35 each without a coupon. We used them in one day and there is no way I thought this buffet was worth that much.. But, yes, it was good. I guess we just don't eat that much. Would you pay $35 for Embassy Suites breakfast that's included with the room rate ? This buffet is on par with that. Good but not $35 pp good. The Moana Terrace is a great place on property for drinks and apps. Has a great view of the beach and ocean. The Sensei Sushi Restaurant is also very good. The hotel is across the street from the small beach which is public.. so with that hefty resort fee, you get no beach chairs, etc. Like some hotels down the way, ( Moana Surfrider or Royal Hawaiian;)). The pool sits back from the beach viewing and is pretty basic and nothing amazing. There did not seem to be pool service for drinks but the bar is near. You get complimentary classes like Hula or Lei making that run from 0930-1030 or yoga or zumba and some discounts on excursions that can be booked at the resort. We thought that these discounts would be applied, however, as we booked two. Nope. They were not. Ask when booking as Amanda the Concierge was great but did not apply these discounts or ask when booking and after, it's too late. There is a Starbucks and ABC on property and a Honolulu Cookie on the corner too. All in all this resort just did not excite me and for a few bucks more we could have had a true resort experience with stepping out of resort on to the sand. This hotel for having status left us under whelmed with the computer system and blah room which was not an ocean view as we booked and felt like a business hotel room. Status or not, we probably won't book here on our next stay in Hawaii.

Good locations just opposite site of the Waikiki beach very convenience also near by shopping area and if you want to go to Alamona center from there just walk across the hotel get the PINK line bus I also walk there sometimes. The gym is huge and varieties. I like the TV which big screen and you can use the internet TV login to Netflix. There are ABC store at the hotel as well. The staff really friendly and welcome I experience myself it was heavy rains and I am standing near the concierge counter they were offer an umbrella to borrow. Only one problem I face is about the noise seem like I can hear next door flushing and the door slam. However I do enjoy the stay there and will recommend to my friends.

My stay here was good overall, though not especially memorable. Perhaps I have been spoiled by some of the premier properties I've had the blessing of staying at, but this hotel missed that "something" that made it special. Still, it was a good place overall.Check-in was fine, though robotic, especially compared to the awesome people at the Marriott on Maui. I was given a room upgrade to an ocean view room on the 19th floor as a Marriott Gold member. I guess it did have a view of the ocean, through the neighboring skyscrapers. It left a lot to be desired and the ocean was pretty far away. I couldn't hear the waves crashing over the street noise down below. A room on a higher floor would have cut down on the noise, but alas that was not to be on this stay.The room featured 2 double beds, which were just okay comfort wise with just a thin sheet as a comforter. The shower was one of the adjustable handicapped shower heads, with poor water pressure. The room was merely adequate and far from special.You need to cross a busy street to get to the beach, which was disappointing. At least the (public) beach was nice with good sand. The location of the hotel is convenient to many shops and restaurants, and there are several within the hotel.I was granted complimentary breakfast (see my separate review) as a Gold member, which was appreciated. Overall, my stay here was average. It provided clean, safe accommodations, though wasn't especially personalized or luxurious.

The location is fabulous and the service was better than average. I will be posting a review on TripAdvisor based on my experience here that I did not see when going over reviews written previously. I am a Marriott Platinum Member and disappointed in our experience. First of all, the property is very dated with popcorn ceilings and four square walls similar to a Best Western. We reserved a king bed and got a room with two singles for our second honeymoon in Hawaii. The room featured connecting doors and the neighbors were up and loud until after 1AM. We were tired being wired to East Coast time so the noise wasn't welcome. The bathroom is incredibly small and when utilizing it you cannot close the door to keep the light from waking up your partner. Given $250 room charge and the $37 up charge for a resort fee, the overall value of this property is not comparable to similar, more updated Marriott properties.

We had one night here due to a cancelled flight, so the airline picked up the tab. Given that they managed to accommodate a plane-load of people at relatively short notice, they did well. However, the decor was a strange mix of modern and 1970s. The bathroom door was a sliding wooden door that didn't really close properly. Having just stayed a week at the Courtyard by Marriott Waikiki, it was easy to compare. The Courtyard's decor was much more up-to-date. The room sizes were similar, but to be fair, the bed and pillows at the Marriott were more comfortable. However, the shower and hairdryer at the Courtyard were better - at the Marriott we had a shower over the tub. While the Marriott is nice and close to Waikiki beach, it is quite a walk to shops and restaurants. The Courtyard's location is more central. The Marriott has plenty of shops inside, so maybe the idea is you would not need to leave. We had originally wished we had spent more and stayed at the Marriott, but realise now the main difference is location. Oh, and price. Choose your accommodation wisely!

Hotel has nice grand entrance, as I like. lol. Location is very good, in the heart of city life and at the same time literally on the beach. We felt very safe walking in the late evening on the street. Hotels itself clean and provide good service. Greats you with $40 self parking fee and I think $$5 for valet parking. We used self-parking option. We stayed on 34th floor with ocean view. The view is just WOW!! You can see ocean and city lights. Amazing. The balcony fits two chairs and table, enough to have morning coffee. Room was not spacious. At least it didn't feel so. We had two queen beds. Beds are comfy , pillows are comfy--> we had a good sleep. Room feels a little outdated. Tv wasn't working or not programmed. But in general it was fine. We didn't use pool . Pool is outside on the 4th floor. It has Starbucks in the lobby. Lobby has no roof, which is cool, I like that. Though if it rains you can't sit in the lobby, but still enjoy fresh air.In general It was good. we stayed just one night at this location. The best of this hotel is its location.

Great customer service at this location. The inside of the hotel has an ABC store attached right to it which is super convenient for those must need hotel room items (waters, juices, chargers...etc.). The location of the Marriott is perfectly placed right across the street from Waikiki beach. The best thing about the location is that the beach has a protective closing to prevent any large waves from coming in. It’s great to get a float from the ABC store and float around in the water. Location is everything and this hotel definitely has it. The rooms are kept very clean and tidy and everybody was very nice to us during our stay. We ate dinner at the Moana, which was great as well as breakfast at the Kuhio. Both very good places to visit. 5 stars all around.

An excellent hotel, perfectly located at the east end of Waikiki Beach. We stayed for 9 days and would definitely come back and recommend it to others. It is 4 plus stars and it's location is not a busy as those immediately adjacent to the Royal Hawaiian Hotel. Plenty of dining options all around and there are ABC stores that sell snacks, sandwiches, fruit plates, salads, drinks etc., everywhere including two on the ground floor of the hotel itself.Beware that the hotel buildings (2 towers) are sited perpendicular to the beach. So most of the rooms, all of which seem to have balconies, while called Ocean View, are located down the sides of the towers and while they do offer views of the ocean from the balconies, you have to press yourself against the window and crane your neck sideways to see the ocean. We had to upgrade to a superior room to get the full on ocean view we wanted.Beware also that many hotels in Waikiki charge a resort fee that is not likely quoted in the room price if you book through an internet site such as Expedia. The resort fee at the Marriott is $38 per day plus tax and you don't really get anything for it other than excellent WiFi.Great views of the sunset from the pool deck and good entertainment every night is provided.Honolulu is fabulous but not cheap, and the Marriott Waikiki Beach is a great place to stay.

I was in town for a work trip (before you get too jealous, it was apparently the worst humidity in a bit, and I really did have little free time). It was an okay stay and I hope what I am experiencing isn't typical, but it sounds like a systemic issue. First though, the overview:Pros: - The room I had was very comfortable and had a great view.- Free wifi with okay coverage. - Parts of the lobby have a nice relaxed feel, especially around the reception area.- Good on-site amenities and tenant shops (ABC store, Starbucks)- Food at restaurants on-property were good, service varied from good to poor (see more below).- Gym / Fitness center has a nice selection of workout equipment. - Very close to the beach (without having a private beach area)- You can easily sign into your own netflix account on the TVCons: - Resort is a misnomer - yes there are pools, but overall it has the feel more of a mid-range shopping center than a resort. Wouldn't mind except you pay an extra $37 for a mandatory resort fee. - Maid service was generally okay but missed some things like new lids for the coffee cups. - Although elevators are numerous and fast, they are small and you're likely to wait a few minutes to board, especially at peak times. - Although rooms have good AC, the elevators and the gym / fitness center lack A/C or any apparent ventilation. - While the hot tub/jacuzzi is nicely heated and decently sized it's quite uncomfortable, with little about its design that lends itself to relaxing. Not sure if it's just me but I spent most of the time having to find ways to prop myself up against the stone sides. - The parking garage is a total mess and in need of a major overhaul. While there are signs that the elevators inside the garage are being replaced and it sometimes looks like you can hope a shuttle from the 10(th?) you're more likely to need to take a concrete side stairwell, stepping through pooled water. It's probably structurally sound, but the contrast between the dank, dark concrete structure and adjoining hotel can be jarring. I won't dink it for the tight turns and difficulty finding a parking spot on the lower levels as that's somewhat expected in the area, just plan extra time to get in and out of the garage if you self-park (you can valet if you prefer).The Big Con: *Beware*: Anyone is apparently able to charge something to your hotel room simply by being choosing your room and signing for it. No ID for verification is required. This I need to explain in more of a narrative fashion. The last night of my work trip, my co-worker and I shared an appetizer and had a few drinks at the poolside bar. It was a pretty busy night so I was initially forgiving of the slow service (I'm pretty patient and the humid spell had finally turned into a nice night), but eventually we grew frustrated waiting to flag down the waitress for the check as she'd mostly disappeared from view. Once we did get the check we paid cash, not wanting to have to wait for her to have to run the credit card so we could make it to dinner in time. The next morning I awoke hoping to use the gym and received the itemized hotel statement and noticed it included a $198 charge from the same poolside bar. I was a bit perplexed how this could have happened until I asked tried to dispute the charge with the receptionist. She showed me a receipt for the charges, with a lot of Jack Daniels and hot dogs (kind of a weird combo) and the receipt listed my name and room number. But someone else had signed. Don't know if it was just dumb luck they chose my room to charge it to, if it was intentional, or if it was just a mistake. I remarked that they should really use some form of verification/identification for room charges since anyone could have done this or done it to anyone and the receptionist remarked that this seemed to be a recurring issue. I noted that although yes, my co-worker and I did have a few drinks there, and although we unfortunately had to pay in cash and lacked the receipt due to the crappy service, I could recall exactly what we ordered, where we sat, and describe our waitress. She assuaged me when she said they would remove the charges from the bill, handing me a new itemized statement that would be processed on my check out, and I thought that was the end of that....The following week I checked my credit card statement and saw the hotel had in fact charged me the $198 without sending me any sort of notification, which struck me as somewhat underhanded. I've now disputed the charge with my credit card and with the billing department at 'Big Marriott' - I'm hopeful this time the hotel will actually cancel the charges, instead investigating who (presumably a family?) did in fact place the order and perhaps more importantly enact some verification controls on room charges. Long story short: If you do stay here, be sure to check your statement.

VERY expensive for what you get: small room, small bed, small bathroom - I could barely turnaround in the shower without banging into the walls. DO NOT TAKE A ROOM BY THE MAIN STREET! PARTY AVE.The noise is incredible. I asked to be moved the same moment I opened the door and saw the closeness of the road. I was told I had a three day wait for the next available room. Really? Staff was ok, but, I had to pull teeth to get advice for local sites. I spend a lot of time on the road for business travel. Guess where I am not staying next time in HI?

Booked on a partial ocean view. The room was big enough, clean bathroom, comfy bed, and a nice view of waikiki beach. The room needs to be updated. The hotel is situated across waikiki beach and is close to everything.

This was our pre-cruise hotel for Norwegian Pride of America. This was a very nice package deal. The check-in was a little slow, but it's island time, so no worries! The staff was friendly and helpful. We were able to pay for an upgraded room facing the beach, it had a very nice view! The key card did not work, we had to have it re-programmed. Twice. Only to find out that it was the door mechanism that was out of power. That made the wife cranky. She was able to get vouchers for breakfast the next morning, which was nice! All-in-all, it took over an hour to get into the room and get settled. The room was decently sized. The beds were ok, as was the bathroom. Nothing to really write home about, standard Marriott all around. The pool area was large, plenty of chairs when we went in the evening. There are tons of small stores and restaurants within walking distance and on the lower level, which is so convenient! The beach is directly across the street as well, there is a breakwall so you don't have to worry about rip currents. It's not very deep (waist deep when we went.) Check-out was a breeze! You just leave your bags and the bellmen get them over to the boat! So easy! That was a nice thing to have, as our party of four had ten bags total. I would stay here again, especially if doing the POA cruise.

We had a beautiful view of Diamond Head and partial view of the ocean. The rooms are getting a bit outdated, but the TV screen was giant. The parking rate was ridiculous. There is a much cheaper option next door. The rooms were a bit smoky. I think people were smoking on their balconies. If you want to be in a city and close to the beach while in Hawaii, this is a convenient location.

First, and foremost: thus us a great location.Just across from the beach, and a half mike from all the major shopping.Our room had a wonderful view of Diamond Head. The room was quiet, an decently appointed.Valet parking was quick efficiency and friendly.Check in was a pain: the service agent was hard to understand. In spite of using the app to check in ( which I have used many times), she indicated it had not been used.So we sat I. The lobby for nearly 2 hours waiting on a room.I had to go back to ask about it. Found out the room was ready, and they did not contact me.I get up into the room, and the app cheerfully tells me my room is ready !Small pool and hot tub... very crowded.Having said all that... for the money, it is a solid choice.

The location is great, beautiful views and a great breakfast buffet that will break the bank. The rooms were very outdated. Our bathroom had paint peeling off the tile and soap dish, and the only way to turn on the light in the shower/toilet area was to turn on the light in the sink area which then turns the whole room bright. Not very convenient for the nighttime bathroom visits. If you are looking for a hotel at a great location, but one that will nickel and dime you all the way home, this is your hotel.

Nice hotel in great location. Some of the rooms are quite dated but the location is excellent. Very close to all Waikiki attractions and a really nice bar overlooking the beach with plenty of options for eating very close by.

This is one of the largest hotels on the island. It is relatively expensive but the location is good. Parking your car is very expensive ($45 a day with valet $40 without) Breakfast not included. Booked room with sea view but was given one where cars drove up be bedroom window on the 5th floor. Gym was well equipped and well used. Didn’t eat here and Starbucks cafe in the morning always had big lines as they were slow to serve you so I didn’t bother. WiFi was average. The room was well appointed and met my business need - safe in room was a good size for a standard laptop. Pool was nice and service by all staff was good. Overall a pleasant stay and would stay here again for business trip.

This was our second stay at the Marriott. They treated us great both trips we stayed two weeks each time. The hotel is clean and comfortable the staff is very helpful. I like that it is across the street from the beach and close to food and entertainment. I would stay here again if we go back to Waikiki

After arriving from an all night flight our room was not ready as we had been told it wouldn’t be. The woman at the front desk managed to get us a ready room for a small cost by upgrading. It was totally worth it! The hotel is quiet and comfortable although quite dated, but all the amenities were there. Breakfast wasn’t included, but the stay did include a free night before going aboard the Pride of America cruise ship. In all, it was an OK hotel.

We stayed three nights at this hotel. It was a great location and a nice enough hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The customer service was excellent from the front desk to the restaurants. The location was perfect for walking to the beach and the surrounding area. The restaurants in the hotel are great as well. The beds were comfortable and the room was pretty quiet. If we're ever in the area again we would stay there again.

Loved this hotel and location! I was disappointed when I first arrived thinking it was beachfront when it actually is across the street from the beach BUT it ended up being perfect. The ocean view from our balcony was amazing. Beach was truly across the street and felt like it was beachfront. Location near restaurants and shopping was perfect! Sushi restaurant in hotel was amazing and they offer 1/2 price sushi Monday nights until 6pm. People started lining up at 4pm to get this deal because it sells out early but they take your name in line so you can return at 5:30 when they open to claim your spot and the deal. Pools are nothing spectacular but sufficient with no slides for the kids. Concierge arranged our tours and car rental for the week. Will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

I am a Marriott Gold member and I LOVE staying with the hotel chain. This hotel, with the exception of the lobby, is NO Marriott. I am here currently and they put me in a horrible room. I have friends here who are NOT gold (not even Marriott members) and were upgraded to better rooms. Knowing this, I requested and upgrade and was denied. I hear nothing but sirens and jackhammers from the street below. The pool noise/screaming from the other hotel across the way comes right in too. Its laughable.Because I was forced to book this hotel thru my daughters cheer comp company I can’t use points and I don’t qualify for the free breakfast. Maid service was so late one day and we were desperate for towels /garbage dumped we let them come in while I was trying to take a nap with my daughter. That was awkward.It is raining all day and we have a late red eye flight - they couldn’t accomplish my late checkout request but did extend it some.The rooms: absolutely below Marriott standards. Our bathroom door doesn’t shut all the way and the room is very small. Two adults and two children in my room make this thing seem even smaller. Very outdated. There Are two towers- one you see up front in the pictures and the larger one I’m staying in waaaay away from the beach. Super disappointed to pay for beachfront and have to trek my small children a couple blocks to see sand.Overall, My recommendation is to stay away. Go to another Marriott property or island- I’m sure they will treat their gold members better there.

This is a huge hotel with 30+ floors, many shops, restaurants, pool,and spa. My Spa experience was wonderful. I paid more than I am accustomed to for a massage but, it was the best massage I have ever had! All the staff were Japanese women and I was treated like royalty! It started with a wonderful shower, robe & slippers, Aveda products during the massage. I would do it again in a heartbeat! Totally worth it! Ask for Yoko, she's wonderful!

The Waikiki Beach Marriott is our favorite place to stay while in Honolulu. We have considered staying at the Royal Hawaiian or Moana Surfrider. But, for the value, you cannot beat the Marriott. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. Since I am platinum elite with Marriott, we were upgraded again after already paying for an upgrade. This was not our first stay at this location. We stayed here in 2017 around the same time. At the time, they thanked me for platinum status but that was about it. No late checkout, no additional upgrades, etc. During this visit I truly felt that they were genuinely happy to have us stay there, and were bending over backwards to do anything for us. Marianne especially went out of her way to make us feel welcome. She was very personable and seemed very eager to assist with anything we needed. If you’re ever in Waikiki, I recommend this resort. You can walk to anything in Waikiki and drive to anything else you want to experience easily.

Stayed 4 nights. Staff attitude and helpfulness earned 4th star. Otherwise it would have been 3, based on what you get for what you pay. Rooms are clean, but smallish and not well laid out. Did have an unobstructed view of Diamondhead and some beach. City noises all night. Restaurants are good but not great.

Stayed at this Marriott two nights upon arrival into Honolulu. The hotel lobby and other areas have been renovated recently. The rooms are due for an update - they are clean/small and could use a refresh. Staff at the hotel was great, especially at the elite services desk. The breakfast buffet was very good - though could get pricey without having breakfast vouchers. The only real problem that we had was with valet. It just seemed to be completely understaffed. Upon arrival we were greeted but no offer to help with out bags. Upon check-out we were given our keys to the vehicle and offered no assistance to help with out luggage. Come on Marriott - you can do better. If you are looking for a city vibe, great views of the beach, and slow valet service then this hotel is for you.

Had a fantastic stay on the 20 th floor with sweeping views of the ocean! The gym was great. Staff very welcoming. Location was perfect to be able to access the beach and shops. Breakfast at Kulio Grill was okay. The food didn't change in the 11 nights we were there. My husband doesn't eat eggs so very limited hot foods available. Not a lot of healthy options available for guests!

Greeting us was a pretty blonde in a bright red SHORT DRESS.. when asked a question, she immediately referred me to a clerk who couldn't answer my question, and referred me back.. when i turned around the self- called gal was the Mgr....when i asked for a mgr. i was asked can i help you and asked for the \Mgr. again..never go one again..Never got problem solved..A heavy lady went back stage in the lobby and after several min. came out saying i'm sorry and i walked away..Very overrated and expensive for what you get.. Would NOT recommend this hotel to stay at..Everything is overpriced...Our view was the back of another hotel

Sitting by the pool right now, first Sun in 5 days and the pool bar is not open, seriously? Sent us to a restaurant inside to get drinks and the guy was so rude, said he could not make a margarita and then ran upstairs to tell the pool guy not to send anyone else down, nice service!

Stayed at this hotel for 11 nights. When we first checked into the ocean view room, hated it and had to go back down and do an upgrade. The tower they first put us in was very shabby. Needed a major renovation. Paid $25 more per night for an upgrade. The room was large and had a very nice balcony with ocean view. The decor in the room was pretty bad but I am not a fan of Marriotts because they use such bright colors. Housekeeping service was excellent. Restaurant at the pool was good with view of the beach. The Kuhio Grill that does the breakfasts for the hotel was way over priced so went to Starbucks or the Cheeseburger Grill a block away gor good breakfast and reasonably priced. I would never stay at this hotel again. I did not care for location because too many bums and homeless on the beach and they were aggressive.

I really wanted to like this hotel. It's in a great location, right across from the beach and within walking distance to many shops and restaurants. My room was huge, with a sofa, desk, large TV and desk. But there was just something "off" about this place that made this Marriott feel old, tired and a little depressing. It just didn't feel like a "resort", especially after walking through some of the other beautiful hotel lobbys and gardens at other hotels in Waikiki. This hotel needs a complete makeover; rooms, lobby, pools, gardens, everything. Check-in was quick and the front desk employees were friendly and helpful. No complaints here, as Marriott employees are some of the best and that's why I usually stay at Marriott properties. Overall, this hotel is just very average. It's clean, the rooms are large and it's in a great location, and that's fine if that's all you're looking for. But for a "resort" right on Waikiki beach, I expected a much nicer hotel. Lots of potential here, but needs a serious make-over.

I confirmed a room with what Marriott described as a magnificent Ocean View on the oceanfront Tower. The room actually looked directly at the side of another Marriott building and the only way to see a small view of the ocean was to go on the balcony and look off to the side and reposition the chair.For $40 a day the parking the lot was full and the elevators were out of order. Despite complaining to Marriott they did absolutely nothing and didn't even refund any of the parking.You are much better off to try to book a room in the Westin, the Hyatt or other beachfront hotels. Aloha Marriott. Will not be seeing you again soon.

The view from the room was very nice but query if it is oceanfront - especially when you’re in the back tower. This is really a side view of the left side of the beach with the beach photo blown up and cropped). To see the right side of the beach we used the window by the lifts. It’s a big hotel with everything you’d expect. Enjoyed the music on the deck - on each night. It would be better if the hotel fee of US$37 a night (apparently to cover such benefits) were clearly disclosed up front in the nightly rate when booking; this is how it is done for hotels in Australia - the amount you see per night is what you pay (plus the government’s goods and services tax). I was disappointed that half the final account including the hotel fee was debited from the credit card a couple of days before leaving; I guess if you complained about the hotel fee when you leave the hotel would at least keep the half they have already helped themselves to. It’s a good idea to have a common understanding about the true price so there are no nasty surprises so perhaps it should be brought up when you book and when you check in. A full service hotel which is beautiful to stay at.

Upgrade yourself to an Ocean View Room. It is worth it. It is spectacular. Hotel is very nice and the pool areas are wonderful. Alissa checked us in and was most cordial to us and helped us out. Kyle helped us with our bags and gave my husband a great recommendation for a barber while we were there. He got a great haircut :-) WE really liked everything about the hotel especially the breakfast. Lots of great options.

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott booked as part of a pre-cruise package. The hotel is very nice. Restaurants in the hotel are very pricey, but there are plenty of options within walking distance. We had an ocean-view room, and could sit on our balcony and watch the waves ... so relaxing! The Starbucks in the lobby was a great perk! We really enjoyed our time there!

we were here for two nites before our 7 day cruise on the pride of america to four islands we stayed in the second tower on the fifth floor the first night we went to a buffet in the hotel and cost my husband and i 96.00 dollars and the food was not so good,went there for breakfast the next morning and it cost 49.00 for two and they give you a lot but i think it was very expensive ate the rest of the meals at starbucks which was very good

We had no idea what we were doing when we reserved a room on Oahu for our trip to attend a wedding. We trusted the Marriott brand, and so felt comfortable reserving at this hotel. What a disappointment for us. This hotel is planted across the street from Waikiki beach in the midst of a touristy, shopping mecca, with lots of chain restaurants. If you are looking to spend your time in a mall or shopping at high end stores, this is the hotel for you! All of these are within easy walking distance. Looking for a Cheesecake Factory? International House of Pancakes? Cheeseburger in Paradise? This is the area for you! Every high end brand can be found in this area. If shopping is your thing, and you don't have access to these stores at home, you will love the Waikiki area. For us, we aren't shoppers and we don't go to chain restaurants at home, so we certainly weren't going to visit them in Hawaii! Needless to say, we were not happy with our location. The room was fine. Very large. A bit noisy. Supposedly ocean view, but only if we stood out on the balcony and put up with the traffic that was truly our view. The bathroom was much smaller and it pretty bad shape for what we were paying for a Marriott resort. What I can say is that they were very gracious to let us out of our reservation when we wanted to move to another Marriott property. Check out my review of Marriott Vacation Club at Ko Olina for that experience. Definitely an improvement, but still lacking in the Marriott experience I have come to expect.

Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. Check in was fast and easy we had a rental car, so we parked across the street at the Waikiki Banyon. There it cost $20 for 24 hrs, cheapest around. Upon arriving, they upgraded our room. The room was huge. It had one king bed and two queen beds. It had two full bathrooms and two balconies. Very nice to have all the space for only 4 of us. There are guest self service laundry facilities on the second floor. You can get change right there for detergent etc. The machines run via credit card. Lovely shops in the lobby areas. Requested a 1:30pm Check out and they were very nice to approve it! Great location, would recommend.

My wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott in early February for 6 nights. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is an older property but in an awesome location. It is a great base for exploring Waikiki. The view of Diamond Head was unbelievable from our room. Waikiki-beach is right across the street, and the promenade and an adjacent park provide good opportunities for walkers. The hotel offers a nice gym, two small pools and a whirlpool. From the hotel, Waikiki with a vast variety of restaurants, shops, and bars is a short walk away. Highly recommend the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa.

We enjoyed our stay...my husband was here on business and I was on vacation. The hotel is located on a busy street and requires that you cross the highway to get to the beach. I was a little disappointed and didn’t go to the beach. Our room came with breakfast Buffet which was wonderful. Only downside is that it is very difficult to get to the restaurant if you’re disabled and have a wheelchair. Our room was fairly large but we were unable to upgrade to a nicer room upon check in. Overall it was a good vacation.

We spent an unexpected night here after a cancelled flight. We were treated so very well that our next trip to Hawaii will include a stay here for sure. Right on the beach with great facilities and the most helpful staff I have encountered in my weekly travels. Hotel is not as fancy as many in area but still nice and the service far makes up for any dated looks

the Marriott was great not only was the service fantastic but the location I loved... From the time we arrived to when we left it was great Rooms are really large and we had a particial ocean view room, which I thought was a geat view of the ocean.

We are a family of 4 and our stay at marriott was very pleasant. The greatest plus point is that marriott is right on the beach and you can just step out for coffee/shopping or meals everything is close by. We have children and quite a few convenience stores are in the hotel lobby itself so its great for when we wanted to grab something for the children or some last minute shopping. There are two pools and one is better than the other..the pool next to the bar is quite crowded but has a nice ambience with the bar and restaurant nearby and the cabanas around (although thr is a charge to rent the cabanas). The service at the bar was good and we did not feel the need to walk to the beach as we were chilling at the hotel pool all day...its much safer for the kids and easy to manage with our room just an elevator ride away. All in all great stay recommended....

I booked here for a work trip noting the accessible location and expecting Marriott quality service. Upon checking in I was informed that the only room available was a room with two double beds for six nights. Despite indicating that I had requested a single bed room, the staff explained that the room was not available (I was checking in at 9pm) and that I would have to wait two nights for a new room.I explained that I was traveling for work and that I did not want to re-pack after two nights given my hectic business schedule.Two days later I received a frantic and condescending voice mail explaining that housekeeping still saw my belongings in the room and that they 'had tried to reach me ALL DAY" (caps for emphasis on the voice mail.)This 7pm phone call, however, was the first I had heard from them. Given that I left the room at 6am for meetings, I was CERTAIN they would have left a voicemail. HOWEVER, there was absolutely NO voicemail or any indication that (as emphasized by the staff leaving the voicemail) they had been trying to contact me ALL DAY. Instead there was no indication whatsoever that the staff had tried at any point to contact me. When I called the front desk, they merely said that, to clarify, when housekeeping went into my room there was luggage. TO ME, luggage in the room does not indicate any effort to communicate with me until 7pm when I received the first effort to communicate via my cell phone to let me know that the room (mind you that I had booked!!!) was no longer available (mind you, that I said I didn't want, despite being disappointed and expecting more from the Marriott)OVERALL. AWFUL COMMUNICATION and SERVICE. fine facilities. disappointing pool space (the hot tub is slippery and uncomfortable) and overpriced resort fee is included for "internet" and an 8am fitness class. Disappointing. I recommend booking somewhere else.

I had the most incredible stay here because of Lani (Guest Service Agent) and Ha'aheo (Front Office Manager). Although I am a Marriott Gold member, I booked this stay on Trip Advisor as I received a lower rate. I booked a 'run-of-the-house-room', so I didn't have very high expectations. My check-in with Lani was a revelation of how good service can be routinely delivered. Attentive to me, responsive to my requests, but also versed in company policy. When she said yes or no to my requests, I could sense those were accurate answers. As I was early my room wasn't ready, so I used the pool for awhile. I was happy to receive an upgrade in the tower in closest to the beach. I was assigned room 1003 (which I HIGHLY recommend). It is an ocean view room. Because it is on a corner it had TWO balconies. One could sit on the front facing balcony in the mornings to get the view and the indirect sun and sit on the side balcony in the afternoon to enjoy the outdoors without sitting in the direct light of the sun. While I happened to be in the lobby, I stopped by to thank Lani for two things: first having spent more than 450 nights at Marriott Hotels, I have seen all kinds of service and I wanted to thank her for the kindest and most competent service I think I have ever had and secondly for the great room. As a kind gesture she and her manager sent a gift basket to my room with chocolate covered strawberries -- needless to say they had me right there. The room was clean and functional. The hotel is nice, it has been there a while and there are some signs of wear at the edges. Most importantly, the location is great. Busy area, but not over-crowded. Yes, the pool area service could stand some additional staffing, but I had a great experience and it all started at the front desk. I highly recommend that one give the Guest Service Agent the benefit of the doubt during check-in. Their attitude can make or break your stay and your attitude can determine theirs. As a friend of mine would say, "Don't start none, won't be none"!

Hotels for us, most often, are a safe place to light at night and a clean spot to springboard our day ... they're not our destination. The Waikiki Marriott was in a convenient location, with easy ingress and egress. The staff was friendly and available. Breakfast was tasty, and we especially liked the omelette guys. Best of all: the chocolate-covered macadamia nuts they gave us at check-in. Shazam!

My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week in February/18. I don't understand why it is called a resort. It is just a hotel with a small pool. The point is: it doesn't offer anything more than a hotel room. We met people in the beach who had chairs or towels from their hotels, but you don't get anything like that from this one. There isn't even a microwave in the room. And they charge you for everything. We discovered that we were charged an extra $37 per room fee for an "Activity Package" that is useless. $6 per minute to use a computer in the office. Another issue is that it is a bit noisy, you can hear a lot from the other rooms and hallway. Besides all that, the localization is good.

We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for two nights. At 2am we were woken up by a distorted tone coming through the fire alarm system in the room. A message then quickly came through advising us to evacuate. We evacuated down through 15 flights of fire stairs. When we reached the lobby, it looked as if it was a false alarm as guests were immediately using the lifts to get back to their rooms. There were some staff around but they seemed just as confused as the guests. “We’re still investigating but you can go back to your rooms.” One guy was carrying a small kitchen fire extinguisher. No one had any hi vis jackets on, no one was doing a head count. We then headed back to our room and soon heard another inaudible fire alert message over the loud speaker in our room. Had no idea what was actually said. The next morning, we went to make tea and coffee and found only paper cups for us to use. Paper cups, at the Marriott. If you’re considering various hotel options for your time in Waikiki, choose another option...

We stayed at the Marriott as part of a package tour with Norwegian Cruises. The check-in and check-out processes were easy. The room was pleasant. It had a balcony view of the ocean and Diamond Head. We walked out of the hotel, crossed the street and were on Waikiki. Admittedly, Waikiki is not traditional Hawaii, but it is fun and their is lots of activity. The hotel does not provide complimentary breakfast which is a problem. It was ideal for what we were doing.

NCL Cruise line put us up at this gorgeous hotel a day prior to beginning a cruise at NO CHARGE to us. It is a typical large hotel/resort located across the street from famous Waikiki Beach. Watching people surf from my balcony was so cool having a birds eye view from 10 stories up. Lots of dining and shopping options nearby makes this hotel a perfect location. Our room rate would have been about $400/ night, but NCL has a special deal with Marriott.
user_name:
Al T
DeLand, Florida, United States

review_body: I'm a Lifetime Platinum Elite member with Marriott, my stay at the Waikiki Marriott is a great and enjoyable. The hotel is older, BUT very well maintained! Most rooms are ocean view with a balcony. Staff at the Waikiki Beach Marriott were great. All the food I had from breakfast at Kuhio Beach Grill, lunch at Moana Terrace and dinner at d.k Steak House were wonderful but breakfast was the best!

Our goal was only to visit Pearl Harbor while in Oahu. We landed in mid afternoon from the mainland. Went the next day to explore the Pearl Harbor site; we were there all day. We flew out the next day to Maui. Based upon our utilitarian needs, this hotel was totally fine. Clean and functional. We ate both nights at the roof top bar, which is casual and serves decent food at reasonable prices for Hawaii with a good house band as a backdrop.

Hotel service was great and the hotel itself was in a perfect location. The beach is just across the street and you have lots of dinning options within walking distance. If you want to check out other parts of the island they conveniently have a enterprise rent a car kiosk located inside the hotel. I would highly recommend taking the time to visit Laniki Beach it’s about a 30 minute drive but totally worth it! The beach is much less crowded than Waikiki and the views are just stunning!

This Marriott is located directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. No shuttles from the airport, but a $45 can ride. Uber rates can fluctuate. We had a quote as high as $70. The foyer is spectacular and the rooms were nice. I would skip the breakfast on site. At street level there is a lovely restaurant called Arancini that had a wonderful breakfast.

This was a great place. Many of the rooms have an ocean view and you are right downtown within walking distance to many places to eat, AND the bus route which is very easy to navigate and use while in the city. Marriott also has guest activiites that are so fun to join in. Highly recommend

Overall a great place to stay. Great location, staff is very friendly and helpful. There are a number of good restaurants and shops in the complex and many, many more nearby. Would give them a 5 but the room we were in needed an update; carpets were stained and buckled up a bit, bathroom clean but worn.

On beginning of February this year, I spent 2 wonderful weeks with my spouse in Marriott Ko’Olina Beach resort on Hawaiian island O’ahu. The Hotel itself is on the perfect position direct on the beach with very cultivated garden, full of tropical plants. Sendy beach in front of the hotel is relatively big Laguna, very nicely artificially built. In the Laguna see water is calm and warm, because it is protected from the open Pacific with huge stones. Of course there are several heated pools between Hotel and the beach, so you can always choose what you prefer better. There are also few Restorants between the pools, but this is standard for such a resort type. Our apartment was huge, two bedrooms connected with bathrooms, each approximately 40 m2, and big living room connected with kitchen also about 40 m2 of space. Very comfortable and nice, really “American standard”. The hotel is placed in one large resort aria together with few other Hotels ( one of them is fancy “Four seasons”) about 45 km from Honolulu. There is a highway all the way, so you can make it in about 40 minutes of driving with a car. Take care about terrible ‘Rush our’ on the highway between 7-10AM and 4-7PM. The weather is always fine and warm, 21*C in the morning, and 28*C in the afternoon. Honolulu is beautiful city with amazing Waikiki beach and to many tourists. It was a very nice trip and I recommend it to everybody.

I stayed here on business so my perspective is not that of a vacationer. The hotel and area is touristy as can be expected but it's refreshingly less touristy than the western end of Waikiki. I liked having the option to either swim laps in one of the pools or swim in the ocean every morning before work. I was given a suite upgrade so had 2 mountain facing balconies which was great since they were shaded in the afternoons/early evenings - which was when I spent time on them. Since I'm Platinum my breakfast was free which was good because it was quite expensive - so much so that it surprised me that anyone would pay that much for what is served.Anyhow - because of the "eastern Waikiki" location I would book here again the next time I have to be in town.
user_name:
SeatOfMyPntsTravelr
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great hotel in a prime location! They have restaurants and bars. You are also in walking distance to so many other restaurants and bars. Staff are very friendly. Our room was nice and clean. Would stay here again.

Marriott is keeping this hotel up nicely. The nightly music at the bar very fun. A local trio and they connect well with their audience. Staff were very pleasant and welcoming for a large tourist hotel.

Enjoyed my stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. My room was comfortable, well appointed, actually quite large (King size bed). Had a nice view ocean view (upgraded to this at check in). As a Marriott Rewards member (Gold), I received complimentary breakfast buffet, which was delicious. I also ate at Sansei (Sushi), which was wonderful (definitely make a reservation! I used Open Table); I also dined at the Italian restaurant on the first floor (Arancino di Mare) - amazingly good. While there I took advantage of the activities; Lei making with fresh flowers, and also Hula Lessons! I must say Hula is quite the workout! Everything is in walking distance - Honolulu Zoo, Aquarium, tons of shopping too! I rented a car for the day and drove around the Island, which was fun, and also got the opportunity to partake of the shrimp on the North Shore. As others have mentioned, a bit of updating is in order, but overall the hotel was wonderful. Don't forget to have a cocktail or two at the Moana Terrace too! Plus visit the Spa!

I enjoy this hotel because it's right in the heart of what's happening along Waikiki beach. You are within a few blocks of almost everything you would enjoy going to. I like Starbucks which isn't too far away (near the pier) and of course, shopping, across from the beach where you can see the sunset/sunrise, etc. Plus I'm a Marriott Rewards traveller, and you receive lots of points and advantages by participating in that program and staying in their hotels which are located almost everywhere.

We stayed here 4 nights. The hotel is nice and well located across from Waikiki Beach. I wouldn’t say there is much extraordinary about this place. We are Marriott gold so were given breakfast passes - good thing - the breakfast buffet is very mundane and they charge like $35 for it without a pass. I would not pay that. There are several restaurants located in the hotel- making dining an easy experience.

Right off WAIKIKI beach, close to shopping, restaurants, Zoo, and Diamond Head. Pool is ok, Hilton Hawaiin Village has a better pool area. Restaurants in hotel are good, Sensei sushi and DK steakhouse. Remember you are at a resort so prices are high.

The hotel in general is pretty standard and came at a decent price for the location only. Pros - close to Waikiki downtown- close to popular sites & hikes- has stores inside for quick merchandise pick-upCons- they didn’t tell you there is a resort fee until you get there ($30 more EACH day)- parking is $40 if you park yourself and $45 if you valet... not really a good price at all- Ocean-view room is extremely loud from all the traffic on the street- staff aren’t all that friendly at all except for valet. Personal experienceI called a month before we arrived to make sure chocolate covered strawberries and drinks were in the hotel before we got there (celebrating 2 year anniversary) and asked how much parking was a day - guy on the phone said “$10” so I thought sweet! I’ll rent a car.Got to the hotel, found out what “real” parking cost. The guy at the front desk who checked us in was super rude, and when I asked him if he could talk to the guy who set up our reservation he was very reluctant and tried to hurry us off by telling us the resort fee and throwing us our keys. Food for thought - tell your guests there is a fee, I probably wouldn’t have booked this hotel knowing that since we used zero of the amenities. Also, I wouldn’t have rented a car knowing the price of parking. Resort fee includes : free WiFi, pool, dvds, gym, and a few other unworthy things. There’s a beach across the street, I didn’t need WiFi because I’m on vacation and if I wanted it I would pay it myself, we are hardly in the hotel so I didn’t used the dvds and I’m not working out during vacation. All in all - Things they should tell you while you book. Got to my room, nothing I ordered was there. Had to call and asked them not to charge my card. We ordered room service (a salad and a burger) $70! Seventy frikkin dollars! Not only do they charge 20% grat, they also charge you a service fee on top of the tip. Then why am I tipping you if I’m already paying you to take the elevator? The food was subpar - not worth it. Won’t do that againAll in all, would I stay here again? No. I am paying an extra $70 a day on top of the $150 I paid per night to be here. Best bet is to Airbnb or pay $220 to stay at a nicer place. The location is nice, the hotel is big, but it’s really nothing spectacular. My biggest irritation is that they withhold information to get you to pay more when you arrive. What am I gonna say, “no, I’m not going to pay for parking or for your resort fee”? Never stayed at a Marriott before, probably won’t ever again.

Stayed here for 5 nights. Specifically requested ocean view, got a partial ocean, partial city view in the Kealohilani Tower on the 8th floor. I was hoping for better, it was ok. You are right across Waikiki Beach. There were a couple of things that bothered me during the stay. On arrival, no one offered to help with our luggages. Up in the room, I had trouble with my luggage lock and called to the Concierge for help. Instead of sending maintenance engineering up to help me, they rudely told me I have to wheel down my luggage so they can take a look. I've stayed in the Outrigger down the block in the past and if I had to choose to stay in Waikiki again, I'd go back to the Outrigger or try to book at the Moana Surfrider.

I stayed this past weekend and I cannot begin to tell you how pleased I was! From the moment I checked in at the front desk with Michelle, the service was amazing! She knew I had a frustrating day coming from a different hotel (not so nice) Michelle quickly checked me in and I was on my way. The room was fantastic! 8th floor with a huge lanai and an ocean view. The beds and bedding were among the most comfortable I have ever had! There was a HUGE flat screen TV but I didn't take advantage of that, the hotel amenities were too fabulous to be watching TV. I spent time at the Moana Terrace poolside bar. The bartenders were very personable and gave great service. Thank you Chad, Chuck, Korey and Jason! The pool and jacuzzi had plenty of loungers and even an Ice water/ice machine out there so you could help yourself. The towel service gentleman, wish I caught his name, was so friendly when I asked where the elevator was he actually walked me to it to make sure I found it. Anytime I came in and out of my room and came across the housekeeping staff, whether they were servicing my room or others they all greeted me with a friendly smile and asked how I was and if I needed anything. The location doesn't get any better. Just across the street from the beach and the views are amazing. My stay came with their Kuhio Beach Grill Breakfast buffet and what can I say, it was so good and had everything you could ever want. Ronnie waited on me and was a total sweetheart and made sure I had everything I needed. And finally I actually came across the manager on duty Runell and he made it a point to ask how my stay was and make sure I was happy. All of this fabulousness for such a great price because I found a great deal online. I live here. It was a much needed staycation and so well worth it! I highly recommend this hotel due to both the staff and facility. It was the best!

Beautiful property facing Waikiki beach and right in the heart of the action Location was nice if you like being in the hustle and bustle. Our rate included breakfast at the buffet and was tasty each day. Special thanks to the host staff and wait staff at the breakfast buffet. Unfortunately our room assignment was not the best. We were in the far tower away from the beach, at the end of the hallway and on a low floor (the 6th) I had hoped for something better as a Silver Elite member. The street noise was loud. There is a bus stop across the street so up until the wee hours of the morning you can hear the bus coming and going. I said to my husband in regards to the noise "Are we in Manhattan or Hawaii?" Our thermostat also clicked and made loud noises. It stopped right as we were about to call maintenance.We sat at the pool one afternoon and my husband ordered a beer from the pool server. It never came. Finally we found our server again and she finally got it. Later on we flagged her down to close the tab. She sharply said "Um, I already did last call" We explained that we only wanted to close our tab. While she looked for our bill she said "I didn't mean to be rude." I guess she realized she was in fact being rude. I wish I could remember her name. Overall it was a decent stay- not the best, not the worst.

The absolute best thing about this hotel is the numerous restaurant options on property. We enjoyed the Kuhio Beach Grill in the mornings for breakfast, and we dined in the Sansei seafood restaurant one night and Arancino's (Italian) another evening. We also tried (and loved) Tiki's Grill and Bar across the street for dinner one evening, and had reservations as d.k. Steakhouse on property for our final evening but later decided to venture nearly a mile away from the hotel to try Stripsteak instead. Cheeseburger in Paradise is also just a block away for burgers or nachos and an enticing Happy Hour. So again... lots of dining options within minutes of your room. They also have a number of shops on site, but the shopping is much, much better half a mile down the beach. My biggest criticism of the Marriott is; there are too many areas on property that are lacking in decor -- nothing but cement walls and floors on lengthy walks on the second and third floors in particular. You can go from "how pretty" to nothing special in seconds. Also, be sure to note there is a daily resort fee per room. Regardless, it's a nice hotel in a good location with great restaurant selections both on premises and very close by.

We had a room with a balcony on the 29th floor with a view of the ocean and the side of Diamond Head. Yes, I did pay for a small upgrade. The room and view were outstanding. Maid service was outstanding. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful when needed. Having a rental car and previous experience on Oahu, I did not buy any packaged tours. TripAdvisor says this hotel is rated number 4 on Oahu and I second that. It is an excellent and convenient place to stay (a block to the ocean and two blocks from Honolulu Zoo). For parking, I recommend the garage directly across Kuhio street which has an in-and-out rate of $80 for a 7-day week, much less than any hotel parking garage. I was very pleased with this Marriott. It is a quality place! There is a $36,65 (with tax) "Daily activity fee" which covers ukelele lessons, yoga or zumba lessons, and a whole bunch of other activities that we did not use at all. But, it was not a surprise because it was disclosed when I booked my trip with American Airlines. To me, it is just a "profit grab" by Marriott by requiring everyone to pay it regardless of usage or the guest's interests..

Stayed two nights. Right across from Waikiki beach...convenient location to restaurants and shopping. Neat shops in the resort and close to an ABC store for all you need. Hotel in Excellent condition. Complimentary breakfast buffet - extra large dining area - bright and modern. Clean and staff very pleasant. Pool very nice. Good for teens. Definitely would stay there again!!

We flew into Honolulu, arrived during late afternoon rush hour. It took a while to get to the hotel, but it was a wonderfully comfortable room and restaurants. We had a mai tai up on the Moana Terrace, had some munchies and listened to the live music. Our room had a view of Diamond Head - what more could we ask?

We stayed with 2 other couples, we were lucky to sleep on the sleeper sofa, it was very comfortable. The grounds are great and the staff is super helpful. We arrived @ midnight, we were courteously directly to our building with no problem. Great amenities, definitely go back.

Stayed here for three nights as part of a land tour of O'ahu with Norwegian Cruselines. Room was spacious, but bathrooms were the smallest I've ever experienced for a luxury resort. Separate shower and vanity are are a plus - but tiny! Has refrigerator. Be aware, the most scenic tower "starts with a K" is the loudest as there are often after hours parties at the resort next door. Rooms do have a great view of city to one side and obstructed view of beach on other. Also, if placing a mobile order for Starbucks (ate here for breakfast each day)... make sure you PICK THE CORRECT ONE - there are two in the resort. I picked the correct one, but location didn't recognize / know how to do this and sent me to the other location. Luckily the manager didn't make me go back and filled my order - for free! It's in a convenient area, but location and hustle bustle of this area isn't my thing.

rather expensive and the hotel is definitely showing its age. The rugs were stained, chips in sink & tub and peeling wallpaper in the bathroom. The concierge called Waikiki the "armpit of Hawaii". I think the further away from this area the better.

The BEST hotel service and amenities I’ve ever seen. If I could rate above 5 stars I would. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!! Beach in just across the street and they allow you to take their towels and bring them back! Free movie rentals as well!! Awesome place to stay!!

Nice hotel - close enough to everything. Great view from the tower closer to the beach. 2 pools. Staff very helpful. Would certainly go back. Beach right across the street. Food very close and certainly in walking distance.

Booked as part of a cruise package we loved the location and the room. All the amenities you could ever want and the view from our balcony was priceless. Can see the beach from the balcony and is a block walk away. Lots of premium shopping within walking distance. Restaurants galore. Room is large and comfortable. Coffee in the room.

Although the facility is a little dated, the service and amenities remain Marriott level.The room was comfortable, we had a Diamond head view. The pool was well maintained.We had two of the restaurants for meals, and had absolutely no complaints.With a mini fridge in the room, and an ABC store on the property, we could have snacks and wine to keep our spending down.

I choose the Marriott as part of a package deal (air/hotel). Rates were a little lower, as this was an slower week. I got a room in K Tower (the front one) on the east side, facing the Aston. Here's my impressions:As soon as I walked into the room I got a whiff of the mildew. Not too strong, and after airing out the room over the next 5 days I never really noticed it again. It had 2 beds but they were not queens, just double-sized, so a bit shorter. The bed had 4 pillows that worked well; no issues there.The room safe in the closet is big, but it's down on the floor, so you'll have to get on your knees to use it. There was a iron and board in there also.The carpeting was very old and in need of replacement. The bathroom was good. Not huge but not small and tight. The shower came with a detachable shower-head with 2 positions, high or low, making one of the few that are high enough that I don't have to stoop over to rinse my hair when taking a shower. Great water pressure too.The light was a little dim.The flat TV was huge with a ton of input jacks. And it had SURF TV, so I could watch the Volcom Pro up at Pipeline live!The good thing about this room was the balcony. It had 2 chairs, a small table and a lounge, with room for 2 more chairs. And while it directly faced the Aston across the street, it also had a side view of the Waikiki Pier and the pool at Kuhio Beach. I could check out the surf every morning and get sun until about 1 or 2 pm.Unfortunately, it also gets a bit of noise from the street below. Many trolleys go up the one way street and ring their bells every time they stop there and there is noise from the band playing at the tiki bar at the Aston until about 11 pm.Wi-Fi was pretty good throughout the property. Which was good because that was the only thing in the Resort Fee that I needed. I never used the gym or any of the other offerings they charged me $38.74 a day for.Getting on to the rest of the hotel- the 2 pools are on the smaller side. I liked the one near K Tower better. The restaurants were good. I liked the sushi at Sansei. Very soft rice in the tuna rolls.I ate at DK Steakhouse twice and had the organic roasted chicken both times. They have a tasting menu for wines. I tried the Pinot Envy tasting for $12.I also tried the buffet at Kuhio Beach Grill. It was 1/2 price from 5- 6 pm. But with one glass of red wine still came to $37 with tip. They add the tip to the bill BTW. The prime rib was sub-par, not really "prime". I tried having breakfast there one morning but service was so slow I just left. Good thing, because not only did the grill want about $24 for breakfast, but I got to try Arancino di Mare, which is at street level. They had a decent breakfast with unlimited refills on juice. If you eat breakfast at the hotel you should try this place first.The hotel is not a real resort and should not have that in the name. No gardens or beachfront should rule it out. They did have more than a few shops, and the ABC stores (2, front and back) came in handy for a cheap snack or beverage. I rented a bodyboard at Aqua Zone for just $10 for 24 hours. There's another shop that rents better boards for a bit more. They had a perfume store that kept bugging me every time I walked by, asking me if I'd like to try a sample. They do that in the courtyard AND on the street! The Harley Davidson shop on the street has gone out of business.I liked how close the hotel was to the beach. I could walk to the corner and cross and be there. I bodyboarded at the pier, surfed out on the reef and snorkeled in the pool, where there are a ton of fish alongside the edges. Good snorkeling just down the beach at the longer pier.The K tower had 5 elevators, so there wasn't too much of a wait. You need to use your room keycard at night to go up.Parking was very expensive. I rented a car for one day and needed to go back to the front desk and get new room keycards so I could use them to get out of the parking garage, which is very tight. So I had to get new keycards. The front desk staff were very helpful. If you only need to park so a few hours, just use the zoo parking around the corner. It's only $1/ hour, while the hotel charges $40/ day.

Nice lobby and friendly staff. Lots of shops onsite. The rooms are a bit run down and dated. Not terrible but could use a refresh. The price is about the going rate. Didn’t have time to really use the whole place. Restaurants are predictably expensive but got 2 free breakfasts as a Marriott gold elite. Nice ocean view from my balcony. Clean, quiet and comfortable. Overall a good stay.

Wahroom has no lock just sliding door. The decor are all outdated. there is no lights on the balcony so you would not enjoy being there. The only saving grace of this hotel that's why i have one star is because of the the cleaning service. our room is flawless clean whenever we got back from all day of activities. i find the people in the lobby who direct traffic RUDE and INCONSIDERATE. To think you pay for a hefty amount of parking but their building where you park is small, old, dark and very narrow driveway - ONE WAY for each turning lane. Watch out for your turns as i saw an ALMOST accident that happened. Never again!

The Hotel is right across the road from the ocean, nothing to block the view. In 10 mins you can be across the road and in the water. There are On-site parking,There are several excellent restaurants in the hotel. Lobby and public areas: Complimentary Wireless, if you want one in your room they are Wired for 14.95 a day. On returning from our days out, we always found the room comfortable and clean.

Stayed here with precruise excursion package with NCL so not sure how it compares price wise with others in same area. Our room wasn't ocean view but it didn't matter as we were only across the street from the beach and we could see it from our balcony. Room was a good size and very clean. Staff were very helpful when we had questions for them. So close to shopping and bus services.The only negative I have is the outrageous almost criminal cost of the breakfast buffet- roughly $73.00 US for the two of us so we ate as much as we could. Having never been to Honolulu before we weren't familiar with what restaurants were around us- we had arrived late the night before after a day of flying, plus we were up early because of a tour and needed to eat somewhere close and it was open early in the morning. The selection of food was fantastic but the cost was a killer- we soon found other places to have breakfast and other meals as well. Starbucks and ABC store is in the lobby which was very convenient.

Marriott should be ashamed of themselves for the state of this property. We stayed here in Feb and Mar 2017 as a before and after a trip to NZ. Truly the only saving grace was that we stayed on points. Even though we worked hard for those points, we would have felt more angry if we had paid cash for the 5 nights we stayed there. It is at 10-15 years PAST when it should have been renovated. I last saw this room decor in a D.C. Marriott in the 90's! We were in rooms 2031 and 2224. Absolutely disgusting. And the couple of pictures I have attached don't even begin to show just how badly the rooms were in disrepair. Here's a tip Marriott - when you can no longer repair things in rooms or clean them sufficiently then it is time to RENOVATE! This is a great location. Why would they let this hotel get in such a state? Especially at the prices they charge.We loved the location, the view and the staff we encountered was excellent. Public spaces were lovely and clean. None of that makes up for the condition of the rooms though and we absolutely will not be back until they bring the rooms into this century.

This hotel is an excellent value for the $$. When I made the reservation, I requested a higher floor and king-size bed. Kenneth, at the Front Desk, welcomed us to Honolulu, and informed me that he had been able to put us on the 28th and in a king room. Very pleasant surprise. He also told us that the room we were in had not been renovated yet, but we were happy to get even a partial ocean view!The room was a standard hotel room, but had all the normal amenities (safe, mini-fridge, coffee maker). The ice was on odd floors, so we had to take the elevator one floor down/up, but the elevators were a smooth, fast ride.The hotel has a lovely lobby, open-air, as most Hawaiian hotels do. Around the lobby edges were several small shops, including an ABC store (alcohol, wine, beer, but also snack foods and inexpensive souvenirs), and a Starbucks (Score!! Inexpensive breakfast!)The hotel is across the road from Waikiki beach. It is nicely located close to amenities, the Honolulu Zoo (good size in the middle of a city!), 2 very nice, upscale malls, and several excellent restaurants.Within the hotel, we ate at Sensei (expensive, but good sushi, discount for hotel guests from 4:30-6:30), and Maona Terrace (open-air cafe with good food and KILLER views of Waikiki beach). The sunsets aren't to be missed!! And the Lava Flow drink is a treat!The staff...Pao, a maid, was in our room cleaning when we returned late morning one day. She was very nice, but asked us to prove we were in the room (very politely!), as security in a large hotel is a concern. We were happy to use our key and impressed that the staff were trained that well. When she left shortly after, she asked if we needed anything and wished us a pleasant stay. :) We found the room comfortable and clean.The bell desk has small bottles of cold water, and there is a purified water refill station across the lobby as well. A nice touch for tourists walking about the city.Beach towels are available in the gym and near one of the 2 pools. They were plentiful and clean, and we were welcome to take them to the beach.Finally, I inquired one day before we left about a late checkout, as we were flying out at about 8 p.m. the next day. Richard and Catrina were very helpful and let me know the options. I was happy to pay $20/hr for a few extra hours (to catnap and shower) before we headed to the airport. Nice option!I will recommend your hotel to friends and family. The only challenge is that the taxes and resort fee equal almost 25% of the total room cost... something to look at reducing in the future?Thank you, Marriott for a lovely stay!

Located on the end of Waikiki next to the Honolulu Zoo, it’s a little less busy than the other end of Waikiki. You can walk to Rainbow Drive In or Leonard’s Bakery for malasadas. It’s a clean hotel with excellent service. It is however, getting a little worn around the edges. Our lounger on our balcony was bent and broken. The walls are very thin and you can hear neighbors. It is in a good location, across the street from the beach. Lots of shops, including the ubiquitous ABC store, located on the first floor. We stayed for two nights, after a week long stay in Ko Olina. There were no loungers available by the pool on Friday about 2 pm, but it appeared less busy on Saturday and Sunday. The pool doesn’t receive direct sun until after noon.

We recently travelled to Waikiki and booked our two nights at this Marriott right on the beach. While the initial impression in the lobby was positive, and the staff attentive, the hallway and then room was less than desireable. While we had an upgraded room with ocean view, the bathroom was small, dark and lacked any ventilation. The tub had rust stains and looked well worn. The carpeting throughout the room and halls was stained. Overall the room was not what I have come to expect from a Marriott. We will not return. After more research, we understand why the price was less than the Westin down the beach!
user_name:
Marilyn S
West Caldwell, New Jersey

review_body: Had a pleasant stay here. We got upgraded to an ocean-front room, and the view was gorgeous. The hotel is conveniently located to do tons of things in town; we were quick lyft rides away from Ala Moana, Intl Market, Iolani Palace & shave ice. The hotel is just across the street from the beach, so it's easy to stroll the beach, all the way up to the Royal Hawaiian. The staff was all super nice--especially Kyle with the Bell staff--he was so helpful every time we ran into him. The thing to know about this hotel (And most in Waikiki)--the atmosphere and energy are not relaxing. There is a constant bustle, so you should not expect complete relaxation. The hotel is also not directly on the beach (it's across the street) so you will need to rent beach chairs and umbrellas from one of the stands set up on the beach. There is a ton of good shopping & eating to do in Waikkiki, so this is not a bad place to stay for that. Ps. The hotel is a quick walk/bike ride to Shimazu's shave ice, Leonard's malsadas & Rainbow Drive-In.

Great hotel. The location really can’t be better if you like being close to the beach. When you get tired or hungry and you want to head back to the hotel from the beach just walk across the road. The beach is on one side of the road and the hotel on the other. The rooms are well designed with up to date furnishings.The only drawback is that the hotel does not have a lounge but they offer you a free breakfast in the hotel's restaurant.I would definitely return again.

Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights during a recent business trip. While I thought it was good for a business trip, I probably wouldn't pick this resort for a vacation.The Pros:Beautiful open air lobby.Very helpful staff at the front desk and valet station.Good size rooms.
