I had 2 queen size beds in my room and could probably fit a family of 4 comfortably.Convenient location right across the street from Waikiki beach.Right in the middle of all the restaurants and shops on the strip.The Cons:Very noisy! Not only from the busy streets surrounding the hotel -- but also within the hotel. The walls are paper thin. I could hear every word of the TV show that my next door neighbors were watching (every night!!)! There are no chairs offered for the beach (at least not that I knew about). I brought a towel from the pool to sit on the sand. I saw people from a neighboring hotel bring chairs that were provided by that hotel, but nothing from the Marriott.While the hotel is close to the beach -- and you can see it from the balcony, I wouldn't consider this a beach resort. This was definitely a downtown location. Somewhat dated bathrooms that could use some new fixtures, etc.Again, this was a great location if you want to be in the hustle of the downtown vibe, but not great for a relaxing beach resort vacation.

My husband had the chance to stay here for work and so we decided to join him for a week. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor I wasn’t sure what to expect. People always have such varying views and expectations and sometimes reality is in the middle. Well we arrived and it is an open air type hotel. It has shops inside and two pools - they’re pretty small as people commented. You have to get there early to get chairs. Cabanas are available to rent - they’re probably ok to rent but you could catch it in between. The food service is great. We ordered drinks and food - pizza, quesadillas-typical fare. The breakfast buffet in the Grille restaurant was fantastic! Always have great fruit, omelettes made to order and delicious baked pastries like sticky and cinnamon buns! The beach is just outside with a barrier to keep it safe for kids to swim. There are stores outside - Starbuck’s, ABC and outside cafes. The zoo is around the corner and the Waikiki Aquarium is a ten minute walk. We preferred to grab a Lyft though. We did souvenir shopping at the hotel. Got some great deals. The room is comfortable- queen beds and a pullout couch. The bathtub is clean - no rust as others cited. At least our room. The drain hardware could be newer but it’s ok. The door to the bathroom is a tight fit so it’s hard to move around in the bathroom with the toilet. Our room had a separate sink area so that was good for getting ready. The room has a refrigerator and large TV. Comfortable desk space to work. The best part were the balconies. We had two but one had a great view of the pools and ocean. While it’s not the ihilani at k’o O’lina where I stayed 9 years ago it still is very nice. Clean and comfortable especially for a family of 4! Proper planning and everyone can get ready. The staff was courteous and helpful. The bellman brought our bags to the room when we arrived right away. Very helpful staff! I’d return again! This is in the heart of the action.

I read previous reviews and almost did not book this hotel. I had a room on an upper floor that was beautiful. I had 2 balconies, one overlooked Diamond head and the other the ocean. Room was large, clean and in great shape. Staff was very nice and attentive. Pool was fairly nice but all you had to do was cross the street and you were on the beach. Can rent umbrellas and chairs right there as well as surf boards and other equipment easily. Signed up for surfing lessons in the hotel itself and was great experience. Rented a car for the day from Enterprise, also in the hotel and was a great experience. Food at the grill poolside was excellent. one of us had a burger and the other a salad with chicken. The breakfast buffet was outstanding...so much to choose from! I would recommend this hotel and stay here again!

The Marriott Waikiki Beach hotel is a gigantic hotel which covers an entire block in Waikiki. It took my wife and I two days to figure out where everything was located at this luxury hotel. It has everything you could possibly want if you can locate it. The hotel provides an excellent buffet breakfast with talented omelet makers. There are several fine restaurants right in the hotel. The steakhouse was particularly good. Many stores are contained within the hotel for easy shopping. Nothing is cheap however. The staff was very attentive and efficient.

We stayed 2 nights prior to our cruise and it was a very pleasurable stay. The staff were helpful, the grounds and rooms kept clean and modern. The shops within the complex were nice and the beach access across the road was wonderful. Our room had a perfect view of Diamond Head.

The people and location can't be beat. Right on the beach and near the shopping strip. The people are always amazingly supportive and helpful. I recently had an issue with a lost item and Mr. Kanaiaupuni did an outstanding job of working the issue and getting my item back to me! Definitely a good place to stay!

Nice large clean room. Open air lobby with classes for everything like making leis. Food options are affordable and nothing beats the walk across the street to get in the water at the world famous Waikiki Beach. The ABC stores have everything from booze to souvenirs to spam musubi! My hubby bought board shorts and we had snacks for the room and din't cost an arm and a leg! Stocked up on water and drinks for the day before heading out. Staff is lovely. HH in the Kuhio Beach Grill is a must at sunset. The restaurant on the second floor was great! Compliments to the chef the xmas eve buffet was nothing short of amazing.

We are spending a night at the Marriott Waikiki. We didn’t choose the hotel it was part of a cruise package. Check in isn’t until 3pm however there was a very helpful lady (Carolina?) who said she could upgrade us to a family room for an additional $90+ taxes. So after a long flight we got to check in at 10:30am. These family rooms are usually $500 a night so my expectations were expecting a luxury room. The lobby area is modern, clean and makes you think you are in a top resort in Waikiki. I’d expect the rooms to match, also looking at the photos on the website I thought I’d get something very similar to thatWell the room appears clean on the surface. But the couch in the room was so uncomfortable and worn out. It looked like it belonged in the side of the road. I would not expect furniture to be so worn if you are staying at a “luxury resort”. The beds looked comfortable but I was surprised when there were no quilt covers on the doona instead they had 2 sheets covering the doona. In saying that the doona was clean. I did find hair in one of the beds, thankfully I was able to use the other queen bed instead. The shower and bath were clean but again the money they charge for a family room I’d expect it to be modern. The bath had the enamel missing in places the soap holder looked old and cracked. Positive the bathroom supplies were nice. The biggest annoyance I found though was the NOISE. Oh my goodness coming off a long flight all we wanted to do was sleep but we could hear the people in the next room throughout the day and some electrical noise that sounded like a lift running all night. Then it gets worse...the music and noise from the surrounding hotels is just unbearable. The noise from the traffic I can ignore, as it is a busy tourist area but the partying and the constant noises from some electrical thing is just too much. I’m thankful we just wasted $90 and not the $500 that the room usually goes for. I’d suggest looking somewhere else if you want a peaceful nights sleep so you are regenerated for sightseeing and beach fun. There are so many to choose from I suggest you go on reviews and not the hotels website. I am yet to find a hotel room that looks anything like what’s advertised. But if the location of the Marriott Waikiki is what you’re after make sure you don’t stay in room 1812.

It's been around (a long time) but it's neat, clean and well-staffed. Nothing "over the top" but a good choice for a Mariott-level hotel. Stayed here many year ago and was impressed; still a quality mid-priced hotel close to the action.

I was moved from a really terrible location by my travel agency to this property and it is wonderful. The view from my balcony is spectacular and the staff are wonderful. It’s very, very close to the beach and there’s much to see and do nearby. The property has a pool and several restaurants.

I booked a very short solo trip to Oahu at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa January 2018. My premium room #2330 was located in the Kealohilani Tower (with ocean view). What did I love? The room was surprisingly larger than most hotel rooms I’ve booked. I travel to Waikiki at least 3 times a year. The ocean view from my lanai was wonderful. The front desk and all staff were friendly and accommodating. I accidentally locked myself out of my room and security arrived quickly to assist me. The property is located across the street from Waikiki beach and near many shops and restaurants. I felt very safe at this hotel. I was able to reserve an 80 minute deep tissue massage at the Marriott spa (2 hours after my plane landed). Ahhhhhhhh, the masseuse melted my knots away. I didn’t want to leave the Waikiki Marriott and I look forward to returning. Thank you Waikiki Marriott for such a wonderful birthday trip!

really did not expect much but pleasantly surprised. the location was great/close to everything we need (stores, restaurant, and beach). beach towel service and laundry room were very helpful. would love to stay again.

My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in early January as part of our cruise line package. Our first impressions of the hotel were very favourable. We arrived at the hotel in the morning as we had just got off a long overnight flight from Australia. We expected to drop our bags off and wait for our room to be available in the afternoon but the lovely lady (unfortunately I have forgotten her name) at reception changed our room and we were able to check into our room straight away. The Marriott is a large hotel with 2 towers and a lobby in the middle. Our room was in the tower closest to the beach and was clean, large and comfortable with glimpses of the beach from our balcony. The bathroom was a little on the small side with the basin outside the bathroom which made it easier for one person to get ready for the day while the other person used the shower/toilet facilities. Unfortunately we had a room with a connecting door which allowed the noise from the next room to filter into ours. Luckily for us, our neighbour was considerate although we may have disturbed them early in the morning as we often had to get up early to make our bus tours. Although the Marriott was clean, tidy and had good customer service, we found the lifts to be quite slow with lots of people lined up to access them most of the day and into the night. The hotel is also quite expensive to eat at and although the restaurants onsite sounded delightful we did not eat there as the prices for meals were just too high. Even the continental breakfast you could get delivered to your room was $18 without tax or gratuity. This hotel is also situated at one end of Waikiki Beach nearest Diamond Head and across the road from the beach, although it was a bit of walk to restaurants and shops so be aware of this if booking this hotel. All in all, a comfortable stay although not a hotel we would have chosen to stay at if given a choice.

I had a nice room (ocean view) and was upgraded to a suite which was a lovely touch. The room was much older than expected but very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was very tiny and make up mirror / vanity seperate in a small corner. A comfortable stay for one night but would likely choose a more updated hotel if my budget works.Short walking distance to popular shops and eatery areas. Friendly and helpful staff.

Third time here. The service is always great. Friendly helpful staff. Rooms and facilities nice and clean. Relaxed stay. Lots of food choices. All good food in the restaurants. The moana terrace bar by the pool. makes the best mai Tai on the beach in my opinion. The sun Doesn’t hit the pool area till mid day. But that’s ok.

While our upgraded king room was large and had a spectacular view, the good vibes stopped there. Valet parking: $45/night. Resort fee: $35/night. Room service: a $16 pizza (which was a small personal-sized pizza that was burned and not good at all) was $29 after delivery fee ($5), required gratuity (20%) and tax. Hard to fathom the prices at this place, even compared to other places in Hawaii.

Had a very good time at this Marriott hotel across from the beach. Wonderful concierge named Kylie Sueoka took care of all our arrangements. She is expert in the area and we could not have been more pleased.Good restaurants on properly with friendly servers. Clean well appointed room

My husband & I, as well as another couple we are friends with, capped off a 2 week Hawaiian vacation with a 3 night stay at the Marriott in Waikiki Beach. We also stayed at the Marriott in Wailea & Līhue during our trip. The hotel was nice. I have status with Marriott and we were given and upgraded room. The rooms were nice. The bathrooms were a bit outdated, but nothing that made me think twice about it. The hotel lobby is beautiful and has some great shops in it. Where my complaint lies is with their total lack of any emergency plan, or really any organization or communication with their guests during an emergency. Unfortunately, we were all guests when the missile threat was sent out to all of Hawaii. My husband, as well as the couple we were traveling with both received the alert and agreed (in a panic) to meet in the lobby. The first issue was that the stairs are not clearly labeled at all. After running all over our floor, we found the stairs tucked away, and with minimal signage. We ran down 18 flights of stairs to meet them, and once we reached the lobby it was total chaos. The staff had absolutely no plan, and no idea what to do with everyone. We kept asking where we should shelter, if there was a basement, and they just told everyone to go back to their rooms. They also made no announcements over the intercom, so God forbid the warning was real, anyone who was still asleep (it was 8:08am) should have had no idea what was happening. I don’t know about you, but I don’t want to wait out for a nuclear missile in my hotel room in the 18th floor. There was not even any mention of stay away from windows, or stay in your bathroom, or anything like that. It honestly just created more unnecessary panic and hysteria. I’ve heard accounts from many other people who were staying in hotels and they alerted their guests at once, got them into a parking garage or basement, and kept everyone there until it was determined the threat was false. All the Marriott did was take an already horrific and terrifying experience, and make it much much worse.

This is a not a new hotel and it could use an update, however it was clean, the staff helpful and it's location was hard to beat. It has two towers, 2 pools, and a beautiful open lobby as well. Having stayed in many Marriott properties I would say that this is mid to high end average, but location was perfect.

Waikiki has a busy and a less busy side. This Marriott is located on the less busy side, closer to the ZOO. It is a very nice hotel where the lobby was completely redone in a modern approach. As we stayed there many times, for us it was sad to see that a lot of the Hawaiian atmosphere, like the large outrigger canoe had gone. But times change and younger people take our place. The rooms are tired but clean. Make sure, if you can or are willing to pay to get a room at a high floor ( 10 or higher is good, 21 or higher will give you better views ) Most rooms only see the ocean when you are out on the balcony. The east side rooms are on a busy street with a lot of delivery vehicles and tour busses. The west side looks out over a parking lot. Stabucks in the lobby and an other one just outside the hotel. Great bar at the third floor overlooking the ocean and nice bites with the drinks. Great Italian place on the ground floor and the only restaurant that was able to give us a NON-GARLIC menu. Bravo for that.

I had an excellent experience with Lani Ching while checking in today. This young lady brightened my day and should be given a raise! I’m a Marriott Platinum member and I always feel at home in Marriott properties, but when an individual stands out and gives exceptional service I’m glad there’re places like this to give her PRAISE! Thank you Lina!

We stayed here for four nights in January. The Hotel is located at one end of Waikiki Beach. Whilst this might sound like a good location it is a little walk to get to any other locations past a lot of construction sites and other older run down hotels. The hotel is also very dated. The rooms and pool area looks like hotels you see in the movies from 1970s. The bathroom was tiny and very old. We did have a room on the 25th Floor which did give us great views of the beach and bay but every time you got in the elevator it was a bit hit and miss as to whether you would get to your desired floor. On a couple of occasions we ended up having to take the service elevator because the guest elevators had broken downAlso was disappointed by the fact that as a Elite Member, one of the benefits I am supposed to get is complimentary breakfast and cocktails for me a one guest. One I checked in I was told that I would get a complimentary breakfast and I would get 25% discount on her breakfast. I questioned this and was told this was the hotel policy. The manager made some excuses about this policy be contrary to other other policies in Marriott group because of the cost of living in Hawaii. I have lived for the last 20 years in Hong Kong, Singapore and Tokyo the most expensive cities in the World and not once have they tried to fob me off with that excuse. I have stayed in Marriott group hotels in all those cities and the complimentary breakfast for me and my guest has been extended on all occasions, with out question. Also in all these cities I have been invited for complimentary cocktails. I did eventually get a voucher for complimentary breakfast but felt as somebody who has been an Elite member for over 10 years and having invested a tidy sum in Marriott Vacation Club ownership that this recognition should not have to be fought for. Having said this I wish I hadn't bothered. We only tried to eat breakfast twice. Both mornings we came down to find massive queues and no sense of any organisation being shown by the staff at all. For example in front of us there was a group of eight people who wanted to be sat together so we had to wait for them to be seated before they would seat us even though there were several empty tables for couples. As I said generally very disappointed with this hotel. If we are ever back in Waikiki we will not be staying here.

I rated this three star because the Complex was nice. Some staff were good others showed little care. Went in over Xmas new year designed only for Japanese and the occasional white Man as they had bright yellow packeted scrambled eggs + dried bacon strips for breakfast. Breakfast was a feast of Asian delights you know their usual rice 3 types, watery soup like Asians would like and other Asians typical. Be ware pay a fortune like $120.00 for breakfast and even more for Dinner. We eat twice there and then decided to eat anywhere on the street which was better and cheaper. There is a lot more but cant be bothered with spending more time on it.

For our last night in Waikiki we ventured over for some casual dining at the Marriott poolside — we had a very rude waiter who refused to include chips with our daughters meal and kept saying no no chips with tacos then eventually Brang out a packet of chips as a side to her fish tacos but said he swapped the salad for this packet of chips. Very disappointing would not recommend. Then he disappeared and we couldn’t find him to ask for some salad. Do not eat here.

Decent rooms with amazing views of Waikiki beach. Rust stains on bath tub but other than that decent rooms. Great restaurant and buffet breakfast is full of choices.Great pool areas with plenty of seats (however still gets busy) gym modern and well equipped.Staff were excellent. Overall great experience

I was quite disappointed by this place which has a room rate of over 500$/night. I had also stayed at the nearby Coconut Waikiki at 175$/night and found the latter better in service and hospitality. One could easily sense that the Marriott was more interested in extracting cash from its customers than providing decent customer service or treating its employees well. Employees appeared generally demotivated. Some specific examples of my issues here:- Room was fairly standard and dated for a luxury hotel and bathroom was no better than an average Holiday Inn. Walls were thin so one could hear conversations clearly from the room next door.-The hotel has two 30 story buildings for residents but a common infrastructure that is woefully inadequate. Queues for the 40$ breakfast were 30-45 minutes, swimming pool was tiny and overcrowded and there was 1 jacuzzi for the whole hotel.- a can of diet coke would cost 11$ for room delivery and we were told it could take 1/2 hour- our luggage was delivered in 1 hour.- Reception kept me on hold for 10 minutes to answer a simple question, luckily their phones have a speaker.- Lani at reception should be trained better as she appeared to be more of a pompous official than a friendly receptionist, I would have thought that was a minimum requirement in a 500$ plus hotel in Hawaii of all places. Compare that to the friendly receptionists at the Coconut Waikiki- Cost 9.75$ for me to print my boarding pass at the Business centre, at the Coconut they did it for you for free. The location was great but with so many irritations at an expensive hotel, I would look elsewhere. Marriott has recently taken over Starwood, where I normally stay happily and I hope they don't infect the Starwood hotels with such sloppiness and greed.

While the rooms and bathrooms are a little small, the location and beach are great! The beach right out front is well protected and a safe place to swim. The water is warm and very clear. I wouldn’t waste time at the pool when you can go to the beach! Pools are on the small side but there are plenty of chairs.

Honestly, one of the worst supposedly high end resorts I’ve ever stayed at. I’m a gold member with Marriott and completely treated poorly upon check in. This property needs serious help training their staff. I’d be happy to give the GM some pointers if they would take the time to listen. Atrium and who owns this property and Marriott corporate will be getting a detailed report on the very poor customer service. Go down the road to the Hilton. They know how to treat guest/reward members much better.

This is a great property located in a great area a bit removed from the big crowds up by the Hyatt.One suggestion, make sure you get the front tower if you want ocean view. We had ocean view, yet it was on the second tower and our balcony was off to the side. The ABC STORE in the Marriott is well stocked.One complaint is that the breakfast area is somewhat hidden and hard to find since it literally hidden aroun d a corner on the second level.A good point is the filtered water statios throughout the hotel offer great water to fill your bottles for free. Also, there is a way to login to your Hulu or Netflix right on the TV if you have downtime.

Centrally located. A short walk to the beach and great food.They have a pretty decent gym for a hotel, and two nice pools. The layout is a little confusing at first. There are two towers and we found ourselves looking for elevators and stairs for awhile.The lobby is a nice open air atrium.No free breakfast.

We stayed at Christmas time, the room was lovey and we had an ocean view. Staff were very friendly and helpful, room service was great, food was reasonably priced.Great location - beach is straight across the road. The main shops are a short stroll away, along with great restaurants..This is a family friendly hotel - would highly recommend ...

I cannot say we were unhappy, but both my husband and I looked longingly at the other more picturesque hotels in the same location and same price. This Marriott is a very large, generic hotel, that was poorly serviced during the busy holiday season. Concierge response time was notably poor, to the point that we gave up trying to use it. Pools were also dramatically undersized for the number of hotel rooms, so often could not find a spot at the pool. What was ok? Great location, rooms were pleasant and clean (though tiniest bathroom I have ever had in a hotel). You can do far better than this hotel at this price is my conclusion.

We stayed there three nights during New Years weekend. Room was okay. Decent partial ocean view with balcony. No mini bar, stain on carpet, basic furnishings. Our safe did not work and it took EIGHT requests to get it fixed. This place is huge - two 25 story towers, which means long lines and not enough room at the two relatively small pools.I am a long time Marriott Elite member and this was my worst Marriott experience. Pros: great location on the beach, nice bar overlooking the ocean. As currently built, won’t stay here again. Poor value for money.

I stayed here with my gf and her two small kids - 5 and 10 years old. A convenient place to stay - centrally located for most events. This was a big week for tourists and the Hotel was overbooked and wall to wall with people. Arrived late at night from SF. Slow checkin process and some confusion about the room reservation. 16th floor in the Pao Tower with a balcony and two standard beds - workable but very small from our normal queen. Great room staff and service - we were outdoors all the time so we were constantly getting wet from either the ocean or the swimming pool and the room staff kept our room spotless and stocked with fresh towels. I found the food everywhere to be pretty average and we ate in a lot of places including the hotel. Book your Hotel reservations early - a lot of Hotel guests like the comfort of eating in the Hotel. The Sansei and dk steakhouse were totally booked whenever we tried for a reservation - generally a one hour wait if you didn't have a reservation. We got take out from Sansei one night and that was a good idea and a good meal. Plenty of shops and local restaurants in the immediate area. A walk to the beach, and an easy walk just about anywhere else. The 5 year old had about a 1/2 mile walk limit so we took a cab anywhere outside of that. Cab stand at the Hotel and also a Baggage Storage area - helpful when your flight out was at 11pm at night. A concierge and info desk - but those were generally swamped. Two main pools and a hot tub - saline pools and a moderate temperature. Plenty of lounge chairs and the best deal of all - rent a foam cushion cabana poolside for the entire day for $75.

By far the worst Marriott Experience I have ever had. I booked a trip to Hawaii as an end of the year vacation before returning to work. As Gold Elite Member I was committed to Marriott properties, however after this last trip, I am not sure. Before booking my hotel, I called the hotel and explained that my foot was in a cast and would be unable to go down to the beach, walk around or walk on the sand. I wanted to ensure that the room I was getting would have full unobstructed view of the water, specifically from my balcony as that is the only think I would want to do is sit on the balcony and look at the water. I paid almost $2000 for 2 nights in this hotel to ensure that my foot would not ruin my experience. Upon checking in, I get to my room and there are two balconies, (1) that faces the mountains/City and another that has a slight view of the water, if you look through the buildings to the left. The bathroom was not as clean as it should be, there was no phone by the bed, so every time I had to make a call I had to hobble out of bed all the way to the other side of the room. the bed was actually blocking the entrance and not only could I barely get my luggage in, when I ordered room service the attendant literally had to move my entire bed to even get into the room. I called the front desk and explained my dissatisfaction. They told me they could not do anything, but could change my room the next day……I went to change rooms the next day – still no balcony facing the water, but I did have a very dirty window that had a very clear view of the ocean. There were several hair strands on the bed and in the bathroom (gross) there was rust and stains all through the bathroom, dirt on the curtains, spider/cobb webs on the window seals. Also lets talk about the toilet. Honestly it was the loudest toilet flushing to the point that in the middle of the night when my sister went to use the bathroom it actually woke me up. It also would gurgle throughout the night, we thought it was going to overflow. If this review allows me to upload a video, I am going to include it so you can hear it. Also none of the balconies have screens so If I wanted to open the door and get a breeze I had to deal with bugs as well. The only good things that I can say is Rob- The security guy was amazing, when we first checked in they gave us keys that didn’t work, he immediately brought new keys up to our room, and after dinner wheeled me back up to my room so I would not have to hobble. Eli at the front desk was great as well. Also I do have to say that the room service (breakfast) was amazing. If I would have spent $200 a night I think this would be unacceptable but to spend almost $1000 (1k) per night is unbelievable, The biggest waste of money I have every spent. Either way I am quite upset that I spent $2000 for two nights of no full views from the balcony, dirty room, rusted floors, spiderwebs, dirty curtains, and someone else’s hair in my bed and bathroom.. If this is the quality of hotels that are acceptable to the Marriott, then Needless to say I am pretty much done with Marriott.

we stay here often with our young daughter. older hotel but friendly staff, good restaurants, nice pools and right across from the beach. in between rooms at the moment as the staff is accomodating a room request for us, thank you!

The hotel was pretty nice, it seems like they have recently renovated and they have done a great job. The only complaint would be the noise of the plumbing, you can never fix that in an old building but everything else was great.

As I sit by the pool at 1 pm waiting for the sun to appear I wonder who designed this - the 2 puny pools are in perpetual shade until 1 pm The hotel itself is in a great location albeit in dire need of updating as it’s still stuck with 70’s materials and looks very worn No special elite treatment

My husband and I stayed one night before our cruise. The room was great and the staff was attentive. The hotel was close to restaurants, bars and the beach. We could see the beach from our balcony. We would stay there again.

Be sure to read small print when getting a Flight/room package through Marriott.com. Our 7 nights will not get any points on our Marriott card. Additionally room charges won't get the10X because it was a Marriot vacation package. The hotel was great, super room, excellent conciage and restuarants.

Visited here in December. On check in were told we would also have to pay an extra $39 + taxes on check out - we thought we had paid it all... Room had very limited ocean views although we had paid for ocean views. Door on bathroom was noisy and difficult to shut. Sheets were not changed every day which was disappointing. We were also never given the right amount of towels and had to constantly ask for them. We also had to ask for tea in the room. There was a coffee machine that you could make tea in, but it tasted like coffee. The room was tired, the painting needed to be updated. The pillows were also very uncomfortable. With the amount of hotels in Honolulu I would think this should be better service etc. We had drinks at the bar on the third floor and each time the staff were rude and even argued with us. Would not recommend!

My 5th stay (2-9 Dec 17) at this property as a Platinum Elite since 2013, my previous posts have been deleted. Majority of the time I get upgraded when I check into Marriott. My last stay here was Dec 2015 (mediocre write up). Mobile check in so they knew I was arriving late, checked in at 23:30 Saturday night. After asking about upgrade, a room was available but not till Tuesday. My first room was located at Paoakalani Tower with a view of Diamond Head. Upgrade room was located at Kealohilani Tower with a view of Tikis Grill & Bar and beach.Management really needs to train everyone in how to better handle customers and more importantly your PLATINUM ELITE CUSTOMERS that stay with your hotel on business. Your check in staff is the face of this property. Your staff at breakfast were phenomenal. I've stayed at all four Marriott locations on Oahu.The reason I stay here is their awesome breakfast, weight room, running routes and close to beach for 1-2 hrs of surf/SUP time.9-16 Dec I was at Kaua'i Marriott in Lihue, Wow! You can learn from them.

Marriott resort is the best at Waikiki beach great location U can walk to almost every where,friendly staff, price good too , like you paid 3star$$ stay 5 Star hotel. Also Starbucks 2 abc store inside hotel。we will be back

We had a great stay at the Marriott, loved the location at the Diamond Head end of the beach. Beach out the front was more peaceful than further down in Waikiki.Concierge (particularly Amanda) was a wonderful help. Booking us a couple of tours, amazing days! And also offering wonderful info for us on other things of interest to us.Would highly recommend Waikiki Beach Marriott

We had a room with a lovely view of Waikiki beach looking West with incredible sunset views. The room is nice and well appointed. They are in the process of starting a room update...and it is probably time (before it gets worn looking). The bathrooms are currently small but I am told those will change a bit. The resort sits directly across the street from the beach but you can check-out beach chairs to take across for the day. There was entertainment in the pool bar area each night with live music.I would stay here again without hesitation. The staff was wonderful and helpful!

We stayed here two nights and really enjoyed the hotel. We received a room upgrade and had a wonderful view of the water and Diamond Head. Though the hotel is an older building, like much of Honolulu, it is very well maintained. The food options were good, including a great breakfast buffet. The employees were good and service was fast and friendly, considering how busy they were.

I have been staying at this property for over 3 months as a Platinum Elite for at least 2-3 weeks at a time. The quality of my stay is really determined when I check in. Without listing names I will say the front desk staff is pretty rude when it comes to discussing upgrades or room changes. There have been several times where we have a discussion and they are very stand-off ish and cut you off in mid sentence. Management really needs to train everyone in how to better handle customers and more importantly your PLATINUM ELITE CUSTOMERS that stay with your hotel weekly.The one person I will rave about is Lani (sorry if I spelled that wrong). After the lady that checked me in rudely told me there was nothing she could do in terms of an upgrade or anything else and cut me off real quick, Lani was willing to hear me out, acknowledge my status, and get me upgraded halfway through my stay. This meant wonders for me because I was in HNL for 4 weeks on business staying at the property and my mother came for the last week for her first time in Hawaii. Everyone should shoot to demonstrate the respect and kindness that Lani has. Keep it up Lani!!

We very much enjoyed our recent 2-night stay at the Marriott Waikiki Beach. Our flight arrived late in the evening and it was a delight to receive a complimentary upgrade to an Ocean view room, a pleasant surprise and a wonderful start to our Hawaiian adventure. Our front desk attendant was very friendly and welcoming. The room was nicely appointed and comfortable. We enjoyed the pleasing décor of the hotel but its location across the street to Waikiki Beach was the main reason for booking this property. Catching my first ever glance of Waikiki Beach from the lovely balcony was a memory I will never forget. Having the lobby entrance be separate from where all the tours / taxis departed from was also convenient. We enjoyed a couple of meals at their Moana Terrace poolside grill, especially their complimentary Mai Tai punches. All staff we encountered was warm and friendly. The only glitch was a billing issue I discovered a few days after we checked out. The timing of this error was most inconvenient, but sometimes these things happen. The best we can expect is for someone to make it right and I was very happy with how the staff handled this matter. The cruise terminal is a short 15-20 minute drive away so it is very convenient for anyone cruising from Honolulu. I would recommend this property to anyone visiting Honolulu. Cheers from Miami, FL.

Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and SpaI have to say this has been my favorite Marriott I have stayed at yet. Close contenders are the Sedona Marriott and the Residence Inn San Diego Downtown/Bayfront Marriott. I base this on many factors including location, physical facilities, staff friendliness/helpfulness, and amenities. The Waikiki resort started me off a skeptical. Unfortunately, the first staff member we dealt with checking in was not very friendly (check in staff at Waikoloa Hilton on the Big Island was super nice and helpful.) It just seemed like she didn’t want to be there. Everyone has bad days, I will strike it up to that. After that first contact almost every staff member we came in contact was super friendly and helpful. The breakfast wait staff ladies were lovely always checking if you needed anything and bringing juice for the kids and coffee when needed. The morning hostess there seemed very serious and not very personable either (besides the lady at check in, this was the only other employee that stood out as not being very pleasant.) Luckily the wait staff made up for the hostess. The concierge staff was excellent. We talked to the concierge people on several occasions. They were always friendly and helpful. They offered great advice on activities and made bookings easy. Their recommendations were spot on! The rooms were very nice and pleasant. The workout room was fantastic! Surly the biggest gym in a hotel I have ever stayed at. They have floorspace areas for cardio/body weight workouts, free weights, machine weights, and of course countless cardio machines. The second or third floor (can’t remember exactly) has the workout room and a huge open area patio. And I mean huge, the workout room is at one end and the patio café/bar is at the other. The patio has two swimming pools and a hot tub between those areas. There was plenty of lounging chairs for people to relax and sunbathe in on the patio. Our kids loved the pool and the adults loved the hot tub. I even got in the pool after my kids told me it was really warm. Now I have fallen for that in the past and of course was shocked by the cold water. Not so here, I got from the hot tub into the pool and was immediately surprised by how pleasant it was. The patio café/bar was an excellent place to hang out in the evenings drinking a Mai Tai and enjoying the warm air and coastal scenery. The downstairs lobby area was spacious and very nice. The Marriott basically takes up a city block. On the ground floor in addition to the Marriott they had ABC stores and Starbucks Cafes (two of each on either side of the building if I am remembering correctly. There was also some small gift shops and an Enterprise car rental kiosk there. Right across the street was a Wolfgang Puck Express where grabbed some quick tasty meals on a few occasions. There are several restaurants within walking distance and you are directly across the street from the beach. The buffet breakfast was included in our Costco vacation package and it was spectacular. They had eggs to order and lots of other food choices.Probably the only negative side to this location (and it wouldn’t matter what hotel you stayed in) was the noisy city. Early mornings the garbage trucks were out banging around emptying dumpsters. And you have people yelling and screaming out in the street on occasion. But it is the same in most major cities. And you are in Hawaii, sooooo, that kind of cancels out the negative stuff, LoL.

Wife and I stayed there for a week in a partial ocean view room. It is a beautiful hotel full of shops (two ABC stores[small convenience stores with everything you might need]). Located at the end of Waikiki just across the street from the beach. Didn't really deal with the staff much as we weren't in the hotel except to sleep. Did have an initial issue with housekeeping about enough soap but right after we mentioned it they started providing enough soap, body lotion, shampoo and conditioner to open a small boutique by the end of the week. The staff at the front desk were always friendly and helpful the few times we did need them. Only drawback, and this is not the hotels' fault, is the enormous amount of homeless living on the beach and sidewalks adjacent to the beach. That is a problem Honolulu needs to deal with if they want to have a tourist friendly atmosphere.

We booked a cruise of Hawaii through NCL who kindly booked us pre cruise nights stay at this hotel. Did not expect much but we were given a huge room with balcony which was quite nice. This hotel is at the end of Waikiki near Diamond Head. Lots of restaurants if you go for a walk. The breakfast here was good. NCL organised pick up of our suitcases and coach transport for us to the ship. Good experience, thanks.

Hope you are lucky enough to have Lani at the front desk and Florence serve you in the Kuhio Beach Grill. Located on Kalakaua Ave, this hotel is right across the street from the beach. They have two buildings - Kealohilani Tower is closest to the beach; Paoakalani Tower is not ocean front but still has great views. We were entitled to an upgrade in the K tower but none were available. Lani worked her magic and gave us a suite in the P tower. The suite is phenomonal and more than made up for not having an ocean front room. If you hit the Kuhio Beach Grill for breakfast, Florence is a wonderful server. She's been there many years. Because of them, this hotel has become a new favorite for us when visiting Waikiki. We can be sure of having a clean and well-appointed room even if it is not a suite.

The hotel is beautiful and the location can't be beat. It's at the quieter end of Waikiki but a short walk to everything. I'm a little biased; being Marriott Gold we were upgraded to a room with views of Diamondhead and the ocean. The food was very expensive, even for Waikiki but we loved the hotel and location overall.

My husband and I came back here for the 4rth time last month. We had a corner oceanfront room on the 23rd floor. The views were unbeatable!! Our house keeper Luticia was so sweet and thoughtful. The restaurants at The Marriott are so delish we ate at 3 twice each!! Ivy and her staff at DK Steak are always so friendly and welcoming. The food is so good. We booked my birthday dinner here befor even leaving . Wagyu Carpaccio and the Shrimp Scampi are amazing!! The steaks literally melt in your mouth! We ate at Arancino's 2 nights as well. Doug the manager was so friendly and kind we enjoyed talking to him. The arancini siciliani, the clams in white wine, the seafood linguini were all exceptional but I'm still dreaming about the shrimp, onion and garlic pizza!! A must!! We had a roast beef and king crab leg buffet also the breakfast buffet at the Kuhio Grill all was really good. Everything you need or want is in walking distance to this hotel. Had no trouble getting pool chairs in the sun or shade every afternoon.

WE stayed here in November 2017. Like the typical Marriott our first room we checked into was not correct. We had paid for a king and were put into two beds. A quick call to the front desk and all was corrected. But the king room we were provided had a strong mold smell. We were only in town for one night at the Waikiki shell so we put up with the smell. Had we been staying for several nights it would have been an issue. Proximity to the beach, Waikiki shell, and shopping was great. Both rooms appeared to be very clean and in good working order. They were small rooms but had a great view of diamond head. The pool area seemed to be appropriately sized for the number of guests. While this property is not my first choice in Waikiki it is a good option for the cost.

the rooms are nice, staff is great, lots of nice restaurants, very nice lobby and facilities, and superb gym. it is right across from the beach and the views are terrific. The breakfast is also top rate but very expensive if you are not elite member.

I stayed five weekend and weekend nights at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa. I have had the experience of staying at several Marriott Resort properties in my 800+ Marriott nights over the years. I believe I've finally cured myself of the desire to stay at them. Between the resort fees which offer little value in exchange for the cost, the properties tend to be well used, which is a euphemism. The large property is located directly across the street from a pleasant beach with a sea wall offering young and old the opportunity to enjoy the water without the full effect of waves. In terms of location, it's situated at the terminus of Kalakaua Avenue, which is essentially the main center of attraction in Waikiki. It's a short walk to the zoo and to all of the upscale shoppes and boutiques.In terms of accommodation, the hotel leaves much to be desired. It's immediately obvious that rooms were last updated in the 1990s or early 2000s. The rooms are clean and comfortable, of course, but they offer little in style that one would expect from a Marriott property. It's clearly a property that is past its prime. I moved to this location after a few nights at another Marriott property nearby and wish I would've stayed where I was. The hotel is easily avoidable on future visits and so I shall do so.My biggest disappointment with the stay was that I had to do battle with the staff regarding my Lifetime Platinum upgrade. Note to management: it's not an upgrade to offer the same room with a different view, no matter how it's spun. After flexing muscles with reservations, I was able to secure a very modest upgrade to a larger room. What's most disappointing is that I checked hotel availability daily and there were suites available each day, yet I was told by staff each day that I asked that none was to be had. I've encountered this duplicity at other properties over the years. I suspect it's the misguided policy of local management, as Customer Services, which soon will be getting my complaint, has always been rather gracious to compensate me when I've received this treatment.

The hotel overall is very nice but their additional charges are outrageous.The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. There is new carpet (in the hallways as well). TV has Netflix and Hulu if you have an account. Lobby is awesome.. Very open with ample tables and chairs to sit and drink coffee. They have a small shopping mall, ABC stores, gift shops, clothing stores, Starbucks etc. Two small pools with a nice bar. Decent fitness center. Easy to pop into the gym and get beach towels to take with you for the day. Several good restaurants including DK Steak House. The Marriott is very close to all the action and has great views of Waikiki. Please note that in addition to your room rate you will be charged $21 per day transient tax and $36 per day resort fee. If you are renting a car they charge $40 per day to park.

The people are friendly and welcoming, the room was clean and inviting (dated), overall not bad. The breakfast buffet was good and they had very nice shops and restaurants on the property.The problems are: I was expecting the hotel to be on the beach, there is a resort fee but I'm not sure what it covers since there are no resort features associated with this property, seems like a way to charge more for the room. There are no water bottles in the rooms, coffee service but no cups, and to order room service for a pot of coffee takes more than 45 minutes. If you have a balcony, other people use the balcony to smoke so the smell wafts into your room. I booked an ocean front view but they put me on the side, although a nice view of Diamond Head, not much of an ocean view.

We stayed at Marriott for 12 days. Very nice hotel and clean. Good location, ABC store and Starbucks inside. However, 12 days in Honolulu was too much. Expensive destination, too many homeless people around and bad smell in the street.

not a typical marriott property. there are two towers, one obviously much older than the other. our room was in the older tower and it showed.....dramatically. i travel quite a bit for work and this property needs a facelift. silicone caulk in tub/shower area was so old it had started to peel away from the enclosure. carpet was so worn that it had ridges very visible and paint which i assume was once white was yellowed. additionally, the staff seemed very cold and distant with our group. as i said, not a typical marriott property and not one i would return to.

Great curtomer service. The team at the front office, bellman and concierge are very welcoming and friendly. They take away your tiredness from a long trip. They are very familiar with the area and can give you the best direction in the city. They treat you like a family and are honest about your accommodation. The housekeepers are so proud of their workplace and speak highly of their superiors.. A complete workout room with everything you need for every muscle group. The steak house is comparable to the local steak house with a dash of friendly staff. The property is looking to have a renovation next year and we are looking forward to our next stay. Mahalo to the staff...

My family and I stayed at this hotel the whole week of Thanksgiving. Overall, we had a very comfortable stay, in this nicely run hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean with a nice balcony that overlooks the water. The biggest plus is very quick access to the Waikiki beach!

Very nice staff, from the parking crew to the room service. All good. I stay in the area a lot and this is my #1 pick in Honolulu! Walk to beach, close to great shopping and sites of interest. Highly recommend this property.

Visited for the first time in 2004. This place is comfortable. Nice bed that provides a great sleep. It is also in a very handy location. The pools are adequate and there is a decent sized hot tub available. The rooms are loud though (the doors/windows are old and require replacement/repair). They do not close properly (no seal) so it sounds like you've left your door open a crack. If you've been to Waikiki, you will know that this is not a quiet place. The tiki bar below could be heard for hours while trying to sleep. Despite that, the beds are superb, so you do get a good sleep - just remember to bring your ear plugs! ;)

Great location & views, staff are professional and warm. The rooms are ok but in dire need of refurbishment. Beddings were quite acceptable. This hotel is across the road from Waikiki beach and best suits travellers who prefer big hotels

Some times the service of a place and the expectations to your stay happens as soon as you're in contact with the hotel's reservation office. For our visit in December, Lynn from their customer service has been giving a service beyond our expectations and if her service is even just slightly a reflection of the hotel itself, we can look forward to our stay.

Great hotel with very friendly staff. Many restaurants to choose from with nighttime live music by the pool. Pools are smaller than I️ expected and shaded part of the day...but the beach is right across the street.

My wife and I honeymooned in Hawaii with NCL (cruise.) We arrived later than expected to the Marriott and Enterprise had just closed minutes before our arrival. Phillip, the Enterprise representative, unlocked the door and allowed my wife and I inside the office, and proceeded to process our rental car. Phillip demonstrated exemplary customer service, as he could have easily turned us away. This particular gesture by Phillip meant a great deal to me personally, because it allowed my wife and I to visit the Marine Corps. Air Base where I had grown up. Phillip provided the customer service families pray for when vacationing to Hawaii!!

Great location along Waikiki Beach. Short walk to the International Marketplace. Our room had an awesome balcony with a full view of Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed a beautiful sunset from the room. Updated oversized room. The bar in the pool area is a great place to meet up with friends. Hotel staff was very helpful. There is an ABC store in the lobby just in case you forgot anything. I would book this room again.

Beds and pillows are comfortable. You control you own heat/air. The room was clean but given the furniture and carpet stains it felt kind of dirty. Sofa bed in the room but no sheets or pillows to make into a bed. Well lit but very few wall switches to turn them on. Internal and external walls lack sound proofing—you can hear toilets flush and people talking inside and music and cars outside... Fairly good free WiFi. Tv volume only changes in increments of 5 bars which kind of makes it too quiet or loud. No bathroom controllable exhaust fan. Plenty of Hot water. Water pressure is ok, but not braggable, and the adjustable shower head setting helps to compensate. NCL desk was inconveniently closed when we arrived at 5:30pmish. Note, NCL does not give you shuttle to the hotel from the airport unless you specifically pay extra, we cabbed it to the hotel for about $50. One of the NCL agents told us it was included with the free prestay the night before the cruise...it’s not... Good view of ocean. Good location with access to restaurants, ships, and ocean activities.

We stayed for two nights in Oahu and chose the Marina Resort due to the proximity to Waikiki Beach. Unfortunately, we arrived very early from Australia and got to the check in counter at about 10.30am. We were not able to check in but they stored our bags and we tried to pass the time although we were very tired. It took until 3.15 before we could get to our room and it was definitely worth the wait. Our view was great, the room was well looked after and the kitchen was very useful. The downside is the air conditioning is very loud and clicks on and off through the night.The fitness centre was okay with basic cardio equipment and gym machines. No free weights makes getting a good workout difficult.The staff were nice but you didn't get a real engagement from them as you didn't see them much. The one other downside is that due to this hotel being a time share, when you check in they will try to sell you an information session. That's the last thing you want after flying 17 hours with no sleep.

Came here for business. Checked into a room at 1 am that had a serious mold/mildew smell. I called the front desk and asked them to move me in the morning. The did, no questions asked. Set me up in a much nice room, then brought champagne and snacks and a nice nite from Guest Services apologizing. It was unnecessary but made an impression. You cannot entirely avoid problems but when they do crop up your reaction says a lot about your standards. In his instance, I could not have been better cared for, thank you Marriott. There are some observations about the reader of my stay:--Location - excellent, right across the street from the beach. Took a swim every day.easy stroll down the braved to opts of shops and restaurants and a phenomenal view of all of the beach from upper floors.--Rooms - very spacious in Kealohilani Tower. Ask for Hi floor and the deluxe ocean view. Two chairs and a lounger on each balcony, so lots of comfort--WiFi - a bit spotty.--Pool - small for such a big hotel. No shade unless you pay for a cabana, although they were putting out a couple of umbrellas the day I was leaving so maybe that has changed--Dining options are very plentiful I ate at the sushi restaurant twice and it was excellent.I would stay at this hotel again if I was in Waikiki again but honestly, I would not go out of my way to come back to Waikiki. Lovely weather and nice views but the area generally is very busy, crammed with tourists (and this was not the busy season), not terribly safe and quite expensive.

Pros- Awesome location right on Waikiki beach.Good toiletries provided.Beautiful view from the ocean facing room.Excellent variety of breakfast. Very good staff at the restaurant. Awesome view overlooking the beach. Endless variety of food n beverages.Very close to bars and eating joints.Cons- Bathrooms are very old and small. Definitely need to make them better.Even though I am a gold member, they charge $ 45 parking which is crazy. I don’t see any reason for elite members to pay for parking.Pool isn’t great at all. Other than that still a wonderful stay !!

While I agree with other reviewers that mentioned the need for room refresh (particularly the carpet), I really enjoyed my stay here. The valets were always quick and friendly and I thought the location was great. I had a room with a beach view so that wiped away any negative thoughts very quickly. The hotel gym was well equipped.The on-site restaurant on the 2nd floor had a great breakfast buffet and I had dinner there on multiple occasions. As I recall the dinner buffet (which was a tremendous spread of different foods every night) was tasty and a really good value (for Hawaii) as it was around $40/person. Even the deserts that usually look great but have no taste were yummy.Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here back in 2010 and came back. Hotel hasnt changed at all. It really needs updating. First time i went the service was great so i came back but the service is however really poor. Concierge was unhelpful and didnt provivde us with the best information. I booked a trip through concerige and realise it was just cheaper to book it myslef. The $35 resort fee is a rip off i feel as the hotel is outdated and offer standard services. I dont think i would stay here in ther futire as other hotels in Waikiki offer better facilities and services for a cheaper rate

Stayed here for one night prior to getting on a cruise. Very nice right next to waikiki beach. A lot of good food and shopping right outside the door. Touristy for sure but nice. Would stay here again.

Among the sacrifices one must make when it comes to business travel is suffering through the burden of having to travel to a place like Honolulu. That was how it was for me recently, and this Marriott was the logical location for the stay. So sarcasm aside, Hawaii is a lovely place to visit no matter the reason for the trip, and that's true even in exceptionally touristy Waikiki. This Marriott is across the street from Waikiki Beach, and a short walk from all the shopping and what-not you'd ever want (including an Apple Store, which was handy since my iPhone died while I was there). This hotel has not one, but two ABC Stores on the main floor in case you have a need for an Aloha shirt, bottle of wine, Spam Musubi, or a taste of ice cream. (If you've been to Waikiki, you'll understand the joke there.) The property itself is nice, especially considering that it was built in 1968, and last renovated in 2008. The rooms do seem to show nearly a decade of wear, but have been well maintained. About my only complaint was the fact that one of the two sliding glass doors in my room was rough and hard to open. But given the exquisite views of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach from my high floor, corner room in the Paoakalani Tower? It was easy to overlook. Comfy beds and a reasonably quiet environment rounded-out a good experience. Wouldn't hesitate to return there in the future. One more tip: While the food and drink are expensive, just indulge, understand you're at a resort in Hawaii, and enjoy. Also, try the Musubi Wild Ahi Poke at the Moana Terrace poolside bar and grill... Wow!

We enjoyed our stay at this property. My husband is a gold premier rewards member due to work travel so we were able to book an ocean side with balcony through his points. We were traveling with 3 other couples and were instructed to jump through a number of hoops so our reservations would be linked (which we did). When we checked in, only one of our friends had a a room anywhere near our room with the other 2 scattered separately in other parts of the hotel. It's a huge property so it would have been nice to be at least in the same area. We did the breakfast buffet one morning and it was really busy. It was a nice buffet but without the coupon for one free breakfast per day through the rewards program, it would not be worth the cost.

My wife and I decided to stop off in Hawaii for a few days to break up the flight from Auckland, NZ on our way home to Seattle. First time I stay at this Marriott and our stay was exceptional and outstanding. They really know how to treat a guest well.The hotel has anything you need, is well operated and the staff are exceptionally friendly. They really make you feel at home. Kudos to the staff. Give them a raise for going well beyond what is expected for excellent service.The beach is right across the street, Our room had a great view of the ocean. It has a great pool, several restaurants, a great concierge service.Stay here! You will not be disappointed,

Stayed here before flying down to the Big Island. Room was a great size and beds comfortable. The location is great, to hit the beach you just cross the street, or for shopping just exit right!The bathrooms are a bit dated, but nothing that bad.Hotel has a Starbucks if you want a cheap breakfast. The gym is excellent, potentially one of the best hotel gyms I've been too. It's great if you're struggling with jet lag and need to get back on track. It's also popular, so don't go at 6am expecting to be the only person.I'd stay at the hotel again as I think the location is great.

Very positive - Our check in was very positive because of the wonderful lady at the reception desk who helped us get a room earlier than the usual check in time. She was very understanding that we had a baby with us. As a result she also upgraded us to a better room and better view. It really made our stay with a little one much better especially since we ended up spending a lot of time in the room. The negatives for a 5 star hotel chain - service from the gents in the pool bar and some of the restaurants was disappointing. They came across as arrogant and unhelpful for a expensive hotel. Decor of the rooms looked outdated, the vibe in the pool bar area was boring compared to other hotels in Waikiki. I recommend staying on one of the hotels further north of Waikiki and that aren’t part of a big hotel chain

Flew from Australia overnight and arrived around 9 am at the hotel. Requested an early check in via e-mail. Upon arrival we were told room would not be ready until 3 pm. Knew about laundry facility at the Marriott so went up to the 3rd floor and did a couple loads of laundry. Back down to the front desk and room still not ready! This is a very large hotel and others were seen getting room keys. Went back to front desk looking very tired and weary and finally got a room. Only stayed 1 night as this was a pre-cruise arrangement. Beach across the street is small but breakwall makes it calm. Lots of homeless people sleeping on the benches. Saw a purse snatched while a couple was sitting at a small cafe. ABC store nearby. Harley store on the corner. Overall this hotel met our needs getting to the ship on time but I don't think we would stay in Waikiki next time.

Okay, I think you can tell from the title that this was the hotel we stayed in for 3 nights before we took our cruise on Norwegian Cruise lines Pride of America. With that said, the cruise line knew when we were arriving, had someone at the airport to pick us up (they met us in the luggage claim area) and they presented us with leis. All very nice, but I suspect the Marriott had nothing to do with the pick up service.We arrived at about 11 AM on a Wednesday morning and were surprised when our spacious room on the 16th floor of one of the towers was ready. The beds were comfortable and the room was spotless. We had a private balcony overlooking the St Augustine Church and a view of Waikiki Beach (see photo).We decided to eat in restaurants outside the hotel as the hotel restaurants menus were a bit high priced. On our trip from the airport to the hotel, the driver gave us some tips of places to eat which and we used tripadvisor to search for others. We did save some money by doing this and found some decent food as well.We did have drinks and lunch on the afternoon of our arrival at the beach side bar.which cost us over $70 including tip (reviewed in restaurants).On Friday evening, the last night of our stay, we decided to do some laundry because we still had another 9 days of trip in front of us. Fortunately, the hotel does have a laundry which isn't cheap ($4/load for the washer, $4/load for the dryer and another couple of bucks for the soap and fabric softener). While doing that, my wife read a book and I dropped by the bar by the beach, grabbed a couple of drinks and brought them back to the laundry which was a short walk from the bar! HOW CONVENIENT!We did some shopping in the hotel shops for gifts for our two toddler grandkids.The rooms were made up every day. We were out on Cruise line arranged excursions on Thursday, Friday and Saturday and the last excursion dropped us off at the Cruise ship. We choose to go out in the morning for breakfast and at night for dinner rather than eat in the hotel restaurants.Because this was part of the cruise package, we checked out by leaving our luggage and the keys in the room. The cruise line picked them up on Saturday and delivered them to our room on the ship (which wasn't quite a spacious).We walked by the pool (at the bar by the beach) and it looked very nice and it appeared the bar delivered drinks to your chair by the pool.Not a bad stay but not sure how much it added to the price of our cruise since it was all combined. I would consider this a luxury hotel.

We spent two weeks at this hotel and it was terrific. At check in after a long day of flying the front desk clerk Anna made checking into the hotel both easy and fun. That is no small feat when dealing with people who have just spent 9 hours flying and 12 hours total in transit. She made sure we could find our way around the hotel, provided a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room since we were Elite Rewards members, explained we had vouchers for the breakfast buffet daily, and generally made us feel welcome. The room was clean comfortable with a great bed nice ocean view good wide screen TV and great air conditioner. The bell captains were courteous and helpful. The only complaint would be the lack of shade at the pool but otherwise it was a nice place to relax and have a drink or a light meal. Service was good and the food was typical pool bar fare. We would recommend this Marriott property. The breakfast buffet was great. We did not eat at the other onsite restaurants

I booked this place merely because of its location, which was perfect. Roland at the front desk gave us many recommendations on places to go and shortcuts to take. We appreciated his help and was our buddy during our stay! The rooms were great and views are amazing! Everyone was very friendly and the beds were very comfortable. Enjoy!

This hotel has great ambiance. It is clean and look fresh. Check in was easy and efficient. The rooms are clean and well appointed.The bars served a decent drink. They har a variety of shops and restaurants on premises for anything you could want. We tried ocean view bar for food and drinks and were quite happy with both the fish tacos and the prime rib dip sandwiches. All was fresh and perfect temperature. The view was outstanding. Service was terrific and attentive. We liked this hotel very much, but its very expansive complex and easy to get lost. A lot of walking from South to North Towers.

Stayed last week and LOVED this hotel. Premium Ocean View Room offered views of Ocean and Diamond Head from the 22nd floor. Room had what we needed, the only odd thing was the bathroom setup...toilet and shower in closed off area fronted by sinks and mirror not closed off to room. Would have liked a door on the sinks/mirror area.Other than that: check in was a breeze, Moana Terrace had decent food and amazing sunset views. Two of the restaurants (DK and Sansei Sushi) had fantastic food.The beach across from the hotel in Waikiki is very nice for family and kids, no waves as it's walled off a bit from the ocean. Clean, clear water and great temp. Housekeeping did a great job for us, room was tidied every day while we were out. Shopping at the hotel is nice, quite a few stores to choose from.Tip: you want Starbucks in the morning? Go to the one near the Italian restaurant instead of in the lobby.

We stayed on the north shore for a few days in a rental. After there was not much to do, we decided to stay here. First off, you’re going to pay parking $40/day and resort fees $35/day, no matter where you stay in the area. Trust me, we looked at multiple hotels and that’s just the going rate. Personally I would be able to rent a car for a few days, then you can get around on foot, bus, shuttle, taxi if you really wanted to go somewhere. If you’re that cheap to not pay parking you could make it work. The beach across the street had fewer homeless people compared to closer to the city, so that was nice. There’s beach chair, surfboard and other equipment rental. There’s stores in the bottom for food, gifts, souvenirs. The pool chairs were comfortable. It was nice having beach towels for use. The views were great even in the back tower. We were on the 32nd floor way above the other buildings. Loved our stay!

Very accommodating receptionists. They have nice rooms. Their WiFi connects right away if you’d been to other marriot hotels. There’s no airport shuttle that’s free. The concierge informed us that it’ll cost $16 per person to go get into the hotel’s shuttle to airport. We decided to get GOGO shuttle instead as it is only $12/person to the airport. The lobby was nice except that when it rained the whole seating area was soaked. There’s a Starbucks at the lobby, pretty cool to have your coffee right there. Housekeeping was great she cleaned our room very nice replaced new towels just great. The complimentary shampoo conditioner etc were kinda short for the two of us. The room has safe.
user_name:
Nikki R
New York City, New York

review_body: There are plenty nice restaurants near by, Tiki’s Grill & Bar for one. The ABC stores are everywhere in Hawaii and close to this hotel in case you have forgotten anything. The beach is just across the street with several benches to watch the surfers and activity. Great choice for hotel. Even our city view room let us have a view of the ocean. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Still very busy but near where we had several functions to attend. The hotel has a great ground floor area with check in. Our room had an ocean view, which we loved, but the carpet was torn and needed replacing. The bathroom was nice but overall, the whole place could have used an update.

Welcome to energy.eto review. We are experienced travellers. Our goal is to provide an exciting feedback based upon our expected (what we were looking for) experience: short stay, romantic stay or business stay. The review normally consists of a quick summary (energy.eto Review), a more detailed infographic (energy.eto Info) and some great additional location pictures (@energy.eto on Instagram).Introduction- expected experience: romantic stay- stay: 7 nightsenergy.eto ReviewJust cross the hall and you will really be feeling at Hawaii! Excellent position, good maintenance despite the age and everything you need to enjoy your relaxing vacation. We had the overall amazing feeling to be back to the 80s/90sFor more exciting details please view our attached infographic: energy.eto InfoWhat was awesome: atmosphereWhat will probably be awesome in the future: bathroomDid you enjoy our review? Please mark this useful here and follow us on Instagram @energy.eto

Our room was nice size and had 2 large beds. It was very clean and was ready when we arrived. It was right off the beach and had several restaurants in close proximity. The staff was helpful and courteous and it was a pleasure to stay one night prior to boarding the Pride of American Cruise ship.

Just in Honolulu for work and stayed at Marriott Waikiki. Hotel is in great condition with swimming baths straight across road, diamond head mountain to the left and a short stroll to restaurants. Rooms are clean, tidy and staff are very friendly and helpful.Keep up the great work.Mahalo

Stayed here for one night before going on the pride of America cruise and then for 3 nights when we got back, went to check in and to start with was giving the room number for the store cupboard and then given a room someone else was staying in. Was not happy about this so asked to speak to a manager who rectified this for us by giving us a room upgrade. The beds are amazing I wish I could have spent more time in them and the complimentary Meitei and bottle of champain went down a treat. Would go back in heart beat if it wasn't so far away.

We stayed for 8 nights in the Marriott Waikiki Beach in the Paokalani Tower ( or second tower) on the 33rd floor (top floor). The room had ocean views towards Diamond Head and was very large with two Queen beds and a well appointed bathroom. For a lengthy stay, it was ideal given that this was the last part of a month long trip. The room was well maintained throughout our stay, although the walls are fairly thin and you can hear the conversations of neighbours in adjoining rooms. We went as part of a Luxury Escape and this gave us a few extras - particularly important was a two for one breakfast voucher booklet as this is very expensive without them. The Marriott is well positioned at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach, just a little out of the very crowded central part of the strip. The Marriott is a huge complex with good facilities (although the pools are small considering the number of rooms) and there are a number of good bars and restaurants nearby. We enjoyed our stay.

I went to Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa in July 2017.Since my flight from Nagoya-JP arrive very early morning, 10am the team in front desk gave me a room.The room was always very good cleaned.The restaurants in hotel was very good.The breakfast was little expensive, but very good.The hotel was in the front to Waikiki Beach, few steps. To leve at night to dinner, it was very close everywhere.I bought a trip to Pear Harbor in hotel (Expedia) and was perfect.

Without even asking the lady at the checkin found a room at 9am for us. I was really jet lagged and it showed and she was so helpful and pleasant. There were 2 double beds in this modern room ...very comfy and we slept for hours. Large flat TV ..nice lounge desk and chair..Nice bathroom with shower over the bath and big fluffy towels. We were in the back tower but could see the ocean from the balcony. We didn't have breakfast as it was expensive at $34 each and we are not big breakie eaters. We didn't use the pool but looked inviting.

Recently stayed here for four nights after a cruise from Vancouver.What an excellent place to stay on Waikiki Beach. It is situated at the far end of the strip close to the Aquarium, Zoo and Diamond Head crater but within easy walking distance to all Waikiki offers. For trips further afield the area is well provided for by local buses at a rate of $5 for a 24hour period.The hotel is equipped with two pools which though not huge were suitable for our needs. The pool area looks better in real life than the hotels photo’s show.Restaurants are well provided on site covering everything you would need.We arrived for our wedding anniversary and were provided with champagne and chocolate covered strawberries which was a nice touch. I think the ladies name was Yoko who sent these up so thank you from both of us.With excellent rooms and great views of the sea from room 22 I thoroughly recommend a holiday at this Marriott.

This hotel is well located across from the beach at Waikiki, and a short walk from the Zoo.Bedrooms were well appointed and spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds.Checkin was easy dispite arriving before noon, and our room was ready.Waikiki is expensive in all aspects and the prices here reflected this in the cost of dining.Our only drawback was that in the pool area there was no seating in the shade unless you paid for a cabana at $75 per day.Service was very good especially from the front desk and bell staff.A good place to stay, at a first rate location.

This hotel is towards the end of the Waikiki shopping district. Very close to plenty of restaurants. Just know that it is not actually on the beach. It is right across the street. Unless you get a room in the front tower you dont really get a great beach view. Also, there are quote a few homeless people in this area so be careful walking around at odd hours.

Nice big hotel. Very competent and friendly staff. I really appreciate two comfy chairs - usually there is just one. Beds and bedding were very nice. I also like the separate sink area, but it should have a towel rack. A magnifying mirror would also be appreciated (I make this particular comment for almost every hotel).Location is great - across from the beach. Staff - I noticed that they were all very attentive and welcoming.

Everything about this hotel was excellent! The staff was so wonderful even offering a boogie board to my daughter that another guest had left behind. We returned it for the next guest. The front desk and valet staff were so helpful with information regarding restaurants, directions and things to do and see. The hotel room was beautiful and clean. The Island is not as crowded or over commercialized as the other islands so it was perfect for our family.

We have 7 nights here at the wonderful Marriott. From when we walked into the lobby, we have had great attention and service. Our room is on the 24th floor and the views are great. Very good sized rooms and the balconies are generous in size too. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. The beach is across the road, so very close.

Oahu was the 3rd island we visited and our second Marriott hotel on the trip. We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott for 2 nights. Our visit didn't start well.
