The Marriott agent I had spoken to when we booked the room had offered late check-out on Friday because we had an early tour and an afternoon flight. The hotel said we would have to wait until Friday to see if that was possible. We wanted a room with a king bed and ended up with a room on an outside corridor on the second floor. The room was sufficient but small. I suspect we were in the old part of the hotel and that the newer rooms were nicer. We had booked with free breakfast and discounted valet parking. Our excellent full breakfast was provided by the Arancino di Mare Italian Restaurant and there are several restaurants within walking distance. The valet parking was easy and convenient. We certainly could not tell we were any where close to a beach from our room.

From check-in to check-out the hotel staff was attentive and took good care of us. This hotel is located right across the street from Waikiki beach and has plenty of places to get shop inside the hotel property. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on property because they are so many great restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. We stayed as part of a precruise package before sailing on the Pride of America. Being able to have our luggage picked up and transported to the pier for us just made things easier for our embarkation. Would happily stay at this location again.

It’s an average Marriott, nothing more. Located across the street from the beach, you need to be careful crossing the street. I thought it’s a difficult hotel to navigate around to find restaurants etc. It’s a nice hotel but well used. Typical of Marriott hotels, the staff was great, very helpful and friendly.

If you want to be in the heart of Waikiki- in the hustle and bustle then I would definitelyl come here! It's a relatively large hotel with 2 pools- one was a quieter/adult pool near the nice gym (lots of cardio machines and weight equipment) and another one near the restaurant/bar.The lobby has an open air type feel and it's beautiful. As you check in you can get a lovely purple Plumeria to tuck behind your ear and they give you a little box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts. The property offers classes and entertainment (hula lessons, yoga classes, lei making classes, etc) which are nice if you can take advange of these! We didn't because we were busy on excursions or in the pool.On the bottom floor of the hotel there are shops, an ABC market, scuba/snorkel gear rental place and you can charge the ABC market items to your room which is nice (add a way of getting more points!). The hotel has a few restaurants, but we only ate at the one near the pool and it was overpriced and not that great. It's super convenient to just order food and drinks while the kids are swimming but I would only take advantage if there's a happy hour. It's not all that great. The hotel is steps away from a ton of restaurants and bars and would definitely go exploring. The people at the concierge were very helpful and helped us book several excursions and I was able to charge the excursions to the room (helping me out get more Marriott points). They gave us some great recommendations and we were not disappointed with any of them!The rooms are a little dated, but they're spacious enough. We were upgraded to a nice suite this time around and it was so nice to have the extra room and the beautiful ocean view! Parking is pretty pricey, but that's the area. I would recommend a car if you want to go exploring. There are so many better beaches than Waikiki Beach that are relatively close (by car of course). If you're a Marriott Elite member (Gold or Platinum) the breakfast buffett is FREE (for 2 adults)! This was an amazing perk as the buffet is delicious! They had an omelet station, fresh fruit, typical hawaiian fare, pastries and other goodies. It was a great way to start the day!I look forward to returning again!

A nice resort hotel in the Aloha state, walking distance to the Honolulu Zoo and easy access to public bus stops, especially to Diamond Head and Hanauma Bay Nature Preserve. It is ideally located next to the Waikiki beach, the main reason that attracted my attention to book this resort hotel. Check-in line was a long wait during the summer time, an extremely busy season. But there's complimentary drinks/water at the lobby and sometimes you can ask for a bottle water at the concierge desk, just remember to greet everyone with "Aloha" and smile at all times. After all, you are there to relax and enjoy the sunshine and beaches. Overall, most of the staff at every department is friendly, professional and willing to go the extra mile. But the location, view and the layout of the 2 swimming pools, are a little disappointing. The pools are not large enough to accommodate so many people in high seasons and they don't offer a great beach view as they are not on the street level. Room 664, city view also offer partial ocean view from the balcony but sometimes it's slightly noisy at night. Be prepared to pay more for a truly ocean view room. Also note the additional daily resort fee.

Here for 6 days. Staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful. Room was clean but the whole hotel is getting tired. My room had multiple wrinkles in the carpet, and the furnishings had a fair number of dings and scratches. Location was excellent and the pool bar has a great view but once in my room I could have been in a Marriott anywhere in the world. Overall a good value considering the location.

We spent 4 nights in hotel. Hotel maybe not with the highest standard but for us was more then enough. We got for 2 drinks "free". From hotel to Wakiki beach you have just cross the street. Near the hotel a lot of restuarnts and ABC stores. Hotel has pool, free towels and bar on the pool. We didnt eat in hotel. Coffe and tea in room. We really enjoyed time in Marriot and for sure we will come back.

My wife and I spent 10 terrific nights at this Marriott and can’t wait to come back. Management upgraded us to a room with a spectacular ocean view, which was great, but the friendly staff made the nicest difference in our visit. With zero exceptions, all the Marriott staff we met were friendly, helpful, and fun to talk to. We looked forward to seeing them each day. Parking Possibility: if you have a car while staying at this hotel, consider parking a block away at Waikiki Banyan garage. Cost is $80, and it comes with in-and-out privileges around the clock. All nice people at the garage, too!

When my son decided to marry in Hawaii we were very excited as we were looking forward to our stay at the Marriott and we were not disappointed. Everything was well done and the service was excellent. Marriott never let's you down.

Stayed here for 7 nights as part of our Luxury Escapes deal. The hotel is at the West End of the Waikiki Strip. Not a bad location and just across from the Puhio Beach Park. Food on site is pretty good....the Japanese seafood place does a 50% discount deal for early diners on Sunday and Monday. Rooms are ok....maybe a little tired and old. We had 2 x double beds for 4 of us. Suffice to say the beds were way too small and it probably should never have been advertised as able to sleep 4. Main pool had a really annoying lack of shade unless you paid for a cabana or wanted to drink at the bar. Pretty crap if you wanted to supervise your kids without getting burnt or gouged for money (note no lifeguard on duty). That said, staff were generally friendly and the place had good facilities. Not sure if I would stay this place again were on the strip....although that may be just my view on the strip rather than the hotel.

Well located and comfortable accommodation. Staff helpful and polite.Ocean views Package included breakfast half price vouchers - ok, but not cheap. Other outlets in the vicinity.Overall - Recommended.

Ive stayed a couple times at this hotel now and love it. The hotel is located on the far end of Waikiki beach close to the Honolulu Zoo. It is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Waikiki Strip so it is a bit quieter at night. Like everywhere in Waikiki, an ABC store is only seconds away which makes it very convenient. There is a new bike rental service (Biki) in the Honolulu area and there is a bike rack right across the street of the hotel whoch adds to the convenience. The "resort fees" are higher than some other hotels but you do get quite a bit of freebies which include alcoholic beverages, wifi, etc. Hotel staff are very friendly and you definitely feel the Aloha feeling when you encounter them.

We stay at Marriott properties quite often, and I must say that this one has exceeded my expectations in every way. There are two pools and a large hot tub with a huge area for deck lounges. The outdoor bar provides poolside service. All of the staff are very friendly and take the time to interact with the guests. The spa offers a fantastic massage. There are several restaurants within the hotel from which to choose, as well as two ABC stores and many other retailers. The lobby is so relaxing that in fact you will see folks utilizing the space at any time of day.

I stayed at this property for 10 days with my husband.This hotel was a good property. The goods...Starbucks downstairs, ABC store, friendly staff and close to proximity to the beach, shopping and restaurants. The bad...... no beach chairs are provided by the hotel and rooms need updating. Also housekeeping didn't come to almost 5pm every day. Overall the hotel was good and staff was nice!

Hawaii to us is like a yearly pilgrimage and we always have a great stay at our time sharing at the Hilton. This time though I decided to extend just for a day and chose the Marriott Resort and Spa at Waikiki since I am also a Marriott loyal member. Check in was friendly and we were happily told we get an upgrade in the room. That is really very disappointing though as the so called upgraded room is really a disabled room without the look and feel of the luxurious Marriott that I know. So next time they tell you that you have an upgrade, make sure you get to see what it is first. As for me, I will never stay in Marriott Honolulu again.

As a family of 4, we fit nicely in an ocean view room on the 19th floor. The room was well maintained and nice enough. The balcony is a little small and can get very claustrophobic. Staff were nice enough and the gym facilities are fantastic. Just beware of the hidden extras, such as the cabana hire fee (when there is no other shade at that particular pool area) and the breakfast buffet is very expensive, even with the 2 for 1 vouchers we had. You are better off going for a walk to find brekky elsewhere. The spa prices are also ridiculous. The location is a bit of a walk from the main shopping/restaurant hub of Waikiki but is ok if you're fit and don't mind the long walks everyday. Overall it is fine if all you care for is a decent place to sleep at night.

Our room had 2 beds, for 4 people. It had a nice open-air lobby, a Starbucks, several restaurants (VERY expensive). Nice beach right across the street. Staff was friendly and helpful (getting taxi, etc.). They kindly extended our check-out by 2 hours as we were transferring to a cruise ship and would be too early to board. Granddaughter enjoyed the pool.

nice rooms..we asked for a fan due to breathing and had one when we got to room..we were on cruise and stayed here 3 days..nice job norweigen .elevators werte very fast..check in was perfect. we ate at burger king on corner next to hotel..look at advertisements on wall as you go in for specials.

We stayed at the Marriott Waikiki Beach in Honolulu for three nights. This was our first visit to Oahu and Honolulu. Honolulu was just not our cup of tea. We come from South Florida and Honolulu seemed no different from Miami with the high rises, concrete, steel, asphalt, traffic congestion, and car horns. However we cannot hold this location against the Marriott. The Marriott Waikiki was a nice hotel with tasteful décor and upscale shops although it did have significant shortcomings. First of all there was the parking. You can choose how you want to be raped. You can self park at $40 a night or pay $45 for valet parking per night. This charge is just totally outrageous. In addition the hotel does not have any complimentary lobby coffee in the morning like most hotels do. The hotel has three restaurants with two of them very nice and upscale but the third restaurant named the Kuhio Beach Grille belongs in association with a Red Roof or Motel 6. We made the mistake of having dinner at this restaurant which was buffet in style and cafeteria in ambiance. The food was cafeteria quality as well and the buffet was also way overpriced Kuhio also serve a breakfast buffet and we went there one morning but found the food to only be mediocre and then again also overpriced. After this experience we had our breakfasts at the Starbucks off the lobby for much less money. We did enjoy dinner one evening at the DK Steakhouse however. This restaurant was indeed the quality that you would expect at the Marriott. I would also have to give high marks for the services provided at the front desk and concierge desks at this hotel. However everything considered I would not give this hotel a very good rating.

As a Marriott Platinum member, we've admittedly been spoiled with upgrades and special treatment at many properties. This visit was exceptional! We redeemed points for this stay, 14-18 Sep (book 4, get 5th night free) to celebrate our anniversary. Upon check-in we were greeted by the lovely Wendy, recognized as Platinum members and thanked for choosing their property to celebrate our anniversary. Wendy made us feel special with an upgraded suite, extra breakfast buffet certificates (no Marriott Club here, since a resort), a great poolside cabana and a beautiful fruit and cheese plate delivered to our room with a hand-written note, again congratulating us for our anniversary! Special shout out to Leti, the perfect Marriott Ambassador/pool attendant who seemed to enjoy catering to our every need during our 3 days poolside. Also, the housekeeping staff was friendly and did a great job. Note: This property is across a busy street, from a beautiful, but crowded beach. We really enjoyed the on-site sushi restaurant - good food, competitively priced. Pool bar has 1/2 priced drinks 4 to 6 PM. Ubered to Diamondhead parking lot and walked back (downhill and around 1 mile to the hotel.)

The hotel, rooms, lobby and ambiance is top shelf. However, the location is a detraction as it is on the far end of the high end shopping strip of Waikiki. There is a very smallish beach across the street from the hotel but not rally a resort atmosphere. The property consists of two towers with restaurants in one tower creating a logistics issue if you can't walk distances.It offers a sumptuous but pricey breakfast and dinner buffet

We stayed at this resort as a family on return from the US mainland. It was most relaxing in a first class atmosphere. Rooms were well appointed and the facilities catered for the whole family. Cocktails by the pool each day was certainly one of our favourites. Great location on the beach front and walking distance to most attractions in Waikiki. We would definitely go back.

First off, the location is great. It’s a right at the water front. The lobby looks great but the rooms need some work. I’m a platinum member and my upgrade was to a room with peeling paint on the ceiling and stains in the bathtub. The hotel needs a serious facelift and upgrade compared to other Marriott properties I’ve stayed at. The customer service is also average. I had to drop some laundry off in the lobby and they wouldn’t accept it and instead pointed me to the bell desk. The fitness center is well equipped with machines and free weights. I also ate at the restaurants at the hotel. The food is average here. Nothing fancy and just your basics. I’ll stay here again for the location and location only.

My wife and I stayed for 6 days recently for a relaxing getaway. Everything started off great. We were met at check in by Lani, who thanked me for being a Platinum member and proceeded with check in. She did an excellent job of explaining the benefits of being a platinum member and going over each thing individually. The only thing I really didn't care for was that breakfast was only included for the elite guest. This was obviously taken care of, but something to note. I inquired about the possibility of a suite upgrade if one was available. Little did I know that Lani had upgraded us to one of the best rooms, the Paupani (sp?) Suite. This was an excellent room on the 33rd floor. This suite had everything you could need. It had a sitting area, dining area, living room and separate bedroom, along with a master bath and another bathroom. Not to mention the two balconies to view Waikiki from. Things were sort of hit and miss from this point on. The breakfast at the grill only allowed for coffee or tea. If you wanted to espresso, it would cost you $8. Why would I pay $8 for a single espresso when there is a Starbucks in the hotel that would sell me a double for $3? We never really got any hot food unless you went to the omelet station or were lucky enough to catch food as it was being brought out. Otherwise, you were stuck with cold food from the buffet. It was free and the omelets were great, so that was a plus.The Moana Terrace bar and grill service was hit and miss as well. We'd have great service one day, only to be followed by below average the next. The pool service was the same way. I think it had to do with how busy the bar and grill was, but you're best just heading up to the bar and getting them yourself most of the time. We did have amazing service and meal from the dk Steakhouse one evening we were there. Our waiter helped us pick an amazing bottle of wine and our steak and lamb were cooked to perfection. It was a bit pricey, but worth it.The gym at the hotel was well equipped with plenty of exercise equipment. My wife and I were able to get great workouts in while we were there. Overall, 4 stars is a fair assessment. Based on the room alone would be 5 stars, but the service was lacking in certain areas and the breakfast didn't allow for a 5 star rating. Would we return? Yea, but only if we got to stay in the suite again. From what I saw with some of the other rooms, they didn't look like anything too special.

One of the well established hotels on Waikiki Beach, has all the facilities you want and great service. Has easy access to beach and public transport as well as being a major pick up and drop of spot.Rooms are spacious and well kept, getting a little tied but still very good.Would recommend you get a higher level floor room with ocean views but make sure there not next to the lifts as it can get noisy.

The staff and overall level of service is much more like a three star hotel (e.g., Courtyard, Holiday Inn). The hotel doesn't even offer brewed coffee for its most loyal customers. The rooms are economically updated (cheap), and the non-smoking rooms need to be steam cleaned.

Spend three nights here to conclude our Hawaiian trip after a week in PrincevilleKauai. Had a 21 floor room with Diamond Head and ocean views. Big room,very comfortable twin beds. But small bathrooms. Clean but carpets need tobe replaced. Housekeeping skimpy on toiletries. Only one bathroom soap andhad to ask for replenishment on last day.Great location and plenty of hotel sponsored activities. Unfortunately we did notpartake since we were constantly out. Was given a cabana use for free.But was charge in my folio. Good thing, i caught it was asked them reverse.Pricy but you pay for location. Helpful, cheerful staff throughout.

For a 1300 bed hotel on the Wakiki strip that takes up the entire city block, this resort lived up to its expectations. Dining and shopping options won't leave you wanting. Staff were quite helpful and friendly. My room was clean and spacious. A bonus was I've never been in a hotel room that had a 55in TV.Only small thing was the two pools could be a bit larger for the size of hotel. However, this could be overlooked when Wakiki Beach was only a few hundred feet away. Overall, I highly recommend this luxury resort.

This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki! We loved the view, the restaurants and shops in the hotel. The service was top notch and the the hotel is beautiful. The pool/hot tub/gym facilities were also great! We will definitely be back!!!

Great stay at the Marriott before our Norwegian Cruise. We really enjoyed the hotel and all it had to offer. Really great location and access to Waikiki Beach and lots of great bars and stores to visit. Hotel was clean and staff was great.

Its a great location for beach lovers and walking distance to shopping centers along Waikiki. The bus stop for the trolley is just across the street fronting the Aston Waikiki. Convenient location although the room that we stayed in is a little old. The bathroom space where the toilet and tub is located is a little tight. We paid extra 35 dollars a night for the use of the resort facilities on top of the room but you get a free 60 mins international calls daily and unlimited local calls. You would also get free drink daily at the bar, unlimited use of the dvd rental. They need to change the how to dial the free international call instructed written at the back of the card. Completely wrong info. No breakfast included in the room but there are Starbucks and an ABC located inside the lobby and another just outside the hotel. There are no free bottled water in room but free to refill your water container with iced water at the lobby. The staff are not friendly.

Totally amazing view from our 10th floor - waikiki beach view was amazing- sitting on the balcony relaxing- beautiful fresh comfortable rooms - quiet and peaceful- will 100% stay here again - totally recommend this resort and it's close to everything and the service I couldn't fault

Great Hotel with Views of Ocean. Our hotel room was very nice. Beds and pillows very comfortable. Room overlooked side street but we had a balcony with a view of the ocean. Staff was very friendly. Lots of shops and restaurants right by the hotel. A historic Catholic Church was right across the street. Waikiki Beach block down from hotel.

Wow! I really enjoyed my stay, we stayed here the day before our cruise. Our room was clean also the maids were very helpful. The Pool overlooks the Beach which is very delightful. All and all it was a good stay.

Check in was a breeze. The people have always been pleasant, friendly, and professional. This was our 3rd consecutive year at this hotel for our beach vacation. The beach was never crowded and the water was protected.  The room had a wonderful view. It was kept clean but needed a renovation pretty badly. The carpet, though clean, was old and needed to be replaced. The bed needed replacement. It was not comfortable. We don't like the breakfast policy for Gold Elite. They give you one breakfast and a discount on the second. This is instead of the usual Breakfast for two. We think it is bad business for elite members. We feel this was our last stay at this hotel.

Our stay at the Marriot was for 3 nights prior to boarding the Pride of America for a seven night cruise to the Hawaiian Islands of Maui, Kauai and the big Island ports of Kona and Hilo. (A package deal)Our first impression of the hotel was that it was a nice hotel. And, although it was nice enough it was outdated and the rooms were very small. I was traveling with my daughter and 2 grandsons and the room was definitely too small for the four us. They only have two double beds in a room or a room with a king suzed bed. The room is very small and there really is not much room for a cot? There were no cots available all available cots were being used. The travel agent said we would be comfortable with the room, not so. After we arrived it was too late to get an extra room as the hotel was sold out. Most rooms had a balcony over looking the water which was nice but there are two buildings that are part of the hotel and they don't connect except for through the lobby. If you want to get from one building to another you have to do so through the lobby level which means going up and down two different sets of elevators and this can be annoying.If I ever return to Hawaii, I would try to stay at an other newer or more updated hotel.

This was our first time staying at this hotel. We normally stay in the other side of Waikiki. We were very happy with this hotel. Check-in was not the best experience as for some reason my friends husband who made the reservation, who is a black diamond, tried to transfer the reservation to his wife's name and even though they got a confirmation email the front desk did not have it that way. The front desk was nickel and diming us over the comps for breakfast buffet and evening cocktail coupons. After my friends husband who is the black diamond called and spoke with them. they then gave us the breakfast buffets but only a drink coupons for one person. The breakfast buffet was phenomenal. Chuck- the omelette guy- was very friendly and personable and had a great suggestion as to how to spend our day John at the valet desk was also very friendly and informative and gave us a jogging map which I didn't even know existed. The DVD card worked about 50% a time and we kept having to trade it in because we either got movies that was not what we asked for or it never gave us the movies. But it is nice to have the movies to watch in the evening. The views from this location are beautiful and the staff is overall is friendly. The beach across the street is a little crowded and small and choppy versus the other side of Waikiki but we would stay here again!!
user_name:
Tammy R
Long Beach, California, United States

review_body: Not a cent has been spent on this hotel since then. Awful old bathrooms, dirty and stained carpet, horrible decor. Most of Waikiki is stuck in the '80s, and this hotel is no exception. Too expensive for what it is. The good news is, the location is very good, just across the road from the beach. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Very nice staff. And being in Hawaii, there's really nothing to complain about.

I stay almost exclusively at Marriott properties based on their exemplary fine service, professional staff and above past properties. This property is no exception. Although the room decor is a bit dated the rooms are very clean and well maintained. The service could not have been better. Waikiki Beach is directly across the street. A large hotel with over 800 rooms several restaurants and two pools/fitness centers. They offer an excellent breakfast with views of Waikiki Beach. No transportation from the airport is provided.

We stayed here for 8 nights and loved it. We were upgraded to a King Room with partial ocean views with a balcony. Loved this as it was in shade in the afternoon - great for lazing and reading. The staff were very friendly, very comfortable bed, and very spacious room.We had the buffet breakfast included in our package. As buffets go, it was only average. Great omelettes cooked to order, beautiful fresh fruit ... but much of the other food was below par. I wouldn't pay the price I saw quoted of $35!The pool was OK but no shade as such unless you pay extra for a cabana which was disappointing. We spent a few evenings at the bar near the pool where they had great live entertainment - would recommend you stop by.The location is very good - near the end of the "strip" and right across the road from the beach.

The hotel was nice. Clean. Beds were comfortable. Rooms are large. Think it is due for a refurbishment. Would stay here again. The location is great. Right across from the beach. It's walking distance to restaurants, shopping, the zoo..... Restaurants at the hotel are good. The staff is really nice.

My husband and I came to Waikiki for our honeymoon and we were very happy with this hotel! When we got there they helped us switch from a mountain-view room to an ocean-view room with no hassle at all. The staff was friendly and the hotel itself was immaculate. The pool was gorgeous with a beautiful view of the ocean and the wait staff around the pool was very attentive. We loved the restaurants in the hotel and also loved that there were a plethora of stores and restaurants within walking distance if we wanted to venture out. The best part about this hotel, to me, was the proximity to the beach. After leaving the hotel and crossing a small one-way street, our toes were in the sand! The beach was clean and the lifeguard stand was right there - we felt comfortable and safe! My husband got a massage at the spa and said it was one of the best massages he's ever gotten. It was the perfect way to start the vacation! The only reason I gave the hotel a 4/5 in regards to "sleep quality" was because the pillows weren't quite as soft as we're accustomed to, and also you can hear when people on your floor close their doors (they always slammed).We would definitely recommend staying at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa and can't wait to go back!

We stayed at this hotel because we were doing the NCL Pride of America cruise, and we received a night's free accommodation at the Marriott. We also stayed another extra night. We went in with low expectations and they were very much exceeded. For context - we required an accessible room because my mother is in a wheelchair. The hotel upgraded us, at no extra cost (and for seemingly no reason), to an accessible room with a king bed, two queen size beds and two bathrooms. This meant that we each had our own bathroom and one extra bed (that we used for our luggage). They even gave us a bottle of champagne on arrival! We ordered room service three times and each time it was delivered to our room with a rolling table that they set up in the middle of the room for us to eat at. The room was absolutely massive, with a view of the city and the hills. The beds were soft and comfortable, the room very neat, tidy and clean, and the bathrooms were clean as well and fully stocked. Unfortunately I can't remember the room number - it might've been 1210? - but if you want this room, the staff all seem to know about it due to its size. It seems like a well kept secret of the resort. Fantastic room!We didn't make any use of the resort amenities, but we did at the poolside restaurant and it was quite nice. They also made transferring from the hotel to the pier a total breeze. Overall, we were both blown away by the Marriott and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Two pools. Right across from the beach. Staff is pretty friendly. Open air lobby with a Starbucks. Great location. Safe. Held our bags until we could check in. Left an article in the room and they were VERY helpful in returning it.

We stayed here one night pre-cruise for "free" as part of our Cruise package on the Pride of America. When we approached our room, the hallway had an odor, that I thought was similar to urine. This turned us off a little. The room itself was a good size, it was a corner room with a small balcony. It had a very good view of Diamond Head, and a view of the beach/ocean through the buildings. The bathroom had a slight odor, and the shower was a little weak. There were plenty of charging outlets and the largest hotel safe I have ever seen. The air conditioner was extremely loud.The hotel is located right near all the action and a short walk to the beach across the street. The lobby was nice.

We stayed at this resort over the Labor Day weekend to celebrate my dad's birthday. The spa included was delightful and the staff warm and welcoming. We stayed in what I believe was a junior Suite and while it was adequate as far as the space and double balcony (!!!) was concerned, the amount of negative and empty space in the room agitated me personally. I just didn't understand the design. The most irking thing about this resort however is the missing beach amenities. How can you claim to be a beach resort hotel but don't provide your obviously from-out-of-town guests umbrellas, beach chairs, or even beach towels at the very least? Having to take pool towels in order to have a beach visit just puts the hotel at risk for losing hundreds of pool towels unnecessarily. I didn't understand this logic at all. Are guests supposed to buy these things while on vacation since they're not available to rent? Of the restaurants we went to in the hotel, the sushi one was best. The staff was very accommodating. The outdoor pool area that included food service was alright but the food lacked flavor and he service was poor. The resort itself is in a great location as it is across the street, literally, from the beach. All in all, it was an average stay at a resort I expected much more from. I would not and will not be returning.

This was my first time staying here and it was overall a great one. I was upgraded from a city to an ocean view room in the Paokalani Tower. The free breakfast buffet was nice and had a good selection including an omelet station. Also had free mai tai but was a little weak on the alcohol. Great view from my room, loved watching the sunset every night! The only thing is that one of the guests smoked out on the balcony and the smoke reeked down in our balcony.Parking garage is a little tight but I'm guessing it's like that elsewhere. I had the same experience at the Hyatt Regency.Staff was always helpful and greeted me aloha. I saw a staff help a confused, lost guest without the guest needing to ask for help.The standard room was spacious for two, probably comfortable for 3 but could get cramped with 4 people. We had two double beds but there was a space in the corner for a rollaway bed.Housekeeping service was fairly prompt even when I had to call coz our room got missed one day.Ordered room service one night for my son coz he didn't feel good going out. As expected, it was a little steep for a burger and two POG.I paid another $99 on the last day so we could stay all day since we had a very late flight. It was nice having access to our room all day so I could shower after the beach.We'd definitely come back.

We stayed for 4 days at this property. The staff was fantastic and the concierge service was above and beyond expected. No it is not right on the beach... you have to cross the street. There are a lot of shopping opportunities here and food from fast food to nice up scaled restaurants.

I stayed 2 nights before my cruise and I absolutely loved it! It was one of the best hotels I ever stayed at. It was spacious and clean. The balcony was huge. The beds were so comfortable and the shower pressure was amazing. I stayed in the K tower on the 5th floor. It was the highlight of my trip. My last day, I had a few hours to kill before leaving for the cruise port, but decided to stay in the room and enjoy the lovely balcony and views. Transport to the ship was well organized and seamless. I was sad to leave it behind. The hotel is beautiful and the gym is one of the best I've ever seen. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Thank you Marriott for a wonderful start to my dream vacation. I really, really enjoyed my stay.
user_name:
pe2134
New York City, New York

review_body: From the beautiful lobby to the nice welcome we received at the front desk our experience at this hotel was very good. Our room on the 23rd floor had a wonderful view of Diamondhead and the beach with no obstruction as we were higher than other hotels nextdoor. The hotel has some nice older charm with it's cavernous walkways with shops & eateries as well as car rental office and 2 convenience stores for all those last minute necessities. Even though it has the old world charm it is updated and modern. The 2 pools were nice (could be larger), excellent fitness room, yoga in the morning, and the hotel is located directly across from a nice protected beach which is excellent for swimming. Make sure you bring some goggles or mask to view the pretty colored fish that swim over and around the moss covered rocks near the breakwater wall. Cheeseburger In Paradise only 1 block away. It is also possible to stroll down the boulevard to town (about 15-20 minute walk). If you're not up to the walk just take the "pink" line bus on the side of the hotel to main shopping area/restaurants or Ala Moana Mall (only $2 each way!). The hotel does host large meetings which can be a bit annoying in the morning if you go to the 2nd pool early and during the middle of the week sometimes the hotel has the 2nd (smaller) pool closed for an event from 3pm on. All in all though i feel this hotel is an excellent choice with less street noise than downtown hotels.

The Marriott was our choice based on its proximity from the centre of Waikiki. That is, it was just outside the hustle and bustle. We had the Deluxe Ocean View Room, which presented a clear view of the gorgeous sunset and the Waikiki skyline.The service and facilities were very good. The initial stumble we had at check in was sorted out on Day 3 by Wilson, the Hotel Manager. So I could not give it a perfect score. Our go-to place for drinks and food at the hotel was Moana Bar and Terrace. Michael was good value, and shared some great insights into the history of Oahu. The wings were 'bomb'. The Japanese restaurant provided fast service and good food. Other facilities include laundromat; pool; gym; spa; specialty stores; and of course an ABC store :-)

The rooms were decent, but they weren't anything special. The location is why this gets 5 stars. It is a 10 second walk from the hotel shops at basement level to get you to standing on Waikiki Beach. The staff was also very pleasant and helpful, great valet, and easy check-in/check-out. The rooftop pool area was also lovely.

I booked this based on the photos on the hotel website...photos are VERY deceiving this property is not on the beach but rather across the street from the beach. Which would have been ok if they disclosed it. Their lack of pool photo was another big hint, their pool is very-very small considering the size of the hotel! We stayed on the 16th floor with partial ocean view, the room we got was a good size room. The breakfast buffet was a big disappointing and not on the cheap side either. Marriott waikiki is a nice property but if you are looking for resort type pool or on the beach property this is not it!

My wife and I stayed 5 days at the hotel. We are gold elite members. For perks, we received an upgraded room, 4 drink coupons, a free breakfast voucher for each night we stayed, and various coupons. They do not have a concierge lounge. We stayed in the K tower per request. We are glad we did as it is so much easier to get to things and closer to the beach. The resort is very big and sits across the street from the beach. Once you get a feel for the resort, it is easy to get around. Pros:Location. Fabulous. We had a room facing Waikiki beach and to be able to look out our balcony on the 20th floor was spectacular. A great way to start and end our day. Also easy walking access to all the shops and hotels along Waikiki. 2 min walk to the beach. Property. Lobby was huge, open air and really nice. New furnishings, had a Starbucks, ABC store, and shops. Great location for excursion pick up. Easy check in (I used my mobile app ahead of time) and friendly staff. Cons:Breakfast. It really wasn't good. Same food each day. Luckily we didn't have to pay for it. Taxi fee to airport. Greater than $40 both times. In the future, we will use other means to get to the airport. Other:We did not eat at the restaurants or use the pools (used beach). We used the business center to get boarding passes and it was easy. Overall we had a wonderful stay. Again, the best part is the view from the room. Waikiki beach is a gem. We would stay again.

My wife and I decided to stay just outside the busy centre of Waikiki, without compromising on views and amenities. The Marriott fit the brief. We had the deluxe room ocean view, with a clear view of Waikiki Beach and the surrounding 'city'. It made for great photos of the sunset. The hotel has a good choice of bars and restaurants, with Moana Terrace Bar & Grill being our go-to destination for either a quick drink, or a good meal. There are other dining places on the site, which cater for various experiences.We had a shaky start on Day 1, which accounts for the 4 stars, but when we were finally contacted by the Duty Manager, Wilson, it was relatively smooth sailing from there. The staff were generally friendly, and willing to assist where they could.If you're looking for a hotel with great views; a wide range of facilities (incl. laundromat; spa; gym; car hire; ABC store (hahaha); speciality stores; cafes; and located just outside the main hustle and bustle, Marriott is a great choice. The only other alternative would have been the Hyatt Regency just a block away.

The Waikiki Beach Marriot is right across the beach although if you want a beach with any waves, you need to walk a few streets down towards the Hyatt Hotel. The rooms are big but a bit old and are in need of a remodel. I had a great full ocean view room which was spectacular. As a Starwood Platinum member, I was given the room upgrade, the breakfast buffet, and 4 drink coupons. A great value for Platinum members. For the price, the hotel is a great choice in Waikiki.

I've stayed here on several occasions. No major complaints. Elevators are quick to get you to your room. There are a couple of pools and pool bar. Most evenings there is live music.There are a couple Starbucks and ABC stores on the property, including plenty of trinket shops spread around.Waikiki Beach is directly across the street, and the main bulk of the strip (International market place area) is within walking distance.This year they have increased tourist fees (resort fees). Parking cost 45.00 per day for valet, and 40.00 to self-park. Trying to park on the street if you have a car is hit and miss. I also would not recommend it.Personal Note: I'm trying to think of the reason why we stay in Waikiki each time we come here. It's like memory muscle I swear when booking. Something inside feels we need some night life after a day on the beach. There is plenty around the WB Marriott in the evening, but with the tourists, traffic, and prices it's really is not worth it at my age. I'm asleep by 10 pm anyways. Pretty sure this will be the last time I stay in Waikiki or any hotel within. Waikiki will be a tourist attraction I come visit from the other side of the island, then retreat back to peace and quiet.There is nothing wrong with this hotel, the staff is great, and check-in has never been an issue.

Norwegian Cruise Line gave us a one night stay at the Waikiki Marriott as an incentive for booking our Hawaii Cruise. Our bathroom shower had the last person's hair in the tub. It seemed a little dirty. I was not fond of the location and how busy it was. The restaurants inside of the Marriott were subpar. This was just an average experience compared to the rest of our trip. Other guests who were traveling for their honeymoon, received special treatment from staff, but we did not get chocolates or any recognition (I was wearing my veil upon arrival).

This hotel is a large property right across from Waikiki Beach - a very chaotic and busy area. We stayed one night on our way to Maui to visit Pearl Harbor - 20-30 minute drive from airport - convenient parking and great outdoor lounge. Staff was great - and complimentary breakfast buffet was amazing! Hotel could use some updating as it is beginning to show age - but rooms are tidy and clean - and having a balcony with a view is a great plus.

Overall the property is very nice. Directly across from Waikiki beach. To all the naysayers lets get real. If your in Hawaii you shouldn't be spending too much time in the. Room. The rooms are clean and kept fresh. Ok the bathrooms are a little small and the furniture has had better days but it really didn't bother us. Only negative I had were a couple of stains in carpet which should have been cleaned. This property is at the far end of Waikiki closer to Diamond head than th,e airport. So if your looking to be in the center of luxury shopping and night life you may want to stay closer to the airport. The staff was friendly and helpful. shout out to the concierge BreeAnn full of helpful information. As a travel agent I would have no problem booking this property for any of my perspective clients.

Very comfortable rooms with tremendous views. It was close to a god variety of eating and shopping places. The most impressive thing was how well the resort has made getting around by having signs and directions posted and in good locations.

This is a perfect hotel if you are planning to stay in Waikiki and not move around (which by the way is an awesome plan). However, as with every other hotel in Waikiki, driving to and from this location on Oahu is awful. The street congestion is out of control and the number of traffic lights in any direction is stupid. Waikiki is pretty touristy but the beach is still pretty special. The area has plenty of restaurants and bars but just remember to be somewhere with a beach view at sunset. The hotel has a great view of the beach, Diamond Head and most of Honolulu and everything in Waikiki is within walking distance from here. I stayed 4 nights in a 'mountain view' room and was treated to pretty special sunrises and sunsets over Diamond Head and the beach. My room had a great view, plenty of space and good water pressure. This Marriott is staffed by a gigantic group of overachievers. Everyone on the payroll including the staff in the Starbucks and convenience stores works as hard as they can to insure you enjoy your trip to Hawaii. The hotel itself is massive and considers itself a resort. 'Resort' really means Marriott can over charge for even small items and it takes twice as long as usual to check. Listening to the opening and closing speech about resort fees and charges for parking can ruin the first and last day of your trip so be prepared. I used this location as a jumping off place for Honolulu and Diamond Head but because of the traffic it really wasn't practical for reaching the North Shore.

The rooms are spacious, well appointed, clean with great views. The bathrooms are simply wonderful! Plenty of towels and toiletries. This is a fabulous hotel in a great location and I would definitely stay there again.

Don't think about it twice! this is the hotel! location, location, location!Stayed for 2 nights before boarding our NCL cruise... right in the center of everything...Keep it real: Honolulu is expensive... so live the experience properly...This hotel has stunning views, rooms recently renovated, very friendly staff, great breakfast area, one of the best beaches accross the street, within walking distance to aquarium, zoo, restaurants, etc//We're platinum members so received breakfast coupons, otherwise its about US18 for children and US24 for adult breakfast... if you're going cheap, grab something at ABC store downstairs or at the Bking in the corner. You can also either rent snorkle/ surf equipment at the beach or buy cheap ones at the ABC store.Super friendly staff gave us maps, chocolates, coupons and arranged for late check out and kept our luggage while helping us with early check in.From the airport it's about a 30US taxi ride and to the pier about 20 US.Super safe, super clean, quick check in and check out.. no complains at all!Keep in mind, this hotel has 2 towers that connect... go for it and choose high floors with ocean view... totally worth it! we stayed in floor 31 and upon our return from our cruise floor 16 but front building.. this view will stick forever!Pros:again: locationBus route in the cornerGreat breakfast buffetnice demos on lai making and dancing every dayCons:resort fees (this is almost every hotel)parking 40 US per day ( you can park at the zoo - 1 block away 1US per hour)No microwave or kitchenette - just a small fridge in your roomif you want to print anything its about 6US expensive!!!

Stayed here for a few days in May. Location was good, I like to walk so it was good for me. Breakfast buffet was yum I would sit near the window to people watch. Sticky buns and the pineapple were awesome!! Gym was nice and clean. Balcony view was nice too. Look at my sunset photos!!

The hotel is opposite Waikiki Beach which is very convenient. We were fortunate to get an ocean view on a high floor and we could also see Diamond Head. Rooms are clean and there are restaurants, shops, fitness centre and a pool. The hotel overall is in good condition. There is a self serve laundry which is also convenient. When we were there the coin change machine was out of order so we had to use a credit card. There is self serve and valet parking although we opted to park elsewhere. The resort fees are a bit steep ($35 + tax) and disproportionate to the "extras" that are included, many of which other hotels included for free (such as Wifi). There is one drink (Mai Tai or beer) per day included, per room, even though we had two people in the room. I would have expected two drinks per day, for the price. A resort fee is common in many of the hotels in the area although many charge less than the Marriott. Overall no issues during our stay. I would stay here again only if the price was competitive with other hotels in the area.

We stayed here in a king deluxe for five nights on vacation. The room seemed a little dated and the bathroom was small and so was the closet, but the room was very spacious. The view was beautiful as we had both an ocean and city view. The bed was very comfortable and the air conditioning was excellent and probably the only retreat from the heat as most businesses and restaurants around the beach were open to allow the hot air to flow. This hotel is not in the center of all the chaos of the tourists, but on the outskirts and still very busy, close to the zoo and a little walk past the park to the aquarium. I'd recommend this hotel to families, but it seemed to lack romance for a couples vacation. The breakfast buffet at the Kuhio Beach Grill is $35 per person and not really worth it, but everything on the menu is also expensive. I opted for a breakfast sandwich from Starbucks after being a little disappointed with the buffet. The Moana Terrace Bar and Grill was comfortable and the place we liked to hang out. The nachos were really good but mixed drinks were weak. There are plenty of other places nearby to eat and have drinks and close to a lot of shopping. All in all, this is a pretty mediocre place, but reasonably priced for the area.

We booked this resort for a three night stay and were not disappointed. From this base, we explored Oahu including Pearl Harbor, and flew to the Big Island for a day trip. Nice restaurant overlooks the beach and ocean.

This is one of the best hotels in Waikiki, with prime location (sea front and downtown) and excellent service. After reading so many unfavorable reviews, I was surprised with the quality of my room. There are two towers, Paokalani on city side, and Kealohilani on sea side which is also known as K Tower. If you have the opportunity for an upgrade, try suite 2103 on K Tower. On the third floor, K Tower, you have two excellent restaurants, the DK steakhouse and the Sansei Japanese restaurant where you should try the seafood pasta. As for the staff, they are very friendly and efficient. I highly recommend it.

We enjoyed 5 days in Waikiki in this hotel. The room was spacious, and it was across the road from the beach. It was at one end of Waikiki so, all the touristy things were a few minutes walk. Parent with children may especially like this hotel as the zoo was also a 5 minute walk away.The only drawback was the sound at night. We could hear a fair amount of noise despite being on the 18th floor. Double glazed windows would have made this a perfect place.

The Marriott Resort & Spa in Waikiki is a mainstay of Waikiki hotels and ideally located near the end of the Waikiki strip enabling you to walk to the beach and a host of nearby locations. The pool area is amply provided with lounging and seating overlooking the beach with a adjacent bar and Grill as well as Cabanas for relaxing and settle from the ever present sun. The ground floor is surrounded by interesting shopping venues from one stop wedding, spa, jewelry, clothing, Starbucks and more. There are several dining options on site and plenty more within easy walking distance including world famous Duke's. The rooms are typical Marriott style with all expected features. Both towers have plenty of elevators so waits are momentary. The workout facility is huge with great views of ocean. The Marriott staff know how to treat guests which is not surprising due to high standards but this location has added bonus of the staff being infused with an Aloha spirit on top of the Marriott magic which makes for rewarding encounters with everyone you meet. We were especially pleased with encounters with Ola in our Cabana and Troy in the Kuhio Grill. They set the standard!!

While I was working, my wife and daughter had the time of their life. We were able to meet with Jing Jing who was one of the Expedia concierges at the hotel. She did a truly outstanding job of lining the girls up with great activities every day.

Very nice "resort" in a good location across from the beach, although we thought it was actually on the beach. The staff, room, pools and fitness center were excellent. I do wish there were more umbrellas at the pool. If you did not get a cabana you had better be prepared to swelter in the heat. The only real negative I can say is that the breakfast buffet is not worth the price. Fortunately we had vouchers, but if you do not, I would walk down the street for $5.99 breakfast at many restaurants.

Pros:Wonderful staff, great rooms (though a bit dated) with private balcony, very clean. Yummy restaurantsCons:There are two pools, one small and one tiny (litterly the size of our personal pool at home!). Service at the pool is very slowly

Stayed here for one night very clean nice staff nice hotel great for couples or family's very close too every thing you need and most of all close to beach had breakfast in Italian cafe at side on ground level very nice

Marriott Waikiki has everything you starting with a great location right on the beach. It has several restaurants, parking, gym, gift shops. Staff is very friendly. The property, however, needs a little renovation, for parts of it are showing its age. They do nickel and dime you: resort fee is $35 and parking is another $40 but those are typical fee for Waikiki. As a Gold member, I received only 1 breakfast per night, so if you come with another person, some of the breakfasts need to be paid.

My wife and I just spent a few days in the Waikiki Beach Marriott. The hotel is clean, the rooms are comfortable, and the staff is friendly. The location is excellent, right across the road from the beach and close to lots of great restaurants. Having a Starbucks essentially attached to the hotel is a plus for a coffee lover like me.

We are staying here currently for five nights and are thoroughly enjoying it. Love being across the street from Kuhio Beach and just a tiny walk from Waikiki Beach. Great to have a Starbucks and ABC Store (small convenience store) in the lobby. Loved having DVD rental included in resort fee!. They have great housekeeping services and their lobby is beautiful!

This hotel is great right in the center close to every thing you need by the beach the staff are sooo friendly wherever you are you are being greet with a smile and a will to help excellent restaurants the pool the music the bar all makes it a best vacation the view from the room to the ocean is spectacular we woke up every morning with a rainbow like in a fairytale Thank you Waikiki Marriott

This location is perfect if you're wanting to look out over Waikiki during the day and be able to catch a beautiful sunset all within the comfort of your room. Its view is perfect for the fireworks that happen every Friday.

Great hotel. Great location. Room was nice and large but could use some updating. Beds were very comfortable. Coffee in the room. Safe in the room. Would definitely recommend! Buffet breakfast was fabulous but go early if possible.

We chose this hotel because we are Marriott Rewards Members and because we wanted the quieter end of the beach. We were upgraded upon check in to a junior suite with ocean views. We got two breakfast coupons too. That was great.While the place was clean, our room was extremely old and smelled musty. The bathroom was tiny and even though clean, looked unclean because it was old.The breakfast buffet was frankly barely acceptable. We had to wait a long time to get into the room and the buffet food was mediocre at best. Luckily it was free and we didn't go back a second day. Starbucks in the lobby was awesome.The hotel is huge with two large towers. Never had to wait for an elevator (which is impressive), always got a parking spot in the garage and the people working at the hotel were very pleasant and efficient and helpful (especially the concierge).Overall would really think twice about staying there unless they upgrade the rooms. Many other great properties to choose from in Waikiki.

We booked this hotel as a stopover on our way back to the mainland after a week on Kauai. We are long time Marriott loyalists and used our accumulated points to stay here. The city is built right up to the beach, so you have to understand that. The drive in from the airport is mostly highway, but once you get off, it is confusing city streets. You have to pay to park $$$, so consider using Uber if you plan to just stay at this huge hotel. We planned to visit the Pearl Harbor Memorials, so we paid for valet parking, $45 per day. Self park is $40, so it was an easy choice. We pulled up and the very efficient valet called for a bellhop to help with our bags and pointed to where the front desk was. We have elite status and were seen with very little wait. We had booked an ocean view room and were not disappointed ( see pic). There are 4 restaurants and a pool bar/ grill. We ate every meal at the hotel except for lunch the day we visited Pearl Harbor. We had our first meal, a late lunch at the pool bar overlooking the beach. Fast service, yummy frozen drinks and a delicious flatbread pizza. The drinks are pricey at $12 for mixed and $9 for wine. We had two dinners at the Sushi restaurant which was excellent! We used room service for breakfast on our day out because you have to get to the Pearl Harbor Memorial early if you didn't think ahead to reserve tickets on line ( you should!). My wife is vegan so we wrote specific requests on the hang tag you leave on your door the night before. A very nice young lady called for clarification and filled our every request. The meal arrived promptly at 6:30am and was perfect.Our second morning we ate at the Grill Restaurant which is a different buffet every night of the week, but the same breakfast buffet everyday. They had everything you could possibly want, including custom omelets. The fresh fruit was plentiful and delicious. The waitress takes your drink orders at the table and even had soy milk for my wife. Waikiki Beach is but a sliver of what it once was. I don't know what they plan to do as the seas continue to rise? There is enough beach left in front of the Marriott for now. We did not visit the beach but did appreciate the beautiful scenery and enjoyed watching the surfing and sunsets.I don't think I would book here for a family beach vacation. There are too many family friendly alternatives. We enjoyed our two days here and it meet our needs.

the rooms at this hotel need full rnovation, furnitures are old, bathrooms are too small with no ventillation. on top of this we had witness a middle aged man changing colothes by the pool area in front of everyone with no shame. we had to report it to security. it was total disgusting. they should make the pool area more secure. I guess anyone can enter this area from the street. never will stay there.

My colleagues and I stayed at this location during our last business trip. This was not my first time staying here and it's a good location which has an outstanding staff. This establishment has many amenities inside as well as other quality businesses around and near it. The only issue I have, is I believe the hotel could use a little updating as you can see in the pictures, but otherwise it's a fabulous place.

The typical clean and overpriced experience you get at these chains in touristy locations. You get free bar tickets, one per night. People are friendly and professional, great views. Don't go for partial view rooms - not worth it if you want to spend any time in the room.Good Expedia booking service in the hotel, we got helicopters and cars from there.

Stayed one night with the family in two rooms. The bathrooms were very small. No water in the rooms. I'm sure you can find better elsewhere. It's not that it's horrible but I haven't been to a worse Marriott.

My husband was gonna for 8 months for the airforce and so we decided to do a staycation to welcome him back to the islands... upon check in we were amazed how beautiful the lobby is and the courtyard... Alyssa was checking us is and it was easy and fast and we got an AMAZING military rate!! When she was calling to check if our room was ready she said their was no rooms available with a king bed but she could upgrade us for free but it would be two queens.. we took the upgrade and when we went to the room we had the most BEAUTIFUL view of Waikiki not one building or apartment in front of our balcony. We are staying in the kealohilani tower on the 17th floor. The room was CLEAN and very spacious... Alyssa took great care of us and really made this trip special for me and my husband! We would definitely come back!!

We stopped in here for the night before heading to another destination, but fell in love with this hotel. It's right in the middle of everything...very convenient for shopping, restaurants and of course, the beach! The staff was very friendly and helpful, with concierge and tour desks all over! My only minor complaint was I couldn't find stair access and the elevators were ALWAYS busy. Would recommend this hotel!

This hotel is an amazing place to stay. My room was amazing and huge and I had an awesome view of the ocean from my balcony. My room was clean and my bed felt like I was sleeping on clouds. Staff were wonderful and I couldn't have been more happier.

Hawaiian Air put us up here after multiple plane delays landed us on Oahu. Not our destination. We were only here to sleep 6 short hours until our next flight, but I fell in love! We were on an upper floor facing the ocean. A beautiful view! The room was large, bed way too soft. But I will be back! Someday....

First thing I need to say is that I would recommend this hotel for any type of stay.The hotel grounds are larger than I expected, especially after staying at the Holiday Inn Express last month (I don't recommend that hotel). There are several shops spread across the grounds to include an ABC store. Several restaurant choices, all of which seemed to have good menus and prices compatible with the restaurants in Waikiki. We ate at Sansei and the sushi was fresh and tasty (Tip: go Sunday or Monday for the half price menu, but make sure to get in line by about 5 PM). The gym is bigger than your average mainland gym that only has two or three pieces of equipment at dumbbells. The gym had ample free weights, a Smith machine, plenty of equipment, etc. We did not go to the pool, but it looked average and seems quite crowded each time I walked by… Just go to the beach right across the street. Great location - walking distance to pretty much everything and central Waikiki and right across the street from the beach. I will say that stretch of beach gets quite crowded, so if you don't mind the walk I suggest going down towards Fort DeRussy (seemingly less crowds,calmer water, wider beach front, and sea turtles I seem to be hanging around that area). We stayed in the Paoakalani Tower (back of the property). I had a view of the beach and the city from the eighth floor and cannot complain. The room was clean, quiet, large, and seemed to be appointed with newer furniture and electronics.Only a few complaints… I know parking is at a premium in Waikiki, but the garage parking fee is pretty outrageous at $40 per day plus fees/taxes (valet is $45 a day). The staff as a whole were better and friendlier than average (especially the housekeeping staff ) except for the pool bar bartenders. Maybe it's the continuous stream of people that put them in a bad mood, I don't know, but they were not the friendliest group.My last complaint is admittedly a bit picky, but I wish this hotel was on the other side of Waikiki, closer to Hard Rock Cafe or Embassy Suites.Bottom line – I recommend this hotel and Lloyd definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott with the family , and overall I would have to say the stay was very good.It's a large property that is great for families.Pool is great , very good restaurants , gym and laundry facilities.The property is close to great restaurants , walking distance to the beach shops.The only criticism that I have which I didn't like is not providing beach umbrellas for all guests at the pool.If you want an umbrella with shade it costs money ranging from $25 to $45 which was quite steep.Overall it was good and would come again

Stayed in a Diamond Head view room which had partial ocean views. Good-Location is lively and minutes to walk right into the centre of Waikiki beach-Beds were really comfortable-Balcony was a decent enough size to enjoy a drink on and soak in the view -Plenty of elevators meant I didn't have to wait long even though the hotel was extremely busyBad-Bathroom was very small. Barely had room to dry myself with the door closed-Room felt a little dated and worn-Layout of hotel was confusing. Didn't realise there was a much bigger pool until being informed by another guest. Overall I enjoyed my stay. While the bathroom was disappointing the room as a whole was comfortable. I would strongly recommend requesting a room in the front tower if booking as it is better located and easier to navigate.

Our home for 8 nights! We loved it but only spent limited time in our room as we tried to fit as much into our holiday as possibly. We had a Deluxe room over looking Waikki Beach and that view certainly did not dissapoint. Staff were lovely, our room wasn't ready so the lovely male on reception took us to a lounge area where we got to freshen up and shower before starting our holiday. Also if you want fresh fruit get the breakfast .. we had a buy one get one free voucher for breakfast but just to get fresh fruit was worth it. Can't wait to come back.

I wasn't expecting much from the Marriott Waikiki, I thought it was too far away from the heart of Waikiki but its location is great, the rooms are really good, staff are quick and friendly with service, the Starbucks in reception a little win, great beds and bathrooms

We had a 4 day stay here, and the lovely lady at the counter upgraded our room free of charge, we had a beautiful suite overlooking Waikiki beach. Most of the staff were lovely and accommodating and the facilities were lovely. Only downfall was the disinterest in the wait and bar staff out by the hotel pool. We were never offered a drink even though people right near us were ordering, and so when we called someone over, she looked annoyed at us and the bar staff were not real happy to serve us. Staff everywhere else though were amazing and are to be commended.

We had a room on the 29th floor in the tower furthest away from the beach. We found this too far away from everything. The room was mediocre with a very small bathroom and balcony. Carpets and fittings need to be updated. We were there at the same time as a group of 200 kids checked in. This caused huge delays waiting for the lifts. It would have been nice if the hotel had advised us this was going to happen. On the plus side, the pools were nice, and the breakfast buffet provided good choice, though on the pricey side.

I stayed 4 nights at this Marriott Hotel on business and check-in was fast and easy when I arrived (no one in line). Looks line there's sufficient staff to help. Resort and other fees were costly and parking was, too, at $40 a day. But it's a good location just across a pier at Waikiki Beach and plenty of restaurants and shops around. There's a pool on the 3rd floor with a nice bar and a couple of nice restaurants. My room was upgraded to a view overlooking the pool and the ocean. Thanks to the friendly male staff who checked me in. There's a mini-ref, safe box which I didn't use, good size-flat screen TV that's also connected to wifi, free wifi, and plenty of bedside power outlets. Guest parking spaces were tight and we almost always could not find a spot. Room key is used to get in and out of the parking lot if charges are automatically added to the account. After check-out, be sure to keep a card key or ask for card key to be able to get out of the parking lot. I had to run back to the front desk when I realized before getting into the car that I need one to get out.

We stayed 7 days.2 Pools and spa live music, Starbucks, and several places to eat right at the hotel.Well worth it! The pictures do not do it justice.Staff are nice.Close to everything.We had a great vacation with out any worries.

Excellent hotel with the best service. Our second stay here while on holiday in Waikiki for a family of four. Convinient to the beach, shops and trolleys. Will highly recommend this hotel to friends and families who are travelling with children to stay here. Mahalo

Stated here because was part of package deal for a cruise. But, it was a nice hotel as Nd staff was very polite. Waikiki beach was block away. Lots of eateries around the hotel and plenty of shopping.

Last five years I've stayed 720 nights in Marriott around the country and world and I would say that this was One of the nicest Marriotts I have stayed at. When we checked in the process was smooth and friendly they upgraded us to a Junior suite with an ocean view. As a platinum member I was given vouchers for the breakfast buffet and drinks voucher for each day that I was staying. The room was newly renovated and very comfortable. The bellhops were super helpful with getting her luggage in and out. We valet parked our car which is $5 more a day then self parking so worth it. You're right across the street from Waikiki Beach which is very nice for families with the break wall to prevent the waves from crashing into the beach. The hotel has two pools both were very busy.

I went here in April of 2015 and loved this hotel. I had an ocean view and would watch the moon and sun daily. The hotel staff was friendly, It's close to everything. I walked to the beach, restaurants and shopping areas.

The staff is excellent, restaurants for food and entertainment the best, All the tours originate from here and it is close to the beach and everything you may want to do. A little pricey but what isn't in Waikiki!

I stayed here for 5 weeks during a business trip. It is not the highest end of hotels and I'm sure the company got a good deal for all of us. You have to ask for a kettle at reception, they keep them in the back. There is a fridge but no mini bar. The K-Tower, where I stayed, is loud - guests scream a lot and because you hear the bars and street from outside. The view is on the ocean side which is nice to wake up to in the morning. Staff is very friendly. Karaoke at the Sushi Bar every Friday night is a laugh. Steak at DK is good. Gym is good. Pool is okay. I had two beds while others had a nice large bed. Room vary as they do in every hotel. Bathroom seems older. Starbucks downstairs is open early to late.

Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, big lobby, orchids everywhere, complimentary chilled water as you walk in. Wonderful city and ocean views. Easy walk to the beach. Watched sunset from our balcony. Just a one night stay before boarding our cruise, but I could have been happy here for a weekend or longer.

A mid winter break ... just eat the doctor ordered On arrival check in was seamless and quick, a nice upgrade to an ocean view was a nice touch as was the flower and bobby pin on the desk for the ladies Our room was in the 19th floor and had a fantastic view of diamond head and Waikiki beach. The morning sun on the deck was amazing and breakfast was spent out there every morning The resort has two mid size pools one out side the gym , the other right by a cafe so very handy for drinks The pool was great however there is not much shade in the morning unless you book a cabana The resort is walking distance from the main restaurant strip and we walked from the hotel to Ala Moana shopping mall twice ( my mum is 67 and she managed this in the morning heat so it is a doable walk , however we bussed it back with our shopping ) The resort is very clean and spacious and I loved the entry with the casual seating and of course the Starbucks in the foyer Our stay was amazing and Yes I would defiantly stay here again as it's close to everything and the staff were super help full Please note that there is a resort fee you pay at the end of your stay , ( which I knew about and was prepared for ) personally I thought it was high especially if you don't get to any of the activities.

Good location adjacent the ocean and closer to Diamond head than Honolulu city center, the hotel complex has two main towers, the Paoakalani and Kealohilani, offering partial ocean views and rooms the SE have great views of Diamond Head. Friendly service and very, clean with decent amenities including a guest laundry, good sized fitness area, two pools, and a number of useful shops. Convenient parking with valet parking only $5 more than self parking and for me it was worth it. I found this place ideally to access Waikiki attractions on foot and I would stay here again. The only is that this part of town is noisy because of traffic and air conditioner noise but I have not found a place on Waikiki where one can completely get away from it.
user_name:
DaveGski
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed in the tower farthest from the beach with a partial Oceanview. I must say even with a partial view the view was fantastic. This property has an excellent location in Waikiki on the island of Oahu. Very handy for business and for sightseeing you're right in the center of the action. The staff here was very friendly and very helpful. I have visited Hawaii many times and would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely use it again in the future.

A beautiful, updated hotel with great service at the front desk and in room.It has a wonderful Hawaiian open air lobby with fountain that you just want to sit a minute to enjoy and realize just where you are.Elevators are a bit slow because of so many floors.Has two pools and open air bar/grill to enjoy on level 3. If one pool is busy, go to the other.They were gracious to store our luggage when we arrived early so that we could go on to the beach.

I wanted to call out my experience at check-in. I inquire about availability of an upgrade and the front desk was very accommodating. She actually showed me my choices of room and the views available. This demonstrated to me that she was more interested in helping my family and i have a wonderful visit and we were just not dollar signs. We got a great room (1962) and really enjoyed our visit. Thank you very much.

We stayed over at the Marriott one day before going on our cruise on the Pride of America. The hotel was very nice and had the most spacious rooms that i have ever stayed in. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The beach is across a busy street and i did not see any beach chairs to rent so you might want to keep that in mind if you are staying there to go to the beach. The beach is also small and very crowded, but beautiful. There were many dining options and shopping in walking distance. We enjoyed our short stay. I would not choose this hotel if going to the beach were my priority unless the cost was cheap.

I stayed here over the weekend for a work conference and ball. The hotel was so accommodating, facilities were amazing snd location is perfect right across the road from Waikiki Beach.As a travel agent i would recommend this hotel to all my customers that travel to Waikiki and i know plenty others would to.

Love this place to stay, Fantastic position, all you have to do is walk across the street & you are on the beach. Staff are really friendly, check in & check out was busy, but the staff do their best when busy.Pool & the Pool bar was nice to have sunset drinks.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott was an awesome place to stay for our girls trip. Close enough to everything at a great price. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a partial ocean view room in the back tower that gave us a great view of not only the ocean but also Diamond Head. I would stay again no question.

Of the many times I have stayed at this Marriott, this was the worst. The owners remodeled the lobby, removing the beautiful water garden and replacing it with a bland, non-appealing collection of conventional furniture. The cost of doing so would have been better applied to renovating the rooms. In two separate rooms, one changed for the other, the finish of the bathroom fixtures was peeling and chipping away, and there was mildew everywhere in the grout and caulking. The rooms desperately need updating. There are numerous shops on the property, all but the ABC stores overpriced. The only factors keeping my rating from dropping lower are the excellent, friendly and helpful staff, and the outstanding - if pricey - restaurants which I rated separately and individually. To my further irritation, this hotel charges a thirty- five dollar daily "resort" fee for a resort consisting of a small pool, a high-prices terrace bar, and a public beach across the street. I have been an elite Marriott rewards program member for over twenty years and will not let this one disappointing experience cloud the esteem in which I hold Marriott properties, but this will be my last stay at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Hotel.

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Marriott for a few days between inter island visits and had a great time. Upon arrival, we quickly found the open-air lobby on Ohua Avenue. Check-in was fast and easy thanks to the very nice and efficient front desk attendant. He got us all checked in and on our way up to our room very quickly. As Elite members, we received complimentary wifi, buffet coupons, coupons for free Mai Tais, a card for free DVDs and a few other little welcome perks. Our cozy room was clean, well maintained and had beautiful views of Waikiki Beach and downtown Waikiki. We booked a standard room but received an ocean view, so the view was much better than expected. My wife and I were traveling with our two daughters and found the two double beds to be comfortable and sufficiently sized for the four of us.
