The room also contained a 55-inch flat screen television, a writing desk and chair, mini-fridge and a closet safe. The resort has two towers. The Paokalani Tower sits further back away from the beach on the mountain side of the resort. The Kealohilani Tower sits closer to the beach on the ocean side. We stayed in the Paokalani Tower and had a fabulous view of the beach, city and distant mountains. Great views are available in both towers. Each tower also has a pool and deck. The pool outside the Kealohilani Tower is surrounded by a bar, towel desk, nearby restaurants and other amenities. It’s nice if you prefer a more social and busy environment. If you prefer a quieter environment with less foot traffic, the pool outside the Paokalani Tower is more laid back but still easily accessible to all the amenities. The towel desk requires a guest signature to take out towels but thankfully, no annoying towel cards. The hotel does not sit directly on the Waikiki beachfront, so you must cross Kalakaua Avenue to reach the beach. The short walk to the beach was no big deal for us at all and waiting for the traffic light was literally the most time-consuming part of the trip. There are two ABC shops, a Starbucks and various other stores, boutiques and restaurants on resort property. There is also a business center where guests can print boarding passes. It requires a room key for entry and also offers internet kiosk services for an additional charge. We didn't find ourselves in need of anything and were able to leave the car safely parked in the garage for our entire brief stay in Waikiki. We were very satisfied with our visit and had a very enjoyable time. The only con with our room really worth mentioning was the tiny sized bathroom. Not only was it too small but instead of a door, it had a sliding partition that we found impossible to lock. That’s pretty much it for complaints. It’s not worth complaining about parking and resort fees because it's not exactly unique to Marriott and I've learned to live with it as long as no surprises appear on the folio that I didn't agree to when I booked. Thankfully, no weird charges showed up at checkout. Fees and tiny bathroom aside, we really enjoyed our stay and plan to return soon.

My family stayed at this hotel as part of our Trafalgar tour, so we didn't pay separately for the brunch or any other fees mentioned in other posts. But the location was fantastic, across the street from the beach and walking distance of everything. Large rooms, plenty of outlets for charging electronics, and the most incredible brunch.  The brunch had so many options, and the 'eggs to order' station was staffed by superman, he could handle 3 omelets and the waffle machines. It was like watching a show. The waitresses remembered us from day to day, and knew how we drank lots of water and brought us bigger glasses and refilled constantly. Absolutely beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff.

How many people experienced following: your work requires travel, you spent tens of thousands of dollars on Marriott stays, you slowly earn some rewards points, you got your status and then finally you find a time to go for a vacation. You use your hard earned points to book a stay, arrive at the place and expect that just for once Marriott will take care of you... and then the begging and arguing starts:"No sir, we don't have any king-size bed"... "you didn't specified that you want one" (yes I have plus it's in my profile)... "I have two double-bed"... NO WAY... "sir, I am trying to help you"... NO YOU NOT... "Here is your Resort Package that will cost you $38 per day (which you can't refuse), which will give you ONE breakfast per person per day, some worthless discounts, mai-tai "punch" in plastic cup and DVD rental card... what a great deal!""You will park your car with us? Sure, that will be extra $45 per day"...Don't bother - I have stayed here several time before, but this one was my last stay. Overcrowded zoo, unfriendly dorm with no feel... It is time to try some of the SPG hotels now when you can transfer the points...BTW if you really stay here there is $20/day (cash only) right across the street on Kuhio.

Nice room. Bathroom a little too small. Close to the beach and shopping. Staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, just fantastic. Parking was expensive and some nights there wasn't room for our vehicle.

Greeted poorly even though I'm an Elite member. Tried to get me to give a tip at check in. Breakfast is $$$$$ , $35 a person for average food. Would not recommend shops are expensive. Steak restaurant opens at 5 pm, makes people arriving waiting several hours

Marriott was very nice. Have stayed here before with our family. Rooms were spacious and clean, but an update it needed at some point. Staff was very accommodating.A Kuhio Beach Grill breakfast was including in our package. Although expensive to buy on your own ($33), it was one of the best breakfast buffets we have enjoyed. The Grill was recently upgraded in the last year and was amazing.Location and views of Waikiki beach could not be any better.And the cold towels provide by the poolside staff were a nice added touch to our hot days by the pool.Thanks for a nice visit

No, they don't have a lounge. Yes, they have a resort fee. However, they took great care of me and my family for a 5 night stay - resort fee was more than worth it. Right on the beach, 2 ABC stores on premises, surf lessons on premises, easy walk to aquarium/luau and International Marketplace. Very substantial breakfast buffet, and the patio Mai Tai's were great. Pool was fine for the younger kids to wind down after a long day but the star is the location on Waikiki Beach. Will stay again.

The hotel was a great place to stay. Food; even though somewhat pricey, was good. Only thing we didn't like was the crowded pool on the holiday weekend. They appeared to be mostly locals and it was a free for all'

We stayed for 1 night (a family of 4) in a 2x double bed room on our last night in Waikiki before returning home from Maui. There is no real soul to the hotel. It's a large operation. Check in was efficient and the hotel were very good at contacting us to let us know when are room was ready (around 11am). The room was basic but fine for a night. We were on the 4th floor and could hear all the traffic noise outside. The location is good with the beach directly across the road and many restaurants in the area. The concierge was disappointing as she was very abrupt and it worked out a whole lot cheaper and more pleasant experience booking our surfing lesson directly with the provider on the beach itself!

I had a reservation for 2 rooms with 4 people each room (total of 8 people) and upon check-in was given a rooms with what she called a King size bed and a rollaway. (The bed was Queen size at best). How does that make any sense? I very nicely tried to discuss this with her even pleading for at least one room with two beds, and she was adamant that there were no more rooms available. She went on to say that I did not specify I needed two beds in each room.....wow, really? 4 people, one bed - guess that makes total sense. Basically went on about her business and honestly did not care that we were standing there. Did. Not. Care. I was numb. The bellman took us and our bags to our rooms and he could tell how visibly upset I was. This is when miracles happened. He didn't make any promises, but he said he would see what he could do. That meant so much. I don't know how, but he made a call and was able to find two rooms with two beds each. Wow, I am forever grateful to him as he fixed a situation that had basically ruined the start of our long awaited vacation. Thank you, Duane, you have no idea what that gesture meant to us. You are the epitome of customer service. 5 stars for you! I cannot thank you enough.Also, have to say the guys in valet were great and very friendly. Starbucks in the lobby was a great perk for the guests. As for the for the front desk clerk, well.... she still had nothing to say when we went to get our new keys to the rooms we actually fit in (zero stars for her).

Great way station for a day early arrival while waiting for Saturday's cruise ship. Across the street from Waikiki Beach and close to fast food or fine food restaurants. Easy walking distance to a lot of entertainment. Not a good place to park although the hotel has some valet parking. That is the only parking available.

The only good thing about this hotel is it's location. Besides that, the construction is old, the pool is crowded, the service is mediocre. We stayed in the 11th floor and we could hear the noise from the street. Also we could hear the noise from next rooms like people talking, kids running and yelling, etc. The room was clean but old. We had a "partial ocean view" that was nice. From the room you couldn't see the ocean, but if you step out to the balcony the view was nice. I will not go back to this hotel mainly because of the noise level.

We had one night in Waikiki, as a stop on our way to a wedding on Kauai. The is a great hotel on the far far end of Waikiki Beach. The rooms were on the smallish side, but as expected for the location. Double beds instead of queens. The rooms all have a small balcony that overlook the beach, though it was a little obstructed, but still beautiful. It is a very short walk to the sandy beach, protected by a small seawall. Perfect for kids. The rooms are clean and well appointed, and everyone on the staff is warm, welcoming and helpful. It is also home to several good restaurants, bars and a small shopping mall. You get free drinks at check in. The Moana Terrace is a really nice poolside bar overlooking the beach. Tried Poke here for the first time and it was fantastic.

We were so pleased with our room and the location of the hotel. The concierge was a very big help with planning our tours. The hotel is located across from Waiki beach and within walking distance from a lot of great restaurants.

I have been traveling to Honolulu quite often for business and my first choice of hotels is always Marriott on Waikiki Beach. The hotel may be a bit old but the service is outstanding in all departments including front desk, restaurant, and housekeeping and that is largely the difference between other hotels in the area and the Marriott. Of course being situated in the heart of Waikiki and right on the beach are added benefits.A well run hotel, at its heart, has always the people who dedicate themselves to this superior service. Our gratitude goes to several of the finest staff members who have again and again touched our heart (including my wife’s who frequently accompany me on the trips) in a way that they have always gone out of their way to make us feel extremely special and made us feel that we were indeed in a paradise.Ms. Lorelie Rodrigues, the front desk manager, is always kind to accommodate our requests for room of our choice and to make sure that we are at home. But that is not the only reason why she brings value to Marriott operations. Ever since we have met her and seen her in action, we have seen remarkable changes in the attitude at the front desk. The front desk under her management has become friendlier, they have been very welcoming, they are always pleasant, and smiling and ready and willing to help. This is a very noticeable transformation in the front desk attitude from old “I just work here” attitude. This profound change reflects what Ms. Rodrigues has always shown us to be…..customer friendly, warm, and caring and going miles to please the customer. It is remarkable to see how one person’s pleasantness can be so contagious!!The top performer in the restaurant is Ms. Kim Mamiya. She is the hostess at the restaurant managing morning crowd for seating and followed by managing the servers to take care of the seated guests. Despite pressure and managing the most difficult logistics, Ms. Mamiya is always smiling and always very pleasant. I have seen her in this assignment for many many years and her attitude towards the guests has only gotten better. She is never flustered or aggravated. She is always calm, pleasant, and warm but above all extremely efficient. She is very approachable for special needs and she is extremely accommodating to your preferences in terms of seating and service.And if you were lucky enough to stay on 15th floor of beach side wing, you would experience the service from one of the best housekeeper, Marilou. Marilou adds to the hotel the brilliance and efficiency that are always first things to be noticed if they were missing. Marilou has a very pleasant personality and adding to that she has finest work ethics that you rarely see in this position. Once she is done with your room, it is meticulously finished with all your request in terms of extra towels, fresh sheets, special tea selection, etc complied with and leaving the room spotless, well groomed, and neat. On my last trip I stayed 10 days and she was off duty for about 3 days. Marilou was sorely missed during her absence because the differences in finish were very noticeable. Thank you Marilou for your superb service.We humbly request the management to pass on our gratitude to the very special people mentioned in this review.

We arrived at the Marriott around 2pm after our flight from Chicago. We were a group of 8 and heading out the next day for a NCL Cruise of the Islands. We had booked our overnight with NCL. We got two rooms that were a joining. One room was on the south end of the building so we had two windows one was looking out over Waikiki Beach and the other was a patio looking at Diamond Head. The check in process went very well, but our room key didn't open one of our rooms. They were in the process of changing the entry systems and our door was not updated, but our kids room worked fine. So, I had to return to the Front Desk to get a new key, and then the line was very long. I tried to talk with the Concierge and Bell Desk, but they told me I had to wait for the Front Desk. Our rooms were in excellent condition, I had read reviews about the rooms not being in good repair and that was not the case for us. The Resort is beautiful. My wife and I loved to sit in the lobby and watch the activity. The water in the lobby was a must stop each time we walked by it. We used the Fitness Center, Pools and shops along the walk way to the Beach. The resort is very close to the beach, which we spent the afternoon enjoying. We really enjoyed our stay and would go back anytime!!!

Fabulous location, very friendly staff and very accommodating. Kaleo is the best. Really too great care of on our visit. Restaurants were outstanding and the breakfast was fabulous each day. All facilities and accommodations were top shelf and very modern. Amanda at the concierge desk is the best on the island.

We enjoyed one night here before the NCL cruise. Property is beautiful and well maintained. We enjoyed drinks and food poolside (expensive $12/drink and a$23 quesadilla). Room facing ocean with a gorgeous view. Staff was very attentive. The beach is actually across the street, but there are crosswalks so it is safe with children. We also used the laundrymat on site and it was very clean. You are able to walk to multiple sites in Waikiki for shopping and dining.

This return trip to visit Hawaii was part of our 50th anniversary celebration that turned out to be so DISAPPOINTING for us. We booked this trip through TRAFALGAR TOURS in July 2016 we used them the first time went to Hawaii for 25th anniversary and we were happy. This time we only wanted a 3 island tour and after looking in the their tour book at what it included (sight seeing,meals etc. that were included we booked the trip.We planned to stay 2 weeks...1week with the Trafalgar Tour and the second week on the island of Maui which was the third island of the tour. So we booked the same hotel (and room) for our 2nd weeks stay. Jump ahead to 2017......time to head of to Hawaii .....and we get our itinerary........ and see the changes that have been made. Flight changes(not really big deal) hotel changes,/sight seeing changes that were disappointing to us. We called TRAFALGAR and were told that because we booked from 2016 book that things were now changed in the 2017 tour book. Helloooooooo! don't you think it would be a good idea to tell a client at the time of booking that this may happen.!!!!!2017...... we are off to start our 50th anniversary celebrations in BEAUTIFUL HAWAII....and are met at our hotel by a very sullen tour guide (not a good start) but "Hey"we are in Hawaii.Pearl Harbour which we visited on our 2nd day is a very somber experience and well worth the time to see. The Hilo National Park(Volcanoes) very interesting.....good walking shoes recommended.The optional helicopter ride ($250pp) we did not do.Those who did were not happy as the clouds were to low and blocked the view. The Manta Ray Learning Center in the Sheraton Kona Resort, Hotel is a young woman reading from prompt cards with a TV with a video of Mantas.Food in this hotel is over priced and average quality. This is true ALL of the hotels we stayed in.......Waikiki Beach Resort(Honolulu)........Sheraton Kona Resort & Spa(Kona)........Hyatt Regency Maui Resort & Spa.(Maui)Eating out in general is VERY EXPENSIVE in Hawaii......but the quality is superior to these hotels but this adds up to a more expensive vacation.We do want you to understand we still think Hawaii is BEAUTIFUL.....BUT....has become VERY commercial and EXPENSIVE..!!!!

Nice enough hotel fantastic location there are 2 buildings the front one with ocean views and views of Waikiki and Diamond Head obviously the better one. This is better furnished and much more spacious and modern !! Rooms in back building def need a refurb !!!! Handy with a few ABC stores in direct proximity and Starbucks and other shops/eating places ... Sooooo close to the beach !!!!!! The gym is one of the better ones I've been too !!! Two pools ( one for each building ) handy .. good Happy Hour ...All up pleasant stay .. staff very welcoming and obliging ..

Located on Kalakua Avenue on the eastern end of Waikiki Beach, this is a top Marriott property. The lobby, restaurants and rooms are beautiful and top notch. They offer a lot of amenities especially to elite members including room upgrades and daily complimentary breakfast buffet (awesome selection). There's a daily $35 resort fee and daily valet parking is $45 so it can get expensive. Kim and Geogette in the Kuhio Bar and Grill and Wilson at Registration were most helpful and professional.

We were to spend to nights at this hotel. The first night, we were to pay for our room and the second night, it was to be paid by Norwegian Cruise Lines. We traveled with two other couples and asked to be in rooms near each other. Our flight to Hawaii was delayed overnight in Phoenix and I called to tell the hotel. They did not charge us for it, and confirmed our next night's free reservation. Our rooms were not located on the same floors, but we had been upgraded to an oceanview room, which we loved! The hotel was open and very "Hawaiian" in design. The rooms were clean and quiet with very comfortable beds. The next morning we could watch the Hokele'a canoe come into port from our balcony! Everyone we spoke to was very helpful and full of aloha spirit. We would stay here again!

Well great place to stay. Beach across the road and is fun at high tide. But..... there are two pools the back pool was so small that 15 people in it and it was full!!!! The front pool could have been a Lot bigger also there could be a lot more steps and not so deep around the edges. In between the to pools was a area that lays to waste!!! Apart from the pools... the rooms were great so big. Clean. And yes we would go back there again.

Beautiful Beach and hotel! The staff was the best!! Always friendly and helpful! Views were amazing! A BIG shout out to Buster the bellman! He is the best there is! Definitely an asset to the hotel!Mahalo!

Beautiful lobby, we stayed only one night before catching the cruise ship.. only thing was our room seemed like it was a long, long way to the elevators to get to the main floor.... Staff was friendly, great bar on the pool deck served good hamburgers!!

This resort is what you would expect from Marriott. The hotel has recently had a renovations to the downstairs lobby and it is fresh and airy. There are however 2 drop off points and we were dropped to the rear of the hotel and spent 20 mins waiting for the rest of our party who had been dropped off at the front. There was no concierge at the rear so no guidance there on where to go and we had to haul all of our bags up to reception to check in. We stayed with 4 other families, and before arriving had made contact with the hotel to see if they would accommodate us all staying in close proximity of each other. They did put us all on the same floor, however, a couple of families were upgraded to suites and ocean views and a couple were not. I suggested on check out that it would have been better to keep everyone in the same room type, but I guess thats luck of the draw. We also heard the plumbing in the surrounding rooms a lot.The rooms and facilities were very clean and well appointed. Not outdated at all. The lifts ran really well, we never found we were standing around waiting as you do in some other high volume resorts. Wifi was also really good which was great.Pool bar staff were a little hit or miss. One waitress in particular obviously wasn't happy to be at work when we were there! Lots of restaurants close by. Pool is small, but we didn't use it, the beach is straight across the road.Really need to look at the response times for check in and check out. Both times, we waited a considerable amount of time, and there were hardly any people waiting in line. Appeared that all the staff were out the back, and when called to assist, no one came.Overall a nice stay and would recommend, especially for those travelling with kids.

We had a fantastic stay at this resort. The location of the property is outstanding, right across the street from Waikiki beach, with a terrace and one of the pools overlooking the beach. The rooms were good-sized and clean, each one with a balcony. There are several restaurants on the property, as well as a Starbucks and ABC Store in each of the two towers. We enjoyed watching the sunset while listening to live music on the terrace by the pool each evening. They provide towels for use at the pool and the beach. Every single thing we requested, they did well and promptly. We were there with our three teenagers, so needed two connecting rooms - check. With a rollaway so each could have his/her own bed - check. Asked for the rollaway to be delivered and the room cleaned at a certain time to not wake the sleeping kids - check. Called down to alert them of a group of kids having a noisy gathering down by the pool around 10:30 PM, and all was quiet within 15 minutes. Plus a call back to confirm what was happening and that they'd addressed it. Lovely Catholic church right next door. Nice perks for Marriott Rewards members. We would definitely stay here again.

The property is situated in a great location, walking distance to shops and local attractions for that area. Provides easy access to the interstates for going on your own adventures around the island. Bedrooms are very large with tons of space, great TV and awesome mattress for laying your head down in the evening after a long day of sightseeing or work. Access to food is plentiful and many options to choose from.Staff at check-in need to be counseled on check-in responsiveness, especially if there are more than 1-2 people waiting to be checked in, if undermanned, then supervisors and managers should come to the aid and assist. Other than the check in process and cost of parking for hotel guest, nice hotel and would like to come back.

We were staying over night before our hawaiian cruise. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable. It is right across from the beach. We loved it. There are plenty of boutiques in the lobby. The lobby is beautiful and partly outdoors. We did not have time to use their restaurants but there were several options.

Stayed here for one night before a cruise. Resort was very nice. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Very nice modern rooms. Staff was super friendly. Had a very good (pricey) breakfast buffet at one of the restaurants. Would stay here again sometime. They also have an ABC store located on the property.

We attended a convention at the Hawaii Convention Center and stayed for a week at the Waikiki Marriott. The hotel is very good and the service is very good. As a platinum Marriott member, we got a room on a high floor with a beautiful view of Diamondhead. Rooms facing East do get sun in the morning so bring an eyeshade - the blinds do not block 100% of the sunlight. The morning breakfast was included in our spa package and it was very good. However, one morning we had to wait twenty minutes to get into the dining room because it is a very large hotel and the dining room is small. If you want a simple breakfast, there is a Starbucks in the back of the lobby and also every fifty feet in any direction outside of the hotel. We did have a concern with the "concierge" service. We rely on the concierge at a Marriott to help us with planning local activities. The concierge at this hotel is a service run by Expedia. The job of the concierge is not to give you helpful advice, but to sell you on the most expensive possible tours. I assume the concierge is on commission. We did buy two tours (snorkeling and a luau) and they were very nice. Just don't ask about visiting the Bishop Museum in Honolulu since there is no profit for the concierge or Expedia in that. You will get an abrupt answer. The hotel should post signs saying concierge services provided by Expedia and not by Marriott. There is an Enterprise car rental office in the hotel open from 7 am to 3 pm. If you want to rent a car from Enterprise, see them, not the concierge.

The hotel was nice - beautiful open air lobby, clean pool, and comfortable beds. I am only giving this a four star review because the rooms are a bit tired and need a refresh. However, there is a million dollar view of the beach from your hotel balcony and there is also a postcard view of Diamond Head from the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful. In particular our waitress in the morning at the breakfast buffet, Janice, was the best waitress that we have ever encountered at any Marriott or Ritz Carlton property in our frequent travels. Lastly, the breakfast buffet is not to be missed. Wonderful omelette bar, selection of fresh tropical fruit (including lychee) and a variety of fresh squeezed juices. We will definitively be back for a few days again on our next trip to Maui and the Big Island.

The hotel is beautiful located across the street from Waikiki Beach. The open lobby concept allows you to soak up all the beauty Hawaii has to offer. We paid for an ocean view and while we could see the beach from our room, we were several blocks back so we were slightly disappointed having paid more for the room. The service and restaurants at the hotel were all wonderful and we would stay there again if visiting Oahu

This hotel is pretty good. It is down the quieter end of Waikiki and had a safe swimming beach across the road The beds were comfy and room is great size. We had partial ocean view. Clean and tidy. The staff on check in were really lovely and helpful. The pool side is good but you have to pay for the Cabana use. We rented beach chairs and umbrella which I would recommend. Food was okIf I go back to Waikiki would maybe stay again or try the other end

The place really is beautiful. We booked it for my parent's 48th wedding anniversary! The only issue I have is the "resort fee". We were not told of the resort fee prior to check-in and the gentleman at the desk told my parents to pay it or find somewhere else to stay. They are 70 years old. I went to the Marriott website to try and figure out what the resort fee covers. There is literally NO information on the website. What in the world is the $35 a day resort fee for??!! They got 2 coupons for a free Mai Tai's. I then called Marriott's 1-800 number. She even had trouble figuring out what it was for. She finally finds something that says snorkeling or scuba lessons for ONE, a Mai Tai, and a fitness class. My mother is deaf and has a cochlear implant so scuba/snorkeling lessons are out, my dad has hearing aids and bad knees. This resort fee is BS!

I'm a Marriott loyalist and this property does not disappoint. With my status (Gold or Platinum) I received a free breakfast buffet voucher for each night I stayed there. The breakfast buffet is amazing, with any type of fruit you could want, as well as a made to order omelet bar. (Also, don't forget to try the cinnamon rolls - they are to die for). I was upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View room on the 23rd floor that had quite the amazing view of Waikiki and the ocean from the balcony. The room was nicely air conditioned and clean. The Hotel has multiple onsite restaurants/bars, two pools, one Jacuzzi, a pretty extensive gym for a hotel, and an onsite laundromat that takes quarters or credit card. There is a $35 daily resort fee to be aware of. The internet was fast and I had no issues streaming video and using face time.All in all this is a great option if you are looking to stay on Waikiki Beach!

Very large hotel with nice open-air lobby. Great breakfast buffet, nice clean pools with fantastic views of Waikiki Beach. Dated but clean & spacious rooms with great ocean views of Diamond Head. My one tip is don't get fooled by the excursions offered in the lobby. We did the Pearl Harbor trip & wish we had not. We should have known better- group excursions are not our thing & it was way overpriced.

Standard fare for a Marriott resort style hotel. Beautiful open lobby, tremendous views from the room balconies, nice fitness facility. Plenty of restaurants and shops within the hotel plaza. Short walk to beach and shopping.

We travel in pairs and were delegated our city view rooms as we were part of a cruise tour. Didn't spend the money to upgrade! Our room had a view of diamond head and the water, the others had the water and our cruise ship floating by along the city. The beds were comfy and there were plenty of restaurants and shops to keep us happy! Very well managed and organized! Ice and water machines everywhere which we loved to refill our cups great location although not much beachy beach infront of hotel but close enough.

Nice hotel for the area but it is on the pricey side. There are resort fee's etc that drive up your nightly cost. The rooms are nice and its very close to shops, restaurants beaches. The staff was great.

Purchased an 8 day stay via luxury escapes and this resort is far from being ' luxury' . Firstly was told we had to pay a resort fee of $35 per day , even tho this was included in luxury escapes price ( which by the way was not a great deal !) argued with desk staff and the resort fee taken off our bill . Room was nice slightly old , beds very uncomfortable . Pool area nice but very busy . No where near enough lifts for the amount of storeys or rooms and wait for lifts was at one stage 15minutes! . Found some hotel staff a little rude and some couldn't even speak clear English so couldn't get any assistance in finding locations around town . A lot of homeless people at this area of town but they weren't any bother to anyone . Handy to have abc store and Starbucks downstairs. Overall we were in Waikiki for 14 days and our first 6 nights at another smaller resort were much better in comparison . I wouldn't recommend this resort as a 4/5 star resort and won't book here again in our next visit to Waikiki . But Hawaii is amazing and sometimes you just overlook small details to enjoy the bigger picture

I am Marriot platinum and stayed all around the world this is one of the least value for money properties I have stayed in for a long time. Thankfully I only stayed a few nights. Firstly I have a problem with the description of this hotel. Why does it have beach and resort in its title? You may expect the hotel to be on the beach with a private beach area ... but no it is just near a public beach as there is a road in between and depending on your room you could be 100s of meters from it. Secondly why is it calling itself a resort and charging people $35+ tax per night ? There is nothing resort like... If the management think it's because it has some shops in the hotel selling over priced shirts ( which anyone could buy outside on the road) and various desks selling tours etc ( pretending to be concierge) they really are living in the clouds. The hotel is rather old with very low ceilings. I was upgraded to a larger room but the bathroom was tiny. I dread to think what the standard rooms are like. Breakfast is fine but nothing special for the price. The hotel seems to be stuck in 70s/80s, competition and standards have moved up and they are well behind. This property needs a massive upgrade in quality and downgrade in the price they charge!

Close to home, beach and to all that waikiki has to offer. Shops, dining and more! Easy to get to, parking was a little crowded, probably due to the weekend events but good idea to get some parking before the late afternoon/evening rolls around. Relaxing and convenient.

Our Norwegian Cruise offered a free room at this hotel the night before our cruise. It is a beautiful open air lobby with gorgeous furniture to lounge in! When we arrived our room was not handicap accessible, but the hotel quickly made it right and gave us another beautiful room that I am certain was way above our rate for the original room. The staff was very kind to want to make things right with us. The hotel sits right across from the beach with lots of small shops and hotels within walking distance. From the moment we arrived at the hotel , the bellhop and hotel staff were extremely friendly! Beautiful views on one side of the hotel, so ask for a room with an ocean view. Enterprise Rental car is inside the hotel lobby which is extremely convenient. Burger King nearby for meals not so expensive. Parking is underneath the hotel and their is a charge for parking.

We stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa for 9 nights in September 2016. We were there for a conference and arrived at a time when several other travelers arrived. The staff quickly adjusted and opened up more desks for check in to take care on the growing line.Conveniently located just a minute walk to the beach and many shops and attractions. Most travel/tour buses stop at this resort which makes earlier pick ups and drop offs after a long day of sightseeing very convenient. Both pools were nice, a good temperature, and plenty of chairs poolside. The outside bar and food service was very nice with great views. Live music brought a crowd but only had to wait a few minute to sit and be served.Staff was friendly and helpful. We had to move rooms mid-stay due to a change in reservation (work paid for first half of stay, second half was on our dime). We started in an ocean view room which was nice, but the view was obstructed by other buildings. Once we moved to a room with Diamond Head views we had a GREAT view not only of Diamond Head but also beautiful water views.Check out was easy. No problems during our stay. If you're interested in being close to the beach and want to take tours, this is the place for you!

Our family of 4 was only here one night at the end of our vacation. They had already arranged for a surprise upgrade to something they called a "family room." I searched the hotel website and do not see this type of room even listed on their website. It was a large room with a king bed, 2 doubles, 2 full bathrooms and 2 small balconies. You could have slept 6 people comfortably. Our room had a city view. It was quite large, but one big room rather than a separate bedroom. No closet, but instead there was a wardrobe. Upon check in, we were given some chocolate covered macadamia nuts and 1 coupon for a mai tai. (Could be substituted for a beer or soda, but not for any other bar drink.) The hotel itself is very large and includes a shopping area with multiple stores and boutiques. It is right across the street from the beach in a very busy city area of Waikiki. Local schools had just let out for the summer, so there were lots and lots of locals there. The immediate beach area was contained by a wall so that the water was very smooth and calm. Walk a minute or two in either direction for more open water with bigger waves. Within a short walk on the beach, there are several different companies set up to rent equipment. We did an outrigger canoe surf ride, which was really fun but short. There are tons of hotels and shops in the immediate area. We had a late night flight, so we checked out and they stored our luggage for the afternoon. Later we were able to use the hospitality lounge and restrooms to change clothes before heading to the airport. We ate breakfast at the beach bar buffet on site. It was a bit pricey, but it was very good and offered a really interesting variety that you don't normally see at breakfast buffets. (An entire section of cold noodles with toppings . . .miso soup, etc) The hotel staff were all very helpful and accommodating, and you can tell that they really appreciate Marriott loyal guests. They made our quick visit a really nice one, and a great ending to our Hawaiian vacation.

We stayed here for 9 days, we arrived way outside the checkin time when we arrived at 6am the front desk found us 2 rooms ready and up graded us also. The beach is a few steps from the hotel, we made use of the happy hour, watched the sunset and enjoyed the music on site. Rooms were always refreshed superbly and staff friendly. The onsite laundry was a bonus and simple tap and go payment. Could do with a 2nd luggage stand if I was too be picky. Would return.

I was hesitant because of the Parking situation! Next time i wont rent a car, everything is within a distance and easy to get around. (Parking is impossible in Waikiki but my stay at this hotel was amazing..Wonderful staff front desk and hosts you guys Rock..Thank you so much for making this the best stay for my niece, daughter and i. mahalo..

The rooms were OK but the bed was horrible. If the hotel was redone a few years ago, they forgot the beds. Its also on the far side of Waikiki Beach away from most of the things to do but close to the Zoo.The food was really expensive. $30/pp for a breakfast buffet. The value wasn't there.

This is a review from May 2016 that somehow never got posted so here it is again. We stayed here for our honeymoon and they gave us an ocean front room with an awesome view on one of the higher floors. When we got to the room, there were hearts on the bed shaped out of rose petals. We loved that. The service here at this hotel is exceptional, similar to most of Hawaii. The staff was always asking us how our stay was and ensuring we had a good time and asking us if we had any questions or needed any help with out plans for the day etc.etc. We also received 2 complimentary drink tickets per night for the duration of our stay. We used them at the bar close to the pool for our mai tais.This hotel is right across from Waikiki Beach on the far end closer to the zoo. The hotel itself is older but is still fantastic and the rooms are nice with no concerns. This part of Waikiki Beach is nice and quiet and not as jammed as the main part of the beach. There is also a breaker wall in the ocean in front of the hotel so the water is calm. Within a 10 min walk you can be in the heart of Waikiki. This being the case, we loved the location and prefer it to anywhere else on Waikiki.The lobbies at the hotel are beautiful with the waterfalls etc. There are also a lot of amenities: there are 2 ABC stores in the complex as well as many other shops, some with high end jewellery and arts and crafts. There is also an area for the tour buses to pull up which makes it extremely convenient. There are restaurants all over the place and the Marriott had a breakfast buffet for ~ $29 per person. We never tried it though. Instead we would frequently get the banana pie at the McDonalds close by....something we don't get at home.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and we thought the hotel was beautiful and in a desired location. In fact a group of friends stayed here last month and thoroughly enjoyed their stay. I would highly recommend and will visit again.

This was a good place to stay for a few days. Excellent location (from my door to the beach, it was maybe a 4-minute walk), relatively quiet, and good service. The pool and hot-tub were nice and relaxing, and offered a good view of the beach. The lobby was a nice place to sit and hang out, because it was very open and airy. My only complaint would be that our patio door was broken - it didn't open, and it would have been nice to sit on the patio and look at the beach. Overall, though, good hotel.

We attended a wedding in Hawaii and decided to stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott as I was a loyalty member, however reception informed me that as we were on a package deal I could not claim any loyalty points. When we arrived in our room we were once again disappointed to find two double separate beds. Thankfully the receptionist, Kalea, went to no end of trouble to place us in a room with a King size bed with a view of the Ocean. This gesture set the standard of excellent and friendly service for the rest of our stay. It was a 3 minute walk to the beach front and all the fun activities associated with beach life. The Marriott has two swimming pools and a large outdoor spa. For those who are gym junkies there is a well equiped gym for guests use. As evening approached we took full advantage of the outdoor bar, happy hour and snacks. We only attended breakfast in the Hotel Restraunt once as it was only a short walk along the beach front to an array of eating places. Overall we loved this Hotel as the room was great and the staff treated us like VIP's.

It's not often I rave about hotel food. Well here it is. I was at the first night of the return of the buffet in the Kuhio Beach Grill tonight. Where to start. I started small, just as well, gorgeous poached fish, salad, then prime rib eye which was so divinely soft, then i felt I had to try the noddles with seafood. Ok I then had a small chocolate dessert and a little cheese. The delicious Mai Tais washed things down nicely. In addition to the food, the hotel is great. The room is clean and I love the Thann toiletries. the sheets and bed are super comfy, I especially love the pillows. The surf school at the hotel is A+. End of rave.

The Vacation Club shares the facility with the Waikoloa Marriott Resort Hotel. In reality the Vacation Club is 95% Hotel and 5% Vacation Club. Cooking facilities rival a Red Roof-namely a microwave oven and a refrigerator. Albeit, there are a few outdoor grills; but minimal cutlery are provided. Also, sheets for the beds are too small so they quickly become loose. Finally, you must use bell hops as no baggage carts are available. This is not a Vacation Club, it is a Hotel. For a Club experience go to another Marriott Vacation Club on an other island. As a Hotel, the Waikoloa is probably a four star facility.

We stayed here for our trip and loved it! They have all you need within the hotel except the beach which is across the street. The higher floors have the best view of the beach and they really cater to travelers. The rooms are nice and well kept with speedy elevators. Definitely would stay here again!

We stayed here in May 2017. Here mainly for a NCL Hawaii cruise. So we stayed at this hotel one night prior to cruise and one night after the cruise before heading back home. Hotel is clean and rooms were very spacious and clean. We had a junior suite which was very nice. Amenities in hotel and room were good. ABC store in hotel. which you will see everywhere in Hawaii. Location of hotel is great. Right across the street is the beach! Also, maybe a 10 minute walk and you have all your shops, restaurants, etc.

As expected, this was an extremely nice hotel located right across from the beach; the staff were friendly and professional. The room was clean with a spacious bathroom containing a tub and a stylish shower. The bed and pillows were comfortable.This hotel does contain food and beverage outlets including a Starbucks and pool bar and grill; happy hour is 2-6 pm. In addition, there are countless other restaurants and bars within walking distance.I wasn't too happy with the $35 resort fee, but I would still stay here again. I recommend it.

We stayed here for 4 nights, paid the extra for a room with a view and was not disappointed! Spectacular views over the beach. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, the bedding was great and room was more than big enough. Great pool side bar, the pools are on the smaller side but still quite nice.

Aloha,The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is my home away while on Oahu. Coming from Maui, the service, the view, the location, and the price, could not be any better. As a Marriott Member & Family Member to the Waikiki Marriott, I will always recommend and show my appreciation for the great service over the last few years. The Management could not be any more professional, considerate, generous, and accommodating. A special thank you to those that I have had the pleasure to work with ;) You know who you are :) For the locals, business professionals, and for those that are coming for vacation, you would be making a great choice to stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa. You will have a great view, have convenience down in the ABC store and shops below, be perfectly located in Waikiki, enjoy the quiet and nice pool, get relaxed in the Spa, and have one of the best beaches in the world across the street. Do yourself the favor and treat yourself, someone special, or family members to a great property while on vacation, getting away for the day as a local, or business professional doing business on island. Mahalo's Everyone & CYA next month :) JB

First let me say that we are Marriott people. We enjoy Marriott and feel that the reward points are worth it. We had earned three nights and use them in Hawaii at this hotel. This hotel is very centrally located and has all the amenities you need to travel around the city. Renting a car and parking fees are extremely expensive. We liked that we could rent a car straight from the hotel, enterprise and turned it in the same day saving parking fees at the hotel. You can rent multiple days however rent it one day at a time to save on the parking fees. I called the concierge at this hotel several times and she helped me plan our vacation. She was extremely helpful. I am a big Internet researcher however I really feel like the tip she gave me saved us a lot of time and money. The hotel is large and directly across from the beach. It has an ABC store right before you hit the beach. If you don't know what an ABC store is it's like a convenience store Walmart. It has everything.

This hotel offers quieter atmosphere, but it still is only a 15-minute walk from the center of Waikiki, i.e. the Royal Hawaiian, the Moana, the International Market Place. Although it is not right on the beach, all you do is cross the busy Kalakaua Street and you are on a sandy beach. The breakwater holds back the waves, so even kids can enjoy the water. The other side of the hotel fronts onto Kuhio Street, where there is a bus stop for several bus lines. Number 2 will take you to Diamond Head (a great hike - do it in the morning, when the heat is more tolerable), or in the opposite direction to number of points of interest for $2.50/pp. Ask for a transfer and if you can be back on the bus in two hours, that is all you pay for both directions. The hotel itself has a couple of nice restaurants - steak house and sushi and another restaurant for breakfast. Yes, there is Starbucks there too. The buffet is quite good. The Enterprise Rent-a-Car office is right at the hotel and there are many shops as well. If you want to eat out, there is no shortage of eateries to suit every taste and budget just steps away. The pool is not huge, but the lounge chairs are always available, unlike some other places we have stayed at. The room furniture could use an update, but the rooms are large, with spacious balconies and who wants to stay in the room much, anyway? We will return.

This place is close to everything, beach, shops, eating (ABC Store right inside!). Very nice place to stay if you want to be in the thick of all things Waikiki. It has shops within in it that are interesting, very pretty property. Staff is friendly and helpful. Only reason I don't give it a 5 is the food. Thought it could have been a little better.

We have stayed at this hotel multiple times. The location is great. While all views that we have had have been good, the ocean view back towards the heart of Waikiki is fantastic. Parts of the hotel are starting to show some age but it is not bad. The bar area is very good as service is good at the bar and the view right over the beach is neat! If you do not sit at the bar, service can be spotty. It can be very good to downright poor. The bar is pricey but you are in Waikiki which is expensive everywhere.The pool is solid but not overly large.We did have one hiccup this trip and one day our room was not cleaned. We called the front desk just to get clean towels. We left for dinner and the towels were not in the room. We had to call a second time for towels which they were delivered within minutes.The staff is very nice at this location and I will be staying here again.

Not only is the hotel in a good location ( walking distance to beach, stores, etc.) it's own restaurants & bars are very good; as well as the entertainment. My friends & I spent 2 nights at the Waikiki Marriott before a cruise around the Hawaiian Islands. In my excitement I forget to pack 3 pieces of clothing, I thought I would let this go & deal with it until I got home. When I called I spoke to a lovely lady named Rose who located my items. 1 day later a very nice man named John from security called to explain how the shipping would work. 2 days later I got my items. The hotel is clean & beautiful with comfortable beds & a " VERY" caring staff.

From the time we checked in too the time we left the staff where very helpful.The location is great to just walk out onto the beach or main strip.The staff at meals are make you feel very welcome.There is a dive tour in the hotel if you wont to go out to look at turtles.One of Marriotts better hotels .

This hotel is located in the best spot in town !!! Great service and the rooms are nice. They have great restaurants too !!! Of course I would go back !!!!They have beautiful shops downstairs where you can get souvenirs and resort clothes. Just across the street you will find Waikiki beach which is one of the most popular in town. Loved that beach !!!! And on the same street you will find lots of shopping. Great shopping and amazing restaurants !!!!

On a recent trip to Honolulu, we added 2 extra nights prior to a cruise on NCL at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa. What a wonderful choice! Beautiful property, warm and helpful staff and amenities aplenty. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Situated directly across from the beach, the hotel is within easy walking distance to recreation, shopping, eateries and all things necessary for a good stay. The hotel itself contains numerous boutiques and several very good food options, should you decide to stay close. Highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Been at this nice hotel several times. Great location, nice and clean rooms. Across the street to Waikiki beach, and short distance to shopping area. Highly recommended, and we have reorder at this hotel for the forth time for the upcoming vacation this yearHelpfull staff

Quick visit to Honolulu to get some respite from work the Marriott was just great. The staff very helpful and willing to please.The view from our ocean facing room therapeutic.Beach across the road packed with people as expected, sunsets beautiful. Perfect photo keepsakes

Room a little dated. Nevertheless, great location to be able and walk everywhere. Including to Diamond Head, if you choose to do so. Pools are also nice. It was not crowded nor was it noisy. We would consider staying there again.

This was my first time to stay at this hotel. I found this Marriott had excellent service. They were very helpful at a busy time as I was here both for an office visit and to attend a convention at the Hawaii Convention Center. Housekeeping was excellent and the room was great. I had been so busy traveling that I couldn't catch up to my reviews but didn't want to leave this hotel out because they were so good. I like the fact that I could go to church service next door to the hotel.

My partner and I spent 8 nights and the fabulous Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa in May 2017. Loved the location of the hotel, so close to the beach and also a popular tour group meeting point. Would highly recommend for those planning on booking tours with pick ups from their hotel - has a specific tour lobby to eliminate confusion regarding pick up location.The staff were fantastic. We arrived early, well before check in time but were checked in on the spot and given a room upgrade to ensure we could enter our room straight away. The view was great, overlooking the ocean and towards diamond head.Amazing beds!! Super comfortable, ensuring a great nights sleep before each fun filled waikiki adventure. The hotel also offers a number of restaurants, with special mention to Arancino di mare, fantastic authentic Italian restaurant with great coffee!We will be returning on our next visit :)

We had a great experience during our week at the Marriott Waikiki. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable. The beach is right across the street which was extremely convenient. The only problem we encountered was the parking lot. If you came back after 5pm it was always at capacity. We learned that you could valet for free, but there were no signs indicating this which made for a frustrating game in the parking lot. Besides that, the hotel was great and would definitely stay again.

This was a great place to visit full kitchen/ washer and dryer all the comforts of home clean rooms pool,laguna or beach view depending on what side you stay coffee and shops were within walking distance.

We checked in for a 3 night pre-cruise stay (NCL). We had an ocean view room which really wasn't a full view but it was a good view. The room was very clean. The furniture reminded me of the 60's and 70's style my mother had. There could be some updates made to the rooms. That being said, the mattress was very comfortable. The lobby area was very clean and the front desk people were very nice. Any staff we encountered were very nice.The hotel was in an excellent location. Close to attractions and restaurants. Instead of getting the expensive breakfast buffet in the hotel, we opted to get some muffins or banana bread and fruit at the ABC store in the hotel. The room has a fridge. It also has a coffee maker with pretty good coffee.Would we stay here again? Probably unless we could find a better deal for a decent place.

This location was picked by our travel arrangements but was very nice. Check in was easy the rooms were nice and the staff was helpful. This hotel is across the street form the beach which was beautiful.
user_name:
Mike H
Washington Court House, Ohio

review_body: Beautiful room, great views (if you have ocean view) and a lovely open main lobby. The resort connects to shops, a mall, multiple onsite restaurants and a Starbucks. Comfortable bed, large rooms. I would definitely stay there again!

We were part of a tour group so this hotel was selected for us. But I was very pleased with the hotel, the staff, the area, and the comfort of the room. We had breakfast included as part of our tour and it was superb! The food was delicious and the staff there did a wonderful job. Waikiki Beach is a busy area but this hotel was quiet enough for our stay -- we did hear some street noise. The shops along the beach area are numerous and it gives you something fun to do to get out around people to eat and shop. There are a number of homeless people in the area and you might find them laying on the ground near the beach while all the people are milling around. You will also find them using the picnic tables for beds. They did not bother us but they are there. There are so many stores and restaurants here but this is a very touristy area. I enjoyed my time here and enjoyed this hotel very much. If you are there on a Friday night, one of the hotels does fireworks so you can sit on the beach and watch the short show. We also walked to Diamond Head from here and to the top of it to see the crater. Round trip was about 8 miles though.

I checked in with one of my besties for a girls' birthday week of fun, sun and shopping. The Marriott is well located at the Honolulu Zoo end of Waikiki..you can walk to anywhere from here...and we did. Check-in was great...room ready. We were in the tower further back from beach with a beach view...lovely, clean and comfortable. The gym was fantastic...two pools and a Starbucks in the foyer. Busy but never felt crowded. Bus stop at back if hotel and easy shuttle, and tour bus pick up and drop off. We had vouchers for Mai Tais which we used. All good...but..the bar staff in the Moana Terrace bar were rude, dismissive and arrogant. No customer service at all and having one last G&T on our last night left a negative spin on what had been a great stay. Many people pass through hotels and all wanting a great holiday experience from all perspectives....the bar staff let the Marriott team down on this occasion!

We had to use up a bunch of Elite points and booked a gorgeous ocean view suite on the 33rd floor. Lani at the check-in desk was beyond helpful and so nice. She gave us breakfast vouchers for the week (states clearly on the front that it's 1 voucher per person @blare246) for free breakfasts and explained where everything was located. Breakfast is located on the 2nd floor. This hotel has 2 pools, an outdoor cafe where you can people-watch and have cocktails (Susan is fantastic) and a very nice gym (free headphones to use every morning) located on the 3rd floor. Maid service was very good. Everything is within walking distance of this hotel. There are many shops, a spa geared towards weddings, and several places to eat. Is this the Montage at Maui? No. It's Waikiki - it's noisy. I would describe it as the Vegas strip in paradise. I do want to point out that the picture online makes it look as if this hotel is on the beach - it is not. You have to cross a 3-lane road to get to the sidewalk and then to the beach. The worst part is, and this is not the fault of the hotel, is that the homeless population is out of control. The pavillions are filled with them, thereby rendering them useless to get out of the sun. They're laying all over the open areas, soliciting on the sidewalks and the cop cars were constantly parked right out front - breaking up fights and making arrests. It's sad that this is happening - we certainly wouldn't ever want to bring our kids here and unfortunately it's not safe to walk around after dark. I wonder how long the tourism industry can be sustained with this glaring and dangerous situation.

We checked into our room to find the room was already occupied. Upon returning to the main desk, I requested an upgrade which was given to us moving us to a room on the 13th floor over looking Diamond Head Mountain and also partial ocean view. Also the manager named Alyssa gave us each a voucher for the buffet breakfast and a complementary dinner. Alyssa knew it was our 30th anniversary vacation and she most definitely wanted to keep us happy. The room was very spacious, clean and the mattress was outstanding. The location is right across the street for Waikii beach. I would give the resort a 5 if it hadn't been for the mix up upon arrival.

Very nice hotel. The rooms are very nice. A little confusing at first to navigate. Breakfast was included and the restaurant is on the 2nd floor but you stay on the 1st floor by the reception desk and go all the way to the courtyard and then up the stairs or there is an elevator to use. Different towers but all Under one roof. There is an Enterprise car rental on the ground floor which is very convenient since the car is in the garage. The rooms were nice and our view had partial ocean and city view and mountain view. Lots of shops including an ABC store in the hotel. Lots of restaurants to walk to and the beach is across the street.

We've been looking forward to our Honolulu vacation for months and chose the Waikiki Marriott because we're Marriott Elite members. As such, we're used to a certain level of quality, and this hotel did not live up to that expectation.The only room available to us was next to an elevator. (They did offer an upgraded room for an outrageous amount of money.) We were told that the elevators shut down at 11 PM, but no one told us they reopened at 5 AM. The noise from the constant use woke us up and kept us up. The next day, we asked to move to another room, which they did. It wasn't as high up so our view of the ocean wasn't that great.At check in, they provided us with breakfast vouchers (which were included in the price we paid) and said each voucher was good for 2 people. The first 2 days we used them, we had no trouble; the waitresses took them without question. On the third day, we were told each voucher was for one person but they'd "let it slide" for the day. When we questioned the person at the reception desk about it, she said each voucher was for one person. We didn't like the fact that the policy seemed to have changed overnight.In general both rooms we had were old and outdated. We've been to Fairfields that were better quality. It was a big disappointment, especially considering how much we paid!

Very disappointed about the Waikiki Marriot Resort and Spa. Marriot hotels are not what they used to be in the 90s. They claim to be a 4 star hotel but this has to be reviewed because the only 4 stars service that I ve seen in this hotel were the prices, this hotel should be 3 stars not 4 stars at all. Rooms are old with a 70s decoration, bathrooms need to be redecorated, they do not look clean at all, and the resort charges you a 35 dollars fee for very bad services, I am sure for the same price you can find much better hotels in Waikiki beach. I am not traveling again with Marriott.
user_name:
evadiez2017
New York City, New York

review_body: Check-in was fast and easy in the open air lobby. Upgraded to ocean view room upon check-in. Room was very spacious. Plenty of room to unpack with drawers and closet. Safe in closet for anything you want to lock up. Small refrigerator. Coffee/tea box with tea bags, coffee, sugars, creamers, single serve coffee pot. Bathroom had stool and shower/tub separate from sinks/mirror. Love the soap, shampoo/conditioner and lotion, very fragrant, but not overwhelming. Balcony was big enough for a chair, recline chair and table. Could see the ocean and Diamond Head from balcony. Lot of street noise at night and early morning, but didn't keep us awake. Room was very clean, housekeepers did a great job and tipped them appropriately. Beds were comfortable and plenty of pillows. Just what you expect for a Marriott.

Overall, experience is good. Located across from main Waikiki Beach, shopping area, Diamond head and Honolulu Zoo. Location, Location, Location! On site amenities are good and several eating options on and around the property.

Stayed for 8 nights in April, 2017. The Hotel check-In staff were excellent, very accomodating and our room was upgraded. The Hotel has two towers, Paoakalani Tower at the rear and Kealohilani Tower at the front. We stayed in Paoakalani Tower on floor 28 with partial ocean views from our balcony. It was a great view towards Waikiki Beach. Our room was good, clean and enough space for the four of us. The Hotel public areas are neat and tidy. They have (free) cold water jugs in the lobby with slices of lemon/orange/pineapple - refreshing to drink & tasty. The Hotel has two pools & spas, the pool at the front of the Hotel is near a poolside bar/food area with lounges and tables/chairs. Great place to relax after a hard day and overlooks the beach and has great views of the sunset. The Hotel is right across the road from the beach, close to shops & restaurants. It is one block from the Honolulu Zoo and a short bus ride to Diamond Head. We had a great time at this Hotel.
user_name:
Jane M
New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Staying at his hotel was very good. The location and view of the ocean was incredible. There are so many hotels in Waikiki that do not offer unobstructed views. Ours was perfect and worth the room upgrade. The connected restaurants were ok and convenient. Breakfast was average and expensive. Would recommend looking for alternatives. The beach is across the street. The park is to the left. The zoo, aquarium, mall, and many other places are all close by. We would stay here again.

Before a short cruise back to Vancouver from Honolulu, we enjoyed four nights (three days) at the Marriott Waikiki Beach resort. The hotel was excellent in all respects. Check-in was straight-forward (at 5PM in the afternoon when we dragged our jet-lagged selves into the lobby) and my Marriott Gold Elite status was duly recognized. The room was clean and well equipped. Maid service was attentive and responsive to all requests (I left notes asking for, for example, extra Kleenex as I was recovering from a cold). The view of the ocean was restorative, as was the ability to relax on our private balcony. The balcony was of a very good size, including a lounger as well as table and chair. Most rooms in our vicinity had a balcony, but I am not sure if all hotel rooms have one. I recommend a balcony, and ideally an ocean view (although the view of Diamond Head is also spectacular). Food & Beverage service at this hotel was quite fine, generally. The room service approach is a casual one, eliminating the tray and delivering food in boxes. As a traditionalist I am not sure I quite like that, but my wife was fine with it. On our first night as we were so tired, we ordered room service, including one burger and one "special" type of sandwich--and asked if they could be split for sharing. Request was accommodated, and the food was quite good. Breakfast buffets were also quite decent--some different items in addition to the traditional eggs and bacon. A made-to-order omelet station (where one could also get fried eggs) was available too. Later in the week the breakfast buffet got busier, yet the staff sill do their best to get everyone seated as soon as possible. If you can eat before 7:30 AM or after 10AM, depending on the day you may miss some of the "rush hour". The Friday dinner buffet of Crab and Roast Beef was a very good value, although the room has no more ambience than at breakfast. I would suggest that in the evening the tables could be dressed with table cloths, perhaps some candles, just to "smarten up" the room somewhat. The hotel was well located--easy access (across the street with a light for safe crossing) to the ocean. Easy access to other parts of Waikiki too, albeit we just chilled at the pool or beach--mainly at the pool. Lovely loungers and the pool was pleasant for swimming. Attendants provided towels, and servers offered drinks--tried my first Mai-Tai at the pool and it was so good I had to try another! Kudos to the bartenders!Concierge service is available, including in advance of your stay for booked guests. The concierge got us on my "bucket-list" tour of Pearl Harbor, including out to the Arizona (tickets to go out to the memorial site must be arranged in advance, the concierge may be able to assist). For us the concierge used a company called Roberts Tours--they did a very good job; it made for a solemn yet good day at this important site. I found the concierge service very helpful generally, including with dining arrangements. We were very happy with the Marriott at Waikiki, no complaints (and those who read my reviews know that I am a "hard marker"). We would definitely return to this hotel next time we travel to Honolulu. We also loved Honolulu, and found everyone very friendly.

We were booked here courtesy of our travel company for a single night before a cruise. Pleasantly surprised. Staff very accomodating and organised access to guest lounge after a very early arrival from the airport. Although room wasn't ready, we were able to freshen up and explore till midday when we were slotted in to an upgraded room overlooking the beach. King size bed was extremely comfortable. Room and facilities excellent. Spent the evening on tbe balcony with sunset and champagne. While the hotel is not in the midst of the action, being situated on the beach a few minutes walk east is an advantage and improves overall experience. Highly reccomended.

I booked a junior suite, ocean front, in the ocean front tower. Room was large and TV was a 60" LED I think. Great views right on Kalakaua. This was a corner room so it had the lanai plus a window. Woke up looking the ocean daily. The room service was disappointing and served in a bag, no table to eat on. Breakfast used to be street level but is now on the 2nd floor. Also a bummer. No more outdoor dining. The Italian restaurant on the Ohua entrance was delicious so they frown on room charges, so we gave them a credit card. They obviously don't want to pay the hotel the commission when room charges are made. But the food was great. The bathroom sink was a double but the separate shower had old subway tiles, tiny, and needed upgrading. Overall for the price not a bad choice if you don't mind the street noise. Mattress is too soft and very old! Needed a good chiropractor every morning. Pillows are awful quality. I guess there is no place like home!

You can't beat the location, right across the street from the beach, and the open air lobby is amazing. But once you head towards your room, you'll begin to start noticing the a little age on the hotel. The room was comfortable, but they "upgraded" our room to an oceanview that was right next to the elevator. Big mistake. This hotel is 33 floors, so the elevators are relatively high speed. All we heard all day until about 1am is the sound of "jets taking off" as the elevators raced up and down. DO NOT let them put you in a room by the elevator. Fortunately, we were only here for 3 nights before going to Maui for 10 days, so we just sucked it up and got through it. But had this been where we were going to be for our entire vacation, I would have asked to move. That was the big negative, but you can't beat the location relative to the beach and restaurants.

When a friend of mine decided that this was the hotel that we would be staying at while we were in Waikiki, i was a bit disappointed as i previously stayed at the Outrigger waikiki beach and it was just perfect central and on the beach. When i looked up the Marriott they were situated further up near the zoo. The resort fees were $36.65USD per night and wifi in the rooms was $15.65USD per day. They have free wifi in the foyer area, but i think this fee should be included in the resort fees especially for a 4.5 star resort. so i was not looking forward to be staying at the Marriott. But to my surprise on arrival at the Marriott it really surprised the 4 of us, they were very friendly on arrival and tried there best to have us stay near each other as there were 4 of us with 2 staying in each room. The rooms were large with 2 double beds in each with partial ocean view. The bathrooms were a little small but we did make it work. The balcony was nice we would sit out there to have our lunch or a drink enjoying the views. We were located across the road from the beach and really not that far from everything, we would walk the strip every night to look for food and shop. As for the wifi, not sure if it was that i informed them that i was a member of the Marriott hotel group (well i joined a few days before we left) but we got free wifi in our rooms as well. so all in all this hotel did surprise us and we all said we would stay here again.Just 1 little problem, one of the mornings we had some questions about tours we had to wait 45min only 2 people working in the morning with alot of people waiting.Thankyou

This was an excellent Marriott. From a location standpoint it was great, downtown, close to a lot of things to do. It's right across the street from beach, quick drive to the airport or cruise ship terminal and walking distance to a lot to do within a mile. It may not be the nicest hotel on the strip or on the beach but it's still a great choice. The pool is very nice and the bar overlooking the beach and the ocean has great food and drinks.

This is a wonderful hotel for both business travelers and families. The rooms are incredibly spacious, and they all include a balcony with patio furniture. Most rooms have a view of the ocean. The carpet in my room needed replacing, but that is my only complaint. I was shocked at how quiet it was in my room, even though I was staying during Spring Break and the hotel was filled with families. The nightly music at the pool bar was loud, but it ended early, so it wasn't a problem. You have no choice but to pay the Resort Fee, but it includes the breakfast buffet, which is AMAZING! The line can be long for the breakfast seating, but it moves quickly, and the waitresses are super fast. All staff I encountered were extremely friendly and helpful, although the woman who checked in my colleague was unusually cranky--especially for a Hawaiian! I got a massage in the spa and it was fantastic. I will definitely stay at this property the next time I am in Honolulu.

Stayed at this hotel as part of a Trafalgar vacation tour of Hawaii. Its a nice hotel with a great view of Waikiki beach. Its walking distance from the water and tons of restaurants. The rooms are very nice and comfortable.

We visited The Marriott on our Trafalgar package tour to the 4 Islands in Hawaii. This hotel was very nice and we were lucky to have a view of Diamond Head out our 27th floor room. The entire Trafalgar trip was great as a tour director, Tom was with our group for all four Islands. All hotels where great and would highly recommend seeing Hawaii this way as you never know if you will be back.

I am a government employee and have stayed at this property numerous times. However, the last two times I have stayed there (always for business), I get harassed at check in. I show them my government issued id and they say it doesn't look legitimate. I don't make the rules here, I use the id I am issued. On my most recent stay, they went as far as to say that they have notes in my account that say I am not to be given the government rate any more because of the way my id looks. Notes on my account? So now that hotel keeps notes on its guests separate from the general Marriott database. Furthermore, they had the wrong address for me (correct with the general Marriott database) and they had the wrong preferences (also correct with the general Marriott database). So clearly they keep a shadow database of guests with notes no one can view except that property. The woman who checked me in said that the general manager wants to eliminate the government rate at this property. Who is he to dictate what the Marriott does? I told her that I was on the big island the day before and that property did not hassle me. She said that the Waikiki location is "the premier property in Hawaii". So that gives them the right to treat loyal guests any way they want? This is the last time I stay here. It is not worth the hassle.

Positives - nice hotel, nice bars clean rooms - nice lay out - great pools - walking distance to the main drag.Negatives - not on the beach, expensive, NO lounge for gold/plat level members - expensive drinks.

Although the room was nice we didn't come to the island to stay in our hotel room.  Our balcony offered us a view of the side street and a partial view of the beach, which was OK considering the location. This resort is also across the street to the zoo and walking distance to the aquarium. We have visited both places over the years of visiting this wonderful island in the Pacific!Not really much to add when your staying at a resort other than the typical, "our room was clean, the service was great, and the staff helpful in getting you on your way for the day.  We never had to ask twice for an extra towel or shampoo and all you had to do was to ask.  They had a pool which we took advantage of and was a change from being in the saltwater and the crowded Waikiki Beach!My only complaint was the resort fee... REALLY!  They should pay us for the business point of view.  They also charged for parking your "rental" that you rented from the building, which was absurd!! (hence the four stars)We ate breakfast around the corner where the prices were reasonable and of course the view of the beach and just being here was worth the price of admissions!  Can't say we will return in the near future but the extra fee's would discourage a lot of people from staying.

This hotel is awesome!!! It's been some time ago that we stayed here although we in the plans for another trip to Hawaii and are planning on staying at this property again. It's clean, nice staff, good location, walking distance to shops, restaurants, and beach. If you book a room with a balcony...its a beautiful view.

This is a very large hotel with a lot of restaurants and shops. The pool looks out towards the ocean. The hotel also caters to a lot of forgien tourist which gives everyone plenty of options when it comes to food. Location is great. And I would definitely stay there again.

What can I say. This was our second time visiting Hawaii and to me the I just love staying at the resort. We was remember by quite a few staff member from our last trip which really put us more at ease. We could walk through the lobby first thing in the morning and by name would be ask about what activities we had planned for the day or is given very good advice on other activities. Even a few waiters and the chef from the restaurant Kuhio Beach Grill remember us. Everyone we came into contact with was a pleasure.

Nice Hotel by Marriott. The breakfast buffet is very good and the service excellent.It's right on Kalakaua, a bit more toward the zoo end and a bit of a walk fromthe center of Waikiki. To that end it's also a bit quieter too.

Loved my experience there! The room was very spacious and well appointed. its location on Waikiki strip is great and the view on Diamond Head is awesome!The staff at reception was nice and helpful. Overall, we had a great experience. Did not have the chance to eat on site because of all the options available, but is definitely a great place to stay in Waikiki!
