We came here for a family getaway. For a resort, I would rate it 2, at best 3. The rooms weren't bad, but not that great either. The bathrooms were a little dated.Pools were a bit small, advantage of this place is the location in relation to the beach. When we checked out, service was below par. Weren't given a government rate and told it wasn't possible for anything as her definition of franchises was they had differing policies.....which is false as we have done it before at a different Marriott....I think what she meant was different owners of each property different policies. Anyway the fact that she didn't even try to do anything left our stay with a sour note, her supervisor was much more helpful and helped us out. I've stayed at better Marriott hotels so I was disappointed with this one.

At the end of our journey to the USA we came here, WOW it is fantastic. No problem at check-in, extra friendly staff and great views!The location could not be any better, right on the beach front and easy walking distance to some great restaurants. The breakfast buffet was also very good.Would definitely recommend.

By now anyone reading this should know that the hotel is great, the rooms are nice and spacious and the location is fantastic. What I did not like are:a) The $35 resort fee. What a rip off. What do you get for it besides being able to use hotel provided towels at the beach? Yes - many hotels charge similar resort fees but its definitely not worth it. b) Self Parking - At $32 a night, parking is expensive and the garage is almost always full after 6:00 PM. So you have to hunt for a spot. c) Breakfast buffet - At almost $34, the breakfast buffet is very pricey. The breakfast is nice but its very pricey. We had some free breakfast vouchers and that is why we went.

Basic room for the price, especially if you get the double beds to have kids stay. Good location and decent view from half of the rooms. Very large hotel with rooms split over 2 towers. Staff friendly. Highlight was the sunsets at the pool bar. Did some tours organised by the in-house expedia counter without any regrets.Main regret was a double dive via AquaZone located in the hotel. Would recommend to use another operator.

room was a little dated, but staff friendly and location perfectbuffet breakfast was nice and selections were varied on different days so as not to become repetitive. had corner room overlooking the beach, and never was noisy.

We were sold the accomodation under Luxury Holidays and paid premium price for the deal. Very disappointed with the standard of the room. Was anything but luxurious. The decor was uncoordinated and the bathroom very small and dated. Not a Marriott standard we expect. The beds made up for the lack of luxury with very comfortable feather pillows and mattress underlay. Nothing else to be excited about. The location was good with the beach across the road - which to me does not qualify as a "resort" - it was just a hotel nothing more.There's no bar in the fridge just empty and all they give you is small bottles of water when you check in. No milk and cookies or tea bags - not what we get in even the most basic motel in Australia!I would not stay here again for the price they charge.

Stayed here for 3 days prior to a Hawaiian NCL cruise. Was supposed to have an oceanfront room but ended up with a side street with ocean in the far distance view instead. Also didn't have a king bed for some reason? But the beds were comfortable. Room was pretty clean. Shower had great water pressure. Towels felt like sandpaper.

This was our second time staying at the hotel and it is such a great quality hotel. Its far enough away from the hustle of the main strip that you can escape but also only a 5 minute walk from the best restaurants. It is beachfront and the staff are so wonderful. They knew it was our honeymoon and made every effort to upgrade our room and make it a wonderful experience for us. I will say, the pool area is abit lacklustre but with the beach being right there you can easily go elsewhere. Would happily stay there again!

We were in room 412 and although had limited beach views the actual room was a bonus as it was bigger than a standard room and had 2 x queen beds and 2 x single beds as well as coffee table and 2 chairs. (Friends in a standard room on level 14 had the standard hotel room set up with bathroom on right as you enter and 2 x queen beds.) The beds and pillows were comfortable and the shower had excellent water pressure. The location for us was excellent with a red line bus stop outside hotel and everything else was a short walk away. There are 2 pools but the one near the bar is the better one. Good food at the pool bar.Overall happy with the hotel and the staff were excellent and would stay there again

We got one night free pre-cruise from NCL, so spent a couple of extra nights here first....and they kindly didn't make us change rooms OR charge us for an upgrade. While adjusting to the heat and busy-ness of Honolulu was a challenge, the room was perfect. The first morning we went for breakfast at the hotel's Kuhio Beach Grill--which was terribly expensive. The next two mornings we ate at Arancino di Mare, which was more reasonable and very pleasant--nicer staff, too!! Had a late supper at the Terrace Grill a couple of times--not a lot of choice but decent prices and food. This is a great location and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

It's tough to get a pool seat, even more frustrating when you overhear a local group of 5 that aren't staying at the hotel yet taking five of the pool chairs. The most frustrating part is the server knew they weren't staying at the hotel and allowed it all day, multiple days. We were complaining about it to another family and found out they were staying at the much cheaper condos across the street and just using the Marriotts amenities. It really shows how good their security is. It could be an amazing destination hotel if the management and staff cared a little more.

No relationship to beach and far out of the centre. Nice ocean view. Bell staff good. Check in ok but housekeeping a little poor. Never replaced tea sometimes forgot to replace ice bags and cleanliness wasnt fabulous.

I see people saying the rooms need updating but we really liked our room which was partial ocean view which we were upgraded to upon arrival. The king bed was very comfortable, the staff very helpful and friendly and we heard no noise during the night even though our room was above the street. Very convenient to the beach which is directly across the street and very close to all shopping and many restaurants. We did not even need to rent a car as we took a trolley tour to see what sights we wanted to see. We called Lyft once for a ride to a restaurant for dinner off the main beach drive. The pools are a bit small but we visited several hotels to check them out and all the pools we saw were small. You cannot go wrong with Marriott and will not regret a stay here.

We are a family of 4 and had to share 2 x double beds. Hotel is in a nice area but it is quite dated. There are some obvious current attempts to renew it but we thought it was not good value for money. 2 small pools. Polite staff.

Everything from the courteous staff to the superb location enables a guest's travel experience. Convenient shopping and plenty of dining options available. My room was clean and the lanai provided the sounds, smells, and gentle breeze of Waikiki in April. I would book this hotel again if my travels brought me to Honolulu.

The Marriott Waikiki Beach is located across the street from Waikiki beach - very convenient but not on the beach. The hotel does have a designated driveway which is great as the street it is located on can get kind of hectic. Request a high level floor. The rooms we had were on a lower level floor (floor 6) - do not make this mistake. All night we heard the street sounds - cars, honking, loud people, trucks backing up, etc. It was not a very relaxing night. The bathrooms didn't have a privacy door, so if you had to use the restroom in the middle of the night you were either doing so in the dark or waking everyone up. The bathrooms were very small compared to the rest of the room.There is a great restaurant at the hotel - Sansei Sushi. Go here and eat. Very good food with great service.

A lovely hotel located centrally for walking to beach or shops. Wonderful staff. Rooms gorgeous. Food and drinks by pool delightful. Perfect for a girls getaway. Loved this hotel. Free parking for rental car. Easy to get in and out of on the one way road system around this hotel.

The hotel lobby is very nice and looks newly renovated. The location is great and right across from the beach. The views from the hotel are good as you can see the ocean in mine. There are two pools. They are not very fancy but they are ok. One pool has a bar and food menu. The restaurants are very pricey. The breakfast is only offered as buffet and it's crazy expensive. The rooms need updated. They are older and the bathrooms are tiny. The shower/tub is so small and dated. The beds are comfy though and the TV is new and huge.

I am a huge Marriott fan - normally. Silver elite member etc. this property needs a makeover. From the piles of boxes and garbage at the pool bar to the crumpled carpet in the room, it's past it's prime. The front desk staff was excellent, but totally hit or miss service at the pool and the food was mediocre. The sushi place on property is amazing however. Great location, big rooms, but for what you pay, it needs a facelift and an overall of the pool bar staff training.

Great Waikiki Beach location allows for awesome views of the sunset. The hotel is fine, lobby has been redesigned and new breakfast area is larger, rooms a bit dated in parts - but the location is great. The restaurant/bar on the 3rd floor offers great views of the beach.

Our stay here was the first leg of a wonderful Hawaiian Cruise Tour vacation with NCL. The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa was in a word, wonderful. We had a ocean view room where we experienced spectacular sunsets daily. The room was spacious and very comfortable. We literally fell in love with the place. The music in the lobby was nice and upbeat and added to a very pleasant air that seemed to almost posses us. After all, we were in Hawaii!
user_name:
BinDere
New York City, New York

review_body: Comfortable beds sift sheets and towels left plenty of towels and pillows in our room so no need to call down to request more. The food was great the breakfast Buffett was very expensive so we found a little Italian place on the side of the hotel awesome food and service plus was a very affordable breakfast at half the price of Marriott

We have been to Waikiki before but this is the first time that we stayed at the East side of Kalakaua Avenue. The Waikiki Marriott is a very big hotel with two wings. They were busy but it did not feel congested because they had enough elevators to service all the floors. We had a room on the 19th floor facing Waikiki Beach and it was big enough to accommodate our family with two young kids. More importantly, it had enough power outlets to charge all our mobile devices and WIFI signal was very good to catch up on emails and reading materials. Front desk staff who greeted us was very welcoming when we arrived at the hotel at 10pm. First impressions are very important - well done Marriott!As for the amenities, the buffet breakfast on the 2nd floor was very good and they had a lot of variety to satisfy everyone. It was on the expensive side but we were Marriott Gold members and the 25% discount really helped. Hotel pool and gym were clean and busy. However, Waikiki Beach was across the street! There is self parking on site but it costs $32 a day, expensive but similar to other hotels on Waikiki. They had free DVD rentals available to hotel guests and my kids took advantage of it during our week long stay. Overall, we had a great stay at Waikiki Marriott and would recommend it to anyone.

The hotel itself has a good location on Waikiki Beach, but it definitely needs some serious updates. It just did not have the feel of a 'luxury hotel'. The simplest amenities were missing, water bottles in the room, coffee in the lobby, etc. We paid an up charge for a better view, but it still didn't make up for the lack of basics. We were fortunate to have coupons for the breakfast buffet, but seriously, they charge $30++ for breakfast???

We were only here for a night and it worked out very well. The hotel was clean, the staff was helpful and the property was pretty large. It is not directly on the water, but across the street from Waikiki Beach and surrounded by lots of restaurants and shopping.Our room was ready and was in good condition, but the bathrooms were fairly small and dated. Our room was large and had two balconies, one facing towards Diamond Head and the other towards the beach. Nice views.The pool areas and fitness center were nice and the bar next to one of the pools had live music and you could also have a meal. We had their massive breakfast buffet in the morning and it was a nice treat.Overall, we had a good stay and it really is great for families and business people alike.

I stayed at the hotel the last week of March. I was very surprised at how old and worn out the rooms are. I'm a Marriott Platinum member and always love their hotels. I got a text from the hotel that I was upgraded, which i was excited about. However when i got to my upgraded room, it was old, worn and torn. Even the title in the bathroom was old and the grout was black. The bed was lumpy and the linens were torn. So glad i was upgraded couldn't image what a regular room is. I called down to speak to a manager more than once, but they were at capacity so there wasn't anything they could do. For sure I would never stay here again!!!

Traveling to the island for business, I stay here. IT is always clean, fresh and the staff is always friendly and helpful. The rates are very competitive compared to all the choices here. It is across the street from the beach. There are restaurants here that really help out your choices.This place has the best breakfast I have seen. They have a chef who does omelets and I have never seen anyone do them like he does. It is pure entertainment to watch this guy cook.

Service - 5 Value - 4 Grounds - 4Carine checked me in and took care of me the entire stay as if I were the king Duke himself. I was busy minded just flying in from Los Angeles and her calm aloha attitude brought me to Hawaii instantly. Value is pretty good right next to the beach and just a walk away from the beach with only one road to cross to get to the sand. There might be a better value from a boutique hotel but I wouldn't know without past experience. The hotel lobby is newer and with earth tones. There's a lot of sun and good flowers. The rooms are good enough but let's face it, get outside. You'll like staying there.

Stayed here for 5 days on business. My husband came with me so we upgraded to a suite. The suite itself was very spacious - really large with separate living room, 2 full bathrooms and 3 balconies with ocean views. The property itself is pretty old and the furnishings need to be updated. I liked the location since it was at the end of Waikiki and not as crowded. There is a public beach right across the street from the hotel and it is less crowded than several of the beaches in front of the other properties on Waikiki. There are 2 pools on property - we used the one nearest the beach. Both are small. The breakfast is a rip off at $32/person - it is in a non-descript room and isn't very special. We got complimentary breakfast tickets so went there a few days. You will do better going next door to LuLu's or Tikis, or for a real treat, Duke's up the beach which has a better view and is half the price. The real prize at this hotel is the gym - it has several machines and free weights as well as numerous cardio machines. It is a lot better than most hotel gyms. All in all it was a serviceable stay made much nicer by having a suite, but it is not a luxury environment by any means.

Stayed here as part of land tour and cruise through Norwegian Cruise Line. First morning went in search of a cup of coffee. Found hotel restaurant that only served buffet breakfast for $35.00 per person. When I stated I merely wanted a cup of coffee, I was told they had no way to charge me for only coffee, but if I agreed to come later with my wife for breakfast, I could take a To Go cup now and have breakfast later which we did. Room and accommodations were very nice but found Burger King half a block down the street for breakfasts.

It was hard to get from place to place without a shuttle. I wish there were more activities on the hotel property, such as the beach. The view is so beautiful and I would of liked to do activities that really show what hawaii has to offer.

We stay here when we went to Hawaii on a Cruise and it was fantastic, very friendly staff and great hotel. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and used to go to the 24/7 Macys which was just across the road and open 24 hours a day.

I just checked out at hotel, but I left your hotel with unhappy. this week I took my son to Hawaii for spring break from Virginia. when I checked in, I was given the room 724. but the room had full cigarettes smell. the sink from the restroom had some cigarettes ash (you can see from my attachment picture "smoke")after I complained to the front desk, I was transferred to the room 424, I was still not happy the room, the reasons were:1. I was booked the ocean view hotel, the room 424 is too low to view ocean, this was what I should get.2.The drain was clogged from the bathroom. (you can see from my attachment picture "drain 1" and "drain 2") and I told the front desk about the issue. but I was told there was not tech on the site.I enjoyed the Hawaii. but this hotel experience was really unhappy. my brother will go to Hawaii this year. I don't know if I should tell him to stay your hotel.

Was not very impressed! I am a. Marriott member and was disappointed in the service and the rooms. Very old! Everything needs remodeled! It is right downtown and across from beach soyou can walk many places, however if you want to explore the island you need a car! Most places will pick you up! Did not like location st all. Everything in Waikiki is crammed into each other which is ok if you like the city! Most hotels are like that here. Really not what I expected! You have to go here at least once to see all the important tourist things but I do not know that I would go back!!!!

great central location close to the beach. Nice restaurants close by and easy in & out in the morning. We did have the valet deliver our vehicle to us with a homeless person in the back.....but other than that! When the garage is full they don't charge for the valet parking. Nice room, good food for breakfast, nice lobby,

Beautiful and well kept. Our cleaning crew was fantastic and the room was always immaculate-even with 4 of us. I was disappointed by room service however- at the prices they charge- they need to cater to the guests. I have strict dietary restrictions and I asked to substitute the fries with a side salad, remove the cheese from the burger and no "sauce".. pretty much a plain burger- with a salad. For $18 you would think that would be fine... but nope- they very rudely said no substitutions. Will stay at the hotel again.. but will never use room service grill. Other than that-the staff at the Waikiki Beach Marriott was curious and accommodating. This hotel is walking distance to everything in Waikiki and the ABC (convenience store) was well stocked with anything you would need but forgot.

Visited for a week in early March and had a wonderful time. The view from our room was wonderful with a view of Diamond Head and the water, 24th floor. The food at the pool bar was wonderful. You get a free Mai Tai Punch daily from this place, but know this is not the same thing as a Mai Tai and has very little alcohol. It's still refreshing. The staff was very helpful and provided us bottled water upon arrival and throughout our stay. There's an on site ABC store with everything you need and we went several times to stock up. If you spend a certain amount, you get a free gift so be sure to ask about that! I went home with a beautiful coffee mug that says I love Hawaii. The Kuhio beach Grill is where we had our breakfast each morning and it was delicious! So much to choose from and the omelette gentleman was always friendly and made wonderful eggs! You can also pick from fruit, breads, Japanese style food with noodles, pre cooked eggs, bacon. Even bread pudding if you want to eat sweet dessert for breakfast! All of it was amazing. Definitely try the coffee as well, very good. The staff here was always a delight. I highly recommend this Resort.

We stayed 3 nights in the "P" tower, 9th floor...nice balcony with a side view of the ocean and sunsets. The room decor was plain and dated, in my view. Next to elevator bank, a bit noisy. The bathroom is small with the vanity is in the room basically, tub with a shower curtain, updated, I don't think so! Nice TV though and a blu ray player. They charge for local phone calls! The prices for breakfast are ridiculous, $70.00 for the 2 of us for the breakfast buffet...Nothing special really. Drinks at the pool bar area are $25.00 for 2. We dined 1 might at the beach grill, buffet style, they charged $6.00 for a coke and $6.50 for a cup of coffee...ln top of the $70.00 for the buffet! Not worth it at all. Walking through the facility reminded me of a Vegas resort in its heyday. Close to the beach but not on it, have to cross the street along the beach. The staff is friendly and generally did a fine job, but I would not book this facility again.

We only stayed at this hotel one night. It was terrible and old. The lobby seems to be recently renovated but the rooms were very outdated. The carpet was smelly and the bathroom was just really bad. For the price that we paid the standard should be higher. Pools were small, packed with people and the water was smelly. The layout of the hotel was kind of confusing. We got a city view room and it was way too loud. We tried to cancel half and hour after checking in but the staff wasn't helpful and told us that it's too late and we would have to pay a cancellation fee equal to one night stay. So we ended up staying only one night and checks out the next day. Unfortunately I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

We spent a week at the hotel. The location is good across the street from the beach with dining on site. Service staff and housekeeping were friendly and helpful. Only drawback was a loud protest outside a hotel across the street that started at 6:00 Am and lasted four hours. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

Was here on business and enjoyed the location. Beach across the street, plenty of restaurants within walking distance, and the zoo close by. Hotel a tourist location so missing some business services. But overall a solid hotel.

We were in Waikiki for 2 days/3 nights. The room assigned was a corner, two queen room. Nice views of Waikiki beach from both balconies--one facing the beach head on and the other facing the beach from a side angle. The hotel is a large hotel, with multiple towers, and has multiple clothes and amenities stores on property. Uber locating on the app was not a problem. Nice pool area and bar. Breakfast buffet was good. The front desk staff was very helpful. There is a resort fee. We would stay here again.

This Marriott is beautiful! It is in the most desired location of Waikiki. You are steps from the beach and staring right at Diamon Head! A double whammy! The staff were so nice to us and even upgraded us when we got there. The hotel rooms are a tiny bit dated but very clean. There was a pool that was opened until 11 that the kids were happy about! When you check in you get coupons for free drinks at the bar which WE were happy about! Awesome. Would definitely stay here again!

Great location in a very central part of Waikiki Beach. The water is literally across the street, so easy.I came on business and it was easy to work here. Easy WiFi, everything was simple. I saw lots of vacationing guests enjoying it as well.Take a shuttle from the airport to get a bit of a ride through town, it's so beautiful out here.Prepare your wallet for getting ripped off on everything... that part sucks but such is tourism in these areas. If you rent a car you can save money by eating outside of the Waikiki zone and getting your bottled water and snacks in the residential areas rather than on the boardwalk.Yelp stuff and don't rent surfboards on the beach. There are local merchants that rent boards for $25 a day just 1 block away from the water, but you pay $25 an HOUR when renting on the beach.The hotel itself is decent. Bathroom could use an update but when you're in paradise you focus on the view. Noise levels are ok as well, the door shutting is quite loud but nothing else was significantly noisy.Enjoy Honolulu!

I don't have much to add to the current reviews. Staff is, as always at Marriott, top notch. Location of hotel is excellent if one wants to be in the midst of the activities. Calmer part of the beach, with more families, seemed to be at the other end. Room (23rd floor, partial ocean view) was dated, but clean and quite large. Mini refrigerator was in my room. Bathroom is small, worn, but adequate. Neither robes nor slippers provided which I have come to expect from Marriott resorts. No executive lounge (as a platinum, I missed this) but the buffet breakfast provided was fine (and wait staff in the morning was terrific). Drink coupons did not include wine (beer, house rum punch, or soft drink were options). I would stay there again as it is the only Marriott property that near the beach. Would definitely ask for ocean, even if only partial view, as the balcony was large enough to be relaxing rather than cramped. It had two chairs, a side table and a lounge, with enough room left to move around.Wi-Fi was free, but I don't know if that is for all guests or just guests of a certain membership level.

While the rooms were spacious, the decor and layouts are rather tired. We mixed a trip of business and pleasure, so the location was perfect for both. Unfortunately, our brand loyalty drove our decision. Upon arrival in Waikiki, a quick few block walk revealed newer, nicer, more modern properties at the same or similar price.A wonderful surprise of this property is their sushi restaurant, Sansei. AMAZING! Consistently rated one of the best sushi restaurants, the clientele revealed that it was really the best place to go for a fine sushi meal.

I can't complain that much cause I used my Marriott points to stay hereThe staff is awesome. Basically anyone we talked to was super friendly, very informative and tried to make sure we were having a good time/being taken care of. But I will say that the hotel is dated. It needs to be renovated badly. The first room we were given had a tub that basically was losing a layer of lacquer and was flaking badly. We were afraid they would cut our feet, especially our young kids so we asked for another room. While we waited, we also noticed a used band-aid stuck to the wall, so obviously their cleaning crew needs to be a little more attentive. The hotel apologized for that. In the next room we were given, there was the same issue with the tub, but this room came with a rubber mat to cover it...this explains why they haven't done anything to correct this...they just cover it up, but in the first room, there was no rubber mat. The tub was not the only old aspect...just the most obvious example of how dated the hotel is. Every aspect of the room and hotel is old...reminds me when I used to go to Hawaii in the 80's. I will say the location is ideal and the staff is great, so definitely makes up for the aged appearance. Would I come back...probably, but only if I was using points.

(This is a re-posting of a previous review because I inadvertently gave a 1 star instead of a 5 star review)My husband and I stayed at this property using points. When we arrived the woman at the front desk who checked us in said that we had been upgraded to a Diamond Head/ocean view room (due to gold level status with Marriott), but noted it had two double beds. We mentioned that we had requested a king room when we made the reservation and she didn't hesitate to call housekeeping to see if she could accommodate our request. She was able to offer us a king room on the 31st floor with a beautiful view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was a bit small with basic amenities, but totally functional. Hotel staff was exceptionally helpful in explaining hotel amenities, restaurants, etc., and provided us with some coupons for free Mai Tais at one of the hotel restaurants. We also received some buffet breakfast coupons. The offerings at the buffet were great, including made to order omlettes. Hotel is not beachfront - but the beach is just across the street. And there are two pools on the property. Great to be able to walk out of the hotel and be right in the mix of things happening on Waikiki Beach. ABC store is on the property, too, so very convenient to pick up snack items, gifts, etc. Open air lobby very nice. We rented a car and did not want to pay the daily hotel parking fee and were able to find nearby street parking pretty easily. Would definitely stay at this property again.

Huge complex. Lots of amenities. Check in line up is usually long and it took long at the counter to check in.Waikiki beach is within walking distance and do not have to cross busy street.Busy hotel, but very efficient. Lots to do or relax.

This is a large, big city hotel with I believe 32 floors directly across the street from Waikiki near Diamond Head. It has two towers and a lot of walking, restaurants and shops attached. It was very comfortable, everyone was very helpful, and the area is close to a lot of things. The breakfast buffet was good but expensive ($32 pp). They did have an omelet station and good waffles, lots of fruit, etc. There are two good outside pools as well. We stayed 5 nights and I would stay here again.

My second time here. It's been remodeled from the last time. It looks fresh and updated but the rooms are still lacking. The outside bar has some great sunset views. The free maitai's are lacking in the yumminess and island feel. But, Jameson to the rescue lol still during the day you can get a great poolside snack or meal when you come up from the beach which is right across the street! Easy access to all things Waikiki too!

We just returned from a trip to this hotel as part of our 40th wedding anniversary celebration. We mentioned it while checking in, and Marianne was so lovely she had a fruit basket sent to our room. What a great treat! All of the staff was attentive, our room fabulous, and we had a wonderful week. Many thanks! Matt & Kathy Clemens

My husband and I stopped in HI on our way to Australia. Our intent was to see Pearl Harbor. This hotel is about 1/2 hr to 45 min from the airport. The traffic is very congested here so plan ahead. The rooms are small and outdated. The bathrooms are also small with a tiny stand up shower. The balcony was nice but faced a back parking lot overlooking another hotel. I did find it quiet. We found this to be in a touristy section of town. Plenty of shopping if this is your thing. We also utilized Uber and several drivers found it challenging to pick us up due to the pattern of traffic in front of the hotel. Elevators were also small and often crowded. There is no ice machine so you will have to call. Staff are very courteous.

We booked a Full Ocean View Room on the Marriott Website. When we arrived, our room had a partial view of the Ocean. We complained and they politely admitted that the website was misleading but would not resolve the issue. We had to pay extra to get a reasonable room. Very disappointing to come this far for a vacation and have to haggle about the room.

We were warmly greeted by Tina at the front desk. She walked us through all the Marriott rewards perks, answered all our questions and gave us good recommendations. She even left us a personalized welcome/thank you note in our room on the second day we were there. Tara at the concierge desk was incredible. She helped us book out our week of activities (car rental, dinner cruise, massages, etc). She was friendly and really took the time to take care of us. The cleaning staff always greeted us warmly and checked on us.The perks for being a Marriott member were awesome, given they offset the resort fee - which was very nice (coupons, free breakfast, etc). The breakfast buffet was little lacking for the price (we ate for free, so that made it okay). The fitness center and fitness activities (pilates) were really nice. The pools were a little small, but the drink and food service was good - quick and reasonably priced. Great view from the pool side grill. Food at the Japanese restaurant (Sansei) was delicious!!!Our room was clean, water pressure was good. Balcony was amazing with a great view. Loved having a fridge. Decor was simple, but worked. Power outlets in the bed side lamp were appreciated. Also, having a full length mirror was amazing - many Marriott's don't have full length mirrors. Closet had plenty of hangers and the safe was large enough to hold everything we wanted locked up. TV was huge and had good channel selections, and all the hook-ups if you wanted them. The walls were a little thin, so we did wake up a couple times. Ear plugs helped, but didn't silence everything. The other hotel across the street had live music until very late, which was nice while we were up sitting on the balcony, but kind of sucked when we wanted to hit the sack early. The spa was a little awkward, but our massages were good. Having the ABC stores in house made it easy to stock up on goodies and store them in the fridge. The location of the hotel couldn't be beat. Waikiki was a little too busy for me, but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

Hotel was ok, however the rooms are what you might expect at a holiday inn or best western. The lobby is beautiful, but of course you're not staying in the lobby, you stay in the room. In our opinion, the rooms are in desperate need of a makeover & update if they want to compete with other hotels on the Waikiki strip. Rooms are in even more desperate need of soundproofing!! We heard guests next door constantly, heard toilets flushing and tvs on in adjacent rooms...very poor soundproofing. We had a good view of the ocean from our room. Location of hotel is convenient for Diamond Head visits. Breakfast buffet has many, many options. Hotel restaurants are ok, but if you have a car, it's worth exploring other restaurants off-site. Other food options within short walking distance (2 blocks) are hard to come by. There are a few options, but for more dining options(and better ones), you must walk at least 7-8 blocks. (not too bad of a walk when the weather is beautiful and you're not in a rush). Definitely get reservations for dinner for any restaurant at which you want to sit down--or go early, like 5pm.Beach is across the street from hotel - there is no private beach area for hotel guests.We had a slough of issues during our stay and were not happy campers. However, Christian was wonderful and addressed our concerns with the utmost professionalism and kindness. He took care and did a phenomenal job to remedy our situation. Again, he was wonderful. We will say that the best asset of this hotel is the Marriott staff, especially management. For that alone, we would return...but hopefully the rooms will receive an update soon.

If paradise is in your bucket list then Waikiki Marriott Resort & Spa is your destination. Steps away from the turquoise beach and center hub for everything. Friendly hospitable staff to treat you special. Rooms are spacious and clean. And yes the views are phenomenal. Your stay becomes one unforgettable experience of a lifetime-

The hotel is not at the Beach like you think it is! No where really to eat Breakfast in the hotel we found ourselves going elsewhere every day for Breakfast. Not sure why hotels have horrible coffee in the rooms, we never touched it once. The hotel was ok that is it nothing really impressed me at all. The service was ok all around the hotel.

We were there for 3 night. Very nice place. We had a Jr. Suite with a King bed and this was one of the nices places that we have stayed at in years.The hotel is large (two towers) we were in the one farther away from the Beach (but that is OK.) There are two pools. All the restaurants are in the other tower. Our room was spacious, the bathroom was very nice and separate room for tub and toilet. We had two balconies with 2 chairs each (not connected). We sat ourside one night as the sun went down. The hotel is located on the east end of Waikiki Beach. Close to the zoo. This end was great as there were not as many people on the beach as the western end due to more hotels. There is a resort fee ($30 per day as of 3/1/17...but I think I saw it was going up soon.)Bonus....Take the PINK shuttle around for $2 each to see the area or to get to the other end or to the main mall.

I am a lifelong Marriott guy (owner) and my wife and I were in HI for a seminar and decided to stay over a few days to celebrate. I just happened to tell the lady at the front desk that (Melissa) and the rest almost brought tears. She upgraded our room to a gorgeous view and then put a specially welcome basket together along with a personal handwritten card to say happy anniversary. I was blown away!! The staff is superb. The poolside food is pretty good. We ate out. The lobby is open and spacious and well...Marriott. I love the personal touch of the people who work there. You have to go.

Of course the location is wonderful, but I am sure there are more up to date hotels in this area. There are two towers, one is really old and worn and the other is OK. The food is average at best and very expensive. There are other expensive places around the area to eat at, go there. Better yet, look around there are less expensive places to eat. If you are staying here because Norwegian cruise lines put you here, be advised their representative is almost never in the hotel. They have very specific times they are available.

We stayed a total of ten nights, 4 in January, 6 in February. I do not know why but, I expected the hotel to be on the beach, it is NOT. It is a short walk across a major road to the beach and another short walk to the main portion of Waikiki.Our first check in went smoothly with Tina being very helpful. Since we are not big drinkers, she traded us drink coupons for extra breakfasts... as an example of her professionalism and courtesies. On our second check in, Rachel was AWFUL. Probably new. I asked her to convert the drink coupons, she said we don;t do that any more. When pushed... you mean in the last 3 weeks (the time in between our two stays)? She said yes, a lie. She refused to gives us a room since i had checked in for 1:30 PM. So, after flying all night from Australia, she made a Platinum member wait in the lobby for 45 minutes.. There were other nice rooms we would have gladly taken but, not offered until 45 minutes had passed. As usual, we had to go see her if the room was ready and finally, after pushing, she called over a supervisor and guess what... Oh it is ready now. The supervisor immediately provided a trade for extra breakfasts for the drink coupons. I understand younger, less experienced people work at the hotels and, they cannot know everything but... they can ASK and... they could be polite. Rachel was rude and indignant. She needs further training and should NOT be on the Platinum desk or anywhere near it.The rooms we had were fine. We enjoyed the west view since the balcony was shaded in the morning and we were able to use it.The bell staff was awesome! These guys all have worked here 20+ years and, know their stuff. They easily stored luggage for us, provided tips and were very friendly.The restaurant I reviewed there but.. go elsewhere. They are overpriced, OK service and Kuhio Grill is a 40 to 45 minute wait for food after ordering.After that, the parking is outrageous ($50 a nt), the rooms are outrageous and the resort fee does not pay for itself. If they were on a beach with beach chairs, umbrellas etc. like the hotels further west, I could see $35/nt for a fee but here, a rip off.

Overall the hotel was okay. The staff were really friendly and helpful, the location was great, the curtesy room with private showers was nice as well since we had a late flight and was able to clean up and relax before leaving. My only 2 issues were it was noisy. The walls were paper thin and you could hear everything. And we did see a cockroach in the room towards the end of the trip. I don't think I would stay here again.

My stay was from February 24-28. I loved the location which is within walking distance to the Waikiki Aquarium, shops, restaurants, and a short bus ride to Diamond Head State Park. I must write that they have the best and most professional customer service agents at the front desk. A big thank you to Tina and Allyson at the front desk for being so courteous, professional, warm friendly and helpful. I loved my stay at this beautiful beach front property and will book it again when I return to Waikiki!

Wonderful stay for two nights in Waikiki. Hotel staff was wonderful. The maids all had the "aloha" spirit that seems to be slowly disappearing in Hawaii. We were greeted every time the maids saw us--and we really felt their "Aloha" to be welcoming and friendly. The staff at check-in were helpful and went out of the way to accommodate an early check in--we had two rooms and they were able to find two ocean view rooms close to each other. Breakfast buffet was great. Bellman were top notch in getting our luggage to the room at arrival and in storing our luggage at checkout. Cannot stay enough about the staff at this hotel. Every employee goes out of their way to service their customers. Highly recommend this hotel.

Recently, Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort completed its renovation. Nanea Lobby has more room for multiple use, relxing, small group together, using WiFi spot at Porte Cochere, etc. and new restaurant Kuhio Beach Grill. Free WiFi in Public Areas and Hospitality room. Two Saltwater pools. It location is the East end of Waikiki and one block to Honolulu Zoo. You will enjoy stay at Waikiki Beach Marriott.

A modern Marriott, well maintained and one of the closer hotels to the beach and walking paths. Also just a short walk to many restuarants and shops. The hotel design features a large open air lobby and is a nice oasis from the hustle and bustle. Our room was clean and modern with the new Marriott TV entertainment system that lets you log into your own streaming accounts. Lots of shops are right inside the hotel's own lobby.

We stayed in the Keohalani Tower for 3 nights pre-cruise and 2 nights post-cruise. Both rooms pre and post cruise were on the 4th floor. We preferred the pre-cruise room (2 double beds) over the room we had post cruise (king size bed). The double bed I slept in pre-cruise was not comfortable and seemed to sink in the middle. Neither of the bathrooms were large and both need updated tubs and shower fixtures. The bathroom in the 2 double bed room was a little larger than the king bed bathroom. All of the employees we had the pleasure of coming in contact with at this hotel are very friendly and helpful.

Right in the heart of Waikiki and across the street from the beach, you can't beat this hotel's location. We had an Oceanview Room, and it was definitely worth it! We ate breakfast here twice, and both times the food and service were terrific. We had a problem with our bill, but thanks to the Resident Manager, Mr. Tyrone Crockwell, everything was quickly resolved in a very professional manner. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're planning to stay in Waikiki.

This hotel was super pleasant with a fantastic location right on Kalakaua Ave. I stayed here for eleven nights on business. My room was located on the fifth floor, which meant it was close to the restaurants and shops in the resort, as well as the shops and restaurants of neighboring hotels. Noise wasn't an issue though, so don't be afraid of staying on a lower floor if you have to. The room was spacious and comfortable. I didn't go to many of the hotel restaurants, but my colleagues who did only had good things to say. The fitness center was better than my gym back home! :) The staff were very friendly, from the front desk clerks to the valet attendants to the housekeepers. I felt at home right away. I liked that the hotel was in walking distance of not just the beach, but a myriad of restaurants, shops, and bars.This hotel is definitely geared toward those who are on vacation, but I think it's a good option for business travelers, as well.

Enjoyed the crab legs and prime rib buffet. So many good choices: chilled shrimp, seafood dish, seafood chowder, cheeses, salads, ETC. Such a variety and the crab legs stayed warm and were easy to peelThe bread pudding dessert was the best!

This is a very pleasant hotel with a great location directly across from the beach. From your lani most rooms can see the ocean. The beach directly across the street has a huge massive protected swimming area with concrete breakers, perfect for families with kids or those who want calmer waters to learn how to paddle board.Hotel has good restaurants and shopping. From this location (you are at the car end next to the zoo) you can walk down the most popular street with the best shopping and restaurants.

We stayed at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort for three nights as part of our NCL Hawaiian trip. The resort is gorgeous with lots of outdoor spaces, numerous shops and a relaxing restaurant. Our room was spacious with views of the ocean and Diamond Head. Our overall experience at this resort was very positive. All of our excursions left from the hotel without a single hitch. In the evenings, we were able to roam the Waikiki area enjoying the nightlife, numerous restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay at this resort again when we plan to return to Hawaii in several years.

This is a clean hotel in a great location. It is close to shopping, restaurants and across from the beach. There are 2 Pools and a hot tub. The drinks at the poolside bar are good and so is the food. We would stay here again.

This is a wonderful place to stay in Waikiki Beach. It is within walking distance of beach, shops & many restaurants. The restaurants on the property were great as well, however the breakfast buffet was RIDULOUSLY EXPENSIVE. There are several more affordable options available within walking distance.

Longer review to be posted when I am home but we stayed here pre and post NCL Pride of America cruise(review on that to come as well) and I have to give a sincere Shout Out to the front desk staff at this hotel- especially Anna, Winston and Hale-- superior service!! They went above and beyond on both legs of our journey and we say a giant Mahalo for them! Housekeeping staff is On Point - we were in both P tower before cruise and K tower post cruise. One of the very, if not THE best Marriott hotel I have ever stayed in.

We had a great time and enjoyed the hotel as well. We were upgraded to a room with a view of diamond Head and a partial view of the beach. We also has a corner room with two balconies which was very nice. The rooms are not the most up to date but they were clean, the bed was comfortable, the shower was good and we had a great view. It was also located somewhat at the end of the strip, which was very nice as it was across from the beach and some beautiful sunsets.

Having come from Maui after a week, Waikiki was very different. The city like feel and crowds were very different from Maui so that was a bit of a shock. But the Marriott was a great hotel regardless. The pool area is nice, vicinity to the beach is very convenient. The management team and staff took care of all our requests. I would stay at this hotel again, if we were to return to Waikiki.

The rooms are due for an update (see photos). It's a good location. We had an ocean front room which had a gorgeous view. Rooms were clean and maids were responsive. Beware of the concierge service. The one who booked trips for us put us on an excursion that ended up being exactly what I told her I did NOT want. The hotel manager was responsive to my complaints about it and put me in touch with their manager (managed by Expedia).

We are still staying here, however, I have been so disappointed that I thought I should write a review on this hotel asap. (As a note, we are Marriott members and have stayed with numerous Marriott's in the past)1. The lobby is very nice, however, the rooms are extremely outdated with stains everywhere! I feel gross walking on the floors!2. The shower is set up with a hand held shower head making it difficult to shower — I'm 5'4" and it hits me directly in the neck. I even have to duck under it. Definitely not practical for my husband who is 6'2. 3. Our room key never works! It usually works on the 5th to 6th try — they have given us new keys several times, so it is obviously a problem with the door. 4. The woman at the desk was "helpful" when checking in, and said she was upgrading us to an ocean front room, however, there were only double beds available. We said "ok" and "thank you"... well, to find out, it is no upgrade as all rooms are ocean front... So technically, she downgraded us. Cheers to our baby-moon and sleeping in two separate beds!This is the last stop on our Hawaiian vacation after staying at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai which was LOVELY. Unfortunately, disappointed in this place and won't be returning.

Stayed here one night. Nice large rooms. First class property. Did not eat here, but seems to have several choices. Half-block from beach. Check in was a breeze. Receptionist very pleasant and upgraded us to ocean view room. Would most definitely stay here again.

My stay here was amazing. My daughter swam in the pool for hours, and I made the jacuzzi my haven. The beach bar had amazing food and drinks, the cultural activities were so much fun. We had a great time at this property. The staff was super friendly and attentive and the breakfast buffet was absolutely delicious. The best one I've ever had.

This is an older hotel that has been well maintained. The lobby is attractive -a good place to enjoy a coffee and newspaper in the morning. The rooms are OK. The furniture and carpets could use an update. We had a partial ocean view from our balcony. That was one of the best parts about staying at this hotel as we had a view of Waikiki beach from our balcony- not another hotel. The breakfast buffet is very good but pricey. One can order from an ala cart menu but that is pricey also. I would suggest finding someplace else for breakfast unless breakfast is included with your room.

Great location but small rooms old rooms that are very expensive. Labor dispute at neighbouring hotel was a nice wake up at 6 am as protesters started to chant and use noise makers to disrupt hotel guests. Front desk staff did not provide good or fast service. Did not get the rooms we booked online. Would not stay again

Nice clean place with a great location right on the Waikiki Beach strip. You can walk to many restaurants and shops galore. Beach is across the street. The hotel has many stores on site as well. Rental car agency too. Place to rent mopeds, bikes and more across the street. If I ever have a chance to come back to Hawaii I would stay here again. Cheers

We had high hopes for this establishment but were left with mixed feelings. We stayed on two separate occasions - once in each of the hotel towers. The "ocean view" did have a view of the ocean provided that you were on the balcony and looked around the corner. Compared with other Marriott hotels it looked a little dated. Nothing a little spruce up would not cure. Eateries were very good and sometimes difficult to get into with a full compliment of guests in residence. The one and only coffee shop on the premises closed down while we were in town. All the staff were encountered were friendly and helpful. Beware of the Aston Hotel next door - they host loud parties late into the evening. Probably stay elsewhere on next visit.

Stayed here pre cruise.Hotel across road from beach but not close to shops as it's up Diamond Head end of Waikiki.Decor is tired, hotel needs makeover but staff helpful.Had breakfast in Kuhio Grill the hotel's main restaurant.There were long queues to get in at 7.30am which got longer as time went on.Price for breakfast quite expensive, better off eating outside if breakfast not included in your package

Stayed in this hotel two nights. We had a "junior suite" with two queen beds. The beds were comfortable and the room, even though was supposed have city view, did allow for a view of Waikiki beaches. Most of the people in the lobby were nice and polite, although we did get locked out of the room (none of our cards worked) and they wanted us to stay in a long line to get them reprogrammed. They should have a separate desk for issues for current guests. However, the couch in the room was dingy and stained. The breakfast bar was $39 extra (no, we didn't eat at the hotel. Plenty of restaurants in the area to eat!). The room was facing the pool and there was significant noise in the evening. I was not impressed. There were a lot of shops in the complex, if you're going to Hawaii to shop... Thankfully, we checked out after the second night. Would probably not stay there again unless I receive a great discount.

a big clean hotel with beach frontage. could just see the sea from my room. lovely friendly staff at breakfast. lovely breakfast buffet though pancakes were a bit tough! handy having ABC store within complex. lovely big room with all necessary facilities.

I really cannot compare to other hotels on Waikiki Beach but I would certainly attempt to search and read other reviews before booking. We stayed three nights at this property, five on The Big Island and five at the Marriott Kaua'i Resort (near Lihue Airport - this property is gorgeous, tropical feeling and much more like a true resort than Waikiki is). We used Marriott Rewards points on Oahu and Kaua'i Marriott Waikiki staff were professional', friendly and helpful. No issues on staff support. Breakfast buffet was delightful but pricey (about $30 pp but likely typical for Waikiki). The hotel seemingly has good amenities although self parking can be short at times (use valet at same cost if self-park is full). My sole complaint regards this property is that it is NOT at all becoming of a true resort and that the property really appears tired, dated and in need of refurbishment. To pay these rates, plus "Resort Fee", Parking....and get old tired facilities is not reasonable. Shop around.

This hotel is in a good location with good views from the higher floors but way overpricedfor what it is. At around $400.00 AUD per night plus $30.00 USD per day resort fee, plus tax, plus breakfast, pus WiFi, there are far better options in the nearby vicinity. Only stayed there because it was booked by the travel agent pre Pride of America cruise.

The front desk people are nice and helpful. I was provided with an envelope that contained tickets for drinks at their Terrace Restaurant. I also received breakfast vouchers and a card for unlimited DVD rentals.The hotel is across the street from Waikiki Beach which makes it very convenient. There are at least 3 ABC stores within one block.The room itself was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. It contained a large flat screen TV and a refrigerator. Mostly what I liked about the room was the bed was comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was amazingly good for a hotel.I really don't have anything bad to say about the room I had, it had a partial beach view with a small balcony. Other than it was a handicap room and I had to adjust the shower head quite often since it was a handheld shower head.I slept pretty good most of the nights which is very rare and a hotel for me. Overall I would have to say it's one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in around the Waikiki area.

The hotel was open air and nice. We were headed to a suite on Norwegian Cruises and they gave us a complimentary night here. We expected more. The room was small and dated. There was a very small balcony overlooking a lot of tall buildings. We walked across the street to the beach and had dinner about 3 blocks away on the water. On our return, there were many homeless people walking around in the area. There were some nice shops in the hotel to get Hawaiian apparel, jewelry, gifts and even an ABC store offering cheap souvenirs and other "essentials".

Hotel had just been updated so everything looked new and shiny. I cannot say enough about the staff, very helpful, friendly and always wanting to improve your stay. The restaurants in the hotel are not cheap, but nothing is in Waikiki. All had great food and service. The gym was really nice and a pleasant surprise from the standard row of treadmills and one universal machine. Cannot beat the location if you are going to be in Waikiki. Easy enough to get to and get out of. I will certainly stay here on my next trip.

Great location right across from Waikiki beach. On the north end of it, do close to the zoo and closer to Diamond Head. Pretty much as close as you can get to the beach. We didn't use too many of the amenities, so can't speak for that. We did have breakfast each morning at the buffet and that was very good. In terms of the room, it was definitely a little outdated and the walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors.

We checked in after a 19 hr day. Check in went smooth and employees were friendly, we even got a room upgrade. We were disappointed to hear there was no where to go to celebrate being in Hawaii with a drink-it was just after 11pm. Beds are comfortable, room is nice, bathroom could use a refreshing Reno. The hotel seemed to offer a lot, but just didn't feel like the place we wanted hang out at. We found ourselves down the beach at the Outrigger-Duke's/Hula grill.

Beautiful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The famous Waikiki Beach is just across the street. The rooms are large and well appointed. You are close to everything. Worth checking out. The hotel has five restraints and there are many more close by.

We stayed here as the land part of a cruise, so all of the arrangements were handled through a travel agent and the cruise line. This property seems to cater to tour groups. The stay was fine. The staff was friendly, the location is convenient, the beach is right across the street. The room was extremely small, the sink is separate from the shower/toilet, which was nice. Room was clean, but a bit worn and nothing special at all. We didn't have an ocean view room, but could see a glimpse of the ocean from our balcony. The reason for my "average" rating? Based on the hotel description, I expected a "resort" atmosphere. This is simply a decent hotel with a decent lobby in a good location.

Stayed just the one night but it was a very enjoyable one. From the newly refurbished foyer to the pool bar, shops and rooms ... all were good standard and very close to the beach across the road. Would come back to this properly and stay longer next time. Free mai tai on check in was a nice touch

Nice clean hotel, I really like it. No real complaints other than we spent so much money for the week. It was $3300 Canadian for the week for my finance and I. We upgraded for waterfront views for $700? Plus a $600 flight from Vancouver made this a pricy trip, as then you add all food, excursions and souvineers.. We read great reviews and we wanted somewhere really nice for our BABYMOON and cause we needed Zika free places Hawaii was it. Originally wanted Jamaica or Belize. Hahah A local told me I got ripped off, be careful as there's theft in this area, not to walk around at night and watch my things when at restaurants/starbucks/beaches. Made me very aware. So just be careful. He suggested use the app Booking.com the week of travel OR when you're leaving for your vacation and you'll get accommodation for 40% off. He said when he travels he never pays full price. Please learn from my mistake!To save money as we spent a lot we used Groupon (just call ahead to make sure the date of time you want is avail) for a:Boat trip ($68 for 2 originally)>2 for $40 90 mins CATAMARAN SAILING✔️2255 Kalakaua. And $3 beers and $5 drinks. Highly recommend. Boating is fun!Adult pirate ship cruise ($128 originally) $54 for 2 night life BYOB (*no glass). 2 hours. (630) 7pm-830pm Saturday. +18085932469. They have family friendly ones during the day.Pearl harbour was half off $56, originally $100. Cause we went w regan! I put his contact info in a pic. Umm.. car rental Alamo was close and they said if you go the morning of they can do free upgrades if avail to luxury cars. Or use a app Turo (it's like air B&B for cars). If you're planning excursions please consider ragen as he made my Pearl Harbor trip really nice. He does boating trips too. I love supporting small businesses, money goes directly in his pocket and he's really helpful w ideas. He makes excursions affordable! His contact info is in the pic below Oh for foodyou must try PF changs happy hour!Eggs and things, rated #1 for breakfast/ brunch. This ramen place is unreal, always a line, $6 ramen and sides avail. Close to a great food/grocery store. So delicious.

My husband and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa for 5 nights in January of 2017 to celebrate our last vacation together before kids. Gorgeous spot on the beach— walking distance to everything. The beach is much less crowded here than further down by the Hilton. We enjoyed the zoo (a two-minute walk from the hotel), and did some exploring on our own. I recommend renting a car at least for part of your trip. There is so much more you can do and see in Oahu if you aren't held back by walking distance. I suppose you can take a taxi or uber, but it would add up quick, as the north shore is a good 1 to 1.5 hours away from Waikiki. The hotel itself has wonderful staff. Richard at the front desk moved us to a room further from the elevators because they are noisy and run constantly. You can still hear them all night, even down the hall, but it's less noticeable. Perfect view of the ocean/beach and city from our room. I recommend being on the right side of the hotel. We only ate at the hotel's Moana Terrace once, and it was decent for appetizers and drinks. We preferred trying out places around the area with happy hour specials, and local eats. I'm giving 4 stars because our experience was very good, but I just wish it was an all-inclusive. Maybe I just miss that part, having stayed at all-inclusives before. There aren't any all-inclusives in Hawaii, so I'd say this is the next best thing due to its central location. It would be nice to have a breakfast option in the hotel that didn't cost over $60 for two people at the buffet. We didn't even try it because there are breakfast spots in walking distance. Would love more affordable food options. Overall, excellent stay. Very clean room (coming from someone with allergies and asthma), extremely nice staff. Babymoon-friendly!

We had a quick trip and found the hotel clean and convenient location to beach. I have stayed in several Marriott hotels and was very impressed with the breakfast buffet. The omelette chef "Chuck" was the best! Quick skills, fast and great cook....a true asset to the hotel and fun to watch him multitask. I have never seen anyone like him. Marriott- take care of him! The pool could have been a little bigger and more kid friendly. Oh...don't miss the crab and prime rib Buffett on Friday and Saturday evenings. I would stay again! Great job!

Enjoyed our stay at the Marriott. Staff was very nice. Concierge got us a rental car for the day so we could go sightseeing. Breakfast good but very expensive. On our last morning I had the buffet and my boy friend only had coffee and it was $25. Enjoyed and would stay again. Get the ocean view room. It's worth it.

We were here on our honeymoon and were disappointed with the overall quality of the hotel. I'm a platinum member and usually only stay in the Marriott family of hotels. This hotel needs some updating. The bathrooms have mold and the fixtures are outdated. The carpet in the hotel room was ripped. The overall grounds are ok, but again should be updated to reflect the times. Some good qualities : the breakfast buffet was excellent, the gym had a great variety of equipment, and the staff/waitresses/concierge were super nice and friendly.

Arrived late evening as advised & a friendly welcome awaited us by the receptionist Lovely room with ocean side views as we were in the second of the two tower blocks with adjoining walkways. Takes about a day to find ones way around such as locating the dining room/restaurant. Great all day breakfasts worth the price.busy & interesting promenade & for those who like the Cheese Factory there is a good one here, but arrive early as is very popular! Can you easily travel to Pearl Harbour by local bus as No. 20 or 42 picks up behind the hotel. Great stay ! Would come back again!

Was in the area on business and this hotel fit the bill perfectly. Good location, not too crowded or busy (in the hotel itself), genuinely friendly staff, and (important) prompt service for business travelers in the restaurant at breakfast.The downside, however, is despite the name, this didn't feel like a resort but rather a very nice convention style hotel with a bigger pool area. It is across the street from Waikiki beach but the street is very busy and definitely feels like you are in the city rather than what I would think of a resort. It is, however, not as crowded as the other big HNL resorts like the Sheraton or Hilton Hawaiian Village. I would recommend this hotel to biz travelers, people not wanting a crowded resort, or those just crashing at the hotel and spending most of their time exploring the area. Also, I see a few complaints about the cost of the breakfast buffet - that is standard for most Honolulu hotels. Everything is more expensive on the island. Other pros: fast elevators (slow elevators in towers are a pet peeve of mine), nice gym, lots of on site restaurants, and good benefits for Marriott elite members (free daily drink, discounts on food, etc). I will most certainly return when I'm back on business but will probably choose a different property if I'm on vacation.

The concierge at Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and spa far exceeded my expectations. Sarah Best was my Expedia local expert and was very helpful with both my stay in Honolulu and planning of things to do on a cruise my family and I are leaving for in a couple days. I would highly recommend speaking with her as she had great insight into excursions and activities while visiting the different islands in Hawaii. 5 out of 5 stars for sure, I'm very glad I spoke with her.

As a frequent traveler, I was able to book four nights here on points. The resort fee was not a surprise and does have some value, but is likely a hard sell for the company. For $30, we got four breakfasts and a number of drink coupons for the two of us. The person checking us in handled it well and recommended a couple of effective strategies. It wasn't a knockout factor but you need to be aware of it.That being said, we had an excellent experience. We took a deluxe ocean view room on the 22nd floor. The room was large and well equipped. The views were really special and worth considering the upgrade. The meals that we ate at the hotel were quite good. Pricing for breakfast is very ambitious- buffet is $32.95. Quality is very good with a lot of variety but that is pretty expensive in my mind. We ate in the pool lounge and had an evening meal in the restaurant and both were quite good, complemented by stunning sunsets.. Honolulu in general is pricey and these meals were not out of synch with others that we saw. I recommend going a block or two back from the beach to get more options if the view is not important to you. Overall, our stay at the Marriott was a high point of the trip. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. There is a makeup shop on sight where the sales people are a little too aggressive but I was comfortable just walking away. Location is easy access to Waikiki and Diamondhead. Lots of crowds but that is Honolulu.
user_name:
David G
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: The Marriott has two towers. We were in the older or rear tower. Our room was fine. We had a view of the beach through the buildings. The lobby is open to the sky and outdoors. It was very impressive. The desk and staff were very helpful. The pools are on the small side. The hotel supplies beach towels. When you cross the street you are on Waikiki Beach. Great buffet breakfast that is over 30 dollars. Our breakfast was included. The location was in walking distance to Parks, zoo, aquarium, shops and restaurants. I would stay there again.

Marriott hotel is nice and what you would expect from a typical location. While it does have some restaurants, pool, gym, and bar, it's not a full resort style like other hotels. If you want that type of experience check out the Outrigger or Hilton Waikiki. If you are looking for a place to stay that is a nice combination of affordability and location, and plan to spend some time exploring Oahu then the Marriott is a great choice. A few highlights. Location is very convenient - located towards the end of Waikiki but steps from the beach, Honolulu Zoo, and many other great activities in the area. Gym - was above what I expected with lots of space and equipment for cardio and weight lifting. Food - restaurants were actually quite good. Sansei sushi was our favorite.

We had notified them in advance that we would be late arrivals .,. and were given a quick check-in on arrival, bags taken directly to our room on the 13th floor, where we were given complimentary bottles of cold water, and, the room was already pre-cooled. The corner room was quiet, with windows facing north and east. The window on the east had a small balcony that allowed a limited view of the water (not the beach).The location of the hotel is great .. just across the street from Waikiki Beach, and within easy walking distance of the International Market. While we did not eat at the hotel's restaurants, there are many good restaurants within walking distance, including Dukes. There is also an Enterprise car rental on the front of the property. Waikiki Beach, just across the street, was clean, well maintained, policed and yes, there were the obliviously homeless on the grassy park part of the beach. Our first Saturday there, it was overcast and very, very windy. A week later on Saturday it was sunny and beautiful!

We stayed here for work. I have stayed in the Aston next door previously. I'm a 90% of Marriott customer, and this hotel is nice, however heavily used as anyone would expect. We got upgraded to have a partial ocean view, however we lost the single bed (queen/king), I think we would have preferred to keep the bigger bed vs the view. The view is great, but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The breakfast buffet is top shelf, one of the best I have ever ate at...however the bar/restaurant is terrible. The service is slow, the food is not great, and the drinks are over priced. We went to Tiki's at Aston if we wanted to stay local and have drinks and food w/ a view and/or music.

Good hotel close to the beach with qute a few options for breakfast and dinner. The rooms are probably dated and in need to a bit of "fresh air" but remain Marriott-style lare and clean. The meeting rooms can be below the level of the hotel: check in advance if you need one. Renovations are ongoing: again check out if your room / meeting room can be affected.

If you are looking for a location close to Waikiki Beach, this is a good one. It is across the street from the beach, not right on it though. The location is convenient with good access to local and tour transportation. The hotel is large with many good features, however, the two pools are pretty small. The gym is fine. The Moana Terrace bar/restaurant was wonderful with great views, sunsets, Mai Tai's, food and service.

Although large, never felt like there was a crowd. Beautiful outdoor lobby, shops and restaurants. Pool deck, although not used was very inviting. Close to shopping, restaurants and a small beach. Concierge was very helpful setting up trip to Pearl Harbor and driving tips. Very good resort hotel.

This hotel is a bit dated. The rooms are fine and the balcony provides even more living space. It's pretty quiet in the rooms so getting a good night's sleep is welcomeNow why it's only a 3. As others have mentioned the breakfast restaurant is extremely expensive for a generally unimpressive selection and it is not large enough to accommodate the size of the hotel. The resort fee is a bit over the top for me. There's not much of a resort to this hotel...2 pools with lots of lounge chairs but no service. Eating by the pool or getting drinks served is impossible as no one ever comes by. The resort fee is $30 and for that you get a breakfast coupon and 4 free drinks. But as a platinum member, you don't get the usual breakfast for 2. Now I should say that's not uncommon at resorts but here your Platinum status gets you nothing...yes I got 1 free breakfast but I really paid for it thru the resort fee Also I was not offered my guaranteed room type. Normally this results in $100 compensation for MR members but I was told that they do not honour that policy. So in summary, if you are used to Marriott resorts like Marco Islam, Fort Lauderdale or Cancun, you will be sorely disappointed. This is just a big 'institution ' with no tangible benefits for MR members

You will love this hotel. As large as it is you will find the staff friendly and more than willing to be accommodating. After finishing a cruise we checked in early in Saturday morning and expected to have to wait for a room. It took a few minutes but the person behind the counter smiled an announced that our room was ready. TIP: For an early check in be willing to give up the king size bed. Much to our surprise we were given a junior suit that featured double balconies. Keep in mind this was a reservation that was made with points! The room was on the 15th floor, was spacious, clean and best of all... quiet. We had booked for two nights with the intention of actually leaving on the evening of the second day to catch a red-eye flight. Tip: Consider taking advantage of the $99.00 option for a 6pm checkout. The hotel staff graciously let us change our reservation from two nights to one so we could save the points and take advantaged of the early evening check-out! Who does that?! Bravo to Hotel Management and their well chosen team. Travelling for 40 years and this was by far our favorite hotel.

It's a city hotel I am not sure why is it called a resort. Although it is only short walk right across the street – hotel is not on the beach. Nice rooms, good sleep quality, big property. Interesting fact – as a platinum member you’ll receive a breakfast coupon but only for yourself so if you traveling with a companion or anyone that does not have the platinum status they are out of luck and on their own. I tried to have the breakfast however it was 45 minutes wait…. Really for the amount of rooms there are – there’s only handful breakfast tables? I have entered to see what kind of breakfast items they have in the buffet and trust me – even 15 minutes would not be worth to wait not to mention 45min. This was a disappointing experience and that's why 3* rating. Hotel it self it's 4* and nice.

What a great place to stay if on Waikiki Beach. The Marriott has beautiful rooms either looking at the beach or at Diamondhead. The rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet is amazing, and sitting at the Kuhio Beach bar on the 3rd floor is a great place to watch the sunset.

Beautiful lobby with daily activities, clean spacious rooms, great views of Waikiki and a delicious breakfast buffet. The staff is friendly and the pool area is nice. The food at the pool bar is great and very reasonably priced. Waikiki beach is across the street and a perfect place for young kids to splash around. Will go back next time while in waikkki.

This was our first trip to Oahu and The Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort was the first place we stayed. For many reasons, we cannot recommend staying on Waikiki Beach. My husband had just retired so obviously we aren't part of the younger crowd!! We arrived close to dusk so didn't venture out from the hotel that night. Our room had both Ocean and Diamond Head views which was nice, especially the first evenings sunset! That is pretty much all the positive I have for you. The Oceanside blocks of Waikiki as well as the Beach itself were disgusting. Unfortunately, Waikiki has a very large homeless population which is probably due to it's outrageous cost of living. Understandably, as they have nowhere else to go, many of them spend their days and nights on both the streets of Waikiki and on Waikiki Beach. Enough said about that. Our included free breakfast buffet was served in the most DREARY and DRAB room located on the same floor as the pool. Think it was a very old and outdated ballroom that many nasty birds enjoyed flying around in as the door was left open during the buffet hours. Food was mediocre at best. I ALWAYS leave positive reviews for hotel staff members that deserve recognition, cant think of one staff member we encountered at the Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort who are deserving of such recognition.

The staff are (mostly) welcoming. Buster the bellman is a role model for hospitality and gracious patience. Our chambermaid Rosalinda M. was accommodating and efficient. A major problem is that the one restaurant serving breakfast is way over in the K Tower, which is difficult for guests with mobility issues whose rooms are in the P Tower. It's a large, busy hotel just across the boulevard from the beach, close to many shops, and has multiple swimming pools. Prices are typical for its type close to the beach in a major city.

Really nice place. love the lobby, Its a big hotel. I had an awesome room with a view of the ocean and the mts. The staff was very friendly. Great pool, and lots of places to get something to eat and drink. They had music while we were there. This was my second visit to this hotel, very close to the ocean, but you do have to cross the road. Thats not an issue. Lots of shops in the bottom areas of the hotel. You will not go wrong staying here.

Stayed here for 6 nights. The staff was very friendly and attentive, room view of diamond head and the beach from the 29th floor was wonderful. At the end of the Waikiki strip and nice lobby.
