Room seems to need renovations, shower head a bit awkward. Overall it was a nice 6 nights, great views and friendly staff make it a 4 instead of 3.

Have stayed here before as a halfway point to catch up with jet lag. Very nice place with very clean rooms. Two pools on third floor rooftop. Smaller pools but really clean. Other than that the area around them seems like too much concrete and tile. Nice but not what i would expect for an exotic location. Just my opinion. Platinum guest and they upgraded us to a beautiful corner room on the 23 floor with two balconies. Very large with a small bathroom and an adjacent spacious dressing area. Two vanities and two closets. Safe in the room. Two towers with five elevators each so no waiting! Rooftop bar and live entertainment on third floor near pool with awesome views. You must cross the street to get to the beach which is about 80 feet away. Didnt see any chairs or umbrellas there. Food is very good at the breakfast bar Kuhio Grill! Well worth the $. Staff everywhere is gracious and helpful. Asked for a late checkout and they allowed us to stay in the room till 3PM! Orancini restraunt downstairs is DELICIOUS! Hotel is otherwise where you want to be in Waikiki Beach. Close to everything. We will be back.

Stayed here as part of Norwegian cruise lines 11day Oahu adventure. 3 days of tours on land and then 7 days on cruise ship to the islands. Had a nice room with an ocean view and view of Diamond Head. Could not believe the openness of all the hotel buildings. weather was fantastic, in the 70's and 80's every day.

We are frequent Marriott guests, so we were upgraded to a very spacious suite with a full ocean view in the tower closest to the beach. Our sons ended up in the other tower and one of them, also a frequent Marriott guest, was upgraded to a "partial ocean view" room. He showed us a photo of his view: full of tall buildings. From his balcony he had a small glimpse of ocean. As frequent Marriott guests, we were given discount coupons for the hotel's bountiful breakfast buffet which was very expensive. Actually, everything in the hotel was terribly overpriced. But the hotel itself is very nice and located across the street from the beach as well as near lots of shops and restaurants. Nice swimming pool.

We went on a family trip and booked 4 rooms in this hotel the night before our cruise. The location was convenient and had great views of the landscape. We were disappointed with the condition of the room and bathroom. The lobby was nice and the staff was helpful. The hotel rooms need to be renovated.

Stayed at the Marriott with my family. Mixed bunch of 50-60 year olds, mid to late twenty year olds and young children. Transfer from the airport was efficient and friendly and first impressions of the foyer and area was great!! Rooms were always sooo clean. I really praise the house keeping, they were great! Never moved your belongings just made them more orderly. We stayed over the Christmas/Nee Year period so very very busy. Restaurants you need to Book in advance but the steakhouse was so delicious! Location is perfect. Right across the road from the beach and on the main strip. Trolleys and Tram leave from outside the hotel. Inside the rooms, beds were big, TV was huge. Bathrooms a little small - but fine. Only two things I think could improve was breakfast - $32USD for a very average buffet. Very very expensive. Plenty of other options around. Concierge was always EXTREMELY busy. To Book any trips you often had to wait 30-45 mins to get to speak to anyone, at one point waited over an hour to simply book a seat on the bus to the outlets in WeikeleI recommend Marriott to everyone. Two swimming pools, gym, so close to beach, ABC store for your everyday needs, can book all trips from the concierge, friendly staff (especially house keeping, she even wrote hand made cards and cookies for Christmas). Free lei making, Pilates, yoga and hula dances everyday! A must stay for prices in Waikiki!

Overall this is what you should come to expect from a Marriott, good location near the zoo. Walking distance ( out the front door) to shopping, restaurants, the beach etc. very spacious overall including the rooms. The rooms are a bit dated in regards to the bathroom but nothing to worry over. We ate at the breakfast place on site which was very good although expensive as well as sushi also good but nothing to write home about. We were put up here for the night by the airlines after they canceled our flight and the night previously we stayed at the courtyard in town. As a Marriott member don't even think about the Courtyard, spend the few extra bucks for this space it goes a long way.

Once again the first thing that I must mention is that Marriott does a great job with their staff. The staff in this hotel are absolutely unbelievable and really friendly and well informed. This is the reason that I continue my patronage of Marriott. The second thing that I would mention is that the view is absolutely unbelievable. We have a great shot of Waikiki beach. The hotel shows it's age but is well-maintained. The location is excellent as there are shops everywhere. Unfortunately we are only staying the one night and do not have time to explore their entire facility. Thumbs up from this guy.

The very first thing the guy at the front desk said when we checked in was "I just want to let you know: this hotel is in SERIOUS need of an upgrade." Great first impression...and it turned out he was 110% right. The rooms are falling apart at the seams. Torn carpets, chipped paint, cracked bathroom tiles, faded and outdated furniture, flat pillows, crumbling wall moldings. Sure, the breakfast buffet was delicious, the views were flawless, the public areas were all gorgeous and very modern-looking, the staff was friendly and there's no way you can beat the location, but for a hotel at this price point the room quality was unacceptable. This NEEDS to be addressed.
user_name:
Cam F
Amherst, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: We are doing a several island trip and Oahu was our first stop. This was our first stay in a Marriott. The lobby is beautiful and there are several shops on the first floor. There is an ABC shop every 20 feet in this town but darned if they aren't convenient. There are two here, one in each tower. There is a lot of street noise but hey, you are in a busy city surrounded by busy streets with sirens etc, etc. The room was nice and housekeeping was very helpful when we were having trouble with our door. Can't say enough about the breakfast buffet. Delicious and great service.

First let me explain that I travel extensively for business. I stay at hotels at least 10 days out of every month. I have stayed at the highest rated hotels and some that were, let's just say, "dated". This hotel certainly falls within the first category - Excellent.Yes, the location is tremendous. Yes, the restaurants are wonderful. Yes the shops located within the hotel have everything you would ever need. But what really makes this hotel so special is the people who work there. From the helpful parking staff, who always great you with a smile and ask how they can help. To the room service waiters who deliver your food with a smile and genuinely thank you for staying at the resort. While they are all very professional, one in particular stand out. Ms. Lynn Matsumura is one of those people that are most memorable for me. She is courteous, friendly, professional, respectful and, most importantly, truly cares about the experience of the resort guests. She takes the time and asks the right questions to do what she can to make your stay at the resort as wonderful as possible. I wish all of the hotels I stay at had a Ms. Matsumura! I am typically in Honolulu every few months. Over the past 90 days I have chosen to stay at this resort on both of my business trips to Honolulu. My clients are located on the other side of the Island. and it would be much more convenient to stay on the North Shore. However I continually choose to stay at this hotel because Ms. Matsumura and her team always go above and beyond, helping to make me feel "at home". I will continue to stay at this hotel each time my travels take me back to Honolulu. You should do the same as I promise you will not regret your experience. MahaloLeonard S.

We had a family group of 19 who stayed here for a few days pre-cruise. The lobby area is really beautiful, the staff were all friendly and helpful, and the rooms were lovely. The beach was within walking distance, and there were many restaurants, shops, etc. within walking distance also. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so can't comment on those.

There are some hotels that you don't really notice when you visit a location. Then there are those properties that actually make a nice vacation even better. The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is in the latter category.We have stayed at Marriott hotels all over the world, but this hotel is one of the nicest properties we have seen. The hotel is huge with shopping and restaurants galore. But the first floor architecture is absolutely stunning with a fusion of Western, Asian, and Hawaiian influences. Our rooms were very large and we were upgraded to a spacious three-bed suite. The rooms are large and extremely clean. One of our rooms had a view of the ocean which was very nice.Waikiki is one of the nicest city beaches in the US easily rivaling or surpassing Miami Beach or the LA Beach Cities. The Marriott is just across the street from this world-famous location. The resort restaurants are expensive, as are most restaurants in Oahu, but variety and service are exquisite. The views of the beach are really nice, and you lose sight of the fact that you are in a major Hawaiian city. Kalakaua Ave is a wonderful place to walk and window shop at expensive Rodeo Drive-style stores. This hotel made a really good vacation into a great vacation. We will definitely stay here again if we return to Oahu anytime soon.

We only stayed one night at this hotel when our flight was cancelled but it seemed to be a great hotel right on the beach. Awesome balconies!! Rooftop pool was only ok but who needs a pool across from the beach. Dining and especially breakfast buffet were outrageously priced and food was only ok. Check in and out was efficient and service very good. Would totally consider staying here again. It is located on the less busy side of Waikiki where the artificial reef is if that matters to you. If u stay here, be sure to eat at the barefoot beach cafe for dinner during sunset. Park like setting, freshly caught fish dishes at extremely reasonable prices

The location is great if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel is across the street from the beach and there are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. First impressions are important to me, so I was surprised there was not a valet or anyone out front greeting guests and directing them to the check-in desk or helping with luggage. I arrived about three hours ahead of check-in time and was told they were sold out the previous night so no rooms were available for an early check-in (understandable, but only if you don't know better). I explained to my guest services agent that I was a longtime Hilton Diamond member and this was my first stay at a Marriott in a number of years - he became quite helpful and was able to not only have a room immediately available, it was an upgrade from what I booked. He also provided me with bottled water and drink tickets that had not been offered previously (thank you!) and gave me the rundown on the property and restaurants. After my guest services agent's accommodating service, I had high hopes that I just may be switching my loyalty to Marriott - that was short-lived. They do not yet have the mobile room key available - not a big deal, but not as convenient as having the key readily available on your phone. The room was comfortable, but the air conditioner was extremely loud and pretty irritating while trying to sleep. The décor in the room is probably due for an upgrade, but it wasn't horrible. I would put the room more in the category of a Hilton Garden Inn - basic, but meets the needs for sleeping comfortably. The bathroom was extremely small, but the vanity area was a nice size; horrible lighting though. Speaking of lighting, almost all of the lights have to be turned on individually - only one light switch in the bathroom and one by the front door which was only for the one light by the door when you walk in. The bed was comfortable and the balcony was equipped with a table and two chairs. I tried calling housekeeping three times for an extra blanket before giving up on my request. The room service menu is well below average; the offerings are minimal and the food really wasn't that good. I paid $64 for a pizza and a piece of cake - don't waste your money! There are two pool areas and there is plenty of seating at the larger pool area, sufficient seating at the smaller pool and towels are readily available at both, but, apparently, only one of them offers poolside "service". This was my biggest issue with the hotel. For an experienced traveler, customer service is high on my list and this hotel was seriously lacking in just about every aspect. The service at the pool lounge was horrible! The servers look at you but never actually ask you if you need help. From what I could tell, they specialize in standing around! It wasn't like the place was packed when I was there, a small to moderate crowd at best. I had to track down a server every time I wanted to order food or drinks. Generally, when you are ordering alcohol, you can barely finish your glass before another is offered...not here! I literally sobered up between drinks!! Based on the comment by the gentleman near me (this service is ruining my buzz), I wasn't the only one who was irritated with the service. This happened both days I went so I just stopped going. I think looking at you and not offering assistance must be a theme for this location because when I checked out I was once again looked at but not offered any assistance until I finally tracked someone down and asked them to call a taxi for me. Overall, I did not receive anywhere near the level of service I receive from Hilton brands or the level I expect from any upscale hotel. I definitely will not return to this hotel based solely on their lack of customer service, but, if you are looking for a decent hotel with a great location (but lacking any type of customer service) then this is the place for you. It's an average hotel so your rate should reflect that. I wouldn't recommend paying for an upscale hotel and staying at this location.

I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 on this review. I stayed in the 'K' building so this is strictly related to that area. The higher marks go to the pool area, all the great seating areas both outside and inside, my room balcony with 2 chairs and a lounger, and a decent size room with a seating area couch, lots of walking space, office desk. The breakfast buffet choices and its staff were amazing, the lobby area was large and new, and the location directly in front of the beach is perfect. . The 3 star part goes towards the 'rest' of the room. I stayed in a 32 stack, it's a corner, and the size was pretty large which I appreciated. Not sure why all corners have two queen beds (would have preferred one king) from what I was told. The closet has a stack that prevents the hanger from using that section so you lose an entire foot of hanging space, and the closet itself and the doors should be updated. The mini fridge and coffee counter are located in the bathroom - would rather not leave my food and make my coffee in a bathroom (cannot understand any hotel that has this type of set up). I'm a Plat member, so would have appreciated water in the mini daily. I like the double sink in there, lots of counter space. The shower, which is separate from the tub, is tiny, and other than a small holder that barely holds a bar of soap, there is no place for your shower toiletries in there at the same time as you. You keep them on the floor of the shower, and it invites a fall - not very smart for a hotel. Having a tub that is guaranteed little use over the shower is a waste of space. The worst part though is that there is a shower head that points directly in front of you, but will only hit you if you are 5'10 or taller. It's inconvenient to use this type of shower head in your hand during your entire shower. I tried to point it to the corner and got on my toes to try to wash out my hair. WIFI did not work on the balcony of my room, and was often slow during the day so they should look at getting this upgraded. If you want a boutique hotel, this isn't the place. There are alot of people, but there is also alot of space. All the staff I dealt with were great, but I didn't use alot of their 'extra' services. I come to Honolulu once a year and usually stay on this end of the strip. It was my first time at this hotel however, and certainly an upgrade from my previous spot, so so I'll return .. but do something about the showers.

My favorite meal of our week in Honolulu was the one we enjoyed at the restaurant on the veranda where we had lunch. The salmon and ahi tuna were perfect as were the crackers and the dessert added to the meal.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott was a great stay. Good location across the street from the beach. Really enjoyed the restaurants onsite. Arancino di Mare was excellent. Ran out of fresh fish however we were late dining. Rest of the meal was great. Sensei onsite as well was Japanese/seafood/sushi. Entire several course meal including our share of sake was under $100. Great value. Outside terrace seating. Reservations recommended especially if wishing to dine outside. Concierge services were great and staff extremely helpful. Moderately priced and great option.

The hotel is clean and just across the street from the beach and ocean, it is close to some great retail shops and some great restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful the pools were clean and nice and overall service was good. The rooms had great views of the ocean and were clean, the ABC store in the building was nice you could buy beer and wine and snacks and save big money as opposed to the pool bar.The Italian restaurant was good and not real pricey but for the most part ate at places close to the hotel that were very good and less expensive. We would stay there again.

I suppose it depends on what you are paying for because its situated perfectly at the end of the main strip, one of the last hotels before the zoo and diamond head just across from the beach.However with Tax and stupid resort fee you are talking over 1700 dollars for a week in a reasonable room with an atrocious pokey little bathroom which is at best scruffy with the enamel peeling off it and no room to swing a cat.The room itself is very nice and clean with a great view over the bay and the pool. It is a massive hotel with two main towers and three decent restaurants. If you are really lucky and have a platinum package then just one of you gets a free breakfast the other has to pay.You also get 25% off the food and 7 free drinks if you eat in the Kuhio Beach Grill save up though its expensive and you can get better deals locally. The facilities in the hotel are superb but you pay through the nose for everything. The hotel appears to be always packed with guests so its about time they started to treat their Platinum Guests like they value them and sort the bathrooms at the very least.

Stayed here in January and I could not ask for more from the hotel and it's staff. There were some areas of assistance on different issues, some standard, some not standard and the staff could not do more to help and deliver. Nothing was too hard or took long to resolve or deal with. The hotel is clean, open and full of different things to do and see. It would be one of the better equipped hotels in the area. The pool can be busy but this didn't matter, it's was comfortable and peaceful even with families and kids. Service was great as it is everywhere. I will definitely be back here as a favourite and recommend it to anyone considering a great Hawaiian holiday.

Great staff and very friendly, but after that I would highly recommend that serious travelers avoid this hotel. I stayed in Marriott 150+ nights last year, and this is a horrible property. They don't have a concierge (just booking agents for tourist services). The lines to any service are long. 45 minutes to the concierge. 30 min to breakfast. Time for a remodel too. Mattresses lumpy and unacceptable. If you travel on more than one trip a year, this is not the hotel for you. If you are a serious traveler, run away. If you're a tourist on a once a year trip, enjoy. It's in a great location. There are a lot of great hotels out there. This isn't one.

We stayed here about a week. It was me and my 10 year old son. The hotel was nice and clean. It is right across the street from what I consider a good section of Waikiki beach. Down the strip some, the section of Waikiki beach has a lot of rocks on it. However, the section right across from the hotel was our favorite section of the beach, thus, this hotel was a great location for us.The rooms were spacious. I liked the shower head because it had a long hose. It made it easy for me to hose my son off when we returned from the beach.

Stayed here in December 2012, 2013, and 2014. There were 4 of us staying here and 2 elite members and only 2 of us got the free breakfast each day. So 1 would use the coupon one day and the member the other day. How does that figure since the room is getting used by both and the room is booked under the elite member. Enjoyed our time here and we got a corner room with a larger balcony than the other 2. Very nice to look out and see the ocean from your balcony. Also, beds were comfortable and room was clean. Enjoyed using our happy hour tix at the Moana terrace by the pool. Activity counter was helpful calling us a shuttle for the outlets. Across the street from the beach. Good wifi connection here. I saw in February 2016 that the breakfast dining room was being renovated as I walked by the hotel. Abc stores which are handy to pick up a snack or a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. Also, memory cards for digital cameras are reasonably priced here. There are also some restaurants on property. Ate at the Italian one 3 times and Moana terrace at least a handful. Also, the Honolulu Cookie Co. is downstairs and enjoy sampling a few before heading in for the night. Across the street from the Aston for trolley service.

First, let me start be saying this is a crazy, busy, overwhelming place to spend a vacation. There are tour groups, honeymooners, businessmen and women, families, and all manner of shapes and sizes of vacationers. That being said, I liked it and they managed to mix in some fun for our kids with the great guest service desk and activities like lei making, hula instruction, and basket weaving.The rooms are tiny by mainland standards, but they are well appointed and the beds were comfortable. The parking is a problem, and $32 per day is a bit much to pay for it, but I think that is par for the course given the location. As for the location...it is divine. Right off of Kuhio Beach (Waikiki's better-looking sister), the hotel occupies a prime location on the eastern edge near the zoo.Get used to the hustle and bustle, but overall it was a great vacations spot.

I was here on business back in February and as a Platinum Elite member (10 nights away from Lifetime Platinum) they upgraded me to a Corner Suite beachfront. It was quite nice, although the hotel room itself was quite old and outdated, especially the bathroom. Over the holidays we thought it would be nice to come back and stay here because the location IS perfect, and the balcony is a great way to see the sunset every night.In order to stay here for 5 nights, it cost me 240,000 points. On top of that, and in order to ensure an ocean view and a KING sized bed it cost me an additional $150 (PLUS the $30 resort fee) per night. It was NOT worth it. I could have taken my chances to be upgraded at the time of arrival, but I didn't want to miss out on a beach view or have the king bed. Back in February they told me the corner suites only had 2 beds which they call QUEEN but trust me, they're no bigger than a full size bed. The tub/shower is not Marriott worthy - the shower head is pointed right at your face and cannot be moved. Rugs are old and dirty. The concierge NEVER returned my email requesting information on a particular tour, and this was BEFORE we checked in. The manager was non-responsive after we checked in - perhaps he knew we really had no choice or say in our accommodations after check in. On departure, when we tried to request a bellman, it took over 30 minutes for someone to arrive, and that was only after I went down to the front desk and stood there - and got ignored by Lisa (the manager?) for the most part. She kept taking care of other guests until I mentioned we were there first. She was incredibly rude.The final straw which made me really mad was my request for a late checkout (3 PM) and they'd only grant me a 1 PM departure at the latest. Bottom line, outrageous prices for an old lady of a hotel, and it wiped out my points. NOT worth it.

Location, location, location . . . . best part of staying at this resort! Beach is across the street and the rest of Waikiki is only blocks away. We've been loyal Marriott patrons for over a decade and always look for their brands - so naturally, when we planned this Hawaii trip we looked for a Marriott. This is one of their older resorts - so no lounge available for Marriott Elite members. They did throw in one breakfast per day (should have been one for each guest) & a few other 'elite member' benefits; but you end of paying for all of it with the daily resort fee. We were told our room was upgraded - but it was the same room I reserved/paid for, so bad info provided at checkin. The room was large, bed was very comfortable, TV was huge and the balcony appropriate size to relax & enjoy the sun; although the bathroom was tiny. Lobby area was airy, spacious and abound with shops - so you did not need to go far for food, coffee, or souvenirs. All in all, an average resort that needs an overall makeover. Did not appreciate the daily resort and/or hefty parking fee - thought it should have been waived or reduced for elite members.

We stayed at this hotel during the Christmas holidays. Had to book a ways in advance and their cancellation policy is obviously more strict during this time period. It was about 5 or 6 years since we had stayed here and there were some changes.We always stay in the K Tower (like it the best) and our room seemed to have been updated since we were last here. We had a deluxe ocean view room and couldn't have asked for better. Our balcony had 2 chairs and a chaise lounge and a view of Waikiki Beach. Friday night we were able to watch the Hilton Hawaiian Village fireworks from this balcony. The resort fee was still there but Elite Members were offered breakfast coupons for the buffet in lieu of some minor perks (price was approximately $32 apiece so a good deal). Do miss the free bottled water, but with the ABC stores right there - not a big deal. Enterprise has taken over the Hertz Rental spot, but turned out to be an excellent experience with them (do book in advance from home, especially over the holidays, and do join their rewards program).Over the years, we've stayed at several other hotels in Waikiki, but keep coming back to the Marriott. Love the location - nearness to Starbucks and the beach, and walkable to all the good restaurants, yet not in the middle of the most crowded areas. The staff from housekeeping to the front desk were always friendly (and this is during a time when the hotel was full).

This is a big hotel right across the road from the beach. I had a pleasant check in experience - time was taken to explain the services you get - internet etc. because of the amenities fee - although I don't agree with this high fee as the room fee is so high already. You get free coffee ( a cup), a couple of bar drinks and a surfing lesson etc. - but I did not use all this so object to paying for them through the amenities fee. I was told I was upgraded to an ocean view room but there was no ocean to see in my room!There were only two tea bags in my room and no green tea - I had to ask for a tea bag refill. The kettle is really hard to use in terms of boiling water, No glass cups - only paper cups.There was a sliding door to the balcony with two locks but one of the locks was not working.1 piece of soap only provided - I had to ask for more. It can be frustrating asking for basic items like this - time wasting. You expect better in a hotel that is charging so much money,Shower and bathtub were good but shower makes noise. The staff at the taxi stand need to offer better customer service when guests want taxis - they are not on task and seem to be socialising instead of working.At checkout I was told about the Marriot loyalty program and got a loyalty card so I appreciated that information which was volunteered to me.No Skynews Australia TV channel - not happy.There was Bible in the room - appreciated.No newspaper provided.It's okay but expensive. Staff could do more to treat guests better. The amenities fee in addition to your room charge is sneaky - you are given products you may not use ( e.g. surfing lessons).

We've been Marriott Vacation Club members and Marriott Rewards clients for almost 35 years and have stayed here at least 6 times during the past 20 years. The main takeaway for us is inconsistency. This stay was for 10 days and, as happened twice before, the room was woefully small for a comfortable stay. Insufficient closet and drawer space required us to virtually live out of our suitcases. In addition, the room was noticeably out dated and the carpet had numerous stains. The grout in the bathroom, between the beige tile and tub, was blackish. Whether they used gray grout or it had some mold in it is not clear. This is not a category 8 resort. Perhaps a little biased here as we stayed at the Hyatt Regency Waikiki Beach Resort for a week prior to checking in here, which is a no-doubter Category 8 Resort.

We visited Oahu from December 17-28 staying at the Marriott from December 23-28. This resort is massive and right across the street from the beach! We got connecting rooms as per our request and had beach, city and mountain views! It was absolutely stunning! The resort offered daily activities such as hula lessons which my kids took part in and really enjoyed it. There are 2 pools which is excellent. The Moana Terrace bar and grill at the pool had delicious drinks and great food and superb service. We had breakfasts at the Kuhio Beach Grill several mornings and as busy they were they were extremely efficient with finding our party of eight (my sisters family and ours) a table quickly. The food was delicious. We also had dinner their one night which was also just mouthwatering! The rooms are large and clean with large balconies. My husband has elite status with Marriott which offered him many perks. I highly recommend staying here.

We spent 4 nights at Marriott.The lobby is large and smart. The rooms are tidy but not anything special. The pool bar area has a lovely setting with views of sunsets and the beach. The pools are okay. The service is good in general but this is a place that has a lot of occupancy and the reception is always busy. I didn't appreciate the resort fee of $30 per room per night. Better hotels we went to were the westin, the Hilton Hawaiian village and modern. The kahala is beautiful resort hotel a bit further away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

we stayed 3 nights at the Hotel, and would have stayed longer, but due to the prize hike on the same room we left for another Hotel at the Wakiki beach front. Great staff and good service throughout our stay. Not sure why Marriott have a very fluctuate prizing strategy but hey that is their choice. i just can't get myself to pay almost 3 times for the same room.

We have been going here since the 70's and it's been better every time. What makes this place are the friendly staff, the things to do and the location. They are in the midst of updating the entire place so by end of 2017 the facelift will make it one of the best in Honolulu. We always ask for a high room overlooking the ocean preferrably above the 20th floor and on the odd number side.Fireworks by the Hilton and also the Honolulu City at New Years is spectacular from your room. The Hilton I believe does them every Friday at 9PM.The Sushi restaurant is I believe the best on the Island especially on Monday night at 50% off from 5:30. Get there before 4:30 and wait in line. They have a great Concierge Desk too. Make sure you ask fro Bre-Ann.

I booked a special rate of $269 per night for a deluxe view room over Christmas holiday, during the first week of September. That special ran out on Labor Day, so I felt pretty good about the price considering how rates kept on rising for all the Waikiki hotels closer to Christmas. I kept checking other hotels because of the negative reviews I saw on Trip Advisor... Once we got there, I felt that price was fair for the room we received, but all the extra charges are not warranted in my book. They add an extra mandatory $30 per day resort fee, plus $34 per day parking fee to just park in the garage. Why??? Because they can... no real value here for guests. I can see paying $10 per day or something more reasonable if they have to charge in the first place. The beds were full size (not queen) so we asked for a roll-away for our teenage daughter (we were a small family of three in the room) and they were going to add an additional $30 per day for that too.... I kindly asked if they could waive that since I was loyal to the brand and already paying so much for all the other "extras". They did waive that fee, but I felt like I was being nickeled and dimed to death... All the taxes and fees added nearly $200 more per night to our room charge!The beds were extremely comfortable, with high quality sheets. I slept very good every night (an uncommon experience whenever I'm away from my own bed). Kudos to Marriott for this feature. I also liked the refrigerator in the room. No free bottles of water though, which would have been a nice touch for guests. We stayed at the Waikiki Hyatt Regency for one night prior to our cruise, and I honestly liked it better. The cost was about the same per night after Marriott added their extra chargess. For the same money, Hyatt had a nicer room. It had a more upscale feel, was larger, and even had a bidet in the bathroom. The maid at Marriott was exceptionally sweet. She even made us home-made Christmas cookies and a hand-written card on Christmas morning. She was a jewel, and always was extremely friendly every time we saw her. We stayed in room 2225.

We had a fabulous stay here for a few nights; we had an upgraded room which was spacious, had a nice balcony, and had incredible ocean views. We were there on New Year's Eve and could see the fireworks without leaving our room. The two queen beds were comfortable for us and our two kids. The bathroom was strangely small, as others have commented, but it was fine. The lobby was beautiful, the fitness center was nice, and we enjoyed the two pools and hot tub. The hotel is right across from a beach with a protective wall so young children can swim there safely, and it's also centrally located with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. The breakfast is good if if it's complimentary, as others have commented, but not really worth the $32 if you have to pay for it. We also ordered room service and pool-side food, which was fine but overpriced. There are lots of great, affordable restaurants in the area, so going out or getting carry-out is (in my opinion) a better option. But the hotel itself is beautiful and I would absolutely stay there again.
user_name:
Holly K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: They should be closer to 3.5 than 3. Overall the hotel was in a great location in waikiki close to the zoo and across the street from the beach. Had a new renovation and the lobby is nice.Lunch Food is mediocre at best, and breakfast buffet can use more variety but as elite member it was complimentary. (Wouldn't pay $32) long line ups for breakfast so get there before 8:30am.Received a 'upgraded' room when it was same room I booked. King size bed is actually more like a queen bed and we were on the 28th floor yet we could hear the cars from the street (double pane windows anyone?). Thr bathroom was extremely small and wouldnt stat at this hotel again.The sushi resto is good if u want good sushi and a great view of sunset.

A fantastic location for touring hawaii the hotel right on the beach front views are stunning .staff very friendly and polite .the only thing that mars the experience is the bathroom considering the amount of money marriots make a year is it too much to ask for a bath tub where the emanel isnt peeling away from the bath i would advise anyone to avoid room 1623 until this bathroom has been redone

We stayed here at the beginning of the Pearl Harbor 75th Commemoration and during the Waikiki Holiday Parade. It was a excellent place with teenagers. Lots to do by foot and the hotel just seemed to be located well for everyone. The beach is close and is really quite nice but yet all conveniences are nearby. Jellyfish were the big disappointment but hotel could not help that at all!The hotel is well kept. Love the coffee and ABC store right there in lobby. The only suggestion would be to have some hotel help near the elevators in lobby during times when there are lots of large tour groups. The elevators got crowded quickly due to local events. Overall will stay there again if opportunity arises. Good for families with teens.

stayed 2 nights prior to our cruise. very nice hotel near beach. room was very comfortable and all employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. pool lounge was nice with friendly bar tenders. very relaxing atmosphere.

We are currently staying at this hotel to celebrate our anniversary and I am so disappointed. I booked an ocean view with balcony ($2k for 4 nights). The view is mostly of tatty old hotels with the ocean off in the distance and down the road if you hang over the balcony to take a look. No thanks. When we got into the room they hadn't even bothered to fill up the coffee and tea box. The room is really basic and no bottled water. As a Gold member I would have expected that at least. I have tried to be loyal to The Marriott but now feel as though they just don't care. I won't be back as there are so many other options that have to be better than this one.

Won't return here and unfortunately, this was the last hotel on our HI visit. Do yourself a favor - pick a different spot. You wouldn't guess from the photos, but the best way to describe this is a very tired condo-style building versus a "resort". Musty smelling room, housekeeping sprayed deodorizer....and the smell returned by the next morning. There are maybe a half-dozen shaded pool-side seats. Staff wasn't familiar with hotel to offer directions. We suggest you look elsewhere. Hope this is helpful to a future HI visitor.

. . . . .you like a musty smell interior (we were in the 'original' tower) and being located downtown on a busy street and having to walk across the same busy street to get to your hotel.For the rate, wouldn't a hotel on the beach with beach towels and beach sitting be more desirable.

It starts with a warm welcome at check in by-friendly, helpful staff. I'm not a fan of resort fees, but they offer up a nice array of goodies designed to offset the cost. Our room was surprisingly spacious and well-equipped. They started us out with a bag-full of waters. We had a nice corner room with a beautiful view of the beach and ocean. The bedding was comfortable, there were lots of conveniently placed receptacles for our electronics, and wifi was quick. Overall, this was a wonderful experience.

Very helpful staff and a nice property. Variety of restaurants and two small pools but not on the beach (1 block walk). Biggest disappointment was the bathroom. Toilet right on top of the tub (a pet peace of mine) and the tub was chipped and pealing in multiple places. Basically pretty war torn room. When I told front desk, it was the norm to them and never heard back from manager of hotel.

Stayed here for 5 nights for work. Great location and the rooms were very nice. The beach it right across the the road and there is a couple ABC Stores in the hotel as well.All round top stay, would go back.

I stayed in the front tower on the 22nd floor in an ocean view room, having been upgraded as a Platinum Elite Member. The room was great, fairly recent renovation, clean, with and awesome view and large lanai. I like this hotel a lot as a business traveler, although with the small pool and noisy location it's not the best vacation escape in my opinion. But that applies to Honolulu in general, I think. However if you just come for the urban attractions of Waikiki strip, then this hotel would be great.

I wonder if we stayed in a different hotel than some of the other reviewers? We are also Marriott loyalists. This property was better than several JWs I've stayed in recently - and the price was less than locations like Washington, DC. You know what you get with a Marriott - and you will not get the decor of a boutique hotel so why complain? We found our room larger than expected, clean, in fine shape physically, not tired and worn and with a larger and more comfortable balcony than expected. I would have liked firmer pillows - that booking request was not fulfilled. But, all in all, we were pleasantly surprised that the quality of the room was better than anticipated. Some complain about the cost, but it was obvious to me that booking a location on Waikiki for less than $300 was not going to come with luxury resort-style amenities. I can't complain about what we received.The restaurants were convenient and quite good quality. Several evenings we had our dinner and drinks on our balcony. Easy to do. The on-premise shopping was all too tempting. Really enjoyed this, even if my pocketbook didn't. Laundry facilities were a nice bonus. My only complaint was the parking garage. Although very convenient on premise and easily accessed from major streets, the narrow ramps and sharp corners made each journey in and out rather exciting. Thank goodness other drivers were as careful rounding the blind corners as we were. The garage situation would not prevent me from staying - and parking - at the Marriott again. I understand the shortage of space in the area, and it is a bonus to have close parking available at all.Staff was very good. Several times employees went out of their way to get us bottled water, extra coffee and tea and other amenities. There was a mistake on my final bill which I did not notice until we had left the hotel. I was charged at a higher rate than booked. When I was able to send in copies of the original booking, the situation was corrected and I was credited within the hour of my email being sent. This was certainly much faster service than I expected.I would happily book again.

The Marriott is a great place to stay. The rooms (well, at least my room) are very comfortable and well equipped. Lighting was good, work areas were nice, fridge, nice bathroom/shower, and a balcony with a view of Waikiki Beach. The hotel itself is also very nice. The lobby is indoor/outdoor... Lanai? Nicely furnished, several shops including an ABC store (convenience store, which came in handy), souvenirs and Hawaiian crafts and handmade art and clothing. The beach side of the hotel opens into an airy plaza, nicely landscaped, and a great path to the beach. Parking here is scarce... and tight. Be careful if you self-park in their garage, because it is definitely cramped quarters in there. Had to allow valet to park for me one evening because the garage filled up. The staff here is fantastic. Everyone I encountered was extremely pleasant, helpful, and fill of the spirit of Aloha. Front desk, to valet, to the lady who serviced the room... all were fantastic.

We are Gold Elite due to our significant Marriott vacation ownership, so we opt for Marriott properties wherever we travel, and we travel a minimum of 10 times per year. Although we understand an upgrade is not always possible, when we checked in at the Waikiki Marriott, we were told that we did get an upgrade which is definitely not true as we got the exact room type which I booked. There was so much fluff stating that it was a beautiful room, very special. It is not. Furthest room at the back of the rear tower. The views are lovely, ocean and Diamond Head. That is the only positive. The room is very old and kind of shabby, especially the washroom. Certainly not what we expected for a prime Marriott property on Waikiki. So happy we are only staying 3 days. We have high expectations and prefer luxury accommodations. Next time in Waikiki, we will select a better property.

The honor band and honor choir and I from my school came to stay here for a week. The employees very nice and understanding. They clean your room very good and they don't move any of your stuff which is perfect. The hotel has 2 pools a hot tub and a gym and a restaurant. On the main floor which is the lobby floor there was shops like a Christmas store, rental shops, souvenir shops, abc stores, clothing stores, etc. the elevators go very fast. All the rooms have amazing views weather you're facing the beach or the city or half the city and half the beach. You're right across the beach and right on the main avenue where you can go shopping and all that. I totally recommend this hotel

This Marriott lives up to the expectations you have of Marriott. A clean, comfortable room, with superb service. Onsite shopping and restaurants in the heart of Waikiki, right across the street from Waikiki beach. A block west of the Honolulu zoo and close to all Waikiki attractions.

The room we were in was a little small, but since we spent most of our time out and about? All we needed was a place to hang our hats, anyway. Was very clean and tidy. A safe was in the room, which allowed me to stow away my valuables. And I don't know about smoking rules? But I used to smoke on the balcony and ash in a can. No one said anything. All in all? Had no trouble staying there for a week. Enjoyed the shops beneath, it's proximity to everything and the amenities. Well maintained. Great housekeeping. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The only thing stopping me from giving it a 5 stars? Was the size of the room. That's about it ;)Right across the road from the swimming area. Keep an eye out as you're walking around (in the direction of Diamond Head from the Marriot) for a Cafe with forest green barriers and awnings. It was the only decent coffee I could find.

We are platinum Marriott rewards members and expected this hotel to be worth the money we spent on this room. The hotel is tired and old, as was the room. The view was lovely facing the ocean and was large but to relax we had to bring in the two chairs from the balcony! This large room needs a huge makeover beginning with the colors and furniture. Hopefully that will happen soon. Buffet breakfast was great. Location of hotel is fine too if you like the beach. Lots of shopping in the hotel and within walking distance. Great for families.

We had a nice high-floor ocean view and enjoyed our stay tremendously. It's across the street from Waikiki, on the east end of the strip. Closer to the zoo and Diamond Head, but still in the thick of action.Rooms are spacious and standard for a Marriott. A bit dated, but we ended up getting a deal and an upgrade, so that was a-ok. The resort fee nonsense is ridiculous, but is becoming standard at the big chains in Hawaii. We had breakfast included, which was in the conference room "restaurant" which was a little odd. Food was meh. Ended up going out for breakfast most days because the options are better elsewhere.Fine stay, loved the view--could sit out on the balcony and stare at the ocean for hours.

The hotel is location almost the end of Waikiki, I was expecting to walk around Waikiki but could only make the half way. We arrived at around 5pm and there were only 3 front desk agents (the Japanese speaking desk are not helping non Japanese speaker even though there was a line) I have to wait for almost 10 minutes to get some help.

Dated is not the word here. Old and badly in need of repair, remodel and maintenance. The rooms are small. We saw two rooms. One on the 26th floor and one on the 4th floor. The bed on the 26th floor was hard and the beds on the 4th floor were soft. Much better beds on the 4th floor. The reason we saw the room on the 26th floor is because that was the "upgraded full ocean view room" they said they gave us at no request from us. I don't think that is an upgrade. The nose bleed section is what that was. And yes there is a balcony with a working door. I would not step onto that balcony that high up. Tiny little balcony with a short iron rail. Wind howling. We called down and told them they can offer this upgraded view room to the next guest and we would be happy with a room on floor 1-10 if possible looking at a wall rather than this. It was not a full ocean view anyway and if there was anything to see on the ocean from that far away you'd not see it through the tree tops. Silly. So on the 4th floor (which I think is the lowest floor with guest rooms) the room is more square than rectangle. Nice large tv. Bigger balcony with two chairs and a lounge chair and a view of the pool deck possibly used for events and over flow and such. Much better than the Tiny 26th floor windswept balcony. The bathrooms were identical. Tiny. Sink area then a door with the shower and commode. No frills at all. Stained and scratched toilet seat and the sink gurgled randomly day and night and at times BLACK FOAMY GRITTY WATER rose up from the drain of the sink and when the water went back down it left a nasty black mess! It also had a small leak at the hot water handle. We called down and asked them to check on this and we left the room. Maintenance came while we were gone but didn't come in the room because the do not disturb sign was on the door. No problem. We called them to find out the status of the repair and they told us no entry was made due to the sign on the door and a very nice maintenance man arrived a few minutes later. He said there isn't anything he can do right away with the water backing up as it probably is caused in another area of the buildings plumbing and he can't fix the leak at the hot water handle because he needs to shut off the water and install a new seat. Think he said he needed a new seat too?) He was absolutely correct on both issues. We didn't want to relocate to another room and we knew we were checking out the next day so we dealt with the gurgle all night and black stuff. I'm guessing the back flow and seat problem didn't start the hour before we took the room and could have been caught and repaired before the next guests paying $300-400 per night took the room? Or maybe they knew it was set for repair and gave us the room after calling down to be relieved from the upgraded nose bleed section? Have no idea. Not cool tho. The common areas of the hotel are okay. Lots of shops. A small pool and bar area on the 3rd floor over looking he street and beach with a few restaurants. Seattles best coffee in the main lobby area open air. The Marriott in Kauai was much much much better in every way. This is probably the worst Marriott I've ever seen. When you walk out of the hotel the beach is just across the street. It's a beach with coarse sand and pebbles all over it and it has a man made wave break that is an eye sore. (Much better beaches as you walk northwest) You also have to walk past and sit among several beggars and homeless folks. They are everywhere. Some sleeping, some having loud curse filled conversations with other homeless folks while smoking cigars and cigarettes. The homeless folk aren't the Marriotts problem of course I know that. Apparently not many people care about the bad beaches and the homeless sleeping along the beach and sidewalk as the area is FULL of folks walking/jogging around all day. This Marriott has many more problems of their own to worry about above and beyond the ridiculous environment here on what once was a beautiful paradise. We had no desire to be at Wakiki beach once we saw it and this Marriott was no escape. The Americans and the Asians and the homeless have taken over and it's sad. No Hawaiians or culture anywhere to be found. Very few people even say Aloha and Mahalo. It's all good morning, hello and thank you. As for location? Yes this dirty, dysfunctional, outdated Marriott sits in the middle of a busy, nasty, ugly useless beach. I'll not be coming back to this area ever again. Spend your money somewhere else.

Marriott is a perfectly positioned hotel in the heart of Waikiki with large balcony to view spectacular sunsets. It is located on the very south side of Waikiki. Highly recommend this hotel. Only reason it did not receive 5 stars from me is purely on the hotel like most in Waikiki being originally built over 40 years ago and size of pool (also due to that fact) but hey you have a big ocean pool right in front of the hotel! Having an ABC store inside the hotel was also convenient. Lots of restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. nearby the hotel.Room was clean with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom is very small which is not unexpected considering the age of the building. All the furnishings are modern. Shower is powerful but not a rain shower. The breakfast downstairs was decent, nothing spectacular. The bar on the 3rd floor overlooks Waikiki Beach and had nice performing acts each night. Besides the great views I was impressed with the service levels considering how the hotel is really a large convention type hotel. First we arrived early from Japan so we were given a key to use a shower until our room was ready. The bell desk was extremely friendly staff (tall big guy) who gave us some water to cool off and provided us with some stellar advice. The Marriott Special Services Desk for elite members was able to check us in early and really made us feel special. Breakfast staff was nice but also very efficient. Housekeeper provided us with extra hotels as requested through the Marriott App. In regards to some of the other reviews I've read I have to say I did feel like we got some good benefits being a Gold Member especially considering its a resort. These were not listed in our booking. And on the ocean with the breakwater I do agree its good for kids but its definitely not swimmable for adults as the water barely comes up above the waist. I suggest going a bit further up the beach if you want to truly enjoy the water. I would definitely stay here again. Kudos to the staff and management. Really started off our vacation nicely.

This hotel is in a great location, across the street from Waikiki Beach. We enjoyed a pleasant check-in and were extra pleased to be able to check in early as our flight arrived early in the day; many hotels don't seem to even try to accommodate you when that happens. I'm not a fan of the new trend of charging people "resort" fees; IMO, it's just a cash grab. At least this hotel gives you coupons for a newspaper, free drinks and a buffet breakfast, but on the whole, I'd just rather the hotel increase their room charges rather than this tactic. I don't mind paying appropriately for a stay in a nice hotel. This hotel features two towers, one closer to the water than the other. Many rooms provide a side-on view of the water. The area is pretty happening, so bonus for those who enjoy the nightlife and the feel of a busy city. The pool is small but has a true deep end, and it was salt-water, which is so much more pleasant than chlorine. There is a bar at the pool and you can order food there; also in the area are tables with a view over the beach. There was live music in that location the evening we were there as well. The beds in this hotel are very comfortable and the decor is pleasant, there are very large TVs in the rooms. On the whole, although expensive, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and everyone we dealt with provided excellent service.

The hotel is a good central location, walking distance to the beach and shopping however the building and interior is dated with a 70's ambience and it shows. Rooms is quite decent and has full amenities for a short stay. The checked in rooms left a lot to be desired the beds were not full made with a bedsheet that only covered three fourths of the bed. Why this was so is totally mysterious and for the management to determine. The bathroom sink hadn't been cleaned and dirty. Possibly the worst experience we have had in more than 15 years of being a privileged card member.

From the moment we arrived until the morning we left, the entire staff at this hotel were wonderful.I give special thanks to Troy, our waitress in the restaurant. She was spectacular.I highly recommend this place to anyone that travels to Waikiki.The location to the beach access was great and we were able to get around just fine.

My family and I arrived a few days before our cruise departed out of Honolulu. This hotel is very nice and in a great location. You are only steps away from the beach, the zoo, and lots of different restaurants. We even saw some filming of Hawaii 5-0 take place on our street!The only issue we had was the reservation transition between our own booking vs. our booking with the cruise line. Part of our NCL package included a 1 night stay, but obviously we came early to explore a little more. While we specified that we wanted to just tack on extra days prior to our stay with NCL, the hotel's system automatically disabled our key cards in the middle of the day! This was very frustrating as we had to take time out of our vacation to deal with a logistics issue (which we were assured was taken care of at check-in).Aside from that, we really enjoyed our stay.

Took a cruise with NCL and this resort is affiliated with the cruise line. Very comfortable room with a great view of Waikiki Beach. The room was clean and the bed was nice and comfy, what more do you need for one night? We got to the room around 3:00 pm so we had the afternoon to wander. This resort has a bar on the third floor that served a great Mai Tai. First I would like to commend Amanda the concierge at this resort. I called several weeks early to get suggestions on a day tour. Very courteous and extremely helpful. She was even able to make dinner reservations for my husband and I at a Restuarant down the street. Bottom line, nice resort. Conveniently located to the beach, Starbucks, and eating places.

I have just arrived back from my leave and thought I would give a feedbackon how disappointed we are with what was advertised and what was receivedon our holiday at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa .On several internet sites this hotel is rated 4 star. In our experience as experienced travellers, this was not the case. I feel the money that was spent for the 2 rooms was not of the value and the standard that was promised on a video displayed and was not of the true vision that we believed we were investing in. It turned out a horrible holiday. Below are the issues that had occurred.- Rooms were requested to be close to each other as our son was staying in the same hotel. The result was that the rooms were at each end of the building- My wife and my room (which was supposed to have a Queen or KingSize bed) had 2 single beds. I had to go down to receptionto request a change. When requesting for this, the staff were quite rude and cameacross as they did not care. After a discussion that was notrequired on a holiday, they shifted us to another room. Still a fairdistance from my son’s room.- The quality of the rooms were quite demeaning with torn carpets,lamps shades that were bent, view from the balcony waslooking onto a ash felt roof with an industrial air conditioner which was loudespecially when trying to sleep at night, cigarette butts on the balcony, a looseelectrical wire at the door leading to the balcony. Missingbalcony door lock. Coffee machine with paper cups in the rooms (this I not a standard of a 4 Star hotel).- Noise levels from the hotel across the road was quite loud. Withlate night entertainment and tourist buses continuallystopping directly across from our room. Windows are usually double glazedespecially in a 4 star rated hotel to reduce the levels as much possible Thisis expected in cities in cases like this. I was told by the manager that the single panewindows did the job required and that all cities are noisy.My response to that was that I have stayed in cities that operate 24/7 inthe middle of the CBD and I have never experienced this. Mentioning I have stayed incities like Singapore, Hong Kong and London to name a few.When requesting to either refund for the remaining days to go toanother hotel or relocate to another 2 rooms in the hotelwhere there was less noise and of a 4 star quality. His response was hedidn't really care if we selected to leave,to take it up with the tourist agent.Eventually we did get relocated after your discussion with themand my Insistence if there was no refund there was to be aupgrade, even if it meant a view to the hills that we paid for.-The staff apart from 2 people were extremely discourteous as theyviewed Australians as a low tipping opportunity comparedto the people from Japan, China and South Korea. This was epically noticeablewhen we went to other hotels where staff were polite and professional anddid not hesitate to serve you.

Don't get this one mixed up with the smaller Marriott property one block back from the beach. This one is right across the street from the beach. The only problem I have with this resort is there is still a problem with the homeless people at this end of Waikiki. While on vacation it's disconcerting to see someone passed out on the sidewalk. This has been on ongoing problem in Waikiki for the thirty plus years we've been going there so we're used to seeing it. To be very honest you either look the other way and save money or spend more and stay at the other end of Waikiki. It is a well patrolled area but there are still panhandlers asking for spare change. The beach area is our favorite because of the break water and calmer water. The hotel employees are excellent. We stayed in the second tower section, the advantage is you're not right on the main street with the noise, the disadvantage is your view is not as good as the front tower.

Spent 3 nights here recently and was quite impressed with its location and amenities as well as the service. The front desk staff was great upon check-in and the bell staff was great at checkout too. While I still hate having the $30 resort fee tacked on for things like internet and newspaper that I should be receiving for free as a Marriott Platinum member, at least it also included free DVD rentals (which I didn't use given I was in Hawaii!) and a free drink at the bar each night. The best value was the free breakfast buffet certificate given for being Platinum as $35/person is quite steep for breakfast in my opinion.The location of the hotel can't be beat. It's basically a block from Waikiki beach and if you're lucky enough to have a room that faces the beach, the view from the balcony of the room is incredible, especially at sunset. It's far enough down the beach too that you're a bit more isolated from all the tourist activity that goes on more towards the malls and other hotels farther up the road, which is nice if you're looking moreso to relax than partake in shopping.The room was adequate in size given you're in Hawaii, so you shouldn't be spending a whole lot of time in the room to begin with! During my stay the hotel was in the process of upgrading its TV's from 37 inch to 55 inch, which is huge in a room of that size. The A/C does get a little chilly in the room after spending the day outside in the heat and humidity of Waikiki.I didn't eat any meals at the hotel restaurants during my stay as there's a bunch of other restaurants within walking distance of the hotel that seemed to be a better value than the hotel ones. There's also a bunch of shops in both the lobby and on the first floor of the hotel where you can get everything from jewelry and cosmetics to souvenirs and drinks, which is great if you choose not to rent a car while staying here.I also did not use the pools or the fitness center so cannot speak to those but know the hotel had both available for guests to use. Overall, if I make it back to Hawaii again in the future, I'll definitely choose to stay here again if the price is right.

Great hotel, with great amenities and is close not only to the beach but shops, restaurants etc.Pools are great and easy to get to and from.ABC store is efficient for whatever it is that you need.Rooms very clean

Pool doesn't get sun until about 11a this time of year. Great views from our balcony. Also had a spacious room. Carpet was showing wear but otherwise accommodations are nice and location is good. Laundromat on site- same level as the pool and fitness center so you can pack light and wash clothes while u work out or relax by the pool. Though make sure to do a large load because it's not cheap ($7 total to wash & dry) but might be worth the convenience and hassle of packing too much. No car needed but- if you plan to explore def worth getting one

Wow - these have to be the SLOWEST elevators of ANY HOTEL I've ever stayed!!! And the staff had absolutely NO IDEA where any stairs were. Get this - waited over TEN MINUTES to take the elevator 2 flights to the gym -because there were no accessible stairs. Marriott - you should be ashamed!!

Nice but small rooms and everything you would expect in a business hotel. Tiny pool and heavy traffic noise disqualifies this as a resort. About a 5 min walk to a decent part of Waikiki beach, most of which is quickly disappearing in to the ocean. May want to consider another property if you are looking for a beach resort.
user_name:
CHO22
New York City, New York

review_body: I used to live in Waikiki but not familiar with this property. Booked because of my Marriott Awards!!! Best thing I ever could have done. I love the Boston Marriott Back Bay so thought try this. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with Aloha. While a large property the lobby is incredible and easy to navigate and not so large it takes too long to get somewhere. The atmosphere is Hawaiian with quiet understated luxury. The staff was so incredibly happy and service was wonderful. My room was in the front tower- a corner so you have direct West view of ocean (and it doesn't take a high floor to be happy) and almost a whole wall with lanai of Waikiki beach to the North. Palm tree tops waving below my lanai. Not sure how they number the stacks by my room ended in 33. I want to return just for the comfort of the room. Spacious (maybe bigger than others). Fridge, double granite bathroom sinks with elegant fixtures. Wonderful bedding and mattress AND totally quiet-very little traffic noise which surprised me even on Halloween night. They are a green hotel so your choice on laundry. Totally separate glass shower which if you love hot water pressure THIS was a treat. Never any trouble with elevator. At first I objected to the Resort Fee when I booked. There is a reason!!! Each morning received a coupon for breakfast buffet. Worth far more than daily fee. And I mean buffet. Separate egg station for whatever style you wish. Omelets done to perfection. Fruits, to pancakes, to hot items to congee to Japanese. All with incredibly fresh coffee. Oh and the Mai Thai punch coupons for each day- that are actually good. Bright interior that was fun to walk into with a sigh of instant relaxation. There are 3 other main restaurants I'll review at their site- Sansei- Sushi and Seafood, DK was adjoining and had steaks and seafood. Lobby level Italian-Arancino DiMare. Also a poolside area, the Moana Terrace. So much within this complex you could treat yourself and not leave. Morning activities offered such as Yoga, Hula lessons (dang it next time). SO well located. Beach not as crowded as in center of Waikiki. Directly across street from hotel. Walk south along the sidewalk by beach and there is the park and a small zoo. Aquarium a must. Walk north into the hub of shopping (though MANY GREAT shops on property!) and you can entertain yourself for hours. One morning I left on a walk only to discovered I had ambled for 4 1/2 hours. Tired feet. The bus system is a must they make it so easy. Each stop has a plaque that identifies location with a number and phone number to call. A bus route plaque also displays the routes stopping there and their number. There is an automated system that when calling you can enter the route number and will be quickly told when it arrives and if it has just departed. They run frequently. And if you don't know what number to catch just ask any bus driver . Avoid nimitz highway at rush hour . I was there for a retreat of sorts having just lost my husband and had a funeral to attend so staying on site suited me perfectly. There is also a back tower that I have not seen. Be wary of cab drivers as some do not know their way around (or seem not to) so you could get stuck with unwarranted costs. I just can't say enough positive for this Marriott. Years back I worked at several hotels so I tend to expect more. This location exceeded my expectations so much so that when I return to Kona in the future I will plan a stop off in Waikiki just to stay at this location.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for six nights in September. The hotel was decent, but just didn't have the Hawaiian feel I was hoping for. We had a nice view from our balcony, which was partially of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head. Our room and beds were comfortable enough, but I did find a clump of hair in the shower (not mine). There are two outside pools, one is more for kids and the other is more for adults. There was also a hot tub. The gym was nice, and the hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of many restaurants and bars. One thing I thought would bother me is that the hotel is across the street from Waikiki Beach. However, we didn't really mind crossing the street to the beach.Overall, I thought this Marriott was average. If we come back to Oahu, we'll look into other options.

Nice hotel with friendly staff. We stayed with our 12 year old grandson 1 night pre cruise. After the cruise we stayed at a different hotel at the opposite end of Waikiki for a few nights. Our return flight home had a mechanical problem and after 2 hours we had to return to Honolulu. So, we decided to stay 3 extra nights and go back to the Marriott we stayed in the first night. It is less crowded on this end. The beach across the street is protected with a lava wall making it perfect for a relaxing floating, swimming area for families. The hotel has 2 nice pools on the 3rd floor which is great. Plenty of space between lounge chairs. Food can also be ordered from the lounge chairs. A fitness room is next to the pool in 1 tower and a restaurant with live entertainment next to the pool on the other tower. Rooms are clean and nice. Some have very nice views too. Shopping is also in and around the hotel. We were very happy and satisfied with our choice in staying at this hotel.

We had a very nice room 2 queen beds and 2 twin beds on the 5 floors. Kalar & Yuko was very nice and very helpful to us. Our first time in Honolulu @ Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa was awesome The best Thing was not that far from the beach.

Beautiful hotel but the room decor is a little dark for my taste. The balcony was weird as it is a slab of rounded concrete and you can only see over it if you're standing. The views are beautiful. The beach is public and not directly connected to the hotel so i would have liked to have beach towels also in the room and not only by the pool. There is a vendor to rent chairs and umbrellas and other beach items. The hotel itself is nice overall. Upon checkin we received 2 mini waters and chocolates. There is a water station available during regular business hours which is for use with the hotel paper cone cups but you can refill a bottle by tearing off the small end of the cup and using it as a funnel into a water bottle so to avoid putting a bottle to the water station spout. We had an issue with the hotel and cruise line communication. The cruise line booked one night of our hotel, while we booked the extra night before the cruise. The cruise lines directions were to leave our baggage in our room which will be picked up to accompany us in our shuttle to the cruise ship. We followed the directions but somehow the bags were left behind. This was the cruise lines fault but between 11am and 7pm when the cruise line confirmed with the hotel that the bags were left behind, the hotel itself should have discovered the bags left behind and should have also made attempts to contact us in some way. I was pretty disappointed since my expectations of Marriott are of high service and quality and I expected better. Despite my disappointment for proactive measures, I have to commend Jonathan- I believe he was the bellhop manager. He spoke with me several times and provided detail information on the actions needed to get my luggage to the next port of call. He was my only insight into what was being done since the cruise line was not that transparent with their actions. Overall, the stay at this hotel was comfortable and nice. I would return but will continue to have high expectations.

Great location, friendly staff, comfortable beds and LARGE tv's. Great prices too on the rooms with beautiful views. Near shops and the beach and lots of great restaurants around too. Easy to Uber around from this central location.

The hotel is showing its age, but if you want to be near the beach, its a good option. Walking distance to everything your heart desires. Breakfast buffet is good and the work out room is decent. Everything is expensive so don't be shocked....its Waikiki

The Marriott in Waikiki has some good shopping on the grounds, a good breakfast although expensive, and the ABC shop made getting extras like water, wine, etc, easy. The parking at the hotel is a stiff 35+ per day, so recommend leaving the car and using UBER to get around town. The hotel is not on the beach, but it is across the street and it is a good swimming area for families. The security staff went out of their way to find my sun glasses when I left them at the business center.

On our recent trip to the Hawaiian Islands, we started on the Island of Oahu, and on approach to Honolulu Airport, were greeted with a submarine headed out to sea from Pearl Harbor. We elected to stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Hotel and Spa. We chose this property for its location on Waikiki beach since it offered ocean view, proximity to the beach, and proximity to Pearl Harbor. Having had more time to research our room view, I would have either upgraded the room based on expense, or not have spent as much for the view we had. The room was ocean view, and, yes we could see the ocean, as well as Diamond Head (extinct volcano). However, the view of these sites was from between high rise buildings. I did not take the time to call the hotel to find out exactly what “ocean view” we had, which I have done in the past. I have learned the only way to have an unobstructed view without ambiguity is “ocean front”. For these reasons, I would not detract from a very good rating for this hotel; after all, we could see the ocean, as well as Diamond Head, if not framed by buildings. I will include pictures of these views.The room itself was nice with a small balcony, but catching a glimpse of the scenic aspect of the view between hotel towers isn’t where I could say I would spend time to do so. The service was good, as I would expect from a Marriott, but the room had the smallest bathroom area I’ve encountered at a Marriott property. A pocket door was needed to separate the bath/commode from the vanity area. The rest of the room was spacious and comfortable. The room has a mini refrigerator, safe, etc; check the room amenities on their web site for the full list.An unexpected delight was to be visited by two white dives on our balcony each day, and they would even venture a short distance into the room if the door was left open. We could tell at least one was the same because the poor thing was missing a foot, but it got around just fine. The hotel is an immense facility that offers every amenity. The pool deck is very good, as well as any of the exercise/spa facilities. The hotel facility takes up an entire city block, right up to Kalakaua Ave. that separates the hotel to Waikiki Beach itself. One can walk from the lobby of the hotel to Kalakaua Ave. on the first floor where there are multitudes of shops. There are a range of restaurants on property: From the classic “Marriott Bistro” to upscale restaurants.If it’s a quick inexpensive bite to eat, right at the corner of Kalakaua Avenue ( runs parallel to Waikiki Beach) and Kalakaua Avenue (the official street the hotel is on), a one block walk, is a Burger King, complete with surf boards for door handles. Further down, after taking a right at Kalakaua Avenue, there is a plethora of eating establishments within a few block walk. There is a McDonald’s of course, Eggs and Things, and Cheeseburgers in Paradise (great burgers) within two blocks, and further down a California Pizza Kitchen. About a mile down (not a bad walk) is The Hard Rock Café Honolulu.Within the mile from the hotel and the Hard Rock, one will find just about every high end store along that stretch; the stores that don’t sell anything under $1,500; Gucci, Louis-Vuitton, Coach, Harry Winston Jewelers, etc. Of course, there many other gift shops, and stores with clothing.Need something you forgot to bring or buy? There is a chain of stores simply called ABC Stores that were on the three islands we visited: Oahu, Hawaii (Big Island), and Maui. They can be found on almost every street or corner, literally. The hotel lobby had one, as well as the entrance to the hotel courtyard on Kalakaua Avenue. They have beer, wine, water, snacks, fresh fruit, a number of items you would look for in a drug store for (Tylenol, other OTC medications),nail clippers, souvenirs,…the list goes on.Oahu /Waikiki Beach seemed to be the most expensive place we stayed out of the three islands we visited. Another mistake I made with this hotel is that we had a $30/day resort fee, and we didn’t use any of the resort facilities for our arrival and short stay with a tour scheduled each day. Although the room rate was not bad for the location, the taxes and the resort fee added almost $67/day to the bill.
