Ouch!If one is looking for a large resort hotel with all of the amenities one could want, this hotel is for you, however, in retrospect, I would have tried to find a hotel in Waikiki Beach without the resort fee, since we didn’t plan on using the facilities for our stay.

Can't beat the location, right across the street from THE beach. Two towers, five restaurants, including a fun poolside bistro. Very modern styling, all the amenities. Unique fresh air lobby. We stayed here before and after our cruise of the Islands.

We liked the location, service and amenities. The lobby is beautiful and a nice place to relax. Great bedding & restful sleep. We didn't like the spa fee - don't understand why but expected the charge from reading other reviews. Rooms are getting to the point of needing renovations. Breakfast/lunch restaurant is expensive & too much to eat. Try Seattle's Best in lobby or Wolfgang Puck's next door at Aston for cheaper breakfast alternatives.

A Luxury Escapes 8 day stay.Upside - overall this Marriott is quite good, the room small comfortable, with a mini balcony some distance from the water - almost a block back, about 4*.The staff were always obliging but not always understandable, the mai tais good, food usually in excess and but very tasty. Comments just on breakfast later.We received on check-in 8 coffee/mai tai vouchers as expected, and a blue ActivityPackage card ($30 daily paid by LE) with listed continuous benefits, except the 2 mai tai/coffee cards were one offs. Local and international phone calls and wifi were included. Unfortunately the free newspaper was free download of an app to download the newspaper on your laptop which of course all people take on their ‘vacation’. The gymnasium was exceptional, the back pool small and closed for cleansing I believe only for a couple of days. All good. Downside - Our room was in the Paoakalani Tower, almost a block from the beach. To get a triple upgrade one has to have four grades of rooms below the one you are in. We were put in the upper level of the old tower with good distant water views. According to staff there are 2 ‘grades’ in that tower, water (Diamond head/water, and city/water), and partial water glimpses/non-water rooms. Our room was smaller with a mini balcony, compared to the rooms in Kealohilani tower which are essentially road/beach front.So the Triple up-grade term is, in all probability a furphy.Breakfast - advertised as a 2 for 1 buffet, in fact it is a 2 for 1 Hot buffet (expensive) and we could not get 2 for 1 continental breakfasts - which are our preferred type, well we could, but we had to pay for one Hot Full breakfast A$48 anyway. The continental breakfast was acceptable, the full hot breakfast we found below par, in both variety and standard. After the first morning we ate out. The other meals in the restaurants were very good. The resort is in front of the part of the beach with a sea wall swimming area, this was excellent clean calm, up to 1.5m, with easy access. Great for swimming or just cooling off.

This Marriott property is a big one with multiple towers and the lobby is impressive and all outdoors when you arrive. The front desk staff were AMAZING and conversed with us like we were family! We travelled from Virginia to celebrate our 10yr wedding anniversary and they upgraded us to the 32nd floor Oceanview. The room was nice also but it was dated and nothing really spectacular. However the view was the best I've seen on Oahu. The hotel is at a GREAT location just a block or two from the beach! There's no inclusive meals and the restaurants are pretty expensive but the buffet was exceptional I must say.

I am a Marriott Gold Elite member. My first impression at check in was not very good. The agent was very indifferent and non-communicative. He did not thank me for my loyalty to the brand. Check in was quick. He volunteered that I was upgraded but did not elaborate and handed me an envelope as he pointed toward the tower in which we were booked. I have two requests on my Marriott profile, highest floor possible and 2 extra foam pillows. They delivered neither. Our room was on floor 8 out of 32. No extra pillows. I had to ask 2 more times before someone delivered them. The hotel is overdue for a renovation. The rooms, though clean, look tired. The carpet and furniture are old. The bathroom fixtures look worn and dated. Our upgraded room had a partial water view over the tall palm trees and it was a bit wider than the standard size. One gold amenity that we appreciated was one free breakfast buffet and 20% off the other one. Breakfast was good too. You cannot beat the location of the hotel. It is priced competitively with others. I would book it again once the rooms are updated.

Loved it here very close to ocean, shopping, & parks. Felt like we were Nickel and dimed, but that might be every place in Waikiki (or Hawaii) so I don't have much to go on. There were not any frills with the room we stayed in other than ocean balcony and I payed dearly for that and we were in the tower further back from ocean. I guess I expected more from a resort/spa. The room was cleaned daily and restocked. The entry to resort is open and airy with lots of seating to just relax. Wish they would've had bar located there. We are smokers and the smoking location is in a very small spot on third floor between the two pools kind of a pain in the butt. There was always at least 7 smokers there and only four chairs. But smokers are the bad children lol!! We only ate at the place by the pool and it was really good but expensive for hors d'oeuvres. But the view from there was pretty awesome if you can look past lots of tourists. The staff was always prompt, helpful, and friendly.

This is our 2nd time staying at this resort. It's located right by everything, but at the quieter end which I love. The beach is directly across the street. My only complaint would be lack of affordable food options for midday. Other than that all the restaurants are great for dinner, and the staff is wonderful.

Me and my wife stayed at the Marriott Waikiki beach, and I should say that it was the best experience. My wife had a little bit of sickness and as soon as I contacted the front desk they sent security group to our room and they escorted us to the lobby and paid for our cab to get to the hospital. The entire staff were very nice and accommodating. I definitely recommend this hotel .

The hotel is a nice location and the Marriott employees were nice. The hotel decor in the rooms are a little old, worn, and outdated, however, overall it's a decent place to stay. For the money though, I would probably chose somewhere else to stay. I don't feel that this hotel is as nice as it used to be. The valet staff was wonderful overall, only had a couple of times when I had to wait more than 5 or 10 minutes for my car. The housekeeping service was excellent and I found that they were the most friendly, kind, and welcoming of all of the employees. I asked upon checkin if there were any complimentary upgrades and was there was. However, the upgrade moved me from a high floor to a very low floor smaller room and what I considered a bad view. I had reserved a deluxe ocean front room and did not think that a low floor looking mainly over the pool was considered an upgrade. After working with the front desk they agreed to move my room location a couple of days into my 12 night stay.

My husband and I took an anniversary trip to Hawaii and stayed at this hotel on both ends of the trip. It is a great location, directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. Both of our rooms had excellent views. The hotel property contains numerous shops and restaurants as well as being in the hub of Waikiki activity. The buffet breakfast has a great selection, efficiently served starting at 5am. Hotel rates are reasonable for the location and amenities.My only criticisms are the bathroom are small. And it is apparent that the concierge service is outsourced. Unless you are willing to book a tour through them they can be very dismissive. In fact I was even given erroneous information by them in order to sell their tours. A bit disappointing for the Marriott brand.

I really like Marriott's and stay with them often. Overall this property is very good but it has some quirks you need to be aware of up front. Lets discuss the really good parts first. The location is very fine, right on the beach (well across the street and as close as you can get anyway), and away from the heavy newer downtown Waikiki hustle and bustle. Rooms while showing a little age, are well appointed and in general have good views with balconies. The food - as is typical with any major chain - is quite good but grossly overpriced. That's not really a negative statement, its just the way it is everywhere. Service was friendly and good. Now for the things that might not be really bad, but fall in the category of need to know. First, this hotel calls itself a resort (which in my book, it really isn't - its just a large hotel) and by doing so can legally, but rather unethically, charge a resort fee for items that should be included and are not worth the up-charge. Hotels like to do this in order to show a more competitive rate when you are comparison shopping, but then add on charges that drive the nightly rate up. In this case it is $30 a night. You will get very little for that charge especially if you are an elite member with Marriott as most of it you get free anyway. Also they don't treat elite members very well relative to regular hotels. For example you will only get a coupon for a complementary breakfast for one person a day so if you are traveling as a couple you are being conned into spending $30 for a breakfast which you can get for about $7 right next door. Kind of makes the coupons useless. I could go on about this, but you get the point. Of course if the nightly rate was quoted in total, like it should be, they might not get as much business. Kinda sad really. Just be aware that some of the policies here are a little on the questionable side. If you're fine with that then knock yourself out, it really is a nice place in a great location.

We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, the location is just off Waikiki beach (1 minute walk to the water). We liked the fact that the hotel was at the quiter end of the beach. Our room had an amazing view. The breakfast buffet is huge. The valet parking was very helpful. We used the concierge service to book a few tours and had a great time.

Room with patio facing Waikiki had fantastic view of beach during day, and beautiful sunsets at evening. Within walking distance to great places to eat. Live music at pool level bar and grill each evening.

This past July I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa while I was on a business trip in Hawaii. I spent 2 weeks at this hotel and enjoyed every single minute immensely. To begin with, the hotel attendants were extremely accommodating and made me feel very welcome. Anytime I went to the front desk for assistance, my issues were addressed in a very expeditious matter. I also enjoyed how this resort has everything you could ask for in one central location. I really enjoyed the fact that there are 2 ABC stores at this hotel with a variety of items to choose from including some great souvenirs. In addition, the resort has a variety of restaurants to satisfy your appetite. I mean, you can find any type of food you're looking for, including a variety of native Hawaiian dishes, without having to leave the hotel. I also enjoyed the 2 pools. If one was too crowded, there was always room at the other one. If you stay at this hotel, you have to try the breakfast buffet at the Kuhio Beach Grill. This restaurant has a variety of dishes to choose from, and the best part is that you can enjoy your breakfast while admiring the beauty of Waikiki Beach. I also enjoyed my hotel room which was very comfortable. In fact, since I was staying for 2 weeks, I was able to arrange to have a microwave oven in my hotel room at a very reasonable price. If you stay at this hotel, please try to stay in one of the rooms overlooking Waikiki Beach. This way you can enjoy the breathtaking sunrises each morning. Then you can walk across the street to the beach every evening to admire the beautiful sunsets. So, as you can see, I enjoyed every moment I spent at this hotel. I will definitely stay here again in the future since it is centrally located to everything Waikiki Beach has to offer.

This hotel is my go-to property for Waikiki, because as a business traveler, the 5 AM breakfast is a huge plus. It is free to me as a Gold level Marriott Rewards member, but would otherwise cost $30! The rooms are nice enough, but older. The hotel's location is excellent, and you can thankfully still self-park, but parking is still on the expensive side at $37/day. You may also get a $30/day resort fee, which is mandatory but covers WiFi access. This is meant to be more informational than critical, because these sort of charges show up in other local hotels as well, but they should be considered in planning your budget. Some of the rooms in other nearby hotels are nicer and newer, but again, this is a well run property with the earliest breakfast anywhere that I know of, and by the way, it's very good.... second only to breakfast at Dukes, but theirs isn't free, of course!

We purchased the land/cruise package with Norwegian Cruiselines. The hotel portion was the Marriott Waikiki. A great selection: an abundance of amenities, wonderful location and plenty of restaurants in the hotel as well as surrounding it.

First and foremost, I love Marriott properties, they have the best and most comfortable beds of any hotels. The location is right by the water, the rooms are nicely sized and clean. The food is pretty good on their buffets. A great morning buffet before you head out for activities. The dinner buffets are not too bad either. Overall, my stay was quite nice. It's close to everything to include the beach, shopping and food.

The location for this hotel was perfectly placed and close to everything. Whether we chose to walk or take a shuttle, it was very easy to get to wherever we wanted to go. The food in the grill was very good. The beach was directly across the street and the zoo was one block away. Our room had unbelievable views of the ocean where we would watch the cargo and cruise ship enter and exit the ports. Service and cleanliness were fantastic.

We stayed here in July while my husband was on business. The rooms were average considering the cost of the room per night. The pool does not look anything like the image online(beware) and both were FILLED with children . It is in a convenient spot and was about a $25 Uber ride from the airport. The front desk and restaurant staff were very helpful and warm. Although I always stay at Marriott, I would consider staying at a different hotel in the area during our next visit.

I love this hotel because of its location. It is directly across the street from the beach. The zoo is close by and all the shopping and eating is on Kalakaua Ave. Everything you need is down one street. The parking structure is small and spaces are tight though. If you are staying at the hotel and have paid for parking and the lot is full, you are allowed to valet your car at no extra charge. The pool is nice and clean, towels are provided, and there are plenty of lounge chairs. The pool bar is nice and the staff is very friendly. The hotel restaurants are nice. I enjoyed the steakhouse and the Italian restaurant.

Hotel is located right on the beach and with oceanview rooms a total view of the entire beach. Hotel is clean with plenty of venues to eat at. The local trolley service stops right around the corner and for $2 it takes you to the Ala Moana mall which is at the other end of the strip and gives you a great ride through all of downtown and the beach strip.

The staff are very helpful and friendly. We had a part ocean/city view room which was very clean and comfortable. Room serviced every day. Easy walk to the beach and shops. Beautiful Pool and Bar area. Everything you need within the resort if you planned just to stay by the pool. Restaurant had excellent food. Perfect place to stay.

We went here 10 yrs ago to celebrate our 25th year anniversary,now we came back for the 35th.There was some renovations done and made the place better. I remember the room partially overlooking the ocean from the balcony and its still the same. There's this italian restaurant downstairs near the hotel and it still has these amazing food, we went there twice.The staff were friendly and helpful, the beach is just across the street and a great swimming area for kids. We walked to have drinks and snacks to whatever other hotels there's on the way and shoppings the best. Honolulu will always have a special place in our hearts...

This a fantastic hotel situated on Wakiki Beach. This hotel fills the block, and is huge. The public have access, but it has that personal touch. All the expected amenities are modern and kept to the highest standardsThe rooms are a very good size, with immaculate daily cleaning and very friendly staff. The one draw back maybe the early morning noise from delivery, but that is just an observation.Overall a very good located hotel.

We have stayed at this hotel three times over the last six years and are already planning our next time there. It's located just over the road from Waikiki beach and has beautiful views of the sea, beach and Diamond Head. The resort itself has convenient shops, restaurants, bars, swimming pools, gymnasium - everything you could ask for. Our favorite spot in the evenings was up on the roof level by the swimming pool and bar, enjoying live Hawaiian music. The staff are great, very friendly and the activity planners know all about the best attractions on the island. You can book it all from there.

Stayed here for two nights on business. While the hotel, like most Marriott's, is a solid choice, don't expect any benefits with elite status.Pros:Excellent Location - The hotel is right across the street from the beach, and the beach has wave breaks making it very friendly for small kids. Where the breaks open up to the open ocean there are some fun snorkeling spots with a variety of colorful fish. Its no Hanauma bay, but for being 2 minutes from the hotel, its a pretty good spotDining - dk Steakhouse and Sensai sushi were both good options, with dk Steakhouse being the best meal we had while we were there. Service was excellent, although my one complaint was that they didn't open up outside dining despite perfect weather.Rooms - Clean, standard, Marriott rooms. The patios were nice with views of the mountains or beach depending on what side your room faces.Hospitality Room - If you need to check out but still want to have fun before your flight out, you can store your suitcase and then get cleaned up using the hospitality suite for no charge. This is an excellent selling point that made it easier for me to enjoy the rest of my day after checking out.Cons - No Elite Status Recognition - You have a dedicated elite status line, but don't expect anything after that. No free breakfast, no late check out, no rooms upgrades. As a gold elite I was hoping to get a better room at least, but instead was given a low-floor room overlooking the pool that kept me up with live music. Note, if you're still on mainland time, request a room away from the pool or on a higher floor. My colleague who has no status was upgraded to a suite, so I have no idea how they decide who to upgrade. I would stay here again, but if the price was the same I would stay at the Hilton Waikiki Village, as they provide free breakfast to golds. If you don't care about elite status recognition, its a solid option.

The hotel is a bit dated and the rooms aren't really to the level you'd expect of a Marriott. The breakfast was not great quality, we ended up eating out every day for all meals. The pool is OK and the rooms have nice views as long as you ask/pay for ocean front and high floor. We ended up moving to another hotel in Waikiki as our experience wasn't good enough. A bit disappointing being a Platinum Member for Marriott...

After checking in, I was handed a stack of vouchers and coupons. Was I checking into a grocery store? I was walking away from the front desk with a stack of coffee and mai-tai coupons, breakfast vouchers, a DVD card and a self promoting brochure on what was happening this week at the hotel. The guy who checked me in was very nice and he did his best to sell me on how this property is a resort which means, I pay an additional resort fee (not sure for what) and as an elite member, I get less than I what I would get a non-resort hotel. For being an elite guest, they were going to give me free breakfast in the restaurant - one free breakfast per day, although the reservation was for two people. My spouse was welcome to join me but would have to pay $30 for the breakfast buffet,Needless to say, I didn't feel appreciated as an elite member and made the decision that all meals would be taken off property. Why in today's electronic world, was I being handed a stack of vouchers and coupons? With that said, that is the only negative thing I have to say about the hotel. The room itself was spacious, the carpet was a bit worn but otherwise, the room was in good shape and clean. I didn't have any issues with noise. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here for two nights to round out our time in O'ahu, and found the rooms absolutely delightful. As at the Ko Olina resort, we were comped from mountain to ocean view, but I'm pretty sure there isn't a bad room here.Biggest complaint: both rooms had twin beds. We had asked for twins for the kids and a queen for us. Also, feather pillows, to which my wife is allergic.

Great place to stay... we had a very nice ocean view room... This hotel is close to the beach, restaurants, shopping and the zoo! Restaurants on the property are pretty pricey but what isn't in Waikiki. Really enjoyed the sunset and sunrise from out room...

That's what you get when you come here. On the spot parking garage, open lobby floor plan to enjoy the Hawaiian weather! Beds were comfortable and clean. Hotel located on the Waikiki beach with in walking distance to local restaurants, bars, souvenir stores and grocery stores. Two pools, gym, hot tube, in hotel steak and sushi restaurants, cabanas, everyday drink and food specials. Upon check in drink coupons were issued. Great way to start off a trip. Spa and stores were throughout the hotel. Have fun

I booked two rooms for early October 2016 and while they were next to each other, they were not adjoining which was a slight (and only!) disappointment. We were on the 8th floor of the Kapiolani Tower close to the restaurants and shops and just across the street from Waikiki Beach. The room decor was acceptable and the rooms are equipped with flat screen tvs and a refrigerator. We traveled with two small kids (6 & 3) so it was great to run down to the ABC store on the property to get easy breakfast for them, like fruit, cereal, yogurts and milk. It saved us on food costs for our picky eaters. The balconies were great, on our side they overlooked a busy street which was fun for people-watching (we saw a couple of brides during our stay) and there is a beautiful water view. The one caveat about the big balconies is that there is quite a bit of noise at night from a nearby hotel and their live music. We did not have any problems sleeping with the noise (we brought our white noise machine for the kids) but my mother who was in the next room did struggle a bit. However, it all comes with the territory in Waikiki, it's a busy area with a lot of nightlife. Staff was fantastic. From the valet staff to the reception desk and the housekeeping staff was friendly and extremely professional. The resort fee is high but it includes a daily free coffee and mai tai, fitness classes and wi-fi. The valet is also expensive so when I stay again I would likely just rent a car from their on-site Enterprise instead of getting one at the airport for the whole trip. The area around the hotel is extremely easy to navigate and there is plenty to do there that you don't need the car the whole time.

We spent 9 nights here and had a lovely time. The hotel lobby was beautiful, the rooms were quite dated but spacious and clean. We had a fantastic view of Waikiki beach which was a very short walk to. This was very convenient, we didn't use the pool at all. We have a two year old and this part of Waikiki beach was good for us as the ocean was very calm at the front of the hotel. We were within walking distance to restaurants, the Italian restaurant downstairs was excellent. Breakfast was average but the kids loved it. We were also very close to the zoo an aquarium (very small) which was good for the kids too. Perfect location if you have young kids.

Most hotels in Waikiki are either expensive or old. The Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort and Spa is a two tower hotel with everything you need to enjoy your stay. The hotel is across the street from the beach and has restaurants and shops to make your stay enjoyable. You can never go wrong staying at a Marriott and this hotel is no different. The parking is expensive at $32 per day but every hotel in Waikiki is similar or higher. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The views are breath taking and the balconies are a nice option to sit and watch the sunset. This is my 7th time staying here and I will return again. If the Kolina Resort was closer it would be my number one choice for Honolulu stay, but then again it is 26 miles out of town. This is your best choice for Waikiki

My husband and I stated at Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa for 3 nights. We got an amazing view of the beach from the 22nd floor of the Keopalani tower (#2223). The staff was very friendly and accommodating! On the last day, we checked out but our flight was at night: they recommended us to keep our bags with the bell desk and also offered a hospitality room to shower and change before we head out. This was very convenient since we had a whole day to spend about town. We also got great suggestions from the concierge desks and they helped us book the Atlantis submarine tour. Overall really nice location, wonderful staff and a breathtaking view from the room. The only reason I am rating 4 stars is because of the basic amenities in the room : the hairdryer was a cheap and already broken one and the ironing table and iron were severely soiled and worn out : the iron box made black stains on my t shirt that I was trying to iron! Its something not expected from a hotel of it's caliber. However, I will still definitely recommend this hotel as we had a wonderful stay!

We stayed in this hotel for one week, while my husband was in Honolulu for business. My daughter and I tagged along. First, check in went smoothly. We were upgraded to a Jr. Oceanview Suite because of my husband's Platinum Elite Status. The room had plenty of room for the three of us and a very nice view (30th floor in the "P" tower) We did pay the $30 per day resort fee, which along with our status gave us 2 breakfasts per day and 25% off the third person. Breakfast itself is expensive, but very good with lots of variety. With the resort fee we also too part in some of the offered activities like lei making and bracelet weaving. There were also Hula lessons and Yoga and Zumba offered. This hotel is large, so you will do some walking. It has great access to the beach, the zoo and nearby shopping and restaurants. I had a massage in the Spa. While the massage was very nice, the space was disappointing and not as "spa-like" as I would have expected, especially given the price! I would recommend foregoing a car if possible. Many things are in walking distance, or you can book through a tour or take the bus. If you need a car for only a day or two, you can rent on-site. We paid for a car and valet for more than one day that we didn't need it at all!Also, don't pack towels. You can use as many resort towels as you need from the pool area as long as you return them.

As a frequent patron of Marriott I expect consistency and this resort delivers. The restaurants in the hotel are good (DKs is easily the best option) and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The beds are comfortable and the views depending on which tower you're in are absolutely spectacular. The location is excellent and although it's towards the end of the Waikiki stretch of beach, everything is still in walking distance. There is a "pool" in the ocean directly in front of the hotel. Small walls partition off this portion of the shore. This eliminates the waves and allows all levels of swimmers, including small children, to swim in the ocean without fear. The pool is small and if you're looking to surf or get out further you have access to that as well. Diamond head is a short distance away as well on the other side of the hotel. The staff is lovely, there are two ABC stores and two coffee shops inside the hotel. I stay here at least once a month for business but would stay here on vacation as well.

The staff at this hotel is wonderful, top to bottom: welcoming, polite, and helpful. We had some special requests for our stay & the staff went out of their way to accommodate us in every way. The building and furnishings however are tired and out of date. We had a corner suite -- I.e., a very nice and rather expensive premium room. The furniture all looks 30 years old, and the door jams were scuffed and needed paint. The carpet appears a bit tired as well. The structure is what it is, but the decor could be warmer.The lobby in particular is stuffy and very loud. Some sound baffling or use of soft surfaces would go a long way in defeating the noise bouncing off all the hard surfaces there: walls, ceilings, floors. Traffic noise intrudes from the open area to the street, but the breeze only seems to move in one direction through the lobby, and the actual check in desk area feels stifling.The arrangement of amenities is also a bit inconvenient. For example, the very well-appointed fitness room is difficult to find, because there are no signs or directory listings to tell guests where it is or how to get there. This is in stark contrast to the directory listings, signs with arrows, and televised advertisements in the elevators for the hotel's restaurants.There is also an expansive, disorganized space between the two swimming pools, with a sort of path laid out between them using potted plants. One wonders what if any use that space might once have had. Walking through it conveys a sense of loneliness and decay.All of this is somewhat tragic, because the location is spectacular, the restaurants are decent, and the staff is terrific.If we have occasion to stay in Waikiki in the future, we will probably stay in another venue.

I booked for 3 nights 2 weeks in advance and due to pressure of work had to cancel a few days later, some 5 days before my check-in date. The hotel / Expedia took the full per-night charge from me. Neither the hotel nor Expedia was inclined to cut me a break with some kind of waiver or refund, despite the room most likely being resold. I won't book this hotel or use Expedia again.

Next to the beach and near the shopping and good restaurants. You can enjoy a relaxing day at the spa and than you can enjoy the waikiki beach. Also they have good prices if you search for promotions.

Although we only stayed here one night, it was not a good experience. The room accommodation was less than mediocre, with worn carpets, no balcony and a view into an ugly cement parking garage. The entrance and lobbies are also very confusing with long meandering walkways and halls that seem endless before getting to your elevator. Upon check out, we were waiting at the elevator for about 15 minutes without any cars stopping on our floor. I finally called the desk to be told that they were looking into the problem. Well, my problem was that we had an 8am tour pickup that was rapidly approaching. After another few minutes, I dragged 2 fifty lb suitcases down 6 flights of stairs. Luckily our tour waited for us to arrive. It would have been helpful if someone from the hotel had the foresight to advise and assist their guests on each floor with options to help. In the lobby, we found out, too late, from another stranded guest that there was a freight elevator near the guest elevator that they used to go down. I found the staff to be unpleasant, uninformed and not at all concerned about their guests' experience.

Kudos to the entire team - you provided a 5 star memorable experience daily! We can't wait to return! Special thanks to Front Desk Managers Kalae Araujo, Lorelei Rodriguez, and Bellman Lance. Restaurants on site are conveniently located and food is excellent. Concierge Jing was helpful scheduling site seeing and evening venues.

Place was nice and scenic across from the beach and ocean. Staff was very friendly and helpfulRoom was OK but near the elevators which was noisy. Seemed like everything was an extra. Definitely worth it!

Been at the Marriott for a week in an Oceanview room floor 25.Easy access to beach, shops and bus stops.Good standard of accommodation. Very helpful staff.Brilliant outlook to the beach and sunsets. Overall a very good experience.

Over all this is an amazing hotel. Extremely friendly front desk staff, very good at giving us directions and recommendations for food near by, it's located right by the beach. The view is absolutely gorgeous with beautiful view of the Waikiki beach.. The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staffs are also very friendly.  One thing you will want to keep an eye for is if your room type comes with free breakfast or not. I thought my package came with free breakfast so we went down to the breakfast buffet on our first morning, showed the host our room key and asked if this is where we go for the compementry breakfast with our room. The host said yes and walked us to our table. Half way through our meal ( with food still in my mouth) another staff came by and told us that our room actually doesn't come with free breakfast and that I would have to pay. Humiliated, as everyone around us heard and it sounded like we sneaked in to steal food, all I could do was nodd and say ok. That was the worst part of my stay and really the only complaint I have with the hotel. Although they did ended up refunding me the charge for the meal after speaking the the restaurant manager and explaining what happened, I think they should of checked my room package first or at the very least try to not make a scene and embarrass their guest.Aside from that little hiccup, this hotel is amazing. You rewlky can't get any closer to the beach and there's all sorts of restaurants around.

The outdoor hotel lobby is beautiful and serene. You can walk right over to the beach. The restaurants on site are convenient, have good food and great staff. The hotel lobby staff are nice & accommodating.I also like the mixture of shops and 2 ABC Convenience stores on the resort. I would highly recommend if you can afford it to get ocean view room. I stayed in partial ocean view room which was okay but the view could be better. Whatever you do make sure to ask not for a room behind the elevator shaft. I think they all end in 61's. We had to switch rooms because the elevator noise was so loud I could not sleep or relax in room. Hit Leonard's bakery and rainbow drive in which are about 10-20minute walk or bus picks you up right in front of hotel and 10 minutes to get there. You don't need a car since dining, shopping, zoo, sightseeing are within walking distance. I would recommend a scooter rental because parking is scarce & expensive.

Despite any negative reviews, I can't knock Marriott whatsoever for their excellent service to Elite Members. Check in was efficient and the room provided was beyond expectations, with an awesome view of Diamond Head. Room and bed was comfy. The only complaint would be that room cleaning was a bit too late in the afternoon for business purposes. I was done with my work by 3, but had to wait till around 3 for maids to finish cleaning. A bit inconvenient for folks not on vacation.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa is different than most Marriott’s that I have stayed at. It’s beautiful because it has the open feel and you can feel the Hawaiian breeze coming through. It has a whole bunch of stores inside the hotel for souvenirs, clothing, jewelry, activities, and an ABC store which is extremely convenient if you ever need anything. We spent a few days at the beach which is directly across the street. The ocean view is definitely well worth it! You can see the vibrant ocean water during the day and watch the sunset at night. We had the ocean view room and were able to view the Friday night fireworks (from the Hilton) from our balcony which was a good size for a couple of people. The staff was very nice and would always greet us when walking by. They even went out of their way to work with my boyfriend on setting up something special in our room for me which made my trip that much better. All the good restaurants are within walking distance. If we ever needed a taxi, the taxis were waiting across the street and one of their staff would whistle to call one over. I spent a few days at the pool and it was relaxing. There are plenty of lounge chairs to choose from and the service by the pool to order food and drinks was outstanding. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. I would highly recommend the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa to anyone who would like a great location, excellent service and a wonderful memory.

Check in was painfully slow, taking over 45 minutes AFTER reaching the front of the queue. The "spectacular ocean view" advertised is principally a hill and some ugly buildings, with a glimpse of ocean if you lean over the balcony. The common areas are dirty and uncared for. The room was tired, dull and unappealing. The carpet was stained, the beds made roughly and the furniture marked, pitted and dented. There is little to like here. The beach is nice and access to it is fairly easy, but that could be said of almost any hotel near the beach. Service was slow, unhelpful and expensive. Beware having anything left for you or mailed to the hotel - they charge, without warning, up to $25 per item for doing precisely nothing (quite irritating when we emailed specifically to ask and were told nothing of the charges until we arrived.) In summary: Nothing about this hotel feels like it is worth paying for. Everything is overpriced. The place does not feel friendly or even safe.

Great location. I went in November and the pool and beach areas were overcrowded. I can only imagine what this is like in the middle of the summer. Yet, lots of shops, great staff, comfortable rooms, and lots of access to different things to do in Waikiki. Parking is a little messy, but again, the views make you forget anything and everything.

So this is the 2nd time I've stayed at this place. It's clean, and perfectly located along Waikiki Beach and has great shops and restaurants inside the complex. Awesome pool area. This is from my room on the 18th floor.

The Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa entire staff treated me with the courtesy and attention you expect from a fine hotel. The staff was all so friendly and helpful. No matter what I needed, your staff took care of me and seemed glad to do it. It was like being taken care of by your family -- family that you actually get along with. In addition to having staff that treated me so well, the room and the amenities were lovely. The breakfast buffet had tremendous variety. I will also let my travel agent know what superior service you provide your guests. A special 'Thank you' to Alyssa, Erina & Jovyi, for your true professionalism and great conversation. Please share this note with your management.Lewis DurhamLife Time Platinum Member

I just completed a week stay here. We were on the 8th floor facing the beach. The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel is that the walls are thin and the sliding glass doors are very noisy. Everything else was excellent. So basically bring your ambien. The view was gorgeous and the balconies are roomy with 2 chairs, table and chaise. We spent a lot of time on the balcony. The lobby was very nice and all areas of the hotel are clean and sparkling. Housekeeping did an outstanding job cleaning our room. I saw 2 ABCs store so that was very handy in buying things we forgot and also drinks and snacks. We went to the restaurant buffet on Sat night and had crab and prime rib, that was very good. I would love to stay here again, I would watch for a good rate

I was able to take a trip with my husband for my 66th wedding anniversary as a gift from my daughter. They arranged for everything, part of it being a stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa. It was such a lovely stay! The view from our room was perfect. We could see the Catholic church but also the beach below. The suite that we were in was very spacious and modern. We couldn't have asked for a better room. I would highly recommend staying at this location because it is close to shopping and right across the street from the beach. It is on the end closest to diamond head which also gives a great backdrop for photos. And there is also a car rental service in house for you to rent cars on a daily basis if you wish. Quite easy! The management here was quite accommodating and very helpful in making our trip a perfect one. I thank them for their kindness and help in making two elderly people feel quite at home.

The room provided was large and comfortably furnished with a balcony view to Waikiki beach. The room was obviously well used but was clean and all the facilities were provided.Initially had a problem with the in-room safe, but a call to Security had them send a guard to the room and it was fixed very quickly.The only drawback was the balcony view was restricted by air conditioning machines on a lower floor, but for one night was not a problem.

First time here, Will not come back to this hotel. Charges for parking, resort fees, valet, it just does not end. Nothing special about hotel-elevators didn't work well. Bad selection in dining. Room service will kill you!! Next time, I will get my monies worth!!

Stayed here with the wife, great location. Beach straight across the road, couldn't be better. We would definitely come back. Didn't have a meal here, sorry! Has a great bar to watch a sunset, and a pool near buy, even if a little our dated. Over all very happy.

Reserved a Premimum Ocean View room six months in advance thinking we would get a full ocean view. Our main view was of the neighboring hotel with a partial ocean view. It could have been worse but not as expected. The bed was not high quality and the room was dated. The valet staff, the housekeeping staff, the desk staff were great. The housekeeping staff greeted us at every occasion and were genuine. There is no shuttle service to and from the airport or the cruise pier and poor coordination with the car rental companies (may not be hotels fault).

The Waikiki Marriott is in the process of competing with the other resorts that line the beach, and it's doing an admirable job, e.g. the newly refurbished lobby, the tropical fans that usher in cooling breezes, and its upscale stores. Perhaps most impressive is D.K., the hotel's premier restaurant which boasts a lovely ambiance as well as delicious fare. Adjacent to this is a pleasant bar/grill which offers lite fare to after - dinner patrons who enjoy good live entertainment or poolside drinks. My fav was a duo who performed contemporary Hawaiian songs. Outstanding! I found the hotel employees to be courteous and unfailingly helpful. The rooms were adequate but the views spectacular. Location is the hotel's stock and trade--beach, mountain and city amenities. The only disappointment was the minuscule bathroom and the paucity of soap and notions. Then again, how much time do tourists spend in the bathroom?!

My wife and I spent 3 nights at this Hotel last week. The location was fantastic as it was right across the street from the beach and within walking distance of all the best shopping and restaurants. The price was very competitive compared to the rest of Waikiki Beachfront locations and we were upgraded due to our Elite Membership status with Marriott. This is a great place and we will stay here again.

Great hotel right at Waikiki beach. Beautiful rooms and the staff couldn't be better. The views are just amazing and the rooms are insulated nicely so you don't hear the late night hallway walkers. Close enough to all things "Waikiki" and nearby amazing restaurants. Just around the corner you'll find the best Poke on the island. Parking was nice and the shopping in the hotel makes it convenient if you forget something. Front desk staff are some of the nicest and most helpful.

Waikiki is a frequent stopover for us and we have stayed in a lot of hotels at both ends of the beach. Usually we would stay beachfront & not even look at any other hotels but this turned out to be "a hidden gem". Still prefer the Ala Moana end of Waikiki but we would definitely stay here again.Check in was friendly, efficient & extremely helpful. Thank you to that lovely lady.Any hotel staff we encountered, acknowledged us, which is lovely. Lobby area has been renovated & is lovely. Could have sat there all day. Lots of chairs, loungers to sit in, subtle music playing, fans going, good coffee shop, business area & lemon water available. A really nice area...well done.The room which was in the back tower was very clean, well set out & had a partial(good) view of the ocean & the mountain. This was unexpected as I have stopped booking partial view rooms as they usually are a sliver of ocean over a carpark! Bed large & comfortable. Lots of lifts, so no waiting.Pool area was quiet. The main pool area is nice, lots of loungers but no shade. The restaurant has an awesome view, good seating with shade, food & drinks good. A fun place for a snack & after swim drinks.Because their was no shade around the main pool area we used the smaller pool at the back. We were able to move the lounge chairs into the shade as there were not a lot of people. This area does need an upgrade but it was adequate.Location is very good. Close to everything, coffee, shops, restaurants & beach.We really enjoyed our relaxing stay here. Would return & recommend.

Tired hotel, small pool, most of it is very deep so you have to hold onto the sides or keep swimming. Bad part of Waikiki because there are a lot of homeless people around the beach and sleeping on the park area benches at night. It is a pretty good walk to the better restaurants. The rooms are clean and big but a bit dated. I most likely wont return, I would opt for a resort the other end of the beach. The people were very nice and hospitable but the hotel just fell way short of our expectations.

Stayed here for 4 nights. Front desk reception was very friendly and helpful, making some dining recommendations. Hotel is very large with two towers but didn't feel overwhelming. Excellent and ideal location right across from beach. Very nice buffet breakfast and enjoyed cocktails and appetizers at outdoor restaurant. I really enjoyed my massage at the spa and my husband took advantage of the well equipped gym. I made a lovely lei at one of the free classes for guests. Walls seemed a little thin as we had to endure hearing amorous neighbors every day. Would consider staying here again.

PROS: It was near the beach. You can watch the sunset from our room. The hotel staff were all above average: concierge and housekeeping were very very helpful. CONS: We were surprised about the additional hotel cost (US$30/day for a 7night stay) when we arrived. The toiletries were a bit lean and we had to request for the rest of the stuff almost everyday - toothbrush, toothpaste, bathrobes, slippers, razor). This should have been there right from the onset.

I stayed at this property for a business trip over the summer. The hotel is in the heart of Waikiki Beach and close to shops, restaurants and the beach! Hotel has many restaurants on site and several gift shops as well. The property itself is a little outdated but my room was specious and had a balcony that offered a view of Diamond Head and the beach. Biggest drawback is they do not have some of the amenities for Marriott Gold and Platinum members (like the lounge) many other full service properties have. The staff was average as well. They didn't seem to want to go the extra mile like I have experienced at many other Marriott properties. All in all, a good place to stay, especially on vacation.

2nd time here, and again a bit disappointed with the tired condition of the rooms. Not to mention, in my shower was a left over wash cloth from a previous guest, and lotion bottle on vanity was pressed, as there was not much lotion left. Don't they check the amenity bottles? Also, on arrival after a long day of travel, front desk sent me to the wrong room, and had to call down and wait for somebody to come up and correct the situation.Would have nice to have a bottle of water in the room (I would pay), as I had to go down to the ABC store in the lobby to get one.

Huge hotel. Spread out. Lobby is hot, humid and stuffy. Rooms are standard and fine. Food expensive. Long walk through building to get to bar, pool or restaurants. I need to make my comments longer but there is very little to say.

This hotel is right on the beach, right on the beach road. Lots of other hotels, restaurants, shopping, etc. nearby. The hotel itself could use an upgrade - carpets shown their age, furniture is getting dated.Like all Marriotts, the staff is well trained and pleasant, except for the waitstaff at the pool.

Very nice Marriott on Diamond Head End of Waikiki. Beautiful rooms overlooking Kalakaua and across the street from Kuhio Beach. The hotel lobby is gorgeous, spacious and lots of places to sit quietly and read or wait for your late afternoon flight or for your room if you arrive early. Check in is speedy, bell service is not pushed on you or mandatory like some places - you can take your own luggage to your room. And they are available prior to flights to hold your luggage. There are two towers though only stayed with the ocean view which was lovely. Tons of rainbows with early morning rains - so get up early and see the beautiful full rainbows. There are three restaurants in the hotel all are excellent! Must try the Ahi it is local and very tasty. Salads tend to be on the smaller side so if you make salad a dinner you may want to add a protein. For those on a tight budget there are plenty of Subways, McDonalds and Burger King are less than a block away. Only stores are ABC though there is a Safeway about 1.5 miles away on Kapahulu - a good walk - but must go during DAYLIGHT HOURS! Many restaurants there too but again be vigilant of your surroundings. The Zoo is 1 block away and has a Saturday am 9-noon Art Show on the Zoo fence always awesome art and you get to talk with the Artist - highly recommend. Also tried the in hotel spa, nice place good massage, tried a couple all were exactly the same so just go for the cheapest. Initially had a couple of issues with housekeeping but the Manager was fabulous, the problem with fixed immediately and they called one more time while we stayed there so recommend speaking with management if you have any issues as they were very responsive and helpful. Would definitely stay at the Waikiki Marriott again. Only reason for the 4 was in comparison on other stays the price for value is a bit less.

My husband and I consider this property the best place to vacation and we like it so much that we have chosen to come back to this property three different times in the last six years. The hotel is gorgeous and the location cannot be beat because it is at the end of Waikiki Beach, but is footsteps away to a lot of action. We stayed in a lovely suite that had 2 balconies the last two times we were there and had a terrific view of Waikiki Beach - directly across the street - and of the great pool and cabana area. We loved watching the gorgeous sunsets from our balcony at night. From our hotel, we could stroll to many great restaurants and shops, and we enjoyed wonderful beach walks. The property had a great breakfast buffet with a variety of food and lots of fresh fruit. We especially enjoyed starting our days with early morning swims in the large outdoor pool that later in the day was quite a gathering place for people. The staff at the Marriott was very friendly and welcoming. In the evening, it was fun to end the day at the bar by the pool where we enjoyed the live entertainment and the friendly staff and guests. A nice feature is the laundry room near the pool area. We can't wait to go back again!

Hi fellow travelers ,Recently we stayed at this location. First off the good part.1.location2. Beautiful lobby and shopping on site 3. Expedia desk on site4 . Roof top pools. **5. Good room service ($$$$)6. Ocean views 7. Great service staff Now the some of the rest.1. Property old and in badly need of major repairs (pools, bathroom , carpet in room.2. Management aggressive Only 1 manger really listened when issue arose.3. Hotel understaffed( long check in upon arrival unless elite members no machine check in , 4. Hotel looks good but if you look a little deeper it needs a lot of repairs. 5. Resort fee too high for what they offer 6. Garage unattended and when full no. One downstairs and no sign to tell u so .7. Mismanagement by head house keeping mangers that I dealt with , very rofessional and basically a bully along with hotel security. 8. We will never visit this location again. And I don't recommend u do either.Final note had a great time hiking , boating, sailing , diving , and fishing .... Nature at its best ruined by the giant corps of multinational. ANY Hawaii most beautiful but man made structure most uncomfortable and undesirableFor the most part. Hotel have much lower standees than in Mainland . Show be ranked one star lower than they are. Got it.I only speak the truth . My hand to God!!!Mahalo

The view from my room was amazing! I got to the hotel early and requested early check-in. They gave me room 733. I walked in and was stunned! I had the view of the Kuhio beach next to the bed and a balcony looking at the beach. It was a great start of my day!The bathroom was spacious. There was a jacuzzi, shower stall, and two sinks. It definitely had enough counter space for my use. Love it! However, the sliding bathroom door needed some work. It was old and was stuck and I couldn't pull it out. it took many tries and nail strength to pull it out.The location was perfect! It's literally just across the street from the Kuhio Beach. The resort itself has a lot of stores, including an ABC store! They have valet and self-park parking. They also have an Enterprise rental on-site! It's very convenient!I definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Waikiki. I'm going back in December. Hope I'll get the same room again!

This property is located directly across from Waikiki beach. The property is well maintained and the room was clean. Breakfast buffet was great. Even though this hotel is located down one end of the main drag, you can walk to nearly everything Waikiki has to offer. Wi-Fi was adequate. Laundry is also available on property and the resort has two swimming pools. Very nice, will defiantly be back.

This hotel is located on the east end of Waikiki Beach, very close to Diamond Head. One of the two hotel towers is across the street from the beach and the other tower is set back about one block. Good views are available but will cost a decent sum. The rooms are comfortable but the hotel lacks decent on-site dining. The lobby and the rest of the ground floor is more shopping mall than anything else.

Stayed there for 3 nights for the Honolulu marathon. Breakfast was great. Rooms comfortable, laundry way too far from our room but ok. Great location a few minutes from the beach. Hotel provides towels to the beach.

This was my 2nd time staying at this hotel, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. Great location, depending on your interests. This hotel is right across the street from the beach, which isn't necessarily common in Waikiki. However, it is at the south side of Waikiki, so it makes for about a 10-15 minute walk to get to many if the restaurants - but you're in Hawaii, so enjoy the ocean view while you walk! Nice poolside bar with a great view overlooking the ocean. Self parking can be a challenge at times due to crowds and tiny parking spots, but always found a spot. Clean, comfortable rooms. Great stay!

Comfortable room. Stay poolside on the upper floors or the traffic will keep you up at night. Front desk staff is awesome and friendly. The Italian restaurant in house is surprisingly good. I enjoyed the pizza and veal parm. A short walk to the strip - 5 minutes to the Yardhouse at the end of Lewers. If I have another trip I'll probably stay there again.

Wow what a place! Great views, great service, great food! Even rented a Harley downstairs to ride around the island. Will make sure to stay here again next time! Thank you to the Marriott staff and Mahalo!

we had a great time at this hotel ;bar view of waikiki beach/surfing scene and menu/drinks were perfect;;hotel gave free upgrade w beach views;highly recomend;has limited food options surrounding area;alway recommend eat all meals out often;; pools well manged and staff friendly w good service;sunset spectacular;;go for it;;paul boston

Very clean, polite and helpful staff, and right across from the beach. Great location. Good walking distance to a variety of restaurants and shopping. Multiple ABC stores (not alcohol stores, more like 7-11s) everywhere so if you forget something, it's not far too pick it up!

The hotel is in a fantastic location, directly across the road from the beach & central to all the major eateries & shops in Waikiki. However, the hotel is very run down. The lobby is the only thing that's new, giving you a false perception of what the rooms would look like. Every time the toilet is flushed above, I can hear it. Noise from the pool area, bar and street are loud at night. There is mould on the roof above the air conditioning vent. Twice my bed has been made with linen that is ripped or stained. Towels that are unclean. And a second rate cleaning job of the room.Pools are tiny so when there are several people at the pool it makes swimming rather uncomfortable. For the money I spent to stay here, I would have rather gone somewhere else that was cheaper & get the same thing. I won't be returning.

Very disappointed with what we found at the Marriott. Booked two rooms, 5 months in advance. We requested an ocean view, adjoining or adjacent rooms and a queen-sized bed. We rang before departure and everything was confirmed. A conference blew into town and we were bumped out of our reservation. No adjacent room and no queen-sized bed! We were told we were upgraded but if this was an upgrade I hate to see what we shelled out big bucks for originally. How can it be an upgrade when you don't get what you booked?Very pokey bathroom. Nothing to write home about. Won't be staying there next time.

Unfortunately I only got to spend one night. It was so peaceful looking out the balcony of the room we got via the NCL pre cruise package. The hotel is modern and clean. It had a great pool and was almost on the beach. Had a great time strolling on the beachfront shopping area on Kalakaua Avenue. There was a lot of delicious cheap food 4 blocks away on Friday night at the Kings Village Shopping Center.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Ingrid R
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We liked this hotel, the room was comfortable and we liked the location on the beach but not caught up in the middle of everything. The restaurant food was great but it wasn't very central so it was a bit of a hike to get there from where we were in the hotel. Also the secondary restaurant near the pool didn't have as much international variety as the main hotel but there are so many places to eat surrounding the hotel you aren't really pushed for choice.We would recommend the Marriot and would stay again if we ever went back.

This was the third hotel in a ten day business trip. I originally stayed at the Honolulu Airport Hotel which is affiliated with the Outrigger chain. It worked well since I was solo and needed to be close to Joint Base Hickam Pearl Harbor. The second hotel was at Turtle Bay on the North Shore nice hotel but pricey. The Marriott Hotel is a large hotel just across the street from the world famous Waikiki Beach allowing perfect access to the beach and hotel room. It is also close to sunset beach which holds nightly movies. We were there for the 6th Season Premier of Hawaii 5-0. The hotel is literally next to the Hawaii Zone and with walking distance of Diamond Head park. Great location since we normally stay on the other end of WaikikiThe rooms were clean but definitely worn from high occupancy year round. Our stay was 95% full! The staff was pleasant and helpful. Some problems getting an elevator in the morning and finding self parking at night. Commuting via H1 or Nimitz is rough in the morning and evening due to heavy traffic. The hotel offers several rate options including the Gov't per diem and military rates.

I had heard this was an old hotel, but I had a hard time believing it. It was beautifully done and the desk assistants were so helpful ! I had a room with a view of the ocean which was a pleasant surprise and the room was very spacious ! There were shops around the lobby areas and toward the tower section. I thought we had free breakfast, but wasn't hungry and only got coffee at the pool area food space. I was stunned when I received a charge for about $25 ! That ruined my morning !

I was impressed with the location, room, view, and the staff. We enjoyed our stay. The hotel had a few activities planned, we went to the beach across the street, went in the pool. Plenty of places to eat. Concierge helped us to plan some activities.

We stayed at this resort on a Norwegian cruise line land package.  Check in went well as NCL did the legwork. Getting to the towers for room was confusing with poor signage.  Stayed on 11th floor with an ocean view on the side street side of the Hotel.  Room was worn. Rug needed to be replaced, mattress was poor for a Marriott, overall it needed rehab. No free anything including coffee unless you used the room machine. Most if the restaurants were pricy. We ate at 2 of them, one was at the pool near the front. The other was a grill inside that we had breakfast at. $$ about $25.00 for 2. Tad more for dinner at pool area. Would I stay there again? No I would not as place is just too worn out.

My daughter and her best friend ages eight and I spent the weekend at this wonderful time. It was an extremely busy time given that there was a convention and also the aloha Festival hoolaulea festivities I could not find a hotel anywhere and Marriott was able to accommodate me. Prices are quite high for that weekend, with nightly price of over $450. It is usually half the price but I guess with the demand, they were able to increase the rate.The hotel room this comfortable and clean and we had a view of the city.Check in was a breeze and very quick. We were able to settled in our room and get going to the pool. The pool was on the small side but the kids had fun. They were able to move between the two pool decks and enjoy the Jacuzzi.They said land till nearly 10 o'clock at night. The staff was extremely helpful and very accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back for another visit.

We only stayed here for one night before we embarked on our cruise, but this hotel was very nice. The lobby is great, with shops and a nice bar. It is right across the street from Waikiki beach, so it's also convenient.

Really enjoyed my stay, but I am here on business so maybe had a different experience. Wifi really slow and the business center more of a boarding pass center. Great location and lots of tourist oriented assistance.

Of the ocean that is. Waterfront room near the top of the hotel. Great views of the beach and sunset. A bit reminiscent of South Beach... Spacious rooms and great staff. Get the package that includes breakfast. Otherwise the buffet for 2 is $70+.

This hotel is fabulous in every way.Postcard perfect views from the bar overlooking Waikiki. Room is devine.Marriott upgraded us to a partial ocean view room with a beautiful west facing aspect and stunning views over the ocean.Superb pool outdoor restaurant and bar and I have gone from stressed to relaxed in a heartbeat.Early check in after a long flight was no problem. It is worth the splurge. Thank you Marriott.

WE spent four nights here. Wish could have stayed longer. It is on Waikiki beach and everything is available right there. The resort has several restaurants, shops, at least two pools etc. The reception and concierge provide very useful guidance. Room service was prompt and good. Local tours conveniently start from here or have this as a pick up point. We had a great stay

Not a bad place at all, a number of bars and restaurants and a whole load of rooms. A very big place by European standards, two enormous towers, 20 odd stories each, right at the beginning of Waikiki, near to the zoo. Pleasant place, expensive, isn't everywhere in Waikiki, pool is nice, gym is excellent, one of the best hotel gyms I have experienced. Well trained staff. Just opposite is a sea wall making a 250 yard swimming pool, in the sea, quite neat and not seen that done before. Good for gym, swimming and only 10 minutes walk to the middle of Waikiki. Not the best or the worst, a nice Marriott.

Excellent staff as well. Being elite members, we were upgraded to a deluxe room with one of the most spectacular ocean views I have ever had. It completely overshadowed the room, which was fine by Marriott standards, on the smaller side that you find in downtown hotels. But that view makes you forget about any room weaknesses. The housekeeper was courteous and we were glad to tip her throughout our stay. Many events and tours stop for pickup at or near this hotel, which makes planning easier.

The hotel was great. It seemed huge to me. You walk through long hallways to get to your room. The shops and areas were beautiful. The breakfast buffet was very good but pricey. We tried to eat at the steak restaurant but did not have a reservation. It was a Saturday night and there was an hour and a half wait. We went back to the breakfast buffet place and the dinner small plates were great. My husband had poke and I had the steamed clams. The pools seemed nice but we didn't have time to visit. We walked around the area and there were lots of nice shops and the beach was right across the street. The only reason I gave it a four was the rooms needed a make over and everything was so pricey. I am finding that everything is pricey here though.

We loved this place. great location. nice restaurants on site. Great bar from which one can watch the sunset and have a wonderful cocktail and pub food. Service is quite nice. The place is really set up well for business travelers but still quite nice for tourists.

Some of the room are claimed to have a partial ocean view. This is an overstatement. Those rooms have balconies that have a PARTIAL ocean view. You almost have to lean over the balcony's fence to see a small portion of the ocean. The rooms are not well maintained. The air conditioner outlet is full of dust, the ceiling of the room was cleaned some 100 years ago. Not to mention the paint in the room which is ancient.While others claim that the hotel is superb due to its location - all of the hotels situated between Kalakaua and Kuhio Ave have a perfect location, it doesn't matter which one you choose. Don't be fooled by the location thing! In fact, Sheraton has even better location since it is DIRECTLY on the beach while at Marriott you have to cross the Kalakaua Ave. For this reason Marriott is much noisier, can't sleep with balcony doors open.The parking at the hotel is running at $32 a day - at Sheraton it is $25, but included in the resort fee. A total rip-off!

Very friendly staff and comfortable room! It is a great location across from beach and walking distance to all the good stuff downtown. The cleaning staff did a great job though carpets could be cleaned I guess. Restaurants were solid too.

Great location right across from Waikiki beach. Everything you could need within a 15 minute walk. Very late (6am) checkin due to company flight from Asia. The desk agents were quick as they could tell we were tired. Nice room. EXCELLENT beds. Could nearly black out the room for daytime sleep which I needed. Clean, responsive. I would go back.

We have traveled with our 2 year old son since he was 4 months old to Asia and Europe. We have stayed in different kinds of hotels, 4 stars down to 2 stars and even cruise ships. But this is our first time to ever experience our son getting an insect bite on his ear, under our hotel's bed! Talk about unclean!!!My 2 yr old son was playing with his toys. One of his cars went under the bed, so he tried to get it. That night, when we gave him a bath, he complained his ears were itchy. When we looked, we saw it was red and irritated. We thought nothing of it and just told him to go to bed.The next day, his right ear was swollen and looked like it was about to fall off from his head! That was the day we were checking out, so after checking out, we told the hotel manager what happened.He was also shocked at the size of our son's ears. He asked for our email address and contact number. He was courteous and apologized, but we haven't from him ever since. Now that we're home and we told our story to our friends and family, our family friend who manages a hotel, told us the manager should have done something to compensate us for what had happened. They were shocked Marriott didn't do anything?! Oh well, just beware then if something like this happens to you or your children while staying at Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort Hotel!

While I don't care for Waikiki (too busy), I'll try not to let that color my review. The hotel is all about location. You're steps from the crowded beach, blocks from high-end shopping and excellent food options. But those are things you can get at other hotels. The building itself is dated even though it's been renovated at least twice in its history. The wifi is weak, even in the common areas. Don't stay in a "partial ocean view" room - motorcycle exhausts echoing off nearby buildings will keep you up. Despite that, the hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and efficient. I'd stay here again if I have to go back to Waikiki, but I'd prefer a more modern location. Self-parking is available at $32/day, valet for $37.

My wife and I stayed here for a week. Maid service was great., beds were comfortable but it's not my bed. Perfect location to walk to the beach or catch the bus to go shopping at Ala Moana mall. The resort fee of $30 plus tax $1.47 was a bit too much. We used the pool twice. Too much to do than rather staying at hotel., they should lower it to $15, that's why I did not give it 5.

I've stayed off and on at the Waikiki Beach Marriott over the last fifteen years. The most recent renovation has really improved the quality of the rooms and common areas. The look and feel has switched from what I would call Bahama/Caribbean resort to a modern feel. The updates were greatly needed and make a significant impact to the look and feel of the resort.

We have been to Hawaii perhaps a dozen times and we like this location on the outskirts of Waikiki, but close enough to everything and close enough to get out of Waikiki on the H1. First of all, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. From the moment that you pull up to the hotel, the staff warmly greets you - in our case the parking attendants, then they guided ,us to the check in area. Check in went extremely fast, information provided was informative and efficient, and we were quickly on our way. This is a big hotel, so one can get lost the first day or so, since there are two separate towers and multiple restaurants and lounges (and shopping vendors). We were provided an upgraded room that had a wonderful balcony view looking out over the ocean and beach. Great view. The room had a refrigerator, the internet worked great, etc. Here were a few "challenges": the bathroom has a sink area outside of the toilet/bath area which is nice, however if you have to use the toilet and need to turn on the light, the lights in both the toilet/bath area and the sink area come on, lighting up the entire room. Within the bath/shower, some of the fixtures were coming apart from use and from age. Air circulation was a bit of an issue in the room. We set the temperature lower when we wanted to go to sleep, but very little cool air came forth from the AC and the temperature really never lowered much. Without a ceiling fan, the lack of air circulation had us waking up uncomfortably hot a few times each night. Also, we had a lot of light coming into the room (even with the curtains pulled) from the vending rooms. This was kind of strange, but the way that the towers are situated (kind of an L shape) other rooms were at right angles to us, so when we opened our curtains to the balcony, there were others in rooms kind of staring right at us. Between our room and the others were the vending machine rooms all lit up on every floor. A positive - the breakfast. Fantastic breakfast with a great staff of servers. Friendly, attentive, what a great way to start a day. The breakfast is not cheap, so check the cost. When we checked in, as Marriott Gold members (both my wife and I), we were only afforded one breakfast coupon per room per day, and there is no concierge lounge offered to members. Just something to take into account when considering this property versus all other Marriott hotels, etc.

Stayed a week for a congress at Hawaii Conference Centre. Accommodation is clean and comfortable and the hotel is well located for all forms of public transport. I traveled and stayed for a congress, so the hotel was a base, close to Waikiki beach and shops. The only downside is that bus benches outside attract homeless people late at night, but this is a social service, not a hotel issue.

We did a staycation for my daughters birthday. We booked two adjoining rooms and we got coupons for 6 free cocktails and a dvd rental card for free movies. They have two swimming pools, a japanese restaurant that has happy hour all food half off. beach is right across the street and walked at night to see the sites. As all marriot hotels the bed is so comfortable will stay here again.sign up for marriot rewards u can get a discount

My husband, 21 yr old daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights after 5 at the Wailea Marriott. Two very different but pleasing experiences. First impression is how large and busy the hotel is, with people all around the reception area. Yet we were greeted promptly and had access to our room a few hours early. Reception staff were welcoming and helpful throughout our stay, suggesting restaurants and tips for exploring. Servers in the pool area and steakhouse were also friendly and made us feel right at home. Self-parking is expensive but easy since it is right in the building. The concierge desk (2 people; sometimes only one) was always busy and wait times were long so that may be an area for more support. Our room was surprisingly large and clean but double beds (vs. queen in Maui and most Marriotts we've been to) just do not cut it at a resort in this day and age. It definitely does not reflect a higher-end 'resort' experience. Bathroom area was smaller than expected though adequate. Pool was large and lovely with plenty of chairs though not much shade options. I was concerned being across the street from the beach but that was not an issue at all. Hotel is well located with access to many restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. As long-time Honored Guest members we requested and were told we received an upgrade on the ocean-view room we had booked. But was not sure what the improvement was since we still had an ocean-view room though balcony was a decent size to fit two chairs, a chaise and a table with a ok, though sideways, view of the beach. As always, Marriott dependably delivers on a very good vacation experience, but it was short of the outstanding one that seems to go along with the splurge on a Hawaiian holiday.

Location is great on Waikiki Beach but the rooms themselves are quite dated. Very old bathroom and shower. Carpet is also dated. However, would probably recommend folks to stay here but don't have super high expectations.

Great hotel. Pay the resort fee, it's worth it if you plan on eating breakfast (even covers gratuity).Caveat, if you want quiet, try to get a room that doesn't overlook the Aston hotel (Aston pool and bar/lounge area) or on the Marriott pool side. If you get either of those get on a high floor (18+).A lot of traffic, so give yourself ample travel time to and from.There are a number of good eating spots within walking distance. Udon noodle place on kuhio a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Uncle Bo's, 15-20 minute walk, Dukes is a 10 minute walk. That's just a few...

This is a first class hotel! The staff is very friendly which made the check in process a breeze. I had a broken door lock issue and the staff solved the issue quickly and professionally. One on the best Marriots I have ever stayed at and definitely worth another visit. Stay in a beach view room, the sunsets are amazing.

Person at the front desk gave us a great room. Paid for a city view but got a room on the 33rd floor overlooking the ocean and Diamond Head. I would have given it 5 stars if the hotel included free breakfast. Breakfast buffet was $32.95 person which is crazy. There were better options for food on Kalakaua Ave.

Just to let you know, I am a Platinum Elite member. I thouhgt I had reviewed this resort bfore, but cannot seem to locate it. Nevertheless, this place is FANTASTIC! Check in was excellent and Richard, at the Elite Member front desk was the epitome of what I have come to expect from the Marriott chain. Very professional, very friendly, and very efficient, particularly when you have just flown more than 16 hours to get there. Cannot say enough about him, other than he is a keeper! And, speaking of keepers, Allyson is another! She is THE nicest hotel management staffer I have ever ahd the pleasure of dealing with! Again, she is a keeper as well! This was my third visit here and will continue to be my place of choice each and every time I have the fortune of being in Honolulu. The breafast buffet was a good value for the price. You can pretty much make it a brunch and be all set until dinner if you time it right. The rooms were spacious and very well maintained. I had a Jr suite in the ocean front tower.
