The pool area is spacious although the pool is rather small for the number of chairs they put out there. There is a second pool near the back tower are which seems to be well suited for children. And, there is a hot tub as well as a very nice gym in that area too. I had no complaints whatsoever about this property and would recommend it to anyone.

The hotel is located on Waikiki Beach, the hustling bustling strip of Hononulu. Compared to other resort areas on Oahu and other islands, this is the place that resembles the most well established metropolitan areas. There are shops, restaurants, hotels, one-way streets, and lots of people. So depending on your preference, this could be a place for you. It is one street away from the beach, next to the zoo, within hiking distance to Diamond Head, and easily connected to major motorways to go to places. There is an ABC store (as in anywhere in town) onsite, and plenty of restaurants in the hotel. The room is clean, and with essential amenities.A couple of downsides. The swimming pool is a bit small, and the grade from 3 to 8 feet is pretty steep, definitely scary for small children or beginner swimmers. Guess it is not meant to attract people to stay there for long. Next, there was a rude lady at the concierge desk - when my wife asked her about suggestion of local restaurants, she blankly pointed to sections in a brochure and asked my wife to read by herself, without showing any professional courtesy or enthusiasm in helping a hotel guest. Maybe just an outlier in an otherwise friendly staff, but thought to point this out and hope improvement could be made.Overall we had a good time here, and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Checkin and check out was a breeze. The concierge was so helpful. All of our Tours picked us up from right out the back. Great location- Walking distance to the shops and a stroll to the beach.

This place is great while I have to say the rooms are a bit dated they are still good, a decent size and the beds are really comfortable . What made it for us was the service when we arrived. We came off an 8 hour+ night flight so pretty tired and knowing we couldn't check into 3 only to have Wendy check us in, not only did she get us into a room straight away she also upgraded us to a partial ocean view room. As well as doing this she was so friendly, helpful and knew her stuff about the resort and surrounding area. All of the other staff we have dealt with have also been great. This is a fantastic place to stay it's in a good location , on the beach and not to much of a walk to restaurants etc. I would highly recommend this resort.

Perfect for the tourist or person wanting to be near to the beach, high end shops and a good pluck of restaurants. Not for the person wanting a quiet break :)Arriving there are a team of bell captains available to take luggage, check in is generally quick and the staff friendly.This hotel is a big hotel and the lifts a bit of a trek from reception. If you have a lot or heavy bags, get help. There is no executive lounge but it this hotel is not really a business hotel. Good sized bed rooms, ( however the bathroom is very economical in size ) I was given an ocean view, king sized bed , and bedding as always superbly clean and well laundered. Room clean and functional.Breakfast was fine, though it would be nice to see more healthy options. This is my fourth visit to this hotel and I would recommend for trips to Hawaii.

This Marriott resort is in a prime location in the middle of Waikiki. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants and is across the world famous Waikiki Beach. As a Marriott Platinum Elite member, it was great to see a lot of renovations throughout the years. My upgrade to a Deluxe Ocean View room is amazing. The room is expansive, with a balcony facing the ocean perfect to watch the sunset while having wine and just unwind. The bed is very comfy, very soft. The beddings just makes you feel like sleeping on clouds. The decor, minimal but chic. The bathroom and the bath amenities are good quality. Towels are new and soft. But I do find the shower a little small. Everything was on good working order, great shower, water pressure good. The Wifi worked well throughout my stay.The check in process was effecient. I always go mobile check in so my room was ready when I arrived. Kala at the Elite Guest Services Desk was very friendly and proffesional. The buffet breakfast at Kuhio Grill was awesome. Great selection, with made to order Omellete station. The workers are very attentive, excellent service. The Moana Terrace is a great place to have Happy Hour. Pool was also very nice and very well maintained. The lobby was fresh and airy, a great place to hang out and people watch.Con: There is a $30/day Resorts Fee. That includes free daily breakfast, 2 drinks and 1 coffee. As a Platinum Elite member, this is a perks I usually get anyway on other Marriott properties. This is why Im not rating this property 5/5 stars.Overall my experience was great and my stay enjoyable. I will definitely recommend this hotel and will likely stay here again.

The location of this hotel is wonderful, just steps from the beach and all the restaurants and shops. HOWEVER, when you check in, you are then required to purchase an additional set of coupons that if you refuse to buy, you may not be able to keep your room! How unfair is that?? You are not informed about this during booking the hotel.

Many receptionists not so polite, talk bluntly, and in sarcastic way; "Can you give the key card to me? Nobody will check out for you over there, ya!?", that was occurred to me. Moreover, I was once tried to return lost item to the reception, and a lady just "Shush" me because she was on the computer. So, if you don't care for the poor quality staff, go for it.

My wife and I recently enjoyed several days at the Waikiki Marriott. The views of the ocean are unmatched. The gals at the front desk were extremely welcoming. Its been several years since we've been here and the lobby renovations are fresh and up to date. A nice improvement.

Great location, directly across from the beach. Two pools and strong Mai tais. There is Seattle best coffee shop in the lobby and plenty of shops located in the hotel. Rooms are clean and most have balconies. The hotel has a nice breakfast buffet with fresh omelet station and delicious waffles and coconut syrup. There is valet parking only and they are very helpful with directions and recommendations.

This Marriott property is made wonderful by the fabulous staff. The management of this hotel should be proud of the smiles, love and heart that the employees put into their positions. At check in we were greeted by Jordan at the Platinum Elite Check In counter. He worked to get us a very nice room with an amazing view and guided us through what we needed to know about the hotel making us excited for our stay. Our morning started off with the breakfast buffet in Kuhio Beach Grill. The spread and variety of food was delightful but the true enjoyment was Madonna, our server each morning. She truly was interested in our visit to Hawaii, offered wonderful suggestions on what to do and made sure we truly loved our dining experience. We feel like we truly made a friend in Madonna -- she's an asset to your hotel! The entire team at Kuhio from Kim down to the chef should be acknowledged for making the mornings so nice. After breakfast we came back to a very nicely made up room each day. While the location, pool, convenience and views will always be nice at this hotel, it is the kind hearted staff that made our visit to this property so nice! We will be back! The personality and kindness of the staff is reflected across the entire island where people are so friendly and welcoming. Mahalo!

We have stayed here five times! We really love this hotel for many reasons. The location is the best of the best. Immediately across the street from all of the ocean fun. Centrally located to all of the Waikiki activities. Everything is walkable from this hotel. The parking garage here is good too. It is $32 per day but it is priced the same as anything else near here.I am a platinum member so the rooms that I get are always ocean views which directly face the ocean. The views are magnificent!!!!The rooms are always quiet with minimal noise even in the hallways.The staff are all incredibly nice!!!We love to eat the breakfast buffet every morning, primarily for the lovely staff. Loni ALWAYS remembers us and our children!!! She even remembers what she fixes especially for them. We missed seeing Sue and Kim this trip!!!Stay here!!!! You won't regret it!!Oh the only reason I don't give this location five stars is because they do not have a platinum guest lounge.Thanks to everyone at this Marriott for always making our stays so enjoyable!!!

The most important part of choosing a hotel in Waikiki is the location. This hotel is a very, very short walk across the street to the best part of the beach in Waikiki. The hotel is also very close to the Honolulu Zoo and aquarium, which is convenient. The hotel is large, occupying an entire city block, with two tall towers of hotel rooms and plenty of stores and restaurants on the ground level. The pool and yet more restaurants are on the second and third floors. Bottom line: There’s plenty to love about the location of this hotel for easy access to the beach, highway (H1), and attractions. The hotel rooms are good quality Marriott-quality rooms. The in-room refrigerator is a nice feature. The view from my upgraded room was nice but not exceptional. (Photos uploaded.) The bed was comfortable with feather pillows, one of which held an odor from prior guests. The in-room desk and Wi-Fi made getting work accomplished easy. The breakfast buffet was delicious with lots of options for guests from the mainland (waffles, pancakes, cereals, etc.) and Asia (rice, Miso soup, etc.). The fruit was as fresh and delicious as you’d expect. The omelet bar chef was exceptionally friendly. All of the food was yummy. HINT: Breakfast, like everything in Hawaii, is expensive (~$32 each) so consider purchasing a hotel package that includes breakfast unless you’re a Marriott Elite member, which will likely include breakfast vouchers. It’s worth checking beforehand.The property itself is dated. This is more noticeable in some places than others, like the parking garage. The garage elevator broke during my visit, which forced me into the stairwell a few times. Ugh. The lobby, rooms, and restaurants have been updated, but this hotel’s décor doesn’t cater to guests looking for a truly modern look. Every staff member interaction I had was great. They were all very friendly and helpful, including employees who don’t normally interact with guests. For future work visits, I will very likely return to this hotel.

This hotel has extremely comfortable beds.Checkin was smooth and easy.No Marriot Club for gold or above. No Marriott property's in Hawaii have a club.Plenty of great places to eat in walking distance.Two main towers in the hotel. Both are nice.Some of the hotel restaurants have good early specials.Overall a great location and a nice hotel.Friendly staff.The self parking is a better option than the valet for most people. It is faster and the parking garage has shortcuts that come out into the part of the hotel between the two towers.The garage is tight though.

Great view, nice balcony, HIGHLY functional AC in room. Across the street from the beach. ABC store on the complex. Nice dining (at least breakfast), but a bit pricey. Easy walk to shopping, dining, people watching, and the beach. Open courtyards DO get wet when it rains. Marriott quality (tops in my book).

Stayed for one night before departing on a cruise. Room is simply decorated. Beds were comfortable. Balcony on 8th floor with two chairs and tables had a nice view. Hotel is a short walk to the beach. Located on main street near shops and restaurants. Near trolley stops. Hotel has an open air area so will get wet if it rains. There are two towers. Would recommend staying here for its location and service.

I stayed two nights (Aug 28-29, 2016) in the room 619. It is the corner unit. I started with bad things. I could not sleep well because (1) I found and smashed more than five cockroaches, (2) the washroom was smelly, (3) the shower booth was extremely small and dark (no light), and (4) the room was noisy due to the traffic outside. In sum, if you need good sleep at night (what else is needed?), I do not recommend this place. However, I want to appreciate the way the receptionist named "Cauarey" took care of me and my parents. My parents requested to change their room to another quieter room in the morning on our second stay, and they took out their luggage to the receptionist. However, they were wet in the morning (10a-noon) because they went to hiking without proper preparation. When they came back and requested the new room for shower and changing clothes, someone at the Mariott mentioned that the new room was available only after 3PM!... Since my parents were disappointed and became sad... I asked the lady, Courney, to take care of this issue. She listened to me very carefully and searched for a new (brighter, bigger, and better) room instantly for my parents. Thanks to her hospitality, my mom and dad were satisfied.

Mr. Kaled restored my faith in Marriott by helping with a last minute reservation! I tried staying elsewhere in Waikiki and it just didn't measure up to this hotel where I've stayed many times. Once I returned, I felt I had moved back home! Because it was a last minute reservation, I got the Diamond Head view instead of my normal OUTSTANDING view. The Diamond Head view was ok with a high floor.

Additional costs of $500 Australian dollars a week for using resort facilities. In addition i booked this resort mainly because i was there on a business trip, on the website it states that there is a business centre. I had to use a computer, out of 3 computers only 1 was working, there was no access to scaner (as such the hotel staff told me to go to university (which i did) to scan a document (additional cab charges). Then the hotel stated that there is a hairsalon within the complex, which i was going to use and again this was not available. It is very misleading. Disapointed.In addition the resort has 2 swimming pools which are the smallest swimming pools i have seen for a resort. Not sure how this resort received certification of a resort with having these facilities?Disapointed

My daughters and I stayed at this Marriot for 6 days and the staff that work here are so friendly! Every employee we interacted with was helpful and eager to please.The location is great as it is centrally located near everything in Waikiki. My only complaint is that there aren't any beach chairs or food service on the beach. However, the rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable.We didn't eat at all the restaurants on-site, but we did have the breakfast buffet, which was expensive, but good. We also ate on the patio restaurant near the pool. The food was just okay, but it provided a beautiful view of the ocean.

We are four (including 2 small children) and stayed at this hotel prior to our Hawaiian cruise. I've stayed in various hotels in the area on business conferences and this is by far the best reasonably priced one in terms of property, amenities, and staff quality. We paid for two nights on our own and the cruise company paid for one night - the check-in person, Wendy, spent 30 minutes making sure we did not have to switch rooms due to the dual reservations and upgraded our room to boot. The room had a great view of Waikiki Beach, pool area was spacious and clean, great gym, beach across the way... on our return from the cruise we needed a day room and they accommodated it without a hitch. Thank you for a fantastic stay.
user_name:
ronin6050
West New York, New Jersey

review_body: Great location, but not sure how they get to put "resort" in their name. There is a public beach across the street but the Marriott does not offer chairs or beach towels to its guests. The two pools at the hotel are small square boxes - not really up to the Marriott standard. The onsite restaurants are good - especially the buffet breakfast ($30!) that we received for free being Gold Members (note: only the person with Gold status gets the breakfast coupons, not any family members). The hotel room was bland and beige and was in dire need of updating.They put their entire renovation budget into the lobby that most guests just come in and out of - not sure it was the best investment. They do have a wide assortment of shops onsite, including 2 ABC stores. Not sure with all the resort choices on Waikiki if I would return here - we stayed here on points so it was a free stay. And this was just a stop over for 3 days on our way to Maui which is where we invested more for a top tier property.

I was so tired after the first part of my trip to the South Pacific. As usual, the staff was so welcoming and helpful. I enjoy this property not just for the lication, but for the way it is maintained and shared with its guests.

Stayed here two nights on a tour. The location could not be better. Hotel sits right across the street from the beach and we had a spectacular view of the ocean and beach. Rooms were clean. The mattress was quite soft and likely needed replacing. We had breakfast at the hotel buffet which was very good.

Nice grounds and entertainment. Great location - Waikiki beach is just across the street and close to the buzzing Royal Hawaiian Center for boat loads of food and entertainment options. The hotel staff were excellent and very helpful with directions and local entertainment.

I stayed here a few nights for a business trip. It isn't that far from the airport, and the property is quite large. The room was spacious and I had a partial ocean view, which was amazing. I didn't use the outdoor pool but that looked amazing as well. The food was tasty and the breakfast buffet was delicious. All the employees were smiling and friendly. The only downside, if I can call it that, is that it is located across the street from the beach rather than being right on the beach, like the Moana Surfrider is. But I can't really complain about anything with this Marriott.

While the position to Waikiki beach is excellent, the same cannot be said of the rooms. They are just average hotel rooms, and not spacious at all.I spent a lot of time trying to check in after a long flight. There was a mix up with the booking (on their end) . All this to stay a total of 8 hours but had to book 2 days because it was in the middle of the day.

We upgraded to a suite and it most certainly had the wow factor! Three balconies, two over looking Waikiki beach and three double beds! Room service including breakfast on a massive, extremely grand silver trolley, which we ate on the balcony overlooking the surf, coupled with room service, including a turn down service, preparing the beds for bed! The hotel served great food, had fabulous facilities & shops and we would most definitely go back! We went to Pearl Harbour, by taxi and this was simply an awesome experience that will stay with us all for ever! Thank you Hawaii for such a wonderful stay

Only got to spend one night here on our way to a cruise but it was an amazing room.Quik check in and a beautiful lobby. Sorry we didn't have more time there. Had coffee bar in lobby and nice shops. Easy check out also.

We have been lucky to stay at a lot of very nice hotels in tropical places, and I'd like to add the Waikiki Beach Marriott to the list of wonderful stays! The customer service was exceptional, from the managers, Jesse, Stephen, and Chi, to the workers at the hotel. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our wishes. We stayed in a Junior Suite with wonderful windows on multiple sides. The decor is fairly minimal in nature, but it was very tasteful, and didn't feel old or worn out in any way (and we are hotel snobs). The ABC store on the ground level was super helpful for anything that we might need during our stay, including drinks/food/souvenirs/water toys. The location of the hotel is perfect if you have small kids. The location is across the street from the beach (but it takes 2 seconds to get there), and there is a rock wall about 20 yards into the ocean. The beautiful part about the rock wall is that you don't have to worry about the waves being too much for the kids to handle. It is super calm, beautiful water, in front of the wall, and there are umbrellas to rent there ($25/hour or so) for shade. Lots of room in the water... we never felt crowded, and we were there in high season. One of the nice features of the resort fee that we paid was unlimited dvd rentals. All the rooms have dvd players. We used this multiple times at night with the kids. Cool idea! There is an Enterprise Car Rental location in the lobby, which I used and was super convenient, although expensive per day, compared to the lower 48 state car rental places. $75/day for an Economy car. The breakfast buffet was very good too. All in all, a great stay. We debated the Hilton (not the Village), but the Hilton was a block farther away from the ocean, and we wanted to be closer to the water. One nice touch I might suggest for the hotel, is that for a lot of nice properties in the Caribbean, they offer guests a glass of champagne and a wet wash cloth for refreshment upon arrival. I know this property is not an all-inclusive, but it would be a great touch :) Tiki's is next door (great food/drinks), and it is a short walk to Duke's Waikiki/main shopping downtown as well. I highly recommend this property!

Check-in was quick and informative. Staff at the concierge were polite and welcoming also. Hotel was situated towards Honolulu Zoo, therefore making it a little more quiet than normal. Would definitely stay back should I get the chance. It's been a great visit.

First of all, let me preface my comments by stating I am not a fan of Waikiki, despite having spent a bunch of time there as a kid. Nostalgia is all this place offers me these days.So our usual North Shore spot was booked for the last two days of our vacation in Oahu, so I used up some Marriott points for a couple of nights at this place. Within two hours, we knew we had made a big mistake.The good --The front desk staff was awesome, really a great check in process, very accommodating and very helpful.-Good view of Waikiki beach if you are into that and willing to pay up for the room.-Very good breakfast buffet (skip the scrambled eggs) and be ok with spending $32 pp if you do not get vouchers.So why did we check out after one night?-The pool was wall to wall people and a joke in size for a place like this.-The pool bar food, was the worst we have ever experienced at a hotel. -Too loud outside even from the 23rd floor-Dated interior-Balcony that basically is as private as a subway car at rush hour -THE BEACH IS ACROSS THE STREET! I somehow missed that bit when reading reviews here. Thankfully the awesome staff allowed us to ditch one of the days without penalty so we could stay at the Courtyard North Shore where the real Hawaii is and used less than half the points to boot. Oh and paid $10 for parking vs 37 (you do get valet for that.If you are looking for the city experience with some gorgeous (but crowded) water, with lots of people and unnatural sounds this place is for you. But seriously skip the poolside food!

This hotel was well run and very comfortable. The staff was very attuned to excellent service. If you can get a ocean view room the views are spectacular. The restaurant food was vey good and not too pricey Iwould stay here again if I went back..

Stayed there for a few nights before our flight to Japan, Chose this hotel without much expectations but it turned out to be a good experience. Convenient location, comfortable stay Two bedroom suite was excellent with huge wrap around terraces. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Elua7
New York City, New York

review_body: The shape and condition of the hotel is great with the rooms clean and the lobby that is gorgeous. But after that the hotel is huge and confusing. Directions from tower to tower and parking lot to tower are lacking. Speaking of parking we arrived and to check in and told the bell staff that we didn't need help with our luggage. From that point on those guys treated us like we where third class folks telling us to move our car right away and being overall rude. Like really I'm supposed to leave my wife curbside while I park in this maze!!! I also find it highway robbery for these resorts to charge you $30 extra a day for resort activities that we want no part of. Just another way to drum up money...

Large complex at the end of Waikiki Beach. Our room was located on the 57th floor with great views of high rises, the beach and ocean. There is a lot to enjoy within walking distance, including shopping and restaurants. Would stay there again.

Everything was top notch, modern lobby and room, friendly staff, closest hotel to the beach, and awesome night time entertainment. Everything was easy access and location was key to explore the area. Recommend a hike up the diamond head crater (a must and very do-able experience for all ages).

Our family of four (two adults, two teenagers) spent two nights here on the way to Australia. The hotel is at the Diamond Head end of Waikiki Beach. The room was comfortable, with two beds and partial views of both the ocean and Diamond Head. We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but there are two pools and several shops within the property. The beach is a short walk across street, and there are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. For the value, it's a great place to stay on Waikiki Beach.

Right across from Waikiki beach. Walking distance to restaurants and shops, we didn't even rent a car and got around fine. The front desk agent Jesse Abundo is amazing! He's so helpful and really made our stay extra special! I definitely recommend this Marriott for the convince and little extra amenities...they have free dvd rentals which was nice after a long day at the beach and pool!

great area to travel to beautiful oceans and great people it was a place where i first purposed to my wife... thanks so much PTE you were a life saver and helped me to meet my wife.... I was a skeptic cause it was a fax but thank god I called..... 18009922664

I sayed here for 4 nights, i is in Waikiki but at the end of the beach so not in the hustle and bustle part. if you pay for an ocean view, you will have to walk out of your balcony and then turn to the left to see the ocean; you do not have the ocean right in front of your room. You will Have to get the ocean Front room in order for you to open your blinds and have the ocean view. the breakfast is nice, if you have to pay extra for it, i wouldn't there was a special so we got in included with our reservation. the bathrooms are TINY, so small for such a big room. i wasn't impressed with it at all. the pool bar has an ocean view. i wouldn't make this my first choice, but it still wasn't a bad hotel

My second stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa, located at the Diamond Head end side of the Waikiki strip, was just as pleasant as my first. Love the welcoming feel and friendly staff. Smooth check-in! A free up-grade to an ocean view room and hassle free check out. Walk across the road to the beach. Yes, towels are provided. On site, there are pools, a gym, shops, ABC store, café, great restaurants and an outdoor bar with live music offering spectacular views! I still feel the Resort Fee of $30 per day is rather steep. It provides In-Room Internet, a Mai Tai per day at Moana Terrace or Kuhio Beach Grill, up to 60-Minutes International and local calls, gym and cultural class and a newspaper. All I took advantage of was the internet access and a drink at the Terrace bar.

I stay her regularly for work and find th Marriott Waikiki convenient and self contained.Situated right on Waikiki beach the location is ideal close to many retail and dining options from in house restaurants to Wolfgang Puck Express and Macca's all within two minute walk.While a busy property there is an inhouse retail area, car rental also including the omni present ABC convenience store. Two pools and a very well equipped gym featuring free weights and high tech web connected treadmills.Complimentary newspapers, cable TV, nice bathroom amenities, wifi and in room coffee are very convenient.This property is teeming with military types and aircrews and is popular with families.

The hotel is located at the end of Waikiki Beach closest to Diamond Head. You do have to walk across the street to get to the beach. Very nice area with lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. The staff provided excellent customer service and was very accommodating.
user_name:
Lisa D
Stephens City, United States

review_body: The hotel is located on the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. It offers nice views of the nearby park and Diamond Head Peak. It is a large facility with two separate towers. Each tower had its own pool. Neither was very large. It is across the street from the beach where the ocean has a wall built to keep the swimming area calm. It was a skinny, very crowded beach though. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the higher end shopping area and International Market. The room itself was comfortable, about what I would have expected for a Marriott. You are hit with a $30/day resort fee, which really didn't get you much other than a free coffee every day and a couple Mai tais, if you like them. There are some other 'perks' but nothing I found of use or worth the fee. The service was very good, definitely a highlight. Overall it was a comfortable spot and I had no complaints other than the mandatory resort fee.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Well priced and packaged included breakfast buffet as well. Courteous staff specially Jesse. He was well informed and very helpful. Night life is very happening and hotel is situated at a well busy area. There are many shops that stay open quite late. I wouldn't recommend doing any shopping at the resort shops. We did! And later found out same dresses and shirts were available at a lower price outside of the hotel. The area also has a international market. Where local vendors come out and sell various stuff. That's a must check out place.

This is a newly refreshed hotel (in lobby/reception area thus far) and hopefully this willspread to all guest rooms very soon.An old but comfortable property across the road from Waikiki "beach"....This part of Waikiki heaves with tourists and they seem to love the walled off huge sea bath that serves as the "beach".It may serve as a good staging point to start and/or finish your Hawaiian vacation, but more than a few nights would be way too long here.Get out of Waikiki and this hotel to see all the best of this part of the USA.

Wonderful in every way but really needed late night room service as it would have been nice to have had a bite to eat, from the hotel when we arrived on the 1st night after 11:00 pm. Other than that it was excellent

My wife and I stayed at the Marriott over the weekend last week and the property was very good. The hotel has two towers with a number of restaurants and cafes at the ground floor of the property.Starting from my check-in experience where it quite literally took me 30 minutes standing at the front-desk, we were allocated a room that faced Waikiki Beach and it was located right next to the lift well and to be honest, it was borderline annoying with the constant hum of the lifts going up and down during the day and most part of the night. Compared to another five star resort I stayed at Waikiki Beach the two nights before, the room was quite small and the toilet had a smell to it. The balcony door also does not close fully with a slightly gap. Then also comes the resort fees of the hotel which was approximately US$31 a day. Being a frequent traveler, I don't quite understand why the hotel charges resort fees for services which I believe should have been included in room charges already.However, although there are a few negatives, the positives for me was that I was allowed early check-in and the hotel itself is located right next to Waikiki Beach. Food choices are plentiful and plenty of activities to do.

Enjoyed our stay and the view of Waikiki beach. We stayed on the 11th floor which had a great view but the room was also close to the Aston Hotel who was quite loud in the evening. If you are sensitive to sound stay in a higher floor. Also when I asked the valet attendants for parking rates they told me in & out rates were $37/day but if you park and leave it is $32/day. Unfortunately when I discussed this with the elite desk I was told you have to park the car yourself for that rate...If that was the case the rate for parking the car yourself across the street is $18

Centrally located in Waikiki, right across the street from the beach. Staff is very friendly and helpful. They helped us arrange tours for us. Rooms are adequate. The buffet breakfast that came included was pretty good too.

We spend only 2 night in this hotel, very friendly staff. We were upgraded to sea view room. They offer you 60 mints International phone call per day for FreeLocation is excellent near Waikiki beach. However,you need to cross the street to access the brach like most hotel in Waikiki.

This is a beautiful hotel, close to the beaches of Waikiki. We stayed on the 32nd floor. Had purchased a room with partial ocean view and they gave us a room with an ocean view. It was nice to see through the other hotels and watch surfing.Here's the warning!!! Parking is $32 per day, and you have to find your own space. Its $37 per day for valet, plus tipping every time they bring you your car. The hotel also charges $30 per day entertainment tax (whatever that is). I guess because it's Waikiki, they feel they can rip you off. Personally, we'll not go there again, but if money isn't an object for you, this is a very nice hotel.

Great hotel for families with a location close to the beach and restaurants. The hotel has two pools. One of the pools is next to a bar with live music every night. Parking available for free near within a five minute walk next to the Zoo.

We booked an oceanfront room at this hotel.The view was very good and the facilities were clean and all the staff we ran into were very helpful.The housekeeping staff did an excellent job. We mostly got food at the hotel beach bar. We found that the prices were good.

We booked this room for 2 nights before we sailed on the Pride of America. Great location. We walked right across the beach to snorkel & swim. Walked just a block away to catch the free Thursday beach front hula show. There was a $30pp "resort" fee but you got a free drink at the pool side bar, a drink at the coffee shop and a few other perks.

The best thing about this hotel was the outstanding service provided by the staff. They went out of their way to provide an excellent vacation experience. They pay attention to the details which is what sets them apart. They have all the comforts you would expect from a Marriott and I'm sure the other hotels in the area are comparable in that respect however good luck finding better service. Great Hotel.

We scheduled a beach view couples 80 minute, Lomi Lomi massage with hot stones. The spa accommodations were very nice. The massage itself was out of this world! Definitely, a highlight of our honeymoon! Would definitely recommend. This was also one of the best prices as we did shop around. Definitely go!

Initial stay was at Courtyard by Marriott and it was a total miss. On a first morning we moved to this resort. And it is a much better place!This place is so much better than Courtyard that it didn’t even matter how much more expansive it is.Good things: It is our 5th visit to Hawaii and Waikiki beach has been much cleaner now then I remember it was last times.Breakfast place is always good, some waiters are very helpful and some are very annoying:), but defiantly take a buffet it is good.plenty of choices for food and you get 15 to 25% off as a gold elite member for lunch and dinner.Spa and massage services on a 2nd floor but we didn’t try it.Great: The beach is just across a road and you have a lot of shopping plaza with little stores.Kids enjoyed everything. Zoo is good and very close and relatively easy to get on and off freeway. 5-10 minute of walk and you are everywhere in town from souvenirs to Asian noodle shop.Try to get ocean front or ocean view room it is so nice. Rooms were always cleaned.What else: 90 min timeshare presentation will buy two cruise tickets for adults, but you must travel to their vacation club property on other side of an island…not big deal.There is a little restaurant/bar On the deck(2nd floor) with nice ocean view where two guitarists performing. It was our 12 year anniversary they played our favorite song what was absolutely amazing…and romantic. FYI good guys. We do like valet parking ppl they were good.Not good: It is Hawaii and everyone smiles and happy, but you have to be used to the fact that some locals see things differently and they do not see customer service same way as we do.So just to warn you, if you meet a “grumpy cat” just smile he is not worse it.

Checked in with two other families, we were all upgraded. Our room was huge with 4 beds (2Q, 2twin)and a single pullout. We had three kids so this was perfect. Staff was super nice (Ristan at front desk was great). Pool are was very nice, altho the restaurant/bar there was very pricey. Kids loved the two pools. Easy room access...didn't take days to get up and down the elevator like some of the Honolulu hotels we've been to. Only weird thing was hotel set up. I think there were multiple towers so if you needed to get to the main lobby, it was a hike from your room. We didn't so it was no biggie, but my dad had to and it was a hike for him.Lots within walking distance. Would stay again if I could get same room! :-)

Location location location, right? This has it for sure. But so do all the other properties here. The only reason this is a "resort" is so they can charge you a resort fee. That comes with a cpupon for breakfast, but just for you, not for any other adult youre staying with. Because everyone goes to a resort by themselves, right? A resort that doesn't have bathrobes. Or a minibar. Oh and if you pay extra for a view of diamondhead, that's not going to happen either, there is no real view. Or executive lounge. Or even a bloody complimentary bottle of water in your room. But hey, you do get a free drink and can go to a group fitness class. Not Zumba though, that's extra, because hey, that 30 bucks you spent per day can't cover everything right?

The biggest pro for this resort is the location in the heart of Waikiki. That can also be a con; a busy street separates you from the public beach. If you're looking for a more secluded experience, this probably won't do. Otherwise the property is lovely and laid out well - so you're not overwhelmed by the very size of it. Nice shops in the plaza, excellent buffet breakfast, easy to catch cabs, and you can walk to many places. Rooms are nice as well.

The view from the 10th floor of Waikiki Beach and the ocean was amazing. HOWEVER, the view could not make up for the remainder of the hotel's ills. To start, as an elite member, we thought we might get an early check-in. Not only were we not early, we did not get in until after the scheduled check in time of 3pm. The room literally smelled of urine, forcing us to buy air fresheners. We hesitated in reporting the smell because we didn't want to lose the spectacular view since we were only staying three nights but it was so overwhelming, even after our air fresheners, we ultimately did report it to the front desk. They had the head of housekeeping apply a treatment but at the end of the day the smell remained. When we went to order room service, the room did not have a menu and they had to bring us one. The bed/mattress was old and had lost all support. The hot tub was a bathtub for little children. Most places restrict children in the hot tub for their safety. Not here. Generally, the hotel was outdated, top to bottom. Shower was small, carpet worn, etc.I have come to expect so much more from Marriott. I was very disappointed.

Stayed at this hotel before and after a cruise this is the first time we had been to Hawaii and had read some mixed reviews. Yes this is a busy hotel but the staff are just amazing friendly, professional and went out of their way to be helpful throughout both stays. Room décor was a bit dated but the room was spotlessly clean and the location of the hotel itself was great opposite the beach and close to lots of restaurants & shops. I would definitely stay at this hotel again - if I can ever gather up enough money to go back to Hawaii.

You pay a resort fee for this hotel, so you expect several things: 1) to be treated well, and 2) to have nice surroundings. We walked in the lobby to water leaking from the second floor down onto the lobby floor. When we finally got into our room (the room we booked was not available), the sofa was so worn and dirty looking, we would not sit on it. The carpet had long holes in it. We did not want to walk around barefoot in the room. It also took two people to open the sliding door to get out on the balcony. We spend hundreds of nights a year in hotels and usually they are Marriotts. This hotel left much to be desired. I just don't want people spending their hard earned money on a once in a lifetime vacation to find themselves in a dirty dingy room that needs updating. I was there mostly on business, so I can live with a crummy room from time to time. However, I saw so many families who I knew had saved for a long time to come to Hawaii and I felt so sorry for them staying in this hotel. I hate to think that people from other countries would come to this hotel and equate the quality with the United States. I would highly recommend the Marriott in Maui at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club in Lahaina. It's been a few years, but the rooms were very nice and the service was wonderful. It's a different island- but very beautiful and less crowded.

I'm Elite member with Marriott and just started working regularly in Honolulu. Because I'm not very familiar with the area, I figured it was safest to stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort. My other option was the Courtyard which didn't have fabulous reviews and isn't at the beach. I'll probably review that another time...So back to this hotel. I arrived late on a Tuesday night and had checked in online. My keys were ready and I didn't have any problem just picking them up and heading to my room. The lobby is gorgeous. Apparently it was recently remodeled. I was informed via email I got an upgrade so I was disappointed when I got to my room and it had 2 double beds (my preference in my profile is for a king). I called and they informed me they had no kings. Oh well. I guess the upgrade was for my ocean view. The mattress was a little saggy and the furnishings were pretty dated. I did like the fact that I had a balcony that was in the sun in the afternoon that had a table, two chairs and a chaise.There is no breakfast benefit for elite members at this property because it is a "resort" but everyone gets charged a resort fee of $30/d that includes breakfast (for ONE) in the Kuhio Grill. I suppose it was fine. Typical breakfast buffet with local, American and Asian options. Again, seemed to have a very dated appearance.They also give you 2 drink tickets for use at the Kuhio Grill or bar by the pool. Beware. The print is very small. At first glance you will think the ticket is good for Mai Tais but that is incorrect. Order a Mai Tai and you will pay. It is for "Mai Tai punch" - be sure you show them your ticket so you order the right (free) drink (which isn't even listed on the menu, BTW).The pool is open until 11 so if you have a room facing the pool, be ready to keep your balcony door closed if you want to sleep before 11 (the bar was also visible/audible from my room).As I mentioned, I was there for work. I requested a late check out on Friday but it was not available. I had to work until the afternoon but my flight wasn't until 8:30 so I was hoping to spend a couple hours relaxing by the pool. They told me to leave my bags with the bellman when I went to work, and after I was done at the pool I should ask the bellman to make me a key for the "hospitality room" which was a place I could shower before heading to the airport. They specifically said to ask the bellman so I didn't need to wait on line (there was always a line at the registration desk - even at the elite counter). When I finished at the pool and asked the bellman he said he couldn't do it. Oh well. So I got a hospitality room key from the registration desk, took my bags and headed up to he hospitality room. I opened the door and was shocked to see a couple with a little girl in the room - they informed me it was a shared room (would have been nice if the staff had told me that - I thought I had barged in on them). The room was a converted hotel room that had had 3 beds before (I know this because there were still 3 headboards on the wall). There was a tiny odd sofa in one corner of the room, 2 bathrooms (a handicapped and a regular one) and a giant stack of towels in one corner. I wonder how often folks come to clean the room - it was filthy - trash everywhere, used towels everywhere. About 5 opened soaps in every location possible in the bathroom. I cleaned the bathroom/shower so I felt comfortable using it - this included picking up about 10 towels so I could put my things on a counter and make my way to to shower. There were a plenty of bottles of shampoo and conditioner on the counter which was good. I suggest they just put some dispensers in the showers which would cut down on the trash and wasted soap.After my shower I had about 30 min until I had to leave for the airport and I still had those drink tickets since I had to pay for the earlier Mai Tai incident, so I decided to watch the sun set at the bar. This time, all the wiser, I decided to show my bartender the tickets in advance. He told me I could have one of 4 draft beers or a Mai Tai punch. I was pleasantly surprised - they had Bikini Blond on draft. So I enjoyed a few beers and good service before I left. At least it ended on an up note. But I won't be staying here again!

We stayed in an oceanfront room the bed and furnishings were standard hotel fare but it was clean and comfortable. Loved the balcony. The lobby was open air with ceiling fans used to keep it cool. Their are shops of course in this "resort" and I found several hidden treasures there. We ate breakfast at the Kuhio Gril'l's buffet bacon, sausage, fish, assortment of pastries and juice, omelet station, scrambled eggs, noodles, yogurt and various fruits abound. This hotel is surrounded by plenty shops and restaurants. A couple of blocks away was Oahu's version of Rodeo Dr. My daughter and I made ribbon leis in the lobby one day and I noticed that flower leis were being made another afternoon. I stayed here with a Trafalgar tour group not sure how much the room, or buffet separate from that package. Had drinks by the pool, kinda overpriced and very watered down. The beach and the pool was pretty packed everyday we were there. If you get to both early you'll have a more peaceful and uncrowded time. I used the gym and it was never crowded plenty of equipment. I would recommend this hotel. I don't know if I would stay there again simply because there are so many choices I might want to try something different next time.

Great place to stay! The staff was very helpful with excursions. Very clean and convent to everything you need! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone coming to Hawaii. It also had a beautiful view of Diamond Head and the beach!

16-July-2016 to 25-July-2016Stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott while on family vacation to Honolulu / Oahu.Hotel / property is well maintained.Entrance / lobby is expansive and open to the elements. Room on the 18th floor had a balcony which provided a view of the ocean and Waikiki Beach. More than enough room for a family of 4 with 2 queen size beds, television, desk, storage (dresser , closet ), and a safe for valuables. Salt water pool on 3rd floor. Restaurants and shops on the main and 2nd floors.Hotel does charge a $$30 / night fee to cover cost of wi-fi, etc.. Incremental to basic cost of room.Recommend.

We stayed (2 nights) at this facility and it was WONDERFUL. Rooms were exceptionally clean and the staff was fantastic. I would highly recommend staying here. Many amenities and shops right in or near the location.
user_name:
Ralph M T
Rochester, New York

review_body: I was in a deluxe room with 2 double beds. Room was extremely small. Hardly enough roo to walk around the beds. Room was clean, but outdated. Needs a facelift. Street noise was so bad that it was difficult to sleep. The noise didn't quit, it went on all night long. It was even worse on Friday and Saturday night. Try to get a room away from the street. This hotel doesn't have many amenities. The pool was okay, nothing special. The mandatory valet parking fee is outrageous. It's $25.00 per day. However, the valet guys were quick and very helpful.

We stayed one night prior to boarding our cruise. I was amazed by the hotel lobby which was open air and very spacious. The staff were very friendly, there was free lemon water throughout (Hawaii can be hot!) and there was plenty to do. I met some fun people at the hotel bar (they also gave us coupons for complimentary mai tai's). The gym was also nice and clean with plenty of equipment.

Nice hotel allowing the trade winds to enter. A tiny white dove came in and made friends with us as well. Wonderful trip. Hope to return this year, the next and so on. Love the buffet and the shopping.

The hotel was nice and the pool area was nice. The staff was helpful. Overall this was a pleasant stay. My only complaint would be from the area around the hotel. IF you think you are coming to tropical paradise you are not. The beach across the street is fairly nice but you are in a city and it is not quiet or serene around the hotel. Overall the hotel part was good and the staff was nice
user_name:
rell2016
New York City, New York

review_body: Was in Hawaii for work and found this hotel to be convenient to everything. The view from my balcony showed the ocean and Diamond head-lovely. It was very easy to access the beach. I found the staff helpful and friendly. My only complaint was not about the hotel but the loud construction noise-which seems to be ever present all over the island.

If I am ever in Honolulu again, this is my first choice for a hotel. It is right across the street from Waikiki Beach and nothing but beach on the other side of the street. It is also easy to walk to any place you would like to go to along the beach.

Jacuzzi awesome. The two swimming pools are great. Workout room excellent. Great place to relax and enjoy the sun while having a mai tai. The lobby is a nice place to relax and read paper in the sun or shade. Very comfortable chairs to lounge on.

Stayed four nights last week and was disappointed. Our junior suite room was just average -- dated, lots of wasted space and one tiny bathroom with one sink. I expected view of Diamondhead and beach but was put in the tower away from the ocean with a partial ocean /city view. Be careful when you book so you get the tower you want and then confirm it with the hotel directly. I thought I had booked the front tower. However, hotel location is great, $32 buffet breakfast is very good, despite cafeteria feeling and high cost, and room AC worked wonderfully.Overall, will not stay here again. Too many other options and felt ripped off for price we paid.
user_name:
Judy H
Saint Augustine Beach, Florida

review_body: For our family vacation, we were greeted with the offered valet parking, festive plumeria flowers at the desk, coupon package with a free coffee for each day of our day, and were upgraded to an oceanview room. We took advantage of the valet parking for part of our stay and then self-parked in the hotel's garage for the rest of our stay. Both worked well. Self-park is limited, but we always found a spot. The room had great views of the beach looking towards Diamond Head and was nicely decorated and clean. We also took advantage of the refrigerator in our room for snack/breakfast foods and the in-room safe. Free wi-fi was enjoyed by our family. Hotel is easy walking distance to convenience stores and restaurants along Waikiki Beach. Front tower of the hotel sits directly across the street from Waikiki Beach. Good central location to all of the travel destinations on the island. Each room had it's own lanai, but it was really high up, so it was hard for us to be out there. Music from neighboring hotel and streets can be noisy late evening, but was manageable and expected in the heart of the city. However, the ocean waves can be heard which balanced it all out! Many shops and restaurants are located in the hotel along with two pools. Would definitely stay here again!!

We stayed one night while waiting for flights the next day, staff were efficient, rooms are large well maintained with excellent bathrooms, beds huge and comfortable, balconies large and roomy. Newspapers in the morning a nice touch, fab pool and bar areas, restaurants and lots of facilities, if your wanting everything in your door step then stay here.

As part of a package deal, we didn't get a room with a view but had a very clean, comfortable room and bed. The sheets were so soft. The coffee shop in the lobby was very handy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights. One before our cruise and one after. The bellman met us at the curb and took our bags right away. The front desk staff was very friendly. If your stay is arranged by Norwegian, you will need to check in at the Norwegian desk, located to the far left of the front desk, not the Marriott front desk. Both our rooms were beautiful, clean and had a great view of the beach. You will be charged a resort fee, so make sure you use the perks that they provide. You get 2 free Mai Tai drinks at the poolside bar located on the 3rd floor, free coffee or tea from Seattle's Best coffee, and more. The motel has two towers, both right across the street from Waikiki Beach, and both have great views. The lobby is open-air, with orchids and art throughout and truly feels like you are in Hawaii. There are many nice shops including jewelry, clothing, and christmas ornaments. They even have their own ABC store. I would highly recommend the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort.

We stayed a couple of night in Honolulu before taking a cruise this summer. The Marriott was perfect for us. It sits just across from the beach and not far from the shopping and restaurants without being too crowded. We had a balcony with a perfect beach view and it was Marriott quality clean and comfortable. We did not eat at the on site restaurants, but we did stop by the bar. The staff was very helpful and we would LOVE to go back and spend more time. While there...we visited a shop in the lobby area called SEPIA....with Ms. Sue. If you need to look for some Hawaiian resort wear or just want to meet one of the nicest people I have ever met.....stop by and say hello to Sue!

We had a nice time here. There are 2 pools and lots of shops on property. There are restaurants here too. The pizza place was good. wish they would give out leis upon arrival but they don't do that. Convenient to beach. Ask for beach view. Awesome views and sunsets. Ask for high level room too for better view. Lots of shopping and places to eat all along road nearby. Near zoo too although we did not go. Rooms comfortable and spacious.

Marriott Waikiki is at a great location, close to restaurants, shopping and easy to the famous Waikiki Beach. Marriott has the most comfortable beds and pillows you can ask for. Get an oceanview room and you will wake up feeling on top of the world. I was on the 13th floor and the view was so magnificent I never close the drapes not even at nights. The room was quite spacious with modern furniture and a refrigerator.The hotel lobby is has trendy decorations and relaxing atmosphere, nice place to hang out with friends. An ABC convenient store is right in the lobby where you can grab a late night snack or just grab about anything you may forget at home. From clothing, toiletries, souvenirs, food and drinks they have it all. The property was well maintained, friendly and helpful staff.My only negative about it has to do with my housekeeper that cleaned my room, she just pull the top sheet over when she made the bed without dusting off the bed. I could see the wrinkles in the bed that I woke up from the morning when I go to bed at nights. Needless to say my sheet was never changed. I did complain to the Manager and he apologize profusely. It was grossed to sleep in a dirty bed but I was extremely tired when I get to my room at nights. The comfort of the bed and pillows overshadows the negative experience because a housekeeper didn't do her job well.

My husband and son stayed there for the weekend. They just loved the location, had room service, amazing balcony sunset view :)My son left his wallet there on his way to airport. We are from neighbor Island it took about 2 days to have the wallet with us, super happy.I would totally recommend this hotel.We plan t stay here every time we visit Oahu .
user_name:
susiecute71
Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Hawaii

review_body: We have just spent five days here. Wonderful check in by Lani with complimentary upgrade to one of the Sunset View Rooms, from where the view was so stunning that it brought a tear to my eye! Lani was fun, friendly and really looked after us beauftifully throughout our stay.Our room itself was a good size with comfortable bed and all amenities. The internet did tend to cut in and out a bit and the room furniture could really do with a refurb- we heard that this is due to happen soon, so it will be nice to revisit and see it all 'smartened up!" The stunning views made up for the tired room and I spent hours upon the balcony watching all that was happening on the streets below and witnessing the sunset, whilst listening to the live music which rose up from the bar below.The room was spotlessly clean, thanks to Jane our cleaner, who did a fab job and with whom I enjoyed a laugh and a joke!I had heard mixed comments about the Resort fee- for which we are not used to having to pay. We ensured that we got a reasonable deal for our money by making use of all that it offered!!The buffet in the Restaurant was very good and we certainly were stuffed full fit to burst by the time that we left! The chef came out personally to explain gluten free options to me and the gluten free bread was really lovely!Although the pool was quite small for the size of the Resort it didn't appear to become overcrowded whilst we were there; nor did the sun deck.We had the best time here and I had to be dragged away screaming from my beautiful view. It's a long way to come from England to Hawaii, but we shall definitely have to return!!
user_name:
G3Queen
Chalfont St Peter, United Kingdom

review_body: Two rooms for you for one night stay. We flew into Honolulu to see Pearl Harbor. The hotel is in a great location, right across the street from Waikiki Beach. Nowhere near Pearl Harbor though, but we knew that going in.Everything was fine except the bathroom was tiny. Toilet and shower/tub packed into a room so small you could barely close the door. Sink was outside, a la 1970s era Holiday Inns. Bed was comfortable and no sound could be heard from the hall or other rooms.Staff were very friendly and helpful.For one night it was great, any longer though and that tiny bathroom would have been a bother.

We had the best experience here. The staff are extremely pleasant to deal with and were very helpful. Our Ocean View room was beautiful and the view was perfect. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable and without complaint from us. The location of the hotel is right on the beach front and is perfect for anyone wanting to sit and soak up the sun. The Gymnasium is very up to date and perfect to keep the holiday body at bay. The Pools are clean and perfect for a swim. We really have no complaint and can highly recommend Waikiki Beach Marriot . Mahalo

I can tell this was the bomb in the 80s, but it lacks a lot of needed amenities, including redesign of retail and pool areas. Alot of empty retail space. Patio looked out at another hotel where the employees were striking beginning at 6am. Shouting and using loudspeakers. The front desk seemed unconcerned. meh. All else was ok. Waikiki is a wonderful place. Pool was nice and clean, staff was wonderful throughout. Long way from airport !
user_name:
MRFRIENDLY
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Across the street from waikiki beach, access to shopping, food, and everything else that Waikiki has to offer. You cannot beat the location. For a resort style large property I found the place little too crowded. The bummer was limited service for platinum guests. No water in room, no free breakfast. They gave us a few breakfast coupons but only for 2 days or something less, not for the entirety of our stay. It felt weird asking for more :). Marriott platinum ruins you for such stays because you get used to really good premium service, then you go to a resort for a vacation expecting similar service, and none of it is there.
user_name:
Aishwarya_82
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent 4 days here prior to taking a cruise. Staff were attentive, caring and helpful. Hotel had access to beach from at least 2 sides. There was even access to a convinence store for those late night snacks. One block away from the zoo if needing something besides ocean to entertain them with.

We stayed at both the Marriott and Suite 2001 at the Aston Waikiki Sunset while in Honolulu. They are only 2 blocks away from each and each had its merits.What we liked about the Marriott:- The location can't be beat! It is directly across the street from the beach and the pier. The portion of the beach that is across from the hotel has a sea wall that breaks the waves and keeps it fairly safe for the kiddies to swim. - The staff were super helpful and friendly. We even got a free upgrade to a bigger room with an ocean view when we checked in. The woman also gave us a huge stack of free coffee cards.- The hotel is modern, clean, and appears to be newly renovated. The room was comparable to most other high end resort hotels. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioner worked well, there was a fridge, plenty of shampoo, coffee, etc were supplied, and the balcony was huge. -There are activities offered in the lobby every morning. We got to make and keep a real flower lei, a ribbon lei, and learn how to hula. -It is a large hotel with many shops on site, several restaurants, a gym, pool, etc that are open early and late. This was not the case with the Aston Sunset. -The pool was right beside the restaurant/ bar so there was a band to serve as entertainment while swimming in the evenings. Also, the kids could have a swim while adults have a drink while keeping an eye on the kids. The bar also overlooks the beach so there is a great view of the fantastic sunsets if one isn't lucky enough to have an ocean view bedroom.- The lobby was large, open air, and a comfortable place to lounge. - There was free wifi that worked without issue in the rooms and in the lobby.-There was a convenience room to store our luggage when we checked out but didn't have a flight until that evening. Areas for improvement:- The bathroom, although clean and up to date, was fairly small-The beds were only doubles. They could easily fit at least one queen sized bed in the rooms with one double instead. Two grown adults squished into a double bed did not make for a good sleep. -The pool was quite busy. It could be made a little bigger to accommodate all of the people. -There is a $30/ day resort fee that isn't included at the time of booking. It covers use of the internet, daily activities, a free dvd rental, etc. The fee should just be included in the price of the room at the time of booking so there are no hidden surprise costs.

Hello travelling back from a visit with family in Portland Oregon this was a good destresser Great food fun time Too!! Will do more again ... I had a day a Perl Harbour memorial and enjoyed a fun Counter lunch at Wailana's Cafe off Kuhio. Blvd ... Good value family food n I have been going there for 10 Years so can say it is friendly and has everything from island food to the Diner fare... After Swimming At a time when Ilikai Lagoon too Sprinks

Only stayed one night but the staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice with fantastic views of the Ocean from reasonable size balconies. The location is also great if you want to be in the heart of Waikiki.

We got a partial ocean view room and it was amazing. We had two balconies and could see from both angles of the hotel, opening up the doors and letting the Hawaii breeze go through our room was awesome. We had room service (pricey as expected but good food) and just ate on the bed an looked at the awesome view we had. Only down fall was no door on the bathroom...It was also a great location for all the touristy stuff we wanted to do, the shuttles all picked us up at the tour lobby in the back of the hotel, and it was a very short walk to the beach. I would stay here again. Great hotel.

The bathroom smelled like armpit - it was disgusting. We had to buy candles to light in there to combat the smell of body odor. They blocked us from coming into the rooms because Hawaii 5-0 was filming. We had two kids with us and it was really annoying having to re-work our schedules, while on vacation to accommodate the Marriott's shooting schedule with Hawaii 5-0. Really disappointed with the overall stay. The pool is really small and the service at the Moana Terrace was horrible. Great proximity to the beaches and all the restaurants so can't complain about that.

We stayed at this hotel for 8 days. It's a nice hotel but they only have one bar out at the pool which is a bit of a walk away. Would be nice if they had something in the lobby area or closer. The drinks at the pool are pricey and very weak. An afternoon poolside with cocktails can be a bit pricey. Rooms are clean and nice and bed is comfortable. Parking is $39 per day.

I guess I was already upset that I didn't get my hotel at Hilton Hawaiian Village, but then I get put in probably the only hotel that doesn't have a restaurant. Located up town a bit so there is a a nice walk to the beach. Valet Parking only. The pool was very nice and had a great tropical decore.

This was my second visit to this property in two weeks. It is a very large property but pretty well maintained and well located at the east end of Waikiki Beach with great views of the beach, ocean and Diamond Head. There are two pools and a jacuzzi and neither were overly crowded for the duration of my stay. Many food choices in and around the hotel and an ABC convenient store in each of the two towers.They also have a great breakfast buffet that has many choices and is fast, efficient and great food.My only problem with this property is how they treat Marriott Rewards members. They do not have a concierge floor or lounge which is not abnormal for a resort property but they normally provide you with breakfast as a Platinum Elite member. At this property only one person can get the breakfast -- your spouse has to pay. This seems like a crappy way to generate more revenue. After them telling me this the last visit and this one, I finally said I can go to an American Express fine hotels property and get breakfast included and not pay more than I am paying here. After talking with a manager they gave us both breakfast and even upgraded the room to a lovely suite but again just giving us breakfast to start with would have been easier and cheaper!
user_name:
chgotrvlr71
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Must say we were impressed by staff especially Alyssa ( front desk) and Kylie ( concierge ). Very knowledgable and helpful. Free drinks and breakfast were nice token. If in NCL cruise i would use Kylie as guide. Our room had great ocean view off balcony but needed to change rooms at the end and move to NCL assigned room which was not bad at all. Very nice gym.Hotel needs a social bar near the lobby area. Overall very good experience .

We stayed here for two nights before we boarded the Pride of America. We requested oceanview and wow what a view we had!!!Huge rooms, big beds, complimentary champagne on arrival.......fantastic!!We Returned here after our cruise for another two nights and it was sooo good to be back to such a beautiful big room!!Will definitely be back to this hotel when we return again!!!

Overall I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel as I never stay at Marriotts and I have no status whatsoever. We stayed here for 5 nights for a work conference and then went down the street to the Hyatt for the weekend. Despite being a Hyatt diamond member, I actually had a better overall experience at the Marriott. Yes, I was upgraded and had a better ocean view at the Hyatt, but the Marriott bed was significantly more comfortable, the room was very new looking and up to date, and the view we got really wasn't so bad. The staff was for the most part pleasant, although the checkin agent wasn't very helpful and we had to go to a manager to sort out a request that had been promised beforehand. But other than that, everyone was helpful and nice. All said, we were very happy with our stay and would stay here again.

Stayed here for a week on a family vacation. We had two connecting rooms overlooking the beach which was beautiful. The hotel was across the street from Waikiki beach. The hotel rooms where very spacious. The hotel pool was a great place to go after a long day. The bar staff seemed understaffed at times but they were always friendly. The breakfast buffet was delicious and had a lot of options. Given the hotel location, there are a ton of good restaurants within walking distance.

This resort was so luxurious and really had a unique Hawaiian feel. Great location, it was right by the water (have to cross a street) surrounded by cute shops all along the oceanfront. The lobby was modern and open.The only complaint I would have is that the rooms could have been slightly more modern. But the resort is perfectly located and is in short distance from several "must see" spots! Really enjoyed our stay here and will use the Marriott Resort again.

Booked a room for three nights, pre cruise. Before I even arrived, received a text that my room was upgraded. What a nice surprise. When we arrived our room was not ready. I did a mobile check in but did not change the normal 4pm check in. They finally had a room for us around 3pm. It was a nice corner room with ocean front view and ocean view balcony. This hotel is convenient to everything. You can walk to lots of restaurants and shops. The outdoor restaurant by the bar has a beautiful view of Waikiki beach and the food was actually very good.

I was here for only 2 days, but found the hotel to be in Marriott standards....friendly staff and great amenities. My room overlooked the beach and was very nice. The hotel has access to great shopping, restaurants, with many of the aforementioned on the premises. The only knock was the pool was small and overrun with loud kids and the beach was not what I expected. The beach is just a block away, but was not as incredible as I thought it would be, not the Marriott's fault but they should not make it a huge selling point.Best part was the pool bar, great Mai Thais. Friendly staff from check in to check out.

As a Marriott Rewards card member and Gold Elite, it was great to see the renovations done at this resort as this was my 5th + visit. I was greeted by Taylor and was upgraded to a partial view room. Last year I was upgraded to a junior suite using points and was slightly disappointed as I paid the members rate and was hoping for something extra.The pools were fun for my kids as always and the breakfast at Kuhio was great. The staff were great and shared the aloha spirit. The food selection (Japanese, Hawaiian fruit and American) was very good and delicious. If you are on vacation, valet parking is the way to go. Staff and service was good and quick. Will definitely stay there again.

I stayed here for a continuing medical education (CME) conference. Overall it was nice...a bit old, but I did not mind. The view outside our room was pretty awesome as the beach was right across from the hotel.
user_name:
rachell a
Houston, Texas, United States

review_body: We felt welcomed in this hotel since the very beginning. Mrs Taylor at the reception made everything to accommodate our needs and, thanks to her, my daughter had a fabulous birthday. The hotel is clean and offers wonderful sights of the ocean. We will be back again.

Was recently here on business and stayed at the location. From the time you arrive until you leave, the staff was falling over themselves to help you. Our room was close to the elevator but was quiet, extremely clean and had a great little terrace looking at Diamond Head. Easy to park, easy to navigate in and out of Waikiki. Great value. It is what it is at a reasonable price.

The resort is in a prime location for the beach, walking, shopping and dining. Our room had a great view of Diamond Head and the beach (23rd floor). My wife, son and I were in for 2 nights and had a very busy but comfortable stay. Easy access to H1 as well as the scenic drive down Nimitz Hwy. The breakfast buffet had something for everyone and the Staff was responsive and excellent. Overall great stay with a staff that was super friendly and attentive from the Valet to the Front Desk to the room attendants.

My wife and I really liked this hotel. The location was right on the main drag of Waikiki Beach. There were many restaurants, attractions, beaches, pools, etc. available within walking distance. Our room had a partial ocean view which was beautiful. We sat on the balcony to watch some sunsets. The hotel had two pools, but we only visited one. That was a good spot with great access to the bar, paid cabanas, and uncovered seating. The pool could be crowded starting in the mid afternoon and could be taken over by families and children. There were plenty of shops and restaurants right on the property. We did visit the Moana Terrace a few times. We ate dinner there the first night. We had some appetizers and split the fish and chips. Both were good, but nothing spectacular. There was nightly entertainment at the terrace. We saw a terrific duo the first two nights. The breakfast buffet was amazing. We had vouchers for a few days, but even the days we had to pay were well worth the price. There was a large selection, an omelet bar, and a range of healthy and rib sticking options. Some small details and issues caused us to give a 4 out of 5. There was one day where we had to use the stairs because elevators were not coming to our floor. The rooms decor and some functionality could use some updating. The room itself didn't really have a "Hawaiian" feel unless you opened up the curtains and were on the balcony. Overall, we'd recommend this hotel and would stay again if we were to come back to Oahu.

Waikiki, this artificial beach in busy Honolulu is not worth a trip, neither is this hotel which is extremely large and old fashioned. Certain parts, like carpets, are in need of an update. Lines for breakfast are very long, even at 6.30 in the morning. Aircon and fridge in the room are noisy. Balcony is nice. With all the taxes and the resort fee (which is USD 30 and not worth a dime in my view as the coffee offered with it is undrinkable), you run a tab of 430 USD per night which is too much for what this place offers.

The resort is in a nice location but it is not up to Marriott standards. The balcony height seems low and not up to current codes of construction. I would not want my kids out on balcony. The place looks like it needs a major face lift. The laundry room is nice to have but was old and worn like the rooms. Marriott needs to spend some money here or else take the name off. The beach is great, pool is average, food is good. Nothing special about this resort.

For a Marriott, this was not a great hotel. We arrived around 3 pm and our room was not ready. There was no place indoors to wait and it was very hot. The room itself was fine but nothing special. The bar patio was nice with great views.

Fantastic hotel.....service is perfect and staff is very friendly. We organized our daily trips through the concierge at the hotel and they were very helpful in planning our outings. The location is perfect, steps away from Waikiki Beach and shopping.

Great location- right across from the beach. You have to love the beach because if you are a pool person- you will be very disappointed. We are a pool family and the pools are so small my kids didn't even want to go swimming in them. The other problem I had was the way they had the pool chairs lined up. If you weren't lucky enough to get a chair right around the pool, you couldn't see the pool. This is a problem when you are trying to keep an eye on your kids. Our room was completely outdated. Yellow/white carpet. Old mattresses, bathroom has wallpaper, no privacy. It was spacious, I'll give it that. We did have a beautiful view of the ocean. Our last night we ordered room service- avoid! We ordered 2 kids meals and a turkey sandwich- $75! They added an in room service charge of $11. Completely overpriced! For being a Marriott "Resort"- not my idea of resort style living. I look forward to my own bathroom and own bed.

My husband and I spent 4 blissful nights at this lovely Marriott facility. The hotel is conveniently located across from Waikiki Beach, the Honolulu Zoo, and the Waikiki Aquarium, in addition to many shops and restaurants. It is less trafficked than the Hilton Village, Outrigger Hotel areas which are nearer the bigger shopping mall, but to me, less is more. The rooms are large, spacious, and clean. We were in the first tower on the 12th floor overlooking the pool area and Waikiki Beach-a great view to wake up to and turn in with. The Marriott Waikiki has 2 Seattle's Best coffee shops. at least 5 souvenir shops (we found the ABC shop to have the most choices and best prices), a few boutique shops, a quality jewelry store, several restaurants including D.K. Steakhouse (a business casual type restaurant), and a restaurant on the 2nd floor which features a delicious daily breakfast buffet as well as nightly themed dinner buffets. Housekeeping service is efficient and friendly as are front desk staff and valets. It does say resort so expect the usual resort fee you would get at any other comparable hotel located on prime beach property.
