We enjoyed our stay and would consider staying there again should we be lucky enough to return to Oahu.

Amazing two tower hotel at the zoo end of Waikiki Beach. This was my first stay in this hotel. Fortunately we booked the front tower and also Waikiki Beach view so drinks on the balcony were superb. Good size rooms, great bed and amenities. Quite expensive considering USD. Resort fee $30 per day with many inclusions.

We spent 4 days at the Marriott Waikiki...why? Because I am a lifetime Marriott customer. Should you?...NO. There are so many better options at this price range. This property is OLD, the service is OLD and with an attitude, the prices are HIGH without justification. The pools are postage stamp size for a hotel with almost 1200 rooms. The location is poor. Choose one of the Outrigger hotels at the same price and you will be much happier. I lament the loss of the JW @ Ko Olina.. We will not be Marriott loyal when in Honolulu again.

Selected this hotel due to business travel but my husband accompanied me. I must admit we were pleasantly surprised. This was a wonderful resort and excellent for the price point. The beach is literally right outside the door and numerous stores, shops and restaurants available to address your every need. The staff was helpful and courteous, the grounds tended and well maintained and the furnishings were adequate. It will be at the top of my list should we ever return.

This hotel was in a perfect location. It was walking distance to the zoo and aquarium (so no need to worry about parking). You cross one street and then you were on Waikiki Beach. It was also surrounded by a wide variety of shops and eateries. The hotel staff was super friendly and accomodated us even after we checked out (we left our car and luggage with them as we went on a 7 hr tour of the island). I highly recommend this hotel!

Pool bar overlooks beach ocean view. Short walk to high end shopping and beach front happy hours. One block from Zoo, kids will love it. Great sunsets and nice front desk employees. If you want a real Hawaii experience go to Maui

The physical facility is nice. Older but updated. For a lot of money I had a room facing parking lots but it was an okay room. EXCEPT that I was out all day and came back to an uncleaned room. They told me it was my fault since I was asleep when they came. NOT TRUE, I was out all day. Lazy people. Breakfast buffet is pretty boring for $32.Location is pretty good.

We visited this Resort in March 2016, with a package we purchased with the flight.We initially had purchased a packaged with Ashton but switched the Marriott last minute, they were essentially right next to each other but the Ashton was slightly closer to the beach. Not a big deal. The view from the room was gorgeous with a look at Diamond Head and the ocean. It comes with a cute little patio you can relax on. The room also comes with some drink vouchers (coffee/tea x2 and also some alcoholic beverages you can redeem at the bar by poolside.) They also give you a card for the hotels red box type machine that actually had very current movies. The staff was very nice but the only complaint would be the hotel parking lot, make sure to be coming and going very carefully and slowly or else you will for sure get into an accident.

The hotel is nice with two pools and a hot tub. The room was clean but the bathroom was a little small. Close to the beach, lots of restaurants to choose from, and an assortment of activities to do. The sunsets are beautiful.

The hotel is a block away from the beach which is nice. There is even an area blocked off for people not wanting to deal with the waves. There is a $32 plus ya daily fee for parking which is insane. We attempts to order room service one night and were told they had sold out. I have never heard such a thing. Checking in was a hassle but check out was easy. We chose this hotel because we are going in a NCL cruise and they have a partnership. Pools and gym are nice. Clean facility. Room bathroom was small and had no privacy.

Arriving to a Marriott Hotel is always a pleasure, great service and location, this one is right in front of Waikiki Beach, walking distance to active streets, restaurants and shops. The construction is outdated, renovated lobby but rooms and furniture inside are not. Lots of areas to enjoy, spa, gym, two mid size swimming pools in a third floor terrace with a great view to the Beach and coin laundry, very practical when travelling with large families. We enjoyed this place a lot.

The room was a bit small. It's walking distance from everything. Beach is across the street. It took a little while to check in and check out, but they gave us guest passes or something to come back and freshen up. I enjoyed my stay. and they had the best seafood spaghetti. We ordered room service. It was one of the greatest meal of my life.

The newly renovated lobby looks great and is impressive upon arrival. But the room was very disappointingly outdated. They said renovation to the rooms were underway. I hope so.....The parking garage is a mess. Be VERY careful when going around the corners. It is a two ways street that is meant for one car/one direction. The on-coming traffic will not see you at the corners.The hotel is located in a very convenient area to the beach.They gave two vouchers to Seattle's best. this was a nice perk.I would like to come back if/when renovations to the room are done.

Not recommended. The staff harassed me for sitting in there open air lobby with out a room key. Yes it was midnight but there is always people coming and going out of the hotel and I don't see what the big deal was that my stay had to be interrupted for a ridiculous reason. If you're so concerned about people sitting on your couch maybe you should put up some signs. Be sides that the amenities are subpar and the rooms are generic.

I was a bit disappointed in a few things at the hotel. The pool was smaller and less attractive than I thought it would be. It was functional though! Room walls were a bit thin- could hear others. The water pressure on the18th floor left a bit to be desired. No free coffee in the lobby. There was water. They did give us 1 free coffee card at their coffee bar. (Just 1 not 1 per day). I am platinum premier status and no concierge club which I missed. They did however, give us 1 buffet breakfast per day vs the two I'd normally get in a concierge club for breakfast. The bellman did give us some extra coffee cards which was quite nice. We had a junior suite and the room was adequately appointed. The only thing is that the bathroom (commode room) door does not have a lock. It was a sliding door. I did love the two balconies in the junior suite. It had a mini fridge but no microwave in the room. They did have a hospitality suite that one can shower and clean up if you have a late flight. I was able to get a late checkout as a platinum premier. No water or coffee in the hospitality room. We also stayed at the Ko Olina Beach club and it was my preferred hotel of the two. Had a full kitchen and it had far less traffic. We also visited my niece at the Sheraton Waikiki and I'd prefer that over this since it was directly on the beach. It had an infinity pool and beach access.

We spent 5 days at this Marriott. We enjoyed our stay and liked the location of the hotel. It is located across the street from the beach with no other structure there on the beach to obstruct views or ability to get to the beach. I think all rooms have a balcony and our room had a wonderful view looking down Waikiki beach. Also the location is one of the farthest hotels on Waikiki from the downtown area, so it is easier to walk to quieter spots on the beach or to the zoo and aquarium. A few notes about the rooms. The rooms with two beds are doubles and not queen size. The bathrooms are very small. There are two towers, one closer to the beach and one set back. The front tower has better views (which is where we stayed) There is a resort fee of $30 per day. This included wifi, a fitness class in the morning, DVDs rentals, and a few other things. We enjoyed our stay and would probably come back to this hotel if we came back to Waikiki.

The Marriott Waikiki Resort is always my trusted 'go to' hotel in Waikiki. They have just about everything you need. The entire staff from check in, housekeeping, concierge to restaurant and bar attendants is top of the line. The rooms are clean, the beds are great, and the location is wonderful. Being at the end of the Waikiki strip affords a bit more quiet but yet plenty of tourists and centrally located. Yes, the rooms need some updating, but the resort makes every effort to keep the hotel in top shape. On this trip I ate at Sansei which was great. I also used the spa which was wonderful. The breakfast buffet is great and I always look forward to all the papaya I can eat. It's always sad to leave, but I know I will return back there. Thanks Marriott.

The hotel is spacious and airy. Lots of shops and restaurants. Two towers/ two pools. Just across the street from beautiful Waikiki beach. The amenities were great. Very helpful, friendly staff. Very convenient shuttle/ bus/ taxi pickup area. On site car rental. The location was great.

This place is a city hotel with access to a public beach in the most ridiculously overpriced area of the country. I felt like I was in New York City - not Waikiki Beach. The hotel was outdated and in need of some modernization. The bathrooms are extremely small. The pool/bar area is boring.

Had our best Marriott resort stay here.Before we arrived we checked in with our mobile app the night before. Even though check in is at 4pm, we checked in with the mobile app for 2pm. Upon arrival, which was 12pm, we valeted and checked in very quickly. They had both of our rooms ready for us, even coming in 2 hrs earlier than our moved up check in time. The resort is located on the southern end of Waikiki Beach, so it is far to walk with a baby in stroller and mom with knee issues to Moana Surfrider or Outrigger. We ate at Dukes. We got connecting rooms but it takes a key to open the door to connect them. We did call down to the desk to get the crib they forgot to put in the room, but it arrived very quickly after the phone call. The room looked updated. However, I don't know who did the work, it was done quickly and a bit "shabby". The outlets were not square or even, they were in an angle. And the bathroom had too much, free space. the other bathroom did not have a door to the bathroom. The room was quite quiet. We didn't hear others and they didn't hear our baby cry at night. We did have "partial ocean view" but that was only by opening up the patio and leaning over to see the ocean. Had coffee breakfast at Seattles Best. They did give us free breakfast coupon that we didn't use. Also free coupons for 2 Mai Tais and unlimited DVD rentals. This may or may not have to do with Gold Status. Always had fresh water by the lobby area. Lobby area sitting areas were very comfortable and relaxing. Don't forget to call 10 min ahead for valet. Our car was promptly ready for us each time we left. In and out privileges for $37 a night plus tax and tip.

My husband and I have just returned from a great week at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. After arriving on an early morning flight we were hopeful of getting into our room sooner than later. This was not the case but Richard at reception was extremely helpful and we were greatly appreciative of our spacious King room in the front tower with wonderful ocean views. Level 11 was perfect with a spacious balcony which had a lounger, two chairs and a table.I could not speak too highly of the staff when we had breakfast - especially the beautiful hostess. The buffet breakfast was very good. The location of the hotel is at the opposite end of the beach to the historic Royal Hawaiian but really only a short walk to enjoy sunset drinks at some of the other hotels on the beach. We preferred the beach directly out from the Marriott as it was not so 'touristy'.We loved the location, size of the room and balcony however the pool is small. The hotel is handy to transport, shops and cafes. Complimentary wifi was great.We shall certainly return.

This hotel is very clean and nice the staff is amazing. Very close to the beach and close to DFS and all your shopping needs. Great food on property at Spada or walking distance to a bunch of restaurants.

Having been loyal to the Hilton, it was time to try out some other properties to see how they treat their top tier members. I was really excited to try this property out for our 8 night work/pleasure stay. There are 2 towers to this property. Beware - The Tower closet to Kuhio - The rooms are run down and dire need of a refresh. The Tower directly facing the beach - The rooms were larger and have been refreshed. I had a room in both towers.Check in - No long Queues, no mention of amenities/breakfast as a Gold Member. Was told it was not included unless we purchased the resort fee. Was told our corporate rate doesn't have a resort fee. Ok, fine, but Golds still get benefits in the absence of resort fees. For example - Breakfast. I was ready to surrender, my husband asked to speak to a supervisor/manager. Stephen did confirm that 1 breakfast was included as a gold. That's right, 1 not 2. Ok fine, do we get a coupon or anything to give at breakfast? No, just give them your room number and it will be adjusted on the back end.One big plus - We arrived very early - 12 pm, and we were offered a room right away. This was greatly appreciated. The bad part, back tower, 4th floor. Stephen was able to secure a room a little higher up 10th floor. We were also put on a list and offered to move to a better room in the front tower in 2 nights.10th Floor Room - Back Tower King Room - Small, old, dated furniture, small vanity with limited storage to put any toiletries because the modern (sarcastic) coffee making facilities on a try, took up more than a quarter of the counter space. I really can't find a lot of positives to say other than it was clean. My husband immediately asked for more hangers and some bath robes. We were told they should be in our room after dinner. Needless to say, over 24 hours later, nothing. When leaving for work in the am, our room was the only one that appeared to have no newspaper. Breakfast - In temporary ballroom location while main restaurant gets renovated. Very satisfactory with a wide variety of offerings including an omelette/egg station. The service staff are wonderful. I asked for the check, the waitress asked if I had a coupon. I said no, it is included, I was told just to sign for it and it would be adjusted on the back end. She said that I should have got a coupon. Down to the front desk I went to make sure to get this settled as the breakfast here is not cheap - I believe $28.00. I spoke to the agent about my breakfast concern and re-stating what Stephen had told me the day prior only for her to tell me, I don't get breakfast. This was just exhausting to say the least. How can there be this much inconsistency with staff as to what's included for a Gold vs. Resort Fees. After looking on her computer, she said, - Yes I see you do get breakfast and if that's what Stephen told you to do, keep doing. Needless to say, the night before check out, my husband went to review the bill downstairs, and breakfast was charged every day! Stephen was actually on duty and settled it, but this is not acceptable.Front tower - King Room - Two nights into the stay, we moved to the front tower. What a difference. The room was big, modern, and the view was probably the best I've seen from a hotel in Waikiki. It was well worth the move. The balconies are also larger and have a full lounger.Pools/Gym - I have no complaints, yes the pool are a little small given the # of rooms the property has, but the facilities are far superior to the Hilton and Hyatt.The Gym is probably one of the best I've seen in a while.WiFi - Superior to other properties, doesn't require daily/frequent log in's like other properties.Big Plus is having ABC store right on the property. Also pay attention to your poolside bar bill. Sitting at the bar - My husband was charged for a large draft beer and clearly had a small one - His cup was still full when he brought it to a servers attention. This could be a one off, but perception is everything - The bar tenders reaction made me feel like this happens a lot.I'm on the fence if I would stay here again. I get that this is a "Resort" but these resort fees really dilute the benefits of top tier member should get. Staff need to be on the same page.

This hotel is so well located, although a slight frosty reception from the front desk everything else was great. This is a very tall building with balconies so if you suffer from vertigo you better request a lower floor. Waikiki beach does get exceptionally busy so head down early morning to bag a great spot. Although some parts are quite commercial with chain restaurants, you'll find done great places to eat in the neighbouring hotels. I really loved the fast pace of this city, not what I expected at all.

Just took a chance on this hotel.....and could not have been happier. Wonderful room. Incredible view!!! Just across the street from a beautiful beach. Walking distance to a great shopping district with some inscrible high end shops. Great eateries close by too!

Staycation earned us a Hawaii resident hotel rate,and great coffee. Marriott gold status earned us a few free buffet breakfasts. Hot tub, and pool are convenient and workout room is close by as well. Exercise classes held for free, which is nice to see. Also, our upgrade to major Diamond Head View was greatly appreciated. In addition, paper outside your door every day, including Sundays, is a nice touch, and means more than you may think. The Kaila Spa offered wonderful massages. We recommend it highly for sports massage to deep tissue work. Professional and located on hotel property.

This is the worst Marriott I have ever been to. I am a Marriott Gold member and was incredibly disappointed in this hotel. I stay in Marriotts frequently and can honestly say that this is the first time I have ever been this disappointed in a hotel carrying the Marriott brand. The only reason I rated this hotel "poor" instead of "terrible" is because of the location but the hotel leaves much to be desired. First, the hotel does NOT have a concierge floor. Instead they offer you ONE breakfast buffet per room per day. If your traveling companion is hungry in the morning they can pay $28.95 plus tax and tip for a $10 buffet with poor service. Service at the restaurant overlooking the beach is deplorable. It took us an hour and 40 minutes, yes 100 minutes to eat lunch there. It is a good thing we did not have anywhere else to be.The walls in the hotel are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING in the rooms on either side. And the hotel only has ice machines on even floors so if you want ice and are on an odd numbered floor you need to take the very slow elevator to the ice machines. After this Marriott stay I am seriously thinking about switching to Westin as my preferred hotel brand. I will split my travel between Marriott and Westin for the remainder of the year in order to see how Westin Elite benefits compare.

Stayed here two nights before leaving on cruise with NCL. Clean rooms. Great staff very accommodating. Would stay again. The pick up area for tours etc was a big bonus easy for first timers to get to the right place on time. Also a short walk from the beach.

I'll admit, this hotel is in a pretty decent location, however, this hotel is far from a "resort."First off, the front desk staff is the most unfriendly welcoming individuals I've ever seen working a hotel. Upon checking in, the girl that assisted us looked as if they twisted her arm and forced her to work the front desk...far from welcoming. Second, a day before checking out, I went down to the front desk to see if I could get a portion of my bill slit since a couple of day of my vacation were actually work days (something I was told could be done prior to arriving), and the girl working this time, had the same attitude and told me that could not be done. I then asked to speak with a supervisor and a guy named "Stephen" came out who came out raising his voice without even trying to hear what my concern was. That whole front desk crew needs to be taught some serious customer service skills!!!!The hotel was nothing more than a basic hotel that you would stay in within your local city. It didn't even look as if we were in Hawaii until we walked outside the hotel. The rooms are dingy looking, and if you're staying here for multiple days...you'll have to call housekeeping to request your sheets be changed. I didn't think I would have to do such staying in a "resort." The only thing nice about this hotel is probably their lobby.Lastly, parking here is about $32 a night...and you may not even find a parking space if you come back to the hotel late enough.Word to the wise, DO NOT EVEN BOTHER STAYING AT THIS HOTEL...EVEN IF IT'S THE CHEAPEST HOTEL IN WAIKIKI!!!!!

This is very nice. The location is spectacular, on other side of great beach, near restaurants, near aquarium, near zoo, near mall. The restaurant always has music.The swimming pool is leisurely convenient to bar and food. Diamondhead is near here too. Makes for easy pickup to and from locations.

We were given a large family room so our family of 5 could be all together... When we walked in my son found a very nice gift wrapped up for him to open! That was such a special touch! We enjoyed the hotel accommodations, location and staff. We were bothered by one of the sale men in the breezeway to the Ocean (the make up store) who assumed we had lots of $$$$ since we were staying at the Marriott, but that store is not affiliated with the Marriott, and he was the exception. Thank you Marriott for memorable family accommodations!

My wife and I stayed on points. We paid for the upgrade and it was so worth it! 11th floor with great views of Waikiki. The lagoon below is quiet and great for couples or families. Be sure to visit Tiki's next door and Lulu's. Very good drinks and pupus. The pool bar is just ok at the hotel. Food is typical Marriott fare and drinks were mediocre. Smoothies are something to pass on. But we loved the location of the hotel, the views, and the size of the room!

Just spent 6 days at this resort, I was a little nervous due to some of the negative comments. However I have nothing bad to say at all from the moment we stepped into the hotel to the time we left we were always greeted in a friendly way and made to feel welcome by all staff. Room was fantastic thank you for that. We are in Maui now for a few days but coming back to stay at the resort on 19th June for few more daysThank u Marriott
user_name:
Walesunknown
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: We called in here for a quick drink around their pool bar before going for a meal. We were greeted by a young girl with possibly the shortest shorts you could imagine and a neck full of love bites. Talk about feisty. Not sure what the problem was but our party of 8 adults and one baby certainly wasn't helping. After her scowling we eventually got our $10 drinks in plastic glasses although sitting just 2 metre's from the bar and possibly 20 Mtrs from the pool. "Rules are rules" she said. If this is how guests are treated I am glad we were staying elsewhere.

What a wonderful stay in Honolulu!Taylor checked me in and set the tone for a great stay, she was very pleasant and a great asset to the Marriott. My room was spectacular, with a killer view. I'm looking forward to my next stay at the Marriott.The rainbow was a an extra bonus available to everyone:)

Our room was on the 33rd floor so we had a great view of diamond head and the beach. The staff there was very polite and helpful. I really loved the staff down at the breakfast and dinner buffets. The breakfast chef recommendation was really awesome. Not only with the breakfast items but also with shopping tips. The coconut syrup is the best. The servers also made great suggestion on what to do on our stay. Very professional.

Took a group of 200 high school students on a week long trip. The staff were great and very accommodating for such a large group. The hotel also has some shops, including a convenience store (ABC store), inside that makes it easy to keep and entertain 200 students in the hotel late at night.2 awesome pools and direct access to the beach.Wonderful balcony views, nice to relax on the balcony with the cool Hawaiian breeze.Free wifi.

Clean, lovely rooms (though the bathroom was a bit cramped). The ocean view upgrade was worth the money; we also had a view of Diamond Head, albeit blocked by a building.The staff were very efficient and pleasant. The concierge, Kylie, was awesome--she arranged our activities on Oahu and also pulled off some hard-to-get reservations on Kauai.The only restaurant we tried was the pool bar. Good drinks and food (try the fish tacos!).We got some noise from the street and the restaurant next door in our room, but that's Waikiki for you: always bustling.

We usually stayed ( 3 times) here if we like to relax for a weekend. We like it here because good facilities and their rooms are so spacious. Pool is heated so nice to have an early morning and night swimming. They also have happy hr in the resto and all their foods are bomb the only draw back is the beach Infront of the hotel is too crowded other than that everything here is very good. Will always choose Marriott for our staycation

My family and I enjoyed our short trip in this city and was very happy that we'd chosen the right hotel-resort. I couldn't believe how beautiful it was. The location was great as the beach just stone away. We're sad that we'd to leave and wished we could extended it. In our first day of arrival,we went to their outdoor restaurant bar overlooking the Waikiki Beach. After that, we went for a swim to the beach. They've different restaurants within the hotel-resort, Kuhio Beach Grill (diff theme buffet - breakfast & dinner). The staff as welcoming, friendly, and helpful.
user_name:
reallylikes2travel
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hotel room was clean. There is a refrigerator in the room. There is an ABC convenience store in the lobby. This is great so you don't have to lug gallons of water down the street. You do get free internet and movie rentals. You also get free cup of coffee at the coffee shop in the lobby per day. You get one free Mai Tai.This was my first visit to Waikiki. I went alone without a plan. I did not find the check-in person to be helpful. I booked an oceanfront view room. I did not get what I was expecting. I booked this on Priceline, but looked on all the sites. I paid too much for this room and location and view.I was in the building furthest from the ocean. There are two buildings. I booked this thinking I would be in the building closest to the beach. You see the view from my balcony. You do get to see the ocean, but you would have gotten a similar view with partial ocean view. Don't pay the extra on line. Wait til you get there to see where the room is. I did not hear the ocean until I got to the beach. Waikiki is a city. All you hear is the city...not quiet and relaxing from the hotel room.The temperature there was not hot when I went. I could not turn on the heat and there are no blankets. Bring fleece bottoms and long sleeve shirt if you are cold easily. Otherwise it was very comfortable. There is a very convenient spot for pick up and drop off for any tour you chose to go on. All hotels have this. Since this hotel is located at the end of the beach, you will be the last pick up/drop off.Hotel was full of retirees or young families. So the lobby was relatively quiet. There are people, but not rowdy.You can walk to a lot of eating places or take the city bus or trolley. There is a subway and burger king and McDonald's right near this hotel. Subway was $10. If you go to the subway in king's village a couple blocks over, it is $9.The hotel has restaurants, but you may have to make reservations. I went to the steakhouse around 5 on a quiet day...they would not let me in. There are two pools. You get towels since it is a resort. The beach is a block away. The beach was not crowded on memorial day weekend. Locals do come to picnic at the park nearby. The zoo and diamond head is around the corner.The room and my stay were pleasant. I was hoping to have staff take care of me, tell me about sights and surroundings. I did not get that. They have a concierge service, but not always available. I booked all of my tours on line myself. I did not feel like I stayed at a resort even though I paid a resort fee. I felt like I stayed at a hotel. I was disappointed for that reason. I would rate the resort experience as a 1. The only reason why I give this a positive rating is because it was a clean quiet place close to the beach. If you have your expectations set for that, then this was a nice place to stay.

I've visited Oahu 6 times in the last 10 or so years and have never stayed in the Waikiki area so I thought I should do something different. I decided to stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa for a week at the end of May and I am very glad I chose this hotel. The property is located on the eastern edge of Waikiki beach right on the main strip (Kalakaua Ave). It is only a 5-10 minute walk West to get to the heart of Waikiki. Because of the location, I feel that it is a little quieter at night because it is slightly away from all the action (which I prefer). The Honolulu Zoo is minutes away from the property and walking to the Rainbow Drive-In or Leonard's Bakery is very doable. I was able to walk to Rainbow Drive-In in less than 10 minutes and Leonard's in about 20 minutes (I was doing some window shopping at the same time)The Waikiki Beach Marriott also has 2 Seattles Best Coffee stands within the property and an ABC store for your snacks, drinks and last minute souvenirs. The Honolulu Cookie Company is only steps away from the property as well as other shopping. I was lucky enough to have gotten a room on the 23rd floor and the room had an awesome view (westward) of Waikiki Beach. I often turned off the AC and had the balcony doors wide open to get that nice sea breeze and be able to hear the surf. Although this hotel is not directly on the beach, it is only a quick street crossing away. The beach directly in front of the hotel has man made breakers that help calm the ocean waters to make it great for swimming. I highly recommend this hotel.

During our vacation, my wife and I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. We enjoyed a fabulous lunch overlooking the beach nearby. Attractions like restaurants, stores, even a laundromat, all within walking distance. We did not need to rent a car during this stay. Access to the beach was easy.

The venerable Marriott Waikiki Beach Resort sits near the east end of Waikiki. From our balcony in room 2204, our view of the sweep of beautiful Waikiki beach, and a Pacific Ocean that seemed to go on forever, was simply breathtaking. Our huge, well-appointed room with king-size bed was lovely, though lacking somewhat in regard to the bathroom size and layout. From check-in to check-out, the people providing services were wonderfully nice and quite cheerful. Everything we needed was provided promptly and with a smile. The buffet breakfasts offered were a big plus, being both of wide variety and high quality. The pools were lovely, and there was a nice pool-side bar.This remodeled and expanded vintage hotel is stately, with fine internal shopping, spa and health units, two pools and multiple dining facilities. Some renovation was in progress during our stay in late May/ early June 2016, so changes are in store. One negative was the absence of facilities in the large lobby, particularly a place to eat or a bar. Another was one instance of a stand-in concierge who was only moderately competent. These are only minor things and, as a whole, this hotel is a fine place to stay, and priced in line with other nearby establishments.

When I say location... I am not speaking of the location of the hotel itself, but rather the location WITHIN the hotel. I booked a partial ocean view, which I assumed was a nice view that I could look out and see the ocean partially from the balcony. Being assigned room 605 (a lower floor), my view out of one window was a beautiful parking lot at eye level (I am being sarcastic) and the view of a green roof of a church out of the balcony window. If I propped myself in the corner of the balcony, I could see a bit of the ocean. After making a major complaint, in the late afternoon I was transferred to a higher floor room which had a much better partial ocean view. I also recommend that you request the FRONT towers which are literally a block closer to the ocean than the towers on Kuhio. The hotel itself is nice, but it was not pleasant to have to deal with this issue.

This hotel is comprised of several towers, 6 venues at which you are able to buy food & beverages and several lovely pools. The lobby is nice, large and airy. There is a spa,as well as several small retail & convenience food stores. Also there is quite a large workout area. It is a short walk to the ocean beach, which is just across the street. The beach can become crowded, but it extends quite a long way. Incidentally the water is oh so nice. You are able to view the ocean from your hotel window. The rooms are very clean, and the beds are soft and cushy. The staff is very friendly and eager to please. I was with a tour group. We had a buffet breakfast which was varied with an excellent choice of tasty items. You do have wi-fi available. There are many attractions in the area,such as Pearl Harbor and the Polynesian Cultural Center. Gray Line offers tours of the city attractions too. I have been to a few Marriott Hotels, and this one is top of the line.

Checked in for an unexpected extra night stay here in Waikiki. However, as expected of the brand, my room is very well appointed, spacious, and very comfortable. The in room coffee supplies and toiletries are top drawer, too. Also as expected, no free wifi. Select a room on as high a floor as is available for a good ocean view - the beach is down the block.

Check in process had a few hiccups, but upon the manager ( Stephen Chin) stepping in, all was well... Thanks Mr Chin! Beautiful Resort. Marriott's always deliver in quality, service, value, and location. Used points to stay so it made it easier to spend the high prices the Waikiki merchants charge. Be prepared to spend money in Waikiki! King size room with Diamond Head and Ocean View was very comfortable. As Premium members we were place on a high floor. Good view, and it seemed to be more quiet. Used the excersize facility a couple times. Well equipped, with plenty towels. I would definitely go back to this hotel

The location is great, the rooms are nicely appointed and we had a wonderful view of Waikiki beach and Diamondhead from our room and balcony. Everyone was very helpful during our stay. We would stay here again if we traveled back to Honolulu.

I wanted to give this resort 4 or 5 stars, but the photos led me to believe that the resort was actually on the beach instead of across the road from the beach - it makes a difference. Other than that, the rooms were nice for an older hotel; and the staff were very knowledgable.

This was a great spot near the beach. Just have to walk across the street but its very close to the water. Nice bar at the pools and friendly staff. Food was good too! Would stay again. The rooms are a little old but most everything in the area is so that wasn't that big of a deal. This was a great spot for our first couple days in the area. Parking can be tricky. If you stay out late you probably have to use the valet parking. Parking spots go fast.

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa. The lobby is big, bright, and airy, and has a second "tour lobby" where tour buses pick up and drop off all day. Check-in was a breeze, and the staff were welcoming. The room itself was incredibly spacious and bright, with a balcony overlooking Waikiki Beach. The hotel has a few restaurant options, including family friendly poolside dining (also overlooking the beach) and a nicer restaurant on the same level. Breakfast, often a cramped and overlooked affair in hotels, was served in a ballroom and had a variety of US mainland standard dishes (eggs, potatoes, waffles) as well as item influenced by Hawaii (coconut syrup!) and the east (salmon, rice). It was a great way to start the day. The hotel also has an ABC store with everything from snacks to sundresses, and also has other clothing and jewelry stores, coffee shops, and restaurants just outside the lobby. The hotel's location is in Waikiki, so it's busy and near other restaurants, bars, and shopping, but it's also within walking distance of Diamondhead Crater Park and it's an easy drive (or tour bus ride) to Pearl Harbor and other scenic destinations (North Shore, waterfalls, etc). It's across the street from a great swimming, protected swimming spot, with surfing and paddle boarding just outside the jetty/sea wall. The only reason I didn't give the hotel a five was that there are fairly high fees, including a $30/night resort fee, for which you receive coupons for some free coffee, video rentals, and two free drinks, and also a hefty valet parking fee. There is an enterprise on site, so, depending on how much driving you plan to do, it might be cheaper to rent a car at the hotel than to rent one at the airport and then pay to park at the hotel.
user_name:
AngelasTravelTips
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Waikiki Marriott very much! Awesome location, Awesome Room, Awesome Ocean View! Very comfortable bed. Very friendly and helpful staff, especially Lorelie Rodriguez and Macy at the Front Desk. They recognized my Gold status with Marriott and went out of their way to get me a very nice Ocean view room. Each day Lorelie and Macy greeted me and asked if there was anything that they could do to make my stay more special...... Great Staff! I look forward to returning to the Waikiki Marriott in July.

This hotel is underrated in many ways. Since 2007 I have stayed at the property. I have seen the improvement and renovations over the years and enjoyed the great location and service. The team has always tried to accommodate me during my visits. The secret is the rear tower which is both unique and quite since the resort attracts families and tourist. It is actually 37 stores tall in height and has 33 floors due to the larger first 3 floors. The views are amazing and the rooms are excellent. The hotel is completely revamping the property and I have liked everything they have completed so far. The location is great!

Great service. Clean hotel. Very near the beach. Good room selection. Near lots of restaurants. Would go back for sure. Dealt with a couple of different managers,,and they were both very accommodating.

Stayed here one night before joining a cruise. The open lobby area is beautiful and spacious. A nice place to wait for your room or tour bus, with shops that have about anything you'd need and restaurants. We had a very good lunch at the outdoor restaurant near the pool. The room was on a corner with streets on both sides but was pretty quiet. Nice outdoor balcony with a sliver view of the beach. We enjoyed being able to walk a block and being on Waikiki beach and having plenty of restaurants to choose from - some unique, most chains. To be expected in a tourist area. For people who like to walk, it's not all that far to have a drink at the Royal Hawaiian Hotel. Only thing we ran into was we were 3 women and we'd asked for 2 beds and a sofa bed. Arriving at the room there were only 2 double beds. But after contacting the front desk and being told that was the only configuration they could provide, they were quick to have a rollaway bed delivered to the room. Made things a bit tight, but it worked.

This hotel is perfect! We were upgraded to a large room with a balcony that provided views of Diamond Head and beautiful Waikiki Beach. Perfect location to walk to shops and restaurants. Rented a car on site for one day to drive to the Dole Plantatiom and the North Shore. There are two pools, one with a nice lounge that has views of the beach. Very clean and well maintained hotel. Our flight home was at 8:30 pm and this hotel provides a late checkout for an additional $99 - well worth it to have an extra day! Only minor complaint - there is a $30 a day resort charge that includes a mediocre breakfast for 1. Other than that, I would definitely stay here again.

After being stranded by Hawaiian Airlines on our connecting flight to Sydney we needed a place to stay fast. Waikiki Marriott got us a great room at a fair rate and a taxi cab later we were at the pool. Had a great dinner at Sansei (Japanese restaurant on property) with friends and thoroughly enjoyed a night in Waikiki. Staff was very helpful, great location.#hawaiianairlines#hawaiianairtlinestosydney

We had reservations for a king guest room with an ocean view and balcony in the Paoakalani Tower. However, we were upgraded to a king junior suite with an ocean view that had two balconies. The hotel is in a great location. It is an older hotel but it is clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Since the hotel is right across the street from the beach and it has great walkability. The zoo is in walking distance from the hotel. There are also restaurants and shops located in the hotel. There is a great little dress shop near the Paoakalani Tower with locally made dresses according the staff. the staff there was very friendly. They have some cute dresses.

This is our 5th trip to Oahu and as Marriott rewards members, we have always stayed at this resort. We booked our room on the phone and the agent did not tell us that our room was not available through points. Imagine our surprise when we thought our 10 days was going to be covered by points and we had to pay $150 per night extra on top of using our points. Check in was easy and the room was as expected. They made some cut backs as we only received a breakfast coupon for 1 person per day and 1 Mai Tai drink per person per day. We previously had gotten 2, which was nice as there were 2 people in the room. The breakfast buffet food is terrible, juices are warm and food is bland. We had lunch at the pool and the service was slow and food once again just bland. This resort is on the end where most of the homeless hang out and you feel like your in the redneck capital. We were celebrating our anniversary and what a huge letdown in the resort. We will not stay here again. The other end of waikiki strip has much better resorts and shopping/restaurants.

We arrived at the Marriot for our honeymoon and the staff was very friendly, even sent us a bottle of champagne, which was very tasty. The restaurants in the hotel were very good, but very expensive. The walls are paper thin, and the night life will keep you up at night. If you want to be in downtown Waikiki then this is the place to be at. Get out of Waikiki and explore the island, you will not regret it. Go to seven brothers restaurant, it's the best food we have had on the island.

When I checked in, I was pleasantly greeted & accommodated by a agent in the lobby named Macy. She had a great smile, professional tone and very informative. I appreciated her energy and aloha spirit. I checked into my room which I was told was upgraded from a partial view to a full ocean view. This was sadly not the case. The room was smaller than I expected but it still was comfortable enough for my sister and I. A few things to mention are 1. The coffee maker is outdated, Mariott needs to get Kruiegs instead of the 1980 coffee makers they are using ( see image) 2. The toilet seat was wobbled and extremely stained ( see image) I would like to go into detail about the issues I have with this but I just ate dinner and so I'm going to leave it at, the seat is stained and has the indentation of plastic that has been burned by a very hot instrument. Don't ask how or why because I have no clue. Please Mariott replace the toilet seats! 3. The furniture is too large and clunky for the small space Mariott provides as a room, does anyone truly use the desk!? Or the multiple chairs? Or the large clunky tv stand! C' mon Mariott it's 2016! If you want to provide small rooms, get rid of the large furniture! Okay so back to customer service, my key stopped working for the room! And I was annoyed but not noticeably annoyed, I kept it together and went to the front desk to tell the older lady working there that I needed some assistance, her attitude was like someone's grandmother who told you not to run with scissors in your hand " well if YOU are putting the key next to YOUR credit cards or YOUR phone, THAN it will get demagnetized!!!!!" Okay first of all if I needed a lecture I could call my mother, my sister, I'm sure I have an aunt or two, lady! I just want to get into my room, can you make the key work! Please! Ok so after the lecture from her I got into my room and I was pretty happy that I wouldn't have to deal with her ever again... Except for I did have to, one more time because I needed to know where the gym was in the hotel! And again... As if asking her where the gym was, was costing her 100000 dollars, she painfully answered " like the map we gave you when you checked in... Said! It's on the 3rd floor" ok well sorry for not studying the map as soon as it was handed to me, I put all the papers and crap down and never looked at it again! Bloody hell! Can you please stop treating me as if I am bothering you!!!!

This hotel is great, perfect location, perfect service. The staff are very friendly. They are on call to assist with any issues you need resolving (Which I had none) Waikiki beach is literally across the road and BAM! you're on the beach. The are convenient ABC stores...well every where but one just on the corner, a Starbucks on the opposite and plenty of great places to eat with in a 5-10 minute walk.The hotel tell provides a great service, wifi, housekeeping ect how ever you pay through the nose for the service and view from your rooms. The hotel has a gym I could access everyday which was great. Reception provided me with coupons for free beverages at the pool bar every day.Will defiantly go back next time I visit Hawaii

We are obviously Marriott fans as we are platinum members of their rewards program. We have stayed in everything from Fairfield's on up. We weren't thrilled with this. We didn't receive a particularly warm welcome at the front desk. The room was ok, but nothing special. We are supposed to receive an automatic upgrade, but I don't know what they upgraded us from. I wouldn't have wanted to stay there. Because this was supposedly a "resort property" we didn't receive breakfasts every day. They can call it whatever they wish, but it is a large commercial hotel and that was the vibe. They charged a 30 dollar resort fee daily which included a coffee coupon which was only good one day. The food at the breakfast buffet was pretty good but when my wife asked to order a mimosa she was told that they didn't serve drinks. We are so used to Marriott super service that almost anywhere else, they would have gone downstairs and gotten one.The place was comparably priced to nearby hotels, but just about all of them were rated higher on trip advisor than this one.

So, a nice place to stay as a single person or family. The over all complex sports 2 pools, gym, spa, 3 restaurant, 2coffee shops...etc. Shopping is available here in the hotel. This hotel is comparable to hotels in Vegas. Staff is more than pleasant. Hotel has a very relaxed feel to it. It is right across from the beach. I had a suite that had an ocean view. Everything is walking distance. Next trip to Hawaii I would defiantly stay here again. Only draw back was parking $32.00 a night. But just know that there is plenty of public transportation and most all food,shopping and beach is walking distance.

One of the very best hotels I have ever stayed in. The service that they give comes from the heart. They recognize everything by always sending us a nice card. They give exceptional service and all the employees are very genuine. Thank you Marriott Waikiki for the best family vacation. The view from our room was outstanding

As conference coordinator for approximately 250 attendee conference, the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa was an outstanding venue and provided exceptional service. Most attendees availed of the contracted rate for the conference and were highly satisfied and commented about how wonderful the staff was and went out of their way to accommodate special requests. Rooms were well appointed and housekeeping was prompt. The ocean view rooms had gorgeous views. The Events and Banquet management teams and their staff were very professional and easy to work with.

The Marriott is located across the road from the beach in a good location just a 5 minute walk into the heart of Waikiki. We were staying a few doors down but managed to dine at the Marriott numerous times as we really loved the restaurants. The D.K. Steakhouse is fabulous, a true American steakhouse with indoor & outdoor seating, so book for the alfresco dining. The service was outstanding & staff a credit to this establishment . The Sansei Seafood Restaurant & Sushi Bar is very popular so be prepared to queue up. We also enjoyed having drinks on the Moana Terrace watching the sunset.

I took my 2 kids for a first-weekend-of-summer staycation last week.Valet was quick and painless. Cost 37 bucks per day. Pretty standard for alot of downtown hotels I've stayed at.Check in was fairly quick as well, I qualified for the locals discount and they also upgraded me to the 23rd floor which had a very nice view.The room itself was fairly standard. Got the 2 queen beds which were very clean and comfortable. Had a small refrigerator to hold drinks and food. They give you a card to get free blu-ray and dvd's from kiosks on the 3rd floor. They have 2 pools. Both were pretty small, but considering we were 5 seconds from world famous Waikiki beach I guess it's understandable. Nice perk was complementary ice and water stations so you didn't have to buy water.We ate at the Moana terrace. Happy hour from 4 to 6. A burger was 18 bucks just to give you an idea of the prices. Luckily, there are a ton of restaurants within a few blocks and there's a burger king right across the street.There is a fireworks display at 7:45 every Friday, you can watch it from the beach across the street or if you upgrade to the rooms with that view.Overall, the hotel was nice and clean, nothing really bad. The location was the best thing about this hotel, right across from the beach, close to tons of places to eat, in the heart of Waikiki.

Nice looking property. Located right across the beach. excellent view from my room. Excellent room. Restaurant on second floor has a great sunsets. Sit outside to view the beach and take some pictures. This hotel set up the mood for our Cruise around Hawaii. Staff was very friendly.

We arrived tired and hungry (after a 10 hour flight plus getting through customs and the time to be driven from Honolulu airport) at around 12n. We were able to leave our bags at the motel however we were not able to check into our rooms until 3:30pm. It would be nice if the management identified travellers coming a long way and make their rooms available at the expected arrival time. Our rooms were nice with lovely view of the ocean and Diamond Head. The pillows were too soft and tea drinkers not catered for. The motel is well located within walking distance of everything. Waikiki Beach is fantastic. Snorkelling right off the beach both in the ocean and the rock pool shear delight.

My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in May 2016. The hotel was standard Marriott quality (nice and clean, professional staff), and the huge, open, island-feeling lobby was a great welcome. The location was perfect. Across the street from the beach (which is as close as you can get), near a lot of restaurants, shopping, and the bus to Diamond Head. It's down the road from the high-end shopping, which turned out to be a huge plus. While still easily walkable should you want to shop, being a little removed meant fewer tourists making it impossible to get anywhere. 2 pools which were both pretty quiet, a delicious (and expansive) breakfast buffet (that opens at 5 a.m., presumably to accommodate those of us stuck on Eastern Time/who want to hit the beach early), and a nice gym. They also had a lobby entrance specifically for tour groups, and the Marriott seemed to be a pickup on a lot of routes - really convenient! Great views from the hotel rooms and one of the hotel pools/pool bar. Live music at the pool bar most nights for happy hour.
user_name:
erhammar
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed 3 nights prior embarking on the Pride of America Cruise.Clean, comfortable bed, stylish room with amazing oceanview from balcony. Go for a drink on the roof top bar overlooking Waikiki beach, relax in the pool or take a dip in the ocean just across the street. This hotel is located at the end of Waikiki beach which was nice because the beach wasn't packed with people like further down the beach. There is also a break wall so there is very little undertow for swimming and perfect to try out paddle boarding.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Person doing room was exceptional. Ocean view from the high floors gives a partial city view and a look back at the mountains. If the hotel was away from the crowds, I would give it another star.

On our way to Auckland, New Zealand, from San Diego, California, we stopped in Honolulu for one night. We booked this hotel because we had Marriott reward points to use, and it looked like a nice hotel. Check-in was speedy and friendly, and not only was our room free, but we were upgraded to a beautiful high floor, corner room, with a spectacular view of Diamond Head and the ocean. What a great beginning to a wonderful vacation! I wish we could have stayed a little longer!  Our king room was very clean and spacious, and as usual, the Marriott bed was very comfortable. We had dinner at their Japanese restaurant, Sansei Seafood Restaurant and Sushi Bar, and it was excellent. The food was delicious. The drinks, wine, and service were superb. And, the ambience was perfect. I can’t think of anything negative to say about our entire experience at this hotel. If we are ever in Honolulu again (we usually go to Maui) we will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

We stayed here as a pre-night booking for a cruise that was leaving the next day. It was very nice. Has large pool facilities, a nice breakfast buffet and pool bar/restaurant. It is a bit spread out though.

Its location is right across from the Waikiki Beach... I and my kids just crossed over the street to reach at the fine beach easily. Also, we were able to see the best view of the ocean and the beach, so it was just awesome to have good experience.

Great staff . Good food .excellant views from room if you pay just a few dollars more.( worth it.)Close to all honolulu's sights and transport, Pool bar good for light meals and live entertainment, try the local beer on tap.

When I booked this is knew there would be a daily resort fee of $32 I wasn't happy about it but booked it anyway. I went to reserve a car only to find out if would have to pay $30 to park there is was livid. First I have to pay a resort fee and pay to park my car so basically it's an additional almost $65 a day. That is ridiculous. So I already had a bad attitude about staying there. When I checked in the gentleman went over with me what the resort fees are for. Yes it's nice you get 2 drinks, coffee and get to rent movies. But I think parking should have been included. I felt much better when we walked into our room. It was a stunning overview room. Every was beautiful and clean. They have a few pools and a spacious hottub. The gym was nicely equipped. When you check out they can hold your bags. And have a room u can watch TV and get showed. I would stay here again. However please do something about the parking.

My husband and I celebrated out nineteenth wedding anniversary here and it was amazing. Location, views, staff, cleanliness, everything!! I highly recommend this location to anyone wanting to stay near the beach, shopping, and nightlife!!

Lots of amenities, across street from beach, delicious breakfast buffet, clean rooms, good restaurants, beautiful pool areas with bar service right at your seat, great ocean views and views of Diamondhead

nicely located just minutes from the beach and right in the heart of shopping and night life. friendly front desk and nice accommodations - quiet and comfortable. there is a nice pool and plenty of coffee bars in easy distance. all the high-end shops are about a block away.

The hotel was perfectly located along the waikiki beachfront. As an elite member, I didn't expect that I could get some real business benefit for this resort stay. But surprisingly, the receptionist offered a packet with breakfast, credit for food and beverage, and SBC coupon, which turned this hotel out to be smart choice from my experience.The pool was quite nice, and my son loves that. Our ocean-view room was OK, but unfortunately in the opposite of the open bar of the other hotel next door, which was very loud. There is only 10 mins drive to diamond head mountain, and walking distance to the main shopping and dinning area.

My wife and I spent two nights here in April before boarding the Pride of America. Check-in was quick and uneventful. Staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Room was very, very nice! Fresh bed linens and towels! Great view!

Wendy at reception was extremely helpful after a long flight. Organised an early room for us and complimentary bottle of wine. The room was clean & very roomy. Great location. Short walk to shops and restaurants. Beds were really comfortable. Would definately come back for another stay.

My spouse & I stayed at the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort for only one night. We flew in from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada to take in a little fun in the Sun! The hotel staff was very friendly & helpful supplying information regarding local restaurants, attractions and cruise ship details. The room was very nice & clean, the downstairs common area was fantastic to have a drink and relax after our long flight. The common area is an open court yard, with a walk up bar, very nice ambionce. If you are flying into Honolulu to take the Pride of America cruise around the Hawaiian islands this is the place to stay! The Pride of America cruise line has an office in the common area of the hotel with a free shuttle service to the cruise ship. Enjoy!

Advertised city view but also enjoyed ocean view at Waikiki Beach...........Hotel onlyshort walk from the beach.......Also, close to Tiki's Grill and Bar......Great bar foodand drinks........................Got to watch college beach volleyball later in the day; however not from hotel.

This is the business hotel where all the people in my industry stay while visiting the island. It is a good Marriott but has seen its time, my favorite part is the third floor bar by the pool facing the ocean. The bar looks over the Pacific and you can watch the sunset after a day of work. The restaurants for breakfast are OK and I've eaten at the other restaurants a couple of times, my favorite is the Italian restaurant on the lobby level. Friendly service clean rooms great location it makes Waikiki easy.

My wife and I were there for 10 days, The staff was TOP shelf - all very polite and very helpful - very Hawaiian willing and offering to help at every turn, from the bell hops, to the shipping department, to the valet, and the front desk staff, and housekeeping, all a pleasure to have stayed with.The rooms are a little dated as is the caret, but not terribly, just not newly updated. The most uncomfortable thing was the partial ocean view balcony. We stayed on the 11th floor, and unfortunately there is a weird sound chamber that bounces off the hotel across the street making sitting on the balcony VERY loud. It was a constant cacophony of whining bus engines, trucks backing up, garbage trucks collecting dumpsters, tour trollies ringing their bells to let the riders know they were pulling up, and just a litany of street noises that probably wouldn't be noticeable at that height if the sounds weren't bouncing off the adjacent hotel. The location is great - right across the street from the beach and in the middle of the Waikiki strip. There is plenty of shopping in the hotel and the prices are very reasonable. Unless you have some kind of package deal for meals, you probably won't eat in the hotel much. Both breakfast and dinner are buffet only and priced on the high side. If you're an "all you can eat" kind of person, that likes the gravy and sauce laden dinners on the buffet line, then it might be a good deal for you. Personally, my wife and I were too eager to try as many local places as possible.The hotel is on the south side of the Island, and its only an hour to drive to the complete opposite side (north side) of eth island which was where we went to visit the botanical garden. Along the way we passed the Dole plantation and Pearl Harbor, so even with 10 days, there is plenty to do and see other than just soaking up beach sand and sun.Over all the hotel was fine. It was certainly clean and well kept, and again, the staff was wonderful. It's only a short 25 minute drive from the airport, a few miles from Diamond Head National Monument (park - defunct volcano), and steps from the beach.The stores are a mix of standard resort stores with clothes and high end souvenirs, but they also have a Seattle's Best coffee shop (for an extra $1 ask for the 100 percent Kona), spa like stores that sell lotions and oils, and they have 2 ABC stores that are like souped-up convenience stores that sell everything from T-shirts, to liquor, and everything in between.Finally, the $30 per day resort fee is a bit of a racket, but I suspect that it's standard practice for all of the hotels there and is expected with the name "resort", but honestly you don't really get anything above and beyond what you would get at any other Marriott hotel with the exception of a pool that's outside instead of inside, which we never used anyway. If the indoor shops qualify as "resort amenities" then maybe hotel guests should receive a discount because the shop owners aren't renting those stores for free as a convenience to the guests, I'm sure they are paying a very competitive rent.While Waikiki, Honolulu and Hawaii are absolutely gorgeous, and my wife and I will definitely go back (and we live on the east coast), we would try another hotel next time. We're certainly not sorry we stayed there, but if we were to return, there's nothing drawing us back to that property. I happen to be a rewards member of Marriott as well as a Diamond member at Hilton, and as a retired veteran, I can also stay at the Armed Forces Recreation Center hotel that is at the end of Waikiki beach, so I have other choices not based solely on price or availability.Oh - forgot to mention - the WiFi is free and excellent. Great reception, great bandwidth, a real pleasure. Made uploading all of my pictures a breeze.Hope this helps - enjoy.

My wife and I stayed 5 nights on the way home from visiting family in the US around Easter this year. We made the original booking as a fall back position looking for a deal in Ko Olina that never eventuated, Easter, who would have guessed! Anyway, to the review, Mariotts are Marriotts so the quality of the property will be good and the Waikiki Marriott is no exception even if it is somewhat design dated. Being a bit picky small things like ice on every second floor, crowded lifts and undersized pools that are OK for the kids but not for an adult to relax are more a frustration than anything else and reflect its era.The property is located at the Diamond Head end of the major resort area so its a bit of a hike to the most popular beach areas. Our ocean view was OK but it appeared most, including ours, came from the side of the building with a 30 degree water view. Service was pretty good outside of the peak times.So why the title of this review? We did not regret staying at the hotel rather we regretted not spending and additional $40 to $50 a night elsewhere to avoid those irritations!

Very nice hotel, not far from the airport, and a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach. Very close to a lot of attractions. It had lots of places to eat and visit right at your foot steps. Plenty of beach activities also right across the street, from surfing to playing volleyball. It also had a great sunset overlooking the beach.
user_name:
Joe B
White Plains, New York

review_body: I cannot understand how people can put 4 or5 score ,very out of date , very very basic room , beds are cheap ,dinning room old dirty , food basic and school dinner Quilty served by 85 year old not joking this Marriott is really bad and not worth a look as I said if anybody gives it more then 2 scores they have No idea what a good hotel is !!!!
user_name:
Robert K
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

review_body: Room was comfortable with a small balcony and ocean view. Lobby decor was new. Rooms could use an update, but perfectly comfortable. One of the better equipped fitness centers for a hotel Sushi restaurant on site was very good.

I did enjoy my stay here but it's a large property and I kept getting lost.Staff were very nice and helpful. There are many properties in Honolulu so I probably wouldn't stay there again as it didn't make that much of an impression on me.

Room needed to be updated. Did not even have a bar to hang a wet towel on in the bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Balcony with a nice view of the beach and town.Staff was very kind and helpful. Special kudos to Bre-Ann Krystofer (Lead Concierge).Because our travel agent neglected to send in our deposit for our combination land and ship vacation, Bre-Ann cobbled together a wonderful time for us. Super work-out room.

Slept so well in the most comfortable bed & woke to a full balcony of ocean view! Amazing, clean & cozy. Made our stay the best in the islands!I would recommend this hotel above any others on the beach. Very accommodating & complimentary drink coupon - Aloha:)

I am a Marriott Platinum member so I do frequent Marriot hotels. I have stayed here in the past and will agsin, but it has some shortcomings. First the pros: two pools, hot tub, multiple excellent restaurants, nice fitness center, good location. Cons: location lends to a noisy environment, rooms are old and in need of updating, large hotel so walking around might be an issue for some. Overall, I do recommend staying here as it is a good place, but doesn't really stand out compared to other Marriott resorts.

My work has placed me in this hotel twice in the last couple of years, both times all I can say is that this place is overpriced for what you get. I've stayed in hotels at half the price that were just as nice... And had wifi that stayed up, and was usable... Unlike this hotels wifi. I guess if I paid the $12.95/day for wifi, it MIGHT be okay, but no way am I paying for wifi in a hotel these days!Food, nothing to write home about, except the price (!!!!!!!!!) very high.

This is a great hotel in a great location. My only disappointment was that the rooms seemed a bit dated and worn. Bathrooms and carpeting especially. For as much money as they are charging, I expected nicer. I have stayed in much nicer rooms for a fraction of the price, but that's on the mainland. Maybe this is as good as it gets in Hawaii.

Great hotel. Right on the beach and close to everything. The view was amazing and the staff was very very helpful. The made sure we were able to rest up after 13 hours of travling. We would stay there again if back in Hawaii.

We loved this hotel , our room was amazing with a lovely view of Waikiki beach. The staff were very helpful and really friendly. Free wifi was good. Pool was a good size. It was handy to have the ABC store and coffee shop within the hotel. Location was good for shops and eating places. Would definitely stay here again X

stayed for three weeks. Requested room with a microwave and they had none.business center was out of service 2 of the three weeks, and when it was reopened, 2 of the 4 computers were down. front desk staff all new not very helpful.mandatory valet parking is a dragNo Ethernet drops in the room, WIFI was horrible

Booked into the Hotel and asked for and got a room with a view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. We were given a room on the 30 floor, south east side with a balcony and a great view. The room itself had 2 double beds, two lounge chairs and a table, writing desk, flat screen TVs, air conditioning and a two room ensuite. Room was clean with room service every day. Sometimes after lunch, but I guess they did the rooms first that were receiving new guests. Well located in a relaxed end of the main strip with just a leisurely stroll to shopping precincts.

Nice hotel on Waikiki Beach. Lovely view of beach, downtown Honolulu and nearby mountains. Close enough to walk to all the downtown restaurants and shopping or hike to or from Diamond Head state Monument. Lots of local restaurants on this end of the strip. We like small local eats so we found places like Uncle Bo's Pupu Bar, Ono's Seafood, Pioneer Saloon, Rainbow Drive-in and South Shore Grill, to name a few. Hotel breakfast buffet is great. Lots of fresh tropical fruit and juices to go along with omelets, waffles, etc. After this breakfast, didn't need anything until dinner time. Open air lobby was nice. Plenty or small stores to pick of a few items for the folks back home. A pretty clean, well staffed (and very nice staff) hotel convenient to the beachm, downtown and less busier areas toward Diamond Head. Concierge staff was WONDERFUL. Kylie and Bre-Ann booked us on several wonferful tours. Had an odd issue on one tour. Bre-Ann called the company and had a full refund in minutes. Polite, professional and very fun concierge staff. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.

Checking in was a zoo! The lobby was packed and the line was very long. The atmosphere felt like it was a hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. We were greeted though by 2 very friendly employees - 1 handing out cold water bottles and the other helping to make the time pass quicker as you waited for your turn. The woman helping us during check in was not too friendly. Definitely not much of an aloha spirit.Disastrous rooms: The first room reeked with cigarettes! The 2nd room's carpet needed to be pulled tight and tacked back down. You could not open and close the door properly because it got hung up on the carpet. The 3rd room's door had a gaping space at the top of it. It was installed crookedly and the door would not shut properly. You had to pull or push the door strongly to make it sure it was closed all the way.Thank you very much to Anna Rockenschaub (Director of Services) for switching us to a much better room and making sure we were comfortable after the disastrous previous hotel rooms. We truly appreciated her help!One of the older bartenders (at the pool bar) that has worked at the hotel for years was EXTREMELY rude. We had seen him arguing with customers the 1st day we were there. We got 2 Mai Tais and it didn't taste like there was any rum in them. My husband told him that there was't any rum in it. The bartender started arguing with him, and then poured some rum into the glasses and said, "THERE!!!" They need to get rid of him - he's bad for business!On a positive note, the hotel's location was in walking distance to all the shops, restaurants and the beach. There's an ABC store on the premises where you can buy snacks, suntan lotion and small souvenirs.Would we stay at this Marriott again? We don't think so.

Our room had a beautiful view of Waikiki Beach. Just sitting on the balcony was an experieince. Helpful and friendly staff helped us have a wonderful vacation. Seems like we were always going someplace new. The rooms have been updated, beds are comfortable and the shower always hot. We plan on coming back new year

My wife and I have stayed here twice and really like it but both times, we've had to go to bat to get what we wanted, basically a king size bed. The first time we were guaranteed a king size bed in writing but didn't get it until I came down after our first night and showed my confirmation email which did, in fact, say that we had a king size bed room. They found a king size bed room and we changed rooms. I wrote a trip advisor review, and, which I really did appreciate, the hotel manager wrote us a response saying to ask for him next time to insure that we didn't have a problem. So, last month, I called ahead and reserved a king size bed, which the telephone reservations agent processed and sent us a confirmation - saying that we'd have either a king bed room or a two bed room. If they told me that on the phone, I would have reserved somewhere else or called the manager. We get to the hotel and, sure enough, no king beds. I told them about my message from the manager and they upgraded us to a family suite, which we really liked. I have nothing but praise for all of the hotel staff, especially because they accommodated us but am I really going to have to go through this everytime to get a king sized room? Here's something else, the people checking in with us got a king size room, which they had requested by room number. We love Marriott properties are second tier up Marriott Rewards members. If you don't have a king size bed, just tell us in the first place and we'll just catch you the next time. Other than the above, though, a great stay with great service!

This hotel was clean, service was good, pool top bar and breakfast were good. I had a nice view of the ocean and left my slider open and could hear the ocean. It is a really noisy section of Waikiki, so if you are looking for peace and quiet this is definitely not for you. It's very chaotic in and out of hotel, but lots of places to walk to and right across from a nice beach. The Italian restaurant downstairs is one of my favorites!

The lobby might be one of the coolest things I've ever seen! I would hang out here in the open area for drinks, to do work, or to people watch. The rooms were nice. The bed in our room was unbalanced on one side leaving me with a sore back but I just switched sides with my husband and we were both fine. My intention while in Hawaii was to be outdoors as much as possible. The location was great--across the street from the beach, a block from a great bar and two blocks from the zoo.

We arrived here after our long journey and received a warm welcome. A quick mentioning that it's our honeymoon, we got a complimentary upgrade from standard to ocean view on the 26th floor with two balconies! The room was clean, the view perfect. The best day starts with a complimentary "make your own Lei". We'd go here again!

Hotel was nice. But I thing I would stay in a different part of Oahu. Beach is not as wide as I thought it would be and a lot of places have hard coral as you walk in. Unfortunately there was heavy rain right before my arrival and most of Waikiki Beach was closed due to a brown water alert...um...yuck! I was a bit surprised at the LARGE number of homeless living on the beach and park benches.

First time ever coming to Honolulu and I am glad we chose this hotel. The rooms were nice and clean, the balcony was an added bonus. Staff were friendly and efficient and the location of the hotel was close and convenient to everything. It would have been nice if the pool was located in a more private area but who needs the pool when the beach is a 1 minute walk away! The hotel also has the biggest hotel gym I've seen to date. I paid about $80 CAD in resort fees for 2 days. I would definitley recommend this hotel if you ever stay in Waikiki.

In prior years, I've been fortunate enough to stay at the JW Marriott KO Olina. Unfortunately, it closed at the end of 2014 in order to become a Four Seasons. I was perhaps a little reluctant to book Waikiki Beach Marriott; mostly because it was right smack across from Waikiki Beach; not exactly my favorite place on the Island.I shouldn't have been concerned. The property was clean and well kept; with a particularly lovely (and tropical feeling) Pool Area. The gym was better than would typically be expected at a resort property, and the rooms although needing a refresh; were nicely appointed. I have to call out Lisa Wong and her friendly front desk staff; who went a step or two beyond to ensure that we got an upgrade with a nice view. Thanks much for the friendly extra attention; it goes a long way to making this road warrior feel at home; particularly after an airline caused 5 hour delay in arrival.The location although across from Waikiki beach was close enough to where this wasn't a deterrent but rather a benefit. We weren't in the middle of the madness, but close enough to jump right in when we felt like it.I wasn't totally crazy about the shopping mall like ground floor, but I get it.... I know its part of what you might expect being on Waikiki Beach.In future; I will not hesitate to stay at this property. The exceptional service, great views, fantastic pool and nice Gym at a pretty good price for Waikiki make it a winner in my book!

Great location along the main strip in Waikiki. The lobby was pristine and very welcoming and not that crowded so it was easy to find places to sit and do work. The rooms were standard Marriott --- reasonably sized and very clean with no problems. They have some great in-hotel restaurants here which are extremely convenient.Overall, it was a great stay and I would recommend again. I took off one star because their parking lot sucks with 2-direction traffic areas that are not really wide enough for 2 cars.

The rooms are very clean and nice views, lobby is clean and free internet.Reception, again was garbage, we got placed here by our airline due to a flight delay, the lady at reception asked us if we wanted two separate beds, to which we said "no, we are on our honeymoon, could we have a single bed room"To which she responded "sorry, the airline didn't specify what room anyone should get so I'm going to give you a roomWith two double beds, thanks"And walked away after handing us our room keys.That is worse than the service at the Embassy Suites Waikiki! What is with check in desk people in Honolulu!

Attended a 3 day conference. I was upgraded to an ocean view that overlooked Diamondhead. Conference rooms were very good. Room was chilly. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Room and beds comfortable. Across the street from me be beach.

We stopped on Oahu for two days on our way to Kauai. We stayed here one night and it was very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There are a variety of shops you can visit in the hotel.
