The beach is right across the street. The sunset is an amazing site as you watch the surfers and paddle boarders play. We didn't make it to the pool area but it looks very nice and inviting. If you can spring for an ocean view room do it, you are in Hawaii.

The Marriott is perfectly located in Waikiki. The hotel is very nice, if not a bit outdated. However, they are actively improving it. There are a number of good restaurants right in the complex, however, Waikiki has many, many wonderful restaurants. Shopping and eateries are all within walking distance. The beach is just across the street and it is very nice. Sunsets are amazing. We found the staff to be quite pleasant and helpful. The upgrade for the daily breakfast is well worth it.

This hotel as well as many others are located on Waikiki beach but what you miss is that you are downtown Honolulu. This means a lot of homeless and crime elements. Just be aware of where you are and stay in lighted areas everything is fine. Lots of shopping within walking distance as well as excellent restaurants. Enjoyed my stay as there are many great places to see on Oahu like Pearl Harbor, Diamond Head, Waikiki Beach, Ted Bakery on north shore, The North Shore, many beaches, Haleiwa town, Matsumoto Shaved Ice.

We had just come off an 18-day cruise and we were ready to relax on land for a couple of days before heading home. The hotel is right of the main drag and a short walk to the beach. That's the good news.The bad news is the rooms are in definite need of updating. The carpets were very worn, the upholstered furniture had numerous stains and the bathrooms were dingy. Having stayed in lots of Marriotts over the years, this was by far the worse. It was a disappointing ending to an otherwise wonderful trip.

The front desk help was wonderful when I was asking how to ship items from Hawaii. The young man personally escorted me to the Safety & Security office. Then the staff in Safety & Security not only helped but had different size boxes to choose from but kept following up with me by email to ensure I had tracking numbers and if the package had arrived safely. Thank you Ken and staff! Great customer service!

As you know, I love Marriott's, I'm a lifetime platinum elite member. We first stayed in this hotel on our honeymoon when it was called the Hawaiian Regent back in 1980, so we've been here a lot. We love the location because it's at the more quiet end of the strip, right near the Honolulu Zoo, Aquarium and park. A lot less people then center strip. They have 2 towers, I recommend staying in the tower closest to the beach (front) with a room facing west. It gives you a great view of Waikiki beach and the sun setting.The place has 2 salt water pools, one for each tower, but you can use either or. We prefer the pool in the front tower because it has a bar and servers to bring you food or drink. There is some shade at the pool if you don't mind moving around as the sun moves. You can also rent a cabana for $25 and $40 per day. The pool generally isn't crowded and the servers are very attentive. If you prefer the beach, that is just across the street from the hotel.There are a few restaurants in the hotel, the one that has the buffet breakfast and dinner is temporarily located on the 3rd floor and the Moana Terrace located on the 3rd floor near the front pool. We had the buffet breakfast 4 times because we had gotten 8 coupons for free breakfast. It's regularly about $24 each, nothing special or fancy your basic breakfast, lots of fresh fruit, pastries, bacon, sausage, eggs and an omelet station. If it didn't come with the room we would not have gone there, too pricy for us for breakfast. The Moana Terrace, served great lunch and dinner finger foods, nachos, burgers, fish, etc. They also provided free entertainment in the evening under the stars. Prices were resort average $12-18, fruity drinks $12. Service was excellent and the food very tasty.Now unfortunately like many resorts are getting, they have a $30 per day resort fee. This includes some local and international calling, wifi and a few other things. Can't remember them all. Now like I mentioned we did get 8 coupons for the free buffet breakfast, 8 free cups of Seattle"s Best Coffee and the wifi, so the fee I felt was a wash and worth it. The other really cool thing that they have is FREE DVD rentals, located on the 2nd floor. This was cool, titles fairly recent, but hey it was something to do if you wanted to make it an early night. Each room has a DVD player so you can even bring your kids favorite DVD.They have a coin laundry located by the front pool and of course an exercise facility. The room we had was sparkling clean and well kept during our entire stay. It also comes with a refrigerator so you can pick up snacks at the Food Pantry (5 minute walk on Kuhio Drive) or one of the many ABC Stores.Parking is like $34 per day so unless you really really need a car every day, I would take a taxi from the airport (Charlie's Taxi $30 one way 808-233-3333) and then find a good deal car rental near the hotel rent day by day to avoid the parking charge. You can use Charlie's back to the airport as well, set up your pickup time.Would we stay here again, absolutely!! Like I mentioned we first came here in 1980 and whenever we are on Oahu, this is the place we exclusively stay at. Aloha!!

This Marriott was a solid choice for downtown Waikiki. The beds are always comfortable, the staff is great, and everything is clean and professional. The breakfast buffet was great, and there were many friendly staff who made breakfast and enjoyable experience for atmosphere as well as food.I expect Marriott beds to offer me a great night's sleep, and this hotel was no different. I can always rely on Marriott mattresses and pillows for a solid, restful night.Service was outstanding, but in one respect I was quite disappointed. I had a bit of a craving for apple pie one afternoon/evening and spent about 2 hours walking all over downtown Waikiki to find apple pie, but with no luck at any of the myriad restaurants there. Finally, upon returning to the hotel, I found that apple pie a la mode was available from room service. I ordered two slices for our group, and about 20 minutes later I was wishing I had grabbed a small slice of fast food pie at the next door Burger King. For ~$36, this pie was a disappointment. I have no problem paying for quality, but this was ridiculous. The pie was average at best, and the price was ludicrous. Marriott took advantage of the "location, location, location" thing here, I felt. I wouldn't recommend room service--simply from that one experience.Apart from that very minor issue, the hotel was quite good. The carpet in my room seemed to be in need of replacement, but apart from that, it was a nice stay.

We booked on American Express' Travel portal, and got a great pre-paid rate. Or so we thought. The hotel is nice enough, and it's a great location, but you will pay a lot more than what you think you are paying, and you won't find out until you check in.There is a mandatory "resort fee" of $30 per night that is a total scam which we just found about upon check-in. You can't decline it. Supposedly this gives you free DVD rentals, useless coupons for massages and such (which is free on my cellphone anyway) so it's all garbage. Certainly not worth an extra $30 per day. No refunds, of course. Self parking is $32 per day and valet is even higher. It's cheaper to park almost anywhere else, even another hotel. You'll be paying for wi-fi, too.Won't be staying here again, there are other options on the beach that are much nicer for this price, when you get the "real" price at the front desk.

This was our 6th visit to this hotel. The lobby has been renovated and I would suspect the rooms will also over the next couple of years. Staff is very friendly and the beach across the street is great. Today we were able to walk to diamond head which is about two miles away . Also close to zoo and a large park. Taxis from airport not inexpensive as it cost almost 50 . We will for sure come again .

Great location, but a huge hotel. Rooms are big, and have good views of the beach. There are several places to eat at the hotel in addition to 2 pools. Give yourself time to check out, as NCL books all there passengers here.
user_name:
Pat D
Hollywood, Florida, United States

review_body: Very nice 4 night stay prior to going on NCL cruise. Check in was very easy, we got upgraded to a very nice corner room with a balcony and a ocean view. We also got free buffet breakfast coupons and free coffee coupons and two free welcome drinks. Bed and bath looked new and everything in the room worked. They had two swimming pools and a spa and hot tub. Beautiful open air lobby.

I travelled from Canada and my husband from Australia as a midpoint meeting place for our wedding anniversary. I had booked our room via expedia as a partial ocean view. We had friends of ours meeting us from Australia and were staying in the same hotel.I arrived to be given a room on the 10th floor that had no ocean view (Unless you walked out onto the balcony and craned your neck out to the right and caught a tiny glimpse of the ocean between 2 building!!!) I complained out this and the reception staff kindly told me that it would be a $150 US per night for an upgrade. Funnily enough our friends had checked in the day before and had received a free upgrade from a basic city view room to deluxe ocean view. I feel that as the rooms were not booked directly with the hotel, there was no responsibility taken for our bookings. I have never been faced with a similar situation where the hotel staff just simply did not care that I was unhappy with my room. The hotel is in a very convenient location. The rooms in the older tower are a bit dated and do not have much of a view. The pool area is very small and was not relaxing as it was very crowded.There is a $US 30 resort fee and it is unclear what this is for. Self parking is $US32 per day which i felt was a quite pricey.I didn't feel like it was worth the rates we paid and are certainly not going back to stay there.

Check in was a bit sketchy, as the front desk did not have our correct reservation. But it was worked out in a friendly way. Hotel is clean and well located in the heart of Waikiki Beach. Paid a bit more for our two day stay with a diamond head view and buffet breakfast included. Well worth it, view was wonderful, and the breakfast buffet was really good with many choices. Highly recommend that option if you can spend a bit more. Served our needs well as a jump off spot to a vacation that included visits to Kauai and Maui.

The hotel and staff were wonderful. The room was comfortable and spacious; the views were magnificent. I am sure there are places that are more opulent, but for us, this was just perfect. The bars and restaurants were likewise great. Food was delicious and plentiful. Location was great, lots of easy walking. If we get back to O'ahu, we will be back to this hotel.

We absolutely LOVED everything about this hotel. The location is wonderful, you are looking at Waikiki beach and/or Diamond Head. It is an easy walk to many, many restaurants and convenient stores--let's face it there is an ABC store on every corner. The new lobby is so beautiful, calming and full of events. The morning we entered there was a cultural session about Hawaiian customs and the presenter was singing a beautiful song that filled the lobby with such an beautiful atmosphere. The rooms are clean, spacious and inviting. Hopefully you reserved one with a balcony that overlooks the ocean....from there we watched surfers very early in the morning and very late in the evening with the fantastic Hawaiian sunset. I cannot say enough about the friendly and helpful staff. Upon hearing that my husband and I were celebrating our 30 anniversary they upgraded our room and stocked our refrigerator with wine and a cheese/fruit plate. Thank you Chris Tatum---that was so very sweet! We would also like to mention that the concierge, Kylie Sueoka, was delightful! She had great suggestions to make our stay so very FUN!! We loved everyone of her excursions and can't stop talking about the helicopter ride with the landing at the Jurrasic Park waterfall. WOW! Thank you so much, Marriot. We will be back and will recommend this spot to anyone we know who is headed to Honolulu!

Arrived at 1:30P, check-in was smooth and very professional. I had a great rate and I was given a nice upgrade to the 28Th floor with a great view of Diamond Head. The lobby is open airy. Yes, it is not a typical resort where the center piece would be the pool area, but the hotel does have a nice feel. I was not happy with the $30.00 resort fee, but there is no way to get out, I asked. You do get two cups of coffee and two Mia Tias. There are some other amenities, but I don't think anybody uses them. They have a nea Video rental, but I hadn't planned to be in the hotel that long. The rooms was a pleasant surprise. It had a nice decor and the beds were comfortable. The shower was a bit sketchy as it came out scalding hot. The coffee was a one cup dispenser. I got a free newspaper with the resort fee in the morning, The room does have a safe and frig. There is an excellent set-up for charging all your electronics. This hotel is at one end of the Waikiki strip. The hotel is across the strip to the beach. All the beaches are public. Theses beaches are worth a stay. They are clean, We went and it wasn't crowed. Most of the shopping from the hotel is very high end, Prada, Gucci, etc, etc. I did not eat at the hotel as dining options are limitless. I will give a shout out for Fook Yuen Chineses on McCully. There gym is nicely equiped. I would return to this hotel. The only thing that would stop me is a high rate.

I truly wish that I could put it into words just how amazing our honeymoon was at this property, but it was breathtaking. I can not thank your hotel staff enough for going above and beyond our expectations. I work for Marriott as well and it is people like your team that make me proud to work for such an incredible company. Jean Asato (Guest Relations Supervisor), Lynn M. (Reservations Supervisor), and Chris B. (Concierge) ensured that our stay was perfect before we even arrived to the time we departed. I truly can not thank them enough for all that they did during our stay.....even when we showed up earlier than planned they made sure there were rose petals and champagne in the room! I also want to thank Wendy and Lani at the front desk for making everything about check in such an easy process and hooking us up with some incredible goodies. Hawaii is a perfect place, especially for a honeymoon and making the "perfect reservation" can sometime seem impossible so I thank every single one of you for going the extra mile and making our stay absolutely breathtaking...we did not want to leave your hotel! Every single person that we encountered from the front desk to housekeeping always had a smile on their face and was always eager to help. Lastly, the rooms were always clean and the food and drinks were amazing. I especially loved the buffet in one of their banquet spaces as well as a washer and dryer that took credit card. Everyone at this property especially the employees that I mentioned needs a raise or some sort of special recognition because they are what Marriott stands for...Making it Brilliant! Keep it up Waikiki Beach Marriott!

The Waikiki Marriott is located towards the east end of Waikiki beach and is right on the ocean (across Kalakaua Avenue). We had an oceanfront room in the Kealohilani tower which is on the beach side of the hotel. The other tower is quite far from the ocean. Great room except the balcony was on the side of the room and not on the oceanfront. The building looks like it was built for balconies on the front but doesn't have them. The breakfast buffet was a little expensive and hard to evaluate since it was in a temporary location due to construction but the service and food were both excellent. Parking is in the building but expensive at $32 per day for self-parking. Would recommend this hotel but know you will do a lot of walking as the hotel is one of the last hotels on Waikiki and many of the restaurants and shopping are going to be a 10-15 walk towards the rest of Waikiki. Swimming pools are surprisingly small but why use the pool when the Pacific ocean is across the street.

After a very long 22 hour trip of flights and layovers, it was so good to finally arrive at the Waikiki Beach Marriott. We checked in at about midnight and fortunately we were able to get our bags upstairs since there was a small staff on duty at that hour of the night. The room was clean and the next morning we had a beautiful view of the ocean and Diamondhead from our room. On the ground floor of the resort, there are a variety of shops available. We had a complimentary coffee at Starbucks and purchased muffins for our breakfast. There was an ABC store which was convenient. We stopped at the concierge desk to get some information, and decided to book all of our shore excursions through Tara. We told her what we were interested in doing on our cruise, and she arranged everything, and at a savings over what the price of similar excursions were on the cruise ship! Every excursion we booked through her was FIRST CLASS. She explained everything and gave us detailed notes and instructions. We did not pre-arrange transfers to and from the Marriott, so we used cabs which worked out well. All of the cabs preferred cash rather than using credit/debit cards.

When my husband and I were looking for somewhere to stay for our honeymoon, we knew we wanted to be right near the beach and we wanted a spa. Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort & Spa checked those boxes and more. Throughout our stay the staff was attentive, our room (and view of Diamond Head and the ocean) was fabulous, and the location can't be beat.

We stayed at this property and we really loved it, we had a room on the 28th floor and the view was just amazing, room was very clean beds very comfortable staff very helpful and friendly, this property is huge, Waikiki beach is right across the hotel and this property is surrounded by great shopping area for all types of budgets as well as restaurants, we will definitely be back to this property. Make sure to use the amenities that comes with the resort fees one of them is the mai tais.MAI TAIS FOR DAYS!!!!!!

OK, first off, I would not really describe this place as a "resort" since there are no grounds beyond the walls of the hotel. Yes, it has a nice couple of rooftop pools and bars. Yes it has a couple restaurants and some shops. My room was comfortable and the convention spaces and lobby area were wonderful. Hallway carpeting could use replacing. On the down side, this hotel is not on the beach (it is across the street but close). Location is very convenient to the zoo as well as Diamond Head.

Walk across the street to Wakkaki Beach and have a blast! You really do not need to leave the hotel, lots to do here with pools, spa and fitness center as well as great dining. Good pricing, do request a higher floor for best views with of ocean or Diamond Head.

I am a dedicated Marriott person - this hotel didn't disappoint. There are two pools (one for each Tower). The lobby is recently renovated and is a lovely open air lobby. I spent many early morning hours hanging out down there (jet lag). Staff was great, lots of stores and restaurants all around. Within walking distance of shops and other restaurants. The beach is directly across the street and a lovely view from many places in hotel.The beds were the wonderful Marriott beds.Few cons/ complaints, the rugs in our room were clearly not cleaned in quite some time. I travel often and understand the amount of people in and out of a room - i don't gripe about a few paint chips here and there. The rug was really in need of a cleaning. Otherwise, housekeeping was so nice and front desk staff were super friendly.It would be great if there were other quick food options right at the hotel - sandwich/ice cream, etc. The pool bar food was just ok - and just ok. We didn't eat at the other restaurants though i think a bit fancy. Coffee Shop and ABC stores were great to be in the lobby. I think a deli or sandwich type shop would be great.

Marriott had a special for Ocean View Rooms so we decided to stay there. We were upgraded to a ‘Premium’ Ocean & Diamond Head View on the 23rd floor of the Kealohilani tower. In my opinion, the other side of the tower would have a better view of Waikiki as long as it was still a high floor. Had I known, I would have asked at check-in. But I'm not complaining as it was a really nice room with a large balcony and great view.As part of the $30 Resort Fee, Elite members get coupons for 1 buffet breakfast per day, not breakfast for 2 like a other Marriott's. I know it's a 'resort' but even in Paris which was more expensive than Hawaii, we got breakfast for 2. I guess it's better than nothing for the Resort Fee. We also got 2 free MaiTais and 25% off food at the Moana Terrace. Parking was steep at $32 per day. So once you tack on the taxes, resort and parking fees, it was about $100 more than the $239 room rate. BUT, for Waikiki, that was still a pretty good deal. I had initially booked the Westin Moana Surfrider, as it was $1100 for 3 nights for partial ocean view including taxes and resort fee (which includes parking). But, not being a Starwood Elite member, I didn’t think we’d get any upgrade or as good a view and I know we wouldn’t have gotten any breakfast or discounts.We had dinner at Sansei in the hotel - the sushi & tempura were excellent as was the service.Overall, an enjoyable stay in a great location.Overall, an enjoyable stay

I just stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. I was there on business. The hotel has two towers and if you have a rental car and being ocean front is not that important to you you may want to stay in the tower that has the lobby. Easy in, easy out! I stayed in the tower with the lobby in room 1051. The view is from that room. The room was big, but it felt like it was missing furniture cause it has lots of open space.Navidad was the housekeeper and she was very sweet and would ask you if you needed anything else.One thing to note is that in order to get to the beach you have to cross the street.

The staff are amazing and the place is beautiful. The concierge was super helpful in booking the things we wanted to do and giving us advice without just trying to sell us things. The hotel is in a convenient part of the city and many places are walkable. They have a few places to eat on site which are good and 2 pools. Also- they have live music at the pool bar at night. A big plus are the workout classes they offer and little hula and history classes they have in the morning. Try to get a room. With a view-- I'd highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Love4Travel616
New York City, New York

review_body: The Marriott just spent like 4 million dollars to refurbish their hotel here across the street from the beach. It is very open and modern on the inside, the rooms are great. But as you know when you are in Hawaii things are a bit on the expensive side. They do not include breakfast that is extra, even if your not going to be using the features of the hotel you still have to pay the resort fee. It adds up. You can stay two hotels down in the same location for at least 30% less money. Its a nice hotel but not sure its worth the money per night.

Wish they weren't renovating the lobby at the time. They upgraded our room to the 32nd floor diamond head view! All I can say is wow! Easy walk everywhere, close to the park, across from beach! Helpful staff.

We ended up staying at this hotel unexpectedly, twice, due to two different flight delays on the same trip. We chose it because it had availability of an ocean front room on short notice during heavy Spring Break season, and we find Marriott properties to be consistently reliable quality. This is a very nice property, although we were there for only a matter of hours each stay so only able to enjoy the beautiful views (high-floor corner room) and room service (food was excellent) -- unfortunately no time to use the pool, restaurants, or cross the street to the large expanse of famous public beach. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Attached parking garage very convenient (additional fee). We also stayed at the Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club (vacation club/timeshares) on the same trip -- by comparison, that property felt far more crowded, commercial and expensive.

Check-in time is 3 pm but no problem if you are early, there is a "hospitality" room for guest where you can relax, shower or watch TV until they call you to let you know your room is ready. A very nice gesture that is very rare.The staff is professional yet friendly. The rooms are large and clean. The beds are very comfy. The view from the room is stunning. The bathroom is nice with a quality selection of ammenities, however the shower head is too low.The price of breakfast is outrageous but there are 2 Seattle's Best Coffee in the lobby where you can get good coffee and a pastry instead. Wi-Fi is free and fast.The location right on Waikiki Beach is fantastic.My only issue is the resort fee which you pay at checkout... $30/night is a lot and not clear what is is all about...

The cruise line used this hotel as part of their pre-cruise excursion stay. When we arrived, checking-in went great. However, once we got to the room (was on 5th floor), the room was filthy. Since we travelled for over 10hours, we got in the room, undressed and started to use the bathroom. Found filth on the floor. We cleaned it and used the shower. Once we got dressed, went to the front desk, and asked if they could have our bathroom re-cleaned. The young lady did better than that. She moved us to a higher floor (29th) and the room was clean. She also told us that earlier that day, three other travellers prior to us had similar complains of dirty rooms. We loved sitting on the balcony on the higher floor, could see the city, diamond head and part of the Ocean. It was wonderful. The hotel was nice, our second room was comfortable and clean. There was a coupon for each day (we stayed three nights) for free Seattle's best coffee. The lines were long but the coffee was good. I gave 2 rating for room cleanliness since our first room was dirty. Our second room was good.

I was thoroughly pleased with the room and staff my entire trip. The room was much bigger than I would have expected! I especially like the pool deck. I had several meals up there and enjoyed the music and ambiance at night. After spending the day on different parts of the island it was nice to come back and relax just relax! I also thought the location was unique and it gives you a wide variety of shopping and restaurants to choose from. I will definitely stay here again!

Checked in and was told I had a room upgrade - excellent! And got some drink ticket vouchers for the bar - also excellent! The room was average and the soaps were really masculine smelling (after coming from coconut/mango scents at the Hilton). It had a nice balcony and a partial ocean view which was amazing. There were two staff members that wowed me - I wish I knew their names. Set me up with a late check out (I was in the city for the first time, and only staying Friday to Saturday!), and bussing and directions to hike Diamond Head. And restaurant recommendations, Dukes particularly was excellent! Overall, enjoying my stay immensely - but it was the staff that really stood out at this place.

We spent four day and three nights at this clean and comfortable hotel. The ocean is directly across the street with many places to eat near by. There is a shopping area in the hotel and several restaurants.

We really enjoyed the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and Spa. THe staff was excellent. Our check in was quick and easy. The room was nice nd clean and spacious. This is a great location on the main drag and near many restaurants and shops. We really enjoyed the pool and bar on the Moana Terrace. Plenty of space. Quiet and relaxing. It was busy but not hectic.At the bar Randy was a great bartender. He even gave us some excellent recomendations for places to go for dinner. Plus the housekeeping staff was super pleasant. We enjoyed this place. It is not what I wqould call luxious. But it is very nice and fit our tastes perfectly.

Proximity to the beach is fabulous but the hotel itself is in need of updates. You can walk to numerous places. The beaches are very crowded, but they are so close you can stroll along the water within a minute of leaving the hotel. The public areas are worn and always look as if they need to be cleaned. Many people walk through the halls and lounges and it shows. Pool areas are small but suitable. Rooms are small. Beds are comfortable.

Large, clean room. Beautiful, newly redecorated lobby and great location on Waikiki Beach. Nice pools. We booked through Norwegian Cruises and it was beyond our expectations. Our king bed room was much nicer than the website photos.

The view from our balcony was to the ocean and we enjoyed it. The room was spacious and comfortable. The hotel is right across from the beach. It is close to the zoo and park. We stayed here three nights before a cruise and were on tours during the day.

This hotel was pretty average and expected. Rooms look to have been relatively newly renovated. Balconies are small but offer a limited view. The street noise can very very loud at very late hours, the glass doors don't seem to keep the sound out very well.

This hotel has a great location in Waikiki -- rooms facing the water have an excellent, mostly unobstructed view of the ocean. It's also very easy to walk to many parts of Waikiki from the hotel. The rooms are clean, and parts of them have been renovated -- but other parts are showing their age, like the carpet and bathroom. The bathroom vanities, however, were updated during the hotel's last renovation, as was the main lobby. There are also a few shops located right downstairs, including an ABC Store, which is quite convenient.
user_name:
zinear
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We've stayed at the Marriott Waikiki twice previously but this trip is a wedding anniversary milestone I decided to splurge on an oceanfront accommodation. It's been worth it. The bed is comfortable, the room spacious and the extra bathroom a real hit with my wife. The view is really magnificent. Tonight we were treated to a fireworks display from one of the other hotels along the beach (maybe the Royal Hawaiian?). The service at the Marriott has been great. We've eaten at the breakfast buffet twice as I receive one free buffet/day as a gold Marriott member. Our server the first day was wonderful so we have and will continue to request seating in her area each day. The people at the Marriot can't seem to do enough for you starting with the front desk, the restaurant servers, the housekeeping department etc. Now if the parking were a little more reasonable than $35/day on top of the $30/day resort fee I'd really be pleased.

The hotel is not bad. But it's not above average either. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze which was much appreciated after a long flight. Our room was clean -- for the most part. - The bathroom shower had mold on almost all the grouting and it's not something that happened overnight. - The shower curtain liner was plastic, older and very stiff. Not like liners in most hotels that are more like fabric. - The paint in the bath by the tub was peeling. - The bathroom cabinet "update " at some point was putting a piece of granite on top of an old cabinet. Even the granite is beginning to show its age. I spoke to a manager about the mold asking if anyone ever checked on the rooms. He said maintenance was supposed to check after guests checked out and the room had been cleaned. He said he would annotate my comment and offered to move us to a different room. I declined and told him I just wanted them to know. He also said new owners bought the property a couple years ago and were updating the hotel. You can tell the Lobby has been done already - it was gorgeous. It will just take time for the rooms to be updated.

Norwegian Cruise Lines booked us here as a "free" night before our Hawaiian cruise on Pride of America. Staff were very pleasant. It was obvious that the hotel was receiving a major facelift, and we could tell it's going to be absolutely terrific once it's completed. Beds/linens were comfortable, and it's a block from the beach. I would definitely stay here again.

We had an amazing stay here. Carina Yung greeted us after an awful flight delay which meant we missed a night in the hotel. We had chocolate strawberries in our room to celebrate our anniversary. The room 1321 was delightful with views over the pool and sea and a really comfortable bed. The concierge helped with changing bookings for the tour companies because of the delay. They also even helped with a lock on our suitcase which had been damaged by United airlines. Thank you for an amazing stay would totally recommend anyone to book this hotel.

If you like a comfortable beds, clean spacious / quiet, rooms with a beautiful balcony over looking the beach this is your place to stay. Did I mention everybody was most friendliest person you ever met. Give Waikiki Beach Marriott a try. Lots of shops near by as well . We already are planning our trip back next spring.

The only way this property would be considered a resort is if it were a last resort. We recently spent 8 days and 7 nights at this "category 8" Marriott property. I'm not sure on what scale this property reaches a level 8.The food at the pool restaurant bar was the worst we had ever had at a Marriott property. After finishing a decent meal at Sansei the sushi restaurant on the property we were rudely informed that we couldn't take our half finished drinks to our room (not very resort like), because they weren't actually part of the property.The room was outdated and, and in need of serious maintenance. From the rust stains on the bed skirt, to the peeling paint in the refurbished bathroom tub, and dust laden HVAC system. It's a wonder that a sinus infection was the only thing I left with. What they refer to as the "premium" ocean view is laughable. We had a better sight line of the obnoxious union protesters at the Aston hotel next door when they woke is up at 6am, than we did of the ocean. While the service wasn't overtly bad it was nothing special either. The staff by and large was a forced type of pleasant. The only person who seemed to enjoy her job was the hostess at the makeshift morning breakfast buffet which is setup in a pair of old ballrooms. While we are loyal Elite members with Marriott, the only way we will stay at this hotel again is if it is a last resort.

This hotel does not live up to the Marriott resort expectation. With the exception of having a spa onsite I am not sure how it receives a resort classification. It has a very small, crowded pool. The pool and bar food is disgusting (they market it as local Hawaiian food, but it is obviously from a food service can or jar). If you're looking for a party scene then this might be the place for you. It is loud due to the music from the bar/hotel across the street. The elevators are very slow. Plan ahead if you need to be somewhere from a high floor at a particular time. No one was rude and the service, when needed, was good. Having stayed at a ton of category 8 Marriott properties, however, the level of service here was definitely not as top notch as others. Overall, if you're looking for a good deal and like a spring break/party scene then this hotel would work for you. Otherwise, try to find a place outside of Waikiki.

Although our check-in started out a little stressful, the girl checking us in had to search for our reservation and was difficult to deal with -- everything else was perfect from that point on!! We had a room on the 17th floor that had an amazing ocean view it couldn't have been any better. Rooms were clean and beds very comfortable.The breakfast was excellent with fresh fruit, omelets, bread pudding, waffles, and many other breakfast items. The hostess Georgette was super nice and we started to look for her everyday. She as well as Gina, and Chuck the omelet chef went out of their way to be friendly and really provided great service. The atmosphere there was relaxed and casual and everyone was friendly.This Marriott is in a great location, close to the beach, restaurants, and even a church right across the street.We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Waikiki and would go back there in a heartbeat!!

Great location at the heart of Waikiki. Although the food is mediocre, the bar at the pool area is decent if you want to have a night cap. The view from our room is breathtaking. Will stay here again for the view and convenience.

The location was great if you want to be across the beach but it was far from the happening places/restaurants.10mint walk each day for us to any restaurant from the property.Bummer with two lil kids.

Stayed there for 3 nights with my family and really enjoyed it. We stayed on the 6th floor and from our balcony, you could partially see the beautiful beach. Check - in took longer than expected, but apart from that everything else went smoothly. They haf afacility where uou could rent dvds for the children. The staff were very polite and helpful. The beach is literally a few minutes walk. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and many many ABC'S stores to get your few bits and bobs. A must go when visiting Honolulu, Waikiki

We recently stayed here for 3 days before heading to the big island for a business trip. We loved the hotel and the location was great.....the diamond head side of Waikiki, which makes it much easier to get in and out. Check in was about a 10 minute wait and staff was friendly and helpful. Even though we knew in advance about the $30 resort fee, it still felt like a rip-off when you aren't really using any of the amenities. It was a busy hotel with a lot of people in the lobby and poolside. The bar by the pool was fun (although expensive...$9 for a plastic cup of draft beer), and a great place to watch the sunset. They have a guest laundry near the pool that we used, which was a plus. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but heard from other guests that they were good. I would definitely stay here again.

The best family vacation spot ever. It was nice to walk on the ocean everyday and be able to feed the fish too! I would love to stay there again! The service was nice and the people who worked there were very helpful to me and my family!

Because of our Marriott reward status, we were upgraded to a large room with a fantastic ocean view. The hotel room and shared areas (lobby, shops) were all well maintained and very clean. We had the breakfast buffet included, and I've definitely had better buffets at other Marriotts. The huge dining area for the buffet looked and felt a bit like a high school school cafeteria. I would say it was only adequate. And, as another reviewer said, the extra charges for parking and resort fee really added up, although we were informed ahead of time.

This is a really nice place to stay. It is close to the beach and to the Zoo. There is also a pick up point for many of the shuttles and tour buses right across the road. The facilities are excellent . There are two pools, that are quite small but the beach is excellent . Close to shops and restaurants . There is an ABC shop on the foyer.

This is my third stay at this property. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is really good with lots of fresh fruit. The team in the restaurant goes the extra mile to take of everyone's needs.the best thing is being able to walk across the street and be on Waikiki Beach

We stayed here the last two nights on our way to another Hawaiian resort. We arrived at 11PM. Even so, the front desk staff was very accommodating and friendly. I reserved a Junior Suite. Although I am Platinum, no upgrade was offered as this was apparently the best available. Our room is on the 32nd floor facing Honolulu and has a nice view of the beach. There are many shops here with an ABC store conveniently located on each end of this very large facility. Breakfast yesterday was a buffet at the Kuhio Beach Grill at the hotel. Lots of choices. We had lunch at the Moana Terrace by the pool. Good service and good food.

As a Lifetime Platinum member, I found the service and quality of the hotel to be very, very good. The staff was friendly and attentive and took very good care of us. On check in we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with an excellent view. Given our schedule I asked for a late checkout of 3:00 PM and they gave us until 6:00 PM. The food was good as well.The only complaint I have is my experience with the concierge. Upon arrival we sat down with the concierge to schedule some activities. By mid week we began to understand that she had up-sold us on a couple of tours that did not provide the activities we were looking for. The activities themselves were fine, but we had been very clear that we wanted to see/do some very specific things. The concierge assured us that we would see/do these things in addition to the activities of the more expensive version of the activities. We told her that we wanted some free time and she assured us the activities would end with plenty of free time. However, each day we didn't get back to the hotel until late afternoon. On the last 2 days we ended up leaving the tours early and pay in excess of $50 each day for taxis to get back to the hotel and do the other things we wanted to do.I got the impression that the concierge was a contractor to the hotel and probably given incentives by the tour companies and was not especially concerned about the reflection on the Marriott brand. So my advice is buyer beware and make sure you thoroughly understand what you're getting before you spend $4,000 on activities you're not entirely interested in.

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean, everyone was super friendly. The pools were clean the sun was hot and the bar drinks were excellent. Waitresses are at you beck and call around the pool area for food and drinks. Your never looking for a waitress, they're always there. All guests seemed very pleasant and even the locals who showed up at the bar were great. The restaurants were very good. The buffet had a great selection and the sushi and steak restaurants were very good. Our room view was spectacular. The beach was right across the street, and set up the perfect day for beach in the morning and pool in the afternoon. The beach has plenty of palms for shade. Located in the heart of Waikiki, there is plenty to do. You can also catamaran off the beach out to the reef giving you a great view of Waikiki, Honolulu, and Diamond Head crater. A car rental is on site if you want to day trip on your own. Defiantly recommend. Just load up on the sunscreen, the sun is hot and you'll burn quick. We did have an issue with our room. They relocated us no questions asked. They moved all our belongings, we didn't need to do anything. There are fireworks in Honolulu every week and you can watch right from your balcony. Entertainment every night by local bands giving you the ultimate Hawaiian experience. Don't forget to go to the aquarium and the zoo just a 10 minute walk from the resort. Also, try the local Hawaiian food. Pricing is reasonable for the experience. ABC Store in the resort and has everything from food to drinks to lotion to clothing. Definitely consider it, you won't be disappointed.

We stayed here for 10 days with a sporting team of teenagers and parents and it was perfect for us. Easy access to the beach and places to eat. ABC convenience store in the lobby was great. The lobby was stylish and a great meeting place as very spacious. the pool gets crowded but is lovely and deep. Gym is well equipped. Laundry facilities are good. Staff are helpful. I would stay here again. Free wifi was great and not slow. we had four people in our room (2 adults and 2 teenagers) and there was enough room for us and all our luggage and shopping.

Stayed at this Marriott location for 14 nights on a business trip. There are some really excellent qualities of this hotel- it has a different "feel" than many other brand locations and has amazing decor and places to sit back and enjoy being in Hawaii. The rooms were huge, the views unbeatable, and is located within walking distance to many great spots in Waikiki. Overall, I would say that this is a great place to be on a vacation. The only issue I had about staying here, especially for a business trip versus a vacation, was the exorbitant resort fee that really added up after a two week stay. I really would classify this hotel as a "resort" in name only, and most of the comparable hotels in the area do not have similar fees but offer identical amenities. It was a little disappointing because Marriotts are usually above the "nickel and diming" schemes. I didn't feel like the services offered in exchange for the fee were the appropriate value. The bar was also incredibly overpriced for the quality of drinks and service.That being said, it was overall an incredibly positive experience. The staff- both cleaning and guest services- were immensely helpful and incredibly polite and professional. The hotel has 2 ABC stores so there's easy access to any incidental items you might need in a hurry, and it has some really great restaurants as well.

Everything about this hotel was great - my wife loved the spa, has a good gym, the pool was adequate, the only real drawback is the elevators - they are slow and thus get crowded.Great proximity to restaurants, beach, diamond head, parks, shopping.Be prepared for $30/day resort fee - they do tell you in advance.

The staff could not do.enough for me on my stay for Five very special nights with the Waikiki Beach Marriott Resort and SpaThe enterence welcomed me with a magnificent display of an orchid gardenRoom are clean comfortable and the furniture and beds are lovelyI joined the rest of my tour group on my second day

Lovely experience. We were upgraded to ocean view double balcony from city view. It had amzing views of the oceans and even the diamond head. The housekeeping however was not thorough and many surfaces were dusty or stained. Our wifi didnt work but good thing the resort waived two days worth of resort fee. Parking is expensive so park at the zoo for only $1 per hour vs $32 at hotel. The valet parking area is crazy and the valet people are very rude and strict about the drop off zone. For the most part we enjoyed our stay and had a lovely experience. The open air lobby was a charm and staff was on the most part helpful. The elevator broke down when we were waiting with luggages and we waited 30 min for someone to get us down. Service saved them and we didnt feel like that was a concern. They also offered us a later check out time because we had kids. The free flowers and hair pin and citrus water were nice touches. There are fridges in the room but no microwave. I may book a room with kitchenette , free parking instead if you travel with kids.

This is Waikiki folks. Its the Wallmart of Hawaiii and for a short stay you could not ask for anything better. This is a four start hotel but lets be honest, its a little old, the décor is a little dated and its not the most luxurious place on the earth...but it works very well for Waikiki. The staff is beyond excellent and Madonna who works in the restaurant is a master of customer service and excellent with kids. The pool area can get a little crazy with kids, but overall it was very good. You cant go wrong....just don't expect the Plaza Hotel. This is Waikiki and for the area this hotel is just fine

After a cruise around the Hawaiian islands we wanted to just lay back and relax for a couple of days. We ended up here. We are not young so we were not interested in surfing or other similar activities. We wanted to relax on the beach, enjoy good food and hospitality. We found it here. Easy access to the beach. Could sit on the balcony (21st floor) and watch the activity on the beach and on the ocean. A very pleasant room at a reasonable price. The breakfast buffet was very good for a large hotel. We ate there every morning. The outdoor restaurant is a great place for lunch, overlooking the ocean. The room was what we needed and was clean. The staff was very helpful and each one seemed to want to know if they could do something to help make the stay enjoyable. The bell staff did what they could to make the arrival and departure easy. We did not rent a car but found transportation readily available and the staff was helpful in explaining how it worked. The atmosphere was all we could have hoped for. Even though we were not looking for vigorous activities there were those there who obviously were. Surfing lessons were available on site as well as car rental and good shopping. We would stay there again.

Typical Marriott standard hotel in a great location. Rooms were clean and nice. Entire Waikiki area is surprisingly clean and modern. You don't need a car when you stay in this area. The large open air lobby is especially nice. The front desk and bell services staff were very friendly and helpful - can't say the same for the staff at the concierge desks. The $30/night resort fee is annoying since the main benefits are free breakfast and better internet which would be included for gold elite members anyway. Unfortunately there is no concierge lounge.

The staff is great, the area around this location has lots of affordable food choices and an ABC store attached where you can buy wine, beer, liquor to save money on those areas.The only complaint is the 30.00 per day resort fee. Really you get absolutely nothing for this fee. No pool shows, lobby activities, social hour etc... The beach is the activities and it's free. The pool is small and filled with kids so the 30.00 fee should just be in the quote when you price a room here. It just seems tricky but I'm sure all the hotels are doing it.The car rental on the grounds was awesome. Rented a car for one day and went to the north shore, brought back same night with no parking fees. 100.00 for a Jeep was a great investment for the day.Overall the place is clean, friendly and in a great spot. I would stay here again.

It's our first time visiting Hawaii, and through much research for price, location, and review, we decided to stay at Marriott Resort & Spa at Waikiki. It turns out to be an excellent choice.Located just minutes away from Waikiki Beach, many of the hotel rooms have good views on the beach, the waves, and the beautiful scene at Waikiki. The open concept layout of the hotel allows patrons to walk inside the hotel to the intersection that Waikiki Beach is located, so we are practically right on the beach (even though our hotel room was located in the tower that is further from the beach). The service of the hotel has been excellent. Whenever there was a need, we were able to receive assistance in a timely fashion. In the one case where the wi-fi network did not work in our room, two-days worth of resort fees were waived to compensate for our inconvenience. Parking at the hotel is expensive, but you can actually park at Honolulu Zoo, a five-minute walk from the hotel, at the rate of $1USD/hr. We didn't find the parking to be an issue. Just a reminder: Marriott has two entrances for cars - one side appears to be for valet parking only, but there did not appear to be signs indicating that. We were told to remove our vehicle when trying to drop off a toddler, and that was an annoyance. Honolulu has so many things to do and so many sights to see that we did not really take advantage of most of the services available at the hotel. It is a nice touch, for example, that it has a ABC store located right in the lobby to see some of the absolute essentials. Mind you, there are probably two million ABC stores in Honolulu anyway. Within walking distance of Marriott, I can remember at least six or seven. Some reviewers mentioned the slowness of the elevators. We didn't find that to be a problem until the last day of our stay, a holiday, when a bunch of patrons were checking in and they actually caused the elevators to stop working altogether. We were in need to check out, so had to call the front desk to have them send a security up to take us down on the elevator. For a hotel with as many patrons though, five elevators per tower may not quite be enough. We have really enjoyed our stay at Waikiki Beach Marriott, and will be definitely considering a return to this hotel should we visit Honolulu again.

The Top 6 things you need to know about the Marriott Waikiki1. A taxi ride from the airport is approximately $45 one-waySeek out Charlie's taxis for a flat $29 fare to the airport2. The ABC store - in the hotel lobby, sells pints of fresh pineapple every morning.3. Do Not Order Room Service! The extra service charges, taxes, delivery charge and pre-assigned gratuity will skyrocket the cost. 4. It's way cheaper to rent an Enterprise Car at the hotel then at the airport. However, they gave us two cars with zero gas and it is “a challenge” to return the car to their garage after 8 o'clock at night.5. The valet parking staff is very professional and efficient: $32 hotel parking overnight. $37 valet . Tip.6. Breakfast across the street at Wolfgang Puck Express is great! If you liked these tips, tell me...I have quite a few up my sleeve...PS The staff is great, however, hotel guests can be loud and disruptive.The doors are like paper. Merely call Security. Aloha.

A good place to stay if you want to be near the beach and all the activities around the beac.With just a block ahead we can jump to the ocean as soon we put our clothes on.The inside stores not so good...i do not recommend to buy anything there because you can find better things just waking around the beaches stores.The room was good...with the Marriott brand we always expect a very confy bed what us the mist important thing for leisure and to rest of the multiple tours weve been in honolulu...The breakfast was not complimentary but we served ourselves in a burger king nearby because the tours begin early in the morning and there are not much places to go and grab a decent breakfast....they do have a coffeshop with sandwiches but not very assorted...anything that an abc store couldnt help.The facilities are good...the gym was quite complete...not sauna but a jacuzzi outside with the pool you can enjoy...We were on the cruise package so this was our obligatory hotel...not bad and was a walking distance for the real action venuses.

We stayed at this hotel last week and we found a hassell free great location that did it all correctly. There is no downside to the stay at this hotel. You should be aware of the parking fees before you go. They are very high. So if you rent a car add a minimum of $35 per day to your stay just for parking. Breakfast was included in our package and it is worth eating. Lots of restaurants near and in the hotel. We ate one night at the steakhouse. If your budget can handle it do it. There are 2 pools and they get crowded, but still plenty of space. If the pool is not for you the ocean is across the street. Have a great time and enjoy this hotel.

Beach front hotel. Parking is not free and expensive. Heavily packed during holidays. Two pools onsite and number of restaurants within walking distance. Might get expensive during holiday season. Service is above average.

I have status at Marriott due to my frequent travels using their properties. I found this Marriott so tired and disappointing that I will not go back, and in fact have been back to Honolulu one other time with great results elsewhere. Now to this visit:The hotel is located at one end of Waikiki. It is not on the beach, it is across the street from the beach. Other hotels are right on the beach. Please make a note of that. It is a ten minute walk to near the center of the main street, 15 minutes when there are a lot of people out, like all day every day. So, there are better locations also. The property is quite large and you can walk 5 minutes just to get to the front door. Checkin was quite the experience. I swear my agent was on something, moving at turtle speed, slurring his words and more. I asked for a map of the Marriott property and he could not find one and gave me real attitude about this simple request. Quite odd actually. I also was given a double bed room, even though there were kings available and it was clear I was traveling solo. So much for taking care of one's affinity guests... I went back down and requested a different room and they did get me another room but it should have been that way to begin with. The room was ok, typical Marriott fare, but the rooms need to be updated for sure. And as others have said, the elevators are jurassic at best. There seemed to be no service elevator either as we had to share three elevators with a load in of a band playing at an event there. There is no amenities for food it seemed. Some restaurants just outside but not a clear choice go to place. I did eat the buffet one night, I will share about that in another review, it was just ok, keeping with the disappointing stay overall.There are better more central choices a few blocks down the street with better food, better customer service and better location, for the same or a little less money. That is where I will be, regretfully, from now on at Waikiki.

Billed as a Resort and Spa, it was a very busy hotel with large groups of folks everywhere. Granted it was March Break, but if its tranquility you are after hten this is not your hotel. However, if you want good value, nice location in Waikiki and helpful staff, then this is for you.Being Waikiki, everything is a few blocks away although the major action has evolved further down the strip, which could be good thing. There are plenty of shopping and food outlets available but again, being Waikiki they are not cheap. . The hotel has been recently renovated and is in good condition and looks very good. It has two towers, the front one located on Kalakua Road. We were in the back tower and in a high floor room so had a lovely sea view and event then the noise from the street activities was audible. Not sure what the from tower would be like.The hotel is located across the road from the beach which has a protection wall so the bathing is really safe for kids and poor swimmers, one does have to cross the busy road though. The hotel pools are smallish but very clean and well maintained We had several trips lined up so were did not choose this hotel as a resort, rather for its location and price...and we were not disappointed

I typically love Marriotts, and since this one has undergone a remodel it's looking really good. They do seem to be having issues with the elevators and at peak times you can wait am extended amount of time so plan accordingly. There are some design decisions I question like the idea that one light switch for the separate sink/ bathroom area. So if you get up in the middle of the night anyone in the room will be awakened as you have to turn on both lights to use one. Oh well, as I'm usually the one up first it's not bothering me but it does make me feel bad for waking my spouse. The kuhio grill, where breakfast is served has been temporarily located in a dull windowless ballroom, it seems there could have been a more scenic option. Our server Sharon was very nice though but we've opted to eat elsewhere as part of being in Hawaii is enjoying your surroundings. Of course the staff at this Marriott are friendly and helpful and our room has a spectacular view and balcony.  The location is perfect too so there's no doubt we will return.

This place was fine for our 9 night stay in Waikiki. The location is good being at the end of Waikiki, and a little bit quieter than up the road, but still close to everything. Being at the end means we were either the last or the first place on the route, so it was advantageous sometimes.The hotel is fine with the room adequate. We were upgraded and had a view of the beach and the neighbouring hotel pool. The bed was very comfy. Overall the hotel is starting to look a bit dated, but I think I read that a refit is planned soon.One area they need to look at is the elevators. These were painfully slow to arrive. I ended up walking down from the 8th floor on a number of occasions.We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was expensive and there are lots of choices nearby. Lulus just round the corner is a good choice.The staff were friendly and helpful.

This hotel has been a Waikiki landmark for many years but has been updated in parts to reflect a new and modern property. The lobby is enormous and includes many fun places to shop as well as two ABC stores and two Seattle's Best coffee locations. Check in was very easy. My room was absolutely enormous with a panoramic view. The in room amenities were excellent. The only slightly negative comment I have about my room was that the carpet was very worn and the toilet/bath area was small.Daily newspaper delivery and a free coffee every day of my stay was a great perk. The gym has excellent equipment and is well set up. Two swimming pools gave everyone a chance to splash and cool off if they were not at the beach. This hotel is located at the Diamond Head end of the Waikiki strip. It is a very easy walk to shopping, zoo, aquarium etc. Loads of restaurants in the area catering to every taste.I will return to Waikiki and will definitely stay at the Marriott.

Staying at Waikiki Beach Resort with my family. On night 5 of 7 and so far the stay is excellent. On arrival we had the best guest services agent, shout out to Kalae Araujo!!, who helped us find a wonderful ocean view room and surprised us with a snack box and a kind note the next day. The pool and bar are nice and private but who needs to go there when the beach is right across the street!!! Location on Waikiki Beach cannot be beat. Rooms are nice, with recent upgrades. The bath is pretty dated and small in the front tower rooms overlooking the ocean, but no one is really spending much time there.... Exercise classes daily are pretty good and the the gym is always open if you still have energy after surfing all day. On the first floor there are shops for essentials, coffee, cute Hawaiian style clothing, etc. We usually rent a condo or house on vacation so we liked that the hotel was on the far end of the noisy toursit-y part of Waikiki. Would definitely stay here again.

My sister, mom and I stayed here during our recent 5-day trip to Oahu. Normally, I don't stay at big resort/chain hotels, but my sister got a package deal and it was convenient.The property is HUGE, with two towers, some restaurants, a gym and a couple of pools. WHAT I LIKED- We were upgraded to a family room with 4 beds in the beach-facing tower. It was spacious for the three of us, and the beds were good -- with tons of great pillows.- Loved having a patio with an ocean view- In-room AC worked perfectly and was quiet- Towels were nice and plenty- In-room coffee was very decent, although we used the complimentary coupons to Seattle's Best most of the time- Housekeeping staff were always so friendly and helpful- Toiletries were nice- Shower head had great water pressure- Wifi worked well- It's close to a local neighborhood where there are less touristy restaurants. (Try South Shore Grill, Shaka Pressed Juice and the Diamond Head Market & Grill on Monserrat.) WHAT I DIDN'T LIKE- The $30 resort fee. I just don't like the whole nickel-and-dime thing at hotels, period. Pretty hefty fee to pay, and it cheapens the experience!- In my opinion, when a property is this large, there is just no way you'll get an intimate, unique experience -- so it winds up feeling quite generic. Nice and convenient, but generic. - The $35/nt parking fee. (Tip: Circle the block a few times to find a spot on the street. It's free from 6 p.m. - 7 a.m.)Would I stay again? Probably -- if I got a great deal or if I was visiting again with my sister who loves this sort of place.

Great location looking out over Waikiki Beach with a fantastic view of Diamond Head. The rooms are nice and pretty well updated with a food size balcony. Large hotel with two towers so make sure to get the same tower of booking multiple rooms. Many shops on the ground level and a very good breakfast.

I just recently finished a 2 week lag of island hopping in Hawaii. I stayed in this hotel for the last 2 days, and I probably had the worst experience here. The front desk is slow, and mostly incompetent. They're oddly rude, even as an Elite member which makes me wonder how they treat their non-elite customers, especially the front desk personnel. Because of the Elite membership they did upgrade our room to an ocean view on a higher floor and because they have no concierge room for Elite members, the continental breakfast was comped, which was nice. Despite this, I still would never recommend staying here despite the "perks". It's also in the far end of Waikiki, which is incredibly inconvenient if you don't have a car rental. The hotel itself is huge, and difficult to navigate around, and makes you feel like you're in a maze of a mall rather than on vacation in a resort. Also, calling this hotel a resort is a bit of a stretch, since the nicer resorts I stayed made you feel like you were getting your money's worth with the extra resort fees you pay. Overall, Ok place to stay for one night, but most definitely would never recommend this to any of my family and friends. I'd say avoid this place, even if you're an elite member, unless you're using points and it's a free stay. Otherwise, not worth it.

This is a very nice hotel, the rooms seem to be in good condition, the common areas are nice and the staff friendly.Calling this hotel a resort is a real stretch of the word resort. There is not a private beach, 1 hot tub, 2 extremely small pools, 1 bar that I could find, and maybe 2 restaurants. If "lots of overpriced stores" means resort then it may qualify.Here is the biggest issue, after clearly having a king bed request and 2 phone calls confirming a king, I show up and "unfortunately we only have rooms with 2 double beds available, but we give you an upgraded view!"So they say "go check it out and let us know if it's ok...If not come back and we'll see what we can do" We get to the room and I am not exaggerating when I say this, it was quite possibly the 2 smallest double beds I've seen in my life. My wife and I combined might weigh 300 lbs. And there was no way we were fitting in one of those.We go to the lobby to check out our options and the woman at the desk (Taylor, who throughout this entire process was great to deal with and a terrific representative of what I expect at Marriott) has to get her manager. The manager comes over and pulls out a LAMINATED CHART showing how much it's going to cost me to get an "upgraded" room to a king which, by the way, I was "guaranteed" 3 times. So obviously this is a scam they pull on everyone.Finally and $40 a night later we get a king on the 30th floor with a view of Diamond Head, which was great. But, it's just such a joke that we had to waste 2 hours on this scam...and ridiculous in the end I had to pay extra for what I was "guaranteed"Finally after all of that the bed was extremely uncomfortable.I expected more from Marriott.

The hotel is still being renovated from a year ago. No problem. Our check in was friendly, fast, and more than satisfying. The room we were given was clean, bright, and perfect for someone wanting shade on the Patio. The room was serviced daily and kept extra nice by Suzanne, our very friendly room person. This was our second visit to Honolulu. and this hotel. If we get back to Honolulu, we will definitely stay here, and recommend it to all our friends. The Wi Fi was the best in any hotel we have ever stayed at. Turn on your device and You are on.

Newer Lobby is really nice, but no bar or lounge or dining at all in the tower our room was in. Rooms outdated, no exhaust fan in bathroom, no towel rack in the sink area, ocean view was ok, but we were on 26th floor and height bothered me with the see through rail. Bed was ok. Service at front desk was very good! Valet parking was nice. Lots of extra costs, resort fee, parking, etc. Expected a bit more luxury for the price. Pool was small and hot tub was small and crowded with kids. Sushi bar was great!

Very friendly and the hotel is lovely we had a lovely view from our room close to the beach the hotel also has two pools if you don't like the beach close to Cheesecake Factory and also a bus close buy to take you to ala Moana shopping centre

Let me start off by saying I'm not a huge Marriott fan to begin with but this experience further solidified my opinion. This hotel is a rip off. Here is my list of issues with it.- Small rooms with run down furniture- partial ocean view rooms are laughable (you can only see the ocean if you crane your neck around the side of a building) - rude front desk staff, even if you're an elite member - pool is an oversized tub- overcrowded hotel (this is basically the perfect conference hotel since its overcrowded and cheaply made but in a great location) - unresponsive concierge Even with all these drawbacks there were some good things about the hotel like an excellent fitness center, free dvd rentals, friendly staff (just not at the front desk), and convenient location (a block from the beach). I don't know about the rates of the hotels but I would pay a little extra to stay at any other hotel on Waikiki.
user_name:
Christin A
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I booked the hotel as part of a package deal through Hawaiian Airlines (which is another story in itself). Checked in with Nicole who was in short, fabulous! I am only a silver elite member so I was not expecting much. We were upgraded to a larger room with a balcony view of the beach across the street. We received a free buffet breakfast every morning. Plus lots of little extra discounts & freebies. The bellmen who brought us to the room was wonderful as well, full of tips and plenty of free bottled water for the asking! And we asked, everyday & was cheerfully handed water with a smile. I need to make special mention of the concierge, Jing. She too was wonderful. She spent a good deal of time booking day trips for us as well as arranging 2 nights in Maui for us. She was never pushy and respected our choices. Very professional. The cleaning staff did a great job and were so friendly and accommodating. Make sure to stop in at the hotel restaurant, D.K Steakhouse, expensive but worth it. I usually find hit or miss with the Marriotts but this time they hit it right out of the park! Why are people sooooooooo much nicer in Hawaii? Is it the weather?

This hotel was not cheap but we had a reasonable beach view from our room, past a couple of high rise buildings in front of us! Breakfast is ridiculously expensive but others tell us it was very good. There is a coffee shop for takeaway coffee and light snacks in the lobby area and also a shop selling some snack foods and t shirts etc. There is also an underground small shopping area with a car hire office and a very helpful tour agent that is independent from the hotel tour desk. The hotel was very crowded with lots of groups using this accommodation but we still managed to find a good spot around the main pool bar area in the evening to watch the sunset and fireworks from one of the other beach hotels. Nobody mentioned that there are two pools at this complex! The larger pool with beach views was in the building adjoining ours.

We stayed for two weeks in December. First the good stuff, we had a nice room with a great ocean view and we saw rainbows a few times. Our room was cleaned well daily. The hotel is in a good location on the less busy end of the strip (although still too busy for us). We walked most days to the outrigger canoe club so this is a great location if you are going to the OCC.Sensei is located within the hotel in the p tower if I remember correctly which is always good, a plus for close location.Now for the not so good: Aside from the cleaning staff (who were great), the other staff weren't very friendly or helpful. The hotel itself is very large and too busy for our taste. We did self-parking for $32 a day (valet is $38) and the parking lot is very tight and often hard to get a spot when you return at the end of night which can be a little stressful for what is supposed to be a relaxing vacation. The parking lot is so tight you have to backup and pull over if another car is coming from the opposite direction. There's a $30/day resort fee as well (you don't get anything for it) although they pretend to give you some coupons you probably won't use....some for the Seattles Best coffee shop in the hotel. We tried it once but the coffee was terrible so we didn't use the coupons again. In summary, count on an extra $60/day for the hidden fees. Very expensive, too big, too busy and not relaxing....it's a condo for us next time!

This is a nice Marriott. It is very busy with many tour groups and thus fairly crowded. It is across the street from the beach and has a central location. Rooms are a bit nicer than usual Marriott. Nice pool area. Front desk personnel very helpful.

After reading some reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. What a pleasant surprise. The registration staff was awesome. We came early and were upgraded to an ocean view room. What a beautiful view of the ocean. The restaurants on site are excellent. I cannot give the staff at this location enough complements everyone was so nice and helpful. The hotel is very clean and comfortable. I would definitely return.

Overall, a good but not great hotel based on my week long stay there. Good points are the staff was helpful and the location was quite good but to call it a 'resort and spa' seems a bit overstated when compared to other properties we've stayed at before.The noise level inside the room was higher than expected but it could be that we were just unfortunate to be put next to a family who thought they could sing all night. Considering this is a Marriott property, it was a surprisingly a bare bones experience. For example, there were no robes, slippers, not enough bath towels or any other special amenities in the room which seems to be standard in most other resort type hotels.The breakfasts were ok but nothing special beyond what one sees at any other US chain hotel. The lines were long most mornings due to the conventions at the hotel plus the overseas tour groups who seemed to not follow any order when jumping the line to get in front of others who've been waiting longer. The restaurant staff just seemed to accept this practice that tour groups must have some kind of priority over other customers.There was nothing particular negative about the overall experience but, on the other hand, there wasn't anything positive as well to leave me walking away thinking I should really visit again.

Room was great with beach view. Pool nice. Excellent service. Staff was very helpful with information. Stores inside the hotel. Location was good, could walk to beach, restaurants and stores. Balcony was nice & breezy.

Our stay here in February of 2016 was unplanned. My 2yr old Granddaughter was admitted to the children's hospital here in Honolulu, and was diagnosed with Leukemia, treatment was started immediately and we needed to find a place close to her to stay, as we were helping with the care of our Son's other baby, our Grandson. Our 4 Generation Oahu family vacation quickly turned into one from hell. My Son had found 1 smallish room here, we tried to squeeze 2 adults into a full size bed while my Daughter in-law's Mom slept in the other, and we surrounded the baby's pack and play bed with the black out curtain for 1 night. But with our Daughter flying in that day to stay as well, we needed another room bad, or at least an airbed if need be. I went to the front desk, explained our situation, and couldn't control my emotions and started breaking down crying, I had been an emotional mess for days (still am) The woman at the front desk, petite beautiful Wendy Perez, such a sweetheart, gave me what I really needed right then, a HUG! She was a softy as well, she knew we needed help in our situation. I just needed a room close by the other one, view didn't matter, or size of room, just a bed and a bathroom for Husband and me as we took shifts at the hospital. Lets just say Wendy went above and beyond for us, even pulling an extension for our stay if needed, we didn't. After coming back to the room later that evening, she had a card slipped under the door saying she was thinking of us and our Granddaughter in her prayers. I was so touched by her sensitivity, and kindness. I will NEVER forget her. On check out, she was off work for a few days, so I didn't get to give her a proper mahalo, and Aloha. I hope she sees this and so does her Supervisor. When we return, which we will, I'm coming here to stay for sure!! Next time my feet will touch the beach!gofundme.com/Butterfly_Kisses

I am currently staying at this property with my wife and young son and cannot say enough good things about the hotel and staff. We are Marriott reward members and upon arrival we were given a complimentary upgrade to an upper level ocean front room (special thanks to Charlene and General Manager Chris!). The spectacular views from this room are probably the best in Waikiki. The friendly house-keeping staff are top-notch and the Concierge have been extremely helpful with restaurant recommendations which didn't disappoint. Of course the location - right on the beach - is as good as it gets and there are many attractions and restaurants within easy walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel!

We made reservations for 2 nights at this hotel in order to see Pearl Harbor before heading to Maui. If I had known how loud this hotel and this location was, I might have made a different choice. I wore my Bose noise cancelling head set the first night. Welcome to Waikiki.

This hotel was great for our stay in Waikiki. It is at the end of the long strip of hotels, closer to Diamond Head. It is not directly on the beach, but is right across from it with easy access. The amenities were great, ocean views were beautiful, and the service was always on point! And don't miss the delicious breakfast!

This hotel is in a perfect location just across the street from Waikiki beach. The park and beach are clean, well kept and the beach is wide, with plenty of room for everyone. There is umbrella, chair and surfboard rental. There is a sea wall on part of the beach which creates a large protected swimming area. There are many fast food and regular restaurants on the same block and the hotel pool bar/restaurant has a fantastic view and excellent fish tacos. The sushi restaurant in the hotel is also excellent.
