My advice is to go for the sushi rolls versus other items if you go to the sushi restaurant.We had a balcony room which was clean and nice with a fantastic view of the beach. We were there for 4 days, 2 adults and 1 child. We did not stray farther than 2 blocks from the hotel and therefore spent time doing what we came for, playing in the ocean, swimming in the pool and eating great food. This is not a secluded island location by any means but is superbly located for family fun.
user_name:
Jill D
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: We stayed at Paoakalani Tower kingroom with partial ocean view, and it was really nice. Room was spacious and clean, nicely decorated and so on. As this room is already quite pricy, I see no point spending even more to book from Kealohilani tower. We didnt spend that much time in the room anyway. There are two pool areas, and the one in Kealohilani has also a pool restaurant. Towels are available in both areas. We spend some totally relaxing sunny hours there and enjoyed every minute. Location of the hotel is good, close to everything, as are all the hotels near Waikiki beach. There are boutiques and shops inside the hotel area, a restaurant and lots more once you step out. I recommend this hotel especially for couples, but am sure that families enjoy too.

This hotel is right across the street from the beach. You can't go wrong staying here. The staff at this hotel is over the top and they go beyond there call of duty to make you feel comfortable and enjoyable. The rooms are clean, and cozy and up to date. There are nice good restaurants very close to the hotel and if you like the night life there are also many clubs and bars walking distance from your door. This hotel is family friendly but it is also good for young adults. The hotel has beautiful view of the city or the beach. I know every time I come by to Hawaii I will always go back to Waikiki Marriott. Staying here adds on to all the fun you'll already experience for being in Hawaii. Marriott just make it easy foryou to get the best out of your vacation. Stay here and you won't regret it!!!!

We are fortunate and get to travel to Hawaii several times a year. While on Oahu this is our go-to hotel. We were there last week and when we pulled into the valet, the attendant remembered us from our last stay in November. The rooms are clean and the service is fantastic. Great location just a block from Waikiki Beach. There are several cute little boutiques on property and the dining options are great too. We will continue to stay here every time we go.

This a nice motel, has it all for you pools , bar , restaurants, shopping, concierge. The concierge can and will get you setup to do anything you want to do. This is right on the beach so set down at the bar and watch the sunset it does not get any better than that.

We stayed here this past week at the Marriott Waikiki. Upon arrival we were upgraded due to my Platinum status and given a room with a view of the ocean and Diamondhead on the 32nd floor. The room was a King. Overall the room was a good size and the balcony was great. The decor is a little dated but everything was kept up nice and there was a fridge as well. The elevators are quick so being up high isn't an issue. I would suggest requesting 20th floor or higher for the best views. All of the staff was excellent and friendly. Don't remember the last time I traveled at a hotel for a week and was greeted by everyone. The valet guys are friendly and quick. Definitely worth the extra $5 a day over the garage. Both of the pool areas are nice. The pool by the bar is a newer design but usually packed. There is one in the back that is heated and quieter. The fitness center is excellent with cardio equipment, machines and free weights. The breakfast buffet is complimentary and was delicious. A made to order omelette station was great and the staff there was excellent. Only issue is that it is busier in the early morning from 6-830 and usually a line. We also ate at the 3rd floor outdoor bar and grill. The food is pricey but pretty good and with your elite status you get a 25% discount so then the price isn't bad. Their drinks are high though. I would recommend another location for just drinks. The location was nice. We were able to use the beach across the street and walk to other restaurants and bars all within a few blocks. Overall would definitely stay here again.

Been staying at this hotel on each visit to Oahu and it has a number of amenities that others do not have. Great breakfast buffet, two pools, great fitness center, valet parking, great restaurants on the grounds. All rooms seem to have ocean view with balcony.

Being a rewards member has it's privileges. When we checked in hotel didn't have me as a rewards member but when they found out we were given an upgraded room and a free breakfast. Room had a great view of the ocean and Diamond Head. Hotel is in a great location right across from Waikiki beach, and within walking distance to numerous restaurants. Only negative thing is the concierge service at the hotel. We stop by to see about going to Pearl Harbor and was told that if we didn't get tickets in advance it would be hard to get them. He told us if we wanted to go the following day he could set us up for $120\person. We went to our room and booked free tickets on line and made arrangement for ride for $15\person. Don't think they are there as a service to the guest.

Located across the street from the beach. Great location if you want a beautiful beach close. Almost every room with a beach view. Wonderful breakfast on 3rd floor. Omlets, fresh fruit, pasteries, etc.Friendly staff at every turn.

This Hotel is located right across the road from the beach and had many shops and restaurants close by. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was small in size, but it did have a nice outdoor balcony with chairs and a table. The bed and pillows were comfortable and I was able to get a restful nights sleep. A perfect place to stay to enjoy the sights of Waikiki

The hotel is great! Beautiful hall with modern vibe and lots of flowers. Staff was always nice and helpful. The rooms have good space with great view. Hotel is just in front of Waikiki beach. There is a car rental inside the hotel which is very convenient. There is also an office for reservation of activities and bus tours. I stayed there with my husband for business meetings but due to hotel location and facilities we were able to enjoy Hawaii. I would love to return.

We Stayed here in March,2015 for 2 days before we got on the cruise ship, Our room was undated ,Beautiful view with balcony facing the ocean and the pool down below. Everyone was very helpful and nice. We were able to walk to anything or take the bus/trolley system.

Rooms were large & bright with ocean view. Also had great view of Diamond Head. Hotel is directly across street from the lovely Waikiki Beach. Hotel lobby was open concept, very spacious & well decorated. Staff were very welcoming & helpful. Because our flight was late in the evening they offered to look after our luggage after checkout & made available a courtesy room for us to be able to freshen up & change before departing to airport.

We recently had taken a cruise on Norweigin around Hawaii. The first 3 days we stayed at this hotel and took bus tours. The hotel was right on the beach and close to shops and restaurants. Everyone was very professional and helpful. We ate at the buffet twice. Although it was a little pricey, the food was very good. The room was very spacious and very clean. I want to write about the bus tours that we went on. Gray Line was great, our bus driver and guide, BEN was delightful and full of great information. It seems that the bus co. Doesn't have a place to write a review one does Norweigin. We loved our vacation.

This hotel is right across the street from the area of Waikiki Beach with the concrete walls, which makes it a nice part for children because there are hardly any waves. The hotel is very nice with a first floor that is all open and various shops throughout. There is an outdoor bar on the 3rd floor that faces the beach and they frequently have very enjoyable live music. The room was an above average hotel room - The size was comfortable, the bed was comfortable, the balcony was big enough to comfortably fit 2 people, and the bathroom was nice (open sink area, closed door to toilet/shower). Nothing to write home about (good or bad) but what we expected in a 4-star hotel. Housekeeping forgot to come clean our room one day but we asked them to come back that night and they did. I occasionally found faint/small stains on the sheets/towels but nothing bad enough to complain about. The hotel overall seemed like it has been around for awhile but like they make an effort to keep it fresh.I took off a star because this hotel, like many hotels in Hawaii, require you to pay a mandatory $30 nightly "resort fee." However you'll be hard pressed to find a hotel in Waikiki that doesn't have a resort fee tacked onto the price, so with that being said, I would recommend this hotel.

We just got back from an 11 day stay at the Marriott,this place is truly amazing..It is in the heart of everything.Waikiki Beach is just across the road ,very easy access if you follow the signs when to cross, there are so many nice restaurants and fast food places to list..we did the Island tour,Pearl Harbor tour,and a Luau.We took a nice Dimond Head Segway tour,went to the Doles Pineapple plant and North Shore,so much fun.Don't need a car....

We stay here every year and every enjoy I enjoy every minute of our stay. Our room is great. Housekeeping cleaned our room at the time we requested everyday. The women that work in resturant in the morning are such a delight and very welcoming. The pool staff is very accommodating. Ramiro is there every year we visit. The bar staff is very nice. This is what keeps me coming back every year.

Pretty much everything about his hotel is old and substandard except the redone lobby. Making guests pay a $30 daily resort fee and then having breakfast in a repurposed room with some pretty low-grade serving line is just unacceptable. Never seemed to be enough parking. The walls were super thin, the mattresses old and worn and mysteriously my alarm kept being activated for early in the morning. I asked the management about all of these things and received their plan for updating the hotel. Good to know, but didn't really make me feel any better. After one email I was just ignored. Not what you would expect from a "high end" Marriott resort. So disappointed. Go somewhere else until next year, or however long it takes for this hotel to be redone.

Our room had a limited view to the beach, was clean and comfortable. Restaurants in the hotel are well above average. The hotel is across from a beach park and about 5 blocks from high quality shopping. Waikiki is expensive and with that in mind this place represents good value.

I've been coming to the Marriott Waikiki for the last 6 years. I love the location of this hotel. I have been lucky enough to always get at least a partial ocean view room even when I am confirmed in a city view room. The majority of the rooms have an ocean view from the balcony. With my room, I could see the ocean from the bed. As always, the Marriott never fails me, I will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Honolulu. Restaurants, stores, beach and more are within walking distance, you will not need a car. What makes this hotel great is their staff. The pool area is never crowded. I love hanging out there. They charge a $30 daily resort fee and you will get 2 drink coupons and free movie rental. If you are Marriot rewards member, wifi is complimentary.

Its only quiet in the morning. Although the breeze is wonderful at night, you need to keep the windows closed if you want to get any sleep. Breakfast is worth the cost. the poolside bar is way over-priced for the quality of the food and music.

We spent only one night here, but it was excellent.Our room was facing the beach and on the 22nd floor, perfect views of the beach and the ocean!We were treated well from the time we checked in until the time we checked out. At check in every need was fulfilled, they treated us like we were important to them. At check out they checked to make sure they met all of our needs.We didn't find this to be a super high end Marriott, but this is Hawaii, and you are paying to be right on the beach.Overall another great Marriott experience.

I was in Honolulu on a business trip. My children had school break and came with me to Oahu. I chose to stay at Marriott because it was arranged through my conference. It was a very bad experience! Hotel does not have private beach. The public beach which is located across the street from the hotel was filled with drug addicts and homeless people. I could not take my children to the beach at all. Hotel swimming pools are very small and uncomfortable. There was garbage everywhere. Near the pool garbage was never removed. This hotel is completely open and has multiple entrances. Drunks were walking around the hotel especially at night. Elevators smelled like beer. I did not feel secure at all. Would not recommend this place to anyone traveling with kids.

Stayed here on Marriott Reward points and was upgraded at no charge, without a request, which was a nice surprise. They contacted me ahead of time to see how they could help and made a number of tour arrangements - no hassles at all. Easy check in and lots of great views from our room. The "mall feel" between the lobby and the beach is a bit much - but we quickly got use to it. Sansei restaurant is great for sushi and the beach terrace bar is great for happy hour and music entertainment. For some the pools might be a bit small, but didn't bother us - we didn't use the pools. With breakfast and drinks and no car to park, the $30/day resort fee actually isn't a rip off - most are - not here. Staff was wonderful! - across the board, no exceptions.

I consider it one of the nicest hotels on Waikiki for the money. Reasonable price, but made for family rravel, business travel and a holiday. Great gym, beach is a one minute walk outside the door, lots of restaurants and shops outside and in the hotel, and the staff were really great. Room was comfortable, clean and in good shape. Although my room didn't have a direct back view, from my balcony I had a nice one. A south facing room gets you a great beach view. I stayed for a week and had plenty of things to keep me busy when not working. Great location for nice beach runs and a run around Diamond Head. It's located at the east end of Waikiki and perhaps a little quieter than the other end. However, little longer to get on H1 from there vs the west end. Great stay!

We enjoyed our room and ambiance of the Hotel. It's a typical Marriott...expensive, but hey...it's on the beach and is in Hawaii. Our room was "ocean view"...but you had to really hang out on the balcony to see any water.

The 19th floor had a great view and the hotel staff itself provided great customer service! My wife and I were very pleased with the service we had as well as the room itself. The room was bigger than standard hotels and it was very clean!

This is a large property. The rooms were very clean and ours had a balcony with a partial ocean view - very nice! We had breakfast with the room - the usual marriott buffet, but it was refreshed promptly and food was fresh. The morning staff was genuinely engaging and pleasant and remembered us after the first morning. the only marginal part of our stay was the pool bar staff (it's the only place on property to get a cocktail or appetizer near sunset). Service was slow and there were obviously not happy folks. It's the only time in years of staying at Marriott's that I got a "that's not my table" and have service staff walk away. Overall, it's a nice property.

We stayed at the Marriott Beach and Spa for 10 days from feb11 to feb 21 it has a beautiful location right across the street from the beach as soon as we booked in we were given an up grade with an excellent view the room was a corner room which was nice size it was located in the older building on the 17th floor .We liked the room very much it had a real nice view of the beach the carpet was not warn and the bath room had some work done to it but had no cracks in the walls my complain is I didnt like the bath fixures they seemed old and couldnt be adjusted to give you a nice shower the king bed was nice and their was a flat screen T.V with dvd and all the hook ups for computers our room had fridge and a coffee maker in it which was a nice feature About the house keeping it could have been better the tables were not cleaned the whole time we were there and one day none of the garbage was collected in the room I had to find the house keeper to get it done.

Stayed here for an entire week and loved the customer service I received. The staff are wonderful! During our stay we were assisted by Jorge the dining manager and Tina at the reservation desk who went out of their way for us; Natividad our housekeeper was awesome and so was Natacia who is with security. They all went over and above the call of duty to make our stay awesome. The breakfast buffet at Kuhio Beach Grill is sooo good and the coffee was INCREDIBLE. Madonna was my server every day and she was excellent! This was my first time in HI and I went with my husband as part of his business trip then we stayed afterward for pleasure. I learned that Waikiki is very commercial and rather urban so it conflicted a bit with the image I had in my mind of Hawaii. I did not like trying to relax at the pool and hearing sirens, trucks, horns blaring, traffic, etc. but that's not the fault of the hotel .... it's a geographical issue. I would recommend another island or hotel if you are looking for that lush, tropical scenery. The pools are adequate but I was surprised the Marriott did not invest more in landscaping those areas to create better ambiance. We had a partial ocean view room. The room was adequate. Nothing spectacular but it wasn't bad either. Typical neat, clean Marriott I'm accustomed to. Mattress was rather hard for my taste and could stand an upgrade in my opinion. I would've like to have gotten a better night of sleep. Not sure what the other reviewer meant about the sink being out in the open. It was on the other side of the wall in our room as they normally are. I appreciated having numerous outlets in the room (esp near the bed) for my many devices. The partial ocean view nearly went unnoticed because of the angle of the room. You have to sit at the far end of the balcony to see the ocean .... but it's there. Overall, I really enjoyed the hotel. Loved the open air lobby. Waikiki Beach is awesome and shopping was good - everything from souvenir shops to Rodeo Drive retailers.

I was told that they recently remodeled their lobby area, and it showed. The general lobby area is really very nice and had a welcoming feeling to it. I was placed in a room with partial ocean view and view of Diamond Head. The rooms are clean and functional, but nothing special about them. I also had complimentary breakfast buffet due to my membership status. The selections are the same every single day. They should change the menu and should have more local food (they didn't even have spam!). I heard it's $30/person, and I would have been disappointed if I had paid. There are two pools in the property - one on each side of the two towers, but neither is impressive. The pool on the side where there is a hot tub is less impressive than the pool on the other side without the hot tub. I think if the property is being billed as a "resort," it should have a better pool. The location of the hotel is actually pretty good, but it is towards the end of the "strip." The staff whom I interacted with were all very professional and nice, so thank you for that! Overall, I enjoyed this hotel despite some of the shortcomings.

Stopped by for 5 day visit and medical appoints. Overall great location, only a block from the main beach. Great shopping and restaurants just a short walk away. Great service at the reception desk and they worked hard to get me in early since my flight came in at 0700. Valet staff was very friendly and nice - big kudos. A couple issues with the hotel. Only two of six elevators were working. Large crowds waited in the lobby to get to their rooms at peak times. Seattle Beat coffee shop in the lobby is absolutely terrible. Unclean, marginal coffee and latte was just coffee with warm milk. Ladies were not very nice behind the counter. Acted like I put them out ordering a cup of coffee. I know they might not answer to Marriott but they need to tighten up their area because it is in the Marriott area. The rooms are very nice but not a fan of the sink area out in the open. Family tried to sleep in while I had to have the lights on to get t day early in the morning. The street noise at night was load too. Made it difficult to fall asleep at night. Need better sound proofing on the sliders. Overall, I would stay here again but I would ask for a room on a higher floor (we stayed on the 12th floor - too close to the street). I would also go down the street to Starbucks for a cup of coffee.

It hurts me to say this as I have always been a big fan of Marriott properties. We had just finished 2 lovely weeks in KoOlina when we checked into this huge property just across the street from the beach. Granted, it has a beautiful view and great location. We are Marriott Platinum Elite members with over 1 million points currently. We used points for our stay and had our adult kids with us when we checked in, who were heading to the airport in a few hours. My wife asked Lindsee, the young lady at the counter if we could get an upgrade to have a bit more room. She stated we already had the best room she could us give as the "hotel was full of guests that were paying for their rooms". Not the best way to handle this. The next night, we called room service ant ordered 2 salads that we $27 a piece. I asked for a couple of dinner rolls and was told they would be 75 cents a piece. Again, an attitude like this most likely comes from the management or lack there of. Either this franchisee has lost its mind not realizing there are plenty of other rooms in the neighborhood where people are willing to spend $400 plus a night , or they just don't care. The room was nice, but the the carpet was worn, the plumbing dated and the whole place could use a good face lift. Next time we'll stay at the Westin.
